src: um-ma a-sur-i-di a-na i-li-a-lim a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi4-ma a-na i-li-a-lim qi-bi4-ma se-ni-su wa-di te-pu-sa-ni ta-as-li-sa-ni be-el-ka ta-ap-la-ah-ma KU.BABBAR la se-bi4-la-am a-li-ku a-di se-ni-su i-lu-ku-ni-ma u-la ta-al-qe-ma 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR la se-bi4-lam sa 1 ma-na.TA u 0.5 ma-na wa-ar-ki-a i-sa-hu-ru a-ma u-su-ur-sa-a-sur qa-tam a-pu-tum i-na 1 a-li-ki-im si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-a se-bi4-lam 40 ma-na-e-im a-sur li-tu-ul si-ib-tam la a-ka-la-lu-ka sa is-tu ITU.KAM 1 ma-hu-ur-DINGIR li-mu-um i-di-a-sur DUMU ku-bi4-di lu-qu-tam sa se-pi-ka za-ki-ma ti-ib-a-ma a-tal-kam u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku lu za-ki-ma li-it-bi4-a-ma li-tal-kam a-na ha-ar-pi
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Ilī-ālum and Aššur-taklāku; to Ilī-ālum: You know, twice you did this to me; now you have done it a third time! Did you respect your lord when you did not send me the silver? Travelers have come here at least twice, but you had acquired nothing and you have not sent me the 10 minas of silver. For every mina or half mina they prowl around me. Ask Usur-ša-Aššur there! Please, send the rest of my silver with the caravan! With respect to the 40 minas--I take divine Aššur as witness that I shall not make any concessions to you regarding interest, which runs from the month Mahhur-ili, eponymy Iddin-Aššur, the son of Kūbī-idī. Clear the goods from your own caravan, set out and come here. Also, Aššur-taklāku must clear his goods, set out and come here --before harvest.

src: 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR li-te-e SIG5 i-se-er i-sar-da-ga-an u da-ak-ni-is DUMU-me-er-i-su a-sur-ma-lik i-su ku-zi-la-zu a-na KU.BABBAR qa-ta-tum is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-ma-lik a-na sa pa-ar-ka i-sa-qu-lu-u su-ma la is-qu-lu-u 0.5 GIN.TA a-na 0.33333 ma-na-im si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM-im u-su-bu-u IGI su-ISTAR DUMU is-du-ke-en6 IGI i-ku-nim DUMU e-la-li
tgt: Kuzilāzu is guarantor for the silver.

src: 1 GU 57.5 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku <gap> 41 ku-ta-nu qa-dum sa li-wi-tim 2 ANSE.HI.A sa-la-mu u u-nu-su-nu sa-ri-dam 4.5 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na qa-ti-su mi-ma a-nim a-na i-na-ra-wa ap-qi-id
tgt: 1 Talent 57½ Minen Zinn, gesiegelt, 41 Kutānū nebst der Verpackung, (6/7) 2 schwarze Esel und deren Geschirr, (was) den Treiber (betrifft) 4½ Seqel Silber für seinen Anteil: All dies habe ich dem Innarāwā anvertraut.

src: i-na 3 me-at 26 TUG.HI.A sa kur-ub-ISTAR qa-dum li-wi-tim 10 TUG sa a-ki-di-e 9 {TUG}ku-ta-nu sa a-sur-na-da 6 TUG sa ka-sa-ri 66 TUG.HI.A sa is-mi-di-DINGIR 4 me-at 17 TUG.HI.A <big_gap> TUG.HI.A SIG5 i-sa is-mi-di-DINGIR <gap> TUG sa a-ki-di-e 60-<big_gap> TUG.HI.A sa kur-ub-ISTAR 6 {TUG}ku-ta-nu sa a-sur-na-da 1 me-at 42 TUG.HI.A 8 GU 40 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku sa kur-ub-ISTAR <big_gap> ANSE.HI.A za-ha-an pa-zu-ur-tim i-tal-ku 7 e-ma-ru a-na-kam ni-ip-qi-su 10 TUG i da-da-ni-a a-hu-ki 1 {TUG}ku-si-tam a-na ILLAT-tim ni-di-in 1 {TUG}ku-ta-ni a-na hu-lu-qa-e ni-di-in si-ti TUG.HI.A 2 me-at 52 TUG.HI.A a-na E.GAL-lim e-ru-bu
tgt: Of the 326 textiles belonging to Kurub-Ištar-including (for) the wrapping-(plus) 10 Akkadian textiles, 9 kutānu-textiles belonging to Aššur-nādā 6 textiles belonging to the packer, 66 textiles belonging to Iṣmid-ilum in all: 417 textiles thereof: x textiles of good quality of those belonging to Iṣmid-ilum, x Akkadian textiles, 60 [+ x] textiles belonging to Kurub-Ištar, 6 kutānu-textiles belonging to Aššur-nādā; in all: 142 textiles. 8 talents 40 minas of tin under Kurub-Ištar's seal; 10? donkeys have gone on the smugglers' road; we entrusted 7 donkeys to him here. 10 textiles are left in Dadānim; we gave 1 kusītu-textile to the enterprise; we gave 1 kutānu-textile (in compensation) for losses; the rest of the textiles, 262 textiles, have entered the palace.

src: um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma a-na a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku u si-sa-ah-su-sar qi-bi-ma mi-su sa um-ma a-ti-ma e-la 20 na-ru-uq GIG u 15 na-ru-uq se-im sa ku-tu-pi-is i-di-na-ni mi-ma sa-ni-um la-su a-li 40 ma-na ni-ga-lu 2.5 ma-na AN.NA sa a-na sa-na-a i-li-sar u hu-lu-pa ub-lu-ni a-pu-tum KU.BABBAR sa ha-lu-li a-zu u tu-tu-li u ka-u-pa ta-ah-ti-ra-ma 10 na-ru-uq bu-uq-lum 10 na-ru-uq ba-pi-ra-am si-bi4-ma ep-si su-ma u-ta-tam ta-ha-si-hi sa-mi su-ma a-ba-a-ba la na-<big_gap>-tu te-er-ti-ki li-li-kam I.GIS se-bi4-lim
tgt: From Aššur-nādā to Aššur-taklāku and Šišahšušar: Why is it that you say: "Apart from 20 sacks of wheat and 15 sacks of barley that Kutubiš gave me there is nothing else (here)!" Where are the 40 minas of sickles (and) the 2 1/2 minas of tin which Ilī-išar and Huluba brought to Šana? Please, put pressure on Azu and Tutuli as well as Ka'uba with respect to the silver of Haluli, and soak 10 sacks of malt and 10 sacks of beer bread to prepare (beer). If you want any grain then buy it. If they are not careful with the outstanding claims, send me word. Send me some oil.

src: a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma um-ma sa-sa-ah-su-sar-ma ki-ma a-ta tu-su-ni 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR im-hu-ru-ma a-na u-su-ur-sa-a-sur DUMU a-sur-ma-lik i-di-nu 3 ku-ta-ni u-su-ur-sa-a-sur il5-qe-ma a-na E ka-ri-im i-di-i 12 GIN KU.BABBAR KI sa-ra-pu-nu-wa im-hu-ru-ma i-a-ti i-di-nu-ni-su 4 na-ru-uq se-am E ku-tu-pi-is ub-lu-nim a-na-kam am-hu-ur-ma 3 na-ru-uq e-li-a-am 3 na-ru-uq GIG E ka-u-ba-a ub-lu-nim u mi-ma u-la i-di-nu-nim ki-ma a-ta tu-su-ni a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim i-li-kam-ma mas-ke-e i-zu-a-az zi-ta-ka-a i-ib-si-ma u a-ni-i i-ta-ab-lu-su-nu 15 GIN KU.BABBAR sa ta-ar-hu-nu si-ti KU ha-bu-lu-u SA 8.25 GIN KU.BABBAR i-di-nu-nim u mi-ma u-la i-di-nu-nim u is-ti ta-ar-hu-nu-u 5 GIN KU.BABBAR a-hu-ur u si-ti KU.BABBAR su-nu-u il5-qe-u i ba-ab-ti-ka mi-ma u-la im-hu-ru-u a-na te-er-ti-ka u-su-ur-sa-a-sur na-hi-id u4-mu-um is-tu i-ta-at-qu ITU.3.KAM e-si-e ma-ma u-la is-a-ma a-na-ku-ma a-as-a-am KI ha-pi-i 1.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR ni-im-hu-ur-ma u-su-ur-sa-a-sur il5-qe-e 0.66666 ma-na KI ha-ku-li-e ni-il5-qe-e u 5 GIN KU.BABBAR u-su-ur-sa-a-sur
tgt: To Aššur-nādā from Ša-ša-aḫ-šu-šar: Since you had left they have received 2/3 mina 5 shekels of silver and given that to Uṣur-ša-Aššur son of Aššur-malik. Uṣur-ša-Aššur has taken 3 kutānu-textiles and deposited them in the port office. They received 12 shekels of silver from Šarapunuwa and gave that to me. The house of Kutubiš brought 4 sacks of barley; I received it here and 1 1/2 sack will be for myself. The house of Ka'uba brought 3 sacks of wheat. However, they did not give me anything. 15 shekels of silver from Tarhunu, they owe the rest of the silver; thereof they have given me 8 1/4 shekels of silver. However, they did not give me anything (else), and 5 shekels remain owed by Tarhunu. Also, it was they who took the rest of the silver. They have received nothing from your outstanding claims. Make Uṣur-ša-Aššur pay attention to your orders. The term (for repayment) is overdue by three months. Even firewood he did not buy for me, so I myself have bought it. From Habi we have received 1 2/3 mina 5 shekels of silver; Uṣur-ša-Aššur has taken it. 2/3 mina we got from Haluli; also, Uṣur-ša-Aššur <has received> 5 shekels of silver.

src: a-na sa-lim-a-hi-im qi-bi-ma um-ma la-qe-pu-um i-li-a u pu-su-ke-en6-ma is-tu ni-is-ha-tim u mu-ta-e nu-sa-hi-ru-ni 2 GU 2 ma-na 8 GIN AN.NA-ak-ka iz-ku-a-am 27 {TUG}ku-ta-ni 4 TUG sa li-wi-tim mi-ma a-nim DUMU e-ra-di ip-qi-id-ni-a-ti ni-ka-si is-ti-su a-di-ni la ni-si ANSE.HI-ru-ka me-tu SA.BA 20 {TUG}ku-ta-ni 0.5 ma-na.TA 4 TUG su-ru-tum 15 GIN.TA 7 GIN.TA a-na AN.NA-ki-ka nu-mi-id-ma 28.33333 ma-na 7 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er DAM.GAR a-na u4-me pa-ti-u-tim na-di si-ti {TUG}ku-ta-ni-ka 7 TUG a ni-ka-si-ka na-ad-u 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA 4 {TUG}li-wi-tum 5 {TUG}ku-ta-ni 1 ANSE sa-la-ma-am sa se-ep a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5 26 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 1 ANSE sa-la-mu-um nu-ur-ISTAR ir-de8-a-am 1 ANSE me-et SA.BA 1.5 TUG ni-is-ha-tum u 1 GIN KU.BABBAR ni-pu-ul 3 TUG.HI.A a si-mi-im 0.5 TUG is-ti {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni si-ti TUG.HI-ti-ka 26 TUG.HI.A iz-ku-u-nim i-na 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA sa se-ep a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5 4 ma-na ni-is-ha-tum 4.83333 ma-na 4 GIN mu-ta-u is-tu AN.NA-ak qa-tim gam-ru 7.33333 ma-na 7 GIN AN.NA a-na a-sur-mu-ta-bil ne-pu-ul si-ti AN.NA-ki-ka 1 GU 53.66666 ma-na LA 1 GIN iz-ku-a-am 11 ma-na AN.NA sa ILLAT-at a-sur-ma-lik E ka-ri-im ni-il5-qe-ma a li-bi4 AN.NA-ki-ka ni-di SU.NIGIN 2 GU 4.66666 ma-na LA 1 GIN AN.NA-ak-ka 7 GIN.TA 26 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 0.5 ma-na.TA ANSE ki-ma 0.5 ma-na SU.NIGIN KU.BABBAR sa AN.NA TUG.HI.A u ANSE 31 ma-na 18.5 GIN i-se-er DAM.GAR a-na u4-me pa-ti-u-tim na-di 4 TUG sa li-wi-tim a-na ni-ka-si-ka na-ad-u i-na 6 GU 3 ma-na AN.NA sa se-ep ah-sa-lim 21 ma-na ni-is-ha-tum 3 ma-na 10 GIN mu-ta-u si-ti AN.NA-ki-ka 6 GU 5.83333 ma-na SA.BA 5 GU 4.66666 ma-na 8 GIN.TA 50 {TUG}ku-ta-nu qa-dum su-ru-tim sa is-bu-tu 0.33333 ma-na.TA a-na u4-me-e qu-ur-bu-tim 54.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er DAM.GAR na-di
tgt: To Šalim-aḫum: Lā-qēpum, Iliya, and Pūšu-kēn: After we deducted the excise tax and the deficiencies, they cleared your tin—122 minas 8 shekels. 27 kūtānum-textiles, 4 textiles as wrappings, all this Son of Erradi turned over to us. We have not yet cleared accounts with him. Your donkeys died. Thereof, 20 kutānum-textiles at 1/2 mina each, 4 šurum-textiles at 15 shekels each, 7 shekels for your tin, we bundled together and 28 minas 27 shekels is placed on the merchant on long terms. The remainder of your kutānum-textiles is 7 textiles. They are deposited in your account. 130 minas tin, 4 textiles as wrappings, 5 kutānum-textiles, 1 black donkey (all) of the šēpum of Aššur-mutabbil--Nūr-Ištar drove 26 kutānum-textiles, 1 black donkey here. One donkey died. Thereof, 1 1/2 textiles (were) the excise tax. And we balanced 1 shekel silver. 3 textiles were for 'purchases.' 1/2 textile is with Ilabrat-bāni. They cleared the remainder of your textiles—26 textiles. From the 2 talents 10 minas tin from the šēpum of Aššur-mutabbil, 4 minas were the excise tax. 4 minas 54 shekels were lost. After the hand tin was exhausted, we remitted Aššur-mutabbil 7 minas 27 shekels tin. They cleared the remainder of your tin—53 minas 39 shekels. We took 11 minas tin from the caravan of Aššur-mālik at the colony office and placed it with your tin. The total was 2 talents 4 minas 39 shekels. Your tin—at a 7 shekel rate, 26 kutānum-textiles—at a 1/2 mina each, a donkey—for 1/2 mina, in all the silver from your tin and textiles and donkey—31 minas 18 1/2 shekels—is placed on a merchant on long terms. 4 textiles of the wrappings are placed in your account. From the 6 talents 30 minas tin of the šēpum of Aḫ-šalim, 21 minas was the excise tax.. The deficiencies were 3 minas 10 shekels. The remainder of your tin was 6 talents 5 5/6 minas. Thereof, 304 minas 40 shekels (tin) at a rate of 8 shekels and 50 kutānum-textiles together with šurum-textiles which were seized, at a rate of 20 shekels (we gathered(?), and) 54 minas 45 shekels silver on long terms are placed on a merchant.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na en-um-a-sur qi-bi4-ma 5 GU 25 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 94 TUG SA.BA 5 TUG ka-ab-tu-tum 15 TUG ta-ar-di-u-tum 30 {TUG}ku-si-a-tum 1 {TUG}su-lu-up-ku-um 1 lu-bu-su-um 2 ni-ib-ra-ra-an 6 ANSE 7 ma-na AN.NA ri-ik-su-um sa ik-ri-bi4-a a-ha-ma mi-ma a-nim i se-pi-ka tu-se-si 4 GU 20 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 1 me-at 24 TUG 6 ANSE mi-ma a-nim sa se-ep i-sar-be-li 1 GU 7 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 5 TUG 0.5 ANSE sa se-ep ku-lu-ma-a 2 GU 20 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 11 TUG ka-ab-tu-tum 10 TUG sa qa-tim 1.5 ANSE sa se-ep a-la-bi4-im mi-ma lu-qu-tim a-ni-tim KU.BABBAR sa AN.NA-ki-a u TUG.HI-ti-a sa-ba-at-ma KU.BABBAR ma-la tu-se-bi4-la-ni bu-tu-uq-ma si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-a se-bi4-lam lu-qu-tum sa se-ep ku-ra lu sal-ta-at sa AN.NA u TUG.HI.A za-ki-a-ma KU.BABBAR ku-nu-uk-ma i pa-ni-ka se-bi4-lam a-la-an ma-as-ka-tim sa se-ep ha-na-na i-na a-la-ki-ka mi-ma ni-ka-si sa-ah-lu-tim la tu-ba-lam i pa-ni-ka za-ki-a-am 7 ma-na AN.NA ri-ik-su-um sa se-pi-ka 21 ma-na AN.NA sa a-su-mi DUMU a-sur-i-di ub-lu-ni-ku-ni 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR se-bi4-lam
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Ennam-Aššur: 5 talents 25 minas tin under seal, 94 textiles, therein 5 heavy textiles, 15 tardiāutum-textiles, a kusiātum-textile, a šulupkum textile, a garment, 2 nibrāarum-textiles on 6 donkeys, with .. minas tin (in) a sack for my ikribū separately, you set out with all this in your transport. 4 talents 20 minas tin under seal (and) 124 textiles on 6 donkeys, all this was in the transport of Išar-bēlī.

src: um-ma i-li-<gap>-<big_gap> <gap>-ma a-na {d}en-LIL-ba-ni qi-bi-ma a-su-mi sa E a-bi-ku-ni sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni um-ma a-ta-ma ma-ha-ti i-na mu-a-ti-sa ma-la te-zi-bu-ni su-up-ra-ma uz-ni pi-te mi-ma KU.BABBAR u URUDU i-na E-ti-ku-nu u-la te-zi-ib lu UD.KA.BAR lu ba-pi-re-e u 1 li-im 5 me-at se-am te-zi-ib SA.BA 5 me-at 80 a-na a-ka-al E a-bi4-ku-nu ga-me-er si-ti se-im i-ba-si mi-su la ta-la-kam-ma i-su E a-bi4-ku-nu la ta-la-ma-ad a-na ma-nim a-na-kam ta-da-gal su-ma la e-ni-ka KU.BABBAR DUMU i-li-a a-di-ni u-la is-qul
tgt: Of the 11 kutānu-textiles, the rest of Kurub-Ištar's textiles, that Ṭāb-ṣill-Aššur wrote a note about--1 kutānu-textile, in Zalpa a donkey was lost,

src: um-ma a-mur-ISTAR-ma a-na a-zu-na-a en-nam-a-sur u ar-si-ah qi-bi-ma a-na en-nam-a-sur qi-bi-ma KU.BABBAR 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-tu 13 sa-na-tim a-na si-ib-tim i-la-ka-kum ta-li-kam-ma is-ti-a ta-na-me-er-ma u-la ni-qi-am e-ri-is-ka u-la su-lu-um pa-ni u-ka-li-im-ka a li-bi4-ka la-mu-nim i-na ka-si-im u pa-su-ri-im i ma-ah-ri-a tu-uk-ta-ni 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-a a-na a-sur-ma-lik DUMU ka-ra-wa 40 ma-na URUDU SIG5 a-na ha-da-a a-hi-su ku-nu-ki-a IGI si-be-e ap-qi-da-ku-ma u-se-bi4-il5-ka sa du-a-ki-ka te-pu-us-ma KU.BABBAR ta-ta-ba-al <gap> <gap>-sa a ni-a-ti 40 ma-na URUDU ha-da-a i ni-ka-si la is-ku-na-ni um-ma su-ut-ma u-la i-di-nam a-pu-tum tup-pa-su-nu li-li-kam
tgt: From Amur-Ištar to Azunaya, Ennam-Aššur, and Aršiaḫ; specifically to Ennam-Aššur:

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u dan-a-sur qi-bi4-ma KU.BABBAR sa DAM.GAR sa ku-si-a ub-la-ni ha-ra-num sa ma-at sa-pi-il5-tim sa-da-at u a-na-kam si-mi AN.NA u-la i-ba-si su-ma ha-ra-num sa ma-at sa-pi-il5-tim e-ta-ar-ba-am ma-la di-in a-lim{ki} AN.NA u TUG.HI.A a-sa-a-ma i pa-nim-ma u-se-ba-la-ku-nu-ti a-su-mi lu-qu-tim a-ni-tim mi-ma dan-a-sur la i-ka-la 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ki-a 40 TUG SA.BA 20 TUG ka-ab-tu-tum 33 TUG sa ba-ri-ni SA.BA 10 TUG ka-ab-tu-tum a-sur-ma-lik i-ra-de8-a-ku-nu-ti lu-qu-tam a-ni-tam lu sa se-ep PUZUR4-a-sur za-ki-a-ma dan-a-sur li-ta-al-kam mi-su sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni-ni 6 TUG.HI-ti-ka i-di-su-en6 i-ta-ba-al i-na na-as-pe-er-ti-a ku-lu-ma-a u i-di-su-en6 i-ra-de8-u-ni-ku-nu-ti mi-su sa a-na-ku i-di-su-en6 uk-ta-na-su-du a-na dan-a-sur qi-bi4-ma is-ti KU.BABBAR sa ik-ri-bi4-a 10 GIN KU.GI u 5 ma-na URUDU ma-si-a-am lu-ub-lu-nim sa-du-a-tam mi-ma ta-da-na-am KU.BABBAR i-la-kam-ma ik-ri-bi4-a u-se-ra-ab a-na si-a-ma-tim u-la i-tu-ar
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn and Dān-Aššur: As for the silver belonging to the merchant which Kuṣia brought, the caravan from the lower land is ... Also, here there are no purchases of tin available. If the caravan from the lower land arrives, I will purchase tin and textiles according to the decision of the city and send them to you (pl.) with the very first caravan. Concerning this merchandise, do not be delayed(?) Dān-Aššur whatsoever. Aššur-mālik brings you 2 talents 10 minas tin under my seal, 40 textiles, of which 20 are heavy textiles, and 33 textiles jointly owned, of which 10 textiles are heavy textiles. Clear these goods, and those from the transport of Dān-Aššur so that Dān-Aššur may depart. Why is it that you write to me, "Idī-Suen brought your 6 textiles." Kulumaya and Idī-Suen brought it to you (pl.) in my missive. Why is it that Idī-Suen ... To Dān-Aššur: Let them bring 10 shekels gold and 5 minas washed copper with the silver of my ikribū. For whatever shipping charge you pay, let the silver come so that I may bring in my It will not be returned for purchases.

src: a-na sa-lim-a-hi-im qi-bi4-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma 61 ku-ta-ni qa-dum sa ka-sa-ri-im u qa-dum sa a-na {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni tu-se-bi4-la-ni a-sur-ma-lik ub-lam SA.BA 3 ku-ta-nu ni-is-ha-tum u sa 1 TUG ni-is-ha-tim ta-na-pa-al 6 ku-ta-nu sa si-mi-im u 3 GIN KU.BABBAR i-na-pu-lu-ni-kum 52 ku-ta-nu iz-ku-u-nim u 2.16666 GIN ta-la-qe SA 1 ku-ta-nam a-sur-ma-lik a ma-la te-er-ti-ka a-na qa-ti-ka i-di-in 3 ku-ta-ni ka-sa-ar-ka il5-qe-ma 0.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI sa-du-a-su sa-bu ka-sa-ar-ka na-as-a-ku-um si-ti TUG-ba-ti-ka 48 TUG-ba-tu iz-ku-u-nim a-na 2 GU 18 ma-na AN.NA a-wi-ti-ka 13.83333 ma-na AN.NA da-tum ik-su-ud-ka 3 ma-na 15 GIN u-ku-ul-ti 2 ANSE u 1 ka-sa-ri-im 1 ANSE i-mu-ut-ma 17 GIN KU.BABBAR is-ku-nam 7 GIN KU.BABBAR ig-ri sa-ri-dim is-tu ha-hi-im a-di ka-ni-is is-ku-nam 12 GIN mu-ta AN.NA qa-tim is-tu 12 ma-na AN.NA qa-tim is-ri-hu 5 ma-na 15 GIN AN.NA a-na se-er AN.NA qa-tim ta-na-pa-al 8 GIN.TA 0.5 ma-na 9.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR-ap-su 17 GIN si-im ANSE u 7 GIN ig-ri sa-ri-dim u-ra-di-ma SU.NIGIN 1 ma-na 3.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR ta-na-pa-al 2.25 GIN KU.BABBAR sa i-na-pu-lu-ni-ku-ni is-hi-ir-ma 1 ma-na 1 GIN 15 SE KU.BABBAR a-na a-sur-ma-lik a-pu-ul
tgt: To Šalim-aḫum from Pūšu-kēn: Aššur-mālik brought 61 textiles, together with the goods of the transporter, and together with the things which you sent to Ilabrat-bāni. Thereof, the excise was 3 kutānum textiles. And you will balance the excise of 1 textile. The purchases was 6 kutānum textiles and they will repay you 3 shekels silver. They cleared 52 kutānum textiles, and you will receive 2 1/6 shekels. Thereof, Aššur-mālik deposited 1 kutānum textile to your account according to your instructions. Your transporter took 3 of your kutānum textiles and your transporter brings 25 shekels silver its excise added and shipping duty paid. They cleared the remainder of your textiles, 48 textiles. For your awītum: 2 talents 18 minas tin, the datum set 13 5/6 minas tin for you. The feed for 2 donkeys and 1 packer was 3 minas 15 shekels. 1 donkey died and he charged you 17 shekels. He charged you 7 shekels silver for the hire of the handlers from Ḫaḫḫum to Kanesh. The losses on hand tin were 12 shekels. After the 12 minas hand tin diminished, you will balance 5 minas 15 shekels tin to the hand tin. At an 8 shekel rate, the value in silver is 39 1/3 shekels. The price of the donkey was 17 shekels and the hire of the handler was 7 shekels and I added what coudl be added and in total you will balance 1 minas 3 1/3 shekels silver. The 2 1/4 shekels silver which they balance to you were deducted and I balanced 1 mina 1 shekels and 15 grains silver to Aššur-mālik.

src: um-ma nu-ur-ISTAR DUMU i-la-ab-ra-at-ba-ni-ma a-na su-be-lim qi-bi-ma a-hi a-ta be-li a-ta la na-ak-ra-ku la a-hi-a-ku si-ir-ka da-ma-ka a-na-ku me-tam i-a-ti u me-er-i i-na ki-si-ir-si-im te-ti-ir-ni-ni-a-ti um-ma a-ta-ma a-na a-wi-li-ma et-lu-um a-hi la na-ka-ar la a-hi a-ta a-na a-wi-li a-wa-tam ku-zu-ub-tam is-te-et qa-ri-ib su-ba-tam is-te-en6 si-na a-na GAL si-mi-il5-tim ki-bi-sa-ma et-lu-tum la i-mu-tu a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ki-ma sa ku-wa-a-tu-ni-ma a-ta a-at-u-su-nu-ti u hu-la-lu-um is-ti-ka li-it-hi si-im TUG.HI.A sa ta-na-di-a-ni a-na ba-ab a-wa-ti-su-nu lu-ma-li-u a-hi a-ta be-li a-ta i qa-qi-ri-im sa-nim te-ti-ra-ni ti-ma-li i-nu-mi ma-sa-ni as-e-ka-ma ki-sa-ra-num e-zi-is us-te-li-a-ni
tgt: From Nūr-Ištar s. Ilabrat-bāni to Šū-Bēlum: My dear brother and lord, I am not an enemy!

src: <big_gap> tup-pu-su a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim ne-pu-us ma-la sa ma-ah-ri-ku-nu-ma <big_gap>
tgt: We made his tablet for 20 ḫamuštum weeks. As much as you agreed to ...

src: 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am pu-su-ke-en6 a-na ku-si-a a-na be-a-lim i-di-in IGI PUZUR4.SA.TU DUMU 0.5
tgt: Pūšu-kēn gave 1/3 mina refined silver to Kuziya as capital. Witness: Puzur-sadu'e son of MAŠ.

src: a-na id-na-a la-qe-ep pi-la-ah-a-sur u ib-ni-li qi-bi-ma um-ma a-bi-la-ma 16 ma-na LA 6 GIN KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-a 16 GIN sa-du-a-su sa a-li-li a-na a-sur-UTU-si ap-qi-id a-ma-kam KU.BABBAR u sa-du-a-su sa ki-ma a-li-li li-il5-qe 5.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-a-um a-na a-sur-{d}UTU-si a si-a-ma-tim a-di-in ba-ab ne-pi-si-im a-na a-sur-UTU-si KISIB DAM.GAR la-pi-it a-na id-na-a u la-qe-ep qi-bi-ma KU.BABBAR li-qe-a-ma is-ti-ku-nu li-bi-si u te-er-ta-ku-nu li-li-kam 5 GIN KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ku-a a-na ta-ta-a me-er-i-ti-a 3 GIN KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-a a-na sa-zu-a DUMU.SAL en-nam-a-sur se-bu-la-tim a-na a-sur-UTU-si ap-qi-id a-ma-kam se-bu-la-tim li-qe-a-ma sa a-na a-lim{ki} i-li-ku a-na a-li-ki-im di-na-ma se-bu-la-tim a-na a-lim{ki} lu-bi-il5-ma a-na ta-ta-a me-er-i-ti-a u sa-zu-a DUMU.SAL en-nam-a-sur li-di-in ki-ma KU.BABBAR u se-bu-la-tim tal-qe-a-ni te-er-ta-ku-nu li-li-kam
tgt: To Idnāya, Lā-qēpum, Pilaḫ-Aššur, and Ibni-ilī, from Abela: I entrusted 15 minas 54 shekels silver under my seal, 16 shekels its shipping charge, to Aššur-šamšī on behalf of Āl-ilī. There, make sure the representative of Āl-ilī recieves the silver and it's shipping charge. I gave 5 1/2 minas silver of my own to Aššur-šamšī for purchases. The seal of the merchant at the opening of the package is marked for Aššur-šamšī. To Idnāya and Lā-qēpum: Get the silver and let it come with you within your shipment. I entrusted 5 shekels silver under my seals for Tatāya my daughter and 3 shekels silver under my seal for Šazua, the daughter of Ennam-Aššur in a package to Aššur-šamšī. Take the package there and give it to those who go to the city for travel so that they carry the package to the city and give it to Tatāya my daughter and Šazua the daugher of Ennam-Aššur. Let your message come that your received the silver and the package.

src: 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-su-en6 PUZUR4-a-sur i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-la-hi-im u na-ab-su-en6 a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-me-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul a-na 1 ma-na-im 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.1.KAM ab sa-ra-ni li-mu-um a-mur-a-sur IGI a-ma-a IGI u-su-pi-is-ki-im
tgt: Šu-Suen owes Puzur-Aššur 2 minas refined silver. He will pay ten weeks from the ḫamuštum of Al-aḫim and Nāb-Suen. If he does not pay at the fulfillment of his term, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest. Month: Ab šarrānē. Eponymate: Amur-Aššur. Witnesses: Amāya, Uṣup-iškum.

src: um-ma hi-na-a-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma 10 GU AN.NA 16 GIN.TA ni-is-a-ma AN.NA i-na E-ti-ka i-ba-si u a-na ma-la te-er-ti-ka KU.BABBAR a-na si-ib-tim ni-il5-qe TUG.HI.A ni-sa-a-ma su-ISTAR ni-ta-ra-dam 5 {TUG}lu-bu-su pa-si-u-tum su-la-ba-an DUMU dan-i-li ub-la-kum mi-ma la u-la-ma-ad-ka 1 lu-bu-sa-am pa-si-a-am a-mur-a-sur DUMU su-ka-li-a ub-la-kum 2 ku-ta-ni a-la-hu-um SES qar-wi-a ub-la-kum 1 ku-ta-nam sa sa-at-a-sur a-na ku-a-ti a-di-na-kum a-ma-kam i-na te-er-ti-a lu ku-ta-nam SIG5 lu sa a-ki-di-e SIG5 lu i-na <big_gap> AN.NA-ki-a a-na KU.BABBAR ta-e-er-ma u sa 2 ma-na KU.GI a-na DUMU sa-lim-a-hi-im di-in a-su-mi sa E a-sur-ma-lik sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni um-ma DUMU-e a-sur-ma-lik-ma a-na ma-la tup-pi-su sa is-pu-ra-ni a-sa-su nu-za-ka-ma te-er-ti-ni za-ku-sa is-ti su-ISTAR DUMU da-da-nim ni-sa-pa-ra-kum a-hi a-ta a-na te-er-ti-a i-hi-id
tgt: From Ḫinnaya to Pūšu-kēn: We purchased 10 talents tin at a 16 shekel rate and the tin is in your house. Also, according to your instructions, we borrowed silver. We purchased textiles and we dispatched Šū-Ištar. Šū-Laban son of Dān-ilī brought you 5 white garments. He/I did not inform you at all. Amur-Aššur son of Sukkallīya brought you 1 white garment. Al-āḫum brother of Qarwīya brought you 2 I gave to you 1 kutānum-textiles belonging to Šāt-Aššur for your disposal. There, according to my instructions, convert either a fine Concerning the matter of the house of Aššur-mālik about which you wrote me, the sons of Aššur-mālik said, "According to the tablet which he wrote, we will clear his wife and clear our instructions. We will send to you with Šū-Ištar son of Dadānum." My dear brother, heed my instructions.

src: KISIB a-na-ah-i-li KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur sa 1 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-DU10 a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ka-si-im a-na 6 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 2 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-DU10
tgt: Seals: Anaḫ-ilī, Puzur-Aššur. Aššur-ṭāb owes Aššur-rēʾī 1 mina 10 shekels refined silver. He will pay 6 weeks from the ḫamuštum of kaššim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er sa-lim-a-sur bu-zu-ta-a i-su IGI a-mur-a-sur IGI a-mur-{d}UTU-si IGI su-be-lim a-ha-ma 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR i li-bi4 sa-lim-a-sur sa a-na a-mur-{d}UTU i-hi-ib-lu-ma a-na-ku qa-ta-tu-ni IGI si-lu-lu IGI PUZUR4-sa-du-e 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-ha-ma i li-bi4 sal-ma-a-sur-ma 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR be-u-la-tim i li-bi4 ur-da-a-sur <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am <big_gap> <gap>-da-at AN.NA da <gap> <big_gap> <gap> is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa <big_gap>-ur u ga-<gap>-<gap> a-na <big_gap> <gap> ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu <big_gap>-MAR.TU IGI ku-<gap> <big_gap> <gap>-nim su ni <gap> <big_gap> a-mu-ra-am al-<big_gap> <gap> ma-na 7 GIN KU.BABBAR sa tup-pi-su ha-ar-mi-im sa su-ISTAR DUMU ma-lik-DINGIR-su 0.83333 ma-na 2.5 GIN i-a-um 0.5 ma-na 4.5 GIN sa a-sur-e-mu-qi 3.5 ma-na 1 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im sa-ha-ar-tim i li-bi4 en-nam-a-sur DUMU u-za-a 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am <big_gap> <gap> na a la ku <gap> u-bi4-il5 IGI su-be-lim IGI <big_gap>
tgt: Šalim-Aššur owes 3 minas refined silver to Buzutaya. Witnesses: Amur-Aššur, Amur-Šamaš, Šū-Bēlim

src: 0.5 ma-na 4.5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er i-la-li-ah-su u pe-ru-a a-sur-na-da i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa am-ri-a u la-qe-ep a-na 6 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 1-<gap> GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM u-su-bu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI zu-pa IGI a-sur-ma-lik IGI ta-ar-ah-nu
tgt: 1/2 mina 4 1/2 shekels of silver Ilaliahšu and Peruwa owe to Aššur-nādā. If they have not paid, they must add interest at the rate of 1 shekel (per mina) per month. They are jointly responsible for the silver. Witnessed by Zuba, witnessed by Aššur-malik, witnessed by Tarahnu.

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur KISIB du-du KISIB a-na-ah-DINGIR sa hu-bu-ul a-na-ah-DINGIR 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-la-hi-im u kur-ub-ISTAR a-na 11 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-na-ah-DINGIR
tgt: Seals: Puzur-Aššur, Dudu, Anaḫ-ilī. He will pay 11 weeks from the ḫamuštum ša Al-aḫim and Kurub Ištar. If he does not pay on time, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: um-ma a-sur-GAL-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-hi a-ta a-di ma-la u se-ni-su te-er-ti i-li-ka-ku-um um-ma a-na-ku-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN sa da-me sa su-ha-ri-im ma-la en-um-a-sur DUMU qa-ri-a il5-qe-u li-qe-ma se-bi4-lam a-ta ma-ti-ma mi-ma-sa-ma te-er-ta-ka la i-li-kam a-hi a-ta a-sa-me-ma si-ip-ri sa as-pu-ra-ni KU.BABBAR sa la-qa-im il5-qe lu KU.BABBAR sa si-ip-ri il5-qe-u lu ma-la i-na li-bi4 en-nam-a-sur DUMU qa-ri-a i-ba-si-u li-qe-ma KU.BABBAR ku-nu-uk-ma se-bi4-lam a-hi a-ta be-li a-ta et-ra-ni su-ma la ku-a-ti a-na ma-nim a-na-ta-al
tgt: From Aššur-rabi to Pūšu-kēn: My dear brother, my message has come to you once or twice. I said, "Take every single shekel of silver for the blood of the youth, as much as Ennum-Aššur son of Qarwiya recieved, and send to me." As for me, why is it that no message of your has come whatsoever? My dear brother, I have heard that my messenger that I sent you took all the silver that could be taken. Get both the silver that my messenger took and whatever is available from Ennam-Aššur son of Qarwiya, and seal the silver and send it to me. My dear brother and lord, as for that which he took away, if not you, to whom else can I look?

src: a-na PUZUR4-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma il5-we-da-ku-ma a-di AN.NA sa i-di-na-bi-im sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni ki-ma e-bu-ur-su-nu-ni u si-mu-um qa-su AN.NA pa-ta-ra-am la a-mu-a a-di 5 u4-me e-bu-ur-su-nu u-se-ru-bu-ma AN.NA a-la-qe-ma a-na KU.BABBAR u KU.KI u-ta-ar-ma si-im AN.NA-su u-se-ba-la-su-um mi-ma li-bu-su e il5-mi-in ki-ma ku-wa-tam i pu-su a-na-hi-id-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN u-se-la-su-um i-na a-wa-ti-a ba-ta-qi-im a-wa-tam is-te-te lu-qa-ri-ib-ma lu a-bu-um i-a-ti
tgt: To Puzur-Aššur from Ilī-wēdāku: Regarding the tin of Iddin-abum about which you wrote, becasue it was(the time of?) their harvest and (becasue of) the price of his share, I did not want to open the tin.

src: 11 ma-na 17 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa li-bi4 a-ta-ta DUMU ma-num-ba-lum-a-sur KU.BABBAR su-a-ti a-sur-i-mi-ti SES-su zi-zi-zi-i DAM-su u u-sur-sa-a-sur DUMU-su e-pu-lu-ni-a-ti a-na ITU.1.KAM KU.BABBAR i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 1 ma-na-um 1 ma-na i-sa-qu-lu ITU.1.KAM ab sa-ra-ni li-mu-um en-na-su-en6 DUMU i-di-a-bi-im IGI a-ta-a-a DUMU bu-si-a IGI pu-su-ke-en DUMU sa-ra-wa IGI a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 DUMU i-di-a-bi4-im
tgt: Aššur-imittī his brother, Zizizi his wife, and Uṣur-ša-Aššur his son repayed us 11 minas 17 shekels refined silver, from the funds of Atata son of Mannum-bālum-Aššur. As for the silver they will pay, if they do not pay, they will pay 1 mina (extra) for each mina. (Month:) Ab-šarrānē. Eponymate: Enna-Suen son of Iddin-abum. In the presence of Attaya son of Buziya, Pūšu-kēn son of Šarawa, and Aššur-mutabbil son of Iddin-abum.

src: 0.83333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa as-qu-dum u a-sur-na-da i-na ka-ni-is il5-qe-u-ni u si-ta-tim KU.BABBAR 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN sa as-qu-dum KI e-di-na-a il5-qe-u su-ma tup-pa-am ha-ar-ma-am u-la si-bi4 a-na e-di-na-a as-qu-dum la us-te-li a-na KU.BABBAR a-nim su-sal-sum as-qu-dum a-na e-di-na-a i-sa-qal su-ma tup-pa-am u-la si-bi4 us-te-li KU.BABBAR as-qu-dum sa-bu is-tu SAG ha-mus-tim sa il5-ba-ni a-na 6 ITU.KAM e-ta-wu-u
tgt: As for 55 shekels refined silver which Asqudum and Aššur-nādā received in Kanesh and the remainder worth 45 shekels silver which Asqudum received from Iddinnāya, if Asqudum cannot produce the sealed tablet or witnesses to Iddinaya, Asqudum will pay triple for this silver to Iddinaya. If he does produce a tablet or witnesses, Asqudum will pay the silver in full. He will negotiate from the beginning of the ḫamuštum of Ilī-bāni for 6 months.

src: 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-SIPA DUMU su-ISTAR a-hu-wa-qar i-su is-tu ITU.KAM si-ip-im a-na 11 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab li-mu-um PUZUR4-ni-ra-ah IGI e-di-na-a-a IGI i-di-a-bi-im IGI su-la-ba-an
tgt: Aššur-rēʾī s. Šū-Ištar owes Aḫu-waqar 2 minas refined silver. He will pay 11 ḫamuštum weeks from the month of Ṣibʾum. If he does not pay (on time) he will add 1 1/2 shekels per min per mont h as interest. Eponymate: Puzur-Niraḫ Witnesses: Idinaya, Iddin-abum, Šū-Laban.

src: 8.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ta-li-a ha-na ta-ar-hu-nu u a-ra-wa a-sur-na-da i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ga-ab-ri-a u a-sur-ma-lik 1 GIN.TA a-na ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab KU.BABBAR i-na qa-qa-ad ke-ni-su-nu sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI {d}ISKUR.GAL IGI ha-lu-li IGI zu-u-zu
tgt: 8 1/3 minas of refined silver Talia, Ha ... Tarhunu and Arawa owe to Aššur-nādā. Reckoned from the week of Kabria and Aššur-malik he[sic] will add interest of x shekels per mina per month. They are jointly responsible for the silver.

src: um-ma im-di-lum-ma a-na lu-zi-na u PUZUR4.ISTAR qi-bi-ma a-na lu-zi-na qi-bi-ma a-hi a-ta a-wa-tam <gap> me <gap> a-na-ku a-su-mi a-wa-tim sa i-tur4-DINGIR u i-na-ah-DINGIR i-hi-id-ma i-na sa-ha-at PUZUR4.ISTAR i-zi-iz-ma i-na a-wa-tim is-te-et u-za-su pe-te-ma lu a-hu ni-si-im su-ut-ma <gap> a-ma-kam <gap> u su a-su-mi <gap> 2 ma-na za-na i-na-ah-DINGIR i-li-ka-ku-ni u4-mu-su ma-di-is e-ta-at-qu <gap> ma-na KU.KI u TUG.HI.A <gap> ID u-ka-lu-ni ma-la <gap> PUZUR4.ISTAR i-qa-bi4-a-ku-ni <gap> is-ti-su i-zi-iz-ma <gap> <gap>-pu-us a-na PUZUR4.ISTAR gi-mi-lam5 su-ku-un <big_gap>
tgt: From Imdī-ilum to Luzina and Puzur-Ištar:

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma {d}ISKUR-ba-ni-ma en-nam-a-sur as-ba-at-ma um-ma a-na-ku-ma KU.BABBAR ma-la pa-ka a-na a-wi-lim ta-di-nu qi-bi-ma u pa-a KU a-na a-wi-lim lu nu-bi-il5 um-ma su-ut-ma a-di 10 u4-me la ta-ha-da-ar is-ti a-hi-a ni-ka-si la-si-ma URUDU-i lu-se-si-a-ma qa-ti hi-na-a u sa ki-ma dan-a-sur a-wa-ti la-ag-mu-ur-ma ra-mi-ni lu-za-ki-ma u la-tal-ka um-ma a-na-ku-ma ta-ak-ta-al-a-ni u-la KU 5 ma-na u-la URUDU 10 GU a-na sa ki-ma um-mi-a-ni-a na-as-qu-ul mi-na-ma a-na um-mi-a-ni la-as-pu-ur um-ma su-ut-ma KU 20 ma-na ma-la pa-i a-di-nu-su-ni a-la-ak-ma a-sa-qal um-ma a-na-ku-ma KU.BABBAR ta-ka-sa-ad a-na um-mi-a-ni-a la-as-pu-ur um-ma su-ut-ma a-ka-sa-ad su-pu-ur a si-a-ti ak-la URUDU sa DAM.GAR-ri-im sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni 11 GU URUDU SIG5 E a-mur-ISTAR na-di a-sur-is-ti-kal is-ba-at-ma um-ma su-ut-ma ha-ra-ni a-na se-na u4-me u-si-am
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Adad-bāni: I siezed Ennam-Aššur and I said to him, "The silver as much as you promised to the man saying, 'We will indeed bring the silver to the man.'" He said, "Do not worry for another 10 days. Let me settle accounts with my brother so that he sends me my copper so that I may answer the share of Ḫinnaya and the representatives of Dān-Aššur and fulfill it from my own funds." I said, "At your departure(!) either 5 minas of silver or about 10 talents of silver we will weigh out to the representatives of my investor/principal. "Why would I write to my principal?" He said, "About 20 minas of silver, the amount which I promised him, I will go and I will pay." I said, "Let me write to my principal that you will acquire the silver." He said, "I will acquire it, write (to him)." I wait for this ??? As for the copper about which you wrote the merchant, 10 1/2 talents of fine copper were placed in the house of Amur-Ištar. Aššuriš-tikal took possession of it and he said, "I will depart on my journey in two days."

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na la-qe-ep u pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma ta-as-pu-ra-nim um-ma a-tu-nu-ma i-na lu-qu-tim sa se-ep i-li-as-ra-ni 6.33333 ma-na AN.NA u 0.5 TUG is-ti {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni e-ta-lu-tam e-pu-us-ma su-uq-li ip-tu-ur-ma AN.NA-ki il5-qe a-pu-uh a-wi-lim sa-ri-im su-ut AN.NA i-a-am il5-te-qe a-na AN.NA-ki-a 6 GIN.TA sa-as-qi-la-su a-sa-me-ma i-na lu-qu-tim si-a-ti-ma 16.5 ma-na-KU BABBAR AN.NA u 0.5 ma-na 7 GIN KU.BABBAR is-ti i-di-a-bi-im DUMU i-di-ISTAR a-na AN.NA 6 GIN.TA u-la i-ba-ta-aq IGI {d}en-LIL-ba-ni IGI PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU e-la-li u-nu-ti u u-nu-su-nu is-te-ni-is a-na-nu-um ir-de8-ma a-wi-lum sa-ru-um a-se-er AN.NA qa-tim sa a-di-nu-su-nu-ti u AN.NA 1 GU u 2 GU up-ta-re-er a ki-ma su-nu a-ma-kam wa-as-bu-ni a-wi-lam u-di-du-ma i-na i-a-im il5-qe-ma u-nu-su-nu sa-lim-tam il5-ta-qe-u ILLAT-at la-qe-ep u-ku-ul-tam 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN.TA is-ku-nu su-nu su-a-ti 0.33333 ma-na.TA u-sa-as-ki-nu-su mi-su a-num sa i-na i-a-tim-ma lu-qu-tim e-ku-lu lu i-na AN.NA-ki-su-nu il5-qe lu i-na TUG-ti-su-nu il5-qe-e u-di-du-su-ma i-na i-a-im il5-qe-ma su-ba-ti-su-nu u AN.NA-ak-su-nu sal-ma-am-ma u-ta-er a-pu-ti-a-ma a-na-ku la a-ha-li-iq is-ti-in u se-na lu-us-bu-ma a-sar us-ma-at-ni le-pu-su su-ma da-nu-tam e-ta-wu-u a-na ka-ri-im al-ka
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Lā-qēpum and Pūšu-kēn You (pl.) wrote me. You said, "From the merchandise of Ilī-ašranni's transport, 6 1/3 minas tin and 1/2 textile are with Ilabrat-bāni." He acted on his own authority and opened my package and took my tin! Instead of some random thief, he took my tin! Cause him to pay a six shekel rate for my tin! I read that Iddin-abum s. Iddin-Ištar owes 19! 1/2 minas [silver] (for) tin from those very same goods, (paying) 1/2 mina silver (per kutānum textile) and a 7 shekel rate (for tin). He will not pay less than a 6 shekel rate for the tin! In the presence of Enlil-bāni and Puzur-Aššur son of Elāli, he drove my goods and their goods together from here and the thief (i.e. Ilabrat-bāni) broke up 1 or 2 'talents' (i.e. sacks) of tin in addition to the hand tin which I gave to them. In this way they who were there 'informed' the man so that he took from mine while they took away their merchandise intact. As for the caravan of Lā-qēpum, they charged feed (expenses of) 45 shekels each. How is it that they took it out of my own merchandise? Did he take (anything) from their tin or did he take (anything) from their textiles? They 'informed' him and he took from mine, and he returned their textiles and tin intact! Urgent! I shall not lose out! Let one or two of them stay and do whatever is appropriate. If they speak harsh words, [go] to the colony.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma la-ma-si-ma li-mu-um su-da-a KU.BABBAR e-ri-sa-ni-ma um-ma su-ut-ma sa wa-si-ti-su KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na ha-bu-ul KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na 10 GIN sa a-na li-mi-im bu-zu-zu tu-se-bi-la-ni a-na li-mi-im su-da-a <gap> 1 ma-na a-sa-qal 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa tu-se-bi-la-ni u-ra-ni u-la i-di-nam um-ma su-ut-ma 5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-di-nam a-na pa-su-ri-im pa-su-ra-am u-la i-di-nam
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Lamassī: The limmum-official Šudāya requested silver and he said, "He owes about a mina of silver for exit taxes." I will pay out the 1 minas 10 shekels (silver) which you would pay to the limmum-official Buzuzu to the limmum-official Šudāya as the 1 mina. Urani did not give the 5 shekels silver which you sent. He said, "He gave me 5 shekels of silver, but he did not give permission to release it.

src: 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-mur-{d}a-sur su-ku-tum i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa u-ra-a u kur-ub-ISTAR 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa zu-zu 0.25 GIN i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na e-sa-ar-tim u-sa-ab IGI a-sur-ma-lik IGI i-ku-pi-a-sur
tgt: Amur-Aššur owes Šukkutum 1 mina refined silver. He will add (interest) at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month from the ḫamuštum of Ūraya and Kurub-Ištar. Witnesses: Aššur-mālik, Ikūn-pī-Aššur.

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur KISIB a-sur-ma-lik 10.5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er su-a-sur DUMU a-la-hi-im sa na-ri-im a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-gu5-za u a-sur-i-di a-na 3 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 10 GIN-tum <gap> GIN.TA i ITU.KAM u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul su-a-sur DUMU a-la-hi-im sa na-ri-im
tgt: Seals: Puzur-Aššur, Aššur-mālik. Šū-Aššur s. Al-aḫim of the river owes Aššur-rēʾī 10 1/2 shekels silver. He will pay 3 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aguza and Aššur-idī. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 10 shekels (per mina) per month as interest.

src: um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma a-na wa-al-di-DINGIR u a-ba-a-a qi-bi4-ma a-na wa-al-di-DINGIR qi-bi-ma 25 TUG.HI.A i-di-a-bu-um ub-lam 7.25 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR ap-su-nu 3 ma-na 1.25 GIN SA.BA 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-di-a-bu-um ub-la-ku-um 5 GIN KU.BABBAR a qa-ti i-di-a-bi4-im a-di-in 1 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na PUZUR4-sa-tu a-di-in si-ti KU.BABBAR-ka 1 0.33333 ma-na 1.25 GIN KU.BABBAR <big_gap> <gap>-<gap> <big_gap> <gap> KU.BABBAR ap-sa gam-ra-kum
tgt: From Pūšu-kēn to Waldi-ilum and Abaya: To Waldi-ilum: Idi-abum brought 20 textiles. At 7 1/4 shekels each, their yeild in silver was 3 minas 1 1/4 shekels. Thereof, Idī-abum brought to you 1/2 minas silver silver. I gave 5 shekels silver to the accounts of Idī-abum. I gave 1 mina 10 shekels silver to Puzur-sadūʾē. The remainder of your silver, 21 1/4 shekels, ... (As for PNf?) her silver is cleared in full to you.

src: a-na i-na-a qi-bi-ma um-ma i-ku-pi-a-ma a-su-mi E ka-ri-im la-ma a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum e-ru-bu e-mi-da-su URUDU u-sa-ma qa-at-ka bur-a-sur il5-qe-ma su-um-su i-na E ka-ri-im la-pi-it 3 ma-na SIG.HI.A qa-at-ka u-sa-ma a-sur-{d}UTU-si il5-qe <big_gap> 3 <gap> qa-at-ka <big_gap> a-sa <gap> <big_gap> u-se-bi-la-ni <big_gap> a-na hi-dim <gap> <big_gap> a-na KU.BABBAR ma-qi-it ka-ka-ra-tum i-ba-si-a a ma-la te-er-ti-ka lu KU.BABBAR lu KU.KI KI a-sa-a-ma u-se-ba-la-ku-um mi-su sa ta-zi-ma-tim ta-as-ta-na-pa-ra-ni a-su-mi ma-nim a-na-kam wa-as-ba-ku-u su-ma li-ba-ka i-na sa-am-si tup-pi-i ta-sa-me-u KU te-er-ta-ka le-zi-ba-ma la-ta-al-kam mi-na-am e-pu-us-ma ta-na-zu-ma-am a-sur u <big_gap> li-tu-la i-la-nu-ka a-ba-am sa-ni-a-am la i-su-u
tgt: To Innaya from Ikkupiya: For whose sake am I stayng here?

src: KISIB a-bi-a-a KISIB a-mur-a-sur KISIB en-um-a-sur DUMU u-zu-a sa hu-bu-ul a-mur-ISTAR DUMU DINGIR.SIPA 2 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa a-sur-SIPA is-tu ha-mus-tim sa su-ki-tim u u-ra-a a-na 5 ha-am-sa-tim i-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-mur-ISTAR DUMU DINGIR.SIPA
tgt: Seals: Abīya, Amur-Aššur, Ennum-Aššur s. Uzuwa. He will pay 5 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Šukatim in Burušḫaddum. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: a-na a-sur-i-di qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa ba-ri a-la-hi-im u i-a-ti ha-na-nu-um DUMU i-ku-pi-a a-na a-la-hi-im u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku u-se-bi4-il5 um-ma a-na-ku-ma ni-is-ha-tim u sa-du-a-tam ra-di-a-ma a-na a-bi4-ni u sa ki-ma a-la-hi-im se-bi4-la a-bi4 a-ta be-li a-ta a-na mi-ma KU.BABBAR u KU.GI sa us-te-bi4-la-ku-ni mi-is-lum AN.NA SIG5 wa-at-ra-am mi-is-lam TUG.HI.A sa-ma-am a-na li-im sa a-se-ni-su u la <gap> i-lu-ku
tgt: To Aššur-idī from Aššur-nādā: The 10 minas of refined silver which is owned jointly by Alāhum and myself, Hannānum, the son of Ikuppiya, has sent to Alāhum and Aššur-taklāku. I said: "Add the import duty and the transport tariff and send it to our father and Alāhum's representatives." If you are truly my father and lord, for all the silver and gold To the City they will go two or three times.

src: 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ha-ta-tim PUZUR4.DINGIR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa qa-te MAR.TU ba-ni a ITU.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 0.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab IGI la-qe-ep li-mu-um i-di-a-bi4-im ITU.KAM si-ip-im
tgt: Ḫadādum owes Puzur-ilī 5 shekels refined silver. He will pay one month from the ḫamuštum after Amurrum-bāni. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1/2 shekel (per mina per month as interest). Witness: Lāqēp. Eponymate: Iddin-abim. Month: Ṣipʾem.

src: a-na su-ka-li-a su-a-nim u i-ku-pi-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma i-di-EN.ZU-ma a-na i-ku-pi-a-sur qi-bi-ma ah-sa-lim u a-sur-na-da KU.BABBAR u-la i-di-nu-nim te-er-ta-ka sa-hi-tum li-li-ka-su-nu-ti 6.33333 ma-na 4 GIN KU.BABBAR ha-bu-la-kum 4 ma-na a-mu-ra-am a-na ni-ka-si-a ta-as-qu-ul su-ma KU.BABBAR la us-ta-ak-si-da-kum ma ha-ra-ka ta-la-ak i-na {d}UTU-si wa-sa-i-ka su-ka-li-a u su-a-num KU.BABBAR a-na si-ib-tim li-il-qe-u-ma li-di-nu-ni-kum su-ma i pa-ni wa-sa-i-ka KU.BABBAR la ta-al-qe si-ib-tum la i-ma-<gap>-nim a-na ah-sa-lim u a-sur-na-da su-up-ra-ma KU.BABBAR-ka lu-se-bi4-lu-nim
tgt: To Sukalliya, Šū-Anum, and Ikūn-pī-Aššur from Iddin-Suen: To Ikūn-pī-Aššur: Aḫ-šalim and Aššur-nādā did not give me the silver. Let your urgent message go to them. I owe you 6 minas 24 shekels silver. You paid 4 minas certified silver to my account. If they did not cause the silver reach you, but you intend to go, on the day of your departure let Sukkallia and Šū-Anum take the silver for interest and give it to you. If you do not receive the silver before your departure, (and) the interest does not ..., then send to Aḫ-šalim and Aššur-nādā so that they send your silver to me.

src: a-na a-la-hi-im u a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma um-ma i-di-{d}EN.ZU sal-ma-ni u u-nu-ti sal-ma-at i-na ti-me-el-ki-a ni-ti-si
tgt: To Alāhum and Aššur-nādā from Iddin-Suen: We are well. Also my goods are well. We have just left Timelkia.

src: 0.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-ma-lik dan-a-sur i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa kur-ub-ISTAR a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM-im u-sa-ab ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tim li-mu-um i-li-dan IGI er-ra-su-lu-li IGI a-sur-du-ri
tgt: Aššur-mālik owes Dān-Aššur 1/3 minas 5 shekels refined silver. He will pay in ten weeks from the ḫamuštim of Kurub-Ištar. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels 1 mina interest per mina per month.

src: <big_gap> KISIB a-ma-a DUMU a-bu-um-DINGIR KISIB u-su-pi-is-ki-im DUMU <big_gap> KISIB su-su-en6 DUMU PUZUR4-sa-du-e sa hu-bu-ul su-su-en6 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU su-la-ba-an i-se-ri-su i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-la-hi-im u na-ab-su-en6 a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la <big_gap>

src: um-ma hi-na-a-ma a-na a-sur-na-da u dan-a-sur qi-bi-ma su-ma ku-lu-ma-a i-ta-la-ak-ma mi-ma i-na AN.NA-ki-a il5-qe te-er-ta-ak-nu li-li-kam u su-ha-ri-a na-hi-da-ma e-ma-ri lu-sa-ki-lu AN.NA i-na sa-qa-lim qa-at-ku-nu-ma li-is-qu-ul u a-sar pa-zu-ur-tim su-ba-ti SIG5-tim qa-ti-ma su-ba-ti-ku-nu ep-sa a-hu-a a-tu-nu gi5-im-la-ni
tgt: From Hinnaya to Aššur-nādā and Dān-Aššur: If Kulumaya has left and taken any of my tin, then send me word. Also, instruct my servants to feed the donkeys. In paying tin you must pay personally. Also, where there is a chance of smuggling you must deal with my good textile together with your own. My dear brothers, do me a favour!

src: a-na PUZUR4-a-na qi-bi4-ma um-ma ir-ma-a-sur u PUZUR4-{d}UTU-ma a-di tup-pi-im si-bu-ti qa-ta-tim u a-sur-DUG sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni <big_gap> sa ta-e-ra-su-nu-ni <big_gap> <gap>-<gap>-sa-ah-su-nu-ma <big_gap> <gap>-<gap>-ta-sa <big_gap> pi-la-ah-a-num <big_gap> pi-la-ah-a-nu-um <big_gap> <gap>-da-ma <big_gap> a-mi-sa-am <big_gap> <gap>-<gap>-kum <big_gap> sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni <big_gap> <gap>-na KU.BABBAR <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> um-ma su-ut-ma a-i-tam i-a-ti sa su-ut la i-di-u u-la KU.BABBAR 10 GIN a-na qa-ti-a u-la ANSE a-na ra-ka-bi4-a a-na E a-bi4-a e-ra-ab-ma a-na u-ku-ul-ti su-uh-ri-im KU.BABBAR 10 GIN u-la 0.33333 ma-na u-la a-da-an a-wi-lu-um u-la na-tu u-la i-la-ka-kum a-li ne-mar-ma si-be ni-sa-ka-su-ma tup-pe-e nu-ha-ra-ma is-ti a-li-ki lu tup-pe-ka lu te-er-ta-ka nu-za-ka-ma nu-se-ba-la-kum a-na-kam a-<gap>-<gap> is-ti a-sur-i-mi-ti <gap> <gap>-im sa qa-ta-at en-um-a-sur zu <gap> a na sa-ba-si-a a-sur-i-mi-ti i-tu-<gap> <big_gap> i-na di ni <big_gap> a-si-ti ni <big_gap>
tgt: To Puzur-Anna from Irma-Aššur and Puzur-Šamaš: Regarding the tablet of .. withesses of the shareas and Ašsur-ṭāb about which you wrote, ... which ... Pilaḫ-Anum ... Pilaḫ-Anum ... to there ... to you. ... which you wrote ... silver ... He said, "Who is he that he does not know me?" I don't have even 10 shekels silver for my expenses! I don't (even) have a donkey to ride! He will enter the house of my father and I will give about 10 shekels silver for the child's sustenance funds, but not a third of a mina (silver)! The man is not reliable! Wherever there are profits (to be made) we will set witnesses and we will seal your tablets and we will clear your tablets and instructions and send them to you. Here ... with Aššur-imittī ... of the shares of Ennum-Aššur .. to Sabasiya Aššur-imittī ... ... in the (verdict?) ... for the remainder (?) ...

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma su-pu-ul-tum-ma i-li-ba-ni is-tu is-ti u-su-ur-sa-a-sur us10-bu ar-bi-i-su ha-ra-nam i-li-kam 5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-na be-u-la-ti-su u-la al-qe u-la su-ut i-na la ma-si um-mi-a-ni-su KU.BABBAR 1 GIN u-la ir-si u-la a-na-ku KU.BABBAR 5 GIN u-la ab-la-at su-ma a-bi a-ta be-u-la-ti-su ta-e-er-ma a-na se-ri-ka ta-hi-su su-ha-ru-um li-il5-qe-su-ma su-ha-ri-ka si-ni-iq-su be-u-la-ti-su a-na qa-ti-su la tu-sa-ar i-ga-ma-ar a-di qa-su ta-mu-ru-ni su-ma da-mi-iq u da-mi-iq-ma a-na hu-bu-li-a be-u-la-tu-su li-tu-ra-am
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Šubultum: Ilī-bāni, after he stayed with Uṣur-ša-Aššur, arrived on four trips. I did not take even 5 shekels silver from his capital fund. It was not him. When it was not sufficient, his investor did not redeem for him even a single shekel of silver. It was not me. I did not live on a mere 5 shekels silver My dear father, return his capital fund and draw him near to you. Take the youth. Supervise him as your youth. Do not return his capital fund to his account. He will spend it off. Until you see his account, if it is all well and good, let his capital fund return to my debt.

src: 1 ma-na LA 0.25 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ha-pu-a-la u ba-ar-ku-i-a PUZUR4-a-na i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa kur-ub-ISTAR u a-la-hi-im a-na 6 ITU.KAM i-sa-qu-lu su-ma i-ma-la u4-me-su-nu la is-qu-lu 3 GIN.TA i ITU.KAM a ma-na-im u-su-bu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sa-lim-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI e-na-za IGI ti-wa-ti-a
tgt: Ḫappu-ala and Barkuia owe Puzur-Anna 59 3/4 shekels. He will pay 6 months from the ḫamuštum of Kurub-Ištar and Al-aḫim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 3 shekels per mina per month (as interest). (The responsibility to pay) the silver is bound to whomever is solvent. Witnesses: Enaza, Diwadia

src: KISIB ar-si-ah DUMU ga-ab-ri-a KISIB PUZUR4-i-li DUMU i-ku-pi-a KISIB si-li-{d}ISKUR DUMU na-ap-li-is 0.33333 ma-na 3 GIN KU.BABBAR li-ti SIG5 i-se-er si-li-{d}ISKUR DUMU na-ap-li-is su-ku-bu-um i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-nu-nu u PUZUR4-a-sur a-na ITU.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM te-i-na-tim li-mu-um a-la-hu-um DUMU i-na-ah-DINGIR
tgt: Seals: Arši-aḫ s. Gabrīya, Puzur-ilī s. Ikuppiya, Ṣilli-Adad s. Naplis. Ṣilli-Adad s. Naplis owes Šū-Kūbum 1/3 mina 3 shekels fine quality silver. He will pay one month from the ḫamuštum of Šū-Nunu and Puzur-Aššur. If he does not pay (on time), he will add (interest) at the rate of the colony each month. Month: Teʾināim Eponymate: Al-aḫum s. Inaḫ-ilī

src: um-ma wa-ak-lum-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa as-qu-dim a-na-kam as-ba-at u 10 ma-na a-na si-ib-tim al-qe-ma KU.BABBAR u-se-bi4-la-ku-um lu-qu-tam sa as-qu-dim sa u-sa-bi-tu a-na KU.BABBAR u-ta-ar-ma KU.BABBAR sa si-ib-tim u-ta-ar-ma si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-ka u-se-ba-la-ku-um 2 GU 5 ma-na AN.NA 30 ku-ta-ni 2 ANSE sa-la-me 5 ma-na 5 GIN hu-sa-ra-am SIG5 wa-at-ra-am 11 GIN a-mu-tum ki-is-ru-um mi-ma a-ni-im a-na as-qu-dim a-bi-i i-di-in IGI a-sur u i-li-a a-ka-ra-ba-kum me-er-i a-ta ki-ma a-na KU.BABBAR-pi-ka 1 GIN tu-us-ta-ma-ru-su i-hi-id-ma a-di 1 GU KU.BABBAR u e-li-is a-lik-ma KU.BABBAR-ap a-wi-lim sa-bi-it tup-pi tu-ka-al sa a-na e-ta-lu-ti-ka a-na-ku-ma tup-pi-a ta-sa-bu-tu a-wi-lum se-tu-ti a-bi4-a u se-tu-ti il5-te-qe su-ta-am-ri-is-ma ma-la ta-ga-mi-li-ni e-pu-us 2 su-ha-ri-a us-ti-mi-it u KU.BABBAR ap-ku-nu i-ta-ba-al a-na ti-mi-il5-ki-a ti-i-ir-ti i-ta-la-ak u a-ta a-ma-nu-um su-pu-ur-su-nu-ti-ma KU.BABBAR-pi a-na se-ri-ka lu-se-bi4-lu-nim KU.BABBAR 1 GIN la i-be-e-lu-nim i-sar-be-li su-ha-ri is-ti as-qu-dim wa-sa-ab i-hi-id-ma i pa-ni-im-ma se-ri-a-su
tgt: From the You wrote me. You said, "I seized the 5 minas silver from Asqudum here. Also, I borrowed 10 minas silver on interest and I sent you the silver. The merchandise from Asqudum which I took, I will convert to silver and the silver on interest I will 'convert'and I will send you the rest of your silver." 2 talents 5 minas tin, 30 kutānum-textiles, 2 black donkeys, 5 minas 5 shekels exceedingly fine 'gold', and 11 shekels meteoric iron in lumps--all this my father gave to Asqudum. I will pray for you in the presence of Aššur and my god. My son, because you are grieved over every shekel of your silver, take heed so that up to a talent of silver or more goes out so that the silver of the man is seized. You hold my tablet. Concerning my tablet saying that it is I who (stands) for your authority which you will seize, the man earned the disdain of my father and my disdain. Cause him to constantly fret and do me as big a favor as you can. He ... my two textiles and he will bring/brought your (pl.) silver. My message went to Timelkiya. But as for you, send them from there so that they might send my silver with you. They must not borrow a single shekel of silver. Išār-bēlī my youth is with Asqudum. Take care to lead him away immediately.

src: 0.5 ma-na 2.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er en-nu-um-a-sur {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-ba-ni a-na 7 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul a-na 1 ma-na-im 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab IGI i-di-a-sur IGI en-num-a-sur
tgt: Ennum-Aššur owes Amurrum-bāni 32 1/2 shekels refined silver. He will pay 7 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-bāni. If he does not pay (on time) he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Witnesses: Idī-Aššur, Ennum-Aššur.

src: KISIB a-sur-i-mi-ti KISIB ur-si-si KISIB u-su-ur-sa-ISTAR sa 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er u-su-ur-sa-ISTAR a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa bu-si-a u sa-lim-a-sur ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tim li-mu-um su-da-a DUMU en-na-nim 1 ma-na a-na sa-na-at i-sa-qal 1 ma-na a-na sa-ni-tim sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab 1.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa ILLAT-at a-sur-ma-lik a-sur-SIPA sa-qu-ul ta-ah-si-is-tum10 a-ni-tum10 me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul u-su-ur-sa-ISTAR
tgt: Regarding the 2 minas refined silver which Uṣur-ša-Ištar owes to Aššur-rēʾī. He will pay 1 mina a year from the ḫamuštum of Buṣiya and Šalim-Aššur, month of Qarrātum, eponymat of Šudāya s. Ennānum. He will pay 1 mina in the second year. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month Aššur-rēʾī has paid(?) 1 mina 45 shekels silver of the caravan of Aššur-mālik This memorandum is a copy of the sealed tablet of the debt Uṣur-ša-Ištar.

src: 0.33333 ma-na 2.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er i-di-{d}UTU DAM.GAR-ru-um i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-na-a u a-sur-ma-lik a-na 0.33333 ma-na 2.5 GIN 1.25 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab ITU.KAM ab-sa-ra-ni li-mu-um {d}ISKUR-ba-ni IGI PUZUR4-a-sur IGI a-bi-a-a
tgt: Idī-Šamaš owes the merchant 22 1/2 shekels refined silver. He will add 1 1/4 shekels per month interest to the 22 1/2 shekels from the ḫamuštum of Innāya and Aššur-mālik. Witnesses: Puzur-Aššur, Abīya

src: 0.33333 ma-na 1.5 GIN KU.BABBAR li-ti SIG5-tim i-se-er ta-ak-sa-nu-ma-an ha-pu-wa-su u ma-na-ma-na a-si-ti-su i-na-a i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-na-su-en6 u i-li-a-lim a-na 4 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu-u su-ma la is-qu-lu-u 1 GIN KU.BABBAR i-na ITU.KAM a-na KU.BABBAR a-nim si-ib-tam u-su-bu-u ITU.KAM te-i-na-tim li-mu-um ka-pa-di-a KU.BABBAR i-na qa-qa-ad ke-ni-su-nu u ba-al-ti-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI is-me-li-im IGI ar-ha-nu-ma-an
tgt: Takāanuman, Ḫappu-ašu and his wife Manamana owe Innāya 21.5 shekels fine liti silver. They will pay four weeks from the ḫamuštum of Enna-Suen and Ili-ālim. If they do not pay, they will add 1 shekel silver per month for this silver as interest. Month: Teʾinātim. Eponymate: Kapādīya. The silver is bound to whomever is legally responsible and solvent. Witnesses: iš-me-li-im, Arḫanuman.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-sur im-di-DINGIR u pu-su-ke-en6 u i-li-ba-ni-ma a-na ku-zi-zi-a qi-bi-ma 18 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-ka i-li-ba-ni ub-lam 6 GIN i-na ma-sa-im im-ti 1 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na na-pa-hi-im u e-si ni-di-in 3.6666600000000003 GIN 15 SE mu-su-ka-u ku-nu-ku-ni i-na E pu-su-ke-en6 i-ba-si 16.5 GIN lu ki-ib-sa-tum lu mu-ta-u KU.BABBAR-ap-ka i-bi-ti-iq u a ma-la ti-er-ti-ka a-se-er 18 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa il5-ba-ni ub-la-ni 13 ma-na 16 0.5 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am 1 GIN.TA a-na si-ib-tim ni-il5-qe-a-kum-ma tup-pi-ni ih-ri-mu 31 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am hu-bu-la-ka a-na pu-su-ke-en6 ni-is-qul tup-pa-ka ne-ri-su-ma um-ma su-ut-ma 2 ha-mu-us-ta-an u4-mu-su e-ti-qu si-ib-tam su-uq-la-nim-ma u tup-pu-su la-di-na-ku-nu-ti tup-pa-ka a-na si-ib-tim u-ka-al ku-zi-zi-a li-li-kam-ma a si-ib-tim lu ni-tu-u i-hi-id-ma 13 ma-na 16.5 GIN sa a-na si-ib-tim ni-il5-qe-u se-bi4-lam
tgt: From Šalim-Aššur, Imdī-ilum, and Pūšu-kēn and Ilī-bāni to Kuziza: Ilī-bāni brought 18 minas silver under your seal. 6 shekels were lost in the washing process. We gave 1 shekels for the smith and wood. 3 2/3 shekels 15 grains poor quality silver under our seals is available in the house of Pūšu-kēn. Your silver was deducted 16 1/2 shekels both deductions and losses. Also, according to your instructions, in addition to the 18 minas silver which Ilī-bāni brought, we acquired for you 13 minas 16 1/2 shekels refined silver at a 1 shekel (per mina per month) rate and they sealed our tablet. 31 minas refined silver, your debt, we weighed out to Pūšu-kēn. We asked him about your tablet and he said, "Their terms are two weeks past due. Have them pay the interest so that I may give you (pl.) his tablet. I hold your tablet for interest." Let Kuzizīya come and we will negotiate about the interest. Take care to send the 13 minas 16 1/2 shekels silver which we took for interest.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti u sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-su-mi be-ti sa en-na-nim sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni um-ma a-ta-ma be-ti sa-ma-nim a-na be-ti KU.BABBAR ma-dam e-ri-su-ni-a-ti-ma um-ma ne-nu-ma a-ha-is lu ni-di-ma KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na lu nu-sa-pi-la-am sa-lim-a-sur u su-hu-bur ba-lum sa-a-li-ni a-na 16 ma-na KU.BABBAR be-ti is-u-mu-ni-kum u is-ta-ap-ru-ni-kum um-ma su-nu-ma KU.BABBAR a-na si-ib-tim ni-il5-qe-a-kum KU.BABBAR mi-ma a-na si-ib-tim u-la ni-il5-qe-a-kum 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na si-mi-im be-ti sa-lim-a-hu-um i-na ra-mi-ni-su is-qul i-hi-id-ma KU.BABBAR sa sa-lim-a-hi-im se-bi-lam u 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR ta-as-bi-tam se-bi-lam um-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti-ma KU.BABBAR-ka a-na hu-ra-sa-nim a-di-in-ma la-su-ma u-la as-qul li-ba-am la i-ma-ra-as
tgt: From Aššur-imittī and Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: Concerning the houses of Ennānum about which you wrote me, "Buy the house." They asked from us a lot of silver for the house and so we said, "Let's deposit our money together and so suppress the price about a mina." Šalim-Aššur and Šū-Ḫubur, without consulting us, purchased the houses for you for 16 minas silver. And they wrote to you. They said, "We borrowed silver against interest for you." We did not borrow any silver against interest on your behalf. Šalim-aḫum paid ten minas silver towards the price of the house out of his own funds. Make sure to send Šalim-aḫum's silver. Also, send the remaining balance - 6 minas silver. Aššur-imittī said, "I gave your silver to Ḫuraṣānum and it's gone, so I didn't pay. Don't be disappointed." I gave your silver to Ḫuraṣānum and it's gone, so I didn't pay. Don't be disappointed. I gave your silver to Ḫuraṣānum. It's gone. (?) I did not pay. Don't be disappointed.

src: KISIB ha-pu-a-la KISIB su-mi-a-wa KISIB lu-u-lu KISIB ka-ma-li-a 0.33333 ma-na 0.5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er lu-u-lu u ka-ma-li-a ma-da-wa-da ti-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-tak-la-ku a-na ha-ar-pi-im i-sa-qu-lu
tgt: Seals:Ḫappu-ala, Šumiawa, Lulu, Kammalīya. Lulu and Kammalīya owe Madawada 25 shekels silver. They will pay in the spring after the ḫamuštum of Aššur-taklāku.

src: a-na a-bu-sa-lim su-a-nim sal-ma-a-sur u e-ni-is-ru qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma a-sa-me-ma ur-ka-at E-be-tim ma-qi-it 3 GIN KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki a-na e-ni-is-ru a-bu-sa-lim na-si a-hu-u-a be-lu-u-a i su-ha-ri-ku-nu is-te-na a-na e-ni-is-ru di-na-ma u a-tu-nu u-ma-kal hu-sa-ha-ku-nu e-zi-ba-ma i-na ma-ah-ri-ku-nu lu ni-iz-ku-ma lu gi-mi-lum GAL i-a-ti u a-na-ku a-wa-at-ku-nu sa-ma-am a-le-e a-pu-tum ih-da a-hu-u-a a-tu-nu e-ni-is-ru na-hi-da-ma E-be-tam li-ta-si mi-nam sa is-pu-ra-am um-ma su-ut-ma i-na E-be-tim i-ta-na-ru-du-ni a-di te-er-ti-i la i-li-ka-su-ni la u-si-i a-na sal-ma-a-sur qi-bi4-ma i-na 0.33333 ma-na LA 1 GIN KU.BABBAR sa PUZUR-a-sur
tgt: To Abu-šalim, Šū-Anum, Šalim-Aššur, and Enišru from Pūšu-kēn: I heard that after the house fell(?) Abu-šalim brought 3 shekels silver to Enišru under seal. My dear brothers and lords, he has jipped (?) you. Give only one to Enišru so that you all this very day are lacking. Leave him and very soon, whatever you cleared and my great favor I myself will be able to resolver your matter. Urgent, take care (concerning this matter)! My dear brothers, pay heed to Enišru so that he ... the house. What is it that he wrote? He said, "In constantly approaching the house, until my instructions come, he would not depart." To Salim-Assur: From the 19 shekels silver which Puzur-Assur .... (brought?)

src: a-na ha-su-sa-ar-na qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-tak-la-ku u i-di-{d}UTU i sa-am-si na-as-pe-er-ti-ni ta-sa-me-i-ni ti-ib-e-ma a-na te-ga-ra-ma a-ta-ak-ki-im i-na te-ga-ra-ma i sa-ha-at te-er-ti-a lu us-ba-ti a-di e-ti-qa-ni i sa-am-si ta-ta-li-ki-ni te-er-ti-ki li-li-kam a-ta-ak-ki-im-ma KU.BABBAR i-na wa-ah-su-sa-na ka-i-li <gap> ZU i-di-{d}UTU DUMU a-sur-ma-lik <big_gap> ta <gap> la <gap> i-di-{d}UTU ri <gap> tim
tgt: To Ḫašušarna from Aššur-taklāku and Idī-Šamaš: On the day you read our letter, set out and come to Tegarama. Remain in Tegarama for my instruction. Before departure, let your report come on the day you depart. Come and hold on to the silver from Waḫšušana.

src: i-na 7 TUG su-ru-tim sa E ka-ri-im na-du-ni 5 TUG su-ru-tim pu-su-ke-en6 i-di 2 TUG su-ru-tim i KU.BABBAR-ap sa-lim-a-hi-im ni-is-a-am i-na 9 {TUG}ku-ta-ni 1 TUG pu-su-ke-en6 i-di 1 TUG sa sa-da-dim u is-te-en6 is-ti-su sa se-ep pu-su-ke-en6 a-di 2 TUG sa se-ep i-li-as-ra-ni mi-ma a-nim E ka-ri-im sa-lim-a-hi-im na-di 6.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR i tup-pi-im ra-bi4-im sa-lim-a-hu-um la-pi-it
tgt: From the 7 black textiles which the colony office deposited, Pūšu-kēn deposited 5 textiles. 2 textiles (we purchased?) with the silver of Šalim-aḫum. From the 9? kutānum-textiles, Pūšu-kēn deposited 5? textiles. 1? textile was classified as šadādum and I deposited one with it from the cargo of Pūšu-kēn. 2 textiles from the cargo of Ilī-ašranni. All this Šalim-aḫum deposited in the colony office. Šalim-aḫum is written down for 6 1/3 minas silver in the large tablet.

src: um-ma hi-na-a-ma a-na qar-wi-a u pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-na KU.BABBAR sa AN.NA sa li-bi4 e-la-ma u a-na 10 ma-na-e sa a-lim{ki} sa tam-qa-ar-ka <gap>-<gap>-<gap> e-zi-ib is <gap>-<gap>-<gap> <gap>-<gap> <gap>-<gap>-<gap> ki <big_gap> KU.BABBAR <big_gap><big_gap><gap> sa is-<gap> <big_gap><gap> sa-as-qi-la <big_gap> se-bi-la-nim a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma 2 GU AN.NA 7.5 ma-na.TA mu-ta-tum wa-at-ra pa-ni-um u 4 GU 10 ma-na.TA mu-ta-tum wa-at-ra sa se-ep PUZUR4.ISTAR ub-la-ku-ni a-hi a-ta te-er-ti-ka li-li-ik i-na <gap> GU <gap> ma-na AN.NA tu-se-bi-lu <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-nu-uk-ma se-bi4-lam
tgt: From Hinnaya to Qarwiya and Pūšu-kēn: Concerning the silver arising from tin which (was with?) Elama and concerning the 10 minas which ... of the merchant... ... silver ... which ... pay out. (Seal it and) send it here. To Pūšu-kēn: (Concerning) the two talents of tin at a rate of 7.5 minas losses added earlier and 4 talents at 10 minas rate losses included which Puzur-Ištar's transport brought to you, my dear brother, let your message come. From the x talents (x minas) tin which you sent, seal x minas silver and send it here.

src: KISIB pe-ru-wa DUMU ha-al-ki-a-su KISIB a-du-ma-an KISIB ni-wa-su DUMU ki-is-ta-ah-su KISIB a-ra-wa-ar-hu-me-na DUMU bu-lu-ta 4.5 GIN KU.BABBAR 3 e-ri-qa-tim sa e-si i-se-er ni-wa-su-u <gap> a-ra-wa-ar-hu-me-na pe-ru-wa i-su e-ri-qa-tim sa e-si a-ni-ma i-sa-du-du-nim KU.BABBAR ur-ki qi-ti-ip ki-ra-nim i-sa-qu-lu KU.BABBAR u e-ri-qa-tum sa e-si i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu u ke-ni-su-nu ra-ki-is
tgt: Niwašu and Arawarḫumena owe Peruwa 4 1/2 shekels silver and 3 wagons of wood. They will tow the wooden wagons here. The will pay the silver after the picking of the grapes. The silver and the wagons are bound to their lives and words.

src: KISIB su-ISTAR DUMU e-ra-di KISIB {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li DUMU <big_gap>-<gap>-ti-im KISIB bu-sa-nim 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am ni-is-ha-su u sa-du-a-su i-nu-mi dan-a-sur a-na a-lim{ki} i-lu-ku bu-sa-nim i-da-su-ma a-na 30 ha-am-sa-tim 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab
tgt: If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina) per month as interest.

src: 9.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um sa ka-ri-a a-na a-sur-na-da a-na e-bu-tim i-di-nu lu-qu-tum is-tu a-lim{ki} e-li-a-ma a-sur-DUG sa KU.BABBAR a-nim lu-qu-su il5-qe su-ma ma-ma-an a-na a-sur-na-da i-tu-a-ar a-sur-DUG u-ba-ab-su IGI a-sur-dan IGI im-di-DINGIR IGI bu-si-a
tgt: Regarding the 9 2/3 minas of refined silver which Karria has given to Aššur-nādā as an investment loan--the merchandise has arrived up here from the City, and Aššur-ṭāb has taken (his share of) the merchandise corresponding to this amount in silver. If anybody should raise a claim against Aššur-nādā, Aššur-ṭāb will clear him. Witnessed by Aššur-dān, witnessed by Imdī-ilum, witnessed by Buzia.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma la-ma-si-ma tup-pu-um ta-ah-si-is-tam sa ba-a-ba-tim sa i-na be-ti-ka te-zi-bu mu-zi-zu-ka u-se-si-u-ma qa-su-nu-ma u-ka-al a-na-ku a mi-ma u-la at-hi u a-na DAM.GAR-ri-ka is-qu-lu la is-qu-lu mi-ma u-la i-de8 a-ta ma-la-ka u ki-ma as-pu-ra-ku-ni mi-ma su-mi la ta-za-kar-su-nu-ti 6.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI a-sur-{d}UTU-si DUMU la-qe-ep SA.BA <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> sa-du-a-tam u ni-is-ha-tim u-sa-hu-ru 3.6666600000000003 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR KI u-su-ur-sa-a-sur DUMU i-li-a 0.5 ma-na 5 GIN KI sa-lim-a-sur SU.NIGIN 8.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU en-na-nim i-sa-qal i-na 4 ma-na KU sa a-na i-li-is-ti-kal ha-bu-la-ku-ni 2 ma-na KU KI i-ku-pi-a 2 ma-na a-hu-ur 9 GIN ur-da-na-na <gap> 1.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa DINGIR-ma-lik me-he-er tup-pi-im sa te-zi-bu <gap> GIN a-na wa-si-im se-bi4-lam
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Lamassī: The 'gates' memorandum tablet which stays in your house, your representatives got it out and they have it in their possession. As for me, what am I responsible for? Now, I do not know whether to pay out to your merchants or not! As for you, make up your mind! And becasue I write to you must not remember them (or their names). 6 1/2 minas silver is with Aššur-Šamši s. Lā-qēpum. Thereof, they deducted the shipping charges and excise. 3 minas 45 shekels silver is with Uṣur-ša-Aššur s. Iliya. 35 shekels (silver) is (even) with Šalim-Aššur! In total he will pay 8 1/2 minas silver to Aššur-imittī s. Ennānum. From the 4 minas silver which I owe to Iliš-tīkal, 2 minas silver is with Ikūn-pīya. 2 minas (silver) is late. Warad-Nana (has) 9 shekels. Send the x+1 1/2 minas silver of Ilī-mālik, the copy of the tablet which you left, and xx shekels for exit-tax.

src: KISIB i-di-a-sur DUMU u-zu-a KISIB pi-la-ah-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-SIPA KISIB su-en6-SIG5 DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti a-na be-u-la-ti-su i-di-a-sur DUMU u-zu-a mi-ma la i-su be-u-la-tu-su i-na li-bi-su-ma a-na ITU.3.KAM ha-ra-su i-la-ak su-ma a-na ITU.3.KAM la i-tu-ra-am ITU.3.KAM la i-tu-ra-am tup-pu-um sa be-u-la-ti-su tu-pu-su-ma a-se-er tu-pi-im sa be-u-la-ti-su 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal ITU.1.KAM a-la-na-tim li-mu-um i-na-su-en6
tgt: Seal of Idi-Aššur s. Uzuwa, seal of Pilaḫ-Ištar s. Aššur-rē'ī, seal of Suen-damiq s. Aššur-imittī. Regarding the be'ulātum of Idī-Aššur s. Uzuwa, he does not owe anything. His be'ulātum is in his own account. He will go his own way. If he does not return for not return, his be'ulātum will be his own tablet, and he will pay 1/2 mian silver in addition to the (amount on the) tablet of his be'ulātum. REL 107/115/136 XII.

src: 40 <big_gap> ma-na URUDU SIG5 i-se-er a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim DUMU su-hu-bur e-nu-da-gan i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-li-dan u ki-na-a 1 ma-na-um 15 GIN i sa-tim u-sa-ab IGI en-um-a-sur DUMU da-da-a IGI i-di-a-bi-im DUMU i-su-rik13 IGI ki-na-a ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tim i-na a-lim{ki} PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU sa-ba-zi-a li-mu-um
tgt: Aššur-bēl-awātim s. Šū-Ḫubur owes e-nu-da-gán 40 minas fine copper. He will add 1 mina 15 shekels per mina per year from the ḫamuštum of Īlī-dān and Kināya. Witnesses: Ennum-Aššur s. Dadaya, Iddin-abim s. Issu-rīk, Kināya. Month: Qarrātim. In Assur, Puzur-Ištar s. Sabasīya is the eponym.

src: 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er en-um-a-sur i-di-ISTAR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-ni-nim is-tu a-lim a ka-ni-is i-tu-ra-ma KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI a-mur-ili5 IGI ah-sa-lim
tgt: Ennum-Aššur owes Idī-Ištar 2 minas refined silver. If he does not pay (on time), he will add (interest) at the rate of the colony. Witnesses: a-mur-ili, Aḫ-šalim

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u dan-a-sur qi-bi-ma AN.NA u TUG.HI.A sa se-ep dan-a-sur lu sa a-gu-a u ku-lu-ma-a ma-la iz-ku-a-ni te-er-ta-ak-nu li-li-kam i-na KU.BABBAR sa hu-ra-sa-nim u a-sur-ma-lik 7.5 ma-na sa TUG.HI.A sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni 30 ma-na KU.BABBAR u ni-is-ha-su ku-nu-uk-ma i pa-ni-u-ti-ma wa-se-e se-bi-lam su-ma dan-a-sur sa-he-er u si-ti KU.BABBAR lu i sa ANSE.HI.A lu KU.BABBAR 1 GIN a-sar i-ba-si-u 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR ma-li-ma is-ti wa-ar-ki-u-tim se-bi-lam KU.BABBAR sa PUZUR4-{d}IM u en-um-a-sur su-ma u4-mu-su-nu ma-al-u sa-as-qi-il5-su-nu-ma se-bi-lam lu lu-qu-tam sa se-ep dan-a-sur lu sa a-gu-a u ku-lu-ma-a za-ki-a-ma dan-a-sur tur4-dam i-na KU.BABBAR sa tu-si-ba-la-ni ha-nu u-ul ka-la-pa-am <gap> su-ma am-tam dan-a-sur i-na a-la-ki-su la ir-de8-a-am li-bi4 i-la-mi-na-kum i-na tup-pi-ka um-ma a-ta-ma KU.BABBAR sa a-pi-la a-sur-is-ti-kal i-sa-qal
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn and Dān-Aššur: Let your message come as to how many tin and textiles from the transport of Dan-Aššur, as much as they clear. From the silver of Ḫuraṣānum and Aššur-mālik, and the 7 1/2 minas (silver) worth of textiles about which you wrote me, seal 30 minas silver and its excise, and send it with the first departers. If Dān-Aššur is late, then the remainder of silver, whether from donkeys, or wherever a single shekel is available, fill 20 minas silver and send it with the next travelers. As for the silver of Puzur-Adad and Ennum-Aššur, if their terms are full make them pay and send it to me. Clear both the goods from Dān-Aššur's transport and Agua and Kulumaya's transport and dispatch Dān-Aššur here. From the silver which you will send, Ḫanu must(?) not ... If Dān-Aššur does not bring the maid at his departure, I will be angry with you. In your tablet, you said, "Aššuriš-tīkal will pay the silver of Apila."

src: KISIB ku-ku-a KISIB ka-lu-lu KISIB ki-ka-ar-sa u a-si-ti-su 0.5 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR li-ti SIG5 ki-ka-ar-sa u a-si-ti-su PUZUR4-a-sur is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-na-a u a-sur-i-mi-ti a-na 5 ha-am-sa-tim 17.5 GIN i-sa-qal u 5 ha-am-sa-tum i-la-ka-ma 17.5 GIN i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qul 3 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab
tgt: If they do not pay on time, they will add 3 shekels (per mina) per month as interest.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma la-ma-si-ma su-ma a-hi a-ta su-ma be-li a-ta a-na ma-nim ta-na-ta-al ku-ta-bi-id-ma ku-ur-si-ka pa-ri-ir 1 TUG-ka-ab-ta-am a-na a-sur-ma-lik i-na pa-ni-tim ha-ra-ni-su a-di-in-su-um KU.BABBAR-pi-su mi-ma u-la ub-la-am ku-nu-kam sa NA4.ZA.GIN si-a-um na-as-a-kum i-nu-mi ki-sa-am tu-se-ba-la-ni SIG.HI.A su-uk-nam sa-ap-tu-um i-na a-lim{ki} wa-aq-ra-at
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Lamassī: If you are my brother and if you are my lord, to whom should you be kind? Honor (me?) and divide your sack. I gave 1 heavy textile to Aššur-mālik at the beginning of his journey. He did not bring his silver. He brings to you a seal of lapis (from Šiʾāʾum??) When you send the leather bag, put some wool in it. Wool is scarce in the city.

src: a-na u-mi-a-ni e-la-ma u sa ki-ma e-la-ma qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-su-lu-li i-ku-pi-a a-sur-DUG {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni i-di-ISTAR en-um-a-sur u a-bu-sa-lim-ma ta-as-pu-ra-nim um-ma a-tu-nu-ma a-ma-kam E e-la-ma ma-sa-ar-tam pi-te-a-ma lu KU.BABBAR ma-la i-ba-si-u lu URUDU i-ba-si ku-un-ka-ma se-bi4-la-nim la-ma {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni en-um-a-sur u a-bu-sa-lim is-tu ka-ni-is i-li-ku-ni-ni me-er-u hi-na-a ma-sa-ar-tam ip-te-u-ma tup-pa-am ha-ar-ma-am sa 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa hu-bu-ul {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li u i-di-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-na-da il5-qe-u um-ma su-nu-ma a-na a-wa-at um-mi-a-ni ma-as-a-ni ki-ma ma-sa-ar-tam ip-te-u-ni 5 sa-ba-am a-hi-u-tim u-se-ri-bu-ma u-sa-ak-ni-ku u su-nu is-ti-su-nu ik-nu-ku ki-ma ku-nu-ki sa a-sur-DUG u sa a-sur-su-lu-li ip-te-u-ni a-su-mi-ku-nu ni-ip-la-ah-ma ma-sa-ar-tam la ni-ip-te-te a-na sa-a-li-ku-nu ni-is-pu-ra-am i-na sa-am-si tup-pi-ni ta-sa-me-a-ni te-er-ta-ak-nu li-li-kam-ma ma-sa-ar-tam lu ni-ip-te su-ha-ru la i-sa-hu-ru is-ti a-sur-ba-ni u4-ma-kal la tu-sa-as-ha-ra
tgt: To Elamma's shareholders and Elamma's representatives from Aššur-ṣulūlī, Ikuppia, Aššsur-ṭāb, Ilabrat-bāni, Iddin-Ištar, Ennam-Aššur and Abu-šalim: You have written, saying: "Open the strong-room in Elamma's house there, and seal both whatever silver is there and the copper there and send it here!" Before Ilabrat-bāni, Ennam-Aššur and Abu-šalim arrived from Kaneš the sons of Hinnaya had opened the strong-room and taken a certified tablet concerning 21 minas of silver, the debt of Adad-ṣulūlī and Iddin-Ištar son of Aššur-nādā. They said: "We take responsibility for any complaint by the shareholders." When they opened the strong-room they let a group of five strangers enter and had them (re-)seal; and they themselves sealed together with them. Since they opened the sealings of Aššur-ṭāb and Aššur-ṣulūlī we became afraid for your sake, so we have not reopened the strong-room. We wrote to ask your advice; the very day you hear our letter you should send us word, and then we shall open the strong-room. The servants must not be delayed.

src: um-ma wa-ak-lum-ma a-na en-na-su-en6 u-su-ur-sa-ISTAR u a-du-da qi-bi4-ma 6 GU u it-ra-su AN.NA 12 TUG sa li-wi-tim 3 ANSE sa-la-me en-um-a-sur i-ra-de8-a-ku-nu-ti me-er-u-i-a a-tu-nu a-ma-kam ki-ma a ra-ma-na-ti-ku-nu tu-u-ta-ma-ra-sa-ni AN.NA-ki di-na a-du-da la tu-qa-a-a AN.NA 0.5 GIN zi-ti-su ki-ma i-za-zu et-qa-ma di-na KU.BABBAR a-du-da li-ik-su-da-am IGI a-sur u i-li-a a-ka-ra-ba-ku-nu-ti 1 me-at 50 {TUG}ku-ta-ni a-na ka-ri-im tu-ur-hu-mi-it en-um-a-sur na-si a-ma-kam la i-sa-hu-ur tu-ur-da-su
tgt: From the waklum to Enna-Suen, Uṣur-ša-Ištar, and Aduda:

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma 0.66666 ma-na KU.GI pa-sa-lam sa ha-ra-an a-lim{ki} PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU a-sur-ma-lik ha-bu-lam i-na ka-ni-is i-na e-ra-bi-su-ma sa-qa-lam qa-bi u me-he-er tup-pi-su ha-ar-mi-im a-na-ku a-di-na-kum a-wi-lum a-ma-kam i-na e-ra-bi-su-ma a-na is-te-en6 u se-na ma-as-qa-al-tam i-sa-qal e-ti-iq-ma sa-ba-su-ma KU.GI sa-as-qi-il5-su um-ma a-ta-ma is-ti <big_gap> DUMU su-a-sur u-se-ba-la-kum 0.33333 ma-na KU.GI i-na KU.BABBAR-ka ra-di-ma is-te-ni-is 1 ma-na KU.GI a-na ik-ri-bi-a ku-un-kam-ma i-li-a-lim i se-pi-su lu-ub-lam a-hi a-ta a-na te-er-ti-a i-hi-id-ma tup-pe-e-a za-ki-ma en-nam-a-sur u4-ma-kal la i-sa-hu-ur tur4-da-su
tgt: Šalim-aḫum to Pušu-ken: Puzur-Ištar son of Aššur-mālik owes me 2/3 minas He promised to pay upon his arrival in Kaneš. Now, I personally gave you a copy of his certified tablet, (saying) "As for the man, there, he will pay in installments severally at his arrival. Travel overland, seize him, and make (him) pay the gold." You said, "I will send it to you with PN son of Šū-Ištar." Add 1/3 mina gold from your own gold and seal 1 mina gold in a single package for my My dear brother, give heed to my messages and clear my tablet and do not detain Ennam-Aššur for a single night. Send him to me.

src: KISIB ma-si-li KISIB sar-ma-ma KISIB ha-li-it-ka KISIB ku-su-ma-an KISIB ma-wa-as-hi sa 1 ma-na 7.5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er ma-wa-as-hi a-sur-na-da i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa na-ra-am-su a-na ha-ar-pe ta-sa-qal su-ma la ta-as-qu-ul 3 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-em tu-sa-ab
tgt: Seal of Mezini, seal of Šarma'i, seal of Halitka, seal of Kušuman seal of Mawašhi. Concerning 1 mina 7 1/2 shekels of silver (which) Mawašhi owes to Aššur-nādā--reckoned from the week of Narām-Sīn she must pay before harvest; if she has not paid she must add interest at the rate 3 shekels per month per mina.

src: 1 ma-na 3 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-UTU-si a-sur-ma-lik i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ku-bu-um u e-la-ma a-na 5 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab IGI a-sur-ma-lik IGI a-sur-GAL DUMU a-gu5-za
tgt: Aššur-Šamši owes Aššur-mālik 1 mina 3 shekels refined silver. He will pay 5 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Šū-Kūbum and Elamma. If he does not pay (on time), he will add (interest) at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Witnesses: Aššur-mālik, Aššur-rabi s. Aguza

src: 10.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ma-si-i-li i-tur4-DINGIR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-{d}EN.LIL u e-la-li a-na 33 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-me-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qul a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.1.KAM <big_gap> GIN.TA u-sa-ab IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti IGI am-ri-a IGI PUZUR4.ISTAR
tgt: Witnesses: Aššur-imittī, Amria, Puzur-Ištar.

src: 6.5 ma-na 9.66666 GIN KU.BABBAR sa se-pi-a i-na ILLAT a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku DUMU su-{d}EN.LIL at-ma-ku i mi-se-it ILLAT-tim a-la-qe 2.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa mi-si-tim 1 ma-na 9 GIN sa sa-al-sa-tim 1 ANSE i-a-um 1 ANSE sa a-bi4-ni 1 ANSE sa a-la-hi-im i-na ILLAT-at su-nu-nu ni-la-qe 1.3333300000000001 ma-na KU.BABBAR i mi-si-tim 0.66666 ma-na 2.6666600000000003 GIN i sa-al-sa-tim sa ILLAT-at su-nu-nu ni-la-qe 1.3333300000000001 ma-na KU.BABBAR i mi-si-tim 0.66666 ma-na 2.6666600000000003 GIN i sa-al-sa-tim sa ILLAT-at su-nu-nu a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku i-la-qe 12 ma-na URUDU i-na 80 ma-na.TA i bu-ru-us-ha-dim sa a-sur-na-da 6 ma-na sa a-bi4-ni i-ri-ha-am i-nu-mi 20 TUG.HI.A is-ta-ap-ku-ni 1.5 TUG su-ri-im a-di li-mu-um lu-lu-u i-nu-mi 15 {TUG}ku-ta-ni is-tap-ku-ni 1.5 {TUG}ku-ta-nim a-di li-mu-um a-mur-ISTAR 1 {TUG}ku-ta-nam qa-tam sa a-bi4-ni 1 {TUG}ku-ta-nam qa-tam sa a-sur-na-da a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku i-di KU.BABBAR-ap-su i-a-ti i-la-ak 3 GIN KU.BABBAR i-na me-tum 5 TUG sa bu-ru-us-ha-dim 4 GIN sa 10 TUG-tum 1 TUG.TA i-na ILLAT ka-si-a KI a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku zi-ba-at DUB i-ba-si
tgt: I have invested 6 1/2 minas 9 2/3 shekels of silver transported by me in the enterprise of Aššur-taklāku son of Šū-Illil; I shall receive it from the fund of the enterprise. 2 5/6 minas of silver from the fund, 1 mina 9 shekels from the dividends, 1 donkey belonging to me, 1 donkey belonging to our father, 1 donkey belonging to Alāhum, we shall take from Šū-Nūnu's enterprise. Aššur-taklāku will take 1 1/3 mina of silver from the fund, 2/3 mina 2 2/3 shekels from the dividends of the enterprise of Šū-Nūnu. 12 minas of copper out of 80 minas each, in Burušhaddum belonging to Aššur-nādā, 6 minas belonging to our father remain. When there was an opportunity to invest 20 textiles, I deposited 1 1/2 black textiles; the When there was an opportunity to invest 15 Aššur-taklāku deposited 1 The silver for this accrues to me. 3 shekels of silver in the 5 percent tax on textiles in Burušhaddum; 4 shekels for the tithe in textiles from Kasia's enterprise are with Aššur-taklāku. There is a second tablet.

src: KISIB hu-ma-da-su KISIB a-pe-zi-ah-su KISIB za-hu-da-su KISIB ta-am-na-sar KISIB sa-ra-pu-nu-a KISIB i-na-ar 1 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR 7 na-ru-uq se-um u 3 na-ru-uq ar-sa-tim i-se-er za-hu-ta-su u si-ni-il5-ka a-si-ti-su e-ni-is-ru u ta-mu-ri-a i-su-u a-ta-ah-su qa-ta-tu a-na qi-ti-ip ki-ra-nim i-sa-qu-lu u 40 NINDA u-bu-lu-nim
tgt: Ataḫšu and the guarantors will pay at the picking of the grapes. And they will bring 40 loaves.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma la-ma-si-ma 9 TUG.HI.A ku-lu-ma-a na-as-a-ku-um 3 TUG.HI.A i-di-su-en6 na-as-a-kum e-la TUG.HI.A la-qa-a-am la i-mu-a i-di-su-en6 5 TUG.HI.A la-qa-a-am la i-mu-a mi-su sa ta-as-ta-na-pa-ra-ni um-ma a-ta-ma TUG.HI.A sa tu-us-te-ne-bi-li-ni la dam-qu ma-nu-um za-ak-ru-um sa i-na E-be-ti-ka wa-as-bu-ni-ma i-la-ku-ma ma-ah-ri-su TUG.HI.A u-nu-hu-ni a-na-ku a-su-mi i-na ha-ra-an ha-ra-ma KU.BABBAR 10 GIN E-be-ti-ka li-im-qu-tam TUG.HI.A us-te-ka-ap-ma e-pa-as-ma u-se-ba-la-kum
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Lamassi: Kulumaya brings you 9 textiles. Idī-Suen brought you 3 textiles. Ela did not want to take textiles. Idī-Suen did not want to take 5 textiles. What is this that you keep writing me? What man staying in your house is going about disparaging the textiles? As for me, I try my best to make textiles and send them to you so that every caravan trip will bring 10 shekels silver in your house!
