src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni a-na {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni qi-bi4-ma i-na tup-pi-im sa la-qe-ep 6.33333 ma-na AN.NA i-na su-uq-li-ka {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni il5-qe-ma i-nu-mi-su-ma a-na ha-tim i-ta-la-ak ku-si-tam pa-si-tam sa ik-ri-bi4-a i-li-as-ra-ni a-na a-sur-ma-lik u-bi4-il5 a-sur-ma-lik u-la ik-su-ud i-ta-sa-am ku-si-tam a-ta tal-qe um-ma a-ta-ma a-na a-bi4-a se-bu-la-at 0.5 ku-ta-nim sa se-ep nu-ur-ISTAR 15 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na dan-a-sur ta-aq-bi4 um-ma a-ta-ma wa-ar-ka-at-ka u-se-ba-lam mi-ma a-nim is-tu li-mi-im ah-mar-si tu-ka-a-al te-er-ti a-di ha-am-si-su i-li-ka-kum lu sa AN.NA ku-si-tim u 0.5 ku-ta-nim KU.BABBAR a-na pu-su-ke-en6 di-in u-la su-up-ra-am-ma a-na-kam i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-ka la-al-qe 3 TUG.HI.A sa ik-ri-bi-a 1 TUG sa su-ha-ar-tim is-ti su-ba-ti-ka a-sur-ma-lik DUMU a-zu-a ub-la-kum 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na pu-su-ke-en6 di-in-ma a li-bi4 KU.BABBAR-pi-a li-di u-la ta-as-ta-na-me ki-ma a-di KU.BABBAR-pi-ka 1 GIN a-sar ni-du-nu sa-ti-sa-ma is-ti sa-bi4-im 5 u es15-ra-at su-ta-al-mu-na-ku a-sur u {d}NIN.SUBUR li-tu-la a-sar KU.BABBAR 1 GIN a-di-nu KU.BABBAR-pi 10 ma-na u 20 ma-na lu i-ru-qa-ni a-hi a-ta li-bi4 la tu-la-ma-an KU.BABBAR-pi a-na pu-su-ke-en6 di-in u-la su-up-ra-ma a-na-kam i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-ka la-al-qe li-bi4 la tu-la-ma-an
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn and Ilabrat-bāni, specifically to Ilabrat-bāni: From Lā-qēpum's tablet: "Ilabrat-bāni took 6 1/3 minas tin from your sack and at that time he went to Hattum." Ilī-ašranni brought a white kusītum robe for my votive offering to Aššur-mālik. But Aššur-mālik did not arrive. He had departed. You took the kusītum robe yourself. You said, "It is delivered to my father." You promised 15 shekels silver to Dān-Aššur. You said, "I will send it after you." You have held that one since the year of Aḫ-marši (REL 79). My dispatch came to you five times! Give Pūšu-kēn the silver for the tin, the kusītum robe, and the half kutānum textile. Or, send so that I can take from your silver here. Aššur-mālik son of Azua brings you three textiles belonging to my votive fund (and) one textile for the girl with your textiles. Give a mina of silver to Pūšu-kēn so that he puts it in my silver. Are you not constantly hearing that every year, wherever we sell, I must quarrel with groups of five or ten people concerning even a single shekel of your silver? May Aššur and Ilabrat witness that whenever I give a single shekel of silver, I am bereft of 10 or 20 minas of my silver. My dear brother, do not anger me! Give my silver to Pūšu-kēn. Or send to me so that I may take from your silver here. Do not anger me!

src: um-ma su-hu-bur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-su-mi sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni um-ma a-ta-ma me-er-u la-qe-ep ra-bi-a-an a-na na-ru-qi-im na-su-i-im wa-as-mu la tu-wa-sa-ar-su-nu a-na-kam a-sur-{d}UTU-si pi-su a-na na-ru-qi-im na-sa-i-im i-di-nam u na-ru-qum a-na be-ti-ni e-ra-ab a-su-mi a-sur-ma-lik a-hi-su tup-pu-um sa i-a-ti u a-sur-UTU-si a-na a-sur-ma-lik i-tal-ka-sum um-ma a-sur-UTU-si-ma a-na-kam a-na su-hu-bur a-na na-ru-qi-im na-sa-i-im pa-i <gap> a-ti-di-in a-ma-kam a-ta pa-ka a ma-ma-an la ta-da-an-ma la tu-ba-sa-ni lu al-kam-ma su-hu-bur a-na-kam u-za-ka-ka a-pu-tum su-ma a-hi a-ta a-ma-kam a-wa-tam is-te-et a-na a-sur-ma-lik ki-ma i-a-ti qa-ri-ib um-ma a-ta-ma a-sar a-bu-ka u a-bu a-bi-ka i-na pa-ni-tim a mi-nim TUG.HI.A il5-ta-ab-su-ni u a-ta a-ma-kam na-ru-qam na-an-si-ma <gap> li-it-ba-as a-su-mi a-sur-DU10 DUMU qar-ri-a sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni a-ma-kam KU.BABBAR-ap-ka <gap>-im li-qe <gap>-ma u-la i-su a-ma-kam lu is-ti <gap>-ri-su
tgt: From Šū-Ḫubur to Pūšu-kēn: Concerning that which you wrote, (saying) "The (two) older sons of Lā-qēpum they are fit to bear a Do not release them. Here, Aššur-Šamšī promised to bear the 'sack.' Now, the sack will enter our house. Regarding Aššur-mālik his brother, a tablet from myself and Aššur-šamšī addressed to Aššur-mālik went to him. Aššur-šamšī wrote: Here I promised Šū-Ḫubur to carry the sack. There, do not make promises to anyone and do not shame me. Let me come and I will clear you with Šū-Ḫubur. Urgent, if you are my brother, there put in a word with (lit. make draw near to) Aššur-mālik on my behalf. Thus you will say: "Why ... where your father and your father's father in the past ... to whom the god ... so you must there carry the sack ... and be clothed." Concerning Aššur-ṭāb son of Qarriya about whom you wrote, take your silver there. ... and not from there ... or from his ...

src: um-ma hi-na-a-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma a-su-mi sa DUMU la-qe-ep sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni-ni a-na-kam um-mi-a-nu la-qe-ep KU.BABBAR-ap-su-nu il5-ta-qe-u te-er-ta-ka a-se-er a-mur-ISTAR ISTAR-pi-la-ah u ku-ni-lim li-li-ik-ma mi-ma la i-du-nu-sum u su-ma mi-ma ku-ni-lum a-ma-kam i-di-sum tup-pu-su lu-da-ni-in-ma a-na-kam i-na ki-is-da-ti-su KU.BABBAR la-al-qe i-hi-id-ma ki-ma tup-pi ta-as-me-u te-er-ta-ka li-li-ik URUDU ni-il5-qe-ma a-na e-ra-ab ku-lu-ma-a a-na KU.BABBAR pa-ni ni-di-in a ma-la te-er-ti-ka ne-pa-as-ma su-ha-ri-ka ni-ta-ra-dam 5 {TUG}lu-bu-si pa-si-u-tim DUMU da-nu-i-li ub-la-kum
tgt: From Ḫinnaya to Pūsu-kēn; Concerning the matter of the son of Lā-qēpum about which you wrote, the investors of Lā-qēpum took their silver. Also, if Kunilum laid on him anything there, let his tablets be strong so that I can collect the silver here from his 'holdings'. Take care that when you read my tablet you send your message. We took the copper and we gave/deposited it for silver against the arrival of Kulumaya. ??? We have done according to your message and we will dispatch your 'youth.' The son of Dannum-ilum brings you 5 white garments.

src: um-ma su-mi-a-bi4-a-ma a-na a-pi-la-ma u en-nam-be-lim qi-bi4-ma 1 ma-na 1 GIN KU.GI pa-sa-lam ku-nu-ki-a im-di-DINGIR na-as-a-ku-nu-ti 9.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na im-di-DINGIR ha-bu-la-ku KU.GI a-na si-mi-im di-na-ma KU.BABBAR a-na im-di-DINGIR su-uq-la si-ti KU.BABBAR su-up-ra-nim-ma a-na-nu-um lu-se-bi4-lam su-ma ha-ra-su a-na si-ib-tim li-qe-a-ma sa-bi4-a
tgt: From Šūmī-abiya to Abela and Ennam-Bēlum: Imdī-ilum is bringing you 1 mina and 1 shekel I owe 9 5/6 minas silver to Imdī-ilum. Sell the gold (for silver) and weigh out the silver to Imdī-ilum. Write the remainder of the silver to me so that I send it from here. If (it is his journey?) borrow (the silver) on interest and ...

src: 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ra-pa-am i-se-er ha-su-i DUMU a-su-at su-ISTAR i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ka-si-im sa qa-ti i-na-ah-DINGIR ITU.1.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um i-li-a-lim DUMU su-ka-li-a 1 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i-na ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab IGI ba-zi-a IGI ta-a-a sa a za-am-ri-im
tgt: Ḫašui s. Ašuad owes Šū-Ištar 5 shekels refined silver. He will add 1 shekel (per mina) per month as interest from ḫamuštum of kaššim after Inaḫ-ilī, month Kuzallī, eponymate Ili-ālim s. Sukkallīya.

src: um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma a-na i-di-su-en6 u si-sa-ah-su-sar qi-bi4-ma 17 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am si-im a-bar-ni-im ku-zu-zi-a is-tu 19 sa-na-tim ha-bu-lam mi-su sa am-tum ta-li-ku-ma tu-qa-li-lu-su ne-ma-al KU.BABBAR-pi-a sa is-tu 10 sa-na-tim i-be-e-lu KU.BABBAR sa-as-qi-il5-su-ma a-na a-am-tim di-in su-ma mi-ma i-qa-bi4 su-ga-ri-a-am sa a-sur li-it-ma-ma u li-it-ba-al-su a-pu-tum la ta-ga-mi-il5-su u-ul KU.BABBAR li-is-qu-ul u-ul ta-mi-su 15 GIN KU.BABBAR is-ti ha-ar-ta-al AN.NA-ak-su a-na sa-pa-ar-tim KU.BABBAR sa-as-qi-il5-su-ma <gap> ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa du-du 0.5 ma-na KI sa-ra-pu-nu-a sa-as-qi-la-ma a-na a-wi-il5-tim di-in
tgt: From Aššur-nādā to Iddin-Suen and Šišahšušar: Kuzuziya has owed me 17 shekels of refined silver, the price of an abarniu-textile, for 10 years. How come that when the maid went, he insulted her? The profit accrued on my silver, over which he has disposed for 10 years, make him pay that silver, and give it to the maid. If he protests in any way, then let him swear by divine Aššur' s Please, do not show him any favour. Either he pays the silver or you make him take an oath! 15 shekels of silver is owed by Hartal. His tin was pledged for it. Make him pay the silver and have paid x mina 6 shekels of silver belonging to Dudu (and) 1/2 mina owed by Šarapunuwa, and give it to the maid(?).

src: 4.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI a-mur-ISTAR is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa la-li-im u a-ni-nim 1.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ku-bi-im u e-la-ma 1.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI en-nam-a-sur i-be-el 13.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI su-be-lim DUMU a-gi-a is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-li-a-lim u la-qe-ep 1.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab 16.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI su-be-lim is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa bu-si-a u DUMU e-na-sa 1.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab 2 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR KI a-mur-{d}UTU DUMU sa-li-ti is-tu sa la-qe-ep u am-ri-a 1.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab 1 ma-na KU.GI pa-sa-lam KI a-zu-za DUMU su-ku-hi-im-is-tu wa-ah-su-sa-na u-se-ba-lam 8 ma-na 7.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR KI en-na-su-en6 DUMU su-ISTAR is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa la-li-im u a-ni-nim 1.25 GIN.TA u-sa-ab 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI a-mur-ISTAR DUMU i-sar-ki-da-a-sur is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa la-li-im u a-ni-nim 1 GIN.TA u-sa-ab 8.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI a-mur-ISTAR is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ka-si-im 1.25 GIN.TA u-sa-ab 14 ma-na 13.83334 GIN KU.BABBAR KI ku-zi-zi-a is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-su u a-mur-ISTAR <gap> GIN.TA u-sa-ab 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI i-ku-nim is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-a-nim u li-ba-a 1.25 GIN.TA u-sa-ab 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI a-mur-{d}UTU u en-nam-a-sur is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ku-bi4-im 2.83333 ma-na 7 GIN KI DINGIR-is-ti-kal sa a-sur-i-mi-ti u a-sur-DU10 1.3333300000000001 GIN.TA u-sa-ab 3-<gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR KI su-be-lim DUMU sal-ma-a-sur is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa la-qe-ep u i-li-a-lim 1.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI sal-ma-a-sur is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-{d}UTU u a-mur-{d}UTU 1.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab
tgt: Amur-Ištar owes 4 1/3 minas silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels from the ḫamuštum of Lālim and Anninim. dMAT-TU-ba-ni owes 4 minas silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels from the ḫamuštum of Šū-Kūbim and Elamma. Šū-Bēlim s. Agia owes 13 1/3 minas silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels from the ḫamuštum of Ili-ālim and Lāqēp. Šū-Bēlim owes 16 1/3 minas silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels from the ḫamuštum of Buṣia and the son of e-na-sá. Amur-Šamaš s. sà-li-tí owes 2 minas 10 shekels silver. He will add 1.5 shekels from the (ḫamuštum) of Lāqēp and Amria. Enna-Suen s. Šū-Ištar owes 8 minas 7 1/3 shekels silver. He will add 1 1/4 shekels from the hamuštum of Lālim and Anninim. Amur-Ištar s. Išar-kit-Aššur owes 20 minas silver. He will add 1 shekel from the ḫamuštum of Lālim and Anninim. Amur-Ištar owes 8 1/2 minas silver. He will add 1 1/4 shekels from the ḫamuštum of kaššim. Kuzizīya owes 14 minas 13 5/6 shekels silver. He will add ? shekels from the ḫamuštum of Ašu and Amur-Ištar. Ikūnim owes 4 minas silver. He will add 1 1/4 shekels from the ḫamuštum of Šū-Anim and Libbaya. Šū-Bēlim s. Šalma-Aššur owes 3? minas silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels from the ḫamuštum of Lāqēp and Ili-ālim. Šalma-Aššur owes 2 minas silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-Šamaš and Amur-Šamaš.

src: 15 GIN KU.BABBAR ti-re-e i-se-er pu-ut-ka-an DUMU ha-ar-la-ti da-a-a DUMU il5-ba-ni i-su 1 ma-na-um 0.33333 ma-na si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.1.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um sa qa-ti za-a-a IGI a-ta-a-a DUMU PUZUR-i-li IGI su-ISTAR DUMU PUZUR-a-na
tgt: __________ s. Ḫarladi owes Dāyā s. Ilībāni 15 shekels uncertain silver. Month: Kuzallī

src: a-na um-mi-a-ni su-hu-bur u sa ki-ma i-a-ti qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma 3 sa-na-at u4-me is-ti DINGIR e-ri-is um-ma a-na-ku-ma la-lik bu-la-ti lu-za-ki-a-ma e-sa-am u ma-dam ma-ah-ri-su-nu la-as-ku-un su-hu-bur 5 sa-na-at u4-me iq-bi-a-am u a-tu-nu ma-ag-ra-tu-nu a-na-ku la am-hu-ur-su um-ma a-na-ku-ma 5 sa-na-at u-la u-qa-a a-di ma-la u4-me sa is-ti DINGIR e-ri-su la-lik-ma bu-la-ti-a lu-za-ki-a-am a-na DAM.GAR-ri-a sa a-te-be-lu 2-se-na u sa-la-sa-at u-la ta-si-im-tum KU.BABBAR ma-dum ir-tu-qa-ni u-la na-tu-ma su-mi-su-nu u-la u-da-a-ku-nu-ti um-ma a-na-ku-ma ma-ti i-lu-ku-ma DAM.GAR KU.BABBAR 1 GIN u-sar-su-nu-ti-ma u i-a-ti sa qa-ru-bi4-im u-qa-ru-bu-nim a-sur u i-lu-ku-nu li-tu-la KU.BABBAR 1 2 GU ru-qu lu-ma-si be-lu-a a-tu-nu su-ma li-bi4-ku-nu ma-la ni-is-ha-tum E um-mi-a-ni-a i-na-sa-ha-ni mi-il5-ka-ma sa 3 sa-na-at ma-as-ka-ti i-lu-ku-ma <big_gap> KU.BABBAR la i-sa-bu-tu ta-ah-si-is-tam hi-ir-ma-ma a-wa-at-ku-nu da-mi-iq-tam is-ti su-ha-ri-a la-pi-ta-nim-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN bu-la-ti-a a-na ha-ar-pe lu-pa-he-er-ma
tgt: To the investors, Šū-Ḫubur, and my representatives, from Pūšu-kēn: I requested a 3-year term from the god. Thus I said, "Let me go." Let me clear my assets (bûlātum) and I will go out. Also, let me establish much before you (??). Šū Also, you (pl.) were in agreement. As for me, I did not come before(?) him. I said, "I will not wait 5 years. Let me go until the term I asked of the god and let me clear my assets." To my merchants which I 'carry' 2 and 1/3 you did not ... He wasted much silver. He is not planted (firm? mature?) and I do not want to name him. I said (to myself), "As soon as they go, the merchant will release every shekel of silver to them and then they will gather mine as much as possible. May Aššur and your (pl.) god witness (that) I have been deprived of 2 talents of silver! My dear lords, if you will, judge how much excise tax the houses of my investors will exact and seal a taḫsistum-tablet stating that my maškattum can continue for 3 more years and so that they may not seize the silver and write to me your kind words through my servant so that I can gather every shekel of my bulātum before the harvest and (...)

src: 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR si-im am-tim sa-at-a-sur su-a-num DUMU i-na-su-en6 sa-bu su-ma ma-ma-an a-na am-tim si-a-ti a-na la-ma-sa DUMU a-li-li i-tu-ar su-a-num u-ba-ab-su
tgt: Šū-Anum s. Enna-Suen has satisfied the 1/3 mina silver, the price of the servant girl of Šāt-Aššur. If anyone returns to Lamašša d. Alili concerning this servant girl, Šū-Anum will clear him/her.

src: KISIB ku-ku-zi DUMU se-eh-ri-i-li KISIB LUGAL-su-en6 DUMU ma-ni-a KISIB na-ab-su-en6 DUMU su-be-lim 27 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er na-ab-su-en6 a-sur-ma-lik i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-di-a-bi4-im ITU.1.KAM ku-zal-lu li-mu-um i-na-a a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam i ITU.KAM u-sa-ab KU.BABBAR u lu-qu-tum a-su-mi a-sur-ma-lik GAN-lam e-ti-iq DAM.GAR u-la i-qi-ap KISIB na-zi DUMU a-mu-ru-ba-ni KISIB la-qe-ep DUMU PUZUR-sa-du-e KISIB LUGAL-su-en6 DUMU ma-ni-a 0.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er LUGAL-su-en6 DUMU ma-ni-a DAM.GAR i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-di-a-bi4-im a-na 4 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i ITU.1.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab KISIB pi-la-ah-a-sur DUMU a-sur-na-da KISIB a-sur-tak-la-ku DUMU e-na-ni-a KISIB su-a-sur DUMU i-na-ah-DINGIR 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-a-sur DAM.GAR i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-di-a-bi4-im ITU.1.KAM kan-mar-ta li-mu-um en-na-su-en6 DUMU IH.ME 22 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i ITU.1.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab wa-bi-il5 tup-pi-im su-ut DAM.GAR me-eh-ru-um sa tup-pe-e ha-ru-mu-tim GAN-lam e-ti-qu
tgt: Seals: Kukuzi s. Ṣeḫr-ilī, Šar-Suen s. Ma-ni-a, Nāb-Suen s. Šū-Bēlim Nāb-Suen owes Aššur-mālik 27 minas refined silver. He will pay 10 weeks from the ḫamuštum ša Iddin-abim, month Kuzallu, year Innāya. If he does not pay he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekel per mina per month. He will leave the silver and merchandise in the field (in Anatolia) in the name of Assur malik. The merchant will not entrust (the merchandise to anyone else). Seals: Nazi s. Amurru-bāni, Lā-qēpum s. Puzur-sadū'ē, ȃr-Suen s. Mania. Šar-Suen s. Ma-ni-a owes the merchant 5/6 mina refined silver. He will pay 4 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Iddin-abim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest. Seals of Pilaḫ-Aššur s. Aššur-nādā, Aššur-taklāku s. Ennānīa, Šū-Aššur s. Inaȟ-ilī. Šū-Aššur owes the merchant 1 mina refined silver. He will pay 22 weeks from the ˍmußtum of Iddin-abum, month Kanmwarta, eponym of Enna-Suen s. of the priest. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina. The bearer of the tablet is the merchant. They left a copy of the sealed tablet in the feild (Anatolia).

src: 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am ni-is-ha-su u sa-du-a-su i-nu-mi dan-a-sur a-na a-lim{ki} i-lu-ku bu-sa-num i-da-su-ma 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-na 30 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na ITU.KAM-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI su-ISTAR IGI {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li
tgt: If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina) per month as interest.

src: KISIB bur-nu-nu DUMU a-sa-a KISIB su-a-sur DUMU su-su-en6 KISIB ku-za-ri DUMU ku-ra-ra sa hu-bu-ul ku-za-ri 40 ma-na URUDU is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa hu-ra-sa-nim a-na 10 ma-na URUDU 1 ma-na.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im u-sa-ab li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-di-a-sur DUMU ku-bi4-di is-tu ITU si-bi-bi-ri-im
tgt: Regarding the debt of Kuzāri, 40 minas copper. From the week of Ḫuraṣānum, he will add 1 mina per 10 minas copper.From the week of Ḫuraṣānum, he will add 1 mina per 10 minas copper.He will add (interest) Year after IdI-Aššur s. Kūb-idī, from the month of Zibibaburum.

src: a-na i-di-a-bi-im a-sur-ma-lik a-sur-i-mi-ti su-a-nim en-na-su-en6 u PUZUR4.DINGIR qi-bi-ma um-ma pi-la-ah-ISTAR-ma te-er-ti am-tim a-di ma-la u se-ni-su i-li-kam a-su-mi DINGIR-na-da DUMU ba-zi-a mi-su sa a-ma-kam am-tam ik-ta-na-tu-u u E-bi-tam a-na ka-na-ki-im i-za-zu u ni-si-a up-ta-na-ru-du mi-nam a-bi u-la a-na-ku u a-hu-u-a ha-bu-la-ni-ma ru-gu5-ma-e a-na am-ti-a i-ta-na-di is-tu mu-ta-ni 10 sa-na-tim a-bi ib-la-at mi-su-um a-bi la is-ba-at u-la a-na a-bi4-a nu-du-a-e la i-di a-bi il5-ti-pi-ma su-ut is-tu-ru i-li-is-ti-kal KU.BABBAR-ap a-bi-a u-pa-hi-ir wa-ar-ka-nu-um bu-zu-a ra-bi-su-um e-li-a-ma KU.BABBAR-ap a-bi-a u-pa-hi-ir u a-na-ku is-tu 10 sa-na-at ra-bi-sa-am as-ba-ta-ma KU.BABBAR a-bi4-a u-pa-hi-ir mi-su-um i-na KU.BABBAR-ap a-bi-a is-ba-at u-la a-na ra-bi4-si-im u-la a-na i-li-is-ti-kal nu-du-a-e la i-di a-na-ku u a-hu-u-a a-di 5-si-su is-ti-su lu i-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum lu i-na u-la-ma lu i-na wa-ah-su-sa-na is-ti-su ni-na-me-er mi-su-um nu-du-a-e la i-di-ni-a-ti u ma-ti-ma te-er-tu-su la i-li-kam u-la a-na sa ki-ma su-a-ti la is-pu-ra-ma la il5-pu-tu-ni u me-ra-su su-be-lum ka-sa-ru-tam is-ti-a u-si-ib-ma te-er-ti sa KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na.TA u 2 ma-na.TA a-na se-ri-su a-na u-la-ma us-te-ne-ba-al-ma i-na E a-bi-su-ma lu-qu-tum i-ba-sa-al mi-su-um i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-a la i-sa-ba-at a-ba-u-a be-lu-u-a a-tu-nu la te-di-a ki-ma i-nu-mi a-bi4 me-tu-ni mi-is-hu-um i-si-ik-nu-ma KU.BABBAR ma-dum u tup-pi sa a-bi4-a im-ta-as-hu-ni a-ba-u-a a-tu-nu is-tu 5 sa-na-tim a-hu-u-a ma-sa-ar-tam ip-te-u-ma ma-sa-ar-tum a-na a-wa-tim na-ad-a-at a-hu-u-a i-na e-la-tim sa-am-u u a-na-kam a-na-ku sa KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na u 2 ma-na a-na u4-mi a ba-ab ma-hi-ri-im u-se-er-ma a-su-mi ki-a-am pa-ah-ra-ku su-ma a-ma-kam DINGIR-na-da ri-ig-ma-am i-te-di-ma a mi-ma i-te-hi a-ba-u-a be-lu-u-a a-tu-nu DUMU me-tim a-na-ku a-na <big_gap> al-ka-ma <big_gap> ka-ri-im ni-is-ku-ma <big_gap> a-na a-lim{ki} le-li-u-ni-ma <big_gap> a-na-kam la-az-ku-ma la-li-kam-ma ma-sa-ar-tam sa a-bi4-ni lu ni-ip-te-ma lu tup-pe lu ta-ah-si-sa-tim si-sa-tim lu ni-mu-ur-ma a-na a-wi-lim a-wa-tam uk-ti-in u a-na-kam sa i re-es15 a-bi4-ni i-zi-zu-ni ar-ni is-ti-u ki-ma KU.BABBAR a-mi-um hu-bu-lu-su-ni a-na KU.BABBAR a-mi-im ni-il5-pu-tu-su-ni i-se-er <gap>-ka-la-lu-wa la i-ba-ri-a-su-um tup-pu sa a-bi4-a ma-du-tu-ma sa-ar-qu
tgt: To Idī-abum, Aššur-mālik, Aššur-imittī, Šū-Anum, Enna-Suen, and Puzur-ilī, from Pilaḫ-Ištar: The message of the amtum wife has come to me once or twice. Regarding Ilī-nādā s. Baziya, why is it that over there he constantly threatens to distrain my amtum-wife, attempts to seal the house and constantly frightens my people? My father was alive ten years ago, during the plague. Why did he not seize my father? Or not deposit memoranda to my father? Iliš-tikal assembled my father's silver. Why did he not take from my father's silver, or from the attorney or give a memoranda to Iliš-tīkal? I and my brothers met five times with him, in Purušḫattum, Ulama, and Waḫšušana! Why didn't he give us any memoranda? And how is it that his messages never came? Nor did he send messages to his representatives with the result that they did not write (anything) down. Also, his son, Šū-Bēlum, served as caravan driver with me, and he was constantly taking 1 or 2 minas silver in his bundle to him in Ulama and he did not 'ripen' the merchandise in the house of his own father. Why did he not seize from my silver? My dear fathers and lords, do you not know that because a robbery occurred when my father died, much silver and my father's tablets were stolen? My dear fathers, my brothers opened the strongroom five years ago and since then it has been deposed for a matter. As for my brothers, it is heard they are on the caravans. But here, I myself have released 1 or 2 minas silver each day at the gate of the market and because of this I am thus made to assemble. If Ilī-nādā prosecutes the case there, he will claim everything. My dear fathers and lords, I am the son of a dead man! I will come to [GN] and we will set [the matter before] the colony so that they will raise [the matter] to the city and [resolve this?]. Here I will clear myself and will come so that we can open my father's strongroom and inspect the tablets and the memoranda and clear the matter for the man, and those that stood at the head of my father here (will) search. Becasue that silver is his debt, and we wrote him down for that silver, he will not (return)? it to Kalaluwa for him. A great many of my fathers tablets were stolen!

src: KISIB ka-ri-im ka-ne-es 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa i ni-ka-si e-hu-uz a-sur-i-di DUMU ib-ni-{d}IM 1 ma-na 15 GIN sa ar-ni-su li-ba-a SU.NIGIN 7 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-i-di u li-ba-a a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ka-si-im sa qa-ti na-ra-ZU u i-ku-nim 3 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-su-bu su-ma KU.BABBAR is-ti a-wi-li-su la il5-te-qe KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su i-na ka-ri-im i-la-qe
tgt: Aššur-idī and Libbaya owe Aššur-rēʾī 7 minas 15 shekesl refined silver.

src: <big_gap> 7 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um i-se-er a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim DUMU su-a-nim a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-mur-ISTAR u a-sur-i-mi-ti a-na 4 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 8.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI ha-lu-li is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-su u da-da-nim a-na 8 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal <big_gap>
tgt: Aššur-bēl-awātim s. Šū-Anum owes Aššur-rēʾī 7 minas refined silver. Ḫaluli owes 8 1/3 minas refined silver.

src: KISIB dan-a-sur KISIB a-sur-ma-lik DUMU DINGIR-ba-ni KISIB i-su-rik13 KISIB e-la-li DUMU i-di-a-sur KISIB su-ku-bi4-im sa 1 ma-na 7.5 GIN KU.GI su-ku-bu-um ki-ma um-mi-su a-ha-ti-su u ki-ma su-a-ti KI i-di-ISTAR il5-qe-u
tgt: Seals: Dān-Aššur, Aššur-mālik s. Ilī-bāni, Issu-rīk, Elāli s. Iddin-Aššur, Šū-Kūbum. Regarding the 1 mina 7 1/2 shekels gold, Šū-Kūbum took if on behalf of his mother and brother and on behalf of himself, from/with? Idī-Ištar.

src: a-na ma-num-ki-e-li-a i-di-a-sur u zu-mi-za qi-bi-ma um-ma i-li-a-lum-ma a-na ma-num-ki-e-li-a qi-bi-ma a-su-mi u-za-ka ap-te-u u pa-ri-is-tam ta-as-tap-ra-am um-ma a-na-ku-ma KU.BABBAR a-na si-ni-su la i-ha-ba-al a-na ma-num-ki-e-li-a <gap> qi-bi-ma su-ma i-tu-wa-ar-ma mi-ma a-sur-ma-lik i-qa-bi4-a-ma um-ma a-ta-ma tup-pa-am me-er zu-pa sa sa-ba-e u-ka-a-al sa KU.BABBAR sa-bu-u u su-ma mi-ma i-qa-bi4-a-ma tup-pi-a pe-te-a-ma tup-pa-am sa ku-nu-uk su-be-lim u i-su-hi-im sa-as-me-a u KU.BABBAR 1 GIN i-se-ri-su <gap> ki-ma la i-tu-ru-ma la i-la-qe-u a-di a-na-ku is-te-e DUMU a-wi-lim a-na-mu-ru u tup-pa-am u-se-sa-a-am a-na i-di-a-sur qi-bi-ma a-su-mi KU.BABBAR sa a-sur-na-si-ir KU.BABBAR u-sa-as-qa-la-ku-ma li-ba-ka la i-pa-ri-id
tgt: Zu Mannumkī'eli'a, Idī'aššur und Zu-mi-ṣa sprich! Folgendermaßen Ilī'ālum: Zu Mannumkī'eli'a sprich! Was das betrifft, (worüber) ich dich informiert habe, — und du hast mir vertraulich (dazu) geschwiegen — so (sage) ich (jetzt) folgendermaßen: "Silber werde ich kein zweites Mal schuldig werden!" Zu Mannumkī'eli'a sprich! Wenn er darauf zurückkommt und Aššurmalik irgend etwas, das mich betrifft, sagt, so (sollst) du folgendermaßen (antworten): "Die Urkunde hat der Sohn des Zuba, der (einer) von den Beisitzern (war), in Verwahrung." (Hinsichtlich) des (Wertes) des Silbers ist er befreidigt. Wenn er aber irgend etwas, das mich betrifft, sagt, öffnet meine Urkunde und dann laßt die Urkunde mit dem Siegel des Šūbēlum und des Išūḫum verlesen. Ferner werde ich ihm über Silber, 1 Seqel, damit er nicht anficht und nicht (Silber) nimmt, bis ich mich mit dem Angestellten des Herren getroffen habe, eine Urkunde ausstellen. Zu Idī'aššur sprich! Wegen des Silbers des Aššurnāṣir: Das Silber werde ich dir zahlen lassen. Dein Herz soll nicht (darum) zittern.

src: a-na sa-lim-a-hi-im qi-bi-ma um-ma la-qe-pu-um-ma u pu-su-ke-en6-ma 8 GU AN.NA u u-tu-ra-e-su 32 TUG.HI.A SA.BA 10 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 32 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 2 ma-na AN.NA a-ha-ma pu-su-ke-en6 ub-lam SU.NIGIN 34 ma-na AN.NA-ak qa-tim 4 {TUG}ku-si-a-tum SA.BA 1 {TUG}ku-si-tam DUMU a-sur-ma-lik il5-qe 1 {TUG}ku-si-tam ma-ti-tam ki-ma ni-is-ha-at 5 {TUG}ku-ta-ni a-na E.GAL-lim it-bu-lu <big_gap> AN.NA sa a-na <big_gap><big_gap> <gap> <big_gap><big_gap> a-na ni-<gap> <big_gap> a-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR <big_gap> ku-ta-ni nu-ra-di-ma 12 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-ka-si-ka ne-pu-ul 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa i si-im 3 {TUG}ku-ta-ni i-ri-ha-ni a-se-er gam-ri-im sa tap-hi-ri-ka sa sar-ra-ma-te-en6 nu-ta-hi sa 5 GU a-wi-tim sa se-ep i-li-as-ra-ni sa is-tu ra-za-ma a-di bu-ra-lim 6.83333 ma-na 1.66666 GIN AN.NA is-ku-ni-a-ti is-tu bu-ra-lim a-di ka-ni-is 2.83333 ma-na 7.33333 GIN.TA 1 GU-tam ik-su-dam a-na 10 GU 6 ma-na a-wi-ti-ka 30 ma-na LA 11 GIN ik-su-dam 0.5 ma-na AN.NA 2-se-na qa-qa-da-tim ik-su-dam 2 ma-na u-ku-ul-ti 4 ANSE.HI.A u sa-ri-dim 3 ma-na ig-ru sa-ri-dim 2.5 ma-na 4 GIN ta-si-a-tum 0.5 ma-na mu-ta AN.NA-ak qa-tim <big_gap><gap> sa AN.NA-ki-su <big_gap><gap> ta a-na i-li-as-ra-ni ni-di-in <big_gap> GIN a-se-er <big_gap> GIN KU.BABBAR sa si-im 3 {TUG}ku-ta-ni a-na sa tap-hi-ri-im sa sar-ra-ma-te-en nu-ra-de8-ma 11.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR ni-ig-mur si-ti KU.BABBAR sa ANSE.HI.A 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na 3 ma-na AN.NA sa i-li-as-ra-ni is-qu-lu KU.BABBAR il5-qe
tgt: To Šalim-aḫum from Lā-qēpum and Pūšu-kēn: Pūšu-kēn brought 8 talents tin and its ..., 32 textiles, therein are 10 kutānum-textiles, 32 minas tin sealed, 2 minas tin separately. In sum, 34 minas hand tin, 4 kusītum-garments. Therein, the son of Aššur-mālik took 1 kusītum-garment. They took 1 mṭt kusītum-garment as excise of 5 kutanum-textiles for the palace. ... tin which to ... .... for ... ...we added ... for 10 shekels silver ... kutānum-textiles and we paid back 12 minas silver to your accounts. We combined 5 shekels silver which (is deducted ?) from the price of 3 kutānum-textiles, to the total of your taphir of Šarra-mātēn. Of the 5 talents, the awītum-assessement of the transport of Ili-ašranni, (the segment) from Razama to Burallum set to us 6 minas 51 2/3 shekels tin. From Burallum to Kanesh, 2 minas 57 1/3 shekels per mina obtain. For 10 talents, your awītum assessment is 6 minas. 29 minas 49 shekels applies. 1/2 minas tin (for) two heads(?) obtain. The (fee for) fodder of 4 donkeys and their drivers is 2 minas. The hire of the drivers is 3 minas. The tašiātum is 2 minas 34 shekels. The deficiency of the hand tin is 1/2 mina. We gave to Ili-ašranni ... of his tin ... We added x shekels to the x shekels silver for the price of the 3 kutānum-textiles for the taphirim of Šarra-mātēn and we exhausted the 11 1/2 shekels silver. The remainder of the silver of the donkeys is 1/3 minas silver. We received silver for the 3 minas tin which Ilī-ašranni weighed out.

src: 15 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI a-bu-um-DINGIR DUMU a-ba u sa-lim-a-sur a-hi-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa DUMU ba-na-ga u a-gu-za a-na 40 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu 15.5 ma-na 3.16666 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU a-ta-a is-tu ha-mus-tim sa e-la-li u la-qe-ep a-na 45 i-sa-qal 15.5 ma-na 2.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI ili5-ba-ni DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR is-tu ha-mus-tim sa e-la-li u la-qe-ep a-na 45 i-sa-qal 15.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI na-bi-su-en6 DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR is-tu ha-mus-tim sa am-ri-a u i-ku-nim a-na 45 i-sa-qal 15.5 ma-na 1.66666 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI a-sur-na-da is-tu ha-mus-tim sa du-du u li-ba-a-a a-na 45 i-sa-qal 7.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI a-la-bi-im is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-la-hi-im u kur-ub-ISTAR a-na 40 i-sa-qal 15 ma-na 6.66666 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI a-la-bi4-im DUMU su-ti-bar is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ha-bi4-a-ah-su u la-qe-ep a-na 38 i-sa-qal 10 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI i-ku-nim sa ta-wi-ni-a is-tu ha-mus-tim sa {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni u i-ku-nim a-na 15 i-sa-qal 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am KI zu-ba u a-sur-DU10 is-tu ha-mus-tim sa e-la-ma u su-ku-bi-im a-na 6 i-sa-qu-lu 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am KI a-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ka-si-im a-na 13 i-sa-qal 10.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI i-li-is-ti-kal is-tu ha-mus-tim sa DUMU ba-na-ga u a-gu-za a-na 45 i-sa-qal 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI zu-zu is-tu ha-mus-tim sa su-ka-li-a u ku-ra a-na 10 i-sa-qal mi-ma a-nim u4-mu-su-nu ma-al-u sa KU.BABBAR la i-sa-qa-la-ku-nu-ti-ni si-be su-uk-na-ma a si-ib-tim li-li-ik
tgt: Abum-ilī s. Aba and Šalim-Aššur owe 15 minas refined silver. They will pay forty weeks from the ḫamuštum of the son of Banaga and Akuzāya. Aššur-imittī s. Attaya owes 15 1/2 minas 3 1/6 shekels refined silver. He will pay forty five (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of Elāli and Lāqēp. Ilī-bāni s. Puzur-Ištar owes 15 1/2 minas 2 1/3 shekels refined silver. He will pay forty five (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of Elāli and Lāqēp. Nāb-Suen s. Puzur-Ištar owes 15 1/2 minas refined silver. He will pay forty five weeks from the ḫamuštum of Amria and Ikūnim. Aššur-nādā owes 15 1/2 minas 1 2/3 shekels refined silver. He will pay forty five (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of Dudu and li-ba-a-a. Al-abim owes 7 1/2 minas refined silver. He will pay forty (weeks) from the ḫamuštum Al-aḫim and Kurub-Ištar. Al-abim s. Šū-Tibar owes 15 minas 6 2/3 shekels refined silver. He will pay thirty eight (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of ḫa-bi₄-a-aḫ-šu and Lāqēp. Ikūnim of ta-wi-ni-a owes 10 minas 5 shekels refined silver. He will pay fifteen (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of Amurrum-bāni and Ikūnim. Zupa and Aššur-ṭāb owe 4 minas refined silver. They will pay 6 (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of Elamma and Šū-Kūbim. Ašu owes 5 minas refined silver. He will pay thirteen (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of kaššim. Iliš-īkal owes 10 1/3 minas refined silver. He will pay forty five (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of the son of Banaga and Akuzāya. Zuzu owes 5 minas refined silver. He will pay ten (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of Sukkallīya and Kura.

src: um-ma hi-na-a-ma a-na qar-wi-a pu-su-ke-en6 a-sur-dan u a-na-ah-i-li qi-bi-ma a-na qar-wi-a u a-sur-dan qi-bi4-ma i-nu-mi AN.NA-ki ta-du-nu su-ma me-eh-ra-tim i-du-nu-ni-kum AN.NA-ki di-in su-ma la ki-a-am a-se-er ku-ni-lim a-na tur4-hu-mi-it bi4-il5 si-im AN.NA-ki-a a-di a-a-e-em u4-mi-im u-ka-lu a-na se-di-is-tum sa-tum {d}a-sur lu i-de8 a-sar AN.NA-ki ta-di-nu KU.BABBAR sa-as-qi-il5-ma u ti-ib-a-ma a-tal-kam a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-sar AN.NA-ki i-di-nu i-hi-id-ma i sa-ha-ti-su i-zi-iz-ma KU.BABBAR lu-sa-as-qi-il5-ma u tur4-da-su as-pu-ra-kum um-ma a-na-ku-ma a ni-ka-si su-hu-ut la ta-sa-ha-at u qa-ti lu KU.BABBAR lu TUG-ba-ti i-di u su-ma a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum te-ra-ab qa-di-ma te-er-ti-ka sa-hi-iz-ma sa ki-ma ku-a-ti qa-ti li-di-u a-hi a-ta a-na-ku ma-num a-la-nu-ka i-su a-su-mi a-si-im sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni li-ma-am ni-ka-si-ma su-ma i-ta-ab-si a ma-la te-er-ti-ka ni-la-qe en-na-num DUMU su-hu-bu-ur IH.ME 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-na e-ra-bi4-su-ma se-bu-lam qa-bi4-am u a-ha-ma is-tu MU.2.SE ma-na-um 10 GIN i-na ITU.KAM sa-as-qi-il5-su
tgt: From Ḫinnaya to Qarwiya, Pūšu-kēn, Aššur-dān and Anaḫ-ilī: To Qarwiya and Aššur-dān: When you sell my tin, if they give you the exchange value, sell the tin. If it is not so, bring it to Kunilum in Durḫumit. May Aššur know that he has held the price of my tin for six years past its original term! Wherever you sell my tin, make them pay and arise and come here. To Pūšu-kēn: Wherever my tin he sells, take care to assist him so that he collects the silver and dispatch him. I sent to you. I said, "Do not clear my account at the accountings, but deposit my share either silver or textiles. Now, if you reach Purušḫattum, ... and cause him to take your instructions, and let your representatives deposit my share. My dear brother, as for me, who do I have beside you? Regarding the iron about which you wrote, we will arrest the limmum-official, and if it arises, we will take it according to your instructions. Ennānum son of Šū-Ḫubur the IHME official, has promised to pay you 2/3 mina silver upon his arrival. Also, separately, cause him to pay 10 shekels per mina per month.

src: 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er PUZUR4.ISTAR i-di-a-sur i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ha-na-nim u il5-ba-ni 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI a-mur-a-sur IGI a-sur-dan
tgt: Puzur-Ištar owes Iddin-Aššur 1 mina silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina) per month as interest from the ḫamuštum of Ḫananum and Ilī-bāni.

src: 1.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er i-li-as-ra-ni u {d}UTU-tap-pa-i a-sur-na-da i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-{d}EN.LIL u e-la-li 2.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-su-bu 1 ri-ik-su-um ku-nu-ku-su-nu sa KU.GI a-na sa-pa-ar-tim u-ka-al IGI i-di-a-bi4-im IGI {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni
tgt: Ilī-ašranni and Šamaš-tappā'ī owe 1 1/2 mina of silver to Aššur-nādā reckoned from the week of Šū-Illil and Elāli they will add interest at the rate 2 1/2 shekels per month He holds a bundle of gold under their seals as collateral security. Witnessed by Iddin-abum, witnessed by Ilabrat-bāni.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma ku-lu-ma-a u kur-ub-ISTAR-ma um-ma ku-lu-ma-a-ma i-nu-mi a-di-i lu-qu-tim sa dan-a-sur <gap>-ka ni-ka-si a <gap> u aq-bi4-a-kum um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-ma 6 ku-ta-nu sa sa-at-a-sur TUG-ba-tu u-la sa DUMU.SAL sa-lim-a-hi-im u TUG-ba-tu sa kur-ub-ISTAR i-na si-si-ka-at TUG-ba-ti su-mi-i i-la-ap-ra-at-ba-ni u-la wa-du-u a-na dan-a-sur DUB DAM.GAR la-ap-tu TUG-ba-tu su-nu sa kur-ub-ISTAR a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma kur-ub-ISTAR-ma a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta i-hi-id-ma TUG-ba-ti a-na sal-ma-a-sur di-in su-ma ma-ha-ra-am la i-mu-wa IGI 2-se-na qi-bi4-su-ma u te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam u TUG-ba-tu a-na dan-a-sur-ma li-bi4-si-u a su-mi TUG-ba-ti sa ka-sa-ar ka-ru-wa-a u AN.NA sa a-mur-a-sur DUMU su-ka-li-a su-up-ra-am
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Kulumaya and Kurub-Ištar From Kulumaya As soon as the merchandise of Dān-Aššur ... I spoke to you. I said, "Here are the 6 kutānum-textiles for Šāt-Aššur." The textiles do not belong to Šalim-aḫum's daughter; rather, the textiles belong to Kurub-Ištar. My name is on the fringe of the textiles. Ilabrat-bāni is not informed. They wrote a tablet of the merchant for Dān-Aššur. His textiles, they are those from Kurub-Ištar. To Pūšu-kēn from Kurub-Ištar: My dear father, my dear lord, take heed to give the textiles to Šalim-Aššur. If he does not want to accept them, speak to him before two witnesses and send your message. Also, the textiles which Dān-Aššur owes, are to my name. Send the textiles (brought by) Qarwiya's packer and the tin of Amur-Aššur son of Sukkalliya.

src: 4 ne-pi-su 1 GU KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI sa-du-a-su sa-bu i-a-um 1 ne-pi-su-um 15 ma-na KU.BABBAR ik-ri-bu sa a-sur 1 ri-ik-su 0.5 ma-na 8.25 GIN ni-is-ha-su u ni-is-ha-at ni-is-ha-tim sa ik-ri-bi 1 ne-pi-sum 14.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa a-sur-i-di sa-du-a-su i ra-mi-ni-a a-di-i 1 ne-pi-su-um 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa pu-su-ke-en6 u i-na-su-en6 ni-is-ha-su u sa-du-a-su i ra-mi-ni-a a-di-i 1 ri-ik-su 15 GIN a ku-lu-ma-a 1 ri-ik-su 10 GIN a-na a-ni-na DUMU <big_gap>-<gap> GIN a-na en-um-a-sur DUMU a-ni-nim 2 GIN a-na a-sur-dan DUMU i-ku-pi-a mi-ma a-nim a ni-qe-e-su-nu 11 TUG.HI.A-tal-ha-di-a-tum 4 <gap> ki-im 2-si-ta bu-ri-ta-an 1 TUG-me-nu-ni-a-nu-um 1 na-ru-qum ku-nu-ku-a 1 wa-ar-ha-lum mi-ma a-nim a-na dan-a-sur ap-qi-id IGI PUZUR-a-sur DUMU da-mu-ti-ma IGI e-nu-be-lim DUMU su-la-ba-an
tgt: The 4 packets constituting 1 talent silver, its excise added, its shipping charges satisfied are mine. The 1 packet constituting 15 minas silver is the ikrībū of Aššur. The one bundle constituting 1/2 mina 8 1/4 shekels, it's excise added and the excise of its excise belongs to my ikrībū. I placed the packet constituting 14 2/3 minas silver of Aššur-idī (with its?) shipping charges among my things. I placed the packet constituting 10 minas silver belonging to Pūšu-kēn and Enna-Suen, with its excise and shipping charges, among my things. The bundle constituting 15 shekels silver is for Kulumaya. The bundle, 10 shekels is for Anina son of x-x, x shekels is for Ennum-Aššur son of Anninum, 2 shekels is for Aššur-dān son of Ikūn-pīya. I ...them all this. 11 talḫadiʾātum textiles, 4 ..., 2 būritum-textiles?, 1 menunuʾānum-textile, 1 sack under my seals, (and) a warḫālum. I entrusted all this to Dān-Aššur. Witnesses: Puzur-Aššur son of Damutia and Ennu-Bēlum son of Šū-Laban.

src: 23.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa ka-ru-um sa-he-ra-bi i-li-a-lum pu-su-ke-en6 u a-mur-a-sur i-na ha-mu-us-tim sa i-li-is-ti-kal u PUZUR4.SA.TU i-di-nu-ma KU.BABBAR a-na i-ku-nim i-sa-qu-lu-ni-ma su-nu KU.BABBAR-ap a-sur-SIPA i-se-e-u 7.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-ti a-mur-ISTAR 8 ma-na KU.BABBAR <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> KU.BABBAR a-nim i-na ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-ma-lik u hu-ra-sa-nim ni-il5-ta-qe 26 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR qa-dum si-ib-tim ki-ma i-ku-nim a-na sa-lim-a-sur ni-is-qu-ul IGI a-la-hi-im DUMU zi-ik-u-hi-im IGI ka-zi-a DUMU am-ri-a
tgt: 23.5 minas refined silver upon the colony plenary of Ilī-ālum, Pūšū-kēn, and Amur-Aššur In As for them, they will seek the silver of Aššur-rē'ī. Amur-Ištar owes 7 5/6 minas silver. 8 minas silver... .... this silver in the ḫamuštum of Aššur-mālik and Ḫuraṣānim it will be taken. 26 minas 10 shekels silver and interest like Ikūnim and Šalim-Asšur paid. Witness: Al-aḫim s. Zikuḫim, Gazia s. Amrīya.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-sur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma i-nu-mi tu-us-u um-ma a-ta-ma a-na im-di-DINGIR lu KU.BABBAR lu URUDU su-ma sa ki-ma i-a-ti e-ri-su-ka la ta-ka-la-su-nu-ti di-in a-na im-di-DINGIR 5 ITU.KAM ni-ta-la-ak i-na 5 ITU.1.KAM KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na u i-nu-mi KU.BABBAR i-di-nu-u a-na-ku GAN-lam wa-as-ba-ku KU.BABBAR su-a-ti a-na i-ku-nim is-qu-lu-su a-na um-mi-a-ni-ka 5 ITU.1.KAM ni-ta-la-ak-ma i-ba-u-si-im i-na 5 ITU.KAM KU.BABBAR 1.5 ma-na 5 ma-na AN.NA i-di-ni-a-ti SU.NIGIN 2.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR ha-bu-la-ti is-tu KU.BABBAR-ap-ka {d}ISKUR-ba-ni 40 ma-na gam-ru-ni {d}a-sur li-tu-ul 1.5 ma-na a su-mi-ka as-qu-ul-ma 5 ITU.1.KAM lu i-be-i-il5 a-di GAN-lam a-tu-ra-ni {d}ISKUR-ba-ni ta-ra-dam la il5-e-u-ni a-ta i-a-ti a pu-ti-a-ma i-na tup-pi-ka ta-sa-pa-ra-am ki-ma a-wi-lim ha-al-pi-im is-tu 1 me-at be-ri GAN-lim su-ma-mi-in me-ta-ku na-ru-qi-mi-in ta-at-ba-al {d}a-sur u i-li um-mi-a-ni-a li-tu-la um-mi-a-nu-ka sa KU.BABBAR i-di-na-ku-ni ki-ma i-a-ti a na-ru-qi-ka u 1 GIN KU.BABBAR-ka la mar-su-u u lu-mu-un li-bi-im i-a-ti ta-sa-pa-ra-am <big_gap><gap> <gap> ta-sa-ka-ni <big_gap> <gap>-ni-su <big_gap> im <big_gap><gap> sa ra-mi-ni-a <big_gap>-<gap>-pi-im su-um-ka <gap> la a-la-pa-at <big_gap> al-qe-ma i tup-pi-im a-wa-tam a-ni-tam ta-as-pu-ra-am
tgt: From Šalim-Aššur to Pūšu-kēn: When you departed, you said, "Should my representatives request of you either silver or copper for Imdī-ilum, do not refuse them. Give it." We had extended to Imdī-ilum 5 months time. (The rate was) about 1 mina silver for 5 (months). Now when they gave the silver, I was abroad. They weighed that silver out to Ikūnum. To your investors we extended 5 months and they put him to shame(?). (The rate was) for 5 months, 1 1/2 minas silver. He gave 5 minas tin to us. Altogether, you owe 2 5/6 minas silver. After Adad-bāni exhausted your 40 minas silver, may Aššur witness that I weighed 1 1/2 minas to your name and it was at (your) disposal for 5 months. I am returning from being abroad (and) they are not able to dispatch Adad-bāni, and you are writing here in your tablet (that) mine was on my own responsibility(?). (You are) like a despicable man from 1 hundred Were I dead, would that you bear my May Aššur and the gods of my investors witness that your inverstor who has given you money is not as concerned as am I about your Now you are writing bitter things to me. .... you are setting me .... of my own ... -im, I will not write down your name. ... I received ...., and you wrote me this matter in the tablet.

src: 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um i-se-er MAR.TU ba-ni {d}EN.ZU-na-da i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa en-na-nim 2 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam i-na ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-di-a-sur ITU.KAM si-pu-um IGI is-me-DINGIR IGI su-ku-bi4-im
tgt: Amurrum-bāni owes Suen-nādā 45 shekels refined silver. From the week of Ennānum he will add 2 shekels per mina per month. Year after the year of Idī-Aššur (REL 82), month Ṣipʾum (month VII). Witnesses: Išme-ilī, Šū-Kūbum.

src: pi-la-ah-ISTAR me-er-e la-li-im is-ba-at-ma um-ma pi-la-ah-ISTAR-ma a-na me-er-e la-li-im-ma me-er me-tim a-na-ku u a-tu-nu me-er-u me-ti-ma a-bi i tup-pa-am e-zi-ba-am tup-pu-um ku-nu-uk a-bi-ku-nu la-a ku-nu-uk a-bi-ku-nu ku-nu-ki u-di-a um-ma me-er-u la-li-im-ma tup-pa-am se-i-a-ma u ku-nu-ki lu nu-de8-e um-ma pi-la-ah-ISTAR-ma ku-nu-ki u-di-a-ma u tup-pa-am la-si-a-ku-nu-ti su-nu-u tup-pa-am ku-nu-ki u-du-a-am u-la i-mu-u um-ma pi-la-ah-ISTAR a-ma sa ni-is a-lim{ki} u ru-ba-im it-mu-u ka-i-la ki-ma ku-nu-ki u-du-a-am la i-mu-u-ni ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um i-na-a DUMU a-mu-ra-a IGI i-di-{d}IM DUMU a-sur-DU10 IGI u-su-ra-nim DUMU ku-da-a IGI en-na-su-en6 DUMU a-sur-DU10
tgt: Pilaḫ-Ištar seized the sons of Lālum against us. They did not want to identify the seals on the tablet. ... They did not want to identify that they were the seals.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma la-ma-si-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma 5 ma-na.TA SIG.HI.A a-hu-qar u i-a-sar na-as-u-ni-ki-im mi-ma la i-di-nu-nim um-ma i-a-sar-ma a-na-ku-ma 1 TUG e-pa-sum 8 TUG.HI.A u-ra-ni na-as-a-ku-um sa 0.5 ma-na.TA u-su-bu-ni KI i-a-sar u-se-ba-la-ku-um sa u-ra-ni na-as-a-ku-ni pa-ni-u la-ma ta-as-pu-ra-ni e-ep-su-nu a-di a-ma-kam wa-as-ba-ti-ni i-na ba-as-ti-ka nu-<gap>-<gap>-ni li-is-be-u i-nu-mi ki-sa-am tu-se-ba-la-ni SIG.HI.A su-uk-nam su-ha-ar-tim ir-ti-bi4 ku-ta-bi4-id-ma al-kam-ma a-na su-un {d}a-sur su-ku-si 3 TUG-kam-su-tim 6 {TUG}ku-ta-nu ku-lu-ma-a ub-la-ku-um 1 TUG-ka-ab-tum 5 {TUG}ku-ta-ni a-sur-ma-lik ub-la-ma 2 GIN KU.BABBAR sa SIG.HI.A i-a-sar i-di-nam 1 GIN a-hu-qar i-di-nam
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Lamassī: You wrote. You said, "Aḫu-waqar and Ea-šār are bringing you 5 minas wool." They did not give me anything! Ea-šār said, "I will make a textile for him myself." Urani brought you 8 textiles. I will send to you that which they took out 1/2 mina (?) with Ea-šār. As for that which Urāni brought to you, earlier, why did you write me, "...?." While you were there, we have been (haunted?) by your ba Let them ... When you send the leather bag, put some wool (in it). The girl is growing up, so come and place her on the lap of Aššur. Kulumaya brings you 3 heavy textiles and 6 kutānum textiles. Aššur-mālik brings(?) brought (?) you 1 heavy textile and 5 kutānum textiles and Ea-šār gave me 2 shekels silver worth of wool. Aḫu-waqar brought me (only) 1 shekel (of silver worth of wool).

src: a-na PUZUR4-a-sur qi-bi4-ma um-ma il5-we-da-ku-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma lu KU.BABBAR lu KU.KI sa 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR se-bi-lam5 a-na-kam si-ka-tum-ma ma-hi-ru-um pa-ru-ud a-di 2 u4-me si-ka-tum i-pa-ta-ra-nim a ma-la te-er-ti-ka lu KU.BABBAR lu KU.KI u-se-ba-la-kum-ma u a-na-ku a-na ma-ri-it-hi-im u tur4-hu-mi-it e-ti-iq-ma te-er-ta-ka e-pa-as ki-ma si-im a-si-im e-pu-su su-ha-ra-am is-te-en6 ga-ri-sa-am a-sa-pa-ra-kum
tgt: To Puzur-Aššur from Il-wēdāku:

src: pi-la-ha-a a-gi5-a a-sur-na-si-ir ab-sa-lim u na-na-a si-ba-at KU.BABBAR si-na 12.5 GIN KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-a a-se-er ab-sa-lim u na-na-a a-na TUG.HI.A sa li-tab-si-a sa-mi-im 15 ma-na URUDU SIG5 sa ik-ri-bi a-se-er ab-sa-lim u na-na-a is-ra-am tal-ha-ti-tam a-na su-hu-bur mi-ma a-nim a-na ISTAR-ba-ni ap-qi-id IGI ir-ma-a-sur IGI a-sur-ma-lik DUMU a-mu-ra 2 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na ni-qi-su a-di-su 3 GIN KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-a se-ne-en u sa-hi-re-en a-na ab-sa-ab-lim u na-na-a la-qe-pu-um DUMU bu-zu-ta-a u-bi-il5 2 ma-na URUDU a-na DUMU ma-ni-a ni-qi-am a-di-in 1.3333300000000001 ma-na URUDU a-na a-la-hi-im sa E a-de8-la-at a-di-in 1 ri-ik-sa-am a-na-na-a DUMU.SAL du-du 1 ri-ik-sa-am a-na wa-qur-tim DUMU.SAL pu-su-ke-en6 1 ri-ik-sa-am sa sa-at-a-sur DUMU.SAL sal-ma-a-hi-im ku-nu-ku sa su-e-a a-ha-ma 22.5 SE KU.KI ku-nu-ki-a a-na a-ha-ha is-te-ni-is ar-be se-bu-la-tum a-na ke-nim DUMU en-na-nim a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 ip-qi-id IGI ir-ma-a-sur IGI a-sur-{d}UTU-si DUMU a-ma-a 0.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI ku-nu-ki-a a-na DAM su-hu-bur 2 GIN a-na a-ha-ha ku-nu-ki sa am-tim se-ne-en u sa-hi-re-en a-na na-na-a mi-ma a-nim a-na ir-nu-it ap-qi-id IGI us-ma-a-a IGI a-bi4-a-a 10 GIN KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-a a-sur-UTU-si u-se-bi4-il5 5 GIN KU.BABBAR is-tu a-lim{ki} i tu-a-ri-su a-sur-{d}UTU-si i-sa-qa-lam IGI a-sur-ma-lik IGI be-la-nim
tgt: Witnesses: Irma-Aššur, Aššur-mālik s. Amuraya. I deposited 2 shekels silver for their offerings. I brought 2 shekels silver under my seal, a pair of shoes, and a pair of šaḫirum-footwear to Ab-šalim, Nannaya, and Lā-qēpum s. Buzutaya. I gave 2 minas copper to the son of Maniya as an offering. I gave 1 1/3 minas copper to Al-aḫum for the house of Adad-ellat. He entrusted to Kēnum s. Ennānum and Aššur-mutabbil 1 package for Nannaya d. Dudu, 1 package for Waqqurtum d. Pūšu-kēn, 1 package for Šāt-Aššur d. Šalim-aḫum, under the seals of Sueyya, and separately 22 1/2 grains of gold under my seal for Aḫaḫa altogether four shipments. Witnesses: Irma-Aššur, Aššur-šamšī s. Amāya. 25 shekels silver, its excise added, under my seal to the wife of Šū-Ḫubur, 2 shekels to Aḫaḫa under the seals of the amtum, and a pair of shoes and a pair of šaḫirum-footwear for Nannaya, I entrusted all this to Irnuit. Witnesses: Ušmiya, Abiya. Aššur-šamšī delivered 10 shekels silver under my seal. 5 shekels silver from the city he will return to him. Aššur-idī will pay. Witnesses: Aššur-mālik, Bēlānum.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-mur-a-sur-ma 10 GU 50 ma-na AN.NA u li-wi-su 37 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 4 TUG sa su-ha-ri <gap> TUG sa ta-ad-mi-iq-tim <gap> ANSE.HI.A sa-la-mu 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR se-bi4-lam i-na 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa tu-se-ba-la-ni sa 1 GIN KU.BABBAR si-pa-ra-tim se-bi-lam a-ni-tam la a-ni-tam te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Amur-Aššur: 10 talents 50 minas tin and its wrappings, 37 kutānum-textiles, 4 textiles for the boy, x textiles for the tadmiqtum, on 6(?) donkeys [PN brings to you.] Send x minas silver. From the 1/2 mina silver which we will send to you, send a shekel silver worth of bronze.

src: 10 GIN KU.GI ku-nu-ki-a a-se-er a-sa-nim a-ha-ma 10 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na a-sa-nim-ma a-na e-a-ba-as-ti ap-qi-id IGI {d}UTU-ba-ni DUMU en-na-su-en6 uz-ni-im pa-ri-is-tim IGI i-ku-pa-sa IGI il5-ba-ni DUMU a-mur-ISTAR 1.3333300000000001 ma-na URUDU si-kam a-na sa su-uh-ri-im a-di-su-um
tgt: 10 Seqel Gold mit meinen Siegeln (versehen) habe ich dem Asānum, außerdem 10 Seqel Silber ebenfalls dem Asānum für das (Geschäfts)haus des A<ššur>bāštī anvertraut. Vor Šamašbāni, dem Sohne des Ennasu'in, ...; vor Ikuppāša; vor Ištarbāni, dem Sohne des Āmurištar 1⅓ Minen........ Kupfer habe ich für den (Lohn) der Diener ihm gegeben.

src: KISIB en-um-a-sur DUMU e-la-li KISIB a-sur-DU10 sa ha-wa-al sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-re-si sa 1 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR is-tu ha-mus-tim sa na-ra-am-ZU u ha-na-nim a-na 4 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-re-si
tgt: Seals: Ennum-Aššur s. Elāli, Aššur-ṭāb, Regarding Aššur-rēṣī's debt of 1 mina 5 shekels silver. He will pay 4 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Naram-Suen and Ḫannanim. If he does not pay on time, he will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina) per month as interest.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-sur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma KU.BABBAR sa u-ra-ni u <big_gap> ub-la-ni 4 GU AN.NA i-na 2 ANSE ar-ku-us-ma i-ra-de8-u-ni-kum TUG.HI.A a-sa-a-ma is-ti pa-ni-im-ma u-se-ba-la-kum a-su-mi E-be-tim sa te-hi <big_gap> di <big_gap>
tgt: From Šalim-Aššūr to Pūšu-kēn: As for the silver which Urani and PN brought, I bound 4 talents tin on 2 donkeys, and they are driving (them) to you. I purchased textiles and I will send them with the next (departure). Concerning the house of PN which is next to ... ...

src: 0.33333 ma-na KU.GI pa-sa-lam sa ha-ra-an a-lim{ki} i-se-er PUZUR4-a-na DUMU su-la-ab-ra-at i-di-a-sur i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa bu-zu-ta-a u la-qe-pi-im a-na 15 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab IGI ha-na-<gap> <big_gap> IGI u-ra-<gap> <big_gap> a-sur-SIG5
tgt: If he does not pay (on time), he will add (interest) at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month.

src: 3.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa u-su-ur-sa-a-sur a-na a-sur-na-da ha-bu-lu-ma tup-pu-su ha-ar-mu KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su a-sur-na-da sa-bu tup-pu-um sa e-li-a-ni sa hu-bu-ul u-su-ur-sa-a-sur sa-ar IGI a-la-hi-im IGI a-sur-DUG IGI ib-ni-li IGI bu-ur-ka-nim
tgt: Regarding the 3 1/3 minas of refined silver which Uṣur-ša-Aššur owed to Aššur-nada, and for which his contract had been certified-Aššur-nada has been paid the silver and the accrued interest. Any tablet which may appear concerning Uṣur-ša-Aššur's debt will be invalid. Witnessed by Alāhum, witnessed by Aššur-ṭāb, witnessed by Ibni-ilī, witnessed by Burkānum.

src: 4 GU AN.NA sa hi-na-a i-na E hi-na-a e-la-ma u a-sur-na-da a-na 3-si-su i-zu-zu-ma 1 GU 20 ma-na AN.NA e-la-ma il5-qe 1 GU 22 ma-na AN.NA a-sur-na-da il5-qe 1 GU 20 ma-na AN.NA qa-su sa kar-wa-a e-la-ma a-sur-na-da u a-sur-dan a-na tur4-hu-mi-it a se-er kar-wa-a u-se-bi4-lu a-bu-sa-lim i ri-is a-bi4-su i-zi-iz is-tu e-la-ma mi-tu hi-na-a a-lam im-hu-ur-ma ra-bi4-sa-am e-hu-uz-ma tup-pa-am sa di-in a-lim{ki} lu za-iz AN.NA sa hi-na-a lu DUMU a-wi-lim lu a-sa-at a-wi-lim lu ka-sa-ru-um lu sa i ri-is a-wi-lim i-zi-zu lu sa i-na pi-i e-la-ma ba-ab ni-bi4-ri-su is-me-u a-na ka-ri-im ka-ni-is ub-lam-ma a ma-la tup-pi-im sa a-lim{ki} ka-ru-um ka-ni-is i-di-ni-a-ti-ma a-sur-na-da sa AN.NA is-ti e-la-ma i-zu-zu u a-bu-sa-lim DUMU e-la-ma sa i ri-is a-bi4-su i-zi-zu IGI GIR sa a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in
tgt: The 4 talents tin belonging to Hinnaya, that is in Hinnaya's house, Elama and Aššur-nādā divided it three ways: Elama took 1 talent 20 minas tin. Aššur-nādā took 1 talent 22 minas tin. Elama, Aššur-nādā and Aššur-dān sent 1 talent 20 minas tin the share of Karwaya to Durḫumit to Karwaya.

src: 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-DU10 DUMU lu-lu ISTAR-ba-ni i-su is-tu ITU.KAM ab-sa-ra-ni li-mu-um a-ku-tum a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab 1 ma-na 1.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-DU10 DUMU hu-ra-sa-nim ISTAR-ba-ni i-su is-tu ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-DINGIR li-mu-um a-ku-tum a-na 5 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab 0.5 ma-na 7 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-ma-lik DUMU su-{d}EN.LIL ISTAR-ba-ni i-su is-tu ITU.KAM be-el-ti-e-kal-lim li-mu-um a-ku-tum a-na 5 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 0.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er be-la-nim DUMU a-mur-{d}UTU ISTAR-ba-ni i-su is-tu ITU.KAM be-el-ti-E.GAL-lim li-mu-um e-na-su-en6 a-na MU.1.SE i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab 5 GU 20 ma-na URUDU si-kum KI be-la-nim-ma a-sur-DU10 a-na tup-pi-su la-pa-ti-im i-li-ik 0.5 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR KI E-a-SIG5 DUMU iz-ka-nim a-na wa-ah-su-sa-na i-na e-ra-bi4-su u-se-ba-lam IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti IGI pi-la-ah-ISTAR
tgt: Aššur-ṭāb s. Lulu owes Ištar-bāni 4 minas refined silver. He will pay ten weeks from the month of Ab šarrānē, eponymate of Akutum. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Aššur-ṭāb If he does not pay (on time), he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Ea-damiq s. iz-kà-nim will bring 1/2 mina 5 shekels silver from Waḫšušana. Seals: Aššur-imittī, Pilaḫ-Ištar

src: <big_gap> su-ma tu-zi-num u-ul ma-ma-an a-su-mi E-be-tim a-na la-bar-sa i-tu-wa-ar 1 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal IGI ha-su-i IGI za-pa-ra-as-na IGI pe-ru-wa be-lu tu-zi-nim IGI ka-ru-nu-wa IGI is-ku-na-<gap> IGI si-li-<gap>-<big_gap>
tgt: Witnesses: Ḫašui, Zaparašna, Peruwa , Karrunuwa, Iškuna-x, and Ṣili-x-....

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma sa-am-sa-am sa 15 GIN KU.GI a-na {d}NIN.SUBUR ha-bu-la-ku i pa-ni-tim i-nu-mi ta-li-ka-ni um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-na mi-nim sa-am-sa-am la tu-ub-lam um-ma a-ta-ma 15 GIN u-la ma-sa-at um-ma a-na-ku-ma si-ma-am sa-a-ma ta-er-ma i-na e-ra-bi-ka-ma sa-am-sa-am sa 15 GIN KU.GI e-pu-us-ma se-bi-lam is-tu se-pi-ka pa-ni-tim tu-us-ta-na-ab-la-ka-at a-na mi-nim ik-ri-bi tu-ka-al i-hi-id-ma sa-am-sa-am e-pu-us-ma i pa-nim-ma se-bi-lam u su-ma u-tu-ra-u i-ba-si a-qe-er-bi-ma i-di TUG.HI-ti sa ik-ri-bi sa a-sur a-na mi-nim i-ba-la-ku-tu a-di-ni a-na KU.BABBAR la i-tu-ru 1 me-at 90 TUG.HI-ti i-li-a-lum u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku u-sa-ab-si-lu-ni-kum KU.BABBAR ap-su-nu E ma-nim i-ba-si a-na DINGIR dam-qa-at i-na bu-ul-ti-a-ma KU.BABBAR-pi sa-ni-u-tum u-la-pu-tu u su-ma sa DAM.GAR-ri-im a-se-ri-a-ma se-bi-lam si-ma-am la-as-a-ma lu-ta-e-ra-kum u a-na-ku-ma u-la a-ma-sa-ah-ka
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā: I owe a sun-disk weighing 15 shekels of gold to divine Ilabrat. Take care to make the sun-disk and send it to me as soon as possible.

src: a-su-mi 30 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa pu-su-ke-en6 i-na a-lim{ki} i-se-er ku-lu-ma-a-a i-su-u-ma KU.BABBAR a-na na-ru-qi-su i-lu-ku-ni 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR qa-ti a-ha-ha DUMU.SAL pu-su-ke-en6 PUZUR4-a-sur u bu-za-zu a-hu-sa il5-qe-u 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR qa-su bu-za-zu DUMU pu-su-ke-en6 il5-qe 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR qa-su i-ku-pa-sa a-hu-su il5-qe a-na qa-ta-ti-su-nu a-ha-ha bu-za-zu u i-ku-pa-sa a-na ku-lu-ma-a u me-er-e-su u-la i-tu-ru su-ma a-na 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR qa-ti-sa a-ha-ha a-na ku-lu-ma-a ta-tu-wa-ar PUZUR4-a-sur u bu-za-zu u-bu-bu-su a-na KU.BABBAR-ap pu-su-ke-en6 lu a-na ka-sa-ru-ti-su lu a-na a-wa-tim bu-za-zu a-ha-ha u i-ku-pa-sa a-na mi-ma su-um-su u-la i-tu-ru u ku-lu-ma-a a-na mi-ma su-um-su a-na sa pu-su-ke-en6 u-la i-tu-ar-su-nu-ti
tgt: Concerning the 30 minas silver that Pūšu-kēn against Kulumaya in the city and the silver went into his Aḫāḫā, daughter of Pūšu-kēn, Puzur-Aššur, and Buzāzu, her brothers, took 10 minas silver, as their shares. Buzazu son of Pūšu-kēn took 10 minas silver as his share. Ikūppaša his brother took 10 minas silver as his share. Aḫaḫa, Buzāzu and Ikūppaša will not return to Kulumaya or his sons for their shares. If Aḫaḫa returns to Kulumaya for the 10 minas silver, her share, Puzur-Aššur and Buzāzu will pay atonement for her. Aḫaḫa and Ikūppaša will not return for the silver of Pūšu-kēn or for his shipmnets(?) or for the matter of Buzāzu for any reason. And Kulumaya will not return to the family of Pūšu-kēn for any reason.

src: 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-a-nim im-di-lum i-su is-tu <big_gap> <gap>-hu-a-nam a-na 2 sa-na-at i-sa-qal su-ma i-na ma-la-a u4-mi-su la is-qul i-na ma-na-um <big_gap> ma-na si-ib-tam u-sa-ab li-mu-um sa-lim-a-sur DUMU ha-la-ni-a u a-mur-a-sur DUMU DINGIR-ra-bi4 IGI a-sur-ma-lik IGI a-zu-zu
tgt: Šu-Anim owes Imdi-ilum 3 minas refined silver. Witnesses: Aššur-mālik, Azuzu.

src: 2 GU AN.NA ku-nu-ku sa a-lim{ki} 5.66666 ma-na 5 GIN AN.NA ku-nu-ki-ma sa a-lim{ki} 4 TUG-ba-ti sa li-wi-tim 1 ANSE sa-la-mu-um mi-ma a-nim a-bi4-a u ni-im-ra-{d}ISKUR li-ip-qi-du-ni-ku-nu-ti i tup-pi-su sa za-ba 0.5 ma-na al-qe 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-li-a a-5 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul tup-pu-su sa 1 ma-na tup-pu-su-ma 0.5 ma-na-am sa la-qe-u a si-ib-ti-a-ma a-la-qe IGI GAL-ga-li-a IGI ta-li-a IGI a-zu IGI pe-ru-a
tgt: Witnesses: Galgalīya, Dalīya, Azu, Peruwa

src: um-ma hi-na-a-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma i-na 15 GU 25 ma-na URUDU 8.5 GU URUDU a-na a-la-hi-im as-qul 4 GU 10 ma-na URUDU a-na sa-lim-be-li a-di-in-ma URUDU SIG5 ub-la-kum mas-ki wa-di-u-tim su-ut-ma i-di-in u si-im ANSE su-ut-ma u-se-si a-ma-kam lu-ba-li-ta-a-kum URUDU i-na sa-nu-qi-im 8 ma-na i-bi-ti-iq si-ti URUDU-ka 2.5 GU 7 ma-na 35 ma-na si-im SIG.HI.A si-ni-ti im 30 ma-na URUDU si-im 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa i-di-ISTAR a-na E ka-ri-im qa-at-ka i-di-u 4 GU 10 ma-na URUDU a-na E ka-ri-im a-na qa-ti-ka as-qul ni-si-ma 28 ma-na URUDU i-di-ISTAR i-pu-lam i-na si-im SIG.HI.A pa-ni-tim sa se-ep sa-lim-be-li 50 ma-na URUDU SIG5 is-ti DAM.GAR i-di-ISTAR il5-qe i-na 3 GU 45 ma-na URUDU sa <big_gap> tam-ka-ru ha-bu-lu SA.BA 39 ma-na URUDU hu-lu-qa-e E ka-ri-im ni-il5-qe-ma si-ti URUDU 3 GU 15 ma-na ni-il5-qe URUDU 55.66666 ma-na ma-<gap> <gap>
tgt: From Hinnaya to Aššur-nādā:

src: 0.33333 ma-na 2.5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er ha-pi-a sa ka-la-tu-a PUZUR4-a-sur i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa bu-zu-ta-a u PUZUR4.SA.TU a-na si-bi4-it ni-ga-lim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i ITU.KAM u-sa-ab IGI ki-ta-ar IGI lu-uh-ra-ah-su ra-di-u sa ha-ra-as-tal
tgt: Ḫabīya the Kalatua owes 1/3 minas 2 1/2 shekels silver to Puzur-Aššur. From the ḫamuštum of Buzutaya and Puzur-saduʾe he has until the harvest to pay. If he does not pay 1 1/2 shekels per month will be added. Witnesses: Kidar, and Luḫraḫšu the driver of ḫa-ra-áš-tal

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur KISIB a-mur-{d}UTU KISIB a-sur-DU10 sa 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-DU10 a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-i-mi-ti u a-mur-ISTAR 1.3333300000000001 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab KU.BABBAR a-su-mi i-ku-nim il5-qe ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-DU10
tgt: Seals: Puzur-Aššur, Amur-Šamaš, Aššur-ṭāb. Aššur-ṭāb owes Aššur-rēʾī 4 minas refined silver. From the ḫamuštum of Aššur-imittī and Amur-Ištar, he will add 1 1/3 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: um-ma a-la-hu-um-ma a-na a-sur-na-da u PUZUR4-a-na qi-bi4-ma ta-ma-la-ku pi-it-a-ma tup-pa-am sa 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa hu-bu-ul na-sa u a-ga-a u 2 GIN KU.GI sa im-li-ka-a na-di se-bi4-la-nim u i-na tup-pi a-ku-su-tim a-sur-a-ma-ru-um i-de8 a-sar sa-ak-nu-ni sa 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR tup-pa-am sa si-ik-ma-tim u tap-pa-e-su u sa 3.5 ma-na tup-pu-um sa su-ISTAR u su-nu-ti se-bi4-la-nim su-ma 2 ma-na-ma KU.BABBAR a-na i-li-a-lim ta-ta-ad-na u wa-ar-ka-tam is-ti DUMU um-mi-a-nim ke-ni-im 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR se-bi4-la-nim
tgt: From Alāhum to Aššur-nādā and Puzur-Anna: Open the tablet containers and send me the tablet concerning 10 minas of silver, Nanna's and Akaya's debt, plus the two shekels of gold which Imlikaya deposited. Further, among the tablets which were put away--Aššur-amārum knows where they were placed--send me the tablet concerning 20 minas of silver relating to Šikmatum If you have already given the two minas of silver to Ilī-ālum, then send later on with a trustworthy affiliated trader 3 further minas of silver.

src: um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma a-na la-ma-si qi-bi-ma 1 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI sa-du-a-su sa-bu ku-nu-ki-a dan-a-sur na-as-a-ki-im lu si-im 1 TUG u 2 TUG sa qa-bu-ul-tim sa a-na se-ri-a tu-se-bi4-li-ni KU.BABBAR-ap-ki gam-ra-ki-im 21 ma-na URUDU SIG5 ik-ri-bu sa be-lim 2 su-pa-na-an sa UD.KA.BAR 14 e-<gap> <gap> ma-na mas-qal-tim a-la-nu mi-is-lum ka-bu-tu-tum mi-is-lum ta-zi-ki pa-su-ru-um sa a-na ki-ta-um 5 e-pa-da-tum tal-ha-di-a-tum 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR lu sa-wi-ru lu mu-sa-ru-um sa su-ha-ri-im KI.LA.BI 0.66666 ma-na 2.5 GIN a-ha-ma a-nu-qu-su su-ha-ra-am u am-tam mi-ma a-nim dan-a-sur i-ra-de8-a-ki-im a-pu-tum su-ha-ra-am a-na ma-ma-an la tu-si-ri-ma i-na qe-ra-be-tim li-ir-bi i-nu-mi dan-a-sur a-ni-sa-am u-si-a-ni sa-wi-ri-su u mu-sa-ra-am a-se-er 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa a-di-nu-su-ni a-na dan-a-sur di-ni-ma SU.NIGIN sa 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR si-ma-am li-is-am lu-se-ri-am
tgt: From Pūšu-kēn to Lamassī: 1 minas 15 shekels silver, its excise added, its shipping charges paid, under my seal, Dān-Aššur brings to you. As for the proceeds of the 1 or two xx textiles which you sent to me, your silver is exhausted. 21 minas fine copper, for the ikrībū of Bēlum, 2 s. of bronze, 14 e., x minas their weight, above half heavy half taziki divided, which to Kitaum, 5 e. talḫadiatum, 1/3 minas silver, both a š. and a musarrum belonging to the youth (Dān-Aššūr? or the other youth?) their worth 62.5 shekels, separately his anuqqum, a youth and a maiden, all this Dān-Aššur bring to you. Urgent, do not release the youth to anyone so that he may grow up among us. When Dān-Aššur departs from there, Give the š and m. in addition to the 1/3 minas silver which I gave to him so that in total he makes purchases worth about a mina of silver. Send him back up.

src: a-na PUZUR4-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma i-li-we-da-ku-ma 8 TUG sa a-ki-di-e 1 TUG qa-am-su-um 10 {TUG}a-bar-ni-u 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN.TA 20 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 0.5 ma-na 4 TUG qa-dum a-na 25 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na bu-ur-a-sur u su-ma-li-ba-a-sur ni-di-ma tup-pa-as-nu a-na 4 ha-am-sa-tim ni-ih-ri-im sa-pa-ar-tum na-ad-a-at i-na qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is bu-ur-a-sur qa-ta-tum su-ma la is-qu-lu si-ib-tam u-su-bu a-na 2 me-at TUG qa-tim 10 GIN.TA a-na KU.BABBAR na-am-gu5-ra-ku sa-pa-ar-tam KU.GI u URUDU u-se-ra-ba-ma u TUG-ti u-sar-su-um is-ti su-ma-li-bi4-a-sur na-am-gu5-ra-ku-ma
tgt: To Puzur-Aššur: Thus Ilī-wedāku:

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u dan-a-sur qi-bi-ma 1 me-at 12 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 18 ma-na AN.NA-ak qa-tim 4 ANSE sa-la-mu u u-nu-su-nu 1 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na TUG sa sa-e-tim ig-ri sa-ri-di-e sa-bu mi-ma a-nim ku-nu-ki-a i-di-su-in i-ra-di-a-ku-nu-ti wa-ar-ka-at TUG.HI.A a-ni-u-tim AN.NA ma-la se-bu-lim u-se-ba-la-ku-nu-ti-ma u te-er-ti i-la-ka-ku-nu-ti
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn and Dān-Aššur: 112 kutānum textiles, 18 minas hand tin, four black donkeys and their gear, 1 shekels silver for a textile of saitim, the wage of the drivers satisfied-Idī-Suen brings all this to you (pl.) under my seal. After these textiles, I will send you as much tin as I can ship, and my instructions will come to you.

src: 2.33333 ma-na 3.6666600000000003 GIN KU.BABBAR a-sur-ma-lik i-na-pa-al ITU.1.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um a-sur-na-da is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa bu-zu-ta-a u a-sur-i-mi-ti
tgt: Aššur-mālik repaid 2 minas 23 2/3 shekels. (Month) Ḫubur. Eponymate: Aššur-nādā. From the ḫamuštum-week of Buzutaya and Aššur-imittī.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na la-qe-pi-im u a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma 9 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am ha-na-nu-um DUMU ub-ha-ki-im a-na-kam ha-bu-la-am 3 ma-na.TA i-na sa-ti-im i-sa-qal 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-na ku-zal-li a-ni-u-tim sa li-mi-im ah-mar-si i-sa-qa-la-am i-na lu-qu-ti-im sa i-ra-de8-a-ku-nu-ti-ni sa 4 ma-na AN.NA ni-is-ha-at AN.NA ki-a sa E.GAL-lim lu a-se-er AN.NA sa qa-ti-su su-ma mi-ma ni-pi-il5-tum i-ta-ab-si i-na KU.BABBAR sa li-bi4-su <big_gap> lu-sa-he-e-er-ma si-tam a-tu-nu <big_gap> u ha-na-num ku-un-ka-nim-ma se-bi4-la-nim a-na-kam sa ki-ma su-a-ti tup-pu-su li-ip-te-u-ma ma-as-qa-al-tu-su lu-sa-hi-ru
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Lā-qēpum and Aššur-nādā: Hannānum son of Ubhākum owes me 9 minas of refined silver here. He is to pay (in installments of) 3 minas per year. He is to pay me 3 minas of silver in this month of Kuzalli, year of Aḫ-marši. Of the merchandise that he will lead to you may 4 minas of tin, the nisḫātu-tax on my tin for the palace, may that be charged to the tin for his expenses; should there be any balance, he should deduct it from the money he owes, and then you and Hannānum must seal the rest and send it to me; then his representatives here may open his tablet and deduct his payment (from his debt).

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma <gap> <big_gap> e-ru-ba-am as-ta <gap> <big_gap> ni-is-ta-<gap> <big_gap>-ma i-<gap> <big_gap> 0.66666 <gap> la <big_gap> hu <big_gap> <gap> a <big_gap> a-na za <gap> <big_gap> ni-<gap> <big_gap> AN.NA <big_gap> um-ma <big_gap> <gap>-ma a-na <gap> <big_gap> si-ti <big_gap> pu-su-ke-en6 zi <gap> ut wa-za <big_gap> i-mu-a <gap> ni <big_gap> i-na a-wi-tim sa ILLAT-tim wa za <gap> <big_gap> a-du-um sa is-<gap> <big_gap> ni-is-pu-ra-ku-ni <gap> <big_gap> ki-ma 2 GIN <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> a-na KU.BABBAR <big_gap> sa-ak-<gap> <big_gap> ma-ma-an a-na su-ha-ri-ka ta-ra-dim la te-gi ma e-la ta-at-ru-da-ma te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam ka-la-ma ul-ta-mi-id
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn:

src: 15 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ha-nu la-ma-si ti-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-i-di u ha-nu a-na 3 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 0.5 GIN.TA-AT i ITU.1.KAM-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.1.KAM ab-sa-ra-ni li-mu-um ku-bi4-a IGI i-ku-pi-a-sur KISIB i-ri-si-im
tgt: Ḫanu owes Lamassī 15 shekels refined silver. He will pay 3 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-idī and Ḫanu. If he does not pay (on time) he will add 1/2 shekel per month. Month: Ab-šarrāni Eponymate: Kūbiya. Witnesses: Ikuppī-Aššur, Erišum.

src: a-na a-sur-i-mi-ti su-ISTAR su-hu-bur en-na-nim u bu-bu-ra-nim qi-bi-ma um-ma im-di-lum-ma lu-qu-tum sa se-ep a-mur-DINGIR a-di u4-mi-im a-ni-im tu-ka-si-da u lu-qu-tum sa se-ep a-la-hi-im ki-ma a-la-hu-um e-ru-ba-ni e-ru-ba-nim a-tu-nu-ma a-di u4-mi-im a-nim tu-uk-si-da a-<gap> <big_gap> la <big_gap> u lu-qu-tum sa PUZUR4-a-sur sa is-ti <gap>-<gap>-nim ur-da a-di-ni a-ma-kam tu-ka-la-si u sa is-ti-ku-nu ur-du-ni lu-qu-su-nu a-ni-sa-am e-li-a-ma u a-na KU.BABBAR u-ta-e-ru-si-ma u i-tu-ru-nim a-tu-nu is-tu 3 sa-na-at tu-ka-la-si u tup-pe-e us-<gap>-ti-qu-ku-nu u a-la-hu-um ma-la NIG.KA.NIG.KA.ZI i-di-nu te-er-ta-ku-nu ma-ti-ma la i-li-kam u hi-na-a a-mi-sa-am i-ta-al-kam i sa-ha-at um-mi-a-ni-su i-zi-za-ma su-ta-am-ri-sa-ma KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na se-li-a-nim i-na tup-pi as-pu-ra-ku-nu-ti um-ma a-na-ku-ma mi-ma lu-qu-ti-a lu sa se-ep a-mur-DINGIR lu sa PUZUR4-a-sur lu sa se-ep a-la-hi-im a-na ka-ni-is a-na na-ab-su-en6 lik-su-da-ma a-na KU.BABBAR lu-ta-er-si-ma u ha-ra-ni liq-ru-ba-am a-tu-nu mi-ma lu-qu-ti-a tu-uk-ta-si-da wa-ar-ki-um PUZUR4-a-sur ka-sa-ar pu-su-ke-en6 sa ur-ki lu-qu-ti-a lu-qu-su ur-du mi-ma lu-qu-ti-su ig-mu-ra a-na ma-ma-a pi-la-ah-ISTAR DUMU u-zu-a ik-su-da-ka a-na <big_gap>
tgt: To Aššur-imittī Šū-Ištar, Šū-Ḫubur, Ennānum and Bubrānum, from Imdī-ilum: Goods from the transport of Amur-ilī, until this day you have delayed. Also, the goods of the transport of Āl-aḫm, when Āl-aḫum arrived .. you yourself have delayed until this day! ... the goods of Puzur-Aššur which came down with ..., until now, you have delayed(?) them there. Also, the which came down with you (pl.) let is go up to here so that I can convert it to silver and return it. As for you, for three years not you have retained it and ... the tablets. Also, Āl-āḫum as much as he gave you at accountings, your report has not come whatsoever. Also, Ḫinnaya went there. Assist the investors and casue difficulties(?) and raise about a mina of silver. In the tablets I wrote to you, I said, "Let all the goods, either from the transport of Amur-ilī, or from that of Puzur-Aššur, or from the transport of Āl-āḫum, get to Kanesh to Nāb-Suen so that he can convert them to silver and the caravan may draw close." But as for you (pl.) you have delayed my merchandise. Afterward, Puzur-Aššur the transporter of Pūšu-kēn who after he brought my goods down, he(?) exhausted all of my goods. Pilaḫ-Ištar s. Uzuwa brought (goods) to Mamma (for?) you (s.)(?).

src: a-na PUZUR4-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma il5-we-da-ku-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma tup-pi sa a-hi-ka si-ta-me-ma mi-li-ik lu-qu-ti-ka mi-li-ik a-ta-a a-ma-kam wa-as-ba-ti-ma a-na-ku mi-li-ik lu-qu-tim a-ma-li-ik i-na tup-pi-im sa a-hi-a 2 GU 16.5 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 60 TUG.HI SIG5 35 TUG.HI sa qa-tim 6 ANSE sa-la-mu su-ma a-ma-kam ta-da-gal-ma ha-ra-an su-qi-nim la ni-sa-hu-ut ma te-er-ti ma-ma-an i-la-ak u a-ta te-er-ta-ka a-se-er ku-si-im u a-bu-sa-lim li-li-ik-ma a-bu-a-a is-te-en6 AN.NA u TUG.HI qa-tam i pa-ni-tim lu-se-ti-iq a-na-ma a li-bi4 ma-tim i-ma-qu-tu u sa-ni-um TUG.HI SIG5 lu-se-ri-ib i-nu-mi te-er-ta-ka i-lu-ku na-as-pe-er-ti a-ni-tam se-bi4-il5-si
tgt: To Puzur-Aššur from Ilī-wēdāku:

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di a-na a-sur-na-da i-li-a-lim u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi4-ma 12 ma-na KU.BABBAR DUMU a-lu-la-a ha-bu-lam sa-ab-ta-su-ma KU.BABBAR sa-as-qi-la-su su-ma la-su a-sar wa-as-bu i su-ha-ri-a su-up-ra-su-ma KU.BABBAR lu-sa-as-qi-il5-su su-ma u-mu-su a-hu-ru ma-la ta-ar-ki-is-ti-su KU.BABBAR li-ik-nu-uk-ma a-na sa ki-ma su-a-ti u i-a-ti lu-se-bi4-la-ma si-ma-am lu ni-is-am-su
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā, Ilī-ālum and Aššur-taklāku: Alulaya's son owes me 12 minas of silver. Seize him and make him pay the silver. If he is absent, then write to him by means of one of my servants to where he is staying, so he can make him pay the silver. If his term (for repayment) is not up yet, then have him seal the silver in accordance with his contract. Let him send it to his representatives and to me, so we can purchase goods for him.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma i-di-ku-bu-ma i-na u4-mi-im sa u-nu-tu-um i-na E.GAL-lim-u-si-a-ni is-ti a-li-ki-im pa-ni-im-ma u-nu-ti ab-ka-am a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta i-hi-da a-na ma-nim la-ti-ki-il5 KU.BABBAR si-im AN.NA-ki-ka lu u-se-bi4-la-ku-ni a-sur u il5-ka li-tu-la su-ma a-di-ni al-qi i-na ra-mi-ni-a lu-a-di la-ma sa-ri-im u-sa-ba-ni lu-qu-ti ab-ka-am u a-na-ku a-wa-at-ka sa-ma-am a-li-e i-hi-id
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Idī-Kūbum: On the day that the merchandise exits the palace, dispatch my merchandise with the first traveller. My dear father and lord, take care! Who (else) can I trust? May Aššur and your god witness that I indeed sent you the silver gained from your tin! If I did indeed take it, I certainly (would not have) deposited in my own funds! Before the wind (can blow???) resolve, dispatch my goods to me! Take care!

src: a-na su-hu-bur qi-bi4-ma um-ma im-di-DINGIR u pu-su-ke-en6-ma 4 GU 20 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 1 me-at 5 ku-ta-nu 3 ku-ta-nu sa en-na-nim 8 TUG su-ru-tum li-wi-tum 6 ANSE.HI.A sa-la-mu 40 ma-na AN.NA qa-tim SU.NIGIN 9 GU a-wi-it-ka 3.6666600000000003 ma-na 2 GIN.TA 33.33333 ma-na da-tum a-di ti-me-el-ki-a ik-su-dam is-tu ti-me-el-ki-a a-di ka-ni-is 9 0.5 GIN.TA 1.3333300000000001 ma-na 5.5 GIN ik-su-dam <big_gap> ma-na 5 GIN qa-qa-da-tum <big_gap> <gap> hi <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> a-hu-ru-ma <big_gap> u 5 TUG su-ru-tim <gap> 5 ku-ta-nu 0.33333 <big_gap> su-ru-tum 8 ku-ta-nu <gap> SU.NIGIN 4.5 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR <gap> <big_gap> ni-it-hi 2 TUG su-re-en 1 GU AN.NA ku-nu-ki bu-zu-ta-a il5-qe si-ti TUG-ti-ka 5 ku-ta-nu 2 TUG su-ru-tum a qa-ti-ka i-ba-si-u i-na 3 GU AN.NA-ki-ka 1 GU AN.NA a sa ki-ma la-li-im ni-di-in su-uq-lam a se-ni-su ni-zu-uz-ma 30 ma-na AN.NA SIG5 e-na-ma-nim il5-qe 15.66666 ma-na a-na ir-ma-a-sur ne-pu-ul 12 ma-na ni-is-ha-at 6 su-uq-la-ti-ka ni-di-in 5.33333 ma-na a-se-er AN.NA qa-ti-su a-na <big_gap> mu-ta su-uq-la-ti-ka <gap> <big_gap> pu-su-ke-en6 il5-qe <big_gap> 3 ANSE me-tu 3 <big_gap>
tgt: To Šū-Ḫubur from Imdī-lum and Pūšu-kēn: 4 talents 20 minas tin under seal, 105 kutānum-textiles, 3 kutānum-textiles belongning to Ennanum, 8 šurum-textiles wrappings, 6 black donkeys, 40 minas 'hand-tin', altogether your awītum is 9 talents. The dātum-payment to Timelkiya accrued to 3 2/3 minas silver (at a 2 shekel rate), 33 1/3 minas (tin). From Timelkiya to Kane Buzutaya received 2 šurum-textiles (and) 1 talent tin under seal. The remainder of your textiles, 5 kutānum-textiles and 2 šurum-textiles are available in your account. From the 3 talents of your tin, we gave 1 talent tin to the representatives of Lālum. half of his sack ... Pūšu-kēn received. broken section Three ...

src: PUZUR4.ISTAR sa ki-ma PUZUR4-a-sur a-na sa-ba-si-a is-ba-at-ni-a-ti-ma um-ma PUZUR4.ISTAR-ma ki-ma PUZUR4-a-sur a-sa-al-ka i-na lu-qu-tim sa a-su-mi {d}ISKUR qa-tum i-si-ik-nu-ni-ma su-ISTAR u il5-we-da-ku a-na se-ri-ka u PUZUR4-{d}UTU ub-lu-ni-ku-nu-ti-ni 2.5 ma-na 6 GIN KU.KI a-na hu-bu-li-ka sa {d}ISKUR la i-si-qi-il5 mi-ma i-na ra-mi-ni-ka ta-as-qul la i-na lu-qu-tim a-mi-tim sa ni-is a-lim{ki} ka-i-la um-ma sa-ba-si-a-ma ke-na i-na lu-qu-tim sa qa-ti {d}ISKUR i-si-ik-nu-ma lu-qu-tam PUZUR4-a-sur a-na su-ISTAR u il5-we-da-ku ip-qi-du-ma a-na se-ri-a u PUZUR4-{d}UTU u-se-bi4-la-ni lu-qu-tum a-na KU.KI i-tur4-ma 2.5 ma-na 6 GIN KU.KI a-na hu-bu-li-a sa {d}ISKUR i-si-qi-il5 mi-ma i-na ra-mi-ni-a u-la as-qul i-na lu-qu-tim a-mi-tim-ma as-qul a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um wa-ah-su-sa-na sa-he-er GAL i-di-ni-a-ti-ma IGI GIR sa a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in IGI a-sur-GAL IGI dan-a-sur IGI ma-ma-he-er
tgt: Puzur-Ištar, representative of Puzur-Aššur, seized us against Sabasiya: Puzur-Ištar stated: "I am questioning you on behalf of Puzur-Aššur. From the goods which were concerning Adad the share ... and which Šū-Ištar and Il-wedāku delivered (it) to you and Puzur-Šamaš, 2 minas 36 shekels gold belonging to Adad to your debit was not paid. You paid whatever was on your person. Sabasiya replied, "It is true. From the goods which were set for the share as Adad and the goods which Puzur-Aššur entrusted to Šū-Ištar and Il-wedāku and which they delivered to myself and Puzur-Šamaš, the goods were converted to gold and I owed 2 minas 36 shekels gold. It was weighed out as the share of Adad. I did not pay anything of myself. I paid from the goods a-mi-tim-ma." The plenary colony assembly at Waḫšušana set for us (witnesses) concerning this matter and we gave our witnesses before the dagger of Aššur. Aššur-rabi, Dān-Aššur, Mamaḫer

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma su-ISTAR-ma is-tu si-ir-mu-in a-ta-be-a-am a-na KU.BABBAR sa se-ep ku-lu-ma-a u im-ku-a 10 GU 50 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 3 me-at TUG qa-dum 10 {TUG}ku-ta-nu dam-qu-tum 17 ANSE is-ti-a i-lu-ku 1 me-at TUG i-na ha-hi-im dam-qu-tim a-be-a-ar KU.BABBAR 1 GIN wa-at-ra-am a-ga-ma-ar-ma a-ka-sa-dam te-er-ta-ka a pa-ni-a li-li-kam u-zi-ni pi-te u a-na-ku 10 TUG dam-qu-tim i-a-u-tim sa na-as-a-ku-ni u-zi-ni pi-te 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na pa-ni-a se-bi-lam a-na-hi-id-ma a-ka-sa-dam
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn, thus Šū-Ištar: I am setting out from Širmuin. In addition to the silver of the transport of Kulumaya and Imkuwa, seventeen donkeys go with me: (carrying) 10 talents 50 minas tin under seal and 300 kutānum textiles together with 10 fine textiles. I will select one hundred textiles in Ḫaḫḫum, fine (ones). I will exhaust every 'available' shekel of silver and I will arrive. Let your instructions come quickly to me. Inform me. Also, as for myself, my ten fine textiles which I am carrying to you. inform me. Send two minas silver ahead of me. I will take care to arrive (in time).

src: KISIB a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5 DUMU su-be-lim KISIB bu-za-zu DUMU su-su-en6 KISIB en-nam-a-sur DUMU su-ki-tim 0.33333 ma-na 0.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er en-nam-a-sur DUMU su-ki-tim a-gi-a i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa im-di-lim u a-ni-a-nim 0.66666 GIN 15 SE KU.BABBAR i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM ma-hu-ri-lu li-mu-um bu-zu-zu a-li ni-na-mu-ru KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su i-sa-qa-lam
tgt: Seals of Aššur-mutabbil s. Šū-Bēlim, Buzazu s. Šū-Suen, Ennam-Aššur s. Šukkutum Ennam-Aššur s. Šukkutum owes Agia 1/3 minas 1/2 shekels refined silver. He will add 2/3 shekels 15 grains silver (per mina) per month as interest from the ḫamuštim of Imdī-ilim and Anianum. Month: Maḫḫur ilī Eponymate: Buzuzu

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma PUZUR4-a-sur-ma i-na sa-nim u4-mi-im sa DINGIR-ma-lik e-ru-ba-ni tup-pe-e a-ni-u-tim u-la-pi-ta-kum KU.BABBAR ap-ka DINGIR-ma-lik ub-lam a-su-mi AN.NA sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni AN.NA 13 GIN.TA u su-uq-lum za-ku-tum la-su ANSE u 20 bu-tu-uq-tum i-na ki-kam-lim sa-am-u e-ru-bu-nim-ma AN.NA ni-sa-am-ma i ba-ti-qi-im pa-nim-ma nu-se-ba-la-kum a-na KU.BABBAR sa se-pi-a ki-ma AN.NA ba-at-qu-ni mi-ma AN.NA u-la as-a-am AN.NA e-ra-ba-ma a-sa-a-ma is-ti AN.NA-ki-ka a-ba-ka-kum u si-mu-um sa a-ki-di-e su-ma i-ta-as-ra-am sa KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na a-sa-a-am a-na ku-ta-ni sa ta-as-ta-na-pa-ra-ni sa-ap-tum su-ur-bu-i-tum la-su 1 TUG ka-ab-tam i-na ma-hi-ri-im ni-sa-a-ma nu-se-ba-la-kum ra-qa-tum la-su ri-ig-li u su-lu-pi KI su-ISTAR u-se-ba-la-kum ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma mi-ma i pi um-mi-a-ni-a ta-sa-me-u-ni uz-ni pi-te ta-zi-im-tum mi-ma la-su li-ba-ka sa-ni-a-tam mi-ma la u-ba-lam a-di sa e-la um-ma su-hu-bu-ur-ma mi-su-um KU.BABBAR a-sar sa-ni-im u-se-ri-ib
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Puzur-Aššur: On the second day after Ilī-mālik arrived, I wrote you these tablets. Ilī-mālik brought your silver. Concerning the tin about which you wrote, tin is at a 13 shekel rate. Moreover there is not a full package available. Donkeys and 20 sacks were purchased in the gigamlum. They will arrive and we will purchase tin and send it to you by the first express. For silver of my transport, because tin is in short supply, I did not purchase anything. The tin will arrive, I will make purchases and I will depart with your tin. Now, as for the purchases of Akkadian-textiles, if (someone) saved some, I will purchase goods worth 1 mina of silver. About the textiles about which you keep writing me, there is no northern wool. We purchased 1 heavy textile in the market and we will send it to you. There are no fine textiles. I will send to you foodstuffs and ripened dates with Šū-Ištar. You wrote me. You said, "Inform me about what you heard from the talk of my investors." There are no complaints. Your heart must not bear any concern. Regarding the matter of Ela: Šū-Ḫubur said, "Why did he send the silver somewhere else?"

src: 3.6666600000000003 ma-na 6 GIN KU.GI a-na na-ru-uq i-di-su-en6 PUZUR4.ISTAR sa-pi-ik u 8 ma-na KU.GI si-ip-ka-tu-su sa i-di-su-en6 a-na sa E a-ba i-tu-ra SU.NIGIN 11.66666 ma-na 6 GIN KU.GI a-na sa E a-ba i-tu-wa-ar SA.BA 5.33333 ma-na 2.6666600000000003 GIN 15 SE KU.GI si-ip-ka-at i-di-su-en6 0.33333 ma-na 7.75 GIN su-ku-bu-um 1 ma-na 2.75 GIN a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku 1.66666 ma-na 7.75 GIN da-da-a 1 ma-na 7.75 GIN en-nam-a-sur 1.3333300000000001 ma-na 7.5 GIN PUZUR4-a-na 0.5 ma-na sa-di-li IGI a-sur-SIPA IGI a-sur-dan IGI i-di-a-sur DUMU ku-bi4-di IGI PUZUR4-a-sur IGI su-ki-tim IGI su-{d}EN.LIL IGI a-gu5-za
tgt: Witnesses: Aššur-rēʾī, Aššur-dān, Idī-Aššur s. Kūbidi, Puzer-Aššur, Šukkutum, šuden-líl, Aguza.

src: 1.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er u-sur-sa-a-sur bu-za-zu i-su-u um-ma u-sur-sa-a-sur-ma su-e-a ha-bu-lam su-ma su-e-a la i-ta-ah-ba-al-sum 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-em u-sa-ab is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-di-ku-bi4-im ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tim li-mu-um i-ku-pi-ISTAR IGI i-ku-pi-a IGI {d}ISKUR.ANDUL IGI a-sur-nim-ri
tgt: Uṣur-ša-Aššur owes Buzazu 1 2/3 minas refined silver. From the ḫamuštum of Idī-Kūbim. Month: Qarrātum. Eponymate: Ikuppī-Ištar. Witnesses: Ikuppiya, Adad-ṣilūlī, Aššur-nimrī.

src: KISIB <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-a-sur KISIB a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU dan-a-sur KISIB a-ha-la-ar-si sa hu-bu-ul a-ha-la-ar-si 8 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um ba-lu-um du-na-e sa a-sur-SIPA is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-ku-nim u PUZUR4-a-sur 2 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-ha-la-ar-si
tgt: Seals: xxx-Aššur, Aššur-imittī s. Dān-Aššur, Aḫam-larsi. Regarding Aḫam-larši's debt of 8 minas refined silver. From the ḫamuštum of Ikūnim and Puzur-Aššur, he will add 2 shekels (per mina) per month.
