src: 0.5 ma-na 6.5 GIN PUZUR4.ISTAR 11 GIN su-la-ba-an 0.33333 ma-na LA 0.16666 GIN PUZUR4-a-sur 0.33333 ma-na 5.33333 GIN u-zu-u-a 10 GIN a-sur-{d}UTU 15.5 GIN PUZUR4.DINGIR 11 GIN a-sur-dan 8.25 GIN e-la-li 2 ma-na 13 GIN u-su-ur-sa-a-sur 11 GIN su-is-ha-ra 4.66666 ma-na 1.5 GIN is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-{d}UTU DUMU i-tur4-DINGIR a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal-ma SA.BA 0.5 ma-na u-su-ur-sa-a-sur i-la-qe-ma si-tam a-na ba-a-ba-at a-wi-ti-ni ni-zu-a-az u a-na sa a-na sa-ni-u-tim 1.66666 ma-na 1.5 GIN i-sa-qal-ma a-na ba-ba-a-at a-wi-ti-ni ni-zu-az su-ma la is-qu-ul-ma la ni-il5-qe ni-id-ba-at a-ki-li KU.BABBAR-pi-ni ni-tu-ar IGI da-da-nim IGI sa-lim-a-sur
tgt: Witnesses: Dadānim, Šalim Aššur.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma a-wa-at DINGIR dan-na a mi-nim a-na ni-qi-sa-ti-ka a-na E en-na-nim ta-tu-nu-ar a-pu-tum la ta-tu-ar ta-ha-li-iq a-sur-ma-lik su-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN a-na e-bu-tim i-da-na-kum la ta-ma-ha-ar-su su-ma ki-ma su-wa-ti u-sa-za-az-ka la ta-za-az um-ma a-ta-ma ha-ra-ni a-na a-lim{ki} a-su-mi ti-ir-tim sa PUZUR4-a-sur la te-ra-ab-ma TUG.HI.A la ta-ta-na-di-in qa-di um-me-a-ni a-hi-ta-ma i-zi-iz u si-it TUG.HI.A u KU.BABBAR du-gu5-ul su-ma TUG.HI.A i-zu-zu i-zi-iz-ma a-na qa-ti-ni zu-uz is-tu a-sur u-sa-pa-la-ni a-na ma-tim ki-li-sa IR-du-tam la ta-sa-ba-at <gap>-ma-su wa-sa-am la i-mu-u sa i-ta-na-di-nu li-ta-di-in a-ta la ta-hi
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā: The words of the gods are urgent! Why do you keep renouncing your obligations towards the house of Ennānum? Please, do not renounce them! You will perish! As to Aššur-malik, if he wants to give you even 1 shekel of silver as an investment loan, don't receive it! If he appoints you to be his representative, don't do it! Say instead: "I am on my way to the City." Because of Puzur-Aššur's message you are not to enter (the house), and do not try to sell the textiles all over the place. Stand outside together with the shareholders and observe the textiles and the silver that come out. If they divide up the textiles, then stand by and join in the division for our share. Since divine Assur would then humble me, do not become a slave of the entire country. ... they refuse to come out, let he who wishes to sell all over the place do so, but you should not be involved.

src: a-na a-la-hi-im u a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma um-ma e-di-in-a-sur-ma i-na wa-as-ha-ni-a 2 me-at 60 mas-ku lu-qu-ut-ku-nu i-ba-si-u sa ki-ma i-a-ti as-pu-ur-ma a-na wa-as-ha-ni-a um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-di-i sa-qi-il5 da-ti-im ku-ra-ra u-sa-zu-zu a-na qa-ti-su mi-is-li-su mi-ma la tu-wa-sa-ar-su-um a-ma-kam a-na sa ki-ma su-a-ti e is-pu-ur-ma ka-ra-am e im-hu-ru-ma mas-ki e u-wa-si-ru-su-um i-zi-za-ma ki-ma i-a-ti i-ma mas-ki qa-at-ku-nu su-uk-na-a um-ma a-tu-nu-ma tam-ka-ar-ni is-pu-ur-ni-a-ti i-se-er lu-qu-tim qa-at-ku-nu su-uk-na-a a-na-kam ku-ra-ra u-ni-ha-ni u KU.BABBAR-ap-ku-nu a-na re-u-qi-im i-zi-iz a-di tup-pa-am sa ka-ri-im a-na-ku u sa-si-a ni-il5-qe-u sa sa-su-hi-su u-la i-li-kam ih-da-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-ku-nu la i-ru-a-aq
tgt: To Alāhum and Aššur-nādā from Eddin-Aššur: In Wašania 260 fleeces, (which are) your goods, are available. I wrote to my representatives in Wašhania saying: "As long as the fee-paying member appoints Kurara as his agent; Do not release to him his half to dispose over! He must not write to his representatives there lest they should approach the colony and it should release the fleeces to him. Stand up and lay claim to the fleeces on my behalf, saying: "Our Kurara has cheated me here and stood ready to remove your silver. Until I and Sasia received a tablet from the colony authorities concerning his extradition, he would not come. Take care that your silver does not get out of reach!

src: KISIB u-ba-ar-tim sa u-la-ma sa di-in u-ba-ar-tim
tgt: Seal of the wabartum settlement of Ulama for the verdict of the wabartum settlement.

src: a-na a-mur-ISTAR u u-su-ur-sa-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-DU10-ma a-ba-u-a be-lu-u-a a-tu-nu ha-ra-num a-sar pa-na-em u-la i-ba-si si-ip-ri sa a ka-ri-im sa ni-is-pu-ra-ni a-di ha-ra-nim a-na tu-uh-pi-a pa-ta-e-em u a-tu-nu ih-da-ma a-wa-tam ta-e-ra-ma si-ip-ri li-is-pu-ru-nim-ma u a-na-ku a-na-kam la a-sa-hu-ur u te-er-ta-ak-nu a-ni-tam4 la a-ni-tam4 li-li-kam-ma uz-ni pi-ti-a a-na u-su-ur-sa-a-sur qi-bi-ma 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR <gap>-is-ti-kal li-is-qu-la-kum lu-qu-tum sa tu-se-bi4-la-ni sal-ma-at a-di si-ma-am ta-sa-u-mu KU.BABBAR i ku-nu-ki-ka-ma li-ib-si
tgt: To Amur-Ištar and Uṣur-ša-Aššur say: thus (says) Aššur-ṭāb. You are my fathers, you are my lords. There is no road anywhere to move forward. (Regarding) my messenger whom we sent to the (Tuḫpiya) colony, as concerns the opening of the road to Tuḫpiya, take care to report (about the matter): my messenger shoudl be sent to me so that I shall not be delayed here. Let your report in this respect come here and do inform me. To Uṣur-ša-Aššur say: X-tikal should pay 1/2 mina of silver to you. The merchandise which you sent me has safely arrived. Until you make the purchases, the silver should remain in safekeeping under your own seal.

src: KISIB ha-pi-a sa ka-la-tu-a KISIB ki-ta-ar KISIB lu-uh-ra-ah-su 0.33333 ma-na 2.5 GIN KU.BABBAR li-ti i-se-er ha-pi-a sa ka-la-tu-a PUZUR4-a-sur i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa bu-zu-ta-a u PUZUR4.SA.TU a-na si-bi4-it ni-ga-lim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab
tgt: Seals: Ḫabīya ša Kalatua, Kidar, Luḫraḫšu. Ḫabīya ša Kalatua owes Puzur-Aššur 1/3 mina 2 1/2 shekels. From the ḫamuštum of Buzutaya and Puzur-saduʾe the time of the harvest he must pay. If he does not pay 1 1/2 shekels of copper in interest will be added.

src: um-ma hi-na-a-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma i-na pa-ni-tim 35 ma-na AN.NA 2 ku-si-ta-an 1 TUG za-ki-am 2 su-lu-up-ka-e a-na ku-lu-ma-a a-di-in a-na-kam si-ma-am is-a-ma qa-su-ma u-ka-al 6 ku-ta-ni u-ra-di-sum 3 ku-ta-ni ku-lu-ma-a na-as-a-kum SA.BA 1 TUG SIG5 9 ku-ta-ni en-um-a-sur ka-sa-ar ISTAR-pi-la-ah na-as-a-kum 10 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na qa-ti-su a-di-in da-tum ma-la i-ka-su-du-su-ni-ni lu-sa-he-er-ma si-tam li-di-na-kum 2 ku-ta-ni kur-ub-ISTAR DUMU su-hu-bur na-as-a-kum SA.BA 1 TUG sa PUZUR4.ISTAR mi-ma la u-la-ma-ad-ka SU.NIGIN 13 TUG.HI.A SA.BA 1 TUG SIG5 a-na qa-ti-a sa ta-ta-di-u li-qe 1 TUG SIG5 a qa-ti-a-ma li-ib-si 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa DUMU.SAL ISTAR-pi-la-ah kur-ub-ISTAR DUMU su-hu-bur i-na e-ra-bi4-su-ma sa-qa-lam qa-bi4 KU.BABBAR sa-as-qi-il5-su-ma ku-nu-uk-ma a-se-ri-a se-bi4-lam lu KU.BABBAR lu TUG.HI.A is-ta-pu-ku qa-ti sa-ak-lu-ul-tam i-ta-di-i u is-ti a-li-ki ki-a-ma u-se-ba-la-kum a-ta-ma ta-aq-bi4-am um-ma a-ta-ma a-sur-DU10 i-na wa-ah-su-sa-na wa-sa-ab-ma AN.NA-ka ub-lu-nim-ma a-na lu-lu 8 GIN.TA i-di-nu-su-ma KU.BABBAR a-se-er a-sur-DU10 u-se-bi4-lu su-ma sa-he-er i-na su-ha-ri-a u-la a-na-ah-i-li su-pu-ur-ma le-ri-su-ma KU.BABBAR ku-nu-uk-ma se-bi4-lam a-hi a-ta i-hi-id u a-se-er ku-ni-lim te-er-ta-ka li-li-ik-ma su-ha-ra-am li-it-ru-dam a-la-nu-ka ma-nam i-su
tgt: Hinnaya to Pūšu-kēn: Recently, I gave 35 minas tin, 2 kusītum textiles, 1 zakium textile and 2 šulupkā'um textiles to Kulumaya. 1 fine textile to my account is the 40 shekels debt of the daughter of Ištar-pilaḫ. (?) As for Kurub-Ištar son of Šū-Ḫubur, declare his payings at his arrival. Have him pay the silver, then seal it and send it to me. Should they deposit silver or textiles, deposit my full share. Then I will send to you mine with a traveller. You spoke to me. You said, "Aššur-ṭāb stays in Waḫšušana and he brought your tin and they gave it to Lulu at an 8 shekel rate and they sent the silver to Aššur-ṭāb." If it is short, send to me by my youth or Anaḫ-ilī so that they may request and seal the silver and send it (verb tense). My dear brother, take heed that your message goes to Kunilim, and the he dispatches the youth to me. Besides you, whom do I have?

src: a-na su-hu-bur qi-bi-ma um-ma im-di-DINGIR u pu-su-ke-en6-ma 1 me-at 5 {TUG}ku-ta-ni 1 TUG su-ra-am e-zi-ib sa li-wi-tim 4.33333 GU AN.NA ku-nu-ki u 8 TUG su-ru-tim li-wi-tam ir-ma-a-sur u-bi-il5-ni-a-ti 1 TUG su-ra-am <big_gap> <gap>-nam bu-zu-ta-a <big_gap><gap> su 91 ku-ta-nu <big_gap><big_gap><gap> en-nam-{d}ISKUR <big_gap> 12 <big_gap> <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR ap-su-nu si-ti TUG.HI-ti-ka 19 ku-ta-nu 8 su-ru-tum a-na ni-ka-si-ka gam-ru a-na 0.83333 ma-na sa-al-sa-ti-ka lu AN.NA lu TUG.HI.A 2 GIN.TA E ka-ri-im ni-is-ta-qal-ma a-na ba-at-qi-im ta-ad-nu 0.5 ma-na 3.16666 GIN KU.BABBAR za-ku-um sal-sa-tu-ka 4.33333 ma-na 5 GIN <big_gap> 12 TUG 6 ma-na sa <gap> <big_gap> <gap>-<gap>-ni-a-di 13.5 GIN <big_gap> AN.NA u 11 ma-na <big_gap> 11.75 GIN KU.BABBAR ap-ka <big_gap>
tgt: To Šū-Ḫubur from Imdī-ilum and Pūšu-kēn: Irma-Aššur brought to us 105 kutānum-textiles, 1 šūrum-textile beyond the wrappings, 4 1/3 talents tin under seal, and 8 šūrum-textiles wrappings. 1 91 ... their value is x minas silver. The remainder of your textiles, 19 As for the 50 shekels (silver), your šalšātum, both tin and textiles at 2 shekels each, we had paid the colony office and it is given to 33 1/6 shekels silver the clearing? of your šalšātum, 4 minas 25 shekels ... 12 textiles, 6 minas (silver) which ... (brought?) to us. 13 1/2 shekels ... tin and 11 minas ... ... 11 3/4 shekels is their worth in silver.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma a-su-mi sa {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni i u4-mi-im sa tup-pa-am u-la-pi-ta-ku-ni u4-mu-su ma-al-u AN.NA za-ku-a-am sa-a-ma KI dan-a-sur PUZUR4-a-sur a li-bi {d}MAR.TU lu-si-ma a-na e-ta-li-ti-su AN.NA li-is-ba-at dan-a-sur ma-ra-as-ma la u-si en-um-a-sur te-er-ti a-se-ri-ka i-ra-de8 u PUZUR4-a-sur is-ti-su u-si-ma i sa DUMU su-a-e-em a e-ta-lu-ti-su AN.NA en-um-a-sur is-ba-at-ma a-na PUZUR4-a-sur i-di-ma 20 ma-na LA 6.16666 GIN KU-al-qe si-ti KU-pi-a 0.83333 ma-na 1.16666 GIN a-ma-kam li-qe u a-sa-ar wa-as-bu su-pu-ur-su-um 20 ma-na KU-ap-ka sa a-na a-lim{ki} a-se-er sa ki-ma i-a-ti u-se-bi4-lu lu-qu-tum u-sa-ma ki-ma u4-mu-ka ma-al-u-ni a-na e-ta-lu-ti-su sa-lim-a-hu-um i li-bi4 {d}MAR.TU i-di-ma 20 ma-na LA 6.16666 GIN KU il-te-qe si-ti KU-pi-su 0.83333 ma-na 1.16666 GIN se-bi4-lam-ma tup-pa-ka la-di-na-ku-ma du-uk si-ti KU u-se-bi4-la-ku-um la u-se-bi4-la-ku-um te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam 12 ma-na 15 GIN KU sa tu-se-bi4-la-ni AN.NA sa-im u a-na-ku sa ra-du-im u-ra-da-ma AN.NA a-sa-a-ma dan-a-sur u PUZUR4-a-sur a-ta-ra-dam 18 {TUG}ku-ta-ni dam-qu-tim sa su-e-a na-as-u-ni-kum e-ra-ab TUG-ti-su la tu-qa-a 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR se-bi4-lam-ma si-ma-am la-as-a-ma a-di a-ma-kam wa-as-ba-ti-ni lu-sa-ak-si-da-ma KU 1 ma-na le-li a-hi a-ta a-la-nu-ka a ma-nim ta-ak-la-ku a te-er-ti-a i-hi-id
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: Regarding the matter of Ilabrat-bāni about which you wrote, "On the day which I am writing the tablet, his term is full. Purchase cleared tin. Let Dān-Aššur depart with Puzur-Aššur to Amurrum and seize the tin on his own authority." Dān-Aššur was ill and did not go. Ennum-Aššur brings my instructions to you. Now, Puzur-Aššur departed with him and Ennam-Aššur seized the tin on his own authority from (lit. in) the goods of (Ilabrat-bāni's) son, and deposited it with Puzur-Aššur and I received 19 minas 53 5/6 shekels. Get the remainder of my silver there, 51 1/6 shekels. Now, wherever he is, write to him (the following): Let your message come as to whether he send the remainder of the silver to you or not. 12 minas 15 shekels silver which you sent to me, tin is purchased. Now, I will raise what I can and I will purchase (more) tin and I will dispatch Dān-Aššur and Puzur-Aššur. As for the 18 fine Send 5 minas silver so that I can make purchases and can cause (the goods) to reach there while you are still there and maximize profit. My dear brother, besides you in whom can I trust? Heed my messages!

src: a-na a-sur-SIPA pu-su-ke-en6 en-nam-a-sur kur-ub-ISTAR u a-sur-ma-lik qi-bi-ma um-ma su-hu-bur-ma 51 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 1 TUG su-ru-um <gap> <gap>-tum 10 ma-na AN.NA qa-tim 2 ANSE u u-nu-su-nu <big_gap> tum <big_gap> <gap> da-ti-su-nu <big_gap>
tgt: To Aššur-rēʾī, Pūšu-kēn, Ennam-Aššur, Kurub-Ištar, and Aššur-mālik from Šū-Ḫubur: 51 kutānum-textiles, 1 šurum-textile ... 10 minas hand-tin, 2 donkeys and their gear ...

src: KISIB SIG5-pi-a-sur DUMU i-ku-pi-a KISIB a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5 DUMU PUZUR4-a-sur KISIB qa-ta-tim DUMU a-zu-za-a 3 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er qa-ta-tim DUMU a-zu-za-a DAM.GAR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-hu-wa-qar ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um i-li-a-lim a-na 8 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 0.25 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab KU.BABBAR i-na si-im-tim i-ri-ih
tgt: Seals of Damiq-pī-Aššur s. Ikuppiya, Aššur-mutabbil s. Puzur-Aššur, Qātātum s. Azuza Qātātum s. Azuza owe the merchant 3 shekels refined silver. He will pay eight weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aḫu-waqar, month Ḫubur, eponymate Ili-ālim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1/4 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma e-a-sar-ma a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta a di-na-an li-ba-ka la im-ru-su ba-ab-ti ma-la te-mi-sa lu ep-sa-at wa-wa-li a-na ba-ab-ti-a e-zi-ib-ma u a-na-ku ka-ki a-la-qe-a-ma a-ta-bi-a-ma a-ta-la-kam a-di-i te-er-ti PUZUR4-a-sur u dan-a-sur a-di u4-mi-im a-nim as-hu-ur
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Ea-šar: Wawali left (it) to my goods and I myself with take up my weapon and set out and come. On account of the shipments of Puzur-Aššur and Dān-Aššur I have been delayed until this day.

src: um-ma ka-ru-um wa-ah-su-sa-na-ma a-na sa-qi-il5 da-tim u be-ru-tim sa sa-la-tu-ar qi-bi-ma a-na-kam 15 ma-na URUDU ma-si-am sa URUDU i-su u 1 GIN KU.BABBAR sa pi-ri-ka-ni-su a-sur-<big_gap> i-di-ni-a-ti a-ma-kam su-ma DIRI mi-ma us-te-ba-al sa-di-a-su-ma ku-un-ka-ma se-bi4-la-nim
tgt: From the colony at Waḫšušana to the dātum payers and the collegium at Šalatuwar. Here, Aššur-... gave us 15 minas washed copper of its copper and 1 shekel silver for/per pirikannu.

src: KISIB {d}IM-ba-ni DUMU i-sar-be-li KISIB pi-la-ah-su-in DUMU a-sur-e-na si-bu-u {d}a-sur-ma-lik DUMU a-mur-a-sur a-na ZU-be-li DUMU bu-lu-ut-be-li is-ba-at-ni-a-ti-ma um-ma a-sur-ma-li-ma a-na ZU-be-li-ma a-na ITU.1.KAM 30 u4-me-e a-wi-lam pu-li tu-ta-ra-am a-na ITU.1.KAM 30 u4-me-e a-wi-lam pu-li la tu-ta-e-ra-am-ma a-na 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR u si-a-ma-ti-su sa is-tu MU.5.SE a pa-ni-a-ti u ur-ki-a-tim ta-za-za-am um-ma ZU-be-li-ma a-na a-sur-ma-lik-ma a-wi-lam pu-li a-na ITU.1.KAM 30 u4-me u-ta-ra-ku-um a-na ITU.1.KAM 30 u4-me-e a-wi-lam la u-ta-e-ra-ku-ma a-na 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR u si-a-ma-ti-su sa is-tu MU.5.SE a pa-ni-a-tim u ur-ki-a-tim a-za-za-ku-um ITU.1.KAM ab-sa-ra-nu li-mu-um ha-ti-u a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim a-li-ku sa ha-ra-an a-lim{ki} u ka-ru-um su-pi-lu-li-a i-di-nu-ni-a-ti-ma KA DINGIR-li IGI su-ga-ri-a-e sa a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in
tgt: Witnesses: Adad-bāni s. Išar-bēlī, Pilaḫ-Suen s. Aššur-enna, Aššur-mālik s. Amur-Aššur.. He seized us against Suen-bēlī s. Buluṭ-bēlī. Aššur-mali said to Suen-bēlī: "For one month, 30 days Buli did not return the man??? Month: Ab-šarrānē. Eponymate: Ḫadiu. For these matters, the travelers of the city track and the colony at Šupilulia gave us (permission) and in the gate of the gods we gave our testimonies before the weapon of Aššur.

src: KISIB be-ga-a DUMU ISTAR-pa-li-il5 KISIB a-ni-na DUMU a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim KISIB a-la-hi-im DUMU sal-ma-a-sur KISIB a-hi-a DUMU la-li-im 45 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-hi-a DUMU la-li-im li-pi-it-ISTAR a-hi-su i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa en-um-a-sur u sa-lim-a-hi-im a-na 50 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM si-ip-um li-mu-um a-sur-i-mi-ti ma-la-hu-um a-na-num i-na KU.BABBAR a-la-num i-na lu-qu-tim qa-ti sa-ak-na-at IGI i-ku-pi-a DUMU ili5-ma-sar IGI a-sur-ni-su DUMU a-mur-ISTAR IGI su-be-lim DUMU PUZUR4-{d}IM
tgt: Aḫīya s. Lālim owes Lipit-Ištar his brother 45 minas refined silver. He will pay 50 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Ennum-Aššur and Šalim-aḫim. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Month: ṣipʾum Eponymate: Aššur-imittī malāḫum After he will place that silver from the merchandise in custody of Annanum.

src: 11.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-lim-a-hu-um 11.33333 ma-na 5 GIN su-hu-bur 44.5 ma-na pu-su-ke-en6 i-na tup-pi-im GAL E ka-ri-im la-ap-tu
tgt: '11 minas 25 shekels silver - Šalim-aḫum', '11 minas 25 shekels - Šū-Ḫubur', (and) '44 1/2 minas - Pūšu-kēn' are written in the large tablet of the colony office.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na PUZUR4.ISTAR u as-qu-dim qi-bi4-ma 1 GU 5 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ki sa as-qu-dum na-as-u a-na-ma ti-me-el-ki-a ta-ka-sa-da-ni um-ma a-tu-nu-ma a-na su-ISTAR DUMU a-zu-da qi-bi4-a-ma te-er-ti a-sur-i-di AN.NA 1 GU li-qe-ma gi-mi-lam i-na se-ri-su su-ku-un tup-pu-su ha-ar-ma-am sa hu-bu-li-su lu-up-ta a-na 25 ha-am-sa-tim su-ma la i-ma-ga-ar-ku-nu a-na 30 lu 35 ha-am-sa-tim lu-up-ta tup-pu-su hi-ir-ma-ma a-na a-sur-na-da pi-iq-da u TUG.HI.A ma-la ta-le-e-a-ni ad-ma-ta-ni si-ti TUG.HI.A a-na se-er a-sur-na-da bi4-il5 su-ma a-hu-a-a a-tu-nu hi-da-ma gi-mi-lam i-se-ri-a su-uk-na a-na as-qu-dim qi-bi4-ma su-ma PUZUR4.ISTAR a-ta-ma te-bi-ir si-bi4 3 su-ku-su-um
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Puzur-Ištar and Asqūdum: As to the 1 talent 5 minas of tin under seal which Asqūdum is bringing, as soon as you reach Timelkia you must say as follows to Šū-Ištar, the son of Azuda: "Aššur-idī's orders were that you should take at least 1 talent of tin to do him a favour." Draw up a certified tablet concerning his debt to run for 25 weeks. If he does not agree with you, then draw it up for 30 or 35 weeks. Certify his tablet and entrust it to Aššur-nādā. Also, make him take as many textiles as an investment as you can. Bring the rest of the textiles to Aššur-nādā. If you are truly my brothers, take care and do me this favour. To Asqūdum: If Puzur-Ištar <is absent>, then hand it over personally to him. Set 3 witnesses for him.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma a-su-mi sa {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni a-na 29 ma-na KU.BABBAR-pi-su 8 ma-na KU a si-ip-ka-tim sa DUMU a-la-hi-im as-qul 12.5 ma-na a-na um-mi-su a-ha-ti-su u sa ki-ma su-a-ti 17 ma-na a-na sa ki-ma ku-a-ti sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni-ni as-qu-ul 1 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA 2 TUG.HI ANSE sa-la-mi-im dan-a-sur i-ra-de8-su-um 5.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR ni-is-qu-ul <big_gap> 0.5 ma-na a te-su-pe sa KU.BABBAR-pi-su a sa be-u-la-tim e-ri-i-ka se-zi-ib-su-ma si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-a li-is-qu-la-kum AN.NA-ki u TUG.HI-a sa ta-qi-pu-su i-nu-mi-su-ma KU.BABBAR is-qu-ul a-ma lu gi5-mi-li a-sar KU.BABBAR-ap-su a-ta-di-nu sa-ti-sa su-ta-al-mu-na-ku ma-nu-um sa a-na-kam a-na si-ib-tim i-ta-di-nu-ma KU.BABBAR ni-il5-qe-u u ri-ih-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-su tup-pu-um is-te-en6 u se-na sa DAM.GAR-ri i-ba-si qa-tum su-ri es-la-at
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: Concerning the matter of Ilabrat-bāni, as for the 29 minas of his silver, I weighed out 8 minas silver for a pouring of the son of Al-āḫum. I gave 12 1/2 minas to his mother, his sister, and his representatives (and) 17 minas to your representatives about which you wrote. Dān-Aššur will drive to him 1 talent 10 minas tin, 2 textiles, (and) a black donkey. We paid 5 minas 25 shekels silver (for that merchandise). (And paid) 1/2 mina for 'additional expenses' of his silver. He requested silver from you for management. Reject him and so that he pays you the remainder of my silver! As for my tin and my textiles which you entrusted to him, When it is him(?) he paid the silver. Now, let it be a favor to me! Every year I have given him silver, I am embroiled in arguments. Who amoung us here (in Aššur) have sold him tin on interest and got (our) silver? Now, as for the rest of his silver, there is a tablet or two of a merchant. The hand is indeed quite slack.

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur KISIB li-ba-a-a KISIB sa-lim-a-sur sa 8.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er li-ba-a-a a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa en-na-nim u sa-lim-a-sur 1.25 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sax-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul li-ba-a-a
tgt: Libbaya owes Aššur-rēʾī 8 1/2 minas refined silver. He will add 1 1/4 shekels per mina per month (as interest) from the ḫamuštum of Ennanim and Šalim-Aššur.

src: 15 GIN KU.BABBAR sa i-di-su-en6 a-na nu-a-em ha-bu-lu-ma mu-sa a-ha-su qa-ta-tu-ni ki-ma 15 GIN KU.BABBAR qa-qi-ri-su-nu sa ur-ki be-tim a-na nu-a-e-em u mu-sa i-di-in su-ma ma-ma-an a-na qa-qi-ri a-na nu-a-e u mu-sa i-tu-ar i-di-su-en6 u-sa-ha-su-nu IGI en-um-a-sur DUMU sal-ma-{d}ISKUR IGI a-di-a DUMU a-mur-DINGIR
tgt: As for the 15 shekels silver which Idī-Suen owes to the Anatolians and which Muza in his(?) guarantor, he gave the territories of the followers of the household(?) to Muza and the Anatolians for the 15 shekels silver. If anyone approaches the Anatolians or Muza concerning the territories, Idī-Suen with clear them. Witnesses: Ennum-Aššur s. Šalim-Adad, Adīya s. Amur-Ilī.

src: <gap> 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-la-ma-si e-la-ma i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa e-la-ma u zu-pa a-na <gap> 4 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM be-el-ti-ka-li-im li-mu-um sa qa-ti su-hu-bu-ur IGI <big_gap>-pi-la-ah IGI <big_gap>-zi
tgt: Aššur-lamassī owes 2 minas refined silver to Elamma. He will pay 4 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Elamma and Zupa. If he does not pay at the fulfillment of his term, he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Month: Bēlet-ekallim. Eponymate: year after the year Šū-Ḫubur. Witnesses: -pì-lá-aḫ, -zi

src: 15 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa i-ku-num a-na a-mur-{d}UTU i-hi-ib-lu-ma pu-su-ke-en6 qa-ta-tu-ni tup-pu-um sa ku-nu-uk pu-su-ke-en6 u i-ku-nim E im-di-lim i-na ta-ah-si-sa-tim u nu-du-a-tim sa im-di-lim i-ba-si i-na qa-ti PUZUR4-<gap> <big_gap> me-er-i-su sa-ak-li-a DUMU su-ISTAR DUMU na-ap-ra-ka u ma-nu-um-ki-a-sur DUMU su-be-lim e-mu-ru is-ni-u-ma il5-ba-ni su-en6-SIPA u a-sur-ni-su me-er-u a-mur-ISTAR DUMU a-mur-DINGIR e-mu-ru-ma i nu-du-a-tim ta-ah-si-sa-tim is-tu ta-ah-si-sa-tim pa-ti-a-tim tup-pe-e ha-ru-mu-tim sa a-bi4-su is-ta-ka-su
tgt: As for the 15 minas silver by which Ikūnum is in debt to Amur-Šamaš and for which Pūšu-kēn is the guarantor, the tablet with the seals of Pūšu-kēn and Ikūnum is available in the house of Imdī-ilum among the t. and n. of Imdī-ilum. From the (account?) of Puzur-..., Saklia son of Šū-Ištar son of Napraka and Mannum-kī-Ištar son of Šū-Bēlum saw?. They (repeated?) and Il-bāni, Suen-rēʾī, and Aššur-nīšu, the sons of Amur-Ištar son of Amur-ilī, saw and placed it among the n. (and) t. from the open t. (and) sealed tablets of his father.

src: KISIB er-ra-AN.DUL DUMU a-sur-i-di KISIB a-mur-{d}UTU DUMU i-ri-si-im KISIB im-li-ik-i-li-im IR-dim sa i-di-ku-bi4-im 11 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er im-li-ik-i-li-im DAM.GAR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa kur-ub-ISTAR mu-us-ta-qi-tim a-na 4 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 0.33333 GIN 14 SE.TA i ITU.1.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.1.KAM ab-sa-ra-nu li-mu-um en-na-su-en6 DUMU su-a-sur
tgt: Seals of Erra-ṣulūlī s. Aššur-idī, Amur-Šamaš s. Erišim, and Imlik-ilum servant of Idī-Kūbim Imlik-ilum owes the merchant 11 shekels refined silver. He will pay four weeks from the ḫamuštum of Kurub-Ištar muštaqqitim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1/3 shekels 14 grains interest (per mina) per month. Month: ab šarrānē Eponymate: Enna-Suen s. Šū-Aššur

src: 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er pi-la-ah-ISTAR DUMU i-ku-pi-a PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU su-la-ba-an i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-la-hi-im u e-na-ma-nim a-na 15 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal ITU.KAM sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um sa qa-te PUZUR4-{d}MUS su-ma i-na u-me-su ma-al-u-tim KU.BABBAR la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab i-na a-lim{ki} i-na a-la-ki-su si-ma-am sa 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR pi-la-ah-ISTAR a-na PUZUR4-a-sur i-da-an-ma i-na KU.BABBAR qa-su sa-ak-na-at IGI DINGIR-ma-la-ak IGI a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku IGI a-mur-ISTAR
tgt: Pilaḫ-Ištar s. Ikuppiya owes Puzur-Aššur s. Šū-Laban 3 minas refined silver. He will pay 15 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Al-aḫum and Ennam-Anim. Month: ša kēnātum. Eponymate: after Puzur-Niraḫ. If he does not pay the silver at the fulfillment of his term, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month at the colony rate as interest.

src: 1.5 GIN KU.GI pa-sa-lam i-se-er i-sar-a-sur DUMU a-sur-GAL su-mi-a-bi4-a i-su is-tu SAG ITU.1.KAM te-i-na-tim a-na e-ti-su i-sa-qal IGI du-du DUMU ba-zi-a IGI u-su-ur-sa-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti
tgt: Išar-Aššur s. Aššur-rabi owes Šumī-abiya 1 1/2 minas pašallum gold. From the beginning of the month Te'inātum he will pay upon notice. Witnesses: Dudu s. Bazīya, Ušur-ša-Ištar.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na en-nam-a-sur qi-bi4-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma za-ku-a-ku ki-ma dan-a-sur e-ru-ba-ni a-ta-la-kam a-sa-me-ma KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na u 2 ma-na nu-a-u is-ta-du KU.BABBAR da-ma-qam li-im-hu-ur i-na u4-mi-im sa tup-pa-am ta-sa-me-u al-kam-ma e-en a-sur u e-ni-a a-mu-ur ta-ah-si-is-tam a-na a-hi-ka e-zi-ib-ma a-hu-ka la ki-ma qa-qi-di-ka KU.BABBAR ma-la qa-at-ka ka-as-da-at-ni na-an-si-a-ma me-eh-ra-at KU.BABBAR sa nu-a-e a-na-ku a-na-kam la-di-na-ku-ma ha-ra-nam sa ra-mi-ni-ka ka-si-id mi-ma pa-nu-ma la i-ka-bi4-du a-sur u {d}NIN.SUBUR li-tu-la mi-ma li-bi4 la i-la-mi-nu-ma as-hu-ru-nim-ma tu-ta-se-er al-kam-ma e-ni-a a-mu-ur me-er-at um-mi-a-nim i-ga-ra-am tu-mi-id-ma ki-ma a-wi-lim ra-bi4-im a-di u4-mi-im a-nim ta-sa-hu-ur u su-nu pa-ni-a wa-ab-lu-ma u-la i-sa-pu-ru-ni-kum a nu-a-e la ta-as-te-ne-ar a qa-qi-di-ka la ta-sa-hu-ut sa-ru-um li-si-su-nu qa-dum KU.BABBAR-pi-su-nu i sa-ha-at a-hi-ka ba-ab ka-ri-im lu ka-a-na-ti a dan-a-sur qi-bi4-ma KU.BABBAR lu i-a-am lu ku-a-am sa na-ru-qi-ka ma-la qa-at-ka i-ka-su-du a-na en-um-a-sur di-in-ma lu-ub-lam su-ma ni-qi-am ha-bu-ul ni-qi-su u da-ta-am ka-la-ma a-na-ku-ma a-da-su-um a-na na-ab-ri-tim a-ni-sa-am li-ik-su-dam
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Ennam-Aššur: You wrote me. May the silver (problem) turn out well. A daughter of an investor leans against the wall, and you like a bigshot delay until this day! Now, as for them, they are not writing you so as to save me face. Do not worry about the Anatolians. Let the wind carry them off, together with their silver! To Dān-Aššur: Let him arrive here for the accountings.

src: a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma um-ma i-di-ISTAR-ma ki-ma ma-at pu-ru-us-ha-tim lu wa-ah-su-sa-na sa-ah-a-at-ni a si-a-ti a-na wa-ah-su-sa-na la e-ti-iq-ma mi-li-ik URUDU sa i-na wa-ah-su-sa-na na-ad-u la am-li-ik a-na 5 u4-me za-ku-sa a-sa-me-ma a-na wa-ah-su-sa-na e-ti-iq <gap> ma-na URUDU ma-si-am sa a-gu5-a a-sur-UTU-si na-as-a-ku-um KU.BABBAR sa a-la-hi-im su-qul-ma a si-ti KU.BABBAR ku-si-a-tim sa ma-a-ma lu me-nu-ni-a-ni lu mas-ki sa-pa-tim sa-ma-ma ANSE.HI.A ma-li-a-ma ANSE.HI.A ra-qu-tum la i-lu-ku-nim i-hi-id-ma tup-pa-am sa si-bu-ti-su-nu le-qe-ma i pa-ne-e-ma se-bi4-lam
tgt: To Aššur-nādā from Iddin-Ištar: since the land of Burušhaddum as well as Wahšušana is in revolt, for that reason I did not proceed to Wahšušana,and I took no decision about the copper that is stored in Wahšušana. Within 5 days I shall hear definitive news, and shall proceed to Wahšušana. Aššur-šamši is on his way to you with x minas of washed copper under my seal. Pay Alāhum's silver and buy for the rest of the silver kusītu-textiles from Mamma as well as menuni'ānu textiles and woolly fleeces, fill up the donkeys so empty donkeys will not come here. Take care to get a tablet with their testimony as witnesses and send it to me as soon as possible.

src: um-ma il5-ba-ni-ma a-na su-en6-na-da qi-bi-ma a-na-kam 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na i-na-a ha-bu-la-ku a-ma-kam i-na URUDU sa i-di-ISTAR sa a-na e-na-ma-a-sur DUMU a-ni-ni-im ha-bu-lu sa 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR li-qe-ma a-na i-na-a se-bi-lam u-la 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR se-bi-la-su-um a-pu-tum lu KU.BABBAR lu URUDU i-hi-id-ma se-bi-la-su-um a-ma-kam e la tu-se-bi4-la-su-ma lu-mu-un li-bi-im e tu-sa-ar-si-a-ni KU.BABBAR a-num sa tu-se-ba-la-ni i-na hu-bu-ul i-di-ISTAR sa a-na e-na-ma-a-sur ha-bu-lu li-is-he-er
tgt: From Ilī-bāni to Suen-nādā:

src: KISIB DU10-si-la-a-sur DUMU da-ki-i-<gap> <big_gap> KISIB <gap> DUMU a-gi5-a-a GAL-a KISIB sa-te-a me-er-at su-e-ta-ta 12 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er sa-te-a pu-su-ke-en6 i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim <gap>-<gap> sa a-sur-tak-la-ku a-na 5 ha-am-sa-tim ta-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam tu-sa-ab
tgt: Seals: Ṭāb-šill-Aššur s. Daki..., PN s. Agiaya, Šāt-Ea d. Suetata. Šāt-Ea owes Pūšu-kēn 12 shekels silver. She will pay 5 ḫamuštum-weeks from the ḫamuštum-week of Aššur-taklāku. If (she) does not pay, she will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month interest.

src: <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> <gap> sal-ma-a-sur u <big_gap> a-na 6 ITU.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um a-gu5-tu-um
tgt: If he does not pay (on time), he will add the colony rate as interest. Month: ša kēnātim Eponymate: Akūtum

src: 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ha-nu-nu DUMU en-um-a-sur li-qe-ep DUMU PUZUR.ISTAR i-su ITU.KAM ab sa-ra-ni li-mu-um su-ra-ma 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na 1 sa-na-at i-sa-qal 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na 2 sa-na-at i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-u ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im i-na ITU.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-im 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI su-is-ha-ra DUMU ku-ra-ra IGI id-na-a DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti
tgt: Ḫanunu s. Ennum-Aššur owes Lāqep s. Puzur-Ištar 0.5 mina refined silver. He will pay 1/3 mina refined silver one year from the month of Ab šarrānē, eponymate Šū-rama.

src: 0.33333 ma-na <gap> GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er <gap>-<big_gap> a-sur-e-mu-qi i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ka-si-im sa qa-ti a-sur-ma-lik u i-na-a ITU.1.KAM be-el-ti-E.GAL li-mu-um sa qa-ti ku-bi4-a a-na ITU.1.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a ma-na-im i-na ITU.1.KAM-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI su-ISTAR DUMU IGI i <big_gap> DUMU <gap>-<big_gap>
tgt: ... owes Aššur-emūqī 1/3 mina shekels refined silver. He will pay per month from the ḫamuštum ša qāti Aššur-mālik and Innāya, month bēlet-ekallim, the year after Kūbīya. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month.

src: KISIB da-a-a DUMU pi-la-ah-su-en6 KISIB a-bu-sa-lim DUMU e-di-na-a KISIB zi-ki DUMU a-sur-SIPA 7 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er zi-ki DUMU a-sur-SIPA su-mi-a-bi4-a i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa e-la-li u a-sur-is-ta-ki-il5 0.33333 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tim li-mu-um PUZUR4-ni-ra-ah KU.BABBAR-pi a-li zi-ki e-mu-ru a-la-qe
tgt: Seals of Dāyā s. Pilaḫ-Suen, Abu-šalim s. Idinnāya, Zigi s. Aššur-rēʾī. Zigi s. Aššur-rēʾī owes Šumī-abiya 7 shekels refined silver. He will add 1/3 shekel silver interest per month from the ḫamuštum Elāli and Aššuriš-takil Month: Qarrātim Year: Puzur-Niraḫ Wherever I encounter Zigi, I will take my silver.

src: i-na 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa be-u-la-at {d}UTU-tap-pa-i u DINGIR-ma-lik kur-ub-ISTAR i-di-nu 0.66666 ma-na 2.5 GIN KU.BABBAR be-u-la-at DINGIR-ma-lik a-na sa ki-ma kur-ub-ISTAR a-na a-sur-na-da u a-sur-{d}UTU-si {d}en-LIL-ba-ni i-sa-qal-ma i-la-ak-ma i-na a-lim{ki} tup-pa-am <big_gap> kur-ub-ISTAR sa ki-ma {d}en-LIL-ba-ni u-ka-la-am su-ma tup-pa-am <big_gap> la u-ka-li-im a-na 0.33333 ma-na 2.5 GIN KU.BABBAR ma-na-um 0.5 ma-na a-na {d}en-LIL-ba-ni <big_gap> a-sur-na-da DUMU a-sur-i-di u a-sur-{d}UTU-si DUMU a-ma-a i-sa-qu-lu a-na 0.33333 ma-na 2.5 GIN KU.BABBAR {d}UTU-ta-pa-i kur-ub-ISTAR i-se-e su-ma {d}UTU-tap-pa-i u DINGIR-ma-lik a-na si-be la im-hu-ra-ni a-na si-bi-su e-ta-wu na-ab-su-en qa-ta-tu-um u ku-bi4-is-<gap> a-pu-lu da-a-nu
tgt: Out of the 2/3 mina 5 shekels of silver of the working capital of Šamaš-tappā'ī and Ilum-malik, which Kurub-Ištar has given, 1/3 mina 2 1/2 shekels of silver, the working capital of Ilum-malik, Illil-bāni must pay to the representatives of Kurub-Ištar, to Aššur-nādā and Aššur-šamšī; he will then depart, and in the City Kurub-Ištar will show the (original) deed to Illil-bāni's representatives. If he does not show the tablet, then Aššur-nāda son of Aššur-idī and Aššur-šamšī son of Amaya must pay 50 percent (penal interest) on the 1/3 mina 2 1/2 shekels of silver to Illil-bāni. Kurub-Ištar must sue Šamaš-tappā'ī. If Šamaš-tappā'ī and Illum-malik, have sold (their working capitals) then they must discuss with his witnesses. Nannia, Katatum (and) Uṣup-iškum, (these) men are the judges.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma hu-sa-ru-um-ma su-ma a-bi a-ta ki-ma te-er-ti u-se-ri-ba-ku-ni 3 GIN i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-a di-su-ma 5 u4-me-e la i-sa-hu-ur is-ti ba-ti-qi-im tu-ur-da-su TUG.HI.A u AN.NA ba-ti-iq u wa-tu-ur di-in-ma i-na pa-ni-im-ma KU.BABBAR se-bi-lam a-bi4 a-ta a-la-nu-ka a-ba-am sa-ni-a-am u-la i-su
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Ḫusārum: If you are my father, when he brings my letter to you, give him 3 shekels from my silver and do not delay him 5 days. Dispatch him with the express caravan. Sell the textiles and tin, cheap or dear, and send me the silver in the first caravan. My dear father, besides you I have no other father!

src: 15 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er DINGIR-mu-ta-bi-il5 pu-su-ke-en6 i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ka-si-im sa qa-ti {d}UTU-ba-ni u la-qe-ep a-na 50 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab ITU.1.KAM a-la-na-tim li-mu-um a-al-DUG IGI {d}ISKUR.GAL IGI u-su-ur-sa-ISTAR IGI i-ku-pi-a
tgt: Ilī-mutabbil owes Pūšu-kēn 15 minas refined silver. He will pay 50 ḫamuštum-weeks from the kaššum-week after the ḫamustum-week of Šamaš-bāni and Lā-qēpum. If he does not pay at the fulfillment of the term, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Month: Allanātum; Year of Āl-ṭāb (REL 83). Witnesses; Adad-rabi, Ušur-ša-Ištar, Ikuppiya

src: 1 ne-pi-sum 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI a-na um-me-a-ni-a 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI sa sa-al-<gap> a-na sa ki-ma i-a-ti 1 ne-pi-sum 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI KU.BABBAR sa DAM.GAR a-na sa-lim-a-hi-im 1 ne-pi-sum 11.83333 ma-na 0.16666 GIN KU.BABBAR sa su-hu-bur 1 ne-pi-sum 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni a-na sa-lim-a-hi-im 1.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI u 6.16666 GIN KU.GI ni-is-ha-su DIRI a-na la-ma-si mi-ma a-nim a-na u-ra-ni ap-qi-id sa-du-a-su sa-bu 10 GIN KU.BABBAR a qa-ti-su a-di-in 5 GIN a pa-su-ri 2 GIN a-ha-ma a-di-sum 0.33333 ma-na SIG.HI.A a-di-su-nu-ti IGI PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU a-sur-ma-lik IGI su-su-en6 DUMU su-hu-bur
tgt: 1 sack: 20 minas silver, its excise added for my investors, 10 minas silver, it's excise paid for (purchases???) to my representatives.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 10 ma-na AN.NA-ak qa-tim KU.BABBAR-ap-su 10 ma-na 4.66666 GIN 10 TUG.HI.A 0.5 ma-na 3.33333 it-bu-lu 17 GIN lu si-im ANSE lu u-ku-ul-tu-su u 2 GIN te-su-bi4 a-na e-la as-qul 2 GIN u-nu-ut ANSE 5 GIN wa-si-tum 1 TUG ka-ab-tum a-ha-ma i li-wi-tim sa a-zi-a mi-ma a-ni-im ku-nu-ki-a e-la i-ra-di-a-kum
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: 2 talents 10 minas tin under seal, 10 minas hand-tin, its value 10 minas 4 2/3 shekels, 10 textiles, for 33 1/3 shekels, 17 shekels for the price of the donkey, its gear, and 2 shekels for extras I paid to Ela. 2 shekels for the gear of the donkey, 5 shekels for the exit tax, 1 heavy textiles separately in the wrappings of Aziya--all this Ela brings to you under my seal.

src: 15 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er a-gu5-tim i-di-is8-tar i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-bu-um-DINGIR a-na sa ni-ba-as i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 10 GIN-tum 1 GIN.TA i-na ITU i-sa-qal IGI ma-la-ba IGI en-na-su IGI tu-ra-am-i-li
tgt: Akūtum owes Idī-Ištar 15 shekels silver. From the ḫamuštum of Abum-ilī he has ni-ba-as to pay. If he does not pay 10 shekels per shekel a month. Witnesses: Malaba, Enna-Suen, Tūram-ilī

src: a-na a-ha-tim qi-bi4-ma um-ma PUZUR4.DINGIR-ma a-di KU.BABBAR sa ma-nu-um-ki-a-sur um-mi a-ti be-el-ti a-ti a-na sa-la-tu-wa-ar u-la u-su-ru a-wa-tum da-na KU.BABBAR su-qu-li-ma a-wi-lam5 lam-na-am i-se-ri-a ta-hi a-di ITU.KAM is-te-en6 a-wa-tum i-za-ku-a-ni i-nu-mi sa a-la-ka-ni KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su sa ha-sa-ab-si-li-im la ta-ga-mi-li-ni i-se-ri-a li-qe si-im pi-ri-ka-ni a-na-kam ba-at-qu ma-hi-ir ka-ni-is la ma-si a-na u4-um e-ta-ri-im a-su-mi LU ta-ap-qi-da la ta-ap-qi-da uz-ni pi-te te-er-ti-ki a-ni-tum la a-ni-tum li-li-kam
tgt: To Aḫatum from Puzur-ilī: The situation is drastic. Within one month, he will (be forced to) clear the matter with me. When I come, will you not do me a favor regarding Ḫaṣabšilum's silver and interest? Take it on yourself. Here, the price of Let your report come as to whether this is the case or not.

src: a-na sa-lim-a-sur u pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma su-ku-bu-um-ma si-ip-ka-at su-a-nim ni-a-im sa a-na sal-ma-a-sur sa-ap-ku is-ti li-mu-um as-a-am a-na sa-lim-a-sur qi-bi-ma su-ma-mi-in la sa E a-bi-ni qa-ti-mi-in u-la u-bi-il5 a-hi a-ta a-na-ku u-la sa a-wa-tim ga-ma-al-ka a-le-e
tgt: To Šalim-Aššur and Pūšu-kēn from Šū-Kūbum: I purchased a share of our Šū-Anum which divided to Šalim-Aššur from the To Šalim-Aššur, Had it not belonged to out father's estate, he would not have carried a share. My dear brother, as for me, I can do you a favor for anything else.

src: 1 ne-pi-sum 10.66666 ma-na 9.16666 GIN KU.BABBAR sa a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU e-na-nim 1 ri-ik-sum 1 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im be-tim a-na sa ki-ma i-a-ti mi-ma a-nim a-na a-sur-na-da DUMU su-ti-a u ba-al-tu-sar ap-qi-id IGI i-na-a DUMU e-la-li IGI su-ISTAR DUMU lu-zi-na IGI ir-ma-a-sur 1 ne-pi-sum 6 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU en-na-nim 1 ne-pi-sum 12 ma-na 18.83333 GIN KU.BABBAR sa sa-lim-a-hi-im 1 ne-pi-sum 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa me-er-e la-qe-ep a-na a-sur-i-mi-ti mi-ma a-nim a-na su-li DUMU da-dim ap-qi-id IGI li-pa-a DUMU u-zu-a IGI ku-la a-hu su-ki-tim IGI bu-zu-a DUMU a-sur-DU10 1 ne-pi-sum 6.66666 ma-na 7 GIN KU.BABBAR sa a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU e-na-nim 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa i-li-a-lim DUMU il5-pi-u-su-ur is-ti tu-ra-a al-qe-su-um <gap> GIN KU.BABBAR sa TUG-ba-ti-su sa su-ma-nim 2 GIN sa ni-qi-su sa DUMU bu-zu-ta-a mi-ma a-nim a-na u-su-sa-a-sur ap-qi-id IGI dan-a-sur IGI ir-ma-a-sur 0.33333 ma-na 3 GIN KU.BABBAR sa gam-ri-su sa tu-uk-la-nim sa su-hu-bu-ur is-qu-lu ku-nu-ki-a ir-ma-a-sur na-si IGI u-su-ur-sa-a-sur IGI dan-a-sur 1 ne-pi-sum 6.66666 ma-na 8.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR sa a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU en-na-nim 5 GIN a sa-lim-ma mi-ma a-nim a-na kur-ub-ISTAR ap-qi-id IGI su-be-lim DUMU a-mur-DINGIR IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU i-ku-pi-ISTAR su-uq-lam sa a-sur-i-mi-ti nu-sa-ni-iq-ma 1 GU i-li-a-lim il5-qe 2 ma-na u-tu-ra-e a-na-ku al-qe IGI kur-ub-ISTAR IGI na-ab-su-en6 DUMU PUZUR.ISTAR IGI e-nu-be-lum DUMU su-la-ba-an 1 GU 2.33333 ma-na 5 GIN AN.NA u 2 {TUG}ku-ta-ni sa a-sur-i-mi-ti a-na a-sur-{d}UTU-si DUMU la-qe-ep a-di-in IGI i-ku-nim DUMU sa-ma-a IGI dan-a-sur DUMU sal-mi-hi-im
tgt: 1 sack, 10 minas 49 1/6 shekels silver Aššur-imittī s. Ennānum, 1 bundle of 1 mina 5 shekels silver, the price of the house for my representative, I entrusted all this to Aššur-nādā s. Sutiya and Balṭušar. Witnesses: Innāya s. Elāli, Šū-Ištar s. Luzina, Irma-Aššur. 1 sack, 6 minas 5 shekels silver beloning to Aššur-imittī s. Ennānum, 1 sack of 12 minas 18 5/6 shekels belonging to Šalim-aḫum, 1 sack 10 minas silver beloning to the sons of Lā-qēpum for Aššur-imittī, I entrusted all this to Šuli-s. Dādum. Witnesses: Libbaya s. Uzuwa, Kula brother of Šukkutum, Buzuwa s. Aššur-ṭāb. 1 sack of 6 47 shekels silver belonging to Aššur-imittī s. Ennānum, 1/2 mina silver belonging to Ilī-ālum s. Ilpi-uṣur, I took from Tūrāya for him. x shekels silver from his textiles from Sumānum, 2 shekels of his 'offerings' of the son of Buzutaya, I entrusted all this to Uṣur-ša-Aššur. Witnesses: Dān-Aššur, Irma-Aššur. 23 shekels silver of its totality of Tuklanum which Šū-Ḫubur paid, Irma-Aššur brings to you. Witnesses: Uṣur-ša-Aššur, Dān-Aššur. 1 sack, 6 minas 48 1/3 shekels silver beloning to Aššur-imittī s. Ennānum, I ... 5 shekels and I entrusted all this to Kurub-Ištar. Witnesses: Šū-Bēlum s. Amur-ilī, Aššur-imittī s. Ikuppī-Ištar. I checked the package of Aššur-imittī and Ilī-ālum took 1 talent. I took the 2 minas surplus. Witnesses: Kurub-Ištar, Nāb-Suen s. Puzur-Ištar, Ennum-Bēlum s. Šū-Laban. I gave 1 talent 2 minas 25 shekels tin and 2 textiles belonging to Aššur-imittī to Aššur-šamšī s. Lā-qēpum. Witnesses: Ikūnum s. Samaya, Dān-Aššur s. Šalim-aḫum

src: KISIB a-mur-ISTAR KISIB a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU a-ta-a-a KISIB du-da sa 3.6666600000000003 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er du-da a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa en-um-a-sur DUMU a-hu-u-a ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tim li-mu-um su-da-a DUMU en-na-nim 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul du-da
tgt: He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest from the ḫamuštum of Ennum-Aššur s. Aḫua, month: Qarrātum, eponymate:Šudaya s. Ennānum.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma ku-zal-lim-ma 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na en-na-su-en6 DUMU su-ISTAR ha-bu-la-ku-ma 15 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na a-lim{ki} qa-su u-sa-as-ke-en6 ma-la 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR-pi-su URUDU a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum is-tu ITU.20.KAM a-bu-uk i-na wa-sa-a KU.BABBAR KU.BABBAR-ap-su u-se-ba-lam a-ma-kam sa-il5-ma su-ma is-ti ILLAT-tim GAL-a-sur ra-di-e lu-qu-ti-a i-la-ak a-na-kam 2 me-at 13 ku-ta-ni ka-ru-um a-na E.GAL-lim ha-bu-ul-ma u4-ma-am e-ta-ar-su-ni-a-ti 26 TUG hi-na-a u i-a-ti <gap> i-ka-sa-ad a-ma-kam 26 ku-ta-ni qa-tam i-na sa hi-na-a se-bi4-lam u-la i-na i-a-u-tim se-bi4-lam su-ma lu-qu-ti sa ki-ma i-na-su-en6 i-ka-lu-u a-na KU.BABBAR a-pu-ul-su-nu
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Kuzallim: Say to P I owe 20 minas of silver to Enna-Suen son of Šū-Ištar and I set his share at 15 minas of silver to the city. I owe 20 minas of silver to Enna-Suen son of Šū-Ištar I set his share at 15 minas of silver to the city I dispatched copper worth 20 minas of silver two months ago to Purushattum. At the departure of the silver, I will send his/corresponding silver. Inquire there if Rab-Aššur will go with the caravan as the transporter of my goods. Here the colony owes 213 textiles to the palace and they (the colony) ask it daily of us. 26 textiles will fall to Hinnaya and myself. There, send the 26 textiles for the share from Hinnaya's fund. Do not send from my own share. (But) do send (the textiles). If Enna-Suen's representatives retain my goods, pay them back for the silver.

src: 15 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er e-ta-li-im sal-ma-a-sur i-su a-na 6 ITU.KAM-ma KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um a-<gap>-<gap>-<big_gap> IGI ISTAR-pi-la-ah IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti
tgt: Etallum owes Šalma-Aššur 10 1/2 shekels refined silver. He will pay the silver in six months. If he does not pay (on time), he will add interest at the colony rate. Month: ša kēnatim. Eponymate: a-...- Witnesses: Ištar-pilaḫ, Aššur-imittī.

src: um-ma PUZUR4.ISTAR-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u i-ku-pi-a-sur qi-bi4-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma a-hi a-ta a-na u4-mu-u e-ta-ru-im i-na sa-ha-at <gap> i-ku-pi-a-sur i-zi-iz-ma lu sa na-ru-uq zu-pa lu sal-ta-tu-a sa li-bi4 zu-pa tup-pi-i i-ku-pi-a-sur lu-la-mi-id-ka-ma ma-la la ta-ba-li-ka gu-mu-ur-si-na lu sa tam-ka-ru-a <gap> a-li KU.BABBAR 1 GIN ha-bu-lu-ni-ni su-ha-ru-um lu-la-mi-id-ka-ma a-li KU.BABBAR 1 GIN qa-ra-bi4-im u-za-an su-ha-ri-im pi-te su-ma a-wa-at zu-pa ta-ag-ta-am-ra sa-ru-u-um i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-a sa-im i-na a-wa-ti-ku-nu a-di KU.BABBAR us-ta-bu-ni sa-ru-u-um qa-ti lu-bi-il5 me-eh-ri <gap>-<gap> a-ma-kam lu sa a-lim{ki} i-na IGI pu-su-ke-en6 iz-ku-ma la-mi-su
tgt: From Puzur-Ištar to Pūšu-kēn and Ikūn-pī-Aššur; To Pūšu-kēn; My dear brother, assist Ikūn-pī-Aššur to ... terms so that he can instruct you about the joint-stock fund of Zupa, the funds which are with Zupa tablets of Ikūn-pī-Aššur so that you wrap up whatever (she) has not shipped? to you. Let the youth instruct you about the property of my merchants wherever they owe you a single shekels of silver, and inform the youth wherever a single shekel of silver draws near(?). If you two have completed the matter of Zupa, the wind from my purchases of silver from your (pl.) word until they pay the silver in full, let the wind carry my hand/funds. Let me clear my proceeds there and those in the city in the presence of Pūšu-kēn (something is wrong here) so that I may inform him.

src: KISIB en-na-nim DUMU a-la-bi4-im KISIB ku-ra DUMU su-su-en6 KISIB sa-lim-a-sur DUMU ip-hu-ri-im sa 2 ma-na LA 3 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er sa-lim-a-sur a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa pu-su-ke-en u zu-ba a-na 8 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul sa-lim-a-sur
tgt: Seals: Ennanim s. Al-abim, Kura s. Šū-Suen, Šalim-Aššur s. Ipḫurim. Šalim-Aššur owes Aššur-rēʾī 1 mina 57 shekels refined silver. He will pay 8 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Pūšu-kēn and Zupa. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: a-na a-la-hi-im e-me-ma u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma a-sa-me-ma mi-ma i-na ILLAT-tim la ur-ma-ku KU.BABBAR DUMU a-ni-nim u sa 2 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-he-er-tam a-na LUGAL-{d}ISKUR u-se-bi4-lu ta-ah-si-is-tam am-ra-ma lu a-ni-num mi-ma is-qu-ul lu a-tu-nu tu-se-bi-la sa lu-qu-tum a-na se-ri-su-ni sa-as-qi-la 1 ma-na 7.5 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im mas-ki sa ba-ri a-la-hi-im u i-a-ti KI as-ka-pi-im sa-as-qi-la-su su-ma ANSE.HI.A wa-aq-ru mi-ma a-na tur4-hu-mi-it la tu-se-ra-a u-za-ka-ma a-ta-la-kam am-tam sa-hi-za-ma GIG la-bi4-ra-tim a-na ku-ru-ma-tim li-di-na ba-pi-ra-am mi-ma la tu-sa-ab a-na GU4.HI.A u UDU.HI.A ih-da sa ku-ra-ra u tap-pa-i-su sa qa-at-ni sa-ka-nam qa-bi4-u e-ri-is
tgt: To Alāhum, Ememe and Aššur-taklāku from Aššur-nadā: I hear that I have not been booked for anything in the enterprise. They have sent the silver belonging to Anninum's son plus small goods worth 2 shekels of silver to Šar-Adad. Look at the note, and irrespective of whether Anninum has paid anything or you personally have sent it, make him pay to whom the merchandise was addressed. 1 mina 7 1/2 shekels of silver, the proceeds from the sale of the hides that were owned jointly by Alāhum and myself, is owed by the leatherworker. Make him pay. If donkeys are expensive, do not conduct any to Durhumit. I shall clear myself of obligations and leave. Instruct the maid that they shall grind the old wheat for food, but she must not add any beer bread. Take care with the oxen and sheep. Demand the silver from Kurara and his partner who are obliged to lodge our claim to it.

src: 1 TUG-sa-qum ki-mi-ia
tgt: 1 saqqum-textile (belonging to) Kimīya.

tgt: Usānum s. Amur-Aššur owes the merchant 3 minas refined silver

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na la-qe-pi-im u pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-hu-u-a a-tu-nu AN.NA-ki u TUG.HI.A la i-na-ki-mu a-na u4-me-e qu-ur-bi-tim 9 GIN.TA u e-li-is di-na u sa u4-me-e pa-ti-u-tim ma-la ta-da-nim di-na lu-qu-ti lu sa se-ep DUMU er-ra-a lu sa dan-a-sur ir-de8-a lu sa ILLAT-at DUMU su-{d}EN.LIL AN.NA-ki u TUG.HI.A ma-la iz-ku-u-ni-ni te-er-ta-ak-nu <gap> li-li-kam 5 {TUG}ku-si-tum 1 TUG-ni-ib-ra-ru-um sa se-ep dan-a-sur u si-im ANSE.HI.A ma-la ta-as-a-ma-ni te-er-ta-ak-nu li-li-kam 30.33333 ma-na 7 GIN KU.BABBAR sa u4-me-e sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni 10 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa me-er-e a-sur-UTU-si 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa hi-na-a mi-ma a-nim sa-as-qi-la-ma i-na pa-nim-ma se-bi-la-nim tup-pu-um sa si-ma-at a-sur-i-mi-ti i-na hu-ra-ma is-ti sa-lim-a-sur DUMU en-um-a-sur i-ba-si su-up-ra-ma tup-pa-am lu-ub-lu-ni-ku-nu-ti-ma tup-pa-am i-na qa-nu-e la-wi-a-ma da-am-qi-is a-na DUMU um-mi-a-nim ke-nim pi-iq-da-ma lu-ub-lam a-na wa-bi-il5 tup-pi-im KU.BABBAR 1 GIN i-na KU.BABBAR di-na-su-um <gap> u sa <big_gap>
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Lā-qēpum and Pūšu-kēn: My dear brothers, my tin and textiles should not be stocked up. Sell (the tin) on short terms at a rate of 9 shekels or higher; otherwise, sell as much as can be sold on long terms. Let your report come as to how much of my goods—those from the cargo of Erraya's son (Aššur-mālik), those that Dān-Aššur drove, and those from the caravan of Šū-Enlil's son—(that is) my tin and textiles, cleared (the palace). Let your report come regarding the five kusītum-robes, the 1 nibrarum-textile from the cargo of Dān-Aššur, and the price of the donkeys, as much as you bought. As for the 30 minas 27 shekels of silver on terms about which you wrote me—10 minas 10 shekels of silver of the sons of Aššur-šamšī and 5 minas of silver of Ḫinnaya—have all this paid and send it to me at the first opportunity. A tablet recording the will of Aššur-imittī is with Šalim-Aššur son of Ennum-Aššur in Ḫurrama. Send to him to have the tablet brought to you. Wrap up the tablet in straw, and carefully entrust (it) to a reliable affiliated trader so that he may bring it to me. Give a shekel of silverfrom the silver to the bearer of the tablet.

src: 1.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-ku-bi4-im a-ha-tum ti-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa im-di-lim u a-sur-su-lu-li a-na 3 ITU.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im u-sa-ab IGI lu-lu DUMU a-ra-na-ap-su
tgt: Šū-Kūbim owes 1 1/2 minas refined silver to Aḫātum. From the ḫamuštum of Imdilim and Aššur-ṣulūlī he has 3 months to pay. If he does not pay the word of the colony will be added as interest.

src: 0.83333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR a-mu-ru-um i-se-er en-na-su-en6 a-sur-ni-su i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa am-ri-a u i-ku-nim a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab IGI a-sur-na-da IGI PUZUR4.ISTAR IGI ma-nu-ki-a-sur
tgt: Enna-Suen owes Aššur-nīšu 5/6 mina 5 shekels ammurum silver. He will pay 13 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Amrīya and Ikūnim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest).

src: um-ma a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5-ma a-na ku-na-ni-a qi-bi4-ma tup-pe-e sa na-zi u DINGIR-ba-ni u-bu-lu-ni-ki-ni-ma i-pa-qi-du-ni-ki-ni a-sar ta-ti-ni-li-ni su-uk-ni-su-nu-ma sa-si-ri
tgt: From Aššur-mutabbil to Kunanniya: Wherever you can ..., set the tablets which Nazi and Ili-bāni they brought to you and entrusted to you, and send (them) to me.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 i-na-a u ki-li-a SIG7.A qi-bi-ma um-ma su-ku-bu-um-ma mi-su sa a-na me-tim ta-as-ku-na-ni-ma is-tu MU.2.SE te-er-ta-ku-nu za-ku-tum la i-la-ka-ni i pa-ni-tim ta-as-pu-ra-nim um-ma a-tu-nu-ma KU.BABBAR sa a-pa-ta-na-nim ni-il5-qe-ma ki-ma u4-mu DAM.GAR-ri-ka qur-bu-ni a si-ib-tim ni-di-su um-ma ne-nu-ma is-te-ni-is KU.BABBAR is-ti {d}UTU-tap-pa-i lu nu-se-bi-il5 <gap>-<gap>-<gap> u4-mu DAM.GAR-ri-a a-na war-ki-su-nu i-tu-ru-nim ma KU.BABBAR sa a-pa-ta-na-nim is-ti ki-li-a tu-se-bi-la-nim KU.BABBAR sa DAM.GAR-ri-a la tu-se-bi-la-nim a-sa-me-ma TUG.HI-tu-a sa se-ep DUMU u-za-ri-a a-na i-ta-at-lim ta-ad-nu a-na-kam sa ma-ah-ri-su TUG.HI-ti-a i-di-nu-ni iq-bi-a-am a mi-nim KU.BABBAR la tu-se-bi-la-nim a-hu-u-a a-tu-nu ih-da-ma lu sa ba-ab-ti-a sa u4-me lu sa i-ta-at-lim lu sa ni-ka-si-a is-ti ba-ti-qi-im za-ku-tam su-up-ra-nim as-pu-ra-ku-nu-ti um-ma a-na-ku-ma IR-di-a ki-ma e-ru-bu-ni-ni tur4-da-nim a-tu-nu ma-si-be-li u i-sar-lu-ba-la-at tu-uh-ta-li-qa su-ma a-hu-u-a a-tu-nu {d}UTU-tap-pa-i ma-nu-ki-a-bi-a u a-da-a i pa-nim-ma tur4-da-nim su-ma la su-nu a-na se-im sa-a-mi-im ma-ma-an la i-su su-ma i pa-nim-ma la ta-at-ru-da-nim-su-nu ki-ma KU.BABBAR-pi 1 GU tu-ha-li-qa-ni li-bi i-la-mi-na-ku-nu-ti i-na ni-ka-si-a ma-la i-pu-lu-ni-ni <gap>-<gap> se-bi-la-nim ih-da-ma qa-ti i-ta-di-a ma-la la sa-ha-tim tu-us-ta-am-ri-sa-ni
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn, Innāya, and Kilya the yellow one(?) from Šū-Kūbum: Why is it that you write to me as if I were marked for death and your full report has not come to me for two years? Previously you wrote to me. "We received the silver of Apatanānum and since the terms of your merchants draw close, we will give him for interest. We will say, 'Let us send the silver all at once with Šamaš-tappa'ī.'" The terms of my merchant turned to me already (?). Indeed, you did send me the silver of Appatanānum with Kiliya. (But) you did not send the silver of my merchant! I hear that my textiles from the He told me here that they sold the textiles in his presence. Why did you not send the silver? My dear brothers, take heed to send a detailed message about my assets(?) on credit, in cash, and in my account by express messenger. I wrote to you (pl.). I said, "Dispatch my servants as soon as they arrive." But you (pl.), squandered Maṣi-bēlī and Išar-lu-ballaṭ. If you are truly my brothers, dispatch Šamaš-tappāʾī, Mannu-kī-abiya and Ataya to me immediately. Besides them, there is no one to by grain for me. If you do not dispatch them to me immediately, you will make as angry as if you had lost a talent of silver of mine. Send me as much as they balanced me at accountings. Take care to deposit my share. Will you take pains to make me fear?

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur KISIB LUGAL-{d}IM DUMU pi-za-za sa 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er en-na-nim a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-ku-tim u da-da-nim 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul en-na-nim u a-ha-ma sa-ni-um tup-pu-um ha-ar-mu-um sa 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa be-u-la-at en-na-nim-ma i-ba-si hi-ra-am-su sa-na-qam na-zu-um
tgt: Seals: Puzur-Aššur, Šarrum-Adad s. Pízaza. Ennanim owes Aššur-rēʾī 2 minas refined silver. From the ḫamuštum of Akutum and Dadānim. He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: um-ma a-sur-ba-ni u sa-lim-a-sur a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-na a-wa-tim sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni um-mi-a-ni-ka nu-pa-he-er-ka na-as-pa-ar-ta-ka is-ta-me-u-ma um-ma su-nu-ma lu qa-ra-tam iq-ra lu ir-be u-se-ri-ib lu be-tam is-am ma-num <big_gap><big_gap> ba-ni tup-pe <big_gap> {d}UTU-ta-ak-la-ku na-as-a-kum a-sur-na-da DUMU PUZUR4-a-na u DUMU me-sar-GAL tup-pa-am ka-na-kam la i-mu-u um-ma su-nu-ma u ne-nu ki-ma tap-pa-e-ni-ma ma-ag-ra-ni a-ta a-ma-kam ma-la-ka 5.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa DUMU qa-a-a-tim su-hu-bur ta-da-nam la i-mu-a-ni-a-ti um-ma su-ut-ma a-na a-hi-su a-<gap> <big_gap> a-da-an-su 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa <big_gap> a-hi-ka ni <gap> i KU.BABBAR <gap> <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> a-sur-i-mi-ti <gap> <big_gap>
tgt: From Aššur-bāni and Šalim-Aššur to Pūšu-kēn: Concerning the matter about which you wrote, we gathered your investors for you. They read your letter and said, "Whatever wages he has received, income he has gained, houses he has bought, who ..." ... Šamaš-taklāku brings ... Aššur-nādā son of Puzur-Anna and the son of Mešar-rābi did not want to seal the tablet. They said, "We also (will agree) if our partners are in agreement. (?) Make your own decision there. Šū-Ḫubur did not want to give us the 5 1/2 minas silver of the son of Qayyātum. He said, "To his brother, (I will go and ...) I will give him ... We will (give?) 2/3 mina silver which ... to your brother. From the silver ... Aššur-imittī ...

src: 0.5 ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-na se-er e-ni-sa-ri-im i-tur4-DINGIR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa {d}UTU-ba-ni u a-sur-ma-lik ITU.KAM te-i-na-tim li-mu-um PUZUR4-ni-ra-ah a-na da-as-e i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1 ma-na-um 0.5 ma-na i-na sa-tim u-sa-ab IGI PUZUR4.ISTAR IGI su-su-en
tgt: Enišarim owes Itūr-ilī 1/2 mina 2 shekels refined silver. He will pay one season from the ḫamuštum of Šamaš and Aššur-mālik, month of Teʾinātim, eponymate Puzur-Niraḫ. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1/2 mina per mina per year as interest.

src: KISIB da-da-a DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti KISIB su-hu-bur DUMU i-di-a-bi-im KISIB ku-ku-la-nim DUMU ku-ta-a 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ku-ku-la-nim {d}en-LIL-ba-ni i-su i-na 77 {TUG}pi-ri-ka-ni qa-ti {d}EN.LIL-ba-ni sa-ak-na-at is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-i-mi-ti ITU.KAM sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-li-a-lim a-na 6 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-em i ITU.1.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab pi-ri-ka-nu a-su-mi ku-ku-la-nim a-na wa-ah-su-sa-na GAN-lam e-ti-qu KU.BABBAR si-im-su-nu a ka-ni-is a-su-mi ku-ku-la-nim e-ti-qam KU.BABBAR-ap-su {d}en-LIL-ba-ni i-la-qe-ma su-ma wa-tar ku-ku-la-num i-la-qe-ma su-ma ba-ti-iq ku-ku-la-num-ma i-za-az KISIB ku-ku-la-nim DUMU ku-ta-a KISIB la-qe-pi-im DUMU PUZUR-sa-tu-e KISIB su-{d}EN.LIL DUMU ma-nu-ki-a-sur 1.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-{d}EN.LIL {d}en-LIL-ba-ni i-su ITU.1.KAM sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti e-na-ma-a-sur a-na ITU.4.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-em si-ib-tam u-sa-ab KISIB a-hu-wa-qar DUMU su-ISTAR KISIB DINGIR-na-da DUMU a-sur-na-da KISIB ku-lu-ma-a DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti KISIB bu-za-zu DUMU pu-su-ke-en6 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-se-er 1 ma-na-em 0.5 GIN um-ta-lik-ma KU.BABBAR u-du i-se-er bu-za-zu {d}en-LIL-ba-ni i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa li-ip-ta-nim ITU.KAM qa-ra-tim li-mu-um sa-ma 1 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i ITU.1.KAM a-1 ma-na-em u-sa-ab ku-lu-ma-a qa-ta-tum i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is KISIB qa-ta-tim DUMU i-di-ISTAR KISIB a-sur-GAL DUMU la-qe-pi-im KISIB na-na-a DUMU ha-na-nim KISIB PUZUR-a-sur DUMU a-mur-a-sur 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am be-u-la-at {d}en-LIL-ba-ni PUZUR-a-sur u-ka-al is-ti KU.BABBAR uk-ta-al me-eh-ru-um sa tup-pe-e ha-ru-mu-tim GAN-lam e-ti-qu
tgt: Seals of Dadaya s. Aššur-imittī, Šū-Hubur s. iddin-abum, Kukulāanum s. Kutaya. Kukulānum owes Enlil-bāni 5 minas refined silver. From the 77 pirikannum textiles placed in the account of Enlil-bāni... He will pay 6 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum week of Aššur-imittī, month Ša sarrātim, eponymate after the one of Ilī-ālim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest. As for the pirikannum textiles, those belonging to Kukkulānum will go to Anatolia, to Waḫšušana. The silver from their sale, Enlil-bāni will take ithat silver abroad to Kanesh under the name of Kukulānum and if it exceeds (the 5 mians silver) the Kukulānum will take (the excess), and if it falls short, Kukulānum will stand (for the remainder). Seals of Kukkulānum s. Kutaya, Lā-qēpum s. Puzur-sadūʾē, Šū-Enlil s. Mannum-kī-Aššur. Enlil-bāni owes Enlil-bāni 1 1/2 minas refined silver. Month: Ša Kēnātim. Eponymate: the one after Ennam-Aššur. He will pay in four months. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina (per month) as interest. Seals of Aḫu-waqar s. Šū-Ištar, Ilī-nādā s. Aššur-nādā, Kulumaya s. Aššur-imittī, Buzāzu s. Pūšu-kēn. Buzazu owes Enlil-bāni 1 mina refined silver (In addition to 1 mina 1/2 shekel he fulfilled- he declared. the silver). From the ḫamuštum of liptānum, month Qarrātum, eponymate of Sama, he will add 1 shekel as interest per mina (per month). Kulumaya is the guarantor. (The silver) is bound to whichever one among them is solvent. Seals of Qatātum s. Idī-Ištar, Aššur-rābi s. Lā-qēpum, Nanaya s. Ḫanānum, Puzur-Aššur s. Amur-Aššur. Puzur-Aššur holds 1 mina refined silver, the beʾulātum loan of Enlil-bāni. He is held by the silver. This is a copy of the sealed tablets which have gone abroad.

src: mu-za DUMU.MI is-pu-nu-ma-an a-sa-at su-be-lim a-sar li-bi-su su-be-lum i-ra-de8-si su-ma mu-su-ta-su ta-mu-u u-ul ar-nam u si-la-tam ta-ar-ti-si 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na su-be-lim mu-za ta-sa-qal-ma a-sar li-bi4-su su-be-lum i-la-ak IGI su-lu-la IGI in-ba-a-sur IGI en-um-a-sur IGI pe-ru-a
tgt: Muza, daughter(!) of Ispunuman, is the wife of Šu-Bēlum. Šu-Bēlum can take her along where <he> wishes. If she wants to go away from him or commits a crime of an improper act, Muza will pay to Šu-Bēlum 1 mina of silver and Šu-Bēlum can go where he wishes. If she wants to go away from him or commits a crime or an improper act, Muza will pay to Šu-Bēlum 1 mina of silver; Šu-Bēlum can go where he wishes. In the presence of Ṣulula, of Inib-Aššur, of Ennum-Aššur, of Perua.

src: 11 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-na a-sur-dan a-na be-a-lim a-sur-SIPA i-di-in ITU.KAM a-la-na-tim li-mu-um su-da-a DUMU en-na-nim a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab 5 pa-su-re sa-a-ma u u-ta u 5 pa-su-re sa-a-ma 1 BANES LAL 1 BANES hi-im-tam is-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-su-ma ha-mus-tim sa i-di-a-sur u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku IGI la-li-im IGI ku-ra
tgt: Aššur-rēʾī gave 11 minas refined silver to Aššur-dān as a beʾalum loan. He will pay 13 ḫamuštum weeks (from) the month Allanātim, eponymate of Šudaya s. Ennānum. If he does not pay, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest. Five tables ... and grain ... and 5 tables ... 1 šūt measure of honey, 1 šūt measure of butter(?) is with his silver. Ḫamuštum of Idī-Aššur and Aššur-taklāku. Witnesses: Lālum, Kura.

src: a-na su-ISTAR AH.ME sa ISTAR qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-la-ma-si ni-mar-ISTAR u {d}IM.GAL-ma i-na u4-mi-im sa DUMU ap-lim i-li-ka-ni a-na ma-la na-as-pe-er-ti-ka a-sur-GAL u me-er-at i-na-ah-DINGIR i-na E be-ti-ka ni-it-ru-ud-ma wa-at-ni-a-si a-ma-at-ka u a-sur-i-mi-ti me-ra-ka a-na E be-ti-ka nu-se-ri-ib-ma ku-um-ru-tam tu-ka-al a-sur-GAL a-na ka-ri-im i-li-ik-ma um-ma su-ut-ma a-bi4 is-pu-ra-ma i-na E be-tim u-si 5 DUMU-e um-me-a-ni be-ra-ni-ma il5-tam u su-ku-ta-sa la-ap-qi-id-ma u lu-si 5 DUMU-e um-me-a-ni ka-ru-um i-be-er-su-ma il5-tam u su ku-ta-sa ip-qi-id-ma sal-ma-at mi-ma sa su-ku-ti il5-tim lu KU.BABBAR lu KU.KI lu a-mu-tum lu sa-dum <gap> ni 1 tup-pa-am be-ru-u u-la-pi-tu-ma a-na am-ti-ka i-di-nu tup-pu-um sa-ni-um me-eh-su E ka-ri-im i-ba-si a-ma-at-ka ni-mar-ISTAR a-sur-i-mi-ti u e-me-ri-mu-sa sa E be-et-ka u-ka-lu-ni sa-al-tum i-na ba-ri-su-nu i-si-ki-in-ma a-sa-ku-um sa il5-tim i-ta-as-me a-na ka-ri-im i-li-ku-ma be-re pa-ni-u-ti-ma ka-ru-um a-na il5-tim a sa-ri-im is-pu-ru-ma su-ku-ti il5-tim u-sa-ni-qu-ma 12 a-nu-qu-u sa a-mu-tim sa uz-ne-sa 1.5 GIN u-ru-um sa KU.KI 2 zi-mi-zu sa KU.KI sa 0.66666 GIN 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR tu-di-na-tum 17 ka-ku-bu-u sa KU.BABBAR ka-ku-um sa 0.83333 GIN sa KU.BABBAR lu sa-dum lu hu-sa-ru-um 0.5 ma-na 5 GIN si-ku-tum sa i-ir-ti-sa mi-ma a-nim ha-la-aq ka-ru-um u-sa-ni-iq-su-nu um-ma su-nu-ma ke-na ni-il5-qe <gap>-<gap>-<gap>
tgt: To Šū-Ištar, the priest of Ištar, this is what Aššur-lamassāi, Nimar-Ištar and Adad-rabi said: The day the son of Aplum arrived we chased Aššur-rabi and the daughter of Ihan-il out of your house in accordance with your written order; then, we brought your amtum-wife Watniašwe and your son Aššur-imittī into your house and she is in possession of the attributes of priesthood. Aššur-rabi went to the colony and said: "My father sent me a message to leave the house. Select for me five independent traders so that I can entrust the goddess and her jewellery and leave." The colony selected five independent traders for him and he entrusted the goddess and her jewellery; she is fine. [...] the jewellery of the [goddess], be it silver or gold [or meteoric iron] or sādum gold ... – the selected men wrote (it on) a tablet and gave that to your amtum-wife. A second tablet, a copy of it, is at the Office of the Colony. A dispute arose among your amtum-wife, Nimar-Ištar, Aššur-imitti and Ewrimuša, who are in possession of your house, and the taboo of the goddess has been heard. They went to the colony and the colony sent the same men as previously selected to take care of the goddess; they checked the jewellery of the goddess (with this result): 12 earrings of meteoric iron; 1 1⁄2 shekel (ca. 12.5 g), a (representation of a) pudendum of gold; 2 beads of gold of two-thirds of a shekel (ca. 5.5 g); half a mina (ca. 249 g) of silver: toggle-pins; 17 stars of silver; a mace of 5/6 shekels (ca. 6.9 g) of silver; (beads of) either sādum gold or lapis lazuli weighing 35 shekels (ca. 290.5 g), (forming) the string of beads on her chest – all this is lost. The colony cross-examined [them] and they replied: "Yes, we took (it)."

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma DUMU a-lu-la-a pa-su a-na-kam i-di-nam um-ma su-ut-ma i-na e-ra-bi4-a-ma 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR u-se-ba-la-kum 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-ti DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR u KU.BABBAR sa zu-zu u sa ih-bu-la-ku-ni i-hi-id-ma i pa-ni-e-ma se-bi4-lam
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā: Alulaya's son gave me his word here, saying: "As soon as I arrive I shall send you 6 minas of silver." 1 mina of silver is owed by Puzur-Ištar's son, and take care to send Zuzu's silver as well as what he borrowed from you as soon as possible.

src: <big_gap> KISIB ku-ki-ni-im me-er-i-su 2.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-ba-tim u ku-ki-nim me-er-i-su a-hu-qar i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa qa-ti {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni u a-sur-na-da a-na 8 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM si-ip-im li-mu-um <big_gap>
tgt: Seals: Abatim and ku-ki-ni-im his son owe Aḫu-waqar 2 minas 25 shekels refined silver. He will pay 8 weeks from the ḫamuštum after Amurrum-bāni and Aššur-nādā. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest. Month: Ṣipʾem. Eponymate: (Ašsur-nādā s. Puzur-Anna).
