tgt: ⅔ Minen 1½ Seqel Silber: Aššurbāni, der Sohn des Bēlumnādā; ⅓ Mine 2½ Seqel Silber: Šū'išḫārā, der Sohn des Kurārā; von 14 Seqel Silber, die bei Aššurbāni, dem Schreiber, habe ich 5 Seqel erhalten. 9 Seqel Silber (ist) er (noch) schuldig. 15 Seqel Silber, (stehen) bei Abūšalim, dem Sohne des Aššurtāb; 6½ Seqel Silber (stehen) bei Aššurmalik, dem Schmied; 2 Seqel Silber: Aššurtāb, der Transporteur; ⅔ Seqel Silber: Ḫaltika; 5 Seqel Silber: Daknabura ; 4 Seqel Silber: Lībūrbēlī; 2½ Seqel Silber: der Angestellte des Ḫalitka; 1⅓ Seqel Silber: der…...... des Öles (?); 2½ Seqel Silber: Šiwašmi; 3 Seqel Silber: Kakuzānum. (Mit) insgesamt 1 Mine 55 Seqel Silber, dem Außenstand des Abumilī, hat Ṣillanum mich beglichen.

src: 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um i-se-er PUZUR4-a-sur a-sur-i-di i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa id-na a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u-me-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qul E DAM.GAR a-na bi4-ti-iq-tim a-la-qe-su-ma bi4-ti-iq-tam su-ut-ma u-ma-la IGI i-zi-za-am-DINGIR IGI da-du-ni
tgt: Puzur-Aššur owes Aššur-idī 2 minas refined silver. He will pay the silver 13 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Idnāya.

src: 1.3333300000000001 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er be-ru-wa-a DUMU ha-lu-ba se-su-ur i-su si-mi-su is-qu-ul is-a-am-su i-na qi-ti-ip ki-ra-ni-im ma-la ka-zu be-ru-wa i-ka-su-du-ni KU.BABBAR a-na se-su-ur i-ta-na-di-in u i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-im u-sax-ha-ar-su-um a-na KU.BABBAR-pi-im sar-ni-ka-an qa-ta-tum IGI su-pi-a-ah-su-u IGI i-ku-nim DUMU e-la-li
tgt: Peruwa s. Ḫalupa owes Šezur 1 1/3 mina silver.

src: um-ma um-mi-a-nu su-hu-bur a-sur-ba-ni u sal-ma-a-sur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-na um-mi-a-ni-ka ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma 3 MU u4-me-e su-uk-na-nim um-mi-a-nu-ka ma-ag-ru mi-ma <big_gap> <gap>-bi te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam mi-ma la ta-pa-la-ah <big_gap> bi ma-ag-ru <big_gap> <gap> u4-me-e <big_gap> sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni <big_gap> ma-ag-ru-ka
tgt: From the investors, Šū-Ḫubur, Aššur-bāni, and Šalim-Aššur to Pūšu-kēn: You wrote to your investors. Set my term at three years. Your investors are in agreement. Anything ... Let your message come. Do not fear whatsoever. .... are in agreement. ... terms ... which you wrote ... they agree with you.

src: 4 ma-na 6 GIN KU.BABBAR sa i-se-er zu-pa sa-te-a u si-li-ISTAR DAM.GAR-um i-su-u a-na KU.BABBAR a-ni-im sa-te-a a-na E a-ni-ni a DAM.GAR-ri i-ma-la u-mi-si-na i-sa-qa-la is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa hu-ra-sa-nim u {d}a-sur-ma-lik a-na 3 ITU.KAM i-sa-qa-la ITU.KAM ab sa-ra-ni li-mu-um a-sur-i-di IGI pi-la-ah-a-sur IGI su-e-a
tgt: Zupa, Šāt-Ea and Ṣilli-Ištar owe the merchant 4 mina 6 shekels silver. This silver of Šāt-Ea the house of Anini ? to pay? From the ḫamuštum of Ḫaraṣānim and Aššur-mālik he has 3 months to pay. Month: Ab šarrānē. Eponymate: Aššur-idī. Witnesses: Pilaḫ-Aššur, Sueyya

src: KISIB a-mur-{d}UTU KISIB i-ku-nim sa hu-bu-ul PUZUR4.ISTAR 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa a-sur-SIPA is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa li-ba-a u i-li-is-ti-kal 0.66666 GIN 15 SE.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul PUZUR4.ISTAR
tgt: Seals: Amur-Šamaš, Ikūnim. Regarding Puzur-Ištar's debt of 2/3 minas refined silver owed to Aššur-rēʾī. He will add 2/3 shekels per 15 kernels per month as interest from the ḫamuštum of Libbaya and Iliš-tikal.

src: 1 ma-na LA 4 GIN AN.NA da-at TUG.HI.A sa la-ma-si 16 GIN AN.NA da-at 2 TUG.HI.A sa a-sur-na-da 0.66666 ma-na 4 GIN AN.NA mu-ta AN.NA 0.5 ma-na 5 GIN AN.NA a-na TUG.HI.A sa sa-e-tim 10 GIN AN.NA a ta-ak-si-ir-tim 16 GIN AN.NA a-na UDU sa-pu-ra-tim 3 GIN AN.NA si-im se-ne-en6 sa hu-zi-a 15 GIN AN.NA a-na ku-ur-ku-ur a-di-in 10 GIN.TA AN.NA qa-qa-da-tum ik-su-dam
tgt: 56 shekels of tin: the fees for Lamassi's textiles; 16 shekels of tin: the fees for 2 textiles belonging to Aššur-nādā; 44 shekels of tin: loss on the tin; 35 shekels of tin for the textiles of the sa'udum; 10 shekels of tin for repairs; 16 shekels of tin for a sheep from Buraddum; 3 shekels of tin: the price of Huzzia's sandals; 15 shekels of tin I gave to Kurkur; the head tax amounted to 10 shekels of tin per (talent).

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u dan-a-sur qi-bi-ma 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 40 ku-ta-nu qa-dum sa li-wi-tim SA.BA 1 TUG sa sa-at-a-sur dan-a-sur li-il5-qe 2 ANSE sa-la-ma-an 15 ma-na AN.NA-ak qa-tim mi-ma a-nim a-gu-a i-ra-de8-a-ku-nu-ti 0.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR u ni-is-ha-su be-u-la-ti-su a-gu5-a li-is-qu-la-ku-nu-ti 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 40 TUG.HI.A qa-dum sa li-wi-tim 2 ANSE.HI.A sa-la-ma-an 15 ma-na AN.NA-ak qa-tim mi-ma a-nim ku-lu-ma-a i-ra-de8-a-ku-nu-ti sa sa-ri-dim sa-bu AN.NA u TUG.HI.A e-mi-da-ma lu a-na u4-me qu-ur-bu-tim lu a pa-ti-u-tim di-na a-li KU.BABBAR 1 GIN e-li-a-ni ki-ma ta-le-e-a-ni di-na-ma KU.BABBAR u u4-me i-na tup-pi-ku-nu wa-di-a-nim su-ma DAM.GAR la sa ki-ma qa-qi-di-ku-nu a-sar ba-la-ti-a ep-sa
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: 2 talents, 10 minas tin under seal, 40 textiles with wrappings--therein let Dān-Aššur take the 1 textile belonging to Šāt-Aššur--2 black donkeys, 15 minas tin as 'hand-tin'--all this Agua drives to you (pl.). Let Agua pay to you 25 shekels silver and its interest as his capital fund. 2 talents 10 minas tin under seal, 40 textiles together with wrappings, 2 black donkeys, 15 minas 'hand-tin'--all this Kulumaya brings to you (pl.) The (wages) of the transporters are paid. Combine the tin and textiles and sell them on short or long term credit Wherever the price is even a single shekel higher, sell as much as you are able and make known to me the silver and the terms in your tablets. If there are no merchants as reliable as your surety, do whatever is in my best interests.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 a-sur-is-ti-kal u dan-a-sur a-na a-sur-is-ti-kal qi-bi-ma 35 ma-na AN.NA 1 TUG 0.5 ANSE sa se-pi-ka 2 {TUG}ku-ta-ni en-um-a-sur DUMU i-li-li 2 ku-ta-ni dan-a-sur i-di-nu-ni-kum ma-as-ka-ti sa se-pi-ka AN.NA-ki 7 GIN.TA TUG.HI.A 0.33333 ma-na.TA i-di-nu-ma KU.BABBAR ub-lu-nim a sa qi-ip-ti-im 2-se-ne <big_gap> us <big_gap> se-bi4-il5 a-hi a-ta KU.BABBAR di-su-nu-ti-ma si-ma-am la-as-a-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN li-li-ma i-nu-mi ta-la-ka-ni tup-pa-am sa na-ru-qi-ka i-la-pu-tu-ni u a-na-ku a-da-na-kum-ma <gap> <gap>-mu i sar-<big_gap>
tgt: Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn, Aššuriš-tikal, and Dān-Aššur: To Aššuriš-tikal: They sold you 35 minas tin, 1 textile, ½ donkey of your šēpum; 2 They sold my deposit in your shipment, my tin for a 7 shekel rate and my textiles for 20 shekels, and brought me the silver. Regarding the matter of my consignment, 2 ... ... send ... My dear brother, give the silver to them so that I may make purchases and make every shekel of silver possible, so that when you come they will write me in the tablet of your joint-stock fund. Now, as for me, I will give (it) to you and ....

src: 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ma-num-ba-lum-a-sur a-sur-GAL i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-tu-ur-DINGIR u kur-ub-ISTAR a-na ITU.1.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM si-pi-im li-mu-um ku-bi-a IGI i-di-{d}UTU IGI a-sur-GAL
tgt: Mannum-bālum-Aššur owes Aššur-rabi 10 shekels refined silver. He will pay one month from the ḫamuštum of Itūr-ilI and Kurub-Ištar. If he does not pay (on time), he will add interest at the rate of the colony. Month: Šibʾum. Eponymate: Kubiya.

src: KISIB su-hu-bu-ur DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR KISIB a-mur-ISTAR DUMU su-su-en6 7 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-mur-ISTAR ku-ku-la-num DUMU ku-ta-a i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ka-si-im ITU.KAM be-el-ti-kal-lim li-mu-um sa qa-ti a-sur-mi-ti ma-la-hi-im a-na 40 u4-me i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR i-na ur-hi-im a si-ib-tim u-sa-ab
tgt: Amur-Ištar owes Kukkulānum s. Kudāya shekels refined silver. He will pay forty days from the ḫamuštum of kaššim, month bēlet-ekallim, eponymate after Aššur-imittī the boatman. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 shekel silver (per mina) per month

src: a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma um-ma i-di-ISTAR-ma 5 GIN KU.GI pa-sa-la-am ku-nu-ki-a i-ku-pi-a DUMU da-a-a na-as-a-kum a-bi4 a-ta ni-iq-a-am IGI i-li-ka i-qi-ma qu-ru-ba-am
tgt: To Aššur-nādā from Iddin-Ištar: 5 shekels of pašallu-gold under my seal Ikuppia son of Daya is bringing to you. My dear father, make a sacrifice before your god and bless me.

src: KISIB in-bi-ISTAR DUMU si-in-<gap> <big_gap> a-na la-qe-pi-im u si-la-{d}ISKUR su-ha-ri-a <gap>
tgt: Sigel des Inb[i'ištar,] des Sohnes des Sin. [. . . . ] Zu Lāqīpum, des S[ohnes des . . . . . . ,] und Ṣilladad, ['dem Sohne des . . . . ,] meinen Dienern, sp[rich!]

src: 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-la-hi-im su-e-ta-ta i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-la-hi-im u bu-zi-a a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab ITU.KAM kan-wa-ar-ta li-mu-um su-ka-li-a IGI me-na-nim IGI {d}ISKUR.GAL IGI qar-dum-{d}ISKUR
tgt: Al-aḫum owes Sueata 1/2 mina refined silver. He will pay 13 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Al-aḫum and Buzia. If he does not pay (on time), he will add interest according to the rate of the colony per month.

src: 5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er li-ip-ti-ISTAR u nu-ur-i-li DAM.GAR i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-di-ku-bi-im 0.66666 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-i-li li-mu-um i-li-a-lim DUMU su-ka-li-a IGI a-sur-is-ta-ki-il5 DUMU lu-lu IGI DUG-a-sur DUMU ni-mar-ISTAR
tgt: Lipit-Ištar and Nūr-ilī the merchant owe 5 shekels silver. He will add 2/3 shekels (per mina) per month as interest from the ḫamuštum of Idī-Kūbim. Month: Maḫur-ilī Eponymate: Ili-ālim s. Sukkallīya Witnesses: Aššuriš-takil s. Lulu, Ṭāb-Aššur s. Nimar-Ištar

src: KISIB zi-a-ta-tu DUMU a-la-bi4-im KISIB {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni DUMU bu-bu-wa-tal DUB tu-pu-um sa ba-ab DINGIR a-num sa IGI GIR sa a-sur ni-di-nu
tgt: Siegel des Zi'atatu, des Sohnes des Alâbum; Siegel des Amurrubbāni, des Sohnes des Bu-bu-wa-r[i] (?). Diese Gottestor-Urkunde (ist es), die wir vor dem Dolche des [Aššur] [gegeben haben (?)].

src: a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma um-ma i-di-ISTAR-ma a-di KU.BABBAR sa ma-la u se-ni-su ta-as-pu-ra-ni a-sur u i-la-ap-ra-at i-il5 a-bi-ni li-tu-la is-tu u4-mi-im sa a tu-ur-hu-mi-it ta-li-ka-ni-ma ni-na-me-ru si-ma-am sa i-na sa-na-im u 1 ma-na.TA wa-at-ru u-na-si-hu a ma-la u4-me-a URUDU <big_gap> 3-sa-u i-tu-ur-ma me-at GU bu-tu-qa-e lu a-mu-ur-ma a-sur-ma u i-il5-ka a-wi-lam i-ti-di-ma u KU.BABBAR a qa-ti-a ma-qi-it-ma a-di u4-mi-im a-nim su-ta-bu-a-ti sa DUMU a-ni-nim sa ti-de8-u AN.NA u et-ma-su is-ti DUG-si-la-a-sur a se-bu-li-im i-zi-iz-ma i sa-am-si lu-qu-tum u-si-a-ni DUG-a-sur DUMU e-su-ba-ni e-ru-ub-ma um-ma su-ut-ma pu-ru a-wi-lim a-di 5 u4-me i-sa-kan lu KU.BABBAR-pi u-ta-er u lu-qu-su u-ta-er i sa-am-si sa tup-pu u-la-pi-ta-ku-ni te-er-ti a-se-er et-lim i-ta-la-ak su-ma lu-qu-tam qa-ti i-sa-ba-at li-ba-ka u li-bi4 i-ha-du
tgt: To Aššur-nādā from Iddin-Ištar: as to the silver that you have written about once or twice, may Aššur and Ilabrat, the gods of our fathers, be my witnesses, that since the day you came to Durhumit and we met, people collected goods at a purchase price exceeding 2:1 and at a rate of exchange of 60:1, but within my stipulated term the copper has tripled, so would I envisage losses in copper of maybe a hundred talents? While Aššur himself and your own god have rejected the man, still silver has fallen into my hands and until this day you have been fully satisfied. As to the affair of Anninum's son, whom you know, the tin and its overweight stood ready to be shipped with Ṭāb-Aššur, but on the very day that the merchandise came out Ṭāb-Aššur son of Ešu-bāni came in and said: "Within 5 days the man will be disfamed. Turn back your merchandise!" So I turned back his merchandise. The very day I wrote a tablet for you my orders were dispatched to the young man. If I should personally seize the merchandise both you and I will be happy.

src: a-na im-di-DINGIR qi-bi-ma um-ma en-um-a-sur-ma 0.83333 ma-na KU.KI 3.6666600000000003 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-di-{d}ISKUR <big_gap> na-as-a-kum mi-nam ma-da-tim lu-la-pi-ta-kum a-ma a-ma-kam i-di-{d}ISKUR u PUZUR4-i-li sa-il5 e ta-aq-bi um-ma a-ta-ma u-sa-ba-a-ni u wa-di mi-ma-ma la-su a-sur u i la a-hu-tim li-tu-la u i-na a-lim{ki} lu wa-as-ba-ti-ma a-na te-er-ti-ka lu a-na-hi-id u a-ni mi-ma-sa-ma a-na PUZUR4-i-li sa ki-ma i-a-ti li-im-qu-ut u-la tup-pu-su lu-pu-ut u-la a ma-la KI PUZUR4-i-li ta-ma-gu5-ru su-up-ra-am as-lu-ut-ma qa-ti u-ta-hi um-su-ma a-ki-a-am a-ba-si E.GAL-lum sa-bu-u e-du-u u-sa-bi-e-ma a-na a-hi-ka sa ke-na-tim a-tu-ar a-wi-lum KU.BABBAR u-ta-a u a-hu-tam u-ta u a-ma-ti <big_gap> ni-na-mu-ru tup-pa-am a-ni-a-am sa-il5 a-na sa i-mi-is-ru li-ba-ka la i-la-mi-in wa-di KU.BABBAR-ap-ka <big_gap> u-sa-ma e-ta-lu-tam <big_gap> ap-tur4-ma a-di u4-mi-im a-nim a-be-el 2 GIN KU.GI a-na ni-qi-ka PUZUR4-i-li na-as-a-kum
tgt: To Imdi-ilum from Ennum-Aššur: You are in the city and I am taking care with your instructions! Entweder stelle seine Tafel aus oder schreibe mir, wieweit du dich mit dem Puzur-[ilī] einigst. Ich habe aus eigenem Antrieb meine Hand ausgestreckt; bis zum heutigen Tage bin ich so!

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na dan-a-sur qi-bi4-ma i-nu-mi pu-su-ke-en6 a-ma-kam wa-as-bu i-na tup-pi-su sa TUG.HI-ti-ka lu sa se-ep dan-a-sur lu sa se-ep i-di-su-en6 u-za-ka-ma KU.BABBAR i-ku-pi-a a-na-si-am sa is-te-en6 u se-na sa is-ti-a u-se-bi4-lu-ni KU.BABBAR-ap-su-nu ub-lu-nim um-ma a-na-ku-ma KU.BABBAR e-ta-am-dum i-la-kam-ma i ba-ab a-bu-lim la a-ba-as lu-mu-un li-bi4-im e-ta-ap-su-ni lu a-na TUG.HI-ti-a lu a-na AN.NA-ki-a su-ta-am-ri-is-ma KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na u 2 ma-na se-li-a-am se-pa-am a-ni-tam gi5-im-la-ni lu-qu-tam lu i-a-tam lu sa ba-ri-ni za-ki-a-ma a-ta-al-kam mi-ma la te-zi-ba-am KU.BABBAR sa se-ep pu-su-ke-en6 a-di ta-la-ka-ni i-ba-si i-na a-ta-al-ki-ka bu-zu-ta-a u e-nu-be-lam sa-hi-iz-ma a-na ni-ka-si-a li-is-hu-tu a-hu-ka ta-ap-la-ah-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-su tu-se-ba-la-su-um 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i ne-pi-si-a ta-na-sa-ah-ma a bu-zu-ta-a ta-da-an u im-di-lu-um a-na-kam KU.BABBAR-ap-su e-ri-si KU.BABBAR-pi i se-pi-ka bi4-lam su-ma la tu-ub-lam a-sur u {d}NIN.SUBUR li-tu-la si-a-ma-tim la a-ga-mi-il5-ka a-na-kam-ma qa-bi4-a-kum i sa AN.NA-ki-su KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na u-su-uh a-na a-wi-li ta-e-er a-na-ku a-ta-ah-ba-al
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Dān-Aššur:

src: 7.33333 ma-na 1.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er en-um-a-sur DUMU sa-lim-{d}IM su-ISTAR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-di-a-bi-im a-na 17 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i ITU.KAM-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM be-el-ti-E.GAL-lim li-mu-um sa qa-ti a-sur-ma-lik DUMU a-la-hi-im IGI a-sur-GAL DUMU en-na-nim IGI LUGAL-su-en6 IGI lu-lu DUMU am-ri-a
tgt: Ennum-Aššur s. Šalim-Adad owes Šū-Ištar 7 1/3 minas 1 1/2 shekels refined silver. He will pay 17 weeks from ḫamuštum of Iddin-abim. If he does not pay, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per week as interest.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni-ma 17 ma-na KU.BABBAR su-nu-nu ub-la-kum u te-er-ti i-li-ka-kum um-ma a-na-ku-ma 1 ma-na 6 GIN KU.BABBAR su-nu-nu sa-as-qi-il5 1.8333300000000001 ma-na KU.BABBAR PUZUR4-a-sur 0.5 ma-na 3 GIN KU.BABBAR DUMU e-li-me-sar sa-as-qi-il5-ma u ma-su-ha-am mi-si-ma a-na mu-la 20 ma-na ni-is-ha-ti-su u sa-du-i-ti-su a si-ib-tim li-qe-ma a ma-la te-er-ti-a e-pu-us-ma gi5-im-la-ni a-ta te-er-ta-ka-ma la i-ta-al-kam a-bi4 a-ta be-li a-ta i-hi-id-ma a ma-la te-er-ti-a e-pu-us lu gi5-mi-lum i-a-ti u a-su-mi qa-ti-a ma-la E ka-ri-im PUZUR4-a-sur i-ta-di-u u ma-la a-ta ta-ta-di-u te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam-ma uz-ni pi-te PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU a-gu5-a si-ta-par-ma KU.BABBAR a-wi-li su-ut lu-sa-as-qi-la-su-nu
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Ilabrat-bāni: Šū-Nūnu brought you 17 minas silver. Also, my instructions went to you. I said, "Have Šū-Nūnu pay 1 minas 6 shekels silver. Make Puzur-Aššur pay 1 mina 50 shekels silver and the son of Elī-mēšar pay 33 shekels silver so that you purify the dirty (tin?/copper?) and borrow silver on interest for the balance payment of the 20 minas, its excise tax and its shipping charges, doing according to my instructions, and so do me a favor. But as for you, your instructions did not arrive. My dear father and lord, take heed to do according to my instructions. Let it be a favor to me. Also, regarding my account, let your message come as to how much Puzur-Aššur deposited at the colony office and how much you desposited and so inform me. Send frequently to Puzur-Ištar son of Agua so that those men may pay to (you?) the silver.

src: um-ma pu-su-ke-en-ma a-na la-ma-si qi-bi-ma si-ti TUG.HI.A-ti-ki pa-ni-u-tim gam-ra-ki-im 20 TUG.HI.A sa a-na PUZUR4-a-sur ta-di-ni-ni 1 TUG ni-is-ha-tum 2 TUG si-mu-um si-tum 17 TUG.HI.A al-qe 6 TUG a-hu-qar ub-lam 6 TUG i-a-sar ub-lam 2 TUG i-di-su-en6 ub-lam SA.BA 3 TUG a-na PUZUR4-a-sur u-ra-di-ma 20 TUG u-pi-iq-sum-ma a qa-ti-su a-di-in si-ti TUG.HI-ti-ki 11 TUG i li-bi-a SA.BA 1.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI sa-du-a-su sa-bu ku-nu-ki-a ku-lu-ma-a na-as-a-ki-im ta-as-pu-ri-ma um-ma a-ti-ma i li-bi TUG.HI.A sa u-se-bi4-la-ku-ni 2 TUG sa su-pu-ul-tim-ma KU.BABBAR sa ku-lu-ma-a na-as-a-ki-ni 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-wa-um 0.5 ma-na a-na su-pu-ul-tim di-ni si-im 1 TUG kab-tim sa su-pu-ul-tim is-tu bu-ru-us-ha-dum u-bu-lu-nim-ma 7 GIN KU.BABBAR sa il5-ba-ni sa DUMU ku-sa-ri-im is-qu-la-ni u i-na si-im si-ti TUG.HI.A-ti-ki KU.BABBAR us-ta-sa-ba-at-ma <big_gap> i-di-su-en6 u-se-ba-la-ki-im a-na la-ma-si qi-bi-ma 5.TA TUG.HI.A SIG5-tim a su-ha-ri di-ni lu-ub-lu-nim li-ik-su-du-ni mi-su sa e-ma-am ta-ah-di-ri-ni a-na-ku a-na-kam ki-ma i-qa-bi4-u-ni i-se-er NINDA-ka a-zu-ab e-na-a e-ra-ba u-si-a
tgt: From Pūšu-kēn to Lamassī: The remainder of your previous textiles are exhausted to you. As for the 20 textiles which you gave to Puzur-Aššur, 1 textiles was for the excise and 2 for the purchases, and I received 17 textiles. Aḫu-waqar brought 6 textiles. Ea-šar brought 6 textiles. Idī-Suen brought 2 textiles. Thereof, I added 3 textiles to Puzur-Aššur and I entrusted 20 textiles to him and I gave them to his account. The remainder of your textiles, 11 textiles, I owe you. Thereof 1 1 /2 minas silver, the excise added and shipping satisfied, Kulumaya brings to you under my seal. You wrote me, "From the tetiles which I sent to you, 2 textiles of Šupūltum and the silver which (you said) Kulumaya brings to you, 1 mina silver kuwaʾum, give a half mina to Šu-ūltum." The price of 1 heavy textile which Šupūltum brought me from Purušḫattum and 7 shekels silver which Ili-bāni, which the son of Kusārum paid to me, and from teh remainder of the revenues of your textiles I will seize the silver and I will send it to you with Idī-Suen. To Lamassi: Give 5 fine textiles to each of the youth. Let them bring them. Let them reach me. Why is it that you have worried about the maḫā'um? Here, I myself will concern myself with what they said about your bread rations. Innaya will enter and leave.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma i-na ni-ka-si ki-ma ku-a-ti as-ta-ha-at u hu-bu-lam sa a-lim{ki} qa-ti-ni-ma ta-sa-qal su-ma li-bi-ka la ta-sa-ha-at i-na si-hi-ti-ka ni-ka-si-ka <gap>-<gap>-ba al-qe-ma a-na is-te-en6 u se-na a-di-in-ma TUG.HI.A ma-la na-da-im <big_gap><gap> <gap> u i-a-ti <big_gap> <gap>-tim <big_gap><gap> <gap> i-sa <big_gap> ma-la <big_gap> <gap>-<gap> <big_gap> <gap>-is <big_gap><gap> <gap>-a is-tap-ku-u <big_gap> ma i-ta-di <big_gap> ri-ni <big_gap> ki qa-ti is-te-et u si-ta sa a-sa-ka-na-ni ni-ka-si a-ni-u-tim la is-qu-ul a-su-mi su-ha-ri-im su-ma a-ta pa-nam sa-ak-na-ti a-na a-hi-im u eb-ri-im <big_gap><gap>
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: You wrote me. You said, "At accountings I will assist/stand in place of you. Also, you will pay the debt to the city from our accounts." If you wish, do not stand. In your assistance, your account ... I took and I gave for one or two and as many textiles as were to be given ... mine ... ... shares? one or two which I placed/established, these accountings did not pay. Concenring the boy, if you have made up your mind, ... to brother and partner ...

src: a-na sal-mi-hi-im qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma 30 ma-na sa a-sur-DU10 u u-sur-sa-a-sur i-hi-ib-lu-ni 10 GIN ki-ib-sa-tum 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-na ra-mi-ni-a u-ra-di-ma 30 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-a sa-du-a-su sa-bu su-ISTAR DUMU da-da-nim na-as-a-kum ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma a-se-er KU.BABBAR a-nim 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR ra-di-ma su-ha-ra-am tur4-dam si-im TUG.HI.A u si-im 50 ma-na AN.NA a-na se-ep dan-a-sur KU.BABBAR 1 GU 20 ma-na u-pa-qa-ad a-na 2 u4-me e-ra-ba-ma a-ta-ra-da-su u te-er-ti za-ku-tum is-ti-su i-la-ka-kum AN.NA su-ma 15 GIN.TA u e-li-is sa 40 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-a-ma a-di e-ra-ab dan-a-sur li-ni-di-ma a-ma-kam la i-sa-hu-ur tur4-da-su u a-na se-pi-i-a su-ma la 2-se-na tup-pe-e-en sa lu-lu u a-sur-na-da u me-er-i-su mi-ma sa-ni-um u-la i-ba-si a-na me-er-i-ka as-pur-ma um-ma a-na-ku-ma is-ti KU.BABBAR a-nim a-lik um-ma su-ut-ma a-na si-ip-ri-a-ma ki-ma DUMU me-ti-im ta-ta-wu IGI 3 DUMU-e um-mi-a-ni a-la-kam la i-mu-a mi-nam a-qa-bi4 a-se-er is-tu 5 ITU.KAM i ku-ri-a a-ta-na-lu-ku
tgt: To Šalim-aḫum from Pūšu-kēn: Regarding the 30 minas (silver) which Aššur-ṭāb and Uṣur-ša-Aššur owed, 10 shekels were deducted amounts. I added 1/3 minas silver from my own funds and Šū-Ištar son of Dadānum brings you 30 minas silver under my seal. You wrote me. You said, "In addition to this silver, add 10 minas silver and dispatch the boy (Ennam-Aššur) to me. (As for) the yield of the textiles and the yeild of the 50 minas tin, I will entrust about 1 talent 20 minas silver to Dān-Aššur's transport. He will arrive in 2 days and I will dispatch him to you. Also, my complete report will come to you with him. As for the tin, if (the rate) is 15 shekels or higher, purchase it to the amount of 40 minas silver so that it is deposited until the arrival of Dān-Aššur so that he does not delay there. Dispatch him to me. Now, as for my transport, beside the two tablets of Lulu and Aššur-nādā and his son, there is nothing else. I wrote to your son and I said, "Go with this silver!" He said to my messenger, "You argue like the son of a dead man." Before 3 'certified merchants' he refused to go. What can I say? In addition to my constantly running around in ... for 5 months ...

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da i-li-a-lim u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi4-ma ma-la u se-ni-si as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-na-ku-ma KU.BABBAR 30 ma-na sa se-ep i-li-a-lim pa-ni-tim se-bi4-la-nim a-li-ku ma-la u se-ni-si i-li-ku-nim a mi-nim KU.BABBAR la tu-se-bi4-la-nim a-pu-tum i pa-ni-i-ma a-li-ki-im 30 ma-na KU.BABBAR se-bi4-la-nim a-wi-lu wa-ar-ki-a i-za-zu a-pu-tum ih-da-ma se-bi4-la-nim
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā, Ilī-ālum and Aššur-taklāku: Both once and twice I have written, saying: "Send me the 30 minas of silver from Ilī-ālum's previous transport!" Both once and twice travelers have come here. Why, then, have you not sent the silver? Please, send 30 minas of silver with the very first traveler. The men are standing right behind me. Please, take care and send it to me!

src: 1 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um is-ti a-al-DU10 DUMU a-sur-na-da is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa e-la-li u {d}UTU-ba-ni a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.1.KAM be-el-ti-E.GAL-lim li-mu-um i-di-a-sur DUMU ku-bi-di IGI ku-zi-zi-a IGI ku-na-a IGI PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU DINGIR-ku-ru-ub IGI a-sur-i-di DUMU i-li-a IGI ku-us-im
tgt: Al-ṭāb s. Aššur-nādā owes 1 mina 10 shekels refined silver. He will pay 20 ḫamuštum weeks after the ḫamuštum of Elāli and Šamaš-bāni. If he does not pay (on time), he will add interest according to the rate of the colony. Month: Bēlet ekallim. Eponymate: Idī-Aššur s. Kubi-idī.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma ta-ri-is-ma-tum u be-la-tum-ma a-su-mi KU.BABBAR sa ik-ri-bi4 a-na-kam be-la-tum ta-am-ra-as i-na u-tu-ki u i-na e-ta-me sa-am-tu-a-ni a-bu-ni a-ta be-el-ni a-ta KU.BABBAR a-na su-ha-ri la tu-wa-sa-ar a-su-mi ma-za-zi-im DINGIR lam-ni-is E a-bi4-ni e-pa-as a-pu-tum su-ma a-bu-ni a-ta ki-ma ta-le-e-u mi-it-ha-as-ma su-um-ka su-ku-un-ma su-ha-ru a-su-mi ik-ri-bi4 ki-a-am i-ne-pi-su a-pu-tum ma-ma-an i-na su-ha-re-e la um-ta-sa-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN la i-la-qe 1 ANSE.HI.A i-sar-be-li i-ra-de8-a-ku-ni ni-is-me-ma u-sur-sa-a-sur i-ta-ar-dam e um-ta-si-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN e il5-qe su-ma i-sar-be-li a-di-ni la e-ru-ba-am su-pur-ma a-na pa-ni-su i ANSE.HI.A a-sar ku-a-ti le-ru-bu ki-ma TUG.HI.A ta-di-nu KU.BABBAR ku-nu-uk-ma se-bi4-la-ma na-pa-ti-ni is-te-ni-is e-te-er a-bu-ni a-ta a-la-nu-ka ma-nam ni-su
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Tariš-mātum and Bēlātum: Concerning the silver of the votive fund, here you saddened Bēlātum. From the utensils and that among the eṭṭamē, ... Our dear father and lord, do not release the silver to the youths. Concerning the mazzāzum the god will do something evil to our fathers's house. Urgent, if you are our father, gather together as much as you can, and place your name on it so that the youth(s) can in this make a claim against the votive funds. Urgent, none of the youth should ... nor take a single shekel of silver. We heard that Išār-bēlī brought you 1 donkey and Uṣur-ša-Aššur departed. He must not mṣi nor take a single shekel! If Išār-bēlī had not yet arrived, send word so that whatever goods you own enter before him from the donkeys. When the textilesare sold, seal and send the silver so that ... altogether .... Our dear father, without you we have no one.

src: um-ma im-di-DINGIR-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma i-na tup-pi si-ta-pu-ri-im a-ta-ah-da-ar a-na <big_gap> a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku a-<gap> <big_gap> a-na pu-ru-us-ha-tim a-se-er ru-ba-im GAL i-sa-par-su-ma is-ti ka-ri-im e-na-na-tim e-ri-is-ma um-ma su-ut-ma a-na a-lim{ki} ha-ra-ni e-na-num u ku-a-ti a-na ka-ri-im u-ma-sa-ah-ka um-ma su-ut-ma a-sur-na-da KU.BABBAR ma-dam u-ka-al-ma a-su-mi na-pa-as-ti-a e-ta-ri la a-li-a u a-na ka-ri-im um-ma su-ut-ma tup-pa-am sa ma-la lu-qu-tam u-ka-lu lu-se-si-a-ma am-ra ka-ru-um u-la e-ta-na-an-su-um a-na pu-ru-us-ha-tim i-la-ak i-na sa-am-si tup-pi ta-sa-me-u is-ti i-li-as-ra-ni ti-ib-a a-tal-kam-ma a-pi-is a-hu-ka a-na-kam la-su u a-sar KU.BABBAR 1 GIN i-se-ri-ka la-qa-im lu ni-im-lik-ma te-em-ni lu ni-is-ba-at a-hu-ka e-na-su ik-la a-su-ri is-tu is-ti ru-ba-im a-wa-su i-la-qe-u a-ma-nu-ma a-na se-ri-a e-ti-qam-ma a-ma-kam e u-ni bu-la-ti-ka e it-ba-al e u-ha-li-qa su-ma la ta-hi-id-ma la ta-ta-al-kam ha-al-qa-a-ti ki-ma a-hu-ka sa-ah-ru-um u-ni-u-ka
tgt: From Imdī-ilum to Aššur-nādā: I have had it, constantly writing letters! Your brother Aššur-taklāku here sends a messenger to Burušhaddum, to the great king and he asks favours of the colony, saying: "I am on my way to the City, do me a favour!" so, he will cause you to be robbed in the colony, because he says: "Aššur-nādā keeps a lot of silver, while I am powerless to even save my own life!" Then he says to the colony: "Let me produce the tablet showing how much merchandise he keeps, and examine it!" Since the colony has not shown him any favours he will go to Burušhaddum. The very day you hear my letter you must get up together with Ilī-ašrannī and come here, and given that your brother is not here we must confer about where we may receive a single shekel of silver owed to you, and then make up our minds. As for your brother, his eyes are dark. Heaven forbid that after he obtains a decision from the king he will proceed from there to me, lest he cheats you there, removes your working capital and destroys you! If you do not take care to come, you will be destroyed! Like En[ ... ] your little brother has cheated you!

src: KISIB a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku KISIB su-ku-bi-im KISIB en-na-su-en6 KISIB li-ba-a KISIB e-la-ma KISIB sa-lim-a-sur KISIB a-sur-DU10 DUMU ka-ri-a KISIB en-na-nim sa hu-bu-ul en-na-nim 15 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-tu ha-mus-tim sa MAR.TU-ba-ni u i-ku-nim a-na 36 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i ITU.KAM-im a 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab li-ba-a e-la-ma a-sur-DU10 sal-ma-a-sur qa-ta-tum i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu KU.BABBAR ra-ki-is
tgt: He will pay 36 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Amurrum-bāni and Ikūnim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: <gap> bi4 su-<big_gap><gap> i-na u4-me-su ma-al-u-tim sa-as-qi-la-su-ma se-bi-la-nim a pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma a-wa-tam sa ti-de8-u su-ma a-hi a-ta a-wa-tam za-ku-sa su-up-ra-ma lu i-de8 a-bi a-ta 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR u 2 ma-na ku-a-am se-bi4-lam-ma su-ma a-ga-mi-il5-ka a-mu-ur mi-sa-ru-um se-bu-ul-ta-ka na-as-u-ni-ku-um <big_gap> ha-<gap>-<big_gap><gap>
tgt: At the expiration of the term, make them pay and send it to me. To Pūšu-kēn: As for the matter which you informed (me), if you are my brother, clear the matter and send me word to inform (me.) My dear father, send 1 or 2 minas of your own silver and see if I will not do you a favor. Misarum brings your delivery to you.

src: <big_gap> <gap>-ku-nu <big_gap> ma ba <big_gap> a-su-mi me-er-e a-sur-<gap>-<gap> is-ti en-nam-a-sur DUMU su-{d}EN.LIL ni-il5-qe <gap> 2 GU 33.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-ti tam-ka-ri-im sa sa-lim-a-hi-im ni-il5-qe SA.BA 31 ma-na KU.BABBAR 0.5 ma-na sa-du-a-su a-na en-nam-a-sur DUMU su-a-sur ni-di-in-ma u-bi-il5 IGI zu-pa IGI a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku IGI en-na-nim si-ip-ri-im 20.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-ni 0.33333 ma-na a-ha-ma sa <big_gap> a-na a-sur-ma-lik ni-ip-qi-id IGI <big_gap>
tgt: Concerning the sons of Aššur-šamšī, we received (silver?) from Ennam-Aššur son of Šū-Enlil. We recieved x talents 33 minas 40 shekels from the merchant of Šalim-aḫum. Thereof, we gave 31 minas of silver, ½ mina its transport tariff, to Ennam-Aššur son of Šū-Aššur and he carried it. Witnesses: Zupa, Aššur-taklāku, Ennānum the scribe. We entrusted to Aššur-mālik 20 minas 50 shekels of silver under our seal, separately 20 shekels which [ … ].

src: pu-su-ke-en6 <big_gap> um-ma PUZUR4-<gap> <big_gap> a-na pu-su-ke-en6 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR si-im ANSE i li-bi-a a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um ka-ni-is i-di-in-ni-a-ti-ma
tgt: Puzur-x said to Pūšu-kēn, 1/3 minas silver, the price of the donkey is in your funds. For these matters, the colony at Kanesh gave us permisssion and [we gave our witnesses before the dagger of Aššur.]

src: i-na 3 me-at 26 {TUG}ku-ta-ni sa kur-ub-ISTAR qa-dum li-wi-tim 10 TUG sa a-ki-di-e 8 GU 40 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku sa kur-ub-ISTAR 6 TUG sa ka-sa-ri 56 TUG sa lu-qu-tim sa is-mi-di-DINGIR <gap> {TUG}ku-ta-ni sa a-sur-{d}UTU-si ub-la-ni-a-ti-ni 15 {TUG}ku-ta-ni <big_gap> <gap> ba <big_gap> u 8 GU 40 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ki sa kur-ub-ISTAR DUG-si-la-a-sur il5-qe 1 {TUG}ku-si-tam a-na ILLAT-tim ni-di-in 1 {TUG}ku-ta-nu a-na hu-lu-qa-e sa za-al-pa ni-di-in 10 {TUG}ku-ta-nu sa i-na da-da-ni-a a-hu-ru-ni si-ti TUG.HI.A 2 me-at 62 TUG.HI.A a-na E.GAL-lim e-ru-bu
tgt: Of the 326 kutānu-textiles belonging to Kurub-Ištar--including (for) the wrapping- (and) 10 Akkadian textiles; 8 talents 40 minas of tin under the seal of Kurub-Ištar; 6 textiles belonging to the packers, 66 textiles from the goods of Iṣmid-ilum, x kutānu-textiles which Aššur-šamšī entrusted to us, 15 kutānu-textiles

src: a-na ma-la di-in4 ka-ri-im ka-ni-is sa-he-er-GAL su-en6-na-da en-um-a-sur is-a-al um-ma su-en6-na-da-ma a-na en-um-a-sur-ma a-na-ku u am-ti i-na ka-ni-is wa-as-ba-ni-ma a-ta a-na tur4-hu-mi-it KU.BABBAR i-se-er i-di-ISTAR u su-en6-na-da i-li-a-lum i-su 1 tup-pu-um sa 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er su-en6-na-da tam-ka-ru-um i-su-u 1 tup-pu-um sa a-na hu-bu-lim a-ni-e-em i-di-ISTAR i-za-za-ni-i 1 tup-pu-um 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er su-en6-na-da u {d}UTU-tap-pa-i sa-lim-a-hu-um i-su su-en6-na-da qa-ta-tum 1 tup-pu-um 0.5 ma-na 3.5 GIN KU.BABBAR be-u-la-at i-di-su-en6 1 tup-pu-um 15 GIN KU.BABBAR hu-bu-ul su-ma-li-ib-si 1 tup-pu-um 15 GIN KU hu-bu-ul bu-lu-ut-be-li 1 tup-pu-um 15 GIN KU.BABBAR hu-bu-ul hi-da-di 1 tup-pu-um 4.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR hu-bu-ul {d}UTU-tap-pa-i 1 tup-pu-um 1 GU 20 ma-na SIG hu-bu-ul da-da-a 1 tup-pu-um 1 GU 2 ma-na URUDU SIG hu-bu-ul i-di-su-en6 1 tup-pu-um 1 GU URUDU SIG hu-bu-ul ki-ki-da-nim 1 tup-pu-um 2 GU URUDU SIG5 sa i-se-er su-en6-na-da u a-mur-a-sur ra-bi4-is-ka i sa-ha-ti-su-nu i-zi-zu 1 tup-pu-um sa 30 GU URUDU SIG5 i-su-ra-tim il5-ba-ni u a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 a-hu-ka i-di-nu-nim-ma a-na 30 GU URUDU SIG5 a-na hu-bu-ul i-di-ISTAR a-na da-su-su-u a-la-hi-nim a-za-zu-ni 1 tup-pu-um sa as-du-u u me-er-a-sa ta-ri-sa ta-as-u-mu-si-na u tup-pe-e a-hi-u-tim sa a-na na-ab-se-e e-zi-bu-ni-ni 1 tup-pu-um sa ku-nu-uk sa-lim-a-hi-im sa 1.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-na KU.BABBAR-ap i-ku-pi-a DUMU a-ki-a-a sa-lim-a-hu-um im-si-u-ma il5-qe-u 1 tup-pu-um sa ku-nu-uk i-ku-pi-a DUMU a-gi5-a-a sa a-na 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na u-zu-a DUMU i-da-a la i-tu-u-ru 1 tup-pa-am a-sur-ma-lik DUMU i-li-is-ti-kal e-zi-ba-am 1 tup-pa-am qa-i-is-ma a-mur-ISTAR DUMU ha-la-bi4-im e-zi-ba-am 1 tup-pu-um sa di-in4 ka-ri-im tur4-hu-mi-it a-ta-a e-zi-ba-am 1 ku-nu-ku-um sa i-di-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-na-da i-na bu-ul-ti-su-ma 4 um-mi-a-nu-u ik-nu-ku-ma ip-qi-du-nim ku-nu-ku-um sa {d}UTU-tap-pa-i i-na ku-nu-uk 3 ma-ri um-mi-a-nim pa-aq-dam a-ha-ma tup-pu-u sa si-bi4-a lu a su-mi-ka lu a-su-mi i-di-ISTAR sa i-na ba-ab DINGIR u-ha-ri-mu-u-ni tup-pu-u-a i-su-ra-tu-u-a lu ta-ah-si-sa-tu-u-a sa URUDU ma-di-ma mi-ma a-nim i-na 2 ta-ma-la-ki-a ka-an-ku-ma ta-ma-la-ki ku-nu-ki u u-tu-ub-ti i-na tur4-hu-mi-it a-na E wa-ab-ri-a te-ru-ub-ma e-ta-lu-tam tu-se-si 2 ta-ma-la-ki ku-nu-ki-a u u-tu-ub-ti sa-am-sa-am a-ni-tam-ma se-si-a-ma a-na ka-ri-im lu nu-bi4-il5-su-nu-ma a-se-er ku-nu-ki-a ka-ru-um ka-ni-is li-ik-nu-uk-su-nu-ma sa-am-sa-am a-ni-tam-ma a-na-ku u a-ta a-na a-lim{ki} lu nu-si-ma a-lum{ki} u be-el-ni lu-za-ki-ni-a-ti a ma-la di-in4 ka-ri-im ka-ni-is sa-he-er-GAL en-um-a-sur su-en6-na-da e-pu-ul um-ma en-um-a-sur-ma a-na su-en6-na-da-ma is-tu 3 sa-na-tim is-tu i-di-ISTAR tam-ka-ri-i i-mu-tu-u a-na sa i-se-er-i-a u i-se-er i-di-ISTAR tam-ka-ri-a mi-ma la ti-su-u i-na ka-ri-im tur4-hu-mi-it e-ta-lu-tam ba-lu-um ka-ri-im u tam-ka-ru-tim a-na E i-di-ISTAR tam-ka-ri-a sa KU.BABBAR 5 GU u e-li-is ha-bu-la-ni te-ru-bu-ma ma-sa-ar-tam sa tam-ka-ri-a ta-am-su-hu-ma uk-ta-na-sa-ad-ka u si-be-e as-ta-na-ka-ku-um u u-ra-ki-su-ka is-tu 3 sa-na-tim i-li-ku-ma ka-ru-um ka-ni-is sa-hi-ir GAL mi-si-ih-ka u su-ri-i-ka il5-mu-du-u-ma a-na ka-ri-im ka-ne-es ku-wa-a-ti u tap-pa-e-ka u-sa-si-hu-ni-ni-ma i-na ka-ri-im ka-ni-is mi-is-ha-am u su-re-e a-na ku-wa-a-ti u tap-pa-e-ka az-ku-ru-ma tup-pu-ni is-tu ITU.KAM la-pu-tu-ni-ma E ka-ri-im pa-aq-du-u-ni sa a-na E-ti-ka la e-ru-bu-ma mi-ma-ka la al-qe-u a-na tup-pe-e ma-du-tim i-na di-tim ta-as-ta-la-a-ni sa ni-is a-lim{ki} ka-i-la a-na a-lim{ki} u be-li-a a-wa-ti bi4-la ki-ma su-re-e u mi-is-ha-am az-ku-ru-su-ni-ma su-ut i di-tim u-sa-e-li-ni la tu-na-ha-ni u la tu-sa-a-la-ni ba-a-am tup-pi-ni li-ip-qi-du a-lum{ki} u ru-ba-u-um lu-za-ki-ni-a-ti a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um ka-ni-is i-di-ni-a-ti-ma IGI GIR sa a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in IGI a-zu-u DUMU PUZUR4-a-sur IGI {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni DUMU a-sur-ma-lik da-da-a DUMU ni-mar-ISTAR tap-pa-i-ni
tgt: According to the decision of the plenary assembly of the Kanesh colony, Ennum-Aššur questioned Suen-nādā. Thus said Suen-nādā to Ennum-Aššur: I and my servant girl were staying in Kanesh and you went to Durḫumit and acted as though you had authority concerning things that were not owed to you by entering into my guesthouse and pulling out objects and two of my sealed boxes.

src: um-ma <gap>-na-a u sa ki-ma i-a-ti-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma 22 GU 46 ma-na AN.NA sa a-na <big_gap> <gap> ne-pu-ul
tgt: From x-naya, the representatives of PN, to Pūšu-kēn: 22 talents 46 minas tin which ... ... ... we repaid.

src: a-na PUZUR4-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma bu-za-zu-ma i-nu-mi a-na ka-ni-is sa-hu-ha-ku-ma a-li-ka-ni AN.NA lu i-a-am lu ku-a-am a-na il5-we-da-ku e-zi-ib um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-di a-tu-ra-ni URUDU SIG5 e-pu-us-ma li-im-hu-ra-ni is-tu ka-ni-is a-tu-ra-ni la li-bi DINGIR-ma e-er-su-um i-sa-ab-ta-ni is-tu at-be-u um-ma a-na-ku-ma URUDU lu i-a-am lu sa PUZUR4-a-sur di-nam-ma a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum la-li-ik-ma KU.BABBAR 10 ma-na lu a-na PUZUR-a-sur lu i-a-ti le-pu-us i-ta-ba-la-ni-ma su-ku-ur-tum i-ta-as-kan-ma ITU.5.KAM u ITU.6.KAM a-su-hu-ur u i-nu-mi is-tu ka-ni-is a-na URUDU ta-as-ta-na-pa-ra-su-ni a-di 6-si-su u se-si-su aq-bi-su-um um-ma a-na-ku-ma URUDU lu nu-se-bi-il5-su-um u i-a-ti URUDU-i ta-da-nam la i-mu-a u ku-a-ti se-bu-lam la i-mu-a i-se-er URUDU ir-ta-na-bi4-is u mi-li-ik URUDU i-ma-li-ik la na-tu-ma ri-ig-ma-am u-la a-na-di-i um-ma a-na-ku-ma pa-ni-sa-am bu-la-ti qa-ti PUZUR-a-sur sa sa-ba-tim li-is-ba-at a-hi-di-ir-ma a-na si-ip-ri-im ra-mi-ni as-ku-un-ma <big_gap> um-ma a-na-ku-ma URUDU lu i-a-am lu sa PUZUR-a-sur sa a-ba-ki-im i pa-ni-a la-bu-uk URUDU a-na sa-la-tu-a-ar i pa-ni-a a-bu-ka-ma i ba-ab ha-ra-ni-a DAM.GAR u-ta-di-a-am a-di qa-ti URUDU li-is-ba-at um-ma a-na-ku-ma e-zi-ib DAM.GAR sa li-bi4-su lu-wa-di-a-am ki-ma a sa-la-tu-a-ar e-ru-bu ur-ki-a-ma 2 sa-zu-uz-tam us-ta-zi-za-am lu ku-a-ti u i-a-ti a-na ra-pu-di-ni i-ti-zi-iz-ma URUDU a-na sa DAM.GAR a-hi-e-em is-ta-kan u u4-ma-am a-na di-nim i-se-e-a-ni u a-na tar-ki-is-tim is-pu-ra-am um-ma su-ut-ma 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR u 1 GIN.TA ra-ki-sa-ni-su a-wi-lam te-em-su
tgt: To Puzur-Aššur from Buzāzu: When I was freed up (deported?) to go to Kanesh, I deposited tin, belonging to both you and I, with Ilī-wēdāku. After I returned from Kanesh, against the will of the god, the bed seized me.

src: a-sur-ma-lik DUMU e-na-nim a-la-hu-um DUMU e-na-ah-i-li u qar-wi-a DUMU a-sur-DUG si-bu-a a-sur-ma-lik DUMU a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU il5-ku-li si-bu-a-ma u sa sa-zu-za-tu-a ur-ki-ti is-ta-ku-nu-ni lu sa a-ta ur-ki-ti tu-ha-ri-mu a-la-ak u-ha-ra-ma a ma-la di-in ka-ri-im ka-ni-is TUR GAL a-la-ka-ma a-wa-tam a-da-na-kum ur-da-a-sur i-tur4-DINGIR e-pu-ul um-ma ur-da-a-sur a ma-la di-in ka-ri-im mi-ma si-bi sa ta-az-ku-ra-ni i-a-ti sa-ak-nu-nim um-ma i-tur4-DINGIR-ma ku-a-ti la sa-ak-nu-ni-kum a-na a-sur-GAL DUMU a-da-da sa-ak-nu a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um ka-ni-is i-di-ni-a-ti-ma
tgt: Aššur-mālik s. Ennānum, Al-aḫum s. Enaḫ-ilī and Qarwiya s. Aššur-ṭāb- my witnesses.

src: <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> pu-su-ke-en6 <big_gap>-su SU.NIGIN 42.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR <big_gap> ub-la-ku-um 18 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su LA DIRI 18 GIN sa-du-a-su sa-bu ku-nu-ki-a u ku-nu-uk la-li-im kur-ub-ISTAR na-asa-kum-A ki-ma la-qe-pi-im la-lu-um ik-nu-uk SU.NIGIN 2 GU 27 ma-na 10 8 GIN KU.BABBAR is-tu a-li-ka-ni i-li-ka-kum me-eh-ra-am i ku-nu-uk la-qe-pi-im ka-an-ku-ma za-ku-sa la-as-pu-ra-kum i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-ka sa u4-me <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> u su-ba-ti-ka i-ta-ba-al is-tu tur4-hu-mi-it a-sa-su-hi-su as-ta-par <big_gap> <gap>-pu-ul su-ma mi-ma a-na <big_gap> <gap> a-ma-ga-ar
tgt: ... Pūšu-kēn ... In all [PN] brought 42 1/3 minas silver for you. 18 minas silver, its excise added, its shipping charges satisfied under my seal and the seal of Lālum, Kurub-Ištar brings to you. Lālum sealed in place of Lā-qēpum. In total, he will (bring?) to you 2 talents 27 minas 8 shekels silver after I come. Seal the exchange goods with Lā-qēpum's seals and clear it. Let me send it to you. From the silver out on credit ... Also, he will carry (back) your textiles. After I ... (arrive-ish)? (at) Durḫumit, I will send word to you. ??? ... If anyone ... for/to ... I will come to an agreement ...

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma ta-ri-is-ma-tum u ISTAR-la-ma-si-ma a-bu-ni be-el-ni a-ta ma-ma-an i-na su-ha-re-e KU.BABBAR e-e-ri-is-ka-ma KU.BABBAR a-na qa-ti-su-nu e-tu-si-ir KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-ka a-na a-lim{ki} lu-ub-lu-nim-ma mi-ma a-bi-ni la i-ha-li-iq a-ma-kam ki-ma ni-a-ti a-ta-e-ru-ma lu tup-pu-u sa a-bi4-ni i-ba-si-u lu KU.BABBAR i-ba-si lu na-ru-qam a-na ma-ma-an i-di-in a-ma-kam sa-il5-ma u te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam-ma u-za-ni pi-ti a-na-kam KU.GI sa hu-ra-sa-nim nu-se-li-ma a-na si-ib-tim-ma i-ta-ab-lu-su u KU.BABBAR su-ut-ma uk-ta-al a-pu-tum i-hi-id-ma KU.BABBAR sa um-me-a-nim se-bi-lam ku-a-ti ni-da-gal 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na qa-qi-ri sa i-di-ISTAR ni-is-qu-ul a-ma-kam KU.BABBAR sa-as-qi-il5 su-ma se-bi-lam a-su-mi u-sur-sa-a-sur la-su-u ni-is-me-ma ku-lu-ka na-as-a-ni-su-ma a-bu-ni a-ta a-sar qa-qi-di-su sa-la-hi-im mi-li-ik a-na a-bi-su-u i-ta-ka-al ma-la qa-qa-su ta-sa-la-ha-ni mi-li-ik
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Tariš-mātum and Ištar-lamassī: Our dear father and lord, none of the youth should ask you for silver, and you must not release silver to their accounts. We depend on you! We paid out 2 minas silver for the plot of Idī-Ištar. We have heard nothing about Uṣur-ša-Aššur! We have shipped off all your merchandise. Our dear father, decide wherever you can salvage his capital. It is sent(?) to his father. Decide how much capital you can salvage.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na la-qe-pi-im u pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-na la-qe-ep qi-bi-ma 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa a-ta u a-sur-{d}UTU-si DAM.GAR ta-qi-pa-ni tu-se-bi-la-nim 53 ku-ta-ni 2 ANSE sa-lim-a-sur na-as-a-ku-nu-ti i-na tup-pi-ku-nu lu-qu-tum e-li-a-ma me-eh-ra-tim i-da-ni-a-ti-ma qa-at-ni u-ka-al a-sa-me-ma DAM.GAR qa-su es-la-at a-wi-lum u4-mu-su ma-al-u <gap> KU.BABBAR i <big_gap><gap> <gap> la <big_gap><gap> a <big_gap><big_gap> <gap> <big_gap><big_gap>
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Lā-qēpum and Pūšu-kēn: To Lā-qēpum: You sent me the 10 minas silver which you and Aššur-šamšī entrusted the merchant. Šalim-Aššur brings to you 53 I hear that the merchant, his hand is weak. As for the man, his terms are full. ... silver ...

src: um-ma su-hu-bur a-sur-ba-ni sal-ma-a-sur u i-a-sar-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u DAM.GAR qi-bi4-ma i-na 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa i-a-sar ub-la-ni e-ma-ru-um ma-al-a-ma 1 ma-na 12.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-tam a-na si-ti KU.BABBAR ku-lu-pi-nu KU.BI4 <gap> ma-na 0.33333 GIN 2 na-ru-qa-an 0.5 GIN <gap> 0.5 GIN wa-si-tum 2.33333 ma-na 8.5 GIN AN.NA-ak qa-tim KU.BI4 11 GIN i-a-sar i-ra-de8-a-kum
tgt: From Šū-Ḫubur, Aššur-bāni, Šalim-Aššur and Ea-šar to Pūšu-kēn and the merchant: From the 10 minas silver which Ea-šar brought, a donkey was filled and X minas 12 1/3 shekels silver remained. As for the remainder of the silver, the bundles of straw, its price (was) X minas 1/3 shekels. 2 sacks (cost) 1/2 shekels. x 1/2 shekels (was) the exit tax. 2 minas 28 1/2 shekels hand tin, its price (in silver was) 11 shekels. Ea-šar brings (this) to you.

src: 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR qa-ti a-bi-ni 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR qa-ti u 30 ma-na.TA SIG.HI.A sa 28.83333 ma-na 3.5 GIN sa ILLAT pu-su-ke-en6 i-na ka-ar-pa-ta u-su-ur-sa-a-sur il5-qe-ma a-la-hu-um tup-pu-su il5-pu-ut tup-pu-su ha-ar-ma-am sa a-na si-ib-tim i-lu-ku-su-ni a-la-hu-um u-ka-al 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR be-u-la-tum 7 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im ku-si-tim 1 ANSE sa-la-mu-um sa i-di-ISTAR e-zi-bu-su-ni u 40 ma-na URUDU sa-hi-ru-um si-ti URUDU-i-a mi-ma a-nim is-ti a-sur-i-di DUMU mu-mu-la-nim 12 GIN KI ha-lu-li 10.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa ga-nu-a hu-lu-pa a-se-er be-u-la-ti-su il5-qe 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR u si-ba-tu-su u 6 GIN KU.BABBAR sa i-nu-mi a-na pa-zu-ur-tim i-li-ku is-ti {d}ISKUR-ba-ni DUMU bu-da-dim
tgt: Ušur-ša-Aššur took 1 minas silver-the share of our father, 1 mina-my share, and 30 minas wool-worth 28 minas 53 1/2 shekels from the caravan of Pūšu-kēn in Karpata and Al-āḫum wrote his tablet. Al-āḫum holds his sealed tablet, which will go to the interest. 1 mina silver-beʾulātum, 7 shekels silver-price of the kusītum-garment, 1 black donkey which Idī-Ištar left, and 40 minas ṣaḫirum-copper-the remainder of my copper--all this is with Aššur-idī son of Mumulānum. Hulupa took 10 1/2 shekels silver belonging to Ganua for the purpose of a 2 minas silver and its interest, and 6 shekels silver from when they went on the smuggler's route is with Adad-bāni son of Budādum.

src: KISIB ha-na-na-rim KISIB a-sur-e-mu-qi DUMU i-di-su-en6 KISIB <big_gap>-a-sur DUMU su-ka-li-a 1.3333300000000001 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-mu-ra-am i-se-er a-mur-a-sur ka-ru-um i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa MAR.TU-ba-ni u a-sur-na-da <big_gap>
tgt: Amur-Aššur owes 1 1/3 minas checked (?) silver to the colony.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma ku-lu-ma-a-ma 1 GU AN.NA <gap> u i-ti-ra-su 5 ku-ta-ni ku-nu-ku sa su-ISTAR DUMU da-da-nim u 0.5 ANSE sa-la-mi-im mi-ma a-nim ir-ma-a-sur i-ra-de8-a-kum i-na a-wi-ti-ni mi-ma da-tam u-ku-ul-tam u sa sa-ri-dim u-la u-la-ma-da-ni a-bi4 a-ta be-li a-ta AN.NA-ki ki-ma e-ru-ba-ni a-na KU.BABBAR di-in-ma KU.BABBAR a-na pa-ni-a se-bi-lam su-ma AN.NA-ki la ta-ti-di-in 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na pa-ni-a se-bi4-la-ma is-tu u4-mi-im sa tu-se-ba-la-ni ta-ah-si-is-ta-ka i-di
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Kulumaya: 1 talent tin and its excess weight, 5 kutānum-textiles, under the seal of Šū-Ištar son of Dadānum, and 1/2 black donkey; all this Irma-Aššur drives to you. From our awītum assestment whatever dātum payments, food charges and wages of the sāridum he is not informing us. My dear father and lord, sell my tin, as much as arrives, for silver, and send the silver ahead of me. If my tin is not sold, send 2 minas silver ahead of me and your message know from what day you sent it.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 i-ku-pi-a-sur u ku-lu-ma-a qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-ma-lik-ma as-pu-ra-ku-nu-ti 1 GU AN.NA di-na-ma sa-na-tim sa-ma-nim su-ma sa-na-tim ta-as-a-ma-nim TUG.HI ka-la-su-nu u sa-na-tim a-na i-li-we-da-ku pi-iq-da-ma ha-ra-an tur4-hu-mi-it li-is-ri-dam AN.NA E pu-su-ke-en6 li-ni-di-u su-ma sa-na-tim la ta-as-a-ma AN.NA ku-lu-su-ma E pu-su-ke-en6 li-ni-di a-di te-er-ti i-la-ka-ni u4-ma-am u4-ra-am a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum a-da-gal is-ti pa-ni-e-ma a-li-ki-im KU.BABBAR sa si-ip-ru-tim u-se-ba-lam
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn, Ikūppī-Aššur, and Kulumaya from Aššur-mālik: I wrote to you, "Sell 1 talent of tin and purchase (some) kettles for me." If you purchased the kettles for me, entrust all the textiles and the kettles to Ilī-wēdāku and let him load the journey to Durḫumit. Let the tin be deposited in Pūšu-kēn's house. If you have not yet purchased the kettles, then let the tin - all of it - be deposited in Pūšu-kēn's house. Until my message arrives, I will look every day toward Purušḫattum. I will send the silver for the messages with the first traveller.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u u-su-ur-sa-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma su-sa-a-ma 15.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am ku-nu-ki-a a-sur-i-mi-ti na-as-a-ku-nu-ti a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma a-bi4 a-ta be-li a-ta a-na KU.BABBAR 1 GIN e-ni-ka la-ta-na-si i-bi4-sa-e-a la ta-ta-ka-al KU.BABBAR li-qe-ma tup-pi a-na u-su-ur-sa-a-sur di-in me-ra-ka a-na-ku a-ga-mi-il5-ka 2 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa si-im ANSE.HI.A is-ti a-hi-a u-se-ba-la-kum a-bi4 a-ta be-li a-ta tup-pi la ta-ka-la
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn and Uṣur-ša-Aššur from Susāya: Aššur-imittī brings you 15 1/2 minas refined silver under my seal. To Pūšu-kēn: My dear father and lord, do not let your eye lift a single shekel of silver. Do not retain my losses. I am your son! I will do you a favor. I will send the 2 minas 10 shekels silver for the price of donkeys to you with my brother. My dear father and lord, do not retain my tablet.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma su-ISTAR-ma KU.BABBAR i-na wa-ah-su-sa-na wa-qa-ar su-ku-ba-am as-ba-at-ma URUDU a-na sa-la-tu-a-ar us-te-bi-il5 um-ma su-ut-ma su-ha-ru-a li-li-ku-nim-ma KU.BABBAR a-sa-qa-la-kum su-ha-ru-su i-lu-ku-nim-ma KU.BABBAR u-sa-as-qa-al-su-ma u-se-ba-la-kum i-a-sar KU.BABBAR sa-qa-lam la i-mu-a um-ma su-ut-ma a-di 10 u4-me ra-mi-ni u-za-ka-ma a-na-ku-ma a-la-ak a-ma-kam aq-bi4-a-kum um-ma a-na-ku-ma wa-ar-ki-su lu-sa-zi-iz um-ma a-ta-ma wa-ar-ki-su la tu-sa-za-az sa-qa-la-am la i-mu-a a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta su-pu-ur-ma sa-pa-tim i-na lu-hu-sa-ti-a li-di-nu-ma KU.BABBAR pa-ni-a-ma lu-se-bi4-lu-ni-kum KU.BABBAR ma-la u-se-bu-lu-ni-ku-ni te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam a-na DUMU a-mur-ISTAR KU.BABBAR 1 GIN la ta-da-an hu-sa-ru-a ta-ad-nu-ma KU.BABBAR il5-ta-qe-u
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Šū-Ištar: Silver is scarce in Waḫšušana. I siezed Šū-Kūbum and he sent (some?) to Šalatuwar. He said, "Let my servants arrive, then I will pay you the silver." His servants arrived, I caused him to pay (the silver), and I send it to you. Ea-šār did not want to pay the silver (he owed). He said, "In ten days I will clear my own funds and I will personally go." I spoke to him there. I said , "May I cause you to stand for it after that." You had said, "Do not allow him to stand later. He does not want to pay the silver." My dear father and lord, write so that they sell fleeces in Luḫusattiya so that they send the silver ahead of you. Let your message come as to how much silver they send to you. Do not give a single shekel of silver to the sons of Amur-Ištar. They sold my lapis and took the silver.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma su-ku-bu-um-ma a-hu-u-a a-tu-nu qa-ti a-se-er sa i-na-a i-ta-di-u-ni u a-tu-nu i me-si-ti-a qa-ti i-ta-di-a mi-ma e a-pu-ul-ma li-bi4 e im-ra-as lu-qu-ti a-sar ba-la-ti-a di-na-ma KU ab-ka-nim u KU.BABBAR sa KI e-me-me mi-su-um a-di u4-mi-im a-nim la tu-se-bi4-la-nim u DUMU ib-ni-li za-ki-a-ma su-up-ra-nim mi-su <big_gap> sa um-ma na-ab-su-en-ma su-ku-bu-um KU-pi il5-qe ki-ma a-lim{ki} qa-tam sa-ka-nim u-ta-bi4-u KU.BABBAR sa ki-li-a qa-ti na-ab-su-en sa-ak-na-at-ni a-di ki-li-a i-li-ka-ni KU i-bi-si-ma ki-li-a i-li-ka um-ma ki-li-a-ma a sa ki-ma na-ab-su-en su-ma qa-at-ku-nu ta-sa-ka-na a-na a-lim{ki} la-li-ik KU ki-li-a il5-te-qe u tup-pa-am sa ki-li-a ha-ar-mu a-na-ku mi-ma la al-qe
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Šū-Kūbum: My dear brothers, my share in addition to that of Innāya which they deposited--you yourselves deposit my share from my Do not pay out anything and so disappoint me. Sell my merchandise wherever it is profitable and send off the silver to me. Now, as for the silver owed by Ememe, why have you not sent it to me until this day? Also, clear the son of Ibnili and send me a message. Why is it that Nab-Suen said, "Šū-Kūbum took my silver." Instead of laying claim in the city, I dropped the matter. Now, the silver which Kiliya(?) set in the share of Nab-Suen—until Kiliya camethe silver was available, then Kiliya came. Kiliya said to the representatives of Nab-Suen, "If you make a claim, I will go to the city (assembly)." Kiliya took the silver. Now, they sealed Saliya's tablet. (???) I didn't receive anything.

src: <gap> GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er i-la-ap-ra-at-ba-ni PUZUR4.DINGIR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ku-bi4-im u kur-ub-ISTAR 0.25 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im u-sa-ab ITU.KAM sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-di-a-bi4-im IGI a-sur-{d}UTU-si IGI da-da-a
tgt: Ilabrat-bāni owes Puzer-ilī (unknown amount) shekel refined silver. He will add 1/4 shekel per month from the ḫamuštum of Šū-Kūbim and Kurub-Ištar. Month: ša sarrātim Eponymate:after Iddin-abim. Witnesses: Aššur-Šamši, Dadaya.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa ik-ri-bi4-ka sa a-sur tu-se-bi4-lam 4 ku-ta-ni na-as-u-ni-kum 3 GIN KU.BABBAR a qa-ti-su a-di-in AN.NA ki-ma i-sa-ku-nu-ni li-is-ku-na-kum su-nu-nu na-as-a-kum a-na a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi4-ma 12 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa ik-ri-bi4-ka sa a-sur tu-se-bi4-lam ni-is-ha-su u-sa-he-er-ma <big_gap> u si-ti KU.BABBAR <big_gap><big_gap> <gap>-in <big_gap><big_gap> <gap>-ni-ni <big_gap> <gap> za-ki-a-ma KU.BABBAR i pa-ne-e-ma a-li-ki-im su-up-ra-nim a-na a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi4-ma su-ma a-hi a-ta si-ti lu-qu-tim sa se-pi-ka za-ki-a-ma se-bi4-la-ma a-di sa-ah-ra-ti-ni li-ba-al-ki-it-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN li-bi-tam lu-qu-tam wa-ar-ki-tam sa u-se-bi4-la-ku-ni as-pu-ra-kum um-ma a-na-ku-ma KU.BABBAR a-na E a-lim{ki} a-sa-qal i-hi-id-ma KU.BABBAR se-bi4-lam
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā and Aššur-taklāku: to Aššur-nādā: You have sent me 1/2 mina of silver from your votive offerings for divine Aššur. They are bringing to you 4 kutānu-textiles. I gave 3 shekels for his expenses. Let him establish the tin for you at the same rate they use (for others). Šū-Nūnu brings it to you. To Aššur-taklāku: You sent me 1/2 mina 5 shekels of silver from your votive offerings to divine Aššur. I have deducted its [import] duty and .... and the rest of the silver break .... Clear it and send the silver to me with the first traveler. To Aššur-taklāku: If you are truly my brother, clear the remainder of the goods transported by you and send it to me, and let it be shipped (even) while you are delayed so every shekel of silver is active for me. I wrote you about the later shipment I sent to you, saying: "I have to pay the money to the City Hall." Take care and send me the silver.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma 22 {TUG}ku-ta-ni 1 ANSE sa-la-ma-am ku-ra-ra u i-di-a-sur ub-lu-ni-kum 1 GU 5 ma-na AN.NA i-di-a-sur u-se-bi4-la-ku-ma 9.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR tu-se-bi4-la-ma u ha-la-aq su-ma a-hi a-ta a-ta-ak-la-ma i li-bi4-ka KU.BABBAR sa se-bu-li-im se-bi4-la-ma TUG.HI.A ik-ri-bu sa a-sur KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na-um 1 ma-na ra-ma-ka ku-bu-us-ma li-ba-am di-nam KU.BABBAR 2 ma-na sa ba-ab ha-ra-ni-ka sal-ma-a-sur u a-sur-ba-ni la tu-se-bi4-lam
tgt: From Aššur-imittī to Pūšu-kēn: Kurara and Idī-Aššur brought to you 22 kutānum-textiles, 1 black donkey. Idī-Aššur sent to you 1 talent 5 minas tin and you sent 9 2/3 minas silver and then it was lost. If you are my brother, absorb (some of the loss) and send whatever silver can be sent from your own funds and concerning the textiles (that are) the ikrībū ššūr, extend yourself for one mina per mina (extra) and thus give (me) encouragement. You did not send about 2 minas silver to Šalim-Aššur and Aššūr-bāni at your departure.

src: IGI <big_gap>-li-mu-um IGI <big_gap><gap>-<gap>-nim IGI e-na-be-lim <big_gap> IGI en-na-nim DUMU a-bu-SA IGI a-sur-SIG5 DUMU a-sur-re-si 1 ma-na 8 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-mur-ISTAR im-di-lum i-su is-ti KU.BABBAR uk-ta-al IGI {d}en-LIL-ba-ni DUMU il5-ba-ni IGI PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU i-sar-ki-da-a-sur IGI i-ku-pi-a DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-mur-ISTAR DUMU da-da-im-di-lum i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ku-bi-im u ka-zi-a a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tim li-mu-um i-di-a-bu-um IGI {d}en-LIL-ba-ni DUMU il5-ba-ni IGI PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU i-sar-ki-da-a-sur IGI i-ku-pi-a-sur DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ku-ra-ra im-di-lum i-su i-na e-la-i-su-ma i-na ka-ni-is i-sa-qal IGI u-su-pi-is-ki-im IGI ku-lu-ma-a 12 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-DU10 DUMU ka-ri-a im-di-lu i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-a-nim u li-ba a-na 53 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-me-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um a-sur-SIG5 DUMU a-bar-zi-zi-im IGI en-na-su-en6 DUMU ki-li-a IGI PUZUR4-sa-du-e a-hi-su IGI a-nu-um-DINGIR DUMU a-sur-e-mu-qi 2.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er i-da-a DUMU sa-ak-si-im u u-zu-a DUMU a-la-a-a im-di-lum i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku u ka-zi-a a-na 4 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-su-bu ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-i-li li-mu-um a-la-hu-um DUMU i-na-ah-DINGIR KU.BABBAR i-na qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu u ke-ni-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI {d}en-LIL-ba-ni DUMU il5-ba-ni IGI u-sur-sa-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti-<big_gap> 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-DU10 im-di-lum <big_gap> i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ku-bi-im u ka-zi-a a-na 4 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM kan-mar-ta li-mu-um i-di-a-bu-um
tgt: Witnesses: PN limmum, xxxx-nim, Enna-Bēlim, xxxxxxxxxx, Ennanim s. Abusa, Aššur-damiq s. Aššur-rēṣī. He will pay in Kanesh when he comes up. (The responsibility to pay) the silver is bound to whomever is solvent and legally responsible.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma a-mur-ISTAR-ma 4 me-at 20 ma-na URUDU sa i-na E ka-ri-im ad-ma-ti-ni URUDU us-a-ma qa-at-ka al-qe-ma i-ba-si KU.BABBAR i-na ma-hi-ri-im la-su-u URUDU da-ni-sa-ma u-me-ru-u a-bi a-ta i-hi-id-ma su-ma TUG-tu la-su lu AN.NA SIG5 lu a-mu-tam sa-ha-ar-tam za-ku-tam sa-ma-ma se-bi4-lam su-ha-ri-a tur4-da-am 2 {TUG}su-ul-hi a-na qa-ti-ka a-di-i
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Amur-Ištar: 420 minas of copper for which you are recorded in the colony office, the copper has gone out and I received your share and it is here. There is no silver in the market. They pile up copper in massive piles. My dear father, take care to, if there are no textiles, buy either fine tin or pure Send my servant. I deposited 2

src: KISIB i-di-su-en6 DUMU i-tur4-i-li KISIB kur-ub-ISTAR DUMU PUZUR4.DINGIR KISIB PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU da-la-as KISIB a-mur-a-sur 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-mur-a-sur DUMU i-li-a-lim a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa na-ra-am-ZU u ha-na-nim a-na 11 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul a-na 1 ma-na-im 2 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-u-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-mur-a-sur DUMU i-li-a-lim
tgt: Seals: Idī-Suen s. Itūr-ilī, Kurub-Ištar s. Puzur-ilī, Puzur-Ištar s. Dalaš, Amur-Aššur. Amur-Aššur s. Ili-ālim owes Aššur-rēʾī 3 minas refined silver. He will pay 11 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Naram-Suen and Hannānim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: a-na i-di-su-en6 a-sur-na-da u en-num-a-sur qi-bi4-ma um-ma ku-ra-ra-ma a-na i-di-su-en6 qi-bi4-ma 15 GIN KU.BABBAR E ka-ri-im tal-qe 12 GIN a-na a-sur-dan DUMU u-ku si-ip-ri-im as-qul 10 GIN a-na DUMU PUZUR4-a-na as-qul la 0.5 ma-na 7 GIN KU.BABBAR i-na li-bi4-ka a-na pu-uh a-ta-a me ra ti im ta-ta-na-ni-ma KU.BABBAR-pi ta-za-ku su-ma a-bi4 a-ta li-bi4 la tu-la-ma-an KU.BABBAR ku-un-ka i-na is-te-en6 a-li-ki-im se-bi4-la-ni-im
tgt: To Iddin-Suen, Aššur-nādā and Ennam-Aššur from Kurara: You borrowed 15 shekels of silver from the house of a merchant. I paid 12 shekels to Aššur-dān son of Uku, the messenger. I paid 10 shekels to the son of Puzur-Anna. In all: you owe 1/2 mina 7 shekels of silver. Instead of you giving me a corresponding amount, you seize my silver! If you are truly my father, do not make me angry. Seal (pl.) the silver. Send it to me with the first traveler.

src: 0.5 ma-na 5 GIN <big_gap> 6.25 GIN KU.GI sa DUMU.SAL a-sur-na-da 0.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR qa-dum sa ni-qi-a ar-si-ah ub-lam 0.33333 ma-na 1 GIN KU.BABBAR se-bu-la-tum mi-ma a-nim sa a-sur-na-da a-na mi-ma a-nim KU.BABBAR 3 ma-na sa-ru-pa-am is-ti a-hu-wa-qar ki-ma a-sur-na-da PUZUR4-a-na il5-qe a-na 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-sur-na-da a-na a-hu-qar u-la i-tu-ar su-ma i-tu-ar PUZUR4-a-na u-ba-ab-su su-ma mi-ma a-sur-na-da i li-bi4 a-hu-wa-qar i-su i-se-e-su <gap> ITU.1.KAM qa-ra-tim li-mu-um DU10-a-sur IGI su-mi-a-bi4-a IGI a-ma-a
tgt: 1/2 mina 5 shekels of silver, 6 1/4 shekels of gold belonging to Aššur-nādā's daughter, 1/3 mina 5 shekels of silver including that of my sacrifice, Arši-ah brought. 1/3 mina 1 shekel of silver were (separate) shipments-all this belongs to Aššur-nādā. For all this Puzur-Anna has received in silver: 3 minas of refined silver from Ahu-waqar on behalf of Aššur-nādā. With respect to the 3 minas of silver Aššur-nādā must not raise claims against Ahu-waqar. If he raises claim, Puzur-Anna must clear him. Should Ahu-waqar owe anything else to Aššur-nādā, he may sue him. Month Qarra' atum. Eponymate: Ṭab-Aššur. Witnessed by Šumi-abiya, witnessed by Amaya.

src: um-ma <gap> <gap>-in-ma a-di-i sa pu-su-ke-en6 sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni um-ma a-ta-ma a-na se-er <gap>-ba-tim is-pu-ra-am a-ta <gap> ta-se-e su-ut i la i-dim su-mi a-bi-ni i-za-ka-ar u ku-a-ti a-zi-ki-ka sa-ba-at is-pu-ra-am is-ti <gap> lu se-su-ti a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta i-na {d}UTU-si sa tup-pi ta-sa-me-u 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR <gap> ma al <big_gap> <gap> ki i ta <big_gap> um-mi-a-nam sa a-na a-wa-tim-ma i-za-zu lu-sa-zi-zu-ni-kum u te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam a-di ha-ra-ni sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni URUDU 0.33333 GU ma-si-a-am sa e-pu-su-u i-ba-si a-na da-as-e-su a sa-la-tu-wa-ar e-ra-ab-ma ba-ti-iq u-tu-ur a-na KU.BABBAR u-ta-ar-su-ma a-se-ri-ka a-ta-la-kam-ma a-na a-lim{ki} ha-ra-ni <big_gap> a a-na sa <big_gap>
tgt: Thus ... to ... Regarding the matter about Pūšu-kēn about which you wrote, you said, "He wrote to x-batum." You .. he will clear the name of our father. Now, to you, I will zkʾ you. My dear father and lord, on the day that you read this tablet, (give?) 2 minas silver to ... And let your report come. Concerning the caravan of the city about which your wrote, about 1/3 talent of washed copper that he produced is available. I will to Šalatuwar in the spring and he will convert it to silver, cheap or dear, and I will come to you and to the carvan of the city ...

src: 7.5 GIN.KU.BABBAR a-na sa-he-er-tim i-nu-mi a lu-hu-sa-ti-a i-li-ku 4.5 GIN a-na ku-ra-ra a-su-mi su-ha-ri-su GIN KU.BABBAR pa-ni-um i si-im ni-ga-li i-ri-ih 1.5 GIN a-na is-hi-u-li mi-ma a-nim KI hu-zi-is u du-ru-uh-nu
tgt: 7 1/2 shekels silver to the boy, when he went to Luĭhuzattiya. 4 1/2 shekels to Kurara Concerning his boy, the previous shekel silver is left from the price of the sickles. 1 1/2 shekels for the girdle(?) All this is owed by Ḫuziš and Duruḫnu.

src: 5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-na li-bi en-na-su-en6 DUMU i-li-a-lim is-tu wa-ah-su-sa-na i-na e-ra-bi4-su-ma u-se-ba-lam IGI lu-zi-na DUMU a-sur-ba-ni
tgt: The 5 shekels silver which Enna-Suen son of Ilī-ālum owes, I will send it to him after he arrives from Waḫšušana. Witness: Luzina son of Aššur-bāni.

src: KISIB a-hu-wa-qar DUMU su-ISTAR KISIB a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku DUMU am-ri-a KISIB PUZUR4-a-be-eh DUMU en-um-a-sur KISIB su-a-nim DUMU me-na-nim 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-a-nim DUMU me-na-nim su-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-ba-ni i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa qa-ti e-na-ah-DINGIR a-na 6 ha-mu-us-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.1.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um su-su-en6 DUMU pa-pi-li-im
tgt: Seals: Aḫu-waqar s. Šū-Ištar, Aššur-taklāku s. Amria, Puzur-Abiḫ s. Ennum-Aššur, Šū-Anum s. Menānum. Šū-Anum s. Menānum owes Šū-Ištar s. Aššur-bāni 2 minas refined silver. He will pay 6 weeks from ḫamuštum after Inaḫ-ilī. If he does not pay at the fulfillment of his term, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest. Month: Kuzallī. Eponymate: Šū-Suen s. Papīlim.

src: um-ma sa-at-a-sur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma a-su-mi me-eh-si-im ku-lu E-tim ma-su-uh su-ma pa-nu-ka a-na a-wi-lim sa-ak-nu a-na i-li sa-qi-i u a-bu-u la e-ta-as-ru-ni u a-ta a-ma-nu-hi la ta-sa-ra-ni u-la ku-a-ti ma-ma-an sa-ni-a-am la i-su a-su-mi is-tu be-el-te-e-gal-lim a-di kan-bar-ta ku-ta-a DA <gap>-ma tu-ni a-ni ur-ta-i-bu 20 SILA ma-da-dam is-ti a-ma-ti-ka-ma u-us-ta-am-hi-ru-ni GEME 20 SILA e-ka-la u a-na-ku 20 SILA a-kal a-ni su-mi su-ha-ri-im la i-za-ku-ru a-na-nu-um a-ta la ta-za-kar-su-nu a-li-ku i-li-ku-nim-ma su-mi la ta-az-ku-ur ma-nu-ba su-mi-i li-iz-ku-ur a-la-ku-a-ti ma-ma-an sa-ni-a-am la i-su u-la is-<big_gap>-tu i-na-ar ma <gap> a <gap> ni-qi-a-am i-di-nu-nim ni-ki-is-tu-um <gap>
tgt: Šāt-Aššur to Pūšu-kēn: Concerning the attack (of the disease), the entire house is affected. If you intend to come to the city, sacrifice to the gods! But the elders do not look after me. And you yourself, Amunaḫi, do not take care of me ... (who will?) Beside you, I have no one else! Because you did not .... from Belet-ekallin (month i) to Kanwarta (month ix), Kutaya ... check MIchel's translation... Now, they have become angry. They have provided me with 20 silas rations along with your female slaves. A slave girl eats 20 silas (of rations). And I am to eat (only) 20 silas (of rations)?! Now, they do not respect the name of the youth...? Here, you must not invoke them. The travellers will go, but you must not invoke my name. Who would invoke my name. Beside you, I have no one else! not from Inaar ?? (broken section) ... we wait? they gave to me, nikistum...

src: a-na a-sur-na-da u su-su-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa ka-sa-ri-a il5-ka-si-id a si-a-ma-tim <gap>-<gap>-<gap> sa mi-ma il5-ka-si-id i-za-zu lu ANSE lu si-ma-am ma-la is-u-mu KU.BABBAR a-na a-li-ki-im pa-nim-ma pi-iq-da-ma lu-ub-lu-nim u su-ut <gap>-<gap> is-ti u-nu-ti-su li-li-kam su-ma la i-la-kam a-na a-li-ki-im pi-iq-da-ma lu-ub-lu-nim KU.BABBAR a-na KU.BABBAR-pi-a i-tu-a-ar su-ma mi-ma i-qa-bi4 a-na <gap> KU.KI pa-ku-nu di-na
tgt: To Aššur-nādā and Šū-Suen from Pūšu-kēn: The 3 minas silver which I gave to my kaṣṣārum, Il-kāšid, for purchases, whatever Il-kāšid 'stands', whether donkeys or purchases as much as he purcahsed, entrust the silver to a traveller immediately so that he brings it. Now, as for him, let him come with his goods. If he will not come, entrust it to a traveler and let them bring it. The silver will return to my silver (funds). If he says anything (against it), give your (pl.) word concerning the gold.

src: 4.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR li-ti i-se-er a-lu-lu-wa i-di-ISTAR i-su a-lu-lu-wa is-ti i-di-ISTAR uk-ta-al mi-ma ta-ak-si-tam sa u-ka-su-u i-di-ISTAR si-ta qa-te-en i-la-qe is-te-et qa-tam a-lu-lu-wa i-la-qe su-ma i pa-ni i-di-ISTAR pu-uz-ra-am e-ta-ha-az a-na 1 ma-na 6 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab su-ma ba-lum i-di-ISTAR a-na ig-ri i-ta-la-ak i-sa-ri-iq-su-um a-na E i-di-ISTAR e-ra-ab u u-si ba-lum i-di-ISTAR a-na ig-ri u-la i-la-ak IGI ha-pu-a-la IGI i-la-li-a-ah-su IGI a-mu-ra IGI ta-lu-wa-na IGI ku-la IGI e-la-li IGI ta-ta-li
tgt: Aluluwa owes 4 1/2 minas of lītu-silver to Iddin-Ištar; Aluluwa is held (in employment) by Iddin-Ištar. Whatever income he may achieve, Iddin-Ištar will take two-thirds, and Aluluwa will take one-third. If he goes into hiding from Iddin-Ištar, he will add interest at the rate 6 shekels per mina per month. If without Iddin-Ištar's permission he takes up work for hire, it will be taken away from him. He may enter and leave Iddin-Ištar's house. Without Iddin-Ištar's permission he must not take up work for hire. Witnessed by Habuala, by Ilaliahšu, by Ammura, by Taluwana, by Kula, by Elāli, by Tatali.

src: KISIB su-ka-li-a KISIB ga-zi-a KISIB a-gu5-za 0.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-gu5-za a-sur-{d}UTU i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ka-li-a u na-ab-su-en6 0.66666 GIN 15 SE i ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab
tgt: Witnesses: Sukkalīya, Gaziā, Aguzā. Aguza owes Aššur-šamšī 25 shekels refined silver. He will add 2/3 shekels 15 grains per month from the ḫamuštum of Sukkalliya and Nāb-Suen.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma i-ku-nu-um-ma 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am su-ISTAR 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR u ni-is-ha-su {d}ISKUR-ba-ni i-na e-ra-bi4-su-nu sa-qa-lam qa-bi-u u as-pu-ra-ku-um mi-su-um KU.BABBAR la tu-sa-as-qi-il5-ma la tu-se-bi4-lam 13 ku-ta-ni en-na-su-en6 a-na e-la-li u-se-bi4-lam mi-ma sa qa-tim sa-ri-dim sa-bu-u u 7 GIN KU.BABBAR u-se-ba-lam 1 ku-ta-nam {d}ISKUR-ba-ni a-na e-la-li-ma u-bi4-il5 mi-su-um ki-ma ku-ta-ni a-na e-la-li ta-ap-qi-du te-er-ta-ka la i-li-kam 8 ma-na AN.NA is-tu tu-us-u a-di-na-ku-um
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Ikūnum: 1/3 mina refined silver - Šū-Ištar, 1/2 mina silver and its excise - Adad-bāni--they promised to pay at their arrival. Now I wrote to you. Why did you not collect the silver and send it? Enna-Suen brought 13 All of the share of the driver is paid up. Also, I will send 7 shekels silver. Adad-bāni brought 1 Why did your message never come concerning the textiles you sold on credit to Elāli? I gave/sold you 8 minas tin after you left.

src: i-na 9 TUG sa a-na-ku e-zi-bu 6 TUG a-na a-la-hi-im 3.33333 TUG ki-is-da-tu-a SA.BA 0.33333 TUG 1 {TUG}ku-si-tum 1 mas-ku-num i-a-um i-na wa-ah-su-sa-na 5.66666 TUG i-na E.GAL-lim ki-is-da-tum sa i-li-a 5 {TUG}ma-ku-hu u tu-tu-ru sa a-la-hi-im sa i-li-a-lim-ma <gap> GU 6.66666 ma-na AN.NA sa se-ep i-li-a SA.BA 5 ma-na 9.66666 GIN AN.NA a-na i-li-a-lim i-li-ik <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR a-hu-ur <big_gap> AN.NA <big_gap> sa se-ep ku-ra-ra <gap> ma-na 18.33333 GIN AN.NA hu-bu-lam 7 {TUG}ku-ta-nu ik-ri-bu sa a-sur 1 TUG su-ru-um ik-ri-bu sa {d}ISTAR 1 {TUG}ku-ta-num 2 TUG su-ru-tum <gap> a-sur-i-di a-na i-li-a-lim <gap> a-na 3.6666600000000003 ma-na a-na ka-ri-im ta-ad-nu <gap> <big_gap> 4.66666 GIN pa-zu-ur-su-nu <big_gap> 6 GIN <gap> 5 GIN.TA <gap> 1.5 GIN.TA a-na ka-ri-im as-qul si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-su 3 ma-na <gap> <big_gap> <gap> ma-na si-im <gap> ma-na <big_gap> <gap> 12 <gap> <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap>
tgt: Of the 9 textiles which I personally left, 6 textiles were for Alāhum; 5 2/3 textiles in the palace were the share of Ilī-ruum; 5 makūhu-textiles and the x talents 6 2/3 minas of tin transported by ... silver remains. ... tin ... 7 kutānu-textiles were the votive offerings of Aššur, 1 black textile was the votive offerings of Ištar; 1 kutānu-textile and 2 black textiles which Aššur-idi entrusted to Ilī-ālum have been sold for 3 2/3 minas of ... 4 2/3 shekels: expenses for their smuggling;

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma i-na KU.BABBAR sa ik-ri-bi4-a sa 1 ma-na KU.GI sa-am-sa-am a-na a-sur e-ep-sa-am ni-is-ha-sa a-ha-ma ku-un-ka-am 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR hu-sa-e-e SIG5 u ni-is-ha-su a-na {d}ISTAR ku-un-ka-am si-ti KU.BABBAR a-ha-ma ku-nu-uk-ma se-bi4-lam u a-ta za-ki-a-ma ra-ma-ka ti-ib-a-ma a-tal-kam sa i-se-ri-ka sa-hu-ru-ni na-ru-qa-tim na-as-u u sa i-se-ri-a sa-hu-ru-ni 10 ma-na KU.GI is-ta-ap-ku al-ka-ma na-ru-qa-am na-an-se-ma u si-i u su-ma a-ma-kam ma-ma-an i-da-na-kum le-qe al-ka-ma u a-na-kam a-sar la-qa-im la-su a-su-mi ha-ra-ni-ka i-lu-um li-ba-ti-ka ma-li ti-ib-a-ma a-tal-kam 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa tu-wa-ta-ra-ni a di-na-an na-pa-as-ti-ka li-li-ik ik-ri-bu sa a-sur u {d}ISTAR sa TUG ga-su-ri-im u sa {d}NIN.SUBUR su-ma la ma-si li-ba-al-ki-tu
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā: Of the silver from my votive offerings you should make me a sun-disk for divine Assur, weighing 1 mina of gold. Seal the import duty separately. Place 6 minas of good quality scrap silver plus its import duty, for divine Ištar, under seal. Seal then also the rest of the silver and send it to me. Then you must clear yourself of obligations, set out and come here. People less important than you administer joint-stock investments, and people less important than me have invested 10 minas of gold. Come and take over a joint-stock capital and only then leave again. Also, if anyone there wants to give you anything, then take it! Come then, for here there is no opportunity for receiving anything. The god is full of anger towards you because of your journey. Set out and come! The 10 minas of silver which you will give me in addition will serve as a substitute for your own life. As to the votive offerings for divine Assur and Ištar, the textiles from Gasur and for divine Ilabrat--if there is not enough, then have it shipped.

src: 3 TUG u <gap> GIN KU.BABBAR ap sa <gap> E ka-ri-im la-ap-ta-ku 2 ma-na 18 GIN pu-su-ke-en6 i ni-ka-si ni-sa-kan
tgt: I am written down in the colony office for 3 textiles [(and x shekels)?] silver of the ... . We will set 2 minas 18 shekels (silver) for(?) Pūšu-kēn at accountings.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi4-ma 3 TUG ra-qa-tum 2 {TUG}si-li-ip-ki-u 4 {TUG}ta-ku-us-ta-u 2 {TUG}lu-bu-su 1 11 TUG.HI.A 1 ma-na 0.83333 GIN KU.BABBAR it-bu-lu 0.5 GIN wa-si-tum 0.33333 GIN si-im na-ru-qi-im 2 ma-na AN.NA a-na qa-ti-su 17 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR-ap-su 7 GIN KU.GI sa la ta-di-in a-ta-ma is-ti wa-ar-ki-u-tim u-se-ba-la-ku-um KU.GI lu sa ma-i-su lu ku-bu-ur-si-nu-um ma-ma-an i-na ba-ri-ku-nu la u-se-bi-la-am su-ma KU.GI pa-sa-lum SIG5 se-bi4-la-nim mi-ma a-nim {d}UTU-ba-ni u DINGIR-su-ra-bi4 lu-qu-tam sa a-di-na-ku-ni u lu-qu-ut 1 GU-tim a-ni-qi za-ki-a-ma ti-ib-a-ma a-tal-kam
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-taklāku: 3 thin textiles, 2 1/2 shekel: export duty. 1/3 shekel: the price of a sack. 2 minas of tin at his disposal--at the rate 17 to 1, in silver 7 shekels. Your gold was not sold. You said: "I shall send it to you as soon as possible." No one among you should send me any alluvial gold or any kuburšinnu-gold; if the pašallu-gold is of good quality, then send me some. All this Šamaš-bāni and Ilšu-rabi are bringing to you.

src: KISIB a-sur-GAL DUMU ma-nu-um KISIB i-ku-nim DUMU {d}UTU-ba-ni KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU la-qe-ep 19 0.33333 GIN 15 SE KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU la-qe-ep DAM.GAR-ru-um i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa pu-su-ke-en6 ITU.KAM sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-li-dan 0.66666 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam a-na KU.BABBAR a-nim u-sa-ab
tgt: Seals: Aššur-rabi s. Mannum, Ikūnum s. Šamaš-bāni, Puzur-Aššur s. Lā-qēpum. [Puzur-Aššur s. Lā-qēpum] owes the merchant 1/3 shekels 15 grains [refined silver]. He will add 2/3 shekels per month as interest to this silver from the ḫamuštum of Pūšu-kēn, month Šā kēnātim, eponymate after teh one of Ilī-dān.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma i-di-ku-bu-ma ta-as-pu-ram um-ma a-ta-ma KU.BABBAR <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<big_gap> u me-hi-ra-am sa na-as-pe-er-ti-ka la-pi-ta-ma la-as-ta-me ki-ma a-sar 1 ma-na.TA KU.BABBAR is-qu-lu-ni-ni a-di u-mi-im a-nim i-im-su-ru-ni-ni um-ma a-na-ku-ma mi-nam lu-se-bi4-il5 su ma <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> <gap>-ib-ri i-na a-la-ki-<gap> <gap>-<gap> KU.BABBAR-pi-ka u a-na-ku <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR u-se-ba-al <gap> GIN KU.BABBAR u-se-ba-al <gap> sa a-se-er a-bi4-<gap> <gap> <big_gap> li-li-<gap> <big_gap>
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Idī-Kūbum: You wrote me. "Write down the silver ... the exchange value of your shipment so that I may read it.

src: a-na su-ku-bi-im qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6 u i-na-a-ma 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR ma-as-qa-al-tum i sa se-ep pu-su-ke-en6 i-si-qi-il5-ma 10 GIN si-ib-tum KU.BABBAR ma-su-hu-um i-bi-si-ma 15 GIN ki-ib-sa-tum SU.NIGIN 10.33333 ma-na 5 GIN SA.BA 10 GIN sa-du-a-tam ni-di-in-ma 10 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-ni a-sur-ma-lik na-as-a-kum um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma u4-mu tam-ka-ri-ka sa se-pi-a 3 ITU.KAM a-hu-ru 10 ma-na 17 GIN KU.BABBAR sa su-ku-bi-im sa-du-a-su sa-bu 6 GIN a-na PUZUR4-a-sur mi-ma a-nim a-na a-sur-ma-lik ap-qi-id IGI PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU su-la-ba-an IGI PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU su-{d}EN.LIL IGI dan-a-sur
tgt: To Šū-Kūbum from Pūšu-kēn and Innāya: 10 minas silver, the installment payment from the goods of Pūšu-kēn's transport has been paid, and 10 shekels, interest, turned out to be silver of inferior quality, so 15 shekels was the compensation. In total it is 10 minas 25 shekels. Thereof, we gave 10 shekels as the šaddu'ātum and Aššur-mālik brings you 10 minas 15 shekels of silver. From Pūšu-kēn: The terms of your merchant(s) related to my 10 minas 15 shekels silver belonging to Šū-Kūbum, its Witnesses: Puzur-Aššur son of Šū-Laban, Puzur-Aššur son of Šū-Enlil, Dān-Aššur.

src: 1.5 ma-na 5.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er sa-ha-ar-DINGIR DUMU a-sur-e-mu-qi DUMU qa-qa-da-nim a-mur-DINGIR DUMU i-nu-ba-a i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa li-lu-si-im ITU.KAM ta-an-wa-ar-ta li-mu-um a-al-DU10 DUMU pi-la-ah-a-sur 0.66666 ma-na 7.66666 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 0.66666 ma-na 7.66666 GIN a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qul <gap> GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab <gap>-<big_gap> IGI bu-zu-li-a IGI su-e-ta-ta
tgt: Ṣeḫr-ilī s. Aššur-emūqī s. Qaqqadānum owes Amur-ilī s. i-nu-ba-a 1 mina 35 1/3 shekels refined silver. He will pay 47 2/3 shekels refined silver thirteen weeks from the ḫamuštum of Lilušum, month of Tanwarta, Eponymate of Āl-ṭāb s. Pilaḫ-Aššur. He will pay 47 2/3 shekels in twenty weeks. If he does not pay at the fulfillment of his term, he will add x shekels (per mina per month) as interest.

src: 15 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-mur-a-sur DUMU i-di-lim en-num-a-sur i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ku-bi-im u e-la-ma a-na 66 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-i-li li-mu-um PUZUR4-ni-ra-ah IGI su-sa-a IGI si-li-ISTAR IGI a-sur-ma-lik
tgt: Amur-Aššur s. Idī-ilim owes Ennum-Aššer 15 minas refined silver. He will pay 66 weeks from the ḫamustum of Šū-Kūbim and Elamma. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per month per mina. Month: Maḫur-ilī Year: Puzur-Niraḫ Witnesses: Susaya, Ṣilli-Ištar, Aššur-mālik.

src: 1.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki sa lu-lu a-na pu-su-ke-en ap-qi-id IGI PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU i-li-su-da-a IGI a-na-li
tgt: I entrusted 1 2/3 minas silver under the seal of Lulu to Pūšu-kēn. Witness: Puzur-Aššūr son of Ilišu-daya son of Anali.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-ma-lik-ma u {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li-ma 5 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR 12 GIN KU.GI ku-nu-ku-su sa i-ku-pi-a-sur i li-bi4 ne-pi-si-im na-di ku-nu-ki-ni i-ku-pi-a-sur na-as-a-kum-ma 1.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR <gap> sa-ru-pa-am i-ku-pi-a-sur li-is-qu-la-ku-ma KU.GI di-su-um 7 ma-na KU.BABBAR si-im URUDU 7 GU sa PUZUR4-a-sur a-se-er PUZUR4-a-sur se-bi4-il5 <gap>
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Aššur-mālik and Adad-ṣulūlī: 5 2/3 minas of silver and 12 shekels of gold under his seal belonging to Ikūppī-Aššur is placed in his package. Ikūppī-Aššur brings it to you under our seals and let Ikūppī-Aššur weigh out to you 1 2/3 minas of refined silver so that you sell the gold to him. Send 7 minas of silver to Puzur-Aššur, the price of about 7 talents of copper belonging to Puzur-Aššur.

src: um-ma la-qe-pu-um as-qu-dum u kur-ub-ISTAR-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ki-ka u 4 ku-ta-ni a-sur-{d}UTU-si ub-lam AN.NA-ka nu-sa-ni-iq-ma 2.6666600000000003 ma-na im-ti 0.33333 ma-na 6 GIN pa-ar-zi-lam a E ka-ri-im ni-is-qu-ul si-ti AN.NA-ka 2 GU 6.83333 ma-na 4 GIN AN.NA-ka ni-da-ma KU.BABBAR nu-se-ba-la-kum a ma-la te-er-ti-ka ANSE a-sur-{d}UTU-si i-ra-de8-a-kum
tgt: From Lā-qēpum, Asqūdum and Kurub-Ištar to Aššur-nādā: Aššur-šamšī brought 2 talents 10 minas of tin under your seal, plus 4 We paid 26 shekels aside to the office of the colony. We shall sell the rest of your tin, 2 talents 6 5/6 minas 4 shekels of tin belonging to you, and we shall send you the silver. In accordance with your letter Aššur-šamši's donkey will lead it to you.

src: a-na PUZUR4-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma sa-ba-si-a-ma a-su-mi tup-pi-im sa E wa-as-hu-pa-sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni i-la-ap-ra-at-ba-ni is-ti-ka sa-ba-at-ma tup-pi pi-te-ma tup-pa-am sa 49 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa a-na-ah-DINGIR gu5-ba-ab-tim a-ha-ti-su u a-al-DU10 a-hi-su sa 2-se-na be-ta-an e-ru-ba-tu-ni se-li-ma i-na si-ba-at tup-pi-im a-wi-lu a-ni-u-tum wa-du-u a-sar a-wi-lu a-ni-u-tum da-a-nu wa-du-u ma-e si-qi-ma ha-li-iq E-ti ki-la-le-ma qa-at-ka li-is-ba-su-nu tup-pu-um sa 21 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa i-se-er sa-lim-a-sur i-ku-num u sa-ba-si-a DAM.GAR i-su-u KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-ni ra-ki-is tup-pa-am se-li-su-ma a-mu-ur-ma a-sar KU.BABBAR a-su-mi i-li-is-ti-kal la-qe-e wa-du-u ma-e si-qi-ma DUMU sa-lim-a-sur a pu-ti ka-ma ka-li-im-su-ma su-ma a-wa-tam i-ka-par li-ik-pu-ur KU.BABBAR a-na DAM.GAR as-qu-ul-ma tup-pa-am u-se-si-a ma-la ta-le-e-u a-wa-tam gu5-mu-ur 1 tup-pu-um sa ku-nu-uk i-li-a-lim DUMU su-ka-li-a sa 8 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa 2 ma-na KU.GI il5-qe-u tup-pu-um i-ba-si la i-ba-si uz-ni pi-te a-na tup-pe-e sa si-bi sa a-su-mi i-ku-nim DUMU sa-ma-a al-ta-qe-u KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na u e-li-is ag-mu-ur-ma <gap> a-ta-ta-li-ik-ma ba-lu-um ga-am-ri-a la-qa-im tup-pi-a ta-ap-te-ma tup-pe-e sa si-be tu-se-li-ma i-na KU.BABBAR 1 GU u 2 GU me-er-e la-li-im te-ti-ir a-hi a-ta be-li a-ta ga-am-ri la i-ha-li-qa-ni ga-am-ri DUMU la-li-im sa-di-in tup-pu-um sa di-in ka-ri-im wa-ah-su-sa-na sa-he-er-GAL sa 0.66666 ma-na KU.GI <gap> u si-ba-su i-na tup-pi-a <gap> sa a-na {d}ISKUR ha-bu-la-ku-ni i-sa-he-er-ma 0.66666 ma-na u si-ba-su en-um-a-sur i-sa-qu-lu u tup-pu-um sa ka-ri-im i li-bi4 tup-pi-a i-ba-si sa-ni-um tup-pu-um sa ka-ri-im i-ba-si sa si-im-tam zu-pa i-sa-qal si-ib-tam a-na-ku a-sa-qal su-a-ti ta-bi4-su-ma sa 0.66666 ma-na a ka-ri-im su-ku-ma tup-pa-am sa ka-ri-im li-qe-a-am sa ki-ma i-na mi-ma zu-pa i-su-u i su-hu-pi-im sa {d}ISKUR i-la-qe
