tgt: To Puzur-Aššur from Sabasiya: Regarding the tablet (in?) the house of Wašḫuba about which you wrote me, take Ilabrat-bāni with you, open my tablet, and take out the tablet stating 49 minas silver (owed by) Anaḫ-ilī, his sister the gubabtum priestess, and Āl-ṭāb his brother concerning the two houses they entered, --there are these men denoted in the supplementary tablet -- wherever these men are denoted as judges, blot them with water so they are erased. Let your hand seize them-- As much as you are able, settle the matter. A tablet with the seal of Ili-ālum s. Sukkalliya stating, "8 minas silver of the 2 minas gold which he took.",inform me as to whether or not the tablet is available. My dear brother and lord, have you not lost everything that was mine? My all was handed over to the sons of Lālum. The tablet recording the decision of the plenary (assembly of the) colony at Waḫšušana regarding the 2/3 minas gold and its interest is in my tablet regarding that which I owe to Adad. The tablet of the colony, is within my tablet. There is a second tablet of the colony. Zupa will pay our the share. I myself will pay the interest. The represetative will take it from whatever Zupa has, from the holdings of Adad.

src: 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ku-ku-wa pe-ru-wa hu-ma u ku-bi4-ta im-di-DINGIR i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-{d}UTU-si u a-mur-{d}UTU a-na 22 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu KU.BABBAR i-na qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ke-ni-su-nu u a-sa-ti-su-nu ra-ki-is su-ma i-na u-mi-su-nu ma-al-u-tim KU.BABBAR la is-qu-lu 3 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam i-sa-qu-lu IGI i-di-su-en6 IGI PUZUR4-a-sur IGI la-ra-am-su
tgt: Witnesses: Idī-Suen, Puzur-Aššur, Laram-Suen.

src: 1 ma-na 9 GIN KU.BABBAR li-tam SIG5 i-se-er is-pu-nu-ma-an u ta-li-a u ta-li-is me-er-e-su sa a-ma-li-a pu-su-ke-en6 i-su i ha-ar-pi sa i-la-ka-ni <gap> na-ru-uq <gap> mi-is-lam se-am mi-is-lam ar-sa-tim u-su-bu IGI <gap> DUMU a-du-du
tgt: 1 Mine 9 Seqel gutes . . . . . . . Silber hat zu Lasten des Išpunuman und des Tali'a und des Tališ, seiner Söhne, aus Amali'a, Pūšukēn gut. In der kommenden Erntezeit werden sie [ . . Ṣa]ck [. . . . Krug] Getreide, die Hälfte [des Zins]es 'hinzugügen' [Vor . . . . . , dem Sohne des A]dūdu (Rs unbeschrieben).

src: <gap> ma-na 4.83333 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI a-sur-na-da ni-a-im is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-mur-{d}UTU u i-ku-nim a-na 27 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tim li-mu-um bu-zu-zu 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-da-na-ma qa-ti a-sa-ka-an IGI a-sur-GAL IGI a-sur-{d}UTU-si IGI pi-la-ah-a-sur 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI PUZUR4-a-na ni-a-im is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku u ka-si-a a-na 30 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM te-i-na-tim li-mu-um a-mur-a-sur DUMU ka-ri-a IGI PUZUR4-{d}IM DUMU i-di-ISTAR IGI du-um-qa-a DUMU kur-ub-ISTAR 11 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI a-mur-i-li DUMU u-zi-ni-a sa qa-ta-ti-im a-na a-ni-na DUMU PUZUR4-a-sur al-ta-ap-tu KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su i ra-mi-ni-a as-qul is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku u i-tur4-DINGIR 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-i-li li-mu-um a-mur-a-sur DUMU kar-ri-a IGI PUZUR4-a-na DUMU su-{d}EN.LIL IGI ku-ra-ra DUMU a-bu-sa-lim 14.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU su-be-lim-is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-ta-ta DUMU i-di-a-bi4-im a-na 8 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um PUZUR4-ni-ra-ah IGI DINGIR-mu-ta-bi4-il5 DUMU a-zu-za-a IGI su-ma-bi4-a DUMU su-{d}EN.LIL IGI en-nam-a-sur DUMU u-zu-a <big_gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI a-sur-ma-lik DUMU ili5-ma-al-ki is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa as-qu-dim a-na 41 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM a-la-na-tim li-mu-um PUZUR4-ni-ra-ah IGI a-la-hi-im DUMU e-la-li IGI sa-da-ah-su DUMU i-di-su-in mi-ma a-we-li a-ni-u-tim tup-pu-su-nu ha-ra-mu-tum i ka-ni-is i-ba-si-u
tgt: x minas 4 5/6 shekels of refined silver is owed by our own Aššur-nādā. Reckoned from the week of Amur-Šamaš and Ikūnum he is to pay in 27 weeks. If he has not paid (in time), he will add interest at the rate 1 1/2 shekel per month per mina.

src: KISIB a-sur-i-di DUMU i-li-a KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU DINGIR-ku-ru-ub KISIB a-sur-SIPA DUMU a-ku-ti-a sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-SIPA DUMU a-ku-ti-a 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa a-sur-SIPA DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR i-na se-er a-sur-SIPA DUMU a-ku-ti-a a-sur-SIPA DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa hu-ra-sa-nim a-na 1 ma-na-im 2 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sax-ab ITU.KAM sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um i-di-a-sur DUMU ku-bi4-di ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-SIPA DUMU a-ku-ti-a
tgt: Seals: Aššur-idī s. Iliya, Puzur-Aššur s. Ilī-kurub, Aššur-rēʾī s. Akutiya. Regarding the debt of Aššur-rēʾī s. Akutiya, Aššur-rēʾī s. Akutia owes Aššur-rēʾī s. Puzur-Ištar 6 minas refined silver belonging to Aššur-rēʾī s. Puzur-Ištar. He will add interest from the ḫamuštum of Ḫuraṣānum at the rate of 2 shekels per mina per month. Month: ša sarrātim. This memorandum is a copy of the sealed tablet of Aššur-rēʾī s. Akutiya.

src: KISIB en-na-su-en6 DUMU su-su-en6 KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU su-en6-na-da KISIB a-sur-ni-su DUMU sa-la-di-im KISIB a-na-ah-DINGIR DUMU PUZUR4.DINGIR sa hu-bu-ul a-na-ah-DINGIR 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim u a-gu5-za a-na 40 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sax-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-na-ah-i-li
tgt: Seals: Enna-Suen s. Šū-Suen, Puzur-Aššur s. Suen-nādā, Aššur-nīšu s. ?, Anaḫ-ilī s. Puzur-ilī. Regarding Anaḫ-ilī's debt of 20 minas refined silver. He will pay 40 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-bēl-awātim and Aguza. If he does not pay on time, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti er-ra-ili5 u a-sur-ba-ni-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 <big_gap> u <big_gap> qi-bi-ma <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR en-nam-a-sur DUMU <big_gap> ub-lam SA.BA 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA u 20 ma-na AN.NA qa-tim <big_gap> GIN.TA <gap> ma-na it-ba-al 25 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 4 TUG su-ru-tim li-wi-tum 20 GIN.TA 0.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR it-bu-lu 2 ANSE.HI.A 0.66666 ma-na LA+0.16666 GIN KU.BABBAR it-bu-lu 5 GIN u-nu-su-nu 2.83334 GIN u-ku-ul-ta-su-nu 0.83333 GIN TUG sa sa-i-tim 7.5 GIN wa-si-tum SU.NIGIN lu-qu-ut 15 ma-na 3.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR su-mi-a-bi-a i-ra-de8-a-kum si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-ka i se-ep ma-num-ba-lum-a-sur i-la-ka-kum
tgt: From Aššur-imittī, Erra-il, and Aššur-bāni to Pūšu-kēn and PN: Ennam-Aššur son of PN brought x minas silver. Thereof, 2? talents 10? minas tin, 20? minas hand-tin, at a rate of x sheqels, cost 6? minas (silver). x kutānum-textiles, 4 šurūtum-textiles, at a rate of x, they were x+1/3 shekels silver, 2 donkeys, worth 39 5/6 shekels, 5 shekels (silver) for their gear, 2 5/6 shekels for their feed, 5/6 shekels for the taxed textiles, 7 1/2 shekels for the exit tax--. Altogether Šumī-abiya brings you goods worth 15 minas 3 1/3 shekels silver. The remainder of the (goods yeilded from the) silver will come to you in the transport of Mannum-bālum-Aššūr.

src: a-wa-ti-su-nu nu-ga-me-er-ma {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni u {d}UTU-ba-ni a-hu-um a-na a-hi-im a-na mi-ma su-mi-su la i-tu-a-ar ki-la-la-an i-mi-ig-ru-ma ni-is a-lim{ki} it-mu-u IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti IGI a-mur-ISTAR
tgt: We decided their matter and Ilabrat-bāni and Šamš-bāni, brother will not return to either for anything. They both agreed and swore the oath of the city. Witnesses: Aššur-imittī, Amur-Ištar.

src: KISIB MI.ISTAR KISIB {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni KISIB PUZUR4.MAR.TU um-ma su-ut-ma sa ki-ma i-a-ti e-ri-is-ma su-ma la i-di-nu-ni-sum 3 GIN.TA a-na ma-na-em i-na ITU.KAM E DAM.GAR si-si-a-am sa ki-ma su-a-ti IGI PUZUR4-sa-du-e e-ri-is-ma u-la i-di-nu-nim is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa en-nam-a-a 3 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im a-si-sum
tgt: Seals: Ṣilli-Ištar, Amurrum-bāni, Puzur-Amurrum. He said: "Ask my representatives, and if they do not give to him, 3 shekels per mina per month, I asked his representatives in the presence of Puzur-sadūʾē and the did not give it to me. I .. him 3 shekels per mina from the ḫamuštum of Ennamaya.

src: 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ta-ki-il5-a-sur a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa bu-zu-ta-a u su-a-sur a-na 6 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i-na ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab IGI ku-ta-a IGI ku-ku-la-nim
tgt: Takil-Aššur owes Aššur-rēʾī 2/3 minas refined silver. He will pay six weeks from the ḫamuštum of Buzutaya and Šū-Aššur. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 shekel (per mina) per month as interest.

src: um-ma en-um-a-sur-ma a-na pi-la-ah-ISTAR qi-bi4-ma a-hi a-ta be-li a-ta a-la-nu-ka a-ha-am sa-ni-am u-la i-su a-na u4-mi sa te-ta-ra-ni et-ra-ni-ma la a-ma-si-ka lu su-um-ka be-et gu5-mu-ur-tim sa is-ha-ra a-se-er be-ti-a im-qu-ut-ma be-ti-a i-di-ma i-na ki-dim wa-as-ba-ku be-li a-ta a-se-er KU.BABBAR-ap-ka 50 GIN pa-ni-am u-ka-lu u u4-ma-am KU.BABBAR ma-la ra-du-im ra-di-a-ma qa-ti a-na as-ri-su-nu lu-ta-er-ma lu su-um-ka a-hi a-ta be-li a-ta KU.BABBAR 1 GIN li tu-se-qa-ra-ma li-bi4 la i-ma-ra-as a-na ma-nim sa-nim la-ap-nu
tgt: From Ennum-Aššur to Pilaḫ-Ištar: My dear brother and lord, besides you I have no brother.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma PUZUR4-a-sur-ma a-na KU.BABBAR-pi-ka sa se-ep im-gu5-a AN.NA 16 GIN.TA ni-is-a-ma-kum u me-eh-ra-at KU.BABBAR sa se-ep ku-lu-ma-a a-na si-ib-tim ni-il5-qe-ma 16 GIN.TA AN.NA u TUG.HI.A sa-mu ANSE.HI.A la-su ANSE.HI.A ni-sa-a-ma a-na 5 u4-me su-ISTAR ni-ta-ra-dam a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta lu-qu-tam sa se-ep al-be-li la-ma e-la-tum e-ru-ba-ni-ni a-li KU.BABBAR 1 GIN e-li-u a-se-er sa ki ku-a-ti al-be-li lu-bi4-il5-ma a-na i-ta-at-lim li-di-nu a-ki-a-am li-qe la u-su-ru KU.BABBAR le-ru-ub-ma AN.NA u TUG.HI.A lu-us u 1 GU AN.NA ku-nu-ki u 50 TUG a-se-er {d}ISKUR.ANDUL se-bi4-il5 u i tup-pi-ka <gap> <gap>-ra-am su-pur-sum su-ma KU.BABBAR i ba-ab-ti-a us-a-ma a-na pa-nim se-bi4-lam ku-lu-ma-a u-qa-a e-ra-ba-ma a-ta-be-a-ma a-ta-la-kam
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Puzur-Aššur: Regarding your silver from the transport of Imgua, we purchased tin for you at a 16 shekel rate. And(as for?) the corresponding amount, we borrowed silver of Kulumaya's transport on interest and purchased tin at a 16 shekel rate and tin and textiles were purchased, there were no donkeys. We purchased some donkeys and we will dispatch Šū-Ištar in five days. My dear father and lord, as for the goods of Āl-Bēlī, before the caravans arrive, wherever a single shekel of silver arises, let the representatives of Āl-Bēlī bring and let them buy with cash. Receive it (only) in this way. They must not release. Let the silver enter in and let tin and textiles go out. About a talent of tin under my seal and 50 textiles send to Adad-... Now in your tablet: "Send the ... to him." If the silver of my outstanding claims comes out, then send it to me immmediatly. Kulumaya waits. (When) he comes, I will set out and come.

src: 16 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er en-um-a-sur u be-ra-di DAM.GAR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa im-di-lim u a-ni-nim a-na ITU.2.KAM i-sa-qu-lu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is su-ma i-na u4-mi-su-nu ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-lu ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-DINGIR li-mu-um DUG-a-sur IGI su-ku-bi4-im IGI a-sur-la-ma-si
tgt: Ennam-Aššur and Beradi owe the merchant 16 shekels silver. They will pay 2 months after the ḫamuštum of Imdi-ilum and Anninum. The silver is bound to whichever person is solvent. If they do not pay at full term, they will add interest at the rate of the colony. Month: Maḫḫur-ilī Eponymate: Ṭāb-Aššur. Witnesses: Šū-Kūbum, Aššur-kamassī.

src: KISIB a-sur-{d}UTU-si KISIB i-li-a-lim KISIB a-sur-DU10 sa 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-DU10 a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-i-mi-ti u a-mur-ISTAR 1.25 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sax-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-DU10
tgt: Aššur-ṭāb owes Aššur-rēʾī 5 minas refined silver. He will add 1 1/4 shekels per mina per month as interest from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-imittī and Amur-Ištar.

src: KISIB pi-la-ah-a-sur DUMU bi-za-za KISIB hi-na-a DUMU a-sur-DU10 <gap> <gap>-at <gap> AN.NA E <gap> KU.BABBAR sa-li-ba-a is-pu-ra-ni <gap> ma-na <gap> GIN KU.BABBAR a-sur-SIPA is-tu li-ba-a il5-qe si-ti KU.BABBAR 2.6666600000000003 ma-na 5 GIN a-na KU.BABBAR a-nim li-ba-a u i-ku-pi-a uk-ta-nu-ma su-ma li-bi i-ku-pi-a KU.BABBAR a-nim ik-tu-nam a-na 1 ma-na-im 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-na-ah-i-li
tgt: Seals: Pilaḫ-Aššur s. Bizaza, Ḫinnaya s. Aššur-ṭāb. He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma a-na a-mur-ISTAR qi-bi-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma 10.33333 GIN.TA a-na TUG.HI.A-ti-ka <gap> <gap>-<gap> u ISTAR-ka-ku-bu-um <gap> la 9 GIN.TA u e-li-is <gap> <gap>-ri-su <big_gap><gap> KU.BABBAR a-na-kam u-ka-i-lu-su a-se-er PUZUR4-a-sur u dan-a-sur 1 DUMU um-mi-a-nim ke-nam ta-hi-ma mi-ma KU.BABBAR a-nim su-ta-as-bi4-ta-ma a-na 12 ha-am-sa-tim tup-pa-ka hi-ir-ma i-na tup-pi-su si-ib-tum lu wa-du-u DINGIR-su-i-di-in ha-ra-num ki su-mi-sa su-ma 1 ITU.KAM u 2 ITU.KAM e-ta-at-qu si-ib-tam u-la a-la-qe si-im TUG.HI-ti-a sa-as-qi-il5-su-ma KU.BABBAR ku-nu-uk-ma se-bi-lam li-bi li-ih-du
tgt: From Pūšu-kēn to Amur-Ištar: You wrote to me (saying), "At a rate of 10 1/3 shekels for your textiles (I sold to PN)(?) and Ištar-kakkubum." 9 shekel rate or higher ... (As for the ?) silver, they retain it here. Approach Puzur-Aššur, Dan-Aššur, and an affiliated trader and seize all this silver so that your tablet is certified for 12 ḫamuštum weeks and make known the interest in the tablet. As for Ilišu-iddin, the caravan-venture, in place of her name(?), if it (the venture) has passed by one or two months, I will not accept the interest. Collect the price of the (textiles?), seal the silver, and send it here. Let them gladden my heart.

src: 19.33333 GIN 15 SE KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-na si-im-tim i-ri-ih-ma i-se-er PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU la-qe-ep DAM.GAR-ru-um i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa pu-su-ke-en6 ITU.KAM sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-li-dan 0.66666 GIN.TA <big_gap> i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam a-na KU.BABBAR a-nim u-sa-ab IGI a-sur-GAL IGI i-ku-nim
tgt: 19 1/3 shekels and 15 grains refined silver ... and Puzur-Aššur s. Lā-qēpum owes it to the merchant. He will add 2/3 shekels per month as interest to this silver from the ḫamuštum of Pūšu-kēn, month Ša kēnātim, eponymate after the one of Ilī-dān. Witnesses: Aššur-rabi, Ikūnum.

src: um-ma pu-su-ke-en6 u a-sur-su-lu-li-ma a-na e-nu-be-lim qi-bi-ma is-te-ni-u-tim tup-pi-ni {d}UTU.DU10 u a-mur-ISTAR ub-lu-ni-kum sa-ni-u-tim me-eh-ri-su-nu ku-ra-ra ub-la-kum a-pu-tum i-hi-id-ma tup-pi-ni si-ta-me-ma a ma-la te-er-ti-ni KU.BABBAR sa se-pi-ka u KU.BABBAR sa u-sa-nim <gap>-<gap> <big_gap> a-wi-lum a-na ni-ka-si i-ti-zi-iz da-tum ma-tum i-ka-sa-ad-ni-a-ti KU.BABBAR lu nu-se-li-ma a-na ni-ka-si-su <big_gap> ni-sa-qal-ma <big_gap> a-ma-kam <big_gap> <gap>-su <big_gap> <gap> lu URUDU sa i-<gap> <big_gap> a-la-an 1 gu <big_gap> <gap> ni-am bu <big_gap>-za-ku-ma KU.BABBAR <big_gap> sa ra-ma-na-<big_gap>
tgt: From Pūšu-kēn and Aššur-ṣulūlī to Ennum-Bēlum:

src: <big_gap> <gap> i-na <big_gap> PUZUR4-a-sur a-sur-DUG i-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum il5-qe um-ma su-ut-ma ha-bu-lam-ma tup-pu-su ha-ar-ma-am sa ku-nu-ki-su u sa si-bi-su u-ka-al 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-ha-ma il5-qe um-ma su-ut-ma IGI kur-ub-ISTAR u a-mur-DINGIR ah-bu-ul-su-um-ma u al-qe 3 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR um-ma su-ut-ma a-zu u i-di-{d}ISKUR u-se-bi4-il5-sum su-ma a-na mi-ma KU.BABBAR a-nim si-be la us-te-li is-tu ITU.KAM na-ar-ma-ak a-sur sa ke-na-tim li-mi-im su-hu-bu-ur DUMU e-la-li KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su i-sa-qal si-bi-su i-sa-da-da-ma si-bi-su u su-a-ti nu-ta-ma IGI ha-na-na-ri-im IGI PUZUR4-a-sur
tgt: Witnesses: Ḫanna-nārum, Puzur-Aššur.

src: KISIB GAL-a-sur KISIB su-li KISIB a-sur-ba-ni sa hu-bu-ul su-li 0.5 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um sa a-sur-SIPA is-tu ha-mus-tim sa PUZUR4.ISTAR ITU.KAM na-ar-ma-ak a-sur sa ki-na-tim 2 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM-im u-sax-ab li-mu-um ah-mar-si DUMU ma-al-ku-um-i-sar ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul su-li
tgt: He will add interest at a rate of 2 shekels per mina per month from the ḫamuštum of Puzur-Ištar, month Narmak-Aššur ša kēnātim. This memorandum is a copy of the sealed tablet concerning the debt of Šuli.

src: KISIB ISTAR-pa-li-il5 DUMU su-ku-bi-im KISIB su-mi-a-bi-a DUMU a-sur-ni-su KISIB a-hu-wa-qar DUMU su-ISTAR KISIB li-ip-ta-nim DUMU la-li-im 8 ma-na 18.66666 GIN sa-ru-pa-am si-im TUG-ti sa ILLAT-at i-ku-pi-a i-se-er ka-ri-im {d}en-LIL-ba-ni i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa su-ISTAR ITU.1.KAM qa-ra-a-tim li-mu-um en-na-su-en6 DUMU su-ISTAR a-na 6 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 0.66666 GIN 15 SE.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam i ITU.1.KAM u-su-bu li-mu-u a-hu-wa-qar u li-ip-ta-nim KISIB ka-ri-im ka-ni-is 3.6666600000000003 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am ni-pi-il5-tam sa 12 ma-na.TA a-sur-ma-lik a-na ka-ri-im is-qul is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-na-a DUMU a-mu-ra-a ITU.1.KAM a-la-na-tim li-mu-um a-sur-ma-lik 2 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i ITU.1.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab KISIB i-na-a DUMU e-la-li KISIB en-um-a-sur DUMU sal-mah KISIB a-sur-tak-la-ku DUMU a-la-hi-im KISIB ku-lu-ma-a DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti KISIB a-sur-ni-im-ri DUMU i-di-su-en6 2 ma-na 13 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ka-ri-im {d}en-LIL-ba-ni i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ma-nu-ba-lum-a-sur ITU.KAM sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-di-a-hi-im a-na ITU.3.KAM i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 0.66666 GIN 15 SE.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu ki-ma ka-ri-im i-na-a en-um-a-sur u a-sur-tak-la-ku KU.BABBAR il5-qe-u KISIB a-ta-ta DUMU a-mur-ISTAR KISIB su-ISTAR DUMU su-ka-tim KISIB a-sur-DUG DUMU e-na-ma-num 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er a-sur-DUG a-sur-ma-lik i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa PUZUR-sa-du-e u i-tur4-DINGIR ITU.1.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um {d}ISKUR-ba-ni a-na 15 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i ITU.1.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab me-eh-ru-um sa tup-pe-e ha-ru-mu-tim GAN-lam e-ti-qu
tgt: Seals: Ištar-pālil s. Šū-Kūbim, Šumī-abiya s. Aššur-nīšu, Aḫu-waqar s. Šū-Ištar, Lipit-Anim s. Lālim. The colony owes Enlil-bāni 8 minas 18 2/3 shekels refined silver for the price of the textiles from the caravan of Ikuppīya. From the ḫamuštum of Šū-Ištar, (month) Qarrātim, eponymate of Enna-Suen s. Šū-Ištar he has 6 weeks to pay. If he does not pay 2/3 shekels 15 measures of grain will be added per mina in interest. Eponymate of Aḫu-waqar and Lipit-Anim Seal of the colony of Kaneš 3 2/3 minas refined silver of the 12 mina payment of Aššur-mālik to the colony have been paid. From the ḫamuštum of Innāya s. Amurāya, (month) Allānātim, eponymate Aššur-mālik 2 shekels per mina per month will be added in interest. Seals: Innāya s. Elāli, Ennum-Aššur s. Šalmaḫ, Aššur-taklāku s. Al-aḫim, Kulumaya s. Aššur-imittī, Aššur-nimrī s. Idī-Suen. The colony of Enlil-bāni owes 2 mina 13 shekels refined silver. From the ḫamuštum of Mannum-bālum-Aššur, month of sarrātm, eponymate after Iddin-aḫim he must pay. If he does not pay 2/3 shekels 15 measures of grain per month per mina will be added in interest. Like the colony of Innāya, Ennum-Aššur and Aššur-taklāku will take the silver. Seals: Adada s. Amur-Ištar, Šū-Ištar s. Šukatim, Aššur-ṭāb s. Ennamānum Aššur-ṭāb owes Aššur-mālik 4 minas silver From the ḫamuštum of PÚZUR-sa-du-e and Itūr-ilī, (month) Kuzalli, eponymate Adad-bāni he has 15 weeks to pay. If he does not pay 1 1/2 shekels per mina will be added in interest. A copy of a sealed tablet that is sent overland.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR u ni-is-ha-su a-na PUZUR4-a-sur a-di-in a-na tup-pi-im sa PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU a-sur-ma-lik sa hu-bu-li-a sa u-ka-lu mi-su-um ta-as-pu-u a-u-a-am u4-ma-am tu-qa-a {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni u su-a-ti sa-ba-at-ma li-is-pu-ur-ma tup-pa-am sa ku-nu-ki-a i-na a-lim{ki} <gap>-<gap> a sa ki-ma ku-a-ti li-ip-qi-du-u a-ni-am u4-ma-am a-na tup-pi-im tu-qa-a da-mi-iq u da-mi-iq-ma sa-su-ur E a-bi-a i-ma-si a-sa-me-a-ma {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni a-na a-lim{ki} pa-nu-su
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Pūšu-kēn: I gave 2/3 minas of silver and its excise to Puzur-Aššur. Regarding the tablet of Puzur-Ištar of (his) debt to me, which I hold, why are you silent? For whom are you waiting every day? (?) Seize him and Ilabrat-bāni so that he writes me and they entrust the tablet with my seal to your representatives in the City. Wait this day for a tablet. But watch very (damn) carefully! (OR) But be very careful! The house of my father is clearing accounts. I hear that Ilabrat-bāni has decided to come to the city.

src: 1.3333300000000001 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im ku-ta-ni7 sa tu-i-mi-im DUMU a-bi-na-ra su-ku-bu-um DUMU ISTAR-pa-li-il5 a-na ni-wa-ah-su-sar DAM tu-i-mi-im si-ma-at-su-en6 DAM a-sur-tak-la-ku u me-er GAL a-sur-tak-la-ku i-di-su-nu-ti ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur DINGIR li-mu-um mu-na-mi-ru-um DUMU si-in-is-me-a-ni IGI i-na-su-en6 DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti-i IGI sal-ma-a-sur DUMU pu-su-ke-en6 IGI {d}ISKUR-ba-ni DUMU su-ka-lim me-he-er tup-pi i-na-su-en6 u-ka-al
tgt: Šū-Kūbum s. Ištar-pālil gave 1 mina 25 shekels silver, the price of the kutānum textiles of Tuimum s. Abinara, to Niwaraḫšušar w. Tuimium, Šimat-Suen w. Aššur-taklāku, and the oldest son of Aššur-taklāku. Month: Maḫḫur-ilī. Eponymate: Munawwirum s. Sin-išmeanni. Witnesses: Enna-Suen s. Aššur-imittī, Šalim-Aššur s. Pūšu-kēn, Adad-bāni s. Sukkallum.

src: a-na su-ku-bi-im u a-sur-pi-la-ah a-na su-ku-bi-im qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma KU.BABBAR sa a-na tap-hi-ri-im sa sar-ma-te-en a-bu-ni i-hi-ib-lu a-na-kam is-bu-tu-ni-ma um-ma su-nu-ma KU.BABBAR hu-bu-ul a-bi-ka su-qul um-ma a-na-ku-ma KU.BABBAR tal-ta-qe-a-ma KU.BABBAR e-su-ma a-hu-ur ta-ah-si-sa-tum sa a-bi-a i-ba-si-a um-ma su-nu-ma ta-ah-si-sa-tim sa a-bi-ka se-si-a-ma lu ne-mu-ur is-te-en6 sa ki-ma ku-a-ti u is-ti-a a-hi-a-am is-ti-a e-ru-ub-ma tup-pi ni-ip-te-ma ta-ah-si-sa-tim nu-se-li-ma u-ka-li-im-si-na-ma u-sa-li-su-<big_gap>-im ni-qe-e <gap> <big_gap> u sa <gap> me-he-er ta-ah-si-sa-tim nu-se-<big_gap> <gap> kum tup-pi ha-ar-mu-um sa ba-ab DINGIR-lim <gap> <gap>-im ni-a-im <gap> i-na me-eh-ri-im sa tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa ba-ab DINGIR-lim sa e-li-a-ni sa-ar <gap> ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa hu-bu-ul a-la-hi-im a-mur-ISTAR a-na a-sur-SIPA is-qul um-ma a-sur-SIPA-ma a-na a-mur-ISTAR-ma 1 ma-na-ka ma-ti-i 1 ma-na-u-su ik-ta-ma 1 0.5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-di-su-um IGI li-ba-a DUMU u-zu-a IGI en-na-nim sa-be-e-em na-ab-su-en6 DUMU {d}AB-ba-ni tap-pa-i-ni a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um ka-ni-is i-di-ni-a-ti-ma IGI GIR sa a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in
tgt: To Šū-Kūbum and Aššur-pilah, and specifically to Šū-Kūbum, from Aššur-nādā: With regard to the silver with which our father has become indebted to the fund of divine Šar-mātēn, they seized me here and said: "Pay the silver, your father's debt." I answered: "You have received silver repeatedly, so little silver is left (of the debt). There are memoranda of my father's available." They said: "Produce your father's memoranda and let us see." One person representing you and one stranger entered (the house) together with me and we opened for the tablets and took out the memoranda and I showed them; I pleaded with them ... sacrifices ... and ... we took out the memoranda and copies of the tablets from the Gate of the God concerning our own tablet ... in the copy of the certified tablet of the Gate of the God which may appear, concerning x mina 5 shekels of silver from Alāhum's debt—(that) Amur-Ištar paid to Aššur-re'i. Aššur-re'i said as follows to Amur-Ištar: "Your one-mina weight is too light." His one-mina weight was checked(?) and he then paid him 1 1/2 shekel of silver. Witnessed by Libbaya son of Uzua, by Ennānum, the inn-keeper; Nab-Suen son of Illil-bāni was our co-witness. For this matter, the Kanesh colony gave us permission, and we gave our testimonies before the dagger of Aššur.

src: 2.33333 ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er {d}ISKUR-pa-li-il5 PUZUR4-su-en i-su-u is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ab-lu-hu-ul u wa-si-bu-ru-um-ba-ni 1.3333300000000001 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na ITU.2.KAM a-na ha-hi-im u-se-ba-la-am su-ma la us-te-bi-il5 1 ma-na-um 0.33333 ma-na si-a-ma-tim i-sa-qal 1 ma-na 8.5 GIN.TA i-na e-ra-ab PUZUR4-su-en i-na ka-ni-is i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI i-li-pi-i-u-su-ur IGI a-sur-SIPA IGI ma-nu-um-ba-lum-a-sur
tgt: Adad-palil owes Puzur-Suen 2 1/3 minas 2 shekels refined silver. If he does not pay (on time), he will add the rate of the colony per 1 1/2 shekels as interest.

src: a-na mu-za u pu-su-ke-en6 a-na mu-za qi-bi-ma um-ma la-ma-sa-ma 3 a-lu-na-tum sa si-pa-ri a sa-la-si-su su-ga-ri-a-u a sa-la-si-su ma-az-lu-gu5 si-ta it-qu-ra-tum sa si-pa-ri 2 su-pa-nu ma-me-ri 3 ha-si-nu ka-la-pu 4 ar-za-lu u 1 si-ru sa 20 ma-na mi-ma a-nim a-di-na-ki-im a-ha-ti a-ti-i a-na pu-su-ke-en6 pi-qi-su-nu a-su-mi u-nu-tim a-mi-tim is-tu 8 MU.SE is-ti-a za-ni a-ha-ma 7 u-ka-pu sa-pi-u-tum SA.BA 3 u-ka-pu a-na pe-ru-a ta-di-ni si-ti u-ka-pi a-na ar-na u a se-ni-su ta-ma-la-ki ku-nu-ki-a a-na pu-su-ke-en6 di-in u si-ru sa-he-er-tum e-la-nu-ma e-zi-ba-ki-su u su-a-ti di-i-ni a-ha-ti a-ti-i mi-ma u-tu-ub-tim sa ta-du-nu-su-ni i na-as-pe-er-ti-ki lu-up-ti-im
tgt: To Muza and Pūšu-kēn, to Muza specifically, from Lammaša: I gave you 3 almonds in bronze, 3 knives, 3 forks, 2 bronze dishes, 2 supānum-bowls, a mamirum, 3 ḫaṣṣinum-axes , a kalappum-ax, 4 arzallum-tools , and a cauldron weighing 20 minas. My dear sister, entrust them to Pūšu-kēn! Regarding these goods, they have been with for 8 years. Separately (there are) 7 thick saddle cloths. Thereof you gave 3 of the saddlecloths to Peruwa. The remainder of the saddlecloths went to Arnu-[xxx]. Also, another thing, give the boxes with my seal to Pūšu-kēn! Give that also (to Pūšu-kēn?). My dear sister, write to me in your letter to all the ... which you give to him.

src: 8 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-hu-DUG DUMU a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 bu-zu-li-a i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ki-tim u u-ra-a a-na 12 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qul a-na 10 GIN-tim 1 GIN i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab IGI su-e-ta-ta IGI a-sur-SIPA DUMU i-di-da
tgt: Buzuliya owes 8 shekels refined silver to A-ḫu-DUG s. Aššur-mutabbil. From the ḫamuštum of Šukkutum and Ūraya he has 12 weeks to pay. If he does not pay by the full term 10 shekels 1 shekels will be added per month. Witnesses: Sueata, Aššur-rēʾī s. Idīda.

src: a-na PUZUR4-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma {d}IM-su-lu-li-ma a-di sa ha-na-na-ri-im sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni um-ma a-ta-ma tup-pa-am sa 1.3333300000000001 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa dan-a-sur su-a-ti u a su-mi-a i-li-pi-it su-ma ta-da-gal-ma KU.BABBAR i-na ra-mi-ni-su is-qul-ma tup-pa-am u-se-si IGI si-na sa-ba-su-ma um-ma a-ta-ma su-ma KU.BABBAR ta-as-qul-ma tup-pa-am tu-se-si tup-pa-am se-si-ma la-mur-ma ma-la si-ib-tam i-li-ku a-na se-er {d}IM.DUL la-as-pu-ur-ma KU.BABBAR lu-se-bi4-lam si-ib-tam la ta-ma-nu-su-um ki-ma si-bi ta-as-ku-nu-su-ni te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam-ma a-na-kam KU.BABBAR ha-mus-tam i li-bi4 is-ba-at u tup-pa-am sa ku-nu-ki-su-nu la al-qe is-tu si-be-e ta-as-ku-nu-su-ni u wa-ar-ka a-na sa ha-mus-tim ru-gu5-um-su-um a-di sa ma-ha-i-a sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni tup-pa-am sa ku-nu-ki-ka di-su-um a-la-kam-ma tup-pa-am sa si-be-a a-da-na-kum-ma u tup-pa-am du-uk a-di KU.BABBAR sa li-bi4-ka sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni mi-nam tu-ga-za-ba-su lu tu-ha-mi-sa-su ANSE ha-bu-la-ku-um ANSE lu-mi-id ANSE
tgt: To Puzur-Aššur from Adad-ṣulūlī:

src: 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-ta sa-at-a-na a-si-ti-su u ha-nu me-er-i-su a-sur-ma-lik i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ka-si-im sa qa-ti en-na-su-en6 a-na 4 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 3 GIN.TA i ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu IGI na-ki-li-et IGI a-si-et
tgt: Witnesses: Nakiled, a-ší-et.

src: um-ma bu-zu-ta-a e-nu-be-lum u PUZUR4-a-sur a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma is-tu ta-tal-ku-ni 14 TUG.TA E ka-ri-im is-tap-ku-ma a-se-er 7 TUG sa a-na PUZUR4-a-sur te-zi-bu 21 TUG a-na 3 ma-na 16 GIN KU.BABBAR ni-is-a-ma-ku-ma i KU.BABBAR-pi-ka ni-is-qul 28 TUG qa-at-ka qa-ti a-hu-qar u a-mur-ISTAR ni-di 3 ma-na.TA KU.BABBAR is-tap-ku-ma 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na qa-ta-ti-ka PUZUR4-a-sur is-qul 1 TUG.TA SIG5 is-tap-ku-ma si-im 2 TUG 0.66666 ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR is-qul 13 TUG.TA i-na wa-ar-ki-tim is-tap-ku-ma 26 TUG qa-ta-tu-ka 9.5 GIN.TA 4 ma-na 7 GIN KU.BABBAR is-qul 1 ma-na 13.5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-di-ni-a-ti SU.NIGIN 12 ma-na 2 0.5 GIN KU.BABBAR a su-mi-ka PUZUR4-a-sur i ra-mi-ni-su u-sa-qi-il5 20.5 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR E ka-ri-im na-ad-a-ti 7.66666 ma-na 7 0.5 GIN a-hu-qar 7.66666 ma-na 7.5 GIN a-mur-ISTAR
tgt: From Buzutaya, Ennum-Bēlum, and Puzur-Aššur to Pūšu-kēn: After you departed, the colony office held a pouring for 14 textiles per share and in addition to the 7 textiles which you left for Puzur-Aššur, we purchased 21 textiles for 3 minas 16 shekels and we paid with your silver. We deposited 20 textiles, as your share and the shares of Aḫu-waqar and Amur-Ištar. They held the pouring for 3 minas each and Puzur-Aššūr wieghed out 6 minas silver to your shares. The held a pouring for 1 fine textile each and he paid the price of 2 textiles 42 shekels silver. Later they held a pouring for 13 textiles and as for the 26 textiles, your shares, at a rate of 9 1/2 shekels each, paid 4 minas 7 shekels silver. He gave to us 1 mina 13 1/2 shekels silver. Altogether, Puzur-Aššur paid to your name 12 minas 1/2 shekels silver from his own funds. You are deposited for 20 minas 35 shekels silver in the colony office. 7 minas 45 shekels belong to Aḫu-waqar. 7 minas 47 1/2 shekels belong to Amur-Ištar.

src: um-ma hi-na-a-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u zu-pa qi-bi-ma a-na zu-pa qi-bi-ma KU.BABBAR 10 ma-na is-tu bu-ru-us-ha-dum im-qu-ta-ma i-na E-be-ti-ka i-ba-si ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma a-na i-ku-pi-a ka-sa-ri-ka su-up-ra-ma KU.BABBAR <gap>-<gap>-<gap> li-ih-bu-lam as-pu-ra-ma a-na i-ku-pi-a 17.5 ma-na 3.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR i-na E-be-ti-a i-ku-pi-a ip-tur4-ma i-di-na-kum i-na ba-ab ha-ra-ni-a as-pu-ra-ku-ma um-ma a-na-ku-ma KU.BABBAR-pi se-bi4-lam ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma KU.BABBAR is-ti DAM.GAR-ri-im li-qe-ma u su-up-ra-ma a-sar ta-al-qe-u KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su su-ma mi-qi-su <gap>-<gap>-<gap> te-er-ti <gap> <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> KU.BABBAR a-na <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> la-mi-in4 <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> te-pu-sa-<gap> <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> i-ku-pi-a-sur <gap>-<gap>-<gap> KU.BABBAR-pi <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> a-sur lu i-de8 <gap>-<gap>-<gap> sa-na na-ru-qi-im <gap> KU.BABBAR u mi-qi-su a-na pu-su-ke-en6 di-in a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma a-bi4 a-ta KU.BABBAR u mi-qi-su sa-as-qi-il5-su 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR u ki-ma si-ba-su u a-ha-ma 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR si-im 2 lu-bu-si i li-bi4 en-na-nim DUMU su-hu-bur KU.BABBAR sa-as-qi-il5-su
tgt: From Ḫinnaya to Pūšu-kēn and Zupa: To Zupa: About 10 minas silver has arrived? from Purušḫattum and it is available in your house. You wrote me. You said, "Send your hauler to Ikuppiya and let him borrow silver." Ikuppiya opened from my house and abd he gave (it) to you. I wrote to you as I was leaving and I said, "Send my silver." You wrote me. You said, "Take the silver from the merchant and send so that wherever you received it, the silver and its miqissu(product?) ...." If the product ... let your message come(??) Silver to .... evil? ... you .... Ikuppi-Aššūr ... My silver(?) .... May Aššur know that ... second .. naruqqum .. ! Give the silver and its product to Pūšu-kēn. To Pūšu-kēn: My dear father, have him pay the silver and its product. 1 minas silver and its corresponding interest and 2/3 minas silver, the price of two garments, is with Ennānum son of Šū-Hubur. Make him pay the silver.

src: <big_gap> <gap>-na la ak-<gap> <big_gap> a-su-mi PUZUR4-a-sur eq-la-am KU.BABBAR e-ta-na-ti-iq i-mi-ig-ra-at PUZUR4-a-sur u ku-a-ti tup-pa-am la-pi-it la <big_gap> su-ma a-na 6 ha-am-sa-tim KU.BABBAR la ub-lu-nim <gap> 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-sa-qu-lu <big_gap> tup-pi-su i-du-ak <big_gap> <gap>-a-sur
tgt: If they do not bear the silver in six weeks, they will pay x mina(s) silver.

src: pi-la-ah-ISTAR a-na en-na-su-en6 is-ba-at-ni-a-ti-ma um-ma pi-la-ah-ISTAR-ma a-na en-na-su-en6 DUMU me-tim a-na-ku i-na pa-ni-ti-ma a-na sa tup-pi-im a-ni-im aq-bi-a-ku-um um-ma a-na-ku-ma tup-pu-um a-ni-um ku-nu-uk a-bi-ka la ku-nu-uk a-bi4-ka u-de8-e um-ma en-na-su-en6-ma hu-bu-lu-um sa si-na su-nu-ti um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-ta DUMU me-tim-u-a-na-ku DUMU me-ti ma-la ni-ip-ta-sa-ar su-ma tup-pa-am sa sa-ba-e tu-ka-al u-la si-bi-ti ti-su-u a-na a-ni-u-ti ri-da-ma mi-na-am a-qa-bi4-ma um-ma en-na-su-en6-ma mi-ma tup-pa-am sa sa-ba-e u-la u-ka-al u si-bi u-la i-su sa-ah-ra-ku-ma ku-nu-ki sa a-bi4-a u-la i-di si-bu-tam sa ku-nu-ki-su lu-de8-u-ma a-na-ku ITU.KAM ab-sa-ra-ni li-mu-um su-su-en6 su-a-nim bi4-lam5 IGI a-sur-DU10 DUMU sa-li-ti
tgt: Pilaḫ-Išṭar seized us against Enna-Suen: Enna-Suen said: "The debt is for two years. I said: "You are the son of a dead man and I am the son of a dead man. Let us not litigate. If you have the tablet refering to (its) payment in full or you have witnesses, arraign them so that I can ..discuss with them..?" Enna-Suen said: "I do not hold any tablet of (its) payment in full, and I do not have witnesses. I am young and I do not know the seals of my father. Let me establish a witness to his seal and I..." Month: Ab-šarrānē. Year: Šū-Suen.

src: a-na a-ba-a-a qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma a ma-la na-as-pe-er-tim sa as-pu-ra-ki-ni a-na-kam i-na-a a-su-mi-ki u a-na su-mi E a-bi-ki tam-ka-ri e-ta-wu a-su-mi ku-ra li-bu-su im-ta-ra-as um-ma su-ut-ma su-ma la i-pi-sa sa-hu-uz su-nu i-na a-lim{ki} a-li-ki <gap>-ta-na-mu u a-ni-um a-na-kam KU.BABBAR u-sa-ba-at-ma pu-ru-i is-ta-na-kan 3 gu5-su-ri e-si sa E be-ti-ku-nu la-ma a-na ka-ni-is a-li-ka-ni ku-ra a si-mi-im i-di-in a-ma-kam-ma a-ta-wa-ku-nu-ti um-ma a-na-ku-ma E be-tum a-na-ah-ISTAR e-su-ma gam-ru a-tu-nu ma-la-ku-nu
tgt: To Abaya from Aššur-nādā: In accordance with the message I sent to you, Innaya has here discussed with the tamkāru on your behalf of you and your paternal household. He became unhappy becasue of Kura. He said,"If he is not given instructions directly from her, these people will put continual pressure on travelers in the City, and then this one will sieze lots of silver there and constantly cause my reputation harm." As for the x+3 wooden beamsof your house, Kura had sold them before I arrived at Kanesh. I discussed that with you in that very place. I said, "The house of Anaḫ-Ištar is almost finished, and it is you who should ..."

src: 1 ma-na 6.5 GIN KU.GI pa-sa-lum 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa ik-ri-bi-a 2.5 ma-na sa ni-qi-im a-na um-mi-a-ni-a 2 ma-na KU sa su-be-lim u i-a-ti sa ba-ri-ni 4 ma-na KU sa E i-li-dan 0.33333 ma-na sa ik-ri-bi4-su-nu i pa-ni ne-pi-si-im na-di 1 ma-na sa-wi-ru mi-ma a-nim ni-is-ha-su DIRI sa-du-a-su sa-bu 0.5 ma-na LA 1.5 GIN ta-ad-mi-iq-tum sa i-li-a 10 GIN se-bu-ul-tum sa ISTAR-um-mi 2 GIN a-gi5-a-a 2 GIN me-me 2 GIN i-li-a 2 GIN E i-li-dan 2 GIN si-ma-at-ISTAR 0.5 GIN la-qe-ep 1.5 GIN {d}ISKUR.SIG5 1.5 GIN si-la-ma-si 1.5 GIN mu-se-ni-iq-tum 3 GIN sa la-ma-si a-na la-ma-sa-tim 10 GIN KU ik-ri-bu sa be-lim a-na bu-si-a a-di 10 GIN ik-ri-bu sa be-lim 5 GIN ik-ri-bu sa {d}UTU a-na a-sur-dan a-di mi-ma a-nim a-na a-sur-dan ap-qi-id IGI a-sur-ba-ni IGI su-li DUMU me-ra-li
tgt: 1 mina 6 1/2 shekels pašallum-gold and 5 minas silver for my votive fund, 2 1/2 minas for nāiqum to my investors, 2 minas silver belonging to Šū-Bēlum and myself, between us, 4 minas silver belonging to the house of Ilī-dān, 1/3 mina for their votive fund is deposited at the top of the sack, 1 mina bracelets--all this , its excise added and shipping paid, 28 1/2 shekels as tadmiqtum of Iliya, 10 shekels shipping charge of Ištar-ummī, 2 shekels for Agiya, 2 shekels for Meme, 2 shekels for Iliya, 2 shekels for the house of Ilī-dān, 2 shekels for Šimat-Ištar, 1/2 shekel for Lā-qēpum, 1 1/2 shekels for Adad-damiq, 1 1/2 shekels Šī-Lamassī, 1 1/2 shekels for the m., 3 shekels beloning to Lamassī to (go to) Lammassatum, 10 shekels silver for the votive offering of Bēlum I gave to Buṣiya, 10 shekels votive for Bēlum, 5 shekels for the votive offering of Šamaš I gave to Aššur-dān-- all this I entrusted to Aššur-dān. Witnesses: Aššur-bāni, Šuli s. Merali.

src: um-ma su-hu-bur sa-lim-a-hu-um a-sur-ba-ni u sa-lim-a-sur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma be-ti sa ku-lu-mi-im DUMU su-su-en6 DUMU DINGIR-ma-lik sa te-hi E bu-za-zu a-na 4 ma-na LA 9 GIN KU.BABBAR ni-il5-qe-a-kum KU.BABBAR se-bi-lam be-tam sa DINGIR-ma-lik DUMU su-su-en sa te-hi E-be-ti-ku-nu DAM.GAR-ru-su sa KU.BABBAR i-se-ri-su i-su-u-ni a-na 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na sa-par-tim il5-qe-u-su <gap> <big_gap> <gap>-ak-lu ti-su <big_gap> i-ka-sa-ad-ka
tgt: From Šu-Ḫubur, Šalim-aḫum, Aššur-bāni and Šalim-Aššur to Pūšu-kēn: We purchased the houses of Kulumum son of Šū-Suen son of Ilī-mālik which are next to the house of Buzāzu for 3 minas 51 shekels silver for you. Send the silver. The house of Ilī-mālik son of Šū-Suen which is next to your houses, his merchant, who had silver on him, took it as a pledge for 1 mina silver.

src: a-na <gap> <big_gap> <gap>-<gap>-ni sal-ma-<gap> <gap> u <gap> qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma a-na <big_gap> qi-bi-ma mi-su sa ta-as-tap-ra-ni <gap>-<gap> AN.NA be-el-ni <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<big_gap>-ah-ru da-na-i-e AN.NA <gap> GIN.TA <gap> zi-iz 9 GIN.TA AN.NA-ka <gap> <gap>-di-su-ma lu su-ru-tim lu ku-ta-ni <gap> is-am-ma lu KU.BABBAR <gap> <gap>-<gap> a-na E ka-ri-im a qa-ti-ka ni-di-i si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-ka 17.5 GIN KU.GI al-qe u i-nu-mi a-na LUGAL a-si-u-ka-ni 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na sa-wi-ri sa-lim-ha-ni tal-qe ni-ka-si ni-si-ma a-ma-kam-ma lu-qu-ut-ka u-ba-li-ta-kum-ma ta-at-be-a-ma ta-ta-la-ak <gap>-ru-um i-na be-ti-ka i-ba-si a-ma-kam i-na be-ti-a i-ba-si <gap>-<gap>-sa-am me-eh-ra-am a-na-kam u-ka-al lu-uh-ru-um ni-ka-si ni-si-ma um-ma a-ta-ma <gap> <gap>-ta a-na-ku <gap>-<gap>-<gap> <gap>-ma 25 ku-ta-ni-ka <gap>-<gap>-<gap> sa ki-ma i-a-ti il5-qe-u <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> a-la-ak-ma 1 GU <gap>-<gap>-<gap> la-qe-ma a-ga-mi-il5-ka <gap>-<gap>-<gap> <gap> i-na ka-ni-is <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> <gap>-tur4-ma a-sur u il5-ka li-tu-lu 8 GIN.TA <gap> GIN.TA KU.KI pa-sa-lam <gap>-<gap>-<gap> ku-nu-ki-a DUMU pa-pa-li <gap>-<gap>-<gap> um-ma a-na-ku-ma li-bu-su la i-la-mi-in4 AN.NA-ka ig tap dam te-er-ti AN.NA-ki-ka <gap>-ma <gap> 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN.TA <gap> a-na-ku-ma mi-nam le-pu-us lu-mu-un <gap> tum AN.NA 1 GU 0.66666 ma-na <gap> i-na li-bi-su <gap>
tgt: To PN, PN, PN, etc. from Pūšu-kēn: To PN: Why is it that you wrote me (thus) I took the remainder of the your cash--17 1/2 shekels gold. Now, when ... to the king (?), you received 2 minas silver for the sawirum of Šalim-Ḫani We settled accounts and there made good your goods to you, thus you must set out and come here. The ..rum is available in your house. It is available in my house there. I retain that corresponding ...šum here. We settled accounts. May Assur and your god witness that at an 8 shekel rate ... (not a x shekel rate?) the pašallam gold the son of Papali ...! I said, "He must not be angry.

src: 0.83333 ma-na 1 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am si-im 3 {TUG}ku-ta-ni <big_gap> i-se-er PUZUR4-{d}MAR.TU i-ku-num i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-di-a-sur u <big_gap> 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab IGI PUZUR4-ti-a-am-tim IGI su-be-lim
tgt: Puzur-Amurrum owes Ikūnum 51 shekels refined silver, the price of 3 kutānum textiles. He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month from the ḫamuštum of Idī-Aššur and ... . Witnesses: Puzur-Tiamtum, Šu-Bēlum.

src: 15 GU URUDU ha-bu-ra-ta-i-um KI DINGIR-na-da is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa {d}UTU.DU10 a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 15 GU URUDU ha-bu-ra-ta-i-um KI a-sur-i-di DUMU ib-ni-{d}IM is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa {d}UTU.DU10 a-na 17 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 6 GU URUDU ha-bu-ra-ta-i-um KI DUMU si-li-bi-a is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa {d}UTU.DU10 a-na 15 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal mi-ma URUDU a-nim i-na tu-ur-hu-mi-it i-sa-qu-lu tup-pu-su E en-na-nim DUMU a-bi-a i-na tu-ur-hu-mi-it i-ba-si-u
tgt: He will pay 20 weeks from the ḫamustum of Šamaš-ṭāb. He will pay 17 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Šamaš-ṭāb. He will pay 15 weeks from the ḫamušum of Šamaš-ṭāb.

src: a-na PUZUR4-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma il5-we-da-ku u bu-za-zu-ma a-su-mi da-da-a DUMU ti-li-a a-na-kam qa-su URUDU-ka a-mu-ti-su-nu i-di-in-ma KU.GI is-am ni-is-ba-su-ma um-ma ne-nu-ma KU.BABBAR lu KU.GI su-qul-ma lu ni-ik-nu-ka-kum-ma a-ta-ma na-an-si-su um-ma su-ut-ma a-na-ku-ma a-se-ri-su a-la-ak u i-se-er um-me-a-ni-a ma-da-tim-ma i-su a-la-ak-ma is-ti-su a-za-ku-ma KU.BABBAR as-ra-kam sa i-la-qe-u-su li-il5-qe a-wi-lum a-se-ri-ka i-tal-kam a-na-kam si-ku-su ITU.1.KAM is-te-en6 nu-ka-il5 um-ma su-ut-ma a-se-ri-su-ma a-la-ak mi-nam tu-ka-la-ni ki-ma a-se-ri-ka a-wi-lum i-la-ka-ni a si-a-ti a-wi-lam la nu-sa-am-ri-is
tgt: Zu Puzuraššur sprich! Folgendermaßen Ilīwēdāku und Buzāzu Was den Dadā'a, betrifft, so hat der hier (ihnen) dein Kupfer gegeben und Gold (dafür) gekauft. Wir haben ihn vorgeladen; dann (sprachen) wir folgendermaßen: "Silber oder Gold zahle! Dann wollen wir dir eine gesiegelte Urkunde (darüber) ausstellen. Also nimm du es auf dich! (?)" Folgendermaßen (antwortete) er: "Ich werde zu ihm gehen. Denn bei meinem Geldgeber habe ich viele (Posten) gut. Ich werde gehen und mich dann bei ihm rechtfertigen. Dort möge er das Silber, das er zu nehmen (berechtigt ist), ne[hmen.]" Der Mann ist zu dir abgereist. Hier haben wir seinen Gewandsaum einen Monat gehalten. Folgendermaßen (sprach) er: "Zu ihm werde ich gehen. Warum haltet ihr mich (noch) in Haft?" Da der Mann zu dir gehen wollte, deswegen haben wir den Mann nicht kränken wollen!

src: um-ma su-hu-bur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma ma-la lu-qu-ti a-se-er a-sur-SIPA i-ta-lu-ku i se-ep bu-zu-a as-pu-ra-kum a-hi a-ta a-na E a-sur-SIPA e-ru-ub-ma tup-pe-e-a li-ma-ad ma-la lu-qu-ti sa a-se-er i-di-su-en6 it-bu-lu lu ma-la sa a-na i-di-su-en6 <big_gap><big_gap>-IB-<big_gap> i-na E a-lim{ki} al-ta-pa-at tup-pa-su ha-ar-ma-am u-ka-al KU.BABBAR-pi-su sa-ba-at
tgt: From Šū-Ḫubur to Pūšu-kēn: I wrote to you concerning how many (of) my goods came to Aššur-rēʾī in the transport of Buzua. My dear brother, enter into the house of Aššur-rēʾī and read my tablets. [Find out?] how many goods he brought to Idi-Suen and how many [he sold?] for Idi-Suen. I hold his sealed tablets. Seize his silver.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni qi-bi4-ma a-na {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni qi-bi-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma te-er-ta-ka a-na se-er sa ki-ma ku-a-ti li-li-kam-ma AN.NA u TUG.HI.A ki-ma i-qi-pu-ni sa KU.BABBAR 1 GU li-di-nu-nim u i ta-ki-it a-ni-a-tim 10 ma-na.TA KU.BABBAR-pi li-li-ka-ku-ma a-na te-er-ti-a i-hi-id 2 GU AN.NA is-ti hu-ra-sa-nim 2 GU is-ti a-mur-a-sur DUMU su-ISTAR u 1 me-at ku-ta-nu AN.NA SIG5 i re-es15 AN.NA u TUG.HI.A a-na u4-me qu-ur-bu-tim nam-gi5-ra-ma le-qe su-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-ka a-na si-a-ma-tim tu-se-ba-lam la-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-ka e-ru-ba-ni tup-pa-ka le-ti-qa-ma si-ma-am sa ta-sa-pa-ra-ni i ra-mi-ni-a la-as-a-ma lu-se-bi-la-kum KU.BABBAR-pi ITU.1.KAM is-te-en6 u se-na li-be-la-ni a-hi a-ta a-na AN.NA-ki-a 6 GIN.TA la ta-ba-ta-qam 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR 0.5 ma-na KU.GI pa-sal-lam u ni-is-ha-su se-bi-lam 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-su-mi DINGIR i ra-mi-ni-ka ma-li li-bi4 la tu-la-ma-an DINGIR be-el ik-ri-bi li-ir-de8-ka i tup-pi-im sa la-qe-pi-im u pu-su-ke-en6 6.33333 ma-na AN.NA u ku-si-tum u 0.5 ku-ta-ni is-ti {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni a-hi a-ta KU.BABBAR-pi se-bi-lam
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn and Ilabrat-bāni, specifically to Ilabrat-bāni: You wrote me. You said, "Let your instructions come to your representatives so that when they sell me tin and textiles on credit, they sell me (some) totaling about a talent of silver. And in confirmation of these things let a 10 minas silver portion (of the total sale amount) go to you so that you heed my message." There are 2 talents tin with Ḫurašāum. There are 2 talents with Amur-Aššur son of Šū-Ištar. Also, there are 100 kutānum-textiles and fine tin on top of the (bulk) tin. Now, come to an agreement (for a price) on the textiles on short-term credit and take them. If you send your silver for purchases, then before your silver enters, let your tablet travel overland so that I can purchase the purchases which you send from my own funds and send them to you. Let my silver be lent out for a month or two My dear brother, for my tin, do no go less than a 6 shekel rate. Send me 5 minas silver and 1/2 mina Fulfill 1 mina silver for the god from your own funds. Do not disappoint me! May the god, the owner of my votive fund, drive you! My dear brother, send me my silver!

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma tup-pa-am sa te-er-ti-a sa a-na a-sur-ma-lik u hi-na-a a-la-pu-tu su-ma a-sur-ma-lik a ka-ni-is i-ta-al-kam u su-ma hi-na-a a-na ka-ni-is{ki} a-di-ni la i-li-kam sa ki-ma a-sur-ma-lik u sa ki-ma hi-na-a i-na u4-mi-im sa te-ra-bu sa-ba-su-nu-ma tup-pa-am sa te-er-ti-a is-ti-ka li-is-ta-me-u-ma AN.NA-ki u TUG.HI-a a-na u4-me i-se-er tam-ka-ri ke-nu-tim sa ki-ma qa-qi-di-ku-nu id-a 1 u 2 ITU.KAM la tu-se-qa-ra tam-ka-ru-ku-nu lu ke-nu 1 GU 5 ma-na AN.NA 2 TUG sa li-wi-tim u 6 {TUG}ku-ta-ni sa a-na a-sur-{d}UTU-si DUMU ib-ni-li na-as-a-ti-ni ki-ma a-na ka-ni-is te-ru-bu AN.NA u TUG.HI.A u tup-pi sa te-er-ti-a sa a-na a-sur-{d}UTU-si la-pu-tu-ni a-sar wa-as-bu e-hi-id-ma se-bi-il5-su-ma u te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam 2 ri-ik-sa-an sa 5 ma-na.TA AN.NA i-na pa-ni su-uq-lim na-ad-u 1 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR sa ha-bu-la-ku-ni a-hi a-ta 8 GIN.TA di-su-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-ka su-ta-bi AN.NA pa-ze-er i-na 8 GIN.TA e-li la e-li KU.BABBAR-ap-ka su-ta-bi
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: The tablet of instructions which I wrote to Aššur-mālik and Ḫinnaya, if Aššur-mālik arrived in Kanesh and if Ḫinnaya has not yet arrived in Kanesh, seize the representatives of Aššur-mālik and the representatives of Ḫinnaya on the day that you arrive and cause them to hear the tablet of my instruction and sell my tin and textiles on credit to a trustworthy merchant -as trustworthy as yourselves. Do not overvalue 1 or 2 months. Your merchants must be trustworthy. 1 talent 5 minas tin, 2 textiles as wrappings, and 6 kutānum-textiles which you brought to Aššur-šamšī s. Ibni-ilī, when you arrive in Kanesh, take care to send the tin, textiles, and tablets of my te'ertum written to Aššur-šamšī wherever he is. Also, send you te'ertum. Two packages of 5 minas tin are placed in the top of the pack. 1 minas 15 shekels silver which I owe you, my dear brother, please sell it at an 8 shekel rate and take your silver. Smuggle the tin. At an 8 shekel rate above or below, you can take your silver.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-ma-lik-ma i-na ha-am-si-im u4-mi-im sa e-ru-bu a-wi-la-tum sa E a-sur-ma-lik a-lam im-hu-ra-ma a-lum{ki} di-nam i-di-in-ma lu-qu-tam sa 30 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa ik-ri-bi4 sa a-sur-ma-lik ma-ma-an is-bu-tu u-sar u sa il5-qe-u u-ta-ar la sa u-si-ru u la sa u-ta-e-ru i-sa-ri-iq-sum tup-pa-am da-nam sa a-lim{ki} ni-il5-qe u ra-bi4-sa-am ne-hu-uz ka-ru-um e-mu-uq-su a-na la 10 u4-me ha-mu-us-tum sa te-i-na-tim ra-bi4-su-um u i-li-ba-ni u-su-nim u a-na su-mi sa DINGIR-mu-ta-bi4-il5 a-li-ki ak-su-ud-ma mi-su is-ti a-li-ki u-la i-la-ak u-sa-il5-ma a-na ti-me-el-ki-a i-ta-la-ak is-ti a-hi-su a-na TUG.HI.A sa ti-me-el-ki-a i-ta-am-gar su-ma a-na a-lim{ki} i-tal-kam a-na ma-la sa tu-na-hi-di-ni a-na-ku-ma a-wa-tam a-da-sum la ta-na-hi-da
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Aššur-mālik: On the fifth day after I arrived, the ladies of the house of Aššur-mālik approached the city council and the city rendered a verdict that whoever seized the goods worth 30 minas of silver belonging to the votive fund of Aššur-mālik must release them. Now, whatever he took he will return. He will have stolen from him whatever he does not release or return. We received a certified tablet from the city. And we acquired an attorney. The colony is his authority. Within 10 days, during(?) the ḫamuštum-official of Teinātum, the attorney, and Ilī-bāni will depart. Now, with regard to the matter of Ilī-mutabbil, my traveller has arrived and will he not go with my traveler? I made inquiry and he departed for Timelkiya. He agreed with his brother for textiles of Timelkiya. If he departs for the city, I will give to him whatever you instruct me. Will you not give me instruction?

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u GAL-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma ku-zal-lim-ma ki-ma u-nu-tum us-a-ni TUG.HI.A-ti sa i-na pa-zu-ur-tim e-ru-bu-ni-ni u-ma-kal i-na E.GAL-lim us-ib-ni su-ha-ru u ku-zal-lim sa ab-ri-im li-it-bu-lu-nim la-ma ku-us-um id-ni-nu u GAL-a-sur a-di E ka-ri-im za-ka-im li-ik-la a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-ma-kam TUG.HI.A ma-la a qa-ti-a ta-ha-su-hu sa ka-la-im ki-la su-ma sa ki-ma i-na-su-en6 a-na su-mi KU.BABBAR-pi-su-nu lu-qu-tam i-ka-lu-u ma-la 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR ap-pu-si-im TUG a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum a-bu-uk-ma a-di KU.BABBAR u-si-a-ni qa-qa-a-ka ma-ha-as lu-qu-tam la i-ka-lu-u la ma-qu-si-im <gap>-<gap> pu ku-<gap> su-ma ta-qa-bi4 um-ma a-ta-ma a-na 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR qa-qi-di a-ma-ha-as <big_gap><gap> dan-IR i-ku-nu-um u dan-a-sur u i-a-ti li-di-nu-nim-ma <gap>-<gap> KU.BABBAR i-la-qe sa E-<gap> sa a-na <big_gap> i TUG <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap>
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn and Rabi-Aššur from Kunilum: When the merchandise come out, the textiles which arrived as smuggled goods, on the very same day they exit the palace, let the lads and Kunilum bring Abrum's property to me. Until the cold grows severe, Rabi-Aššur should withhold the goods until he has received clearance by the colony office. To Pūšu-kēn (say): There, retain the appropriate textiles, as many as you need (of) my share. If Enna-Suen's representatives withhold (my) merchandise on account of their silver, repay(?) them the amount of 20 minas silver. I sent the copper (textiles?) to Purušḫattum. Until the silver matures, reserve it. He must not retain the merchandise. ... If you will say, "I will reserve the 20 minas silver." Let Dān-(warad??) Ikūnum and Dān-Aššur give me also my own so the silver will go.(?) The matter of the house for ... from the textiles ... (?)

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 um-ma su-ku-bu-um-ma a ma-la na-as-par-tim sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni um-me-a-ni-ka nu-pa-he-er-ma nu-ma-ge5-er u tup-pa-am sa ku-nu-ki-su-nu na-as-u-ni-kum 3 TUG-kam-su-tim SIG5 7 {TUG}ku-ta-ni SU.NIGIN 10 TUG sa a-si-ti-ka a-na ku-lu-ma-a ma-ah-ri-a ta-ap-qi-id-ma na-as-a-kum 1 ri-ik-sa-am sa hu-sa-ri sa a si-ti-ka {d}UTU-tak-la-ku IR-ad-ka na-as-a-kum a-hi a-ta AN.NA u TUG.HI.A sa se-ep a-ta-ta a-ta u i-na-a mi-is-la le-qe-a-ma a ma-la a-na-kam <gap> <gap>-a-ni KU.BABBAR me-eh-ra-tim se-bi-lam KU.BABBAR i se-ep i-na-a <gap> ta-di-nam <gap> ta-ni-ma <gap> ta-ni u a-ni le-qe-ma li-bi la tu-la-ma-an ki-ma ta-ga-mi-la-ni-ma li-bi4 la i-ma-ru-su e-pu-us a-hi a-ta i-hi-id-ma lu KU.BABBAR lu TUG.HI.A lu mi-ma is-ta-pu-ku-ni qa-ti i-ta-di-ma ki-ma a-na ku-a-ti i-na-pu-lu-ni u i-a-ti li-pu-lu-nim-ma gi-im-la-ni na-as-pa-ra-tim sa a-su-mi sa i-na-a i se-pi-ka tu-ub-lu a ma-la u-na-hi-du-ka a-ta u i-na-a si-ta-me-a-si-na-ma ki-ma ta-as-me-a-ni a-ta u i-na-a ku-un-ka-si-na-ma a-na DUMU um-me-a-nim ke-nim pi-qi-id-ma lu-sa-se-er-ma lu-ub-lam u a-su-mi sa su-su-en6 i-hi-id a-sur u <big_gap> li-tu-la ki-ma ku-lu-ma-a i bu-ru-lim <gap> ta-bu-ma 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR a sa ki-ma a-li-<gap> <gap> la-qa-am la i-mu-ma KU.BABBAR <gap>
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Šū-Kūbum: In accordance with the letter which you wrote to me, we gathered your investors and we brokered an agreement. Now, their sealed tablet they bring to you. 3 fine 'finished' textiles, 7 kutānum-textiles, in all 10 textiles belonging to your wife, she entrusted them to Kulumaya in my presence and he brings them to you. Aššur-taklāku your servant brings you one bundle of lapis belonging to your wife. My dear brother, you and Innāya take half of the tin and textiles in Atata's charge and in accordance with (what we discussed) here, send the 'corresponding' silver. Silver in the charge of [PN] ... (fragmentary) ... take. Do not disappoint me. Act in such a way that when you do me a favor, you do not disappoint me. My dear brother, take heed to deposit my share, silver, textiles, or whatever they will invest so that they balance me in the same way they balance you and do me a favor. As for the documents which states, 'Concerning the matter of Innāya,' which you brought in your transport, you and Innāya read them and when you have read them, you and Innāya seal them and entrust them to a reliable affiliated trader so that he puts them in protective casing and brings them to me. Now, take heed concerning the matter of Šū-Suen. May Aššur (and DN?) witness that Kulumaya ... in Burallum. He did not want to receive(?) the 10 minas to Ali-...'s representatives and ... silver ...

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na la-qe-ep u pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma 6 GU 30 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ki-a 18 TUG su-ru-tum sa li-wi-tim 1 me-at 10 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 7 ANSE.HI.A sa-la-mu 1 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA a qa-ti-su-nu mi-ma a-nim ku-nu-ki-a su-su-en6 u dan-a-sur i-ra-de8-u-ni-ku-nu-ti SA 10 TUG sa dan-a-sur 1 {TUG su-ra-am a-na a-wi-il5-tim di-na AN.NA u TUG.HI-ti-a a-na DAM.GAR ke-nim sa ki-ma qa-qi-di-ku-nu a u4-me qu-ur-bu-tim di-na su-ma a u4-me qu-ur-bu-tim la i-ba-si ki-ma i-qi-pu-ni AN.NA u TUG.HI-ti-a a-na DAM.GAR ke-nim sa ki-ma qa-qi-di-ku-nu di-na DAM.GAR-ku-nu lu ke-en6 ITU.KAM is-te-en6 u se-na la tu-se-qa-ra KU ma-la i-na se-er DAM.GAR ta-na-di-a-ni u u4-me i-na tup-pi-ku-nu lu-up-ta-nim 2 ri-ik-sa-an 14 ma-na AN.NA a-na a-gu-a 6 {TUG}ku-ta-nu a-ha-ma a-na DAM.GAR-ri mi-ma a-nim a-se-er la-qe-ep u pu-su-ke-en6 su-su-en6 u dan-a-sur na-as-u ANSE.HI.A sa-la-me TUG.HI.A sa dan-a-sur is-ti ANSE.HI.A sa-la-me e-mi-da-ma a-na u4-me qu-ur-bu-tim di-na a ba-ab ha-ra-ni-su KU.BABBAR li-si-qi-il5-ma i se-pi-su KU.BABBAR lu-ub-lam
tgt: Šalim-aḫum to Lā-qēpum and Pūšu-kēn: 6 talents 30 minas tin under my seal, 18 šurum textiles as wrappings, 100 kutānum textiles, 7 black donkeys, 1 talent 10 minas tin for their expenses: all this under my seal Sū-Suen and Dān-Aššur transport to you. From the 10 textiles of Dān-Aššur, give 1 šurum textile to the lady. Sell my tin and textiles to a reliable merchant, as reliable as yourselves on "short" term credit. If (a credit sale) on short terms is not available, when you sell on credit, sell my tin and textiles to a reliable merchant, as reliable as yourselves. Your merchant must be reliable. Do not overvalue a month or two. Write in your tablet as much silver as you give to the merchant and the term period. Two sacks --14 minas tin -- (related) to Agua, 6 kutānum textiles separately for merchants: all this Šū-Suen and Dān-Aššur bring to Lā-qēpum and Pūšu-kēn. Bundle Dān-Aššur's black donkeys and textiles with the black donkeys and sell (them) on 'short' terms. Have the silver paid at his (Dān-Aššur's) departure so that he brings it in his transport.

src: um-ma i-li-a-ma u la-qe-ep-ma a-na i-di-ISTAR qi-bi-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-ka u se-bu-la-tu-ka ma-la tup-pi-ka sal-mu DUMU su-i-ta-a ub-lam KU.BABBAR um-mi-a-nu-ka i-sa-ab-tu a-hu-ka a-sar la-mu-tim is-e-u nu-sa-li-su-nu-ti-ma um-ma su-nu-ma u-la ni-sa-me il5-e-u-ni-a-ti-ma nu-ta-se-er um-ma i-ri-sum-ma u en-na-num mu-nu-a-ti-ni ta-e-ra-su-um um-ma a-hu-ka KU.BABBAR la tu-ta-ra-su-um na-ru-qi-ni i-ma-si ni-ka-si-ni li-di-in-ma wa-ar-ka ta-e-ra-su-um KU.BABBAR la ta-sa-ka-na-am ta-sa-ka-nam-ma i-sa-bu-tu-ma is-ti a-li-ki-im pa-nim-ma ti-ib-a-ma a-tal-kam-ma tu-za-ki um-ma i-ri-sum u en-na-num-ma li-li-kam-ma KU.BABBAR sa a-hi-su lu-ta-er-ma u ne-nu lu ni-di-su-um a-bi-wa-qar ni-is-ba-at-ma um-ma su-ut-ma 1 me-at 20 sa-am-ru-a-tim ANSE sa-la-ma-am 2 TUG ga-zi-iz-te-en6 e-zi-ba-am 15 ma-na URUDU i-di-in-ni-a-ti um-ma su-ut-ma re-eh-tam i-na ha-ra-nim a su-mi-su a-qi-ip ANSE sa-la-ma-am i-di-ni-a-ti 7 ma-na ni-di-su 0.5 BANES I.SAH ub-lam lu sa a-bi-a-qar lu se-bu-la-tu-ka se-am ni-sa-a-ma-kum na-ru-uq en-um-DINGIR u-se-li-u-ma u-la is-e-u i-na UD.2.KAM um-ma su-nu-ma al-ka-nim KU.BABBAR lu ni-a-ti zu-za um-ma ne-nu-ma is-tu i-na DAM.GAR-tim la ni-zi-zu la na-<gap>
tgt: From Ilīya and Lā-qēpum to Idī-Ištar: Your silver and your shipment, in accordance with your tablet, is well. The son of Suetaya brought it here. Your investors seized the silver.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma su-ma-bi4-a-ma u a-sur-ma-lik-ma 7 GU 30 ma-na URUDU SIG5 ni-ip-qi-id-ma a-na pu-ru-us-ha-tim a-se-er a-mur-ISTAR i-ta-ab-lu 4 GU URUDU SIG5 a-na-kam a-sar a-sur-ma-lik na-di 2 GU i-na u-la-ma E ku-ra-ra na-di 4.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-ni u-su-pi-is-kum na-as-a-kum a ma-la te-er-ti-ka sa as-qu-dim ni-is-ba-at URUDU a-na-kam a ta-da-nim ni-zi-iz-ma um-ma as-qu-ud-ma mi-su-um a-na-kam ta-da-na-ma 1 GIN KU.BABBAR i-bi4-sa-e a-ma-ar as-qu-ud a-se-ri-ka i-ta-al-kam
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Šumi-abiya and Aššur-mālik: We entrusted 7 talents and 30 minas of fine copper and they took it to Purušḫattum to Amur-Ištar. 4 talents of fine copper are deposited here at the place of Aššur-mālik. 2 talents of fine copper are deposited at the house of Kurara/Karriya in Ulama. Uṣupiškum brings you 4 minas 45 shekels of silver under our seals. According to your instructions, we seized the goods of Asqudum. As for the copper, we stood here for its sale and Asqudum said, "Why do you sell the tin here so that I will see (only) 1 shekel of silver, i.e. losses?" Asqudum has departed toward you.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-{d}UTU-si PUZUR4.ISTAR u a-sur-ma-lik-ma 23.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa na-ru-uq su-nu-nu ku-nu-ki-ni PUZUR4-{d}UTU na-as-a-ku-um
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn, from Aššur-šamšī, Puzur-Ištar, and Aššur-mālik: Puzur-Šamaš brings to you 23 1/3 minas silver of Šū-Nunu's sack under our seal.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma hu-sa-ru-um-ma 26 ku-ta-nu 1 ANSE u u-nu-su su-ku-bu-um i-ra-de8-a-kum ma-la TUG.HI.A i-za-ku-u-ni-ni SA.BA 10 TUG a-na a-la-bi-im di-in si-ti TUG-ti a-na kur-ub-ISTAR di-in ANSE a-se-er lu-qu-ti-a pa-ni-tim i-di-su a-bi a-ta i-hi-id-ma si-im lu-qu-ti-a pa-ni-tim is-ti a-li-ki-im pa-ni-im-ma se-bi-lam u su-ku-bu-um la i-sa-hu-ur tur4-da-su i-na TUG-ti pa-ni-u-tim 1 TUG a-na su-ku-bi4-im di-in a-bi4-DU10 tur4-da-am
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Ḫusārum; Šū-Kūbum brings to you 26 textiles, 1 donkey and its gear. As many textiles as they clear to me, thereof, give 10 textiles to Al-ābum. Give the remainder of the textiles to Kurub-Ištar. As for the donkey, place it with my previous goods. My dear father, take care to send the proceeds from my previous goods with the very first traveller. Now, do not delay Šū-Kubum. Despatch him. From my previous textiles, give 1 textile to Šū-Kubum. Despatch Abī-ṭāb.

src: KISIB la-li-im KISIB ku-ra KISIB a-sur-dan sa 11 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-na a-sur-dan a be-a-lim a-sur-SIPA i-di-nu ITU.KAM a-la-na-tim li-mu-um su-da-a DUMU en-na-nim a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab 5 pa-su-ru sa-a-ma u u-ta u 5 pa-su-ru sa-a-ma 1 BANES LAL u 1 BANES hi-im-tam is-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-su i-da-su-um ha-mus-tum sa i-di-a-sur u a-sur-tak-la-ku ta-ah-si-is-tum me-ha-ar tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa a-sur-dan
tgt: Seals: Lālum, Kura, Aššur-dān. Regarding the 11 minas refined silver which Aššur-rēʾī gave Aššur-dān as a beʾalum loan. He will pay 13 ḫamuštum weeks from the month Allanātum, eponymate Šudaya s. Ennānum. If he does not pay (on time) he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest. Purchase 5 tables and search. And purchase 5 tables. He will give to him 1 šūtum measure of honey and 1 šutum measuer of butter with his silver. Ḫamuštum of Idī-Aššur and Ašsur-taklāku. This memorandum is a copy of the sealed tablet of Aššur-dān.

src: a-na i-na-a i-na-ah-DINGIR PUZUR4-a-sur u PUZUR4-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma su-ISTAR-ma a-ba-u-a a-tu-nu a-ma-kam i-se-er be-ti-a e-ku-nu li-li-ik a-na i-na-a qi-bi4-ma a-ma-kam i-se-er a-mur-ISTAR e-ka li-li-ik a-na su-ISTAR la i-ra-ga-am a-na be-ti-a la e-ra-ab u ma-num-ki-a-sur DUMU a-ta-ta la e-ra-ab
tgt: To Innāya, Inaḫ-ilī, ... from Šu-Ištar ...

src: um-ma a-sur-ma-lik-ma a-na su-su-en6 qi-bi-ma a-na-kam um-ma a-ta-ma is-ti a-li-ki-im pa-nim-ma su-ba-tam u-da-ma-aq-ma u-se-ba-la-ku-um a-hi a-ta mi-su-um a-di u4-mi-im a-nim la tu-se-bi-lam i-hi-id-ma su-ba-tam da-mi-iq-ma is-ti pa-nim-ma se-bi-lam su-ma a-na a-lim{ki} ha-ra-ka a-na a-lim{ki} na-an-si-su
tgt: From Aššur-mālik to Šū-Suen: Here, you said, "I will improve(?) the textile(s) with the very first travelers and I will send it(them) to you." My dear brother, why is it that you have not sent them until this very day? If you are making your journey to the city, have them carried to the city.

src: 7 GU 30 ma-na URUDU qa-ta-am sa pu-su-ke-en6 is-ti en-nam-a-sur 1.3333300000000001 ma-na.TA i-di-su-en6 is-am KU.BABBAR en-nam-a-sur sa-bu-u SA.BA 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR um-mi-a-nu sa PUZUR4.ISTAR ik-lu-u u-tu-ra-u sa URUDU a-na en-nam-a-sur i-za-zu 1 GU 5 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ki sa pu-su-ke-en6 2 {TUG}ku-ta-na-an 2 TUG su-ra-an sa PUZUR4.ISTAR a-na i-di-su-en6 en-nam-a-sur ip-qi-id IGI en-um-a-sur IGI da-a-a
tgt: Idī-Suen purchased 7 talents 30 minas copper, the share of Pūšu-kēn from Ennam-Aššur for 1 1/3 minas (silver). The silver of Ennam-Aššur is satisfied. Thereof, the investors of Puzur-Ištar retained 1 mina silver. They settlted the surplus of the copper to Ennam-Aššur. Ennam-Aššūr entrusted to Idī-Suen 1 talent 5 minas tin under the seal of Pūšu-kēn, 2 Witnesses: Ennum-Aššur, Dāyā.

src: 3.6666600000000003 ma-na 1 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er en-na-nim PUZUR4.ISTAR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa bu-ut-ki-im u a-mur-ISTAR a-na 21 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-em i ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab IGI a-bi-la IGI a-li-li
tgt: Ennanum owes Puzur-ištar 3 minas 41 shekels refined silver. He will pay 21 If he does not pay, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest). Witnesses: Abela, Al-ilī.

src: tup-pa-am ha-ar-ma-am sa 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa a-mur-ISTAR a-na i-li-a-lim i-di-nu-ma i-li-a-lum a-na a-lim{ki} KU.BABBAR u-se-bi4-lu a-na bu-zu-ta-a ni-ip-qi-id su-ma lu-qu-tam sa 10 ma-na-e KU.BABBAR i pu-ru-us-ha-tim sa ki-ma i-li-a-lim a-na a-mur-ISTAR la i-ta-ad-nu tup-pa-am bu-zu-ta-a a-na da-ni di-ni-su u-ba-al IGI a-sur-ma-lik DUMU lu-zi-na IGI i-di-a-bi4-im DUMU a-sur-GAL a-na bu-zu-ta-a tup-pa-am ni-ip-qi-id
tgt: We entrusted to Buzutaya the sealed tablet stating 10 minas silver which Amur-Ištar gave to Ilī-ālum then Ilī-ālum took the silver to the city. If the goods worth 10 minas silver minas in Purušḫattum the representatives of Ilī-ālum are not deposited (?) to Amur-Ištar, Buzutaya will bring the tablet to the determiner of his case.? Witnesses: Aššur-mālik s. Luzina, Idī-abum s. Aššur-rabi. We entrusted the tablet to Buzutaya.

src: 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i se-pi-su pa-ni-tim i-li-is-ti-kal ub-la-ku-nu-ti-ma 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR a ni-ka-si-a 1 ma-na-um 0.66666 ma-na.TA a-sa-kan u 10 GIN a ni-ka-si-a ta-di-a si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-a 0.33333 ma-na 7.5 GIN u 0.33333 TUG su-ru-tim i-sa e-la-at DUMU pa-na-ka a ni-ka-si-a ta-di-a 18 GIN KU.BABBAR-ap-su-nu 2 ma-na LA 6 GIN 5 GIN a-mu-tam sa-ha-ar-tam KISIB-ku-nu-ki-a i-pi-li-is ub-la-ku-nu-ti um-ma a-na-ku-ma a ni-ka-si-a id-a-si su-ma ta-di-na-a-si te-er-ta-ku-nu li-li-kam su-ma a-mu-ti i-ba-si se-bi4-la-nim i-na tup-pi-ku-nu wa-ar-ki-im um-ma a-tu-nu-ma ku-ta-nam a-ra-ab-e-ti-ka ni-di-in ra-ab-e-ti-a ka-ru-um e-nu-nam-ma si-im-su i ni-ka-si ta-sa-ka-ni 13 ku-ta-ni a-na 4.66666 ma-na 6 GIN ta-di-na SA 1 ma-na 1 0.25 GIN a pa-zu-ur-ti ki-li TUG.HI-a ta-di-na si-ti KU.BABBAR 3.6666600000000003 ma-na <gap> 4.75 GIN 8 TUG.HI.A sa li-wi-tim a-na 2 ma-na ta-di-na <gap> si-ti {TUG}ku-ta-ni-a 21 <gap> mi-ma la tu-se-ba-la-nim a-ma-kam di-na-su-nu-ma lu a ni-ka-si-a lu a-sar ta-da-nim di-na-su-nu-ma a sa ni-ka-si-a KU-ap-ku-nu li-qe-a 0.66666 ma-na KU qa-ti su-{d}EN.LIL i-di-u u um-ma su-ut-ma a-na e-na-ba-sa-at su-pu-ur-ma KU-pi lu-se-bi4-lam mi-su-um la-qa-am la i-mu-a ma KU-pi i-ba-si is-tu 5 ITU.KAM 3 ma-na.TA u-la 4 ma-na.TA TUG 10 qa-tam i-di-u i-a-ti ma-ti-ma u-la ta-as-pu-ra-nim a-ba-u-a a-tu-nu ma-la ta-di-a-ni su-up-ra-nim-ma lu-se-bi4-ka-ku-nu-zi gi-im-la-ni u su-ma la ta-ga-mi-la-ni ki-ma a-hu a-na a-hi-im si-ib-tam i-du-nu i-se-ri-a li-qe-a ni-ka-su lu-se-si-u-ma tup-pi-a si-in-qa-ma za-ku-tam su-up-ra-nim-ma si-ib-tam i-se-ri-a la ta-la-qe-a-ma a-se-er lu-mu-un li-bi4-a lu-mu-un li-bi4-im la tu-sa-ba-nim
tgt: Ili-ištakal brought you 1 mina refined silver in his previous transport. I will put 2 minas silver into my account--1 minas per 2/3 minas.

src: 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR li-ti i-se-er a-si-at a-ta ka-zu-pa ta-lu-wa-na u pe-ru-a a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa en-nu-ma-nim u a-sur-SIPA a-na 5 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 3 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-su-bu i-na qa-qa-ad ke-ni-su-nu u sal-mi-su-nu KU.BABBAR-pi ra-ki-is IGI la-qe-ep IGI DU10-a-sur
tgt: He will pay five weeks from the ḫamuštum of en-nu-ma-nim and Aššur-rēʾī. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 3 shekels per mina per month (as interest). Witnesses: Lāqēp, Ṭāb-Aššur

src: 0.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-gu5-za a-sur-{d}UTU i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ka-li-a u na-ab-su-en6 0.66666 GIN 15 SE i ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab IGI su-ka-li-a IGI ga-zi-a
tgt: Aguza owes Aššur-šamšī 25 shekels refined silver. He will add 2/3 shekel and 15 grains per month. Witnesses: Sukkallīya, Gaziā.

src: 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er sa-at-e-a u a-ta-ta DINGIR-na-da i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni u a-sur-na-da a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI dan-a-sur IGI la-qe-ep ITU.KAM a-la-na-tim li-mu-um DUG-a-sur
tgt: Šāt-Ea and Adada owe Ilī-nādā 1/3 mina refined silver. They will pay ten weeks from the ḫamuštum of Amurrum-bāni and Aššur-nādā. The silver is bound to whomever is financially solvent. Witnesses: Dān-Aššur, Lāqēp. Month: Allānātum. Eponymate: Ṭāb-Aššur.

src: 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-na ha-mus-tim sa i-li-a-lim u u-su-ur-sa-a-sur zu-pa is-qu-la-am 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-mur-{d}UTU DUMU sa-li-ti is-qu-la-am 9 na-ru-uq 2 DUG se-am a-na PUZUR4-a-sur ah-bu-ul
tgt: I owe 9 sacks and 2 seah grain to Puzur-Aššur.

src: 0.33333 ma-na 3 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er {d}ISKUR-ba-ni su-ISTAR u a-bi-a i-su-u is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-ma-lik 2.33333 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI a-sur-DUG IGI zu-pa
tgt: Adad-bāni owes Šū-Ištar and Abīya 23 shekels silver. He will add 2 1/3 shekels per month as interest.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma mi-su sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni um-ma a-ta-ma i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-ka DUMU a-la-hi-im i-sa-ba-at ma-nam ha-bu-la-ku-ma ta-am-gi5-ir-ti-ni 2 GU AN.NA ku-nu-ki sa a-lim{ki} su-a-sur ma-ah-ri-ka i-sa-ka-an-ma i-2-si-ta is-te-et ta-na-sa-aq-ma 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na e-ti-ka ta-sa-qal u tup-pa-am su-a-ti su-a-sur i se-pi-su <big_gap> ub-la-kum mi-su KU.BABBAR sa i-sa-bu-tu i-na a-wa-tim i-bu-a-ka a-pu-uh 2-si-ta su-uq-le-en6 is-te-ta-ma u-ka-li-im-ka u si-it-ma pa-at-ra-at su-ma-ma mi-ma a-na a-bi4-su ha-bu-la-ku li-is-pu-ra-ma a-bu-su a-na-kam li-is-ba-ta-ni a-ma-kam ki-ma ta-le-e-u AN.NA li-qe-ma ki-ma a-wi-lu-ti-ka e-pu-us-ma KU.BABBAR di-su-nu-ti a-ma-kam a-wa-tum la i-sa-qal
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā: Why have you written me as follows: "Alāhum's son will seize some of your silver"? To whom do I owe anything, since it was our agreement that Šū-Aššur will place 2 talents of tin under the seal of the City authorities, before you and you will choose one of the two and pay 10 minas of silver promptly. Moreover, that very tablet Šū-Aššur brought you personally! Why should he seize any silver? He is depriving you with words. Instead of two containers he showed you only one; moreover, that one had been opened! If indeed I owe anything to his father, then let him write to his father, so that his father can seize me here. Take what tin you are able to there, and act like a gentleman and give them the silver. The matter should not be heard there.

src: 0.5 ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-bu-um-DINGIR DAM.GAR-ru-um i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa kur-ub-ISTAR DUMU a-la-hi-im a-na 6 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-em i ITU.KAM u-sa-ab ITU.1.KAM te-i-na-tim li-mu-um a-sur-na-da DUMU i-li-bi4-na-ni IGI en-um-a-sur IGI a-sur-du-ri
tgt: Abum-ilī owes the merchant 1/2 mina 2 shekels refined silver. He will pay 6 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Kurub-Ištar s. Al-aḫim. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Month: Teʾinātim Year: Aššur-nādā s. Ilī-binanni Witnesses: Ennum-Aššur, Aššur-dūrī

src: a-na i-di-a-bi4-im u PUZUR-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma su-ISTAR-ma be-lu-a a-tu-nu mi-nam a-wa-tim ma-da-tim lu-la-pi-ta-ku-nu-ti ke-num a-na-ku la a-na-di e-na-ka la i-la-mi-na be-u-la-at KU.BABBAR mi-nam ub-la-kum ku-a-ti te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam-ma KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na-um 5 GIN a si-ib-tim ma-ad lu hu-sa-ru-um lu su-ba-tu sa a-ki-di-e lu ku-ta-ni SIG5 sa e-ni i-ma-hu-ru la-as-a-ma is-ti-a li-il5-pu-tu-su-nu-ma si-ma-am la-as-a-ma lu-ub-lu-ni-ku-ma a-ma-kam di-su-ma KU.BABBAR u ne-ma-al-su se-bi4-la-ma KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su la-as-qu-ul-ma KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na sa i-ri-ha-ni la-al-qe-ma lu su-um-ka 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am ma-num-ba-lum-a-sur DUMU e-na-ma-nim ha-bu-lam a ka-ni-is e-ra-ab-ma 1 ITU.KAM i-la-ak-ma KU.BABBAR a-na sa ki-ma i-a-ti i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul si-be-e i-sa-ku-nu-su-ma 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab si-be-e su-uk-na-su-ma KU.BABBAR a si-ib-tim li-qe-a-ma se-bi4-la-nim-ma KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su <big_gap> <gap>-tim i-su-su-um 10 TUG.HI.A sa a-na a-hi-im u eb-ri-im sa e-la-tim a-di-nu KI i-<gap> <gap> ka-sa-ar im-di-lim i-la-ka-ku-nu-ti-ma KU.BABBAR tu-se-ba-la-nim
tgt: To Iddi(n)-abum and Puzur-Aššur from Šu-Ištar: My dear lords, why is that I must write you so many words? I am Starting after broken lines 1-3 Lines 4-7 Lines 8-9

src: 1 GU URUDU SIG5 i-se-er a-mur-a-sur DUMU a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku DAM.GAR-ru-um i-su is-tu ITU.1.KAM si-ip-im li-mu-um is-ma-a-sur a-na 9 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 ma-na.TA si-ib-tam a-na 1 GU-tim i-na ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab IGI ma-nu-ba-lum-a-sur DUMU si-la-{d}IM IGI ar-ib-du-a DUMU a-mur-a-sur IGI PUZUR-a-sur DUMU su-be-lim wa-bi4-il5 tup-pi-im su-ut tam-ka-ru-um
tgt: Amur-Aššur s. Aššur-taklāku owes the merchant 1 talent fine copper. He will pay nine weeks from the month of Ṣipʾum, eponymate of Išme-Aššur. If he does not pay (on time), he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 minas per talent per month. Witnesses: Mannu-bālum-Aššur s. Ṣilli-Adad, Aribtua s. Amur-Aššur, Puzur-Aššur s. Šū-Bēlum.

src: KISIB i-ku-pi-a-sur DUMU pi-la-ah-a-sur KISIB a-sur-ma-lik DUMU a-la-hi-im KISIB {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni DUMU su-ku-bi4-im KISIB i-di-a-sur DUMU ku-ku-la-nim KISIB la-qe-pi-im DUMU a-sur-ma-lik KISIB a-sur-qa-bi4-a DUMU ku-ra-a-a KISIB ni-na-sa DAM a-pi-la la-qe-pu-um DUMU a-sur-ma-lik a-sur-qa-bi4-a DUMU ku-ra-a-a u ni-na-sa DAM a-pi-la ki-ma a-pi-la i-na mi-ig-ra-ti-su-nu is-bu-tu-ni-a-ti-ma a-wa-ti-su-nu nu-ga-me-er-ma ni-is a-lim{ki} it-mu-u-ma tup-pa-am sa 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa hu-bu-ul zu-zu-ba DUMU ku-ut-ba-ka-nim a-bu a-pi-la sa a-na a-sur-ma-lik DUMU la-qe-pi-im ha-bu-lu a-na ITU.4.KAM i-di-a-sur DUMU ku-ku-la-nim u-ba-lam-ma i-na re-es15 tup-pi-im 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR ki-ma a-pi-la ni-na-sa a-sa-su u a-sur-qa-bi4-a a-na i-di-a-sur DUMU ku-ku-la-nim i-sa-qu-lu 45 ma-na URUDU ma-si-am la-qe-pu-um il5-qe su-ma tup-pa-am sa sa-ba-e sa ku-nu-uk a-sur-ma-lik lu sa si-be-e sa zu-zu-ba a-na a-sur-ma-lik is-ku-nu-ma KA DINGIR ih-ri-mu a-pi-la a-na ITU.4.KAM i-tab-lam 45 ma-na URUDU ma-si-am i-di-a-sur DUMU ku-ku-la-nim a-na sa ki-ma a-pi-la u-ta-ar-ma tup-pu-um tup-pa-am i-ma-ha-as tup-pu-um is-tu ka-ni-is a-di tur4-hu-mi-it a-su-mi a-pi-la GAN-lam e-ti-iq KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um su-ra-ma a-sur-ma-lik i-ku-pi-a-sur u {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni a-wi-lu a-ni-u-tum ga-me-ru a-wa-tim
tgt: Seals: Ikuppi-Aššur s. Pilaḫ-Aššur, Aššur-mālik s. Al-aḫum, Amurrum-bāni s. Šū-Kūbum, Idī-Aššur s. Kukkulānum, Lā-qēpum s. Aššur-mālik, Aššur-qābiya s. Kura, Ninašša w. Abela. Lā-qēpum s. Aššur-mālik, Aššur-qabīya s. Kuraya and Ninašša w. Abela, on behalf of Abela, seized us regarding their agreement. (The obligation to pay) the silver is bound to whichever one is financially solvent. Month: Kuzalli. Eponymate: Šū-rama. Aššur-mālik, Ikuppī-Aššur and Amurrum-bāni, these men, were the resolvers of the dispute.

src: <big_gap> ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er {d}a-sur-la-ma-si DUMU PUZUR-a-na a-ta-ta i-su is-tu ITU.1.KAM a-la-na-tim li-mu-um ha-na-na-ru-um a-na sa-na-at KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal su-ma la5 is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na 1 ma-na-e-em i-na ITU.1.KAM-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab
tgt: Aššur-lamassī s. Puzur-Anna owes Atata ? mina(s) 5 shekels refined silver. He will pay the silver 1 year from the month of Allanātum eponymate of Ḫanna-nārum. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels silver per mina per month as interest.

src: KISIB ka-ri-im pu-ru-us-ha-tim 6 me-at 61.5 ma-na URUDU i-na ab-na-ti-ni ni-pi-il5-tam sa ni-ka-si sa en-na-nim DUMU su-hu-bur a-sur-e-mu-qi a-na ka-ri-im bu-ru-us-ha-dum is-qu-ul is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-is-ti-kal ITU.KAM ab-sa-ra-ni li-mu-um a-sur-i-mi-ti 2 GIN.TA i ITU.KAM a ma-na-im u-sa-ab KISIB ka-ri-im ka-ni-is 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am si-hi-tam sa a-sur-e-mu-qi DUMU bu-zu-ta-a ISTAR-ba-ni me-ra-su a-na ka-ri-im ka-ni-is is-qu-ul is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ku-lu-ma-a ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um e-na-ma-nim 1 GIN.TA i ITU KAM a ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu KISIB ka-ri-im ka-ni-is <gap> KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am ni-pi-il5-tam sa ni-ka-si sa 23 ma-na.TA sa a-sur-e-mu-qi DUMU bu-zu-ta-a a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku a-na ka-ri-im ka-ni-is is-qu-ul is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ku-lu-ma-a ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um e-na-ma-nim 2 GIN.TA i ITU.KAM a ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab KISIB a-sur-ni-iw-ri DUMU i-di-su-en6 KISIB ma-ma-he-er DUMU a-mur-ISTAR KISIB a-sur-e-mu-qi DUMU bu-zu-ta-a 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-e-mu-qi DUMU bu-zu-ta-a PUZUR4-a-na DUMU en-nam-a-sur i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa en-na-nim DUMU am-ri-a ITU.KAM ab-sa-ra-ni li-mu-um a-sur-ma-lik DUMU a-la-hi-im 0.66666 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i ITU.KAM a ma-na-im u-sa-ab KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i ma-na-im sa a-sur-nim-ri il5-qe 0.5 GIN.TA a se-er ma-na-im ta-ur KISIB ir-ma-a-sur DUMU <big_gap> KISIB su-su-en6 DUMU i-li-a KISIB i-na-ah-DINGIR DUMU <gap>-<gap>-<gap> 1 ma-na sa sal-sa-ti-su 1 ma-na sa na-ru-qi-su <gap> a-na a-sur-e-mu-qi i-di-nu-ma i-na KISIB <gap> KISIB me-a-ni E bu-zu-ta-a su-mi i-na <gap> sa <gap>
tgt: Seals: Aššur-nimrī s. Idī-Suen, Man-mahir s. Amur-Ištar, Aššur-emūqī s. Buzutaya Aššur-emūqī s. Buzutaya owes Puzur-Anna s. Ennam-Aššur 3 minas of refined silver. Seals: Irma-Aššur s. ..., Šū-Suen s. Iliya, Inaḫ-ilī s. ...

src: a-na mu-za qi-bi4-ma um-ma la-ma-sa-ma su-ma a-ha-ti a-ti su-ma be-el-ti a-ti a-na-ku u a-ti ni-ir-te-ha-am mi-ma u-nu-tim sa a-na pu-su-ke-en6 ta-pa-qi-di-ni te-er-ti-ki li-li-kam-ma uz-ni pi-te-i tup-pa-am sa um-mi ta-di-na-ni u a-na e-<big_gap><big_gap><gap> DAM i-li-<gap>-<gap> a-di a-na DUMU-um-mi-a-nim ke-nim pi-iq-di a-mi-se-ma lu-ub-la-am u a-sar ta-pa-qi-di-ni i-na na-as-pe-er-ti-ki lu-ub-la-am ki-ma tup-pa-am a-mi-a-am tu-se-bi4-la-ni a-te-be-a-ma a-ta-la-kam a-se-ri-ki a-ta-la-kam ta-ma-la-ke-en6 sa i-na ma-as-ar-tim i-ba-si-u-ni a-na i-li-is-ta-ki-il5 la ta-di-ni su-ma pu-su-ke-en6 e-ri-is-ki di-ni su-ma la ki-a-am a-di e-ne-a ta-mi-ri-ni a ma-ma-an la ta-di-ni
tgt: To Muza from Lammaša: If you are my sister, if you are my lady, you and I must remain (close?). Concerning all the utensils which you entrust to Pūšu-kēn, let your message come and inform me. The tablet which you gave to my mother ... Entrust it to a trustworthy certified trader. ... and let him bring it. Also, wherever you entrust it, let it come within your When you send that tablet, I will arise and come. I will come to you personally. Do not give the two boxes which are in the safe room to Iliš-tīkal. If Pūšu-kēn asked you (to do so), then give them. Otherwise, as long as you have sight, don't give them to anyone!

src: 1 tup-pu-um sa 5 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa hu-bu-ul bu-ur-ISTAR 1 tup-pu-um sa 2.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa u-su-ra-nim DUMU su-la-ba-an a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku DUMU su-{d}EN.LIL a-na i-tur4-DINGIR e-zi-ib-ma 7.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR me-eh-ra-tim i-tur4-DINGIR a-na a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku i-di-in is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-na-da u e-me-me 1.5 GIN.TA i ITU a-na 1 ma-na-em si-ib-tam u-su-bu su-ma la is-ta-aq-lu-nim KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku i-sa-qal IGI pu-su-ke-en6 DUMU su-e-a IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU i-ku-pi-ISTAR
tgt: Aššur-taklāku son of Šū-Enlil left with Itūr-ilī one tablet stating 5 minas 5 shekels silver from the debt of Bur-Ištar; (and) one tablet stating 2 1/2 minas silver (owed by) Ušurānum son of Šū-Laban and Itūr-ilī gave Aššur-taklāku 7 1/2 minas silver as exchange value. From the ḫamuštum-week of Aššur-nādā and Ememe, they will add 1 1/2 shekels per month per mina as interest. If they do not pay (on time), Aššur-taklāku will pay the silver and its interest. Witnesses: Pūšu-kēn son of Sueyya and Aššur-imittī son of Ikuppī-Ištar.

src: a-na a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim sa ki-ma a-la-hi-im u a-li-li hi-na-a u a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-be-el-ma-al-ki-in-ma a-na KU.BABBAR bu-la-ti-a sa a-na a-lim{ki} tu-se-bi4-la-ni a-la-hu-um a-sur-i-di u a-li-li i-zi-zu-su-ma 2 GU AN.NA ku-nu-ku 8 TUG 8 ma-na AN.NA-ak qa-tim i-di-nu-nim i-na ba-ab a-bu-lim u-di-u-nim um-ma su-nu-ma am-ma u-su-ur-sa-a-sur ki-ma ni-a-ti u-su-ur-sa-a-sur i-na a-lim{ki} ik-ta-la a-na-ku is-ti ILLAT-ti-a-ma a-na ur-su a-ta-la-ak a-na ur-su te-er-ti su-ku-bi4-im ik-su-di-ma i-na te-er-ti su-ku-bi4-im AN.NA a-na su-ul-hi-im ta-e-er <big_gap> ki-ma TUG.HI.A na-ak-su-ni AN.NA a-na 4 GU URUDU u-ta-er lu-qu-ti za-ar-a-at u-pa-ha-ra-ma a-na re-es15 da-as-e a-ta-la-kam
tgt: To Aššur-bēl-awātim, Alāhum's and Alili's representatives, Hinnaya and Aššur-nādā from Aššur-bēl-malkim: About the silver of my working capital, which you sent to the City, Alāhum, Aššur-idī and Alili met concerning it, and they gave me 2 talents of tin under seal, 8 textiles (and) 8 minas of tin for expenses. In the city gate they made a public statement, saying: ''Now, Uṣur-ša-Aššur is our representative." Uṣur-ša-Aššur was held back in the City while I left for Uršu with my own enterprise. A message from Šū-Kūbum reached me at Uršu and in Šū-Kūbum's message (it said): "Convert the tin to textiles!" Since the textiles had been set aside, I converted the tin to 4 talents of [copper]. My merchandise is scattered around; I shall collect it and arrive at the beginning of spring.

src: um-ma a-li-li i-ku-pi-a u su-hu-bur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 im-di-DINGIR u kur-ub-ISTAR-ma a-na kur-ub-ISTAR qi-bi-ma mi-nam i-se-er a-sur-i-mi-ti ti-su-ma 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa im-lik-a-a ta-as-ba-at u tup-pa-ka sa E a-sur-SIPA sa 2 ma-na 15 GIN sa hu-bu-li-ka KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su su-qu-ul u 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa im-lik-a-a sa ta-as-bu-tu su-qul <gap> su-ma mi-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti ha-bu-la-kum li-qe-ma a-na-kam i-na si-ip-ka-ti-su sa-he-er a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u im-di-DINGIR qi-bi-ma a-hu-u-ni a-tu-nu a-na ba-ab-tim sa a-bi-a-num ih-da a-na kur-ub-ISTAR qi-bi-ma i-na ba-ab ha-ra-ni-ka NIG.KA-si ni-si-ma 1 ma-na 7 GIN KU.BABBAR i li-bi-ka ni-di u ka-ki a-bi-a-nim li-qe-ma KU.BABBAR ha-bu-la-kum KU.BABBAR li-qe
