tgt: From Āl-ilī, Ikūn-pīya and Šū-Ḫubur to Pūšu-kēn, Imdī-ilum and Kurub-Ištar: To Kurub-Ištar: Who are you to Aššūr-imittī that you took 2 minas of silver belonging to Imlikaya? Now, your tablet of the house of Aššur-rēʾī which states 2 minas 15 shekels as your debt, pay the debt and its interest! And as for the 2 minas silver of Imlikaya which you seized, pay it out! If A To P My dear brothers, hd' to the inventory of Abī-anum. At your departure, balance my account so that we give 1 minas 7 shekels silver from your account. Also, take the weapon of Abī-anum and so take the silver he owes to.

src: zu-pa a-na me-er-e pu-su-ke-en6 is-ba-at-ni-a-ti-ma um-ma zu-pa-ma a-na me-er-e pu-su-ke-en6-ma sa DUB tu-pi-a ha-ar-mi-im KU.BABBAR a-bu-ku-nu il5-qe mi-su-um ZU-re-i i-a-ti u-ka-la-ni <gap> um-ma ma-ru pu-su-ke-en6-ma a-na ZU-re-i-ma <gap> sa DUB tu-pi-su <gap> ha-ar-mi-im <gap> mi-ma KU.BABBAR <gap> a-bu-ni il5-qe u-se-er-su-ma ne-nu a-wa-tam ni-da-na-ku-um ma-ah-ri-ni-ma ZU-re-i zu-pa u-se-er <gap> a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um ka-ni-is i-di-ni-a-ti-ma IGI GIR sa a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in IGI zi-a-ta-tu IGI {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni
tgt: Zupa seized us against the sons of Pūšu-kēn and Zupa said to the sons of Pūšu-kēn, "You father received the silver of my sealed tablet." "Why does Suen-rē'ī withhold my tablet?" The sons of Pūšu-kēn and Suen-rē'ī responded "Our father did receive all the silver of your sealed tablet. Release it(him?) and we will give the matter to you. Suen-rēʾī released Zupa in our presence. For this matter, the colony at Kanesh gave us permission, and we gave our witnesses before the dagger of Aššur. Witnesses: Ziadādu, Amurrum-bāni

src: a su-hu-bur qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma i-na 21 {TUG}ku-ta-ni u 2 TUG su-ru-tim sa li-wi-tim sa {d}en-LIL-ba-ni ub-la-ni i-na re-es15 ni-ka-si 10 TUG.TA-ku-ta-ni 4 TUG.TA su-ru-tim is-tap-ku-ma 2 TUG su-re-en a-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR as-a-ma 10 ku-ta-ni u 4 TUG su-ru-tim qa-at-ka <gap> ma-na.TA ku-ta-ni <big_gap><gap> <gap> ma-na.TA <big_gap><gap> <big_gap> ka <big_gap> <gap> ti u <big_gap> KU.BABBAR a qa-ti-ka at-hi i-na pa-ni-tim <big_gap> GIN.TA ku-ta-ni 5 GIN.TA <big_gap> is-tap-ku 0.33333 ma-na.TA ku-ta-ni <gap> 3 GIN.TA su-ru-tim a-ha-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-su-nu a qa-ti-ka at-hi i-na wa-ar-ki-tim <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<big_gap> is-tap-ku-ma 15 GIN.TA 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR a qa-ti-ka at-hi SU.NIGIN 18.5 ma-na E ka-ri-im al-pu-ut-ka 20 ma-na.TA da-tum ik-su-ud-ma 1.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR ta-na-pa-al is-tu KU.BABBAR-ka sa se-ep {d}en-LIL-ba-ni e-ru-ba-ni 20 ku-ta-ni TUG su-ru-tim <gap> se-ep ir-ma-a-sur na-ad-u <gap> <gap>-ti-ka 5 ku-ta-nu 2 TUG su-ru-tum 1 TUG su-ra-am 1 ku-ta-nam bu-zu-ta-a <big_gap> <gap> TUG su-ru-tum 10 8 <big_gap> 1 TUG su-ru-tim 1.5 TUG <big_gap> 1.5 ma-na <big_gap>
tgt: To Šū-Ḫubur from Pūšu-kēn: From the 21 kutānum-textiles and 2 šurūtum-textiles as wrappings which Enlil-bāni brought, at the beginning of accountings they called for 10 kutānum-textiles and 4 šurum-textiles, and I purchased 2 šurum-textiles for 15 shekels silver and 10 kutānum-textiles and 4 šurum-textiles -your share ... minas .. kutānum-textiles ... ... x (minas and shekels) silver I deposited to your share. At 1/3 minas for each kutānum-textile and x shekels for each šurum-textile, separately I put their silver into your share. After your silver from Enlil-bāni's cargo arrived, (they called?) 15? kutānum-textiles and 5 šurum textiles ... ... they bring you in the cargo of Irma-Aššur.

src: a-na PUZUR4-a-sur ku-lu-ma-a a-mur-ISTAR u a-mur-DINGIR qi-bi-ma um-ma DINGIR-na-da-ma as-ta-na-me-ma KU.BABBAR is-ti da-da-a-a ta-am-hu-ra is-tu KU.BABBAR ta-am-hu-ra-ni a-li-ku a-di ma-la u se-ni-su i-li-ku-u-nim-ma KU.BABBAR u-la tu-us-te-bi4-la-nim a-hu-u-a a-tu-nu ih-da-ma KU.BABBAR is-ti pa-nim-ma se-bi4-la-nim lu ta-as-bi-tam ta-am-hu-ra lu si-ba-tim ir-si te-er-ta-ku-nu za-ku-tum a-na pa-ni-a li-li-kam su-ma si-ba-tim tu-sa-ar-si-a a-di KU.BABBAR tu-us-ta-ba-a-ni lu-qu-tam sa ar-si-ah i-ra-de8-a-ku-nu-ti-ni la tu-wa-sa-ra 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa ik-ri-bi4-a i li-bi4-su sa as-qi-la-su KU.BABBAR sa I.GIS u si-im ta-ab-tim a pa-ni-a se-bi4-la-nim
tgt: To Puzur-Aššur, Kulumaya, Amur-Ištar and Amur-ilī: Thus Ilī-nādā: I heard that you received silver from Dadaya. I heard that: You (pl.) received silver from Dadaya. Get rid of this level sentence Since you received the silver, travelers have come once or twice. But you have not sent me the silver. My dear brothers, take care to send the silver with the first (traveler). Whether you received the payment in full or it has produced interest, let your full report come immmediately. If you have allowed the interest to accrue do not overvalue the goods which Arsiah brought to you until you have already __ the silver. 1 mina silver belonging to my ikrībumistherein. Regarding what I weighed out, send me silver for oil and the price of fine oil soon!

src: 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-DU10 DUMU lu-lu ISTAR-ba-ni i-su is-tu ITU.1.KAM ab-sa-ra-ni li-mu-um a-ku-tum a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i ITU.KAM-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab 1 ma-na 1.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-DU10 DUMU hu-ra-sa-nim ISTAR-ba-ni i-su is-tu ITU.1.KAM ma-hu-ur-DINGIR li-mi-im a-ku-tim a-na 5 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab 0.5 ma-na 7 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um i-se-er a-sur-ma-lik DUMU su-{d}EN.LIL ISTAR-ba-ni i-su is-tu ITU.1.KAM be-el-ti-E.GAL-lim li-mu-um a-ku-tum a-na 5 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR SAHAR.BA i-se-er be-la-nim DUMU a-mur-{d}UTU ISTAR-ba-ni i-su is-tu ITU.1.KAM be-el-ti-E.GAL-lim li-mu-um i-na-su-en6 a-na MU.1.SE i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i ITU.1.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab 5 GU 20 ma-na URUDU si-kam is-ti be-la-nim-ma a-sur-DU10 a-na tup-pi-su la-pa-ti-im i-ta-la-ak 0.5 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR KI E-a-SIG5 DUMU iz-ka-nim a-na wa-ah-su-sa-na i-na e-ra-bi4-su u-se-ba-lam IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti IGI pi-la-ah-ISTAR 1 GU 10 ma-na URUDU ma-si-a-am KI A-sur-mu-ta-pil DUMU su-be-lim IGI dan-a-sur DUMU PUZUR-a-sur IGI na-ab-su-en6 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-ti i-ku-pa-sa-ar IGI i-di-ku-bi-im DUMU ba-qi-la-nim
tgt: Aššur-ṭāb s. Lulu owes Ištar-bāni 4 minas refined silver. He will pay 10 ḫamuštum weeks from the month Áb-ša-ra-ni, epnymate Akutum. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Aššur-ṭāb s. Ḫuraṣānim owes Ištar-bāni 1 mina 1 1/2 shekels refined silver. He will pay 5 weeks from the month Maḫur-ilī, year Akutum. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina. Aššur-mālik s. Šū-Enlil owes Ištar-bāni 1/2 mina 7 shekels refined silver. He will pay 5 hamuštum weeks from the month be-el-tí-É-GAL-lim, eponymate Akutum. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina. Bēlānim s. Amur-Šamaš owes Ištar-bāni 4 minas silver. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per 1 mina per month.

src: <gap> ma-na <big_gap> KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-la-bi-im u su-en6-i-di-na-su a-sur-GAL i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-tur4-DINGIR u kur-ub-ISTAR a-na 5 ha-am-sa-tim <big_gap> i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 1.5 GIN.TA i ITU.1.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-su-<big_gap>-bu ab-sa-lim qa-ta-tum KU.BABBAR i-na qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is ITU.1.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um DUG-a-sur IGI ku-ra IGI su-su-en6
tgt: Al-abum and Suen-iddin-ašu owe x minas silver to Aššur-rabi. They will pay 5 ḫamuštum weeks after the ḫamuštum of Itūr-ilī and Kurub-Ištar. If they do not pay (on time), they will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Ab-šalim is the guarantor. (The silver) is bound to whichever amont them is solvent. Month: Kuzalli. Eponymate: Ṭāb-Aššur. Witnesses: Kura, Šū-Suen.

src: KISIB e-nu-ga-mi-il5 DUMU a-ba KISIB a-sur-DUG DUMU am-ri-a KISIB da-na-a DUMU u-zu-a KISIB i-li-dan DUMU tu-ra-am-i-li KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU a-zu-a 5.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er e-nu-ga-mi-il5 u a-sur-DUG DUMU am-ri-a a-sur-GAL i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-ma-lik DUMU a-la-hi-im a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA <big_gap> a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam i ITU.KAM-im u-su-bu ITU.KAM be-el-te-ka-lu-um li-mu-um sa qa-ti si-lu-lu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu u ke-ni-su-nu ra-ki-is
tgt: Seals: Enna-gāmil s. Aba, Aššur-ṭāb s. Amrīya, Dannāya s. Uzuwa, Ilī-dān s. Tūram-ilī, Puzur-Aššur s. Azua. Aššur-rabi owes 5 1/2 minas refined silver to Enna-gāmil and Aššur-ṭāb s. Amrīya. From the ḫamuštum of Aššur-mālik s. Al-aḫim he has 20 weeks to pay. If by the 20 weeks he has not paid 1 1/2 shekels .... per mina will be added in interest per month. Month: Bēlet-ekallum, eponymate aftter Ṣilūlu

src: a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma um-ma u-sur-sa-a-sur-ma 0.33333 ma-na 1 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am ku-nu-ki-a a-sur-i-di sa a-na ka-ri-im ta-as-pu-ra-ni na-as-a-kum a-hi a-ta 6 TUG.HI.A da-nu-tim a-na ni-si E-tim sa a-ru-a-ar sa-a-ma se-bi4-lam a-su-mi TUG.HI.A si-ta-ap-ki-im sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni su-ma si-ta-ap-ku-um i-ba-si qa-tam sa a-bi4-ka a-na-di
tgt: To Aššur-nādā from Uṣur-ša-Aššur: I bring to you 1/2 mina 1 shekel of refined silver under the seal of Aššur-idī about which you wrote to the colony. My dear brother, buy 6 strong textiles for the household in/of Aru'ar and send them to me. With respect to the šitapku-investments of textiles that you wrote about, if there is a possibility for such investments, then I shall deposit your father's share.

src: sa 49.66666 ma-na 7 GIN KU.BABBAR lu-qu-tum sa ba-ri-ni e-li-am si-ti KU.BABBAR 10 ma-na 13 GIN i-na a-lim{ki} a-hu-ur is-tu ni-is-ha-tum u sa si-mi-im is-hi-ru-ni 89.16666 TUG iz-ku-u-nim is-tu ni-is-ha-tim ni-di-nu a-se-er AN.NA qa-tim ne-pu-lu 2.TA su-uq-la-tim ku-nu-ki sa a-lim{ki} 23 ma-na.TA AN.NA 27 TUG.TA ku-ta-ni u 2.TA ANSE.HI.A qa-tam ni-il5-qe 2.16666 TUG u 1 ANSE i li-bi4 im-di-DINGIR 0.66666 ma-na LA 1.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-al-sa-tim ni-la-qe 1.66666 ma-na i-na me-si-it e-la-li sa-lim-a-sur im-di-DINGIR u pu-su-ke-en6 i-la-qe-u
tgt: Goods owned between us worth 49 minas 47 shekels silver came up. The remainder of the silver, 10 minas 13 shekels silver, stayed in the city. After the excise and the tithe purchases were deducted, they cleared 89 1/6 textiles to us. After we gave the excise, we settled for the hand tin, 2 sacks under the seal of the city 23 minas tin, 27 kutānum textiles and 2 donkeys each we took as share. Imdī-ilum owed 2 1/6 textiles and 1 donkey. We will take 38 1/2 shekels silver as thirds. Šalim-Aššur, Imdī-ilum, and Pūšu-kēn will take 1 2/3 minas from the mišittum of Elāli.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma la-ma-si-ma 9 TUG.HI.A ku-lu-ma-a na-as-a-kum 3 TUG.HI.A i-di-su-en6 na-as-a-kum 2 su-pa-ni sa UD.KA.BAR dan-na-a-sur ub-lam 1 su-pa-nam sa UD.KA.BAR u it-gu5-ra-am sa UD.KA.BAR i-a-sar ub-lam 2 it-gu5-ra-tim sa UD.KA.BAR i-di-su-en6 ub-lam 1 it-gu5-ra-am sa UD.KA.BAR a-hu-wa-qar ub-lam 1 su-pa-nam sa KU.BABBAR i-ku-pi-a ub-lam 1 su-pa-nam sa KU.BABBAR DUMU i-bi-su-a ub-lam sa-ma-la-tim it-gu5-ra-tim u si-ba-tim ub-lu-nim su-ma be-li a-ta a-su-mi TUG.HI.A sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni la u-se-bi-la-ku-ni li-ba-ka la i-la-mi-in ki-ma su-ha-ar-tum i-ir-ta-bi-u-ni TUG is-te-en6 u se-na ka-ab-tu-tim a-na na-ar-ka-ab-tim e-ta-pa-as u a-na ni-si be-tim u a-na su-uh-ri-im e-pu-us u-la ak-ta-sa-ad-ma TUG.HI.A la us-te-bi-la-kum TUG.HI.A ma-la qa-ti i-ka-su-du is-ti wa-ar-ki-u-tim u-se-ba-la-kum E a-bu-um-DINGIR i-na i-ga-ar-tim ku-a-tim i-ku-pi-a sa E a-ta-a i-ga-ar-tam su-a-tam is-ta-kan u a-na-ku a-sa-al-ma um-ma su-ut-ma ta-pa-u-tum-ma u-ta-pa-su mi-ma-ma u-la u-ta-pa-su it-be-a-ma i i-ta-sa-am a-ta a-ma-kam qi-bi-su-um um-ma a-ta-ma mi-su-um i-ga-ar-ta-ka i-na E-be-ti-a ta-as-ku-un ki-ma E la a-si-ri-im <gap> te-pu-us u a-su-mi ba-pi-ri sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni ba-pi-ru-um wa-di e-pi-is sa-ak-lu-ul u su-ha-ar-tum da-ni-is ir-ti-bi ti-ib-a-ma a-tal-kam a-na su-ni a-sur su-ku-si u se-ep i-li-ka sa-ba-at
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Lamassī: Kulumaya brings you 9 textiles. Idī-Suen brings you 3 textiles. Dān-Aššur brought 2 bronze spoons. Ea-šār brought 1 spoon made of bronze, and a container of bronze. Idī-Suen brought 2 containers of bronze. Aḫu-waqar brought 1 container of bronze. Ikūppiya brought 1 container of silver. The son of Ibbī-Sua brought 1 supānam of silver. They brought here cups, spoons, and interest(?). If you are my lord, do not be angry about the textiles which you wrote that I did not send to you. Because the girl is growing up, she? took one or two textiles for riding. And I (must) also make (textiles), for the members of the house and for the little ones. I was not finished and so did not send the textiles to you. They will finish as many textiles as we can. I will send them to you with the next travellers. As for the house of Abum-ilī, Ikūn-pīya put his wall from the house of Attaya on your wall! Now as for me, I quarreled (with him) and he said, "I will enter into a partnership with him. Or I will not cooperate with him whatsoever." Get up and go out! You yourself speak to him there. Thus you will say, "Why did you set your wall in my house? You did it when the house was not aširim!' Also, concerning the beer about which you wrote, "Tell (me) about the beer." It's made. It's finished. Now, the girl has quite grown up. Get up and come here! Place her in the lap of Aššur. Now get going! (lit. Take the foot of your going!)

src: 18.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er da-di-a DUMU na-ni-bi4-im a-sur-ma-lik DUMU e-na-su-en6 DUMU su-ka-li-a i-su a-na 5 ITU.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um a-sur-i-mi-ti ma-la-hu-um IGI e-na-a-sur DUMU e-ra-di IGI ka-ri-a DUMU su-be-lim
tgt: Dadīya s. Nanabum owes Aššur-mālik s. Enna-Suen s. Sukkallīya 18 1/2 shekels refined silver. He will pay in five months. If he does not pay (on time), he will add interest at the rate of 1 shekel (per mina) per month.

src: um-ma a-sur-ba-ni u sa-lim-a-sur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma i-na na-as-par-ti-ka um-ma a-ta-ma i KU.BABBAR qa-ti sa-ak-na-at um-ma a-ta-ma a-ni-um sa PUZUR4-a-na a-ni-um sa PUZUR4-a-sur la be-el a-bi4-im i-na sa-na-im ki-am la ta-la-pa-tam su-mi a-wi-li la tu-ta-da-a-ni-a-ti i-nu-mi tu-us-te-bu-lu-ma qa-at-ka ta-sa-ku-nu u KU.BABBAR a-na a-lim tu-se-ba-la-ni DAM.GAR wa-di su-mi a-wi-lim la ta-za-ka-ra-ni-a-ti a-ma-kam mu-us-te-bi4-lum ku-a-ti si-bi4 li-is-ku-na-kum su-ma-mi-in4 mu-tum u <gap>-<gap>-tum ib-si-mi-in4 ni-il5-e-ma KU.BABBAR ne-te-er
tgt: From Aššur-bāni and Šalim-Aššur to Pūšu-kēn: In your letter you wrote, "My hand is placed on the silver." You said, "This belongs to Puzur-Anna; this belongs to Puzur-Aššur; it is not the property of the father." In the next (letter) do not write thus. Do not declare(?) to us the names of the men. When you send goods and lay your hand, and when you send the silver to the city, declare "the merchant." Do not declare to us the name of the man. There, ... your shipping person(?) witnesses (?). If not man and wife (?)would we be able to .. and take away the silver?

src: um-ma a-sur-ma-lik-ma a-na a-zu-za-a-ma u IR a-na a-zu-za-a qi-bi-ma a ma-la a-na a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU a-mur-a-sur te-ra-tim i-na a-ku-a ta-ta-di-nu um-ma a-ta-ma 10 ma-na SIG.HI.A i-na ka-ni-is a-sar IR DUMU ku-lu-ma-a e-zi-ib SIG.HI.A li-qe <big_gap> a-na-kam IR as-ba-at-ma um-ma a-na-ku-ma sa-ap-tam sa a-zu-za-a di-nam um-ma IR-ma ke-na 1 GIN KU.BABBAR a-zu-za-a i-hi-ib-la-ma SIG.HI.A u u-ka-pi-im a-na sa-par-tim i-di-a-ma 1 GIN KU.BABBAR u-sa-bi4-a-ni-ma SIG.HI.A u u-ka-pi-sa u-ta-er-sum a-na bi4-la-tim as-ba-su-ma 1 GIN KU.BABBAR i-di-nam su-ma i li-bi4 IR mi-ma la ti-su 1 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na IR ta-e-er a-ta a-sar SIG.HI.A ta-di-nu se-e
tgt: From Aššur-mālik to Azuzaya and Wardum, specifically Azuzaya:

src: a-na a-sur-na-da <big_gap> u ku-ku-la-nim qi-bi4-ma um-ma kur-ub-ISTAR-ma ta-as-pu-ra-nim um-ma a-tu-nu-ma 63 ku-ta-ni SIG5 7 a-ba-ar-ni-u 1 {TUG}si-li-ip-ka-u-um a-sur-la-ma-si u a-zu-ta-a ip-qi-du a-ma-kam i-sa-ha-at a-sur-na-da i-zi-za-ma ma-la a-sur-la-ma-si u a-zu-ta-a TUG.HI.A ip-qi-du-nu TUG.HI.A a-na a-sur-na-da su-ha-ru-um sa a-zu-ta-a li-ip-qi-id-ma tup-pa-am sa ku-nu-ki-su a-sur-na-da li-di-su-um u du-ul-ba-tum sa i-na na-ru-qa-tim sa-ak-ni a-sur-na-da li-il5-qe a-hu-a-a a-tu-nu a-ma-kam a-se-er lu-qu-tim a-ni-tim lu ba-ab-tam i-su lu lu-qu-tam sa-li-tam i-su lu lu-qu-su a-li ta-sa-me-a-ni sa-ab-ta-ma u te-er-ta-ak-nu li-li-kam <big_gap> lu ba-ab-tim lu i lu-qu-tim mi-ma il5-qe-u uz-ni pi-te-a
tgt: To Aššur-nādā and Kukkulānum from Kurub-Ištar: You have written as follows: "Aššur-lamassī and Azutaya have entrusted on commission 63 Assist Aššur-nāda there, so that Azutaya' s servant entrusts to Aššur-nādā whatever textiles Aššur-lamassī and Azutaya had entrusted on commission (to others), and Aššur-nādā should then give him a tablet bearing his seal. Also the My dear brothers, seize there on top of these goods whatever outstanding 'credits there are, whatever ready merchandise there is as well as any of his merchandise you may hear of, and only then send me word ... Inform me whether they have taken anything, either from the outstanding claims or from the merchandise.

src: um-ma {d}en-LIL-ba-ni-ma a-na a-sur-GAL a-la-hi-im ab-sa-lim u sa-ak-ri-il5-ka u i-di-{d}UTU qi-bi-ma su-ma u-nu-tum i-ta-di-ma ma ha-ra-nu-um wa-su-ra-at u-nu-tam su-um-su sa i be-tim i-ba-si-u a-na be-tim e-si-im se-ri-ba-ma is-ti E.GAL-lim u du-ri-ni i ku-nu-ki-ku-nu ku-un-ka-ma ma-ma-an la i-pa-te lu qe-mu-um lu ar-sa-tum a-sar se-um i-ba-si-u se-ri-ba-ma pe-eh-a ma-la te-zi-ba-ni me-eh-ra-am a-na am-tim di-na u sa-ni-am i-na E.GAL-lim ez-ba-ma am-tum is-ti a-la-hi-im lu ta-ta-al-kam 1 am-tam ki-la-ri-tam a si-mi-im di-na-si i-di-{d}UTU u am-tam ra-bi4-tam a-sar be-tim na-hi-da-ma ku-nu-ki sa E.GAL-lim u du-ri-ni lu-sa-si-ru a-na pa-hi-ka-ri E su-ISTAR ma-ma-an la i-ta-hi 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR um-ma-sa sa am-tim ha-bu-la-at tup-pa-am he-er-ma-ma a-na ab-sa-lim di-na a-ha-ma 7.5 GIN KU.BABBAR ha-bu-la-am sa-as-qi-la-si su-ma se-am ta-ha-sa-ah a-li-bi se-im-ma su-up-ka-ma an-<gap> <gap> 3 GIN KU.BABBAR u si-it-ra-am
tgt: Enlil-bāni to Aššur-rabi, Al-aḫum, Ab-šalim, and Šakrilka, and Iddi-Šamaš: If the perephinalia is deposited and the (entry?/path?) accessible, bring all the perephinalia which is in the house into the new house, and seal the 'palace' and strongroom with your seals so that no one can open (them). Both flour and wheat, wherever their is grain, bring it in and secure it. And also, exit from the 'palace' and let the maid depart with Al-aḫum. As for the kilaritum maid, sell her. As for Iddi-Šamaš and the senior maid, wherever the house is insecure, let then extract seals of the 'palace (courtyard?)' and strongroom. Let no one enter into the p. of Šū-Ištar's house. If you need grain, store more grain within the grain (already there), and ... 3 shekels silver and šitrum textile ...

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma PUZUR4-a-sur-ma ki-ma te-er-tim da-mi-iq-tim da-mi-iq-tim-ma sa-pa-ri-ma uz-ni-a pa-ta-em hi-im-ta-tim u a-ra-tim ta-as-ta-na-pa-ra-am i-di-a-ba-am a-na-ku a-na ap-lu-tim u-la al-qe-su u KU.BABBAR 1 GIN a-na se-ri-su la u-ta-er ki-ma a-na a-hi-im tup-pa-am i-du-nu-ni u a-na-ku tup-pi a-se-er sa ki-ma i-a-ti a-di-sum u4-ma-am ki-ma et-lum la ta-si-im-tu-ni ta-ta-mar a-di-na-ma a-wa-ti-ka sa ki su-a-ti is-ra-at li-li-ku ma-num la i-sa-la-al as-ta-la-al a-na i-ku-pi-a-sur as-pu-ra-am be-u-la-ti-su e-te-er-su i KU.BABBAR sa i-a-sar sa al-be-li ub-la-ni lu a-na si-mi-im se-im is-qu-lu lu a-na zi-ti-ka mi-ma is-qu-lu KU.BABBAR a-na li-mi-im i-ha-su-hu a-na-ku KU.GI a li-mi-im a-di-in is-ti li-mi-im i-sa-si-u-ma KU.BABBAR 3 ma-na lu 4 ma-na i-ha-su-hu KU.BABBAR a-sa-qal KU.BABBAR a sa ki ku-a-ti se-bi4-la-ma li-di-nu-nim a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta a-li AN.NA u TUG.HI.A sa ki i-a-ti u-se-bi4-lu-ni su-pur-ma KU.BABBAR a-se-ri-ka lu-se-bi4-lu-nim u i-ku-pi-a-sur na-hi-id-ma ba-ab-ti lu-za-ki-a-am
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Puzur-Aššur: Instead of sending overly wonderful messages and informing me, you continually send me evasions and curses. As for me, I will not take Iddin-abum to be an heir. Also, I will not return a single shekel of silver to him. Because he will give the tablet to a stranger(?) even I my tablet to my representatives, I give to him. Today you can see for yourself that the youth is not wise. I have set it up so that your words may go to his representatives may go (išrat!). He will not act impudently toward anyone. I will do so myself. I wrote to Ikūppī-Aššur. I took his be From the silver of Ea-šar that Al-bēlī brought, they want, both for paying the price for purchases and as much as he paid for your share, the silver for the limmum. I myself gave gold to the limmum. They made a reckoning with the limmum and they need 3 or 4 minas of silver. I will pay the silver. Send silver to your representatives so that they may give it to me. My dear father and lord, whenever my representatives send you tin or textiles, send them so that they send the silver after you. Also make sure that Ikūppī-Aššur clears my accounts.

tgt: Seals of ú-sà-nim s. Amur-Aššur, Adada s. Adad-rabi, Uṣur-ša-Ištar s. Aššur-imittī, Ḫunia aḫišu Seals of Saklīya s. Šū-Ištar, Iddin-abim s. Atata, Mannum-kī-Aššur Seals of Šuli s. Merāli, Šukkutum s. ?, Qātātum s. Azuza Regarding the debt of Šuli s. Merāli. Šuli s. Merāli owes Ḫunia ? minas refined silver. He will pay one year from the month Teʾinātim, eponymate Ilī-dān. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1/3 mina per mina (per month) as interest. Seals of Saklīya s. Šū-Ištar, Aššur-nīšu s. Amur-Ištar, Ilī-bāni s. Amur-Ištar Ilī-bāni s. Amur-Ištar owes Ḫunia s. Aššur-imittī 2 minas 10 shekels refined silver. He will pay twenty weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-taklāku s. Al-aḫim. If he does not pay (on time), 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest. Month: Kanwarta Eponymate: Aššur-imittī malāḫum Seals of Puzur-Aššur s. Šū-Bēlim, Agia s. ?, Paka s. Lā-qēpim Paka s. Lā-qēpim owes Ḫunia 4/5 mina 2 shekels refined silver. He will add (1 1/2 shekels) per mina per month as interest from the month Maḫḫur-ilī. Seals of Saklīya s. Šū-Kūbim, ?, i-ku-pí-im s. Aššur-immitī, ? s. Dān-Aššur Saklīya s. Šū-Kūnim owes Ḫunia 2 minas refined silver. He will pay 10 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Ennum-Aššur s. Šalmaḫim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels silver per mina per month as interest. Month: ṣipʾem Eponymate: Aššur-imittī Seals of Saklīya s. Šū-Ištar, Ikūppī-Aššur s. Puzur-Ištar, Irma-Aššūr s. Idi-bani Seals of Saklīya s. Šū-Ištar, ?, and Ilī-bˇāni s. Amur-Ištar Saklīya s. Šū-Ištar owes Ḫunia 1/2 minas refined silver. Seal of Kudātim s. Lā-qēpim Regarding the debt of Aššur-lamassī. ?-iz-zi Ḫunia owes ? shekels refined silver. He will pay ten months from the month ṣipʾem. If he does not pay (on time), he will add interest at the rate of the colony. Eponymate: Šū-Kūbum Seals of Ṭāb-ṣilli-Aššur s. Ili-ālim, Saklīya s. Šū-Ištar, Šalma-Aššur s. Ipḫurim, and Idī-Aššur s. Aššur-imittī Idī-Aššur s. Aššur-imittī owes Ḫunia 4 minas refined silver. He will pay ? weeks from the ḫamuštum of Ennum-Aššur s. Šal-maḫ. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels silver per mina (per month) as interest. Month: ṣipʾem Eponymate: Aššur-imittī malāḫum Seals of Puzur-Ištar s. Dalaš, i-dí---im s. Ṣilli-Adad, Idī-Aššur s. Aššur-imittī, i-ku... Seals of Aššur-mālik s. Anninim, Agiya s. Ikūnim Abu-šalim owes Ḫunia 5 shekels silver. He will pay 20 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Itūr-ilī, month qarrātim, eponymate Buzutaya.

tgt: Kukuzi owes Šū-Ištar x minas refined silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina (per month) from ḫamuštum of PUZUR-sú-en, month Kanwarta, eponymate Samaya.

src: 0.5 ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-a-nim DUMU a-zu-za-a DAM.GAR-ru-um i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa en-nam-a-sur ITU.KAM ab sa-ra-ni li-mu-um a-sur-na-da a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI {d}UTU.DUG IGI PUZUR4-{d}UTU
tgt: Šū-Anum s. Azuza owes the merchant 1/2 mina 2 shekels refined silver. He will pay 10 weeks from ḫamuštum of Ennam-Aššur, month Ab šarrānē, eponymate Aššur-nādā. If he does not pay, interest will be added at the colony rate. Witnesses: Šamaš-tāb, Puzur-Šamaš.

src: pu-su-ke-en6 u {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li is-bu-tu-ni-a-ti-ma ni-ka-si ma-ah-ri-ni i-si-u-ma 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i li-bi {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li pu-su-ke-en6 i-di-i ITU.KAM ab sa-ra-ni li-mu-um ku-bi-a a-na wa-ah-su-sa-na i-la-ak-ma 4 ha-am-sa-tum i-la-ka-ma KU.BABBAR u-se-ba-lam-ma KU.BABBAR i-ta-na-ab-la-ka-at-ma e-bu-tu sa {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um ka-ni-is i-di-ni-ma IGI GIR sa a-sur si-bu-ti a-di-in IGI PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU i-sar-ki-id-a-sur PUZUR4-{d}UTU DUMU su-nu-nu tap-pa-i
tgt: Pūšu-kēn and Adad-šulūlī seized us and rendered accounts in our presence. Pūšu-kēn gave 5 minas silver owed by Adad-šilūlī. Month: Ab-šarrānē. Eponymate: Kubīya. He will go to Waḫšušana and 4 ḫamuštum weeks will pass, then he will deliver the silver and the silver will cross back and forth and the colony at Kaneš will give (Pūšu-kēn?) the ebuṭṭum loan of Adad-šulūlī for this matter and I will give my witnesses before the dagger of Aššur. Witness: Puzur-Aššur s. Išar-kitt-Aššur. Puzur-Šamaš s. Šū-Nunu is my partner.

src: 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI a-mur-a-sur sa a za-am-ri-im 0.66666 ma-na 2.5 GIN KU.BABBAR KI ha-as-ta-ah-su 1 ma-na 0.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ni-u-um tup-pu-su sa 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR u 25 na-ru-uq SE-am sa hu-bu-ul wa-ar-hi-la 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI wa-al-hi-is-na 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI ar-wa-na-ah-su 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI na-ki-li-id 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR KI a-zu me-er-i-su u a-ha-ti-su 7 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI ka-si-im u a-hi-su 1.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI ta-ak-sa-nu-ma-an 70 na-ru-uq SE-am u 30 na-ru-uq ar-sa-tim KI AH.ME li-i-su 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI ki-kar-sa-an 15 GIN KU.BABBAR KI ta-ak-sa-nu-ma-an 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR KI ku-um-ri-im sa ku-ba-ba-at 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN is-ti E.GAL ha-tim 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-ti su-ISTAR DUMU su-a-nim 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-ti i-ku-pi-a-sur DUMU PUZUR.ISTAR 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR be-u-la-at DUMU {d}ISKUR-ba-ni is-ti du-du 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-ti il5-we-da-ku DUMU i-da-a 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR be-u-la-at {d}UTU-tak-la-ku a-sur-i-di-in DUMU su-ISTAR il-qe 3 GIN KU.BABBAR is-ti ku-ra DUMU i-si-hi-im 1.8333300000000001 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-ti wa-wa-li u a-sur-i-mi-ti 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-ti sal-mi-ISTAR DUMU tu-ra-am-{d}ISKUR
tgt: 3 minas silver is with Amur-Aššur which was for accounting. 1 mina 1/2 shekel and also its tablet stating 2 minas silver and 25 sacks of barley of the debt of Warḫila. 2 minas silver is owed by Nakiled. 45 shekels silver is owed by Azu, his son, and his brother. 45 shekels (silver) is owed by the palace of Ḫattum. 1/2 mina silver, the beʾulātum loan of Adad-bāni's son, is with Dudu. Aššur-iddin s. Šu-Ištar took 1/2 mina silver, the beʾulātum loand of Šamaš-taklāku. 1 mina 50 shekels silver is owed by Wawali and Aššur-imittī.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da i-li-a-lim u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi4-ma mi-su sa a-hu-ku-nu is-tu 2 sa-na-at ma-ar-su-ma u ta-ta-ga-la-su-ni a-pu-tum i-nu-mi-im sa tup-pa-am ta-sa-me-a-ni su-pu-ra-ma li-tal-kam 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-li-a-lim li-ik-nu-kam u 8 ma-an KU.BABBAR a-ha-ma sa ma-na-ah-ti E-tim sa ha-bu-lu lu-se-bi-lam u a-sur-na-da ma-la i-ka-su-du li-ik-nu-uk-ma lu-se-bi-lam i-na pa-nim-ma a-li-ki-im a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku tur4-da-nim i da-as-e i-li-a-lum lu-us-a-am a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma 11 ma-na AN.NA sa a-la-hi-im i ma-sa-ar-tim tam-si-ma te-zi-ib KI a-li-ki nu-se-ba-la-su <gap> AN.NA u 0.66666 ma-na KU.KI <big_gap> ki-ma 10 ma-na AN.NA a qa-ti-a
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā, Ilī-ālum and Aššur-taklāku: How come that your brother has been ill for 2 years now, but you have held him back? Please, on the very day you hear this letter you must write and let him come. Have Ilī-ālum seal 20 minas of silver for me and let him send me furthermore the 8 minas of silver that he owes on the maintenance of the house. Have also Aššur-nādā seal as much as he makes and send it to me. Send Aššur-taklāku with the very first travelers. Let Ilī-ālum leave in the spring. To Aššur-nādā: Your forgot 11 minas of tin belonging to Alāhum in the safe when you left. We shall send it with travelers. 40+[x minas of] tin and 2/3 minas of silver ...

src: 7.5 ma-na 7.5 GIN KU.BABBAR a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim DUMU pa-na-ka 3 ma-na 15 GIN su-ku-bu-um DUMU-su 11 ma-na 15 GIN a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU a-mur-DINGIR 8 ma-na a-mur-ISTAR SES-su 21.83333 ma-na 2.5 GIN pu-su-ke-en6 25 ma-na il5-ba-ni DUMU i-ku-nim 10 ma-na a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU en-na-nim 2 ma-na <big_gap><gap>-<gap> 1 ma-na 15 GIN a-sur-DUG <big_gap> DUMU e-na-a 13 ma-na a-li-li 8.33333 ma-na MAR.TU ba-ni 1 ma-na 18 GIN a-al-DUG DUMU a-na-li 8.5 ma-na na-bi4-su-en6 DUMU {d}AB-ba-ni 5.66666 ma-na DUMU a-ta-a-a 6.66666 ma-na DUMU a-ta-a-a DUMU su-be-lim SU.NIGIN 4 GU 28.33333 ma-na LA 0.5 GIN pu-ru-um sa pu-su-ke-en6
tgt: 7 minas 37 1/2 shekels silver - Aššur-bēl-awātum s. Panaka 3 minas 15 shekels -- Šū-Kūbum his son. 11 minas 15 shekels -- Aššur-imittī s. Amur-ilī. 8 minas -- Amur-Ištar his brother. 20 minas 52 1/2 shekels -- Pūšu-kēn 25 minas Ilī-bāni s. Ikūnim 10 minas -- Aššur-imittī s. Ennānum. 2 minas ... 1 mina 15 shekels -- Aššur-ṭāb ... 13 minas Al-ilī 8 minas 20 shekels -- Amurrum-bāni 1 mina 18 shekels Āl-ṭāb s. Anali. 8 minas 30 shekels -- Nāb-Suen s. Enlil-bāni. 5 minas 40 shekels -- the son of Attaya. 6 minas 40 shekels -- the son of Attāya s. Šū-Bēlum. Total: 4 talents 28 minas 19 1/2 shekels -- the lot of Pūšu-kēn.

src: 3.6666600000000003 GIN 15 SE KU.BABBAR li-ti i-se-er as-qu-dim mu-za ti-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa u-su-ur-sa-ISTAR ITU.KAM si-pi-im li-mu-um i-di-a-hu-um a-na ITU.2.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 0.16666 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i ITU.1.KAM-im u-sa-ab IGI a-sur-i-di
tgt: Asqudim owes Muza 3 2/3 shekels 15 grains of quality silver. He will pay 2 months from ḫamuštum of Uṣur-ša-Ištar, month ṣí-pì-im, eponymate Iddin-ahum. If he does not pay, he will add 0.167 shekels as interest per month.

src: um-ma il5-mi-ti-ma a-na a-sur-GAL u a-sur-i-mi-ti qi-bi-ma a-na a-sur-GAL qi-bi4-ma la li-bi4 DINGIR-ma DU10-a-sur DUMU a-hi-ka me-et ki-ma me-tu a-lik-ma e-er-su-su as-ba-at-ma u hu-ur-si-a-an-su i li-bi4 la-qe-pi-im a-hi-su as-ba-at u KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na i li-bi4 DAM.GAR-ru-tim ba-ab-ta-su as-ba-at i-na sa-am-si tup-pi ta-sa-me-u la ta-bi4-at a-tal-kam su-ma a-ma-kam la-su a-sar wa-as-bu su-pu-ur-su-um DUMU i-di-ku-bi4-im la te-zi-ba-am is-ti kur-ub-ISTAR tur4-da-su
tgt: From Ili-imittī to Aššur-rabi and Aššur-imittī: To Aššur-rabi: Against the will of the gods, Ṭāb-Aššur, your brother's son, has died. Also, I seized about a mina of silver of his assets from a transaction. Come! If he is not there, write to him wherever he is! Dispatch him with Kurub-Ištar.

src: a-na se-bu-li-ma ki-ma te-er-ta-ka is-ti su-ha-ri sa pu-su-ke-en6 i-li-ka-ni i-na tup-pi-ka 12 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa i-a-sa-ar me-eh-ra-tim se-bi-lam a si-a-ti lu a-na a-wi-li-im lu ku-a-ti KU.BABBAR 10 ma-na sa us-ta-as-bi4-tu a-ar-hi-is la u-se-bi-lam um-ma a-na-ku-ma KU.BABBAR ta-ah-du-um li-li-ik-su-ma li-bu-su li-hi-du i-nu-mi i-na wa-ah-su-sa-na wa-as-ba-ku-ni 8.83333 ma-na AN.NA i sa DAM.GAR DUG-si-la-a-sur il5-qe um-ma su-ut-ma a si-i-im ANSE.HI.A sa a-na dan-a-sur il5-qe-u al-qe um-ma a-na-ku-ma 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR si-i-im e-ma-ri-ka sa-he-er si-tam di-na-am um-ma su-ut-ma a-na 0.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR e-ma-ri-a il5-qe-su-nu um-ma a-na-ku-ma e-zi-ib e-ma-ar-ka is-te-en6 i-ti-zi-iz su-hu-ut is-ti-a la i-na-me-er a-ma-kam a-na 8.83333 ma-na AN.NA is-ti-ka li-iz-kam a-na se-er 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa is-ma-num ha-bu-la-ku-ni 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR i ra-mi-ni-a u-ra-di-ma a DUMU-su DUG-si-la-a-sur is-qu-ul 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa ig-ri-a DUG-si-la-a-sur i-na pa-ni-tim se-pi-su ub-la-su um-ma su-ut-ma 17 GIN.TA AN.NA as-a-ma-kum
tgt: As for the activities of shipping, when your instructions come with the ṣuharū-servants of Pūšu-kēn, in your tablet (it said), "Send 12 minas silver from Ea-šār." For those, both to the man and yours about 10 minas silver which I caused to be siezed, I did not send it late. I said, "Let aboundant silver arrive and let him be happy." When I was in Waḫšušana, Ṭāb-ṣilla-Aššur received 8 1/3 minas tin from the goods of the merchant. He said, "I took (it) for the price of the donkeys which they took for Dān-Aššur." I said, "Deduct 2/3 mina silver as the price of your donkey. Give (back) the rest." He said, "He took my donkeys for 50 shekels silver!" I said, "Leave it. One could assist your donkey (??)." He did not see things my way. There, let him clear for the 8 minas 50 shekels tin. As for the 20 shekels silver which Ismanum owes to you, I gathered 20 shekels silver from my own funds and Ṭāb-ṣilla-Aššur paid his son. 20 shekels silver for the hire of Ṭāb-ṣilla-Aššur in his first transport, he said, "I will purchase tin for you at a 17 shekel rate."

src: um-ma a-sur-ba-ni u sa-lim-a-sur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-na-kam a-wa-tum a-su-mi TUG.HI-sa-ap-ti-ni u pi-ri-ka-ni e-pi-si sa-pa-tim i-bi-si-a-ma sa-bu-um ma-du-um a-na ar-nim ta-di-in u ku-a-ti 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR u-sa-di-nu-ka 1 ma-na.TA KU.BABBAR i-na sa-tim ta-sa-qal 7.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na si-ib-tim i se-ep ku-lu-ma-a ni-il5-qe-a-kum KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su se-bi-lam a-pu-tum a-na sa-ap-ti-ni u pi-ri-ka-ni qa-at-ka la tu-ba-al-ma la ta-sa-am be-et-ka u su-ha-ru-ka sal-mu a-wa-at a-lim{ki} da-na
tgt: From Aššur-bāni and Šalim-Aššur to Pūšu-kēn: Here 'difficulties' (Veenhof) 'procedures'? have arisen concerning the saptinnū and pirikannū textiles and the woollen blankets (?), and many people have been fined. You also they condemned to pay 10 minas silver. You may pay in annual installments of 1 mina silver. We borrowed on your behalf 7 1/2 minas of silver against interest from (the silver) transported by Kulumaya. Send the silver and its interest. Urgent, do not deal in Your house and your servants are well. The decrees of the City are binding!

src: KISIB PUZUR4.SA.TU DUMU tu-i-mi-im KISIB ku-si-a DUMU <gap> <gap>-zi 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am pu-su-ke-en6 a-na ku-si-a a-na be-a-lim i-di-in
tgt: Seals: Puzur-šadūʾē son of Tuimum, Kuzīya son of ..., PN son of x-x-zi. Pūšu-kēn gave 1/3 mina refined silver to Kuzīya as capital.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma a-mur-ISTAR-ma 4 GU 14 ma-na URUDU ma-si-a-am 1 GU URUDU ha-bu-ra-ta-i-am SU.NIGIN 5 GU 14 ma-na URUDU {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni u-se-bi-lam um-ma su-ut-ma URUDU sa pu-su-ke-en6 SA.BA URUDU 5 ma-na URUDU SIG5 a-na E ka-ri-im a-di-in 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN im-ti si-ti URUDU 4 GU 8 ma-na 15 GIN.TA ma-si-a-am 0.66666 ma-na 6 GIN KU.BABBAR-ap-su 5.33333 ma-na 3.6666600000000003 GIN 1 GU ha-bu-ra-ta-i-um KU.BABBAR-ap-su 1 ma-na 5.5 GIN SU.NIGIN 6.33333 ma-na 9.16666 GIN KU.BABBAR SA 6 GIN KU.BABBAR lu a qa-ti su-ha-ri-su a-di u {d}ISKUR-ba-ni 6.33333 ma-na 3.16666 GIN {d}ISKUR-ba-ni na-as-a-kum
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Amur-Ištar: Ilabrat-bāni sent 4 talents 14 minas of washed copper, 1 talent of Ḫaburatine copper: total - 5 talents 14 minas of copper. He said, "The copper belongs to Pūšu-kēn." Thereof, I gave about 5 minas of fine copper to the colony office. 45 shekels were deficient. The remainder of the copper, 4 talents 8 minas 15 shekel, washed copper, at a rate of 46 shekels silver, its yeilded silver was 5 minas 23 2/3 shekels. As for the one talent of Haburatāyyum (copper), its silver was 1 mina 5 1/2 shekels. In total, it was 6 minas 29 1/6 shekels copper. Thereof, I deposited 6 shekels silver to the accounts of the youth. (?) As for Adad-bāni, Adad-bāni brings you 6 minas 23 1/6 shekels (of silver).

src: 14.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-al-DUG u i-li-tap-pa a-mur-ISTAR i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa su-a-nim u du-du a-na 30 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu-u su-ma i-na u4-mi-su-nu ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-lu-u i-na ITU.KAM 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-em u-su-bu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu u ki-ni-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI im-di-DINGIR IGI tu-ra-a
tgt: Āl-ṭāb and Ilī-tappā owe Amur-Ištar 14 5/6 minas refined silver. They will pay thirty weeks from the ḫamuštum of Šū-Anum and Dudu. If they do not pay at the fulfillment of their term, they will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest). Witnesses: Imdi-ilum, Tūrāya

src: 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa DAM.GAR ku-nu-ki sa ah-sa-lim a-na e-na-su-en6 DUMU su-ISTAR u-sur-sa-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti u a-sur-ma-lik DUMU u-sa-nim ap-qi-<gap>-id IGI i-di-a-sur DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti IGI zu-ku-a DUMU a-sur-i-di
tgt: 10 Minen Silber des tamkārum, mit den Siegeln des Aẖšalim (versehen), habe ich dem Ennasu'in, und dem Sohne des Šū'ištar, dem Uṣurštar, dem Sohne des Aššurimittī, und dem Aššurmalik, dem Sohne des Usānum, anvertraut. Vor Idī'aššur, dem Sohne des Aššurmittī; vor Sukū'a, dem Sohne des Aššuridī.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma 5.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-na-kam ah-bu-la-kum mi-su sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni um-ma a-ta-ma KU.BABBAR a-na qa-ti-ka a-na ni-ka-si-ka a-na na-da-im ak-la-su KU.BABBAR am a-ma-kam u-la i-su-ma ma KU.BABBAR sa a-na-kam ah-bu-la-ku-ni ta-ak-la u su-ma KU.BABBAR a-ma-kam la i-su-ma ma i-na ra-mi-ni-ka ta-as-ta-qal-ma ITU.KAM is-te-en6 u se-na i-ta-ab-e-el-ka mi-ma-a kur-ub-ISTAR i-li-kam-ma KU.BABBAR sa DUMU a-la-hi-im lu is-ti DAM.GAR-ri-a a-sar u4-mu-su-nu ma-al-u-ni u-la tu-sa-as-qi-il5-ma u-la tu-se-bi-lam a-na KU.BABBAR 20 ma-na u e-li-is a-tu-ul 7 ma-na KU.BABBAR tu-se-bi-lam a-hi a-ta a ma-nim sa-nim a-ma-kam ta-ak-la-ku a-na te-er-ti-a i-hi-id a-li KU.BABBAR-pi 1 GIN i-ba-si-u sa-as-qi-il5-ma se-bi-lam i-na lu-qu-ti-a a-na ni-ka-si-a qa-tam i-a-tam-ma i-ta-di a-na E a-sur-SIPA e-ru-ub-ma tup-pe-e-a li-qe-ma i-na qa-ti-ka li-ib-si-u lu i-na ba-ab mu-a-ti-su mi-ma a su-mi-a iq-bi lu KU.BABBAR-pi a-ma-kam mi-ma il5-qe li-ma-ad-ma ta-ne-eh-ti li-bi-a su-up-ra-ma uz-ni pi-te u KU.BABBAR ap-su sa na-ru-qi-su ma-ma-an mi-ma la i-la-qe ka-ni-ka-ma se-bi-la-nim a-su-mi si-mi-im sa DUMU su-a-sur sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni su-ma a-di 10 u4-me-e mi-ma-sa-ma la as-pu-ra-kum u-za-ka la i-ba-si su-ma <big_gap> <gap> su-up-ra-ma is-ti-ka lu sa <gap> <big_gap>
tgt: From Aššur-imittī to Pūšu-kēn: I owe you 5 1/2 minas refined silver here. What is it that you wrote? You said, "I withheld silver from your account to your accountings, to your sales." I don't owe money there! Indeed! You're witholding silver which I owe you here! Now, if I do not owe silver there, then weigh out (silver) from your own funds and let it be a loan from you for a month or two! Everything? goes to Kurub-Ištar and you have not collected silver from the son of Al-āḫum or from my merchants whose terms are full, and you have not sent it. I anticpated 20 minas or more of silver. You sent (only) 7 minas. My dear brother, in whom else can I trust there? Heed my instructions! Wherever there is a single shekel of silver, collect it and send it! From my merchandise to my accountings ... my own share/spendable cash. Enter into the house of Aššūr-rēʾī and take my tablets so that they are in your possession. At the very moment of his dying, he said something about my name! He took something of my silver there! Learn (something) and send me some good news and thus inform me. Also, his silver of his naruqqum, no one must take anything. Seal it and send it here. Concerning the purchase of the son of Šū-Aššur about which you wrote, "If I do not write you anything in the next 10 days, I will clear you." It is lost./not here. If ..., send so that with you I may be able to šxx.

src: a-na a-sur-i-di qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa-du-a-su sa-bu sa na-ru-qi-ka ku-nu-ki-a a-sur-dan na-as-a-kum 3 GIN KU.BABBAR wa-si-su sa-bu ni-is-pu-ra-kum i-na se-ep su-{d}ISKUR um-ma ne-nu-ma a-di 10 u4-me a-li-ku a-di se-ni-su u sa-la-si-su i-lu-ku-ma a-ni-ma 5 ma-na.TA KU.BABBAR nu-na-sa-ra-kum wa-ar-ki-su-nu-ma si-ka-tum u-si-u ma-hi-ru-um pa-ru-ud-ma i-na re-es15 ba-ab-tim u-la na-ad-u-ma pa-am u-la nu-ma-la KU.BABBAR-pu da-nu a-na KU.BABBAR ma-dim e ta-ad-gu5-ul si-mu ba-at-qu-ma i-li-a a-na wa-ah-su-sa-na at-ru-su i-na KU.BABBAR a-nim 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI su-a-nim al-qe-ma tup-pa-am ha-ar-ma-am sa ku-nu-ki-a su-ut il5-qe sa a-na 1 ma-na KU.GI <big_gap> sa i-na na-ru-uq a-sur-i-mi-ti la-ap-tu sa-bu-a-ni-ni-ma la ni-tu-ru-su-ni
tgt: To Aššur-idi from Aššur-nādā: Aššur-dān is on his way to you with 6 minas of refined silver, its transport tariff paid, from your joint-stock capital and under my seal. 3 shekels of silver, its export-duty, he has been paid. We wrote to you (in a letter) transported by Šū-Adad, saying: "Within 10 days travelers will come here(?) two or three times, so now we shall set aside for you 5 minas each time." But after they had left the sikkātum went out and the market is disturbed so we are not in a position to fulfil our promise given when the goods were commissioned. Silver is hard to get. Do not expect a lot of silver. Prices being low, I have sent Ilī-ālum to Wahšušana. Of the present silver I have received 4 minas of silver from Šū-Anum, and he in turn received a certified tablet with my seal, which says that we have been paid in full for the one mina of gold that was booked in Aššur-emūqi's joint-stock company, and that we shall not raise the matter again.

src: 2.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-su-mi i-ku-nim i ra-me-ni-a a sa ki-ma bu-zu-ta-a as-qul is-tu ha-mus-tim sa {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni u i-ku-nim 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI a-sur-{d}UTU-si DUMU ib-ni-li
tgt: He will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina) per month as interest from the ḫamuštum of Amurrum-bāni and Ikūnim. Witnesses: Aššur-Šamši s. Ibni-ilī.

src: a-sur-{d}UTU-si DUMU <big_gap> ni-a-um wa-bi-lu il5-ba-ni DUMU i-a-a DUMU as-qu-di-a u e-<gap> <big_gap> sa i-na URUDU qa-ti sa-ak-nu <big_gap> 30 ma-na URUDU ma-si-am a-na-ku a-di-su-um mi-ma KU.BABBAR a-nim u-la la-qu ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma a-na-kam is-ti i-na-ah-DINGIR a-gi5-ri-ma KU.BABBAR sa na-aq-bu-im i-qi-bi mi-su-ma ma-la KU-BABBAR i ba-ri-ku-nu i-qi-bi-u la ta-as-pu-ra-ma uz-ni la ta-ap-te ku-a-ti a-wa-tim u-ka-lam-ka um-ma a-ta-ma a-se-er KU.BABBAR a-ni-um la-qu-u u tup-pu-su sa 9 ma-na LA 10 GIN KU.BABBAR u si-ba-ti-su sa DAM.GAR i-se-ri-su i-su-u-ma su-ut DAM.GAR-ru-ni u-ka-al su-ma um-ma su-ut-ma a-na KU.BABBAR la-qu-im u a-na tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im DUMU a-ni-nim-ma li-is-e a-di KU.BABBAR 15 ma-na u 20 ma-na a-lik-ma ki-ma KU.BABBAR a-na a-lim{ki} e-ta-li-is a-na a-lim{ki} i-lu-ku-ni i-ba-la-ka-ta-ma 30 ma-na KU.BABBAR ap-su us-ta-bu-u e-pu-us-ma tup-pi-i qa-at-ka li-is-ba-at 20 GU URUDU SIG5 u-sa-li-a-ma la am-gu5-ur mi-ma KU.BABBAR la-qu-im u da-ni-ti-i la-li-ka-ni u4-mu-u a-na i-na-ah-DINGIR mi-nam u-bu-lu-su-um
tgt: You wrote me.

src: 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-na kur-ub-ISTAR a be-a-lim id-na-a i-di-in is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa da-da-nim u a-sur-ba-ni a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i ITU.1.KAM a-1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab IGI u-su-ur-sa-a-sur IGI a-sur-is-ti-kal
tgt: Witnesses: Uṣur-ša-Aššur, Aššuriš-tikal.

src: KISIB i-ku-pi-a-sur DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR KISIB i-di-su-in DUMU a-sur-DU10 18 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er i-di-su-in DUMU a-sur-<gap>-<gap> pu-su-ke-in i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa su-ku-bu-um u kur-ub-ISTAR a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i u-me-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a 1 ma-na-im i ITU.KAM u-sa-ab ITU.KAM sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-di-a-bi4-im
tgt: Seals: Ikuppī-Aššur s. Puzur-Ištar, Idī-Suen s. Aššur-ṭāb. Idī-Suen s. Aššur-... owes Pūšu-kēn 18 shekels refined silver. He will pay 13 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Šū-Kūbum and Kurub-Ištar. If he does not pay at full term, he will add (as interest) 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Month: Ša sarrātim. Eponymate: The one after Idī-abim.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma a-mur-ISTAR-ma a ma-la na-as-pi-ir-ti-ka a-na 43 ma-na AN.NA sa na-as-a-ku-ni u 9 {TUG}ku-ta-ni sa is-tu ka-ni-is tu-se-ba-la-ni um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-wi-lu-um is-tap-ra-am qa-ta-am la am-ha-as KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na ra-mi-ni ak-ta-ba-as-ma tup-pi sa 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pi-im IGI a-si-na DUMU um-me-a-nim al-pu-ut-ma ku-nu-ki-su u ku-nu-ki-a su-lu-ma na-as-a-kum a-bi a-ta i-hi-id-ma TUG-ti a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum se-bi-lam a-na-hi-id-ma ra-mi-ni u-za-ka-ma a-na ka-ni-is a-na se-ri-ka a-la-kam-ma a-na a-wa-tim sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni i-nu-mi-su pi-te-a-si-na ki-ma a-wa-tim a-na ki-tim la wa-sa-i-im mi-ma a-wa-tim sa i na-as-pe-er-ti-ka la-ap-ta-ni u-la u-di-a na-as-pa-ra-ti-ka u-ka-al 2 ma-na URUDU a-na qa-ti su-lu-ma a-di-in
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Amur-Ištar: According to your message, regarding the 43 minas of tin which are brought to you and the 9 kutānum-textiles which you sent from Kaneš, I said, "As for me, the man wrote to me. I did not strike(?) the share." I did my best with about a mina of silver of my own funds and I wrote a tablet which stated '10 minas of refined silver in the presence of Ašina, the affiliated trader' and Šuluma brings it to you under his seal and my seal. My dear father, take care to send my textiles to Purušḫattum. I will take care to clear my own funds and come to you in Kanesh so that at that time you will open the tablets referring to the matters about which I wrote you. Becasue the matters do not 'go out' to justice, I did not inform those matters which were written in your letters. I hold your messages. I gave Šuluma 2 minas of copper for expenses.

src: 6 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er se-er-du DUMU na-ar-i-a i-ku-num i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa PUZUR4.ISTAR a-na ha-mus-tim sa i-la-ka-ni i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul a-na 1 ma-na-im 3 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.im u-sa-ab IGI se-er-du sa-am-a-lim IGI e-wi-ir-ni IGI i-zi-iz-mi-sar IGI su-en-pi-la-ah
tgt: Šerdu s. Nariya owes Ikūnum 6 minas 15 shekels refined silver. He will pay in the ḫamuštum following the ḫamuštum of Puzur-Ištar. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 3 shekels silver per mina per month. Witnesses: Šerdu--Šam-alim(?), Ewirni, Iziz-Mīšar, Suen-pilaḫ.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u su-ISTAR qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-be-la-wa-ti-ma 1 TUG su-ISTAR na-as-a-ku-um a-bi a-ta mu-hu-ur-su 1 SILA re-es15-tam su-ISTAR na-as-a-kum 6 ma-na AN.NA i-nu-mi u-sa-ni a-na i-di-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-ma-lik a-di-in su-ma be-lu-a a-tu-nu KU sa-di-na-ma se-bi4-la-nim
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn and Šū-Ištar from Aššur-bēl-awātum: Šū-Ištar brings to you 1 textile. My dear father, approach him. Šū-Ištar (also) brings you 1 SILA of top quality oil. 6 minas tin, when he departed, I gave it to Idī-Ištar son of Aššur-mālik. If you are my lords, make him give it and send it to me.

src: <big_gap> GU URUDU SIG5 sa ta-ri-ta-ar <big_gap> GU 30 ma-na URUDU sa sa-ad-wa-na-am la u-ka-lu SU.NIGIN 6 GU 30 ma-na i-se-er id-na-a-a DUMU za-li-a im-di-DINGIR i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-la-hi-im DUMU i-di-su-en6 u e-na-ma-nim im-di-lum a-na tu-ur-hu-mi-it su-ha-ar-su i-sa-par a-na ka-ni-is a-na ni-ga-li-im URUDU u-sa-ak-sa-dam su-ma la us-ta-ak-si-dam ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im <gap> ma-na.TA si-ib-tam a-na 1 GU-tim u-sa-ab IGI la-qe-ep DUMU <big_gap> IGI {d}ISKUR <big_gap>
tgt: Witnesses: Lāqēp s. ..., Adad ...

src: 12 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er LUGAL-{d}ISKUR DUMU nu-ur-su DAM.GAR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ha-na-a ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um e-na-su-en6 DUMU su-a-sur a-na 8 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab IGI {d}en-LIL-ba-ni DUMU GAL-a-sur
tgt: Šar-Adad s. Nūr-Suen owes the merchant 12 shekels of refined silver. He will pay 8 weeks from ḫamuštum of Ḫanaya, month Kuzalli, eponymate Enna-Suen s. Šū-Aššur. If he does not pay, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest). Witness: Enlil-bāni s. Rab-Aššur.

src: KISIB en-um-a-a KISIB a-sur-ma-lik sa hu-bu-ul su-be-lim sa 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-gu5-a u is-me-{d}ISKUR 0.5 GIN i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab ha-ti u me-er-a-sa e-ru-ba-tu-a a-di KU.BABBAR u-sa-ba-a-ni-ni ma-ma-an u-la i-ta-hi-si-na-ti
tgt: Regarding the debt of Šū-Bēlim of 1/3 mina silver. He will add 1/2 shekel (per mina) per month (as interest) from the ḫamuštum of Agua and Išme-Adad.

src: IGI u-su-ra-nim IGI DUMU ki-li-a la-qe-pu-um ni-is-ba-at-ma um-ma ne-nu-ma AN.NA sa da-ti-ka di-in um-ma su-ut-ma mi-ma la ha-bu-la-ku a-sar-ma ha-bu-la-ti-ni AN.NA u si-a-ma-ti-su la ta-sa-qa-al um-ma su-ut-ma a-sa-qal
tgt: In the presence of Išurānum and the son of Kiliya, we siezed Lā-qēpum and we said, "Pay the tin of your dātum-payment." He said, "I do not owe anything." (We said), "Whatever you owe you cannot pay the tin or its purchases. He said, "I will pay."

src: 5.5 ma-na URUDU SIG5 ti-is-mu-ur-ni-am i-se-er qa-ta-tim u su-a-nim PUZUR4-a-sur i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ah-sa-lim i-na na-ma-ar-ti AN <big_gap> i-na ITU-<big_gap> u-su-bu-u ITU.KAM te-i-na-tim li-mu-um su-hu-bur URUDU-um i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu u ke-ni-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI ma-na-na
tgt: Month: Teʾinātim Eponymate: Šū-Ḫubur.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti u PUZUR4-a-sur-ma i-na KU.BABBAR sa PUZUR4-a-sur ub-la-ni 1 me-at 10 TUG-ta-ni 20 ma-na AN.NA qa-tim 4 ANSE.HI.A sa-la-mu-u 0.5 ma-na be-u-la-tim sa sa-ri-di-im 2 GIN lu-bu-su mi-ma a-nim i-a-sar i-ra-de8-a-kum si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-ka nu-za-ka-ma is-ti wa-ar-ki-u-tim ni-sa-pa-ra-kum
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Aššur-imittī and Puzur-Aššur: From the silver which Puzur-Aššur brought, (we purchased) 110 textiles, 20 minas hand tin, 4 black donkeys, 1/2 mina silver for the be'ulatum of the driver, 2 shekels (silver) for his dressing, and all this Ea-šār transports to you. We will clear the remainder of your silver and send it to you with the next travellers.

src: <big_gap> 1 ne-pi-su-um <gap> <big_gap> sa sa-lim-a-hi-im <big_gap> 1 ri-ik-su-um <gap> <big_gap> sa sa-lim-a-hi-im-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 1 ne-pi-su-um <gap> <big_gap> <gap> sa a-mur-ISTAR <big_gap> pu-su-ke-en6 1 ri-ik-su-um 3.5 ma-na sa a-mur-<gap> a-na i-li-a-lim u PUZUR4-a-sur 1 ri-ik-su-um <gap> <big_gap> sa PUZUR4-a-sur u pu-su-ke-en6 1 ri-ik-su-um <gap> ma-na 13 GIN
tgt: 1 package belonging to Šalim-aḫum ..., 1 bundle also belonging to Šalim-aḫum ... (went?) to Pūšu-kēn. 1 package ... [belonging to ...] ... (1 package) belonging to Amur-Ištar ... Pūšu-kēn ... 1 package 3 1/2 minas belonging to Amur-... to Ilī-ālum and Puzur-Aššur. 1 package ... belonging to Puzur-Aššur and Pūšu-kēn, 1 package x minas 13 shekels (belonging to ...)

src: KISIB u-sur-sa-a-sur DUMU pu-ta-a KISIB su-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-la-ma-si KISIB i-ku-pi-a DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti KISIB a-mur-a-sur DUMU pa-pa-la-nim 2.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-mur-a-sur DUMU pa-pa-la-nim su-hu-bu-ur i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ka-na-su DUMU bu-a-na ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-i-li li-mu-um sa qa-ti a-sur-ma-lik DUMU a-la-hi-im a-na 2 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a 1 ma-na-em i ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab
tgt: Amur-Aššur s. Bablānim owes Šū-Ḫubur 2.5 minas of refined silver.

src: a-na a-sur-i-di qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma a-na su-mi ni-ka-si-a a-di es15-ri-su ta-aq-bi-a-am um-ma a-ta-ma i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-a su-qu-ul u i-na sa-am-si u-si-a-ni um-ma a-na-ku-ma la-as-hu-ut um-ma a-ta-ma la ta-sa-ha-at a-na me-er-a a-na u-sa-zi-iz u ki-ma lu-mu-un li-bi4-im a-ni-a-tim ta-sa-pa-ra-am a-sur u {d}NIN.SUBUR li-tu-la i-na qa-ti-a u-la-qi-it-ma 3.5 ma-na 4 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-na ni-ip-la-ti-a sa 16 ma-na.TA lu as-qu-ul u4-ma-am 16 ma-na KU.BABBAR qa-tam i-na KU-pi-ka na-ad-a-ku is-te-en6 u se-na sa is-hu-tu-ni ma-la na-ad-u-ni i-ti-bi4-il5-ma u 6 ma-na.TA KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa ma-sa-tim sa a-sur i-sa-qal-ma i-sa-ha-at ma-la-ka 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am ni-is-ha-su DIRI sa-du-a-su sa-bu a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku na-as-a-kum AN.NA SIG5 sa-ma se-bi4-lam
tgt: To Aššur-idī from Aššur-nādā: With respect to my account you told me 10 times: "Pay with my silver." And the day I left I said: "Let me clear it." You answered: "Do not clear it!" For which of my affairs have I personally appointed someone to represent me? Also, instead of sending these angry messages, let Aššur and Ilabrat be my witnesses that I have scraped together what I had in my possession, and that I did pay 3 1/2 minas 4 shekels of refined silver for my balance payment, amounting to 16 minas each. Today I am booked for a share of 16 minas of your silver. As to the one or two who have cleared, what they have deposited has been balanced, and he will have to pay at the rate 6 minas each in refined silver to the treasury of Aššur, and he will then clear it. It is up to you. 10 minas of refined silver, its import duty added, its transport tariff and export duty paid for, Aššur-taklāku is on his way to you with that. Buy good quality tin and send it to me.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi4-ma a ni-ka-si-a i-na 1 a-li-ki-im te-er-ta-ka a-na a-hi-ka li-li-ik-ma sa-zi-za a-su-mi KU.BABBAR 1 GIN sa a-di-na-ku-ni lu sa um-mi-ka a-di-na-ku-ni me-eh-ra-tim a-na um-mi-ka a-di-in KU.BABBAR a-na i-a-im i-tu-ar su-ma ka-ru-um i-sa-ni-iq um-ma a-ta-ma KU.BABBAR a-su-mi a-bi4-a-ma <big_gap> u-sa-ab-sa-al ma-ma-an la ta-za-ka-ar u sa-du-a-tam la ta-na-di su-ma u-sa-az-ku-ru-ka zu-ku-ur u <big_gap> i-na ne-mi-lim u-la ta-kal
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-taklāku: With respect to my account, send word to your brothers with the travelers to make them stand (as representatives). Concerning the silver I gave you, every shekel, as well as what I gave to you of your mother's, I have given a corresponding amount to your mother. The silver has now become mine. If the colony puts pressure on you, just say: "I shall deal with the silver on behalf of my father." Do not mention anybody's name, and do not deposit any transport tariff. If they force you to mention (anyone), then do so, but you will not share in the profit.

src: <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-mur-a-sur a-hu-wa-qar i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku u ga-zi-a a-na 30 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qul a-na 1 ma-na-im 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab ITU.KAM ti-i-na-tim li-mu-um a-mur-a-sur DUMU kar-ri-a IGI <gap>-sa-bi4-im IGI <big_gap> DUMU su-a-sur IGI <big_gap>-<gap>-<gap>-ma DUMU <big_gap>-<gap>-um-i-li-a
tgt: Amur-Aššur owes Aḫu-waqar (unknown amount) mina refinded silver He will pay thirty weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-taklāku and Gazia. If he does not pay at the fulfillment of his term, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er a-la-hi-im u-su-ur-sa-a-sur i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa am-ri-a 0.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na 3 ITU.KAM i-sa-qal u 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na 6 ITU.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab IGI i-ku-pi-ISTAR IGI ku-ra-ra
tgt: Witnesses: Ikuppī-Ištar, Kurara

src: 1.3333300000000001 ma-na 1 GIN KU.BABBAR 4 na-ru-uq se-am 2 na-ru-uq GIG 20 NINDA u 2 UDU.HI.A su-pu-u i-se-er ut-ka-ri-a a-sur-ma-lik i-su is-tu ITU.KAM sa sa-ra-ra-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-ku-pi-ISTAR a-na sa-na-at i-da-an is-pu-na-ah-su u su-pi-u-ma-an qa-ta-tum IGI pa-ru-a-wa-ta IGI pu-ta IGI is-ta-ri-ip-ta
tgt: Udkaria owes Aššur-mālik 1 1/3 mina 1 shekel silver, 4 bags grain, 2 bags wheat, 20 loaves of bread, 2 sheep of a special breed. He will pay one year from the month ša Sarrarātim, eponymate after Ikuppī-Ištar. Išpunaḫšu and Šuppi-uman are the guarantors. Witnesses: Parauwata, Puta, iš-ta-ri-ip-ta

src: 3.5 ma-na URUDU SIG5 i-se-er su-ka-lim DUMU i-di-su-en6 i-li-a-num i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-di-ISTAR a-na ITU.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.3333300000000001 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um {d}ISKUR-ba-ni IGI su-be-lim IGI li-la
tgt: Sukkallim s. Idī-Suen owes Ilī-Anum 2.5 minas fine copper. He will pay one month from ḫamustum of Idī-Ištar. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/3 shekels as interest.

src: KISIB e-nu-ga-mi-il5 DUMU a-ba KISIB a-sur-DU10 DUMU am-ri-a KISIB da-na-a DUMU u-zu-a KISIB i-li-dan DUMU tu-ra-am-i-li KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU a-zu-a 5.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er e-nu-ga-mi-il5 u a-sur-DU10 DUMU am-ri-a a-sur-GAL i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-ma-lik DUMU a-la-hi-im a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu ITU.1.KAM be-el-ti-E.GAL-lim li-mu-um sa qa-ti si-lu-lu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu u ke-ni-su-nu ra-ki-is
tgt: Seals: Enna-gāmil s. Aba, Aššur-ṭāb s. Amrīya, Dannā s. Uzuwa, Ilī-dān s. Tūram-ilī, Puzur-Aššur s. Azua. Enna-gāmil s. Aba owes Aššur-rabi 5 1/2 minas of refined silver. He will pay 20 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-malik s. Al-aḫim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina (per month) as interest. Month: bēlet-ekallim. Eponymate: after Silūlu. (The obligation to pay back) the silver is bound to whichever one is financially solvent and legally responsible.

src: 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er se-su-ur sar-ni-ka-an i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa u-su-ur-sa-ISTAR a-na 4 ITU.KAM-im i-sa-qal IGI a-lu-lu IGI ar-si-ah DUMU su-a-nim
tgt: Šezur owes Šarnikan 1/2 minas silver. He will pay four months from the ḫamuštum of Uṣur-ša-Ištar. Witnesses: Alulu, Arši-aḫ s. Šū-Anum.

src: 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er su-is-ha-ra u-zu-a i-su 1 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-i-li DINGIR 5 u4-mi-im i-za-az li-mu-um si-in-is-me-a-ni IGI su-ka-li-a IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti
tgt: Šū-Išḫara owes Uzuwa 1/3 mina silver.

src: a-na 9.66666 ma-na AN.NA u 0.5 ma-na LA 2 GIN KU.BABBAR sa pu-su-ke-en6 a-su-mi su-ISTAR DUMU da-da-nim su-en6-SIPA DUMU a-mur-ISTAR e-pu-lu AN.NA u KU.BABBAR hu-bu-ul su-ISTAR DUMU da-da-nim pu-su-ke-en6 mi-ma u-la ta-hu-u IGI su-ISTAR DUMU lu-zi-na IGI PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU i-sar-ki-it-a-sur IGI dan-a-sur DUMU sal-mah IGI a-sur-ma-lik DUMU a-mur-lu-su IGI il5-we-da-ku DUMU i-di-a-sur
tgt: Regarding the 9 minas 2/3 shekels tin and 28 shekels silver belonging to Pūšu-kēn: Concerning(this?) Šū-Ištar s. Dadānum (and?) Suen-rē'ī s. Amur-Ištar answered. Pūšu-kēn will not aid (pay) the tin or silver, the debt of Šū-Ištar s. Dadānum. Witnesses: Šū-Ištar s. Luzina, Puzur-Aššur s. Išar-kit-Aššur, Dān-Aššur s. Šalim-aḫum, Aššur-māalik s. Amur-lussu, Ilī-wēdāku s. Idī-Ašsur.

src: {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li a-na bu-za-zu is-ba-at-ni-a-ti-ma um-ma {d}ISKUR.ANDUL-ma a-na bu-za-zu-ma i-na pu-ru-us-ha-tim i-na li-mi-im i-ku-pi-ISTAR ba-ab ha-ra-ni-ka um-ma a-ta-ma 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR si-im pe-er-di u a-mu-tim en-um-a-sur DUMU u-zu-a ha-bu-lam 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR me-eh-ra-su di-nam 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR me-eh-ra-su i-na pu-ru-us-ha-tim a-di-na-ku-um la a-di-na-ku-um <big_gap> um-ma ig-ri-u-ma <big_gap> la tu-na-ha-ni a-na di-nim la ta-sa-pa-ra-ni KU.BABBAR ma-dam la tu-sa-ag-ma-ra-ni bu-za-zu {d}ISKUR.ANDUL e-pu-ul um-ma bu-za-zu-ma a-na {d}im-ANDUL-ma 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR si-im a-mu-tim u pe-er-di en-um-a-sur DUMU u-zu-a i-hi-ib-la-am ta-li-kam-ma um-ma a-ta-ma 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa en-um-a-sur ha-bu-la-ku-ni a-na-ku la-di-na-kum um-ma a-na-ku-ma KU.BABBAR lu ta-da-nam i-a-ti mi-ma la ta-tu-ra-am si-bi i-su-a-kum is-tu i-na pu-ru-us-ha-tim tu-sa-ni a-di ha-am-si-su ni-na-me-er-ma ma-ti-ma mi-ma u-la ta-aq-bi-am a-na-ma a-na-ku a-na KU.BABBAR e-bu-ti sa a-bu-ni i-di-na-ku-ni as-bu-tu-ka u a-ta a-na KU.BABBAR sa tu-a-ra-am la qa-bi-a-ti-ni ta-ar-ta-ag-ma-am la tu-ni-hi-ma a di-nim la ta-sa-pi-ri a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um ka-ni-is i-di-ni-a-ti-ma IGI GIR sa a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in IGI a-sur-DU10 DUMU PUZUR-a-sur IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU i-di-we-er
tgt: Adad-ṣulūlī seized us against Buzāzu: Adad-ṣulūlī said to Buzāzu: In Purušḫattum in the eponymate of Ikuppi-Ištar, as you were leaving you said, "I owe Ennum-Aššur s. Uzuwa 4 minas silver, the price of the perdum equids and metoric iron." For these things, the colony at Kanesh gave us permission and we gave our testimonies before the dagger of Aššur. Witnesses: Aššur-ṭāb s. Puzur-Aššur, Aššur-imittī s. Iddin-Wēr.

src: um-ma in-bi-ISTAR-ma a-na a-sur-ni-su bu-zu-ta-a u si-la-{d}ISKUR qi-bi-ma a-di 5 u4-me-e a-sur-GAL a-mi-sa-am ha-ra-su i-la-kam-ma is-ti bu-zu-ta-a i-za-ku a-di a-sur-GAL i-ka-sa-da-am si-ki-i bu-zu-ta-a ka-i-la u a-na sa qa-ta-tim i-ta-di-na-su la tu-sa-ra su-ma ha-ra-nam la i-la-ak a-su-ri si-ku-su e la ta-as-ba-ta-ma u a-na sa qa-ta-tim e la ta-di-na-su-ma eq-lam e i-ta-la-ak-ma li-bi e im-ra-as a-su-ri a-e-ma ha-ra-nam e i-lik-ma a-li us-bu a-sur-GAL e uk-ta-si-su-ma li-bi4 e im-ra-as u su-wa-am li-bu-su da-ni-is u-sa-am-ra-as
tgt: Inbi-Ištar to Aššur-nšu,

src: 0.33333 ma-na 8 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er a-sur-la-ma-si u na-qi-du a-sur-GAL i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-ma-lik 14 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na sa-na-at i-sa-qu-lu 14 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na sa-ni-tim sa-ti-im i-sa-qu-lu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-DINGIR li-mu-um sa qa-ti si-lu-lu IGI i-di-{d}UTU IGI a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku DUMU e-nu-be-lim IGI a-ma-lu-su-ma la is-qu-lu ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im u-su-bu
tgt: Aššur-lamassī and Naqidu owe Aššur-rabi 28 shekels silver. They will pay 14 shekels silver from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-mālik. They will pay 14 shekels silver in the second year. The silver is bound to whichever among them is solvent. Month: Maḫḫur-ilī. Eponymate: The one after Šilūlu. If they do not pay (on time) they will add according to the rate of the colony.

src: 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am ni-is-ha-su DIRI sa-du-a-su sa-bu a-na sa-ra-at-ISTAR 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa ik-ri-bi4-a 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um sa si-sa-ah-su-sar a-na sa GAL re-im sa-a-mi-im 5 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na ni-qi-su a-na kur-ub-ISTAR 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa a-sur-i-mi-ti a-na sa-ra-at-ISTAR 1.5 GIN a-na 1 UDU-su mi-ma a-nim a-na en-nam-a-sur DUMU i-di-su-en6 ap-qi-id IGI i-di-a-bi4-im IGI a-ni-na IGI a-ni-na DUMU PUZUR4-a-na
tgt: 1/2 mina of refined silver, its import duty added, its transport tariff paid, for Šarrat-Ištar; 5 10 shekels of refined silver from my votive offerings; 5 shekels of refined silver belonging to Šišahšušar for the purchase of a ring; 5 shekels of silver for his sacrifices for Kurub-Ištar; 5 shekels of silver belonging to Aššur-nēmedi for Šarrat-Ištar; 1 1/2 shekel for his sheep-all this I entrusted to Ennam-Aššur son of Iddin-Suen. Witnessed by Iddin-abum; witnessed by Annina; witnessed by Annina son of Puzur-Anna

src: <big_gap> a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku DUMU a-la-hi-im a-na 3 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM kan-bar-ta-an li-mu-um a-sur-i-mi-ti ma-la-hu-um i-na tup-pi-im sa 10-<gap>-0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR
tgt: If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest. Month: Kanwarta. Eponymate: Aššur-imittī the boatman.

src: KISIB ta-sa-am KISIB a-ma KISIB ha-du-ma-an KISIB na-ki-li-et KISIB du-du-la-ni KISIB wa-su-hu-ru-ma-an 1.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i se-er wa-su-hu-ru-ma-an se-lu-ma-ta u su-ma-a-hi i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ma-nu-ba-lum-a-sur a-na 6 ITU.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 3 GIN.TA i ITU.KAM-im u-sa-ab KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad E-be-ti-su a-si-ti-su u se-ri-su ra-ki-is
tgt: From the ḫamuštum of Mannum-bālum-Aššur, he will have 6 months to pay.

src: 18 ma-na <big_gap> KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-la-bi-im DUMU su-ti-bar la-qe-ep i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-UTU-si u i-li-a-lim a-na 45 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-me-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab IGI pu-su-ke-en6 IGI da-ga-ni-a IGI su-be-lim a-hu ha-da-a
tgt: Witnesses: Pūšu-kēn, Dagānia, Šū-Bēlim aḫḫū Ḫadaya.

src: 16.5 GIN KU.GI pa-sa-lam SIG5 sa ha-ra-an a-lim{ki} i-se-er {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li hu-ni-a i-su a-na sa ke-na-tim i-sa-qal su-ma KU.GI e-ni la im-ta-ha-ar 8 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR a-na KU.KI a-sa-qal-ma KU.BABBAR a-la-qe IGI su-ISTAR DUMU i-li-is-ti-ka-al IGI PUZUR4-{d}UTU DUMU su-nu-nu
tgt: Adad-ṣulūlī owes Ḫunia 16 1/2 minas fine pašallum gold for the journey of the city. He will pay in month III If I do not encounter any gold, I will pay an 8 shekels silver per shekel for the gold, and I will take the silver.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 13 ma-na AN.NA-ak qa-tim 13 {TUG}li-wi-tum u e-li-tum 1 ANSE sa-la-mu-um sa sa-ri-dim sa-bu mi-ma a-nim ku-nu-ki-a a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku i-ra-de8-a-kum a-hi a-ta eb-ri a-ta ma-ti-ma u-la as-pu-ra-kum um-ma a-na-ku-ma i-na ma-as-ka-ti-a AN.NA 1 GU u-ul 10 TUG.HI.A li-qe-ma gi5-im-la-ni a-hi a-ta a-na u-um ga-ma-li-im a-na AN.NA-ki-a u TUG.HI-a KU.BABBAR 1 GIN la tu-se-qa-ra-am a-se-er 25 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa lu-lu u sa AN.NA-ki-a u TUG.HI-a KU.BABBAR ta-hi-ma i se-pi-ka bi4-lam a-hi a-ta ma-la i-na a-la-ki-ka i-na ba-ab a-bu-li-im la a-ba-su KU.BABBAR lu sa u-me lu sa AN.NA ki-a a-num u TUG.HI-a e-mi-id-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN a-na be-ti-a i-na a-la-ki-ka le-ru-ub-ma lu su-um-ka i-na 13 TUG 2 TUG da-tam la i-la-mu-du 1 TUG a-ha-ma sa sa-at-a-sur sa ra-pa-di-im ka-ab-tum a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku na-as-a-kum a-se-er KU.BABBAR 30 ma-na sa a-sur-DU10 u si-im TUG.HI.A sa se-ep a-sur-ma-lik u a-ta KU.BABBAR 10 ma-na ra-di-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-ka 1 ITU.KAM u se-na li-be-el en-na-a-sur tur4-dam lu-qu-tam sa se-ep en-nam-a-sur ma-la ta-le-e-a-ni di-na-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-ka li-qe su-ma en-nam-a-sur i-ta-sa-am i-na u4-mi-im sa tup-pi ta-sa-me-u wa-ar-ka-su KU.BABBAR sa-ak-si-dam li-bi4-i la tu-la-ma-an
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: 2 talents 10 minas under seal, 13 minas hand tin, 13 textiles--wrappings and top pack--1 black donkey. The wages of the sāridum are paid. All this Aššur-taklāku brings to you under my seal. My dear brother and colleague, have I not already written you? I said, "Take about 1 talent of tin or 10 textiles from my inventory and do me a favor." My dear brother, now that it is time (for a) favor, do not overvalue every shekels against my tin and textiles. In addition to the 25 minas silver of Lulu, and the proceeds of my tin and textiles, add the silver and bring it in your transport. My dear brother, in order that I not be ashamed at the city gate when you arrive, collect every shekel of silver--that which is on terms and the proceeds of my tin and my textiles--so that every shekel of silver will enter my house at your arrival to the benefit of your reputation. Of the 13 textiles, they should not recognize the dātum of 2 textiles. Aššur-taklāku bears to you separately 1 heavy textile for travelling from Šāt-Aššur. In addition to the silver, 30 minas of Aššur-ṭāb and the yeild of textiles for Aššur-mālik's cargo, put up some 10 minas silver yourself and let your silver be disposed for one or two months. Dispatch Ennam-Aššur. Sell as much of the goods of Ennam-Aššur's cargo as you are able and take your silver. If Ennam-Aššur has left, on the day you read my tablet, cause the silver to catch up to him. Do not disappoint me.

src: a-na a-sur-na-da su-ma-li-bi-a-sur u a-lu-la-a qi-bi-ma um-ma {d}ISKUR.DUL-ma 24 GU 10 ma-na URUDU SIG5 a-na ku-da-dim a-hi-bi-il5-ma URUDU i-na u-la-ma sa ki-ma i-a-ti ku-da-dam u-sa-bi-u-ma tup-pi-i sa hu-bu-li-a u-se-si-u-ma a-na i-di-a-sur a-na na-ab-si-im e-zi-bu u4-ma-am tup-pi-i i-di-a-sur wa-sa-ra-am la i-mu-a um-ma su-ut-ma a-na sa me-tim i-di-u-ni-su sa a-na sa me-tim la i-di-u-su-ni a-ma-kam 3 me-er-e um-mi-a-ni a-na ku-da-dim sa-ab-ta-ma um-ma a-tu-nu-ma 24 GU 10 ma-na URUDU ma-si-am sa {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li i-hi-ib-la-ku-ni su-ha-ru-su sa {d}ISKUR.DUL i-na URUDU-i-su sa {d}ISKUR.DUL is-qu-lu-ni-ku-ma u-sa-bi-u-ka si-bi su-uk-na-su-um-ma u na-pa-al-tu-su KI a-li-ki pa-nim-ma te-er-ta-ku-nu li-li-kam ku-ul a-wa-tim a-lu-la-a i-de8 a-ma-kam lu-pa-ti-ku-nu
tgt: To Aššur-nādā, Šumma-libbi-Aššur and Alulaya from Adad-ṣulūlī: I had become indebted to Kudātum for 24 talents 10 minas of fine copper, but in Ulama my representatives paid Kudātum in full, and they produced my tablet concerning my debt and left it with Iddin-Aššur for safe-keeping. Today Iddin-Aššur refuses to release my tablet, for he says: "They deposited it here in connection with an inheritance." To prove that they did not deposit it in connection with an inheritance you must there seize 3 affiliated traders (to be witnesses) against Kudātum, and you must say: ''With respect to the 24 talents 10 minas of washed copper that Adad-ṣulūlī owed to you, did Adad-ṣulūlī pay you out Adad-ṣulūlī copper and satisfy you?" Set witnesses for him and then send me word with his answer as soon as possible. Alulaya knows the entire business. Let him inform you there.

src: 1 0.33333 ma-na 4 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er ISTAR-pa-li-il5 i-di-ISTAR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-di-a-sur a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su la is-qu-ul e-ra-ab-ma E DAM.GAR a-na bi-it-qa-tim a-la-qe-su-um IGI da-da DUMU DINGIR-mu-ta-bi-il5 IGI ba-zi-a IGI i-di-a-bi-im DUMU mu-ni-qi-im
tgt: Ištar-pālil owes 1/3 mina 4 hekels silver to Idī-Ištar. From the ḫamuštum of Iddin-Aššur he has 13 weeks to pay. Witnesses: Dad s. Ilī-mutabbil, Bazia, Iddin-Abim s. Muniqum.

src: 2.6666600000000003 ma-na 4.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR u 7 GIN KU.GI KI i-tur4-DINGIR
tgt: 2 minas 44 1/3 shekels silver and 7 shekels gold owed by Itūr-ilī.

src: 1.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-gu5-za i-ku-num i-su is-tu a-lim{ki} i-ku-num i tu-a-ri-su a-gu5-za <big_gap> KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab <big_gap> IGI PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU DINGIR-pi-la-ah IGI PUZUR4-ti-am-ti-im DUMU ISTAR-pa-li-il5
tgt: Aguza owes Ikūnum 1 mina 45 shekels refined silver. Aguza will pay the silver at Ikūnum's return from the city. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma ki-ma se-ep {d}ISKUR ra-pi-dim e-ti ra-hi-is u a-ta ta-da-la-ak a-pu-tum a-wa-at i-li u-su-ur a-na ni-ki-is-tim sa DINGIR i-si-ra-ku-ni la ta-tu-ar ta-tu-ar-ma ta-ha-li-iq AN.NA sa i-na tup-pi-im la-pu-ta-ku-ni i-na ni-ka-si le-es-ku-nu u a-ta 6 ma-na 8 GIN AN.NA ni-a-am i-na ni-ka-si su-ku-un 2 ma-na 13.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR zu-zu ha-bu-la-am 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-ti {d}UTU-ba-ni DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR 0.5 ma-na 5 GIN KU is-ti {d}en-LIL-ba-ni 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa ih-bu-la-ku-ni 0.5 ma-na sa a-sur-{d}UTU-si ub-la-ku-ni AN.NA-ak-su 8 ma-na u 6 ma-na AN.NA sa a-na ILLAT ta-sa-ku-nu le-qe-ma SU.NIGIN 14 ma-na 8 GIN AN.NA a-na se-er KU.BABBAR i-di-ma i-na a-li-ki-im ku-nu-uk-ma i-na e-ra-bi-ka-ma ki-ma su-ul-mi-ka se-bi4-la-am su-ma a-hi a-ta li-bi4 la tu-la-ma-an su-ma {d}UTU-ba-ni la-su 1 ma-na KU me-eh-ra-tim i-di-ma se-bi4-la-am a-pu-tum qa-ti a-na ni-ka-si i-ta-di
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā: As if by the foot of divine Adad in full rush my house is devastated! But as for you-- you have gone away! Please, please heed the words of the gods! Do not renounce the decision that the god has drawn up for you. If you renounce it, you will perish! The tin for which I was booked in the tablet, let them claim that at the accounting. Then you too may claim 6 minas 8 shekels of tin belonging to us at the accounting. Zuzu owes me 2 minas 13 1/3 shekels of silver. 1 mina of silver is owed by Šamaš-bāni son of Puzur-Ištar. 1/2 minas 5 shekels of silver is owed by Illil-bāni. The 1 mina of silver which he borrowed from you, the 1/2 mina which Aššur-šamšī has brought to you-in tin it was 8 minas--plus the 6 minas of tin that you will claim for the enterprise--take that, and then add in all If you are truly my brother, do not make me angry. If Šamaš-bāni is absent, then make available a corresponding amount of 1 mina of silver and send it to me. Please, let my share be deposited at the time of the accounting.

src: KISIB e-na-nim DUMU ki-zi KISIB a-ta-a-a DUMU bu-zi-a KISIB a-zu-wa KISIB a-ta-ah-su 16.5 GIN KU.BABBAR li-ti SIG5 i-se-er a-bu-sa-lim DUMU as-qu-dim sa-ra-bu-nu-wa i-su ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um da-di-a a-na ITU.5.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab
tgt: Abu-šalim s. Asqudim owes Šarra-bunua 16 1/2 shekels fine quality silver. Month: ḫu-bu-ur If he does not pay, 1 1/2 shekels silver per month interest he will add

src: a-na 0.33333 ma-na 2.5 GIN KU.BABBAR be-u-la-ti-su sa {d}UTU-tap-pa-i kur-ub-ISTAR i-se-e-su su-ma {d}UTU-tap-pa-i u DINGIR-ma-lik a-na si-mi-im ta-ad-nu a-na si-bi-su-nu e-ta-wu-u na-ni-a qa-ta-tum u u-su-pi-is-ku-um a-wi-lu-u a-ni-u-tum da-a-nu
tgt: For the 1/3 mina 2 1/2 shekels of silver, the working capital of Šamaš-tappā'ī Kurub-Ištar will sue him. If Šamaš-tappā'ī and Ilum-malik have sold (their working capitals), they will discuss with their witnesses. Nannia, Katātum and Uṣup-iškum, these men are the judges.
