wa-ah-su-sa-na a-na sa ki-ma i-di-a-bi4-im a-na a-bu-qar la is-ta-qal 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-tu a-lim{ki} i-na e-la-i-su hu-du-ur-la a-na i-di-a-bi4-im DUMU a-sur-DUG i-sa-qal IGI ma-num-ba-lum-a-sur DUMU en-um-a-sur IGI a-sur-ba-ni DUMU be-lum-na-da IGI le-di-is-ISTAR a-hi-su sa hu-du-ur-la 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su wa-si-su DIRI sa-du-a-su sa-bu i-di-a-bu-um DUMU a-sur-DUG a-na a-la-hi-im DUMU su-la-ba-an i-di-in-ma a ma-la gi5-mi-li-su-nu 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-tu a-lim{ki} i-na e-la-i-su a-na i-di-a-bi4-im DUMU a-sur-DUG a-la-hu-um DUMU su-la-ba-an i-sa-qal IGI i-li-a DUMU a-ta-a-a IGI a-mur-{d}UTU DUMU be-la-nim IGI pu-su-ke-en6 DUMU bu-za-zu 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa i-di-a-bu-um DUMU a-sur-DUG i li-bi bu-zu-ta-a DUMU la-qe-pi-im i-su-u is-tu a-lim{ki} i-na e-la-i-su KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal IGI su-be-lim DUMU i-si-im-su-en6 IGI DINGIR-mu-da-mi-iq DUMU su-be-lim IGI PUZUR-a-na DUMU DINGIR-na-da ITU.KAM te-i-na-tim li-mu-um DUG-a-sur DUMU u-zu-a 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i li-bi4 sal-mi-ISTAR DUMU {d}ISKUR-ba-ni i-di-a-bu-um DUMU a-sur-DUG i-su is-tu a-lim{ki} i-na e-la-i-su i-sa-qal IGI su-be-lim DUMU i-di-su-en6 IGI sal-mah DUMU dan-a-sur <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> KU.BABBAR i-di-<gap> <big_gap> <gap>-<gap>-DUG 1 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR <gap> <big_gap> IGI a-sur-ba-ni DUMU be-lum-na-da IGI bu-zu-ta-a DUMU la-qe-pi-im
tgt: Iddin-Abum s. Aššur-ṭāb gave 1 mina 15 shekels silver to Šalim-aḫum s. Dān-Aššur for management. He will pay at his ascension from the city. Iddin-abum s. Aššur-ṭāb will give to Šalim-aḫum s. Dān-Aššur separately 1 mina silver, his excise and exit tax added and he will pay 2 minas silver at his ascension from the city. In total, Šalim-aḫum will pay 3 minas silver to Iddin-abum at his ascension from the city, whether in Kanesh or Ḫattum wherever he meets him. Also, Šalim-aḫum will pay 1 mina ailver to Iddin-abum so that Iddin-abum s. Aššur-ṭāb will pay 2 minas silver to Šalim-aḫum s. Dān-Aššur at his ascension from the city. Witnesses: Iliya s. Attay, Al-aḫum s. Šū-Laban, Pūšu-kēn s. Buzāzu. He gave 2 minas refined silver to Ḫudurla s. Aššur-mālik as cash and Merali s. Ennum-Aššur will pay it to Idi-Aššur s. Aššur-ṭāb. If Merali does not pay the silver in Waḫšušana to Idī-abum's representative Abu-waqar, Ḫurdurla will pay Iddin-abum s. Aššur-ṭāb 3 minas silver at his ascension from the city. Witnesses: Mannum-bālum-Aššur s. Ennum-Aššur, Aššur-bāni s. Bēlum-nādā, Lediš-Ištar his brother. Witnesses: Iliya s. Attaya, Amur-Šamaš s. Bēlānim, Pūšu-kēn s. Buzazu. Witnesses: Šū-Bēlim s. Išim-Suen, Ilmu-damiq s. Šū-Bēlim, Puzur-Anna s. Ilī-nādā. Month: Teʾinātim. Eponymate: Ṭāb-Aššur s. Uzuwa. Šalim-Ištar s. Adad-bāni owes Iddin-abum s. Aššur-ṭāb 1 mina refined silver. He will pay at his ascension from the city. Witnesses: Šū-Bēlum s. Idī-Suen, Šalim-aḫum s. Dan+Aššur, ...

src: um-ma su-hu-bur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u en-um-a-sur qi-bi-ma a-na en-um-a-sur qi-bi-ma a-sa-me-ma 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-na lu-qu-ti-a a-ma-kam sa ki-ma i-a-ti i-qi-pu-ka su-ma a-hi a-ta u su-ma u4-mu-ka ITU.KAM u ITU.2.KAM a-hu-ru KU.BABBAR su-qu-ul-ma se-bi-lam gi-mi-lam i-na se-ri-a su-ku-un a-wi-il5 gi-mi-lim a-na-ku
tgt: From Šū-Ḫubur to Pūšu-kēn and Ennum-Aššur: To Ennam-Aššur: I hear that my representatives entrusted to you 10 minas silver (credit) from my goods there. If you are my brother and though your terms remain 1 or two months (more), pay the silver and send it to me. Do me this favor. I am a man of favors.

src: um-ma PUZUR4.ISTAR u id-na-a-ma a-na en-nam-a-sur qi-bi4-ma a-na URUDU sa pu-su-ke-en6 is-ti ma-ma-an la ta-ma-ga-ar um-ma PUZUR4.ISTAR i-na u-mi-im sa URUDU u-si-a-ni ti-i-ir-ta-ka li-li-kam-ma a-na-ku KU.BABBAR me-eh-ra-tim u-se-ba-lam um-ma id-na-a-ma a-na ku-a-im KU.BABBAR me-eh-ra-tim u-se-ba-la-am
tgt: From Puzur-Ištar and Idnaya to Ennam-Aššur: Regarding the copper belonging to Pūšu-kēn, do not come to an agreement with anyone. From Puzur Ištar: Let your message come on the (same) day when the copper goes out so that I myself may send the corresponding silver. From Idnaya: As for mine, I will send the corresponding silver.

src: 4 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um a-na is-ma-a-sur su-la-ba-an i-di-in KU.BABBAR is-ti is-ma-a-sur i-la-kam is-ti qa-qi-di-su ra-ki-is DAM.GAR u-la i-qi-a-ap u-la e-zi-ba-am is-tu li-mi-im pi-sa-ah-DINGIR a-na ku-zal-li i-la-kam su-ma la i-la-kam a-na 1 ma-na-im 1.25 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab IGI PUZUR4-sa-tu IGI u-su-ur-sa-a-sur DUMU ba-zi-a su-ma is-ti DUMU en-na-su-en6 mi-ma il5-te-qe am-tum i-ra-di-am su-ma la il5-te9-qe is-tu ni-na-mu-ru ha-ra-na-am is-te-et u-ka-sa-ad-ma am-tam sa ha-ra-an a-lim{ki} i-da-an IGI er-su-ma-lik
tgt: Witnesses: Puzur-saduʾe, Uṣur-ša-Aššur s. Bazia. Witness: Eršu-mālik.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u a-sur-ni-su qi-bi-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma i-ku-pi-a-ma 6 ANSE.HI.A 15 GU URUDU SIG5 mi-is-lu-um ma-si-um mi-is-lu-um ha-bu-ra-ta-i-um u su-ha-ru-a i-na ti-ta-tim de8-ku u URUDU-i i-tab-lu ra-di-am u ANSE-ri u-la ar-ti-si a-du-um URUDU-i-a u da-me sa su-ha-ri-a i-na tu-uh-pi-a wa-as-ba-ku a-sa-me-ma a-na a-lim{ki} sa-su-ha-ku a-di wa-ar-hi-im is-te-en6 DAM.GAR-ru-um 10 ma-na URUDU i-sa-qa-lam la KU.BABBAR 1 GIN a qa-ti-a ma-qi-it la URUDU 10 ma-na a qa-ti-a ma-qi-it-ma ANSE.HI.A a-sa-am a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta a-na ma-nim sa-nim la-ap-nu lu 4 ANSE.HI.A lu 5 ANSE.HI.A a-na u4-me pa-at-u-tim ki-ma ta-ta-na-di-nu di-na-ma ANSE.HI.A se-ri-a-ma a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum le-ru-ub-ma 1 GIN KU.BABBAR le-li-a-ma e-en6 a-sur sa-mi-ri u su-ma a-ta ANSE la ti-su is-ti a-hi-im li-qe-a-nim a-na ku-lu-ma-a qi-bi-ma te-er-ta-ka li-ba-al-ki-tam
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn and Aššur-nīšu, specifically to Pūšu-kēn, from Ikūn-pīya: With six donkeys and 15 talents fine copper--half washed and half ḫaburataum-style, my sons(/young men) were killed in DÍ-ta-tim. Also, they carried away my copper. And I cannot recover(?) the donkeys. Concerning my copper and the blood money of my sons/young men, I am staying in Tuḫpiya. I hear that I am summoned to court in the city. In one (more?) month, the merchant will pay out 10 minas copper. There is no silver. A shekel falls to my account. (But) there is no copper. Should 10 minas (silver) fall into my account, I will purchase donkesys My dear father and lord, to whom else can I turn? Give me 4 or 5 donkeys on long terms which you are wont to let out and rustle the donkeys so they arrive in Purušḫattum so that every shekel of silver may arise and the eye of Aššur may (smile on me?) And if you have no donkeys yourself, take some from a colleague. To Kulumaya: Let your message ...

src: 0.83333 ma-na 6.83334 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um i-se-er su-mi-a-bi4-a {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-nu-nu 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam i-na ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tum li-mu-um a-sur-SIG5 IGI ku-ra <big_gap> IGI is-ma-a-a IGI i-ku-pi-a-sur KU.BABBAR KU.BABBAR-ap DAM.GAR-ri-im
tgt: Šumī-abīya owes Ilabrat-bāni 56 5/6 shekels refined silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina (per month) as interest from the ḫamuštum of Šū-Nunu. Month: Qarrātum. Eponymate: Aššur-damiq. Witnesses: Kura, Išmāya, Ikūppī-Aššur. The silver belongs to the merchant.

src: um-ma da-di-a a-gi-a u a-sur-na-si-ir-ma a-na a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5 qi-bi-ma a-na-kam tup-pu-su sa ku-lu-ma-a ni-il5-pu-ut 12 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ku-lu-ma-a a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5 i-su is-tu ITU.KAM ti-i-na-tim li-mu-um en-na-su-in a-na 15 ha-am-sa-tim i ka-ni-is{ki} i-sa-qal su-ma i-na ma-la u4-mi-su i ka-ni-is{ki} KU.BABBAR la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab i-nu-ma KU.BABBAR ku-lu-ma-a i-sa-qu-lu tup-pa-am sa 12 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5 i-se-er ku-lu-ma-a a-na na-ru-qi-im i-na a-lim tup-pa-am su-a-ti u-sa-as-sum a-na 3 ma-na KU.GI sa is-ti um-me-a-ni i-na E i-di-a-bi-im i-na tup-pi-im sa na-ru-uq ku-lu-ma-a su-mi a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5 la-ap-tu a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5 a-na ku-lu-ma-a la i-tu-a-ar a-wa-tum a-ni-a-tum me-he-er tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im IGI i-di-ku-bi4-im DUMU a-sur-ma-lik IGI i-da-<gap>-na-ZU DUMU <big_gap>-ti-in IGI da-da-a-a DUMU a-a-li a-wi-lu-u a-ni-u-tum i tup-pi-su ha-ar-mi-im ka-an-ku tup-pa-am a-su-mi GAN-lim la se-tu-qi-im la nu-se-bi4-la-kum su-ma a-ma-kam sa-ak-sa-tim e-ta-wu-ma KU.BABBAR sa-qa-lam la i-mu-a <gap>-<gap> su-up-ra-ma a pi-i te-er-ti-ka tup-pa-am lu nu-se-bi4-la-kum
tgt: Kulumaya owes Aššur-mutabbil 12 minas refined silver. He will pay in Kanesh 15 weeks from the month of Teʾinātum eponymate of Enna-Suen . If he does not pay the silver in Kanesh at the fulfillment of his term, he will add interest at the colony rate.

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU su-en6-na-da KISIB su-ISTAR DUMU i-li-li KISIB a-sur-DU10 DUMU i-da sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-DU10 sa 2.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-DU10 a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-SIPA u la-qe-pi-im a-na 15 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM-im u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-DU10 DUMU i-da
tgt: Seals: Puzur-Aššur s. Suen-nādā, Šū-Ištar s. Ilili, Aššur-ṭāb s. Ida. Regarding the debt of Aššur-ṭāb. Aššur-ṭāb owes Aššur-rēʾī 2 1/2 minas refined silver. He will pay 15 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-rēʾī and Lāqēpim. If he does not pay on time, he will add the rate of the colony of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: KISIB {d}en-LIL-ba-ni DUMU GAL-a-sur KISIB LUGAL-{d}ISKUR DUMU nu-ur-su 12 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er LUGAL-{d}ISKUR DUMU nu-ur-su DAM.GAR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ha-na-a ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um e-na-su-en6 DUMU su-a-sur a-na 8 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab
tgt: Seals: Enlil-bāni s. Rab-Aššur, Šar-Adad s. Nūr-Suen. Šar-Adad s. Nūr-Suen owes the merchant 12 shekels refined silver. He will pay 8 weeks from ḫamuštum of Ḫanaya, month Kuzalli, eponymate Enna-Suen s. Šū-Aššur. If he does not pay, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: a-na a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU en-na-nim qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6 5 GU 20 ma-na a-wi-it-ka 5.66666 ma-na 5 GIN.TA da-tum sa a-di ka-ni-is 30.66666 ma-na da-tum ik-su-dam 15 GIN qa-qa-ad sa-ri-dim 0.5 ma-na ta-si-a-tum sa SA.TU 0.5 ma-na as-ru-ka u-ku-ul-ti sa-ri-dim 8 ma-na ni-is-ha-tum sa E.GAL-lim 11.33333 ma-na mu-ta su-uq-la-ti-ka u AN.NA qa-ti-ka <gap> i-na 4 GU 40 ma-na qa-tum AN.NA-ak qa-ti-ka 51 ma-na 15 GIN gam-ra-am u-sa-he-er-ma 3 GU 48.66666 ma-na 5 GIN AN.NA-ka iz-ku-am SA.BA 1 GU i-li-a-lum il5-qe 1 GU 2 ma-na 15 GIN lu-lu il5-qe 9 GIN.TA 6.83333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR-ap-ka SA.BA 7.66666 GIN sa-du-a-tam a-na kur-ub-ISTAR a-di-in si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-ka 6.66666 ma-na 8 0.33333 GIN ku-nu-ki-a kur-ub-ISTAR na-as-a-kum 1 GU 46.5 ma-na AN.NA sa iz-ku-a-ni i li-bi4-a i-na 10 {TUG}ku-ta-ni-ka lu ni-is-ha-tum lu si-mu-um 9 TUG iz-ku-u-nim u 8 TUG su-ru-tim sa li-wi-tim a qa-ti-ku-nu a E ka-ri-im a-di si-tam a-sur-SIPA i-di i-na 5.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa ha-bu-la-ku-ni 0.66666 ma-na ar-nu-um lu sa 6 GIN AN.NA-ki-ka lu TUG-ba-ti-ka E ka-ri-im as-qul si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-ka 4.66666 ma-na 4 GIN i li-bi4-a si-tap-ku-um E ka-ri-im i-ba-si-ma a si-a-ti KU.BABBAR-ap-ka ak-la um-ma a-na-ku-ma su-ru-ni-um ma-e i se-ri-su-nu la i-sa-ti <big_gap> ma <big_gap>
tgt: To Aššur-imittī son of Ennānim, thus Pūšu-kēn: Your awītum valuation is 5 talents 20 minas. The dātum tax up to Kaneš is 5 2/3 minas at a 5 shekel rate. A dātum assessment fell at 30 2/3 minas (tin?) . The head-tax on the drivers was 15 shekels. The tašiatum of the ŠA.TU was 1/2 mina. The AŠ-a-dum feed of the drivers was 1/2 mina. The excise-tax of the palace was 8 minas. The deficiencies of your packs (and your hand tin?) was 11 1/3 minas. X from 4 talents 40 minas together with your hand tin- 51 minas 15 shekels was expended. I deducted it and they cleared 3 talents 48 minas and 45 shekels of your tin. Thereof, Ilī-ālim took 1 talent. Lulu took 1 talent 2 minas 15 shekels. At a 9 shekel rate, your silver was 6 minas 55 shekels. Thereof, I gave Kurub-Ištar 7 2/3 shekels for the shipping charges. The remainder of your silver is 6 minas 40 shekels. Kurub-Ištar brings you 1/3 shekels under my seal. 1 talent 46 minas of tin which they cleared, is in my charge. From your 10 kutānum textiles, both the excise tariff and the purchases (tithe) tariff, they cleared 9 textiles. Then 8 šurūtum textiles from the wrappings a deposited at the colony office to your account. Aššur-rē'ī deposited the remainder. From the 5 1/2 minas silver which I owe, 2/3 minas is a fine. Both that of the 6 shekels of your tin and your textiles I paid (to/at) the colony office. 4 2/3 minas 4 shekels (from my own funds?) is the remainder of your silver. There was a "depositing" at the colony office and (to?) it I withheld your silver. (I said), "The šuruniʾum will not *drink water from their backs."

src: KISIB PUZUR-i-li DUMU DINGIR-is-ti-kal KISIB wa-si-pu-ur-su KISIB a-sur-re-si KISIB ta-ri-ku-ta-sa 2.75 GIN AN.NA su-ma <big_gap> la i-ta <big_gap> 1 GU URUDU SIG5 u 2 GIN KU.BABBAR ta-ri-ku-ta a-na a-sur-du-ri u-ta-ar is-tu ha-mus-tim sa kur-ub-ISTAR na-bi-su-en6 DUMU PUZUR4-<gap> <big_gap>
tgt: Seals: Puzur-ilī s. DINGER-iš-tí-kàl, wa-sí-pu-ur-šu, Aššur-rēsī, ta-ri-ku-ta-ša.

be-li-a-lim u DUMU ku-um-ri-im a-pu-ul 3 LA 0.25 GIN KU.BABBAR is-tu sa-du-u-tum gam-ra-at-ni a-na ISTAR-pi-la-ah u DUMU ir-nu-it a-pu-ul 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-si-im 2 GU4.HI.A u u-ti-tim a-na me-er-e sa-ku-li-im ag-mu-ur si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-ka 3 ma-na 0.66666 GIN i-na li-bi4 5 ma-na 1 GIN KU.BABBAR lu-qu-tim sa se-ep en-nam-be-lim u-sa-he-er si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-a 2 ma-na 0.33333 GIN i-na pa-ne-e-ma se-bi4-lam li-ba-ka la tu-la-ma-an a-na a-wi-li ah-sa-ah-ma al-qe
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā: You left me 3 2/3 minas of silver; 1 mina 1/2 shekel of silver belongs to Šū-Ištar; 2 minas less 1/2 shekel of silver you sent to me with Ištar-pilah; Dān-Aššur brought me 1 1/3 mina of refined silver--in all: 8 minas. Thereof I sent off to you goods worth 2 minas 16 2/3 shekels less 7 1/2 grains with Aššur-nādā son of Irnuid; I further gave him 2 1/4 shekels, the wages of a donkey-driver. 16 1/2 shekels of silver to Šū-Suen (and) 4 1/2 shekels to Asqūdia-- I gave to them, they are bound by contract. If they have no claims on you, they must repay you in tin at the rate 16: 1. Also Aššur-rē'ī has been bound by contract (at the rate) 16:1 in tin for your remaining claim on him. Seize him to have him pay. After the price of the copper and 1 shekel 15 grains of silver, which he owed to you, had been paid, I paid as balance to Aššur-rē'ī 23 shekels 22 1/2 grains of silver. 1/3 mina of silver, the price of a donkey, I paid to Uṣur-ša-Aššur. The day you left you took 5 minas of scrap metal worth 4 shekels of silver. The export duty was 1/2 shekel 15 grains; you wrote me about it, and I added it. As to the 5 1/2 minas of silver carried by Ennam-Aššur, 3 shekels were found to be missing during the check, but I forgot to charge it to you at the accounting. 2 sheep belonging to Pidaya's son: 5 1/2 mina; 1 sheep worth 1 5/6 mina belonging to Iddin-ilum; 1 sheep: 3 minas, 1 sheep 2 1/3 minas 5 shekels, 1 sheep: 2 minas 10 shekels belonging to Aššur-rē'ī; 1 sheep worth 2 1/3 minas belonging to Zua; 1 sheep worth 2 2/3 minas belonging to Dunnia; 1 sheep worth 3 1/3 minas--the same Dunnia's eldest son. You forgot 1 textile worth 8 2/3 minas belonging to Aššur-ṭab, so I paid. The total in copper: 32 minas less 5 shekels, in silver: 1/3 mina less 5/6 shekels, I have paid as the price of the textile and the sheep which you forgot about. I paid as compensation 1[+ x] shekels after the transport tariff on your silver transported by Bēlī-ālum and the son of the priest. After the transport tariff had been spent I paid as compensation 3 less 1/4 shekels of silver to Ištar-pilah and Irnuid's son. 1 mina of silver I spent on the price of 2 oxen and grain to feed the sons. The rest of your silver: 2 minas 2/3 shekels, I deducted from the 5 minas 1 shekel of silver, the shipment transported by Ennam-Bēlum; send the rest of my silver, 2 minas 1/3 shekels as soon as possible. Do not be angry. I wanted it for the men, so I took it.

src: a-na a-sur-na-da <gap> u u-sur-sa-a-sur qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku-ma si-li-a-ni sa tup-pe pi-te-a-ma tup-pa-am ha-ar-ma-am sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-na-da DUMU ah-sa-lim sa 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR di-na-su-um a-na-kam KU.BABBAR sa-bu-a-ku su-ma a-sur-na-da la i-li-kam a-ta u a-sur-na-da tup-pi pi-te-a-ma tup-pu-su di-su-ma u ki-la-la-ku-nu ku-un-ka su-ma TUG.HI.A a-na E ka-ri-im si-ta-ap-kum i-ba-si TUG.HI.A sa e-zi-bu a qa-ti a-bi-ni i-da su-ma KU.BABBAR si-ta-ap-ku-um i-ba-si te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam-ma KU.BABBAR lu-se-bi4-lam
tgt: To Aššur-nādā (and) Uṣur-ša-Aššur from Aššur-taklāku: Open the tablet containers and give the certified tablet regarding the debt of Aššur-nādā, the son of Ah-šalim, of 1 mina of silver to him. I have been paid the silver in full here. If Aššur-nādā has not come, then you and Aššur-nādā must open (for) the tablets and give him his tablet, and after that you both must seal (the container). If there is a possibility for šitapku-investments of textiles in the colony office, then deposit on our father's account the textiles which I have left. If there is a possibility for šitapku-investments of silver, then send me word so I can send you silver.

src: um-ma su-hu-bur u me-er-u a-sur-i-mi-ti-ma a-na bu-zu-ta-a pu-su-ke-en6 u im-di-DINGIR qi-bi-ma tup-pa-am sa a-lim{ki} a-na i-ku-nim DUMU sa-ma-a a-na e-bu-bi-su a-na-kam ni-il5-qe-ma tup-pa-am sa a-lim{ki} PUZUR4-i-li DUMU il5-ba-ni ra-bi-is-ni na-as-a-ku-nu-ti a-ma-kam i-na sa-ha-at PUZUR4-i-li ra-bi-si-ni i-zi-za-a-ma i-ku-nam a-na na-ru-qi-su e-bi-ba-su-ma ki-ma a-wi-lam tu-bi-ba-a-ni te-er-ta-ku-nu is-ti a-li-ki-im pa-nim-ma li-li-kam-ma a-na-kam i-na mi-ma i-ku-num i-su-u-ni sal-sa-ti-su lu ne-mu-su-ma lu ni-il5-qe u tup-pu-su ha-ar-ma-am sa ku-nu-ki-su sa ki-ma e-bi-bu-ni li-qe-a-nim
tgt: From Šū-Ḫubur and the sons of Aššur-imittī to Buzutāya, Pūšu-kēn and Imdī-ilum: We received here the tablet of the city concerning Ikūnum son of Samāya and his clearing and Puzur-ilī son of Il-bāni our attorney brings the tablet of the city to you (pl.). There, assist Puzur-ilī our attorney to clear Ikūnum concerning his Also, take a sealed tablet with his seal from when they clear (him).

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti ta-ri-is-ma-tum u be-la-tum-ma 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR PUZUR4-a-sur ub-lam SA.BA 1 me-at 75 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 16.83333 ma-na 3 GIN KU.BABBAR it-bu-lu 30 ma-na AN.NA-ak qa-tim 13 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR-ap-su 3 ma-na 18.5 GIN 6 ANSE sa-la-mu 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR it-bu-lu 0.33333 ma-na LA 1 GIN u-nu-ut ANSE 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR te-su-pe PUZUR4-a-sur il5-qe 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR il5-ba-ni il5-qe a-ma-kam lu-ta-er 12 GIN i-sar-be-li il5-qe a-ma-kam lu-ta-er 0.33333 ma-na 7 GIN be-u-la-at be-li-li 10 GIN <gap> zi tum i-na lu-qu-tim a-ni-ti-im 2 me-at 13 ku-ta-ni 2 ANSE u u-nu-su-nu a-gu-a DUMU PUZUR4-a-sur i-ra-de8-a-ku-um 52 ku-ta-ni 2 ANSE u u-nu-su-nu PUZUR4-a-sur i-ra-de8-a-ku-um KU.BABBAR-pi <big_gap> <gap>-um su-ma <gap> <big_gap> gi-mi-la-am E a-bi-ni su-qu-ul <gap> i-hi-id-ma KU.BABBAR sa a-ma-kam u sa lu-qu-tim sa e-li-a-ku-ni se-bi-lam KU.BABBAR a-na qa-te-e me-er-e a-sur-ma-lik la tu-sa-ar KU.BABBAR sa a-la-hi-im ni-il5-qe-ma hu-bu-lu-um sa a-sur-ma-lik sa-bu-u mi-ma la i-ri-ih
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Aššur-imittī, Tariš-mātum, and Bēlātum: Puzur-Aššūr brought 20 minas silver. Thereof, 175 kutānum-textiles were worth 16 minas 53 shekels silver. 30 minas hand tin, at a rate of 13 shekels (per shekel silver), its silver was 3 minas 18 1/2 shekels. 6 black donkeys, they cost 2 minas silver. The gear of the donkey was 19 shekels. Puzur-Aššur took additional costs amounting to 20 shekels silver. Il-bāni took 20 shekels silver. Let him return it there (?) Išar-bēlī took 12 shekels. Let him return it there (?) 27 shekels, the beʾulātum of Belili, 19 shekels ... zi-tum. From these goods 213 kutānum-textiles, 2 donkeys, and their gear, Agua son of Puzur-Aššūr will bring to you. Puzur-Aššur brings to you 52 kutānum-textiles and 2 donkeys and their gear. silver ... if ... weigh out as a favor to the house of our father. Take care to send the silver which is there and that which arises to you from the merchandise. Do not release the silver to the accounts of the sons of Aššur-mālik. We received the silver of Al-aḫum but the debt which Aššur-mālik fulfilled he did not riḫ whatsoever.

src: a-na 13 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa a-sur-na-da DUMU su-{d}EN.LIL ha-bu-la-ni en-um-a-sur a-hu-su pu-su-ke-en6 u bu-si-a u-sa-zi-za-am um-ma su-ut-ma su-ma KU.BABBAR a-di ITU.KAM u 2 ITU.KAM la us-ta-ak-si-id er-ba-ma E DAM.GAR KU.BABBAR le-qe-a-ma KU.BABBAR a si-ib-tim u si-ba-su di-na-sum IGI sa-lim-a-sur DUMU i-su-ri-ik IGI zu-ba DUMU ISTAR-pa-li-il5 ha-mus-tum8 sa a-su u a-mur-ISTAR
tgt: Witnesses: Šalim-Aššur s. Issu-rīk, Zupa s. Ištar-pālil

src: um-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU i-ku-pi-a qi-bi-ma a-na a-sur-i-mi-ti qi-bi-ma 1 GU 5 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ki-a u 2 TUG su-ru-tim <big_gap> i-a-am <big_gap> a-ta u <big_gap> a-na su-a-sur DUMU a-la-hi-im <big_gap> a-hu-u-a a-tu-nu a-ma-kam i-na KU.BABBAR sa su-a-sur sa AN.NA-ki-a u TUG.HI-ti-a KU.BABBAR le-qe-a-ma ku-un-ka-ma i pa-nim-ma se-bi-la-nim a-pu-tum ih-da
tgt: From Aššur-imittī to Pūšu-kēn and Aššur-imittī s. Ikūn-piya: To Aššur-imittī: 1 talent 5 minas tin under my seal and 2 black textiles ... mine (PN carries/d to you?) As for you and PN, [approach/sieze] Šu-Aššur s. Al-aḫum. My dear brothers, Take ... there from the silver of Šū-Aššur pertaining to my tin and textiles, and seal it and send it immediately. Urgent, take care to do it!

src: 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-na me-si-it e-la-tim i-na e-la-at su-ku-bi-im DUMU qa-a-tim i-na E ka-ri-im a-la-qe
tgt: I will take 1/3 mina silver from the fund of the caravan from the caravan do Šū-Kūbum s. Qaʾatum at the colony office.

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur KISIB a-sur-GAL KISIB a-la-bi4-im KISIB ba-a-a sa hu-bu-ul ba-a-a 7.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-tu ha-mus-tim sa kur-ub-ISTAR u a-la-hi-im a-na 37 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul ba-a-a
tgt: Seals: Puzur-Aššur, Aššur-rabi, Al-abim, Baya. Regarding Baya's debt of 7 1/2 minas refined silver. He will pay 37 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Kurub-Ištar and Al-aḫim. If he does not pay on time, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u i-na-a qi-bi-ma um-ma su-ku-bu-um-ma 2 GU 20 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 35 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 18 ma-na AN.NA qa-tim 2 ANSE sa-la-me u e-nu-su-nu 0.33333 ma-na <gap>-<gap> be-u-la-at a-mur-{d}UTU a-na be-u-la-ti-su 3 {TUG}ku-ta-nu a-ha-ma dar-ku-u mi-ma a-nim a-ta-ta i-ra-de8-a-ku-nu-ti a-hu-a a-tu-nu AN.NA u TUG.HI.A mi-is-la li-qe-a-ma KU.BABBAR me-eh-ra-tim i ra-mi-ni-ku-nu ki-ma ta-ga-mi-la-ni-ni id-a-ma KU.BABBAR i se-ep i-na-a li-li-kam li-bi4 la i-la-mi-in su-ma AN.NA u TUG.HI.A la ta-la-qe-a-ma la ta-ga-mi-la-ni lu a-na i-ta-at-lim lu a-na u4-me pa-ti-u-tim lu a-na u4-me qur-bu-tim di-na-ma a-li ba-la-ti-a ep-sa-ma u te-er-ta-ku-nu li-li-kam a-na i-na-a qi-bi4-ma a-se-er na-as-pa-ra-tim sa i se-ep pu-su-ke-en6 u-la-pi-ta-ku-ni mi-nam ha-bu-la-ku-ni-ma sa se-pi-ka wa-ar-ki-tim si-im e-ma-ri-a ta-ak-la-su i se-ep i-li-a la tu-se-bi4-lam a-na na-as-pa-ra-tim sa se-ep pu-su-ke-en6 i-hi-id i-na a-la-ki-ka la ta-qa-bi4 um-ma a-ta-ma mi-su-um uz-ni la tap-te
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn and Innāya from Šū-Kūbum: 2 talents 20 minas of tin sealed, 35 kutānum-textiles, 18 minas of hand tin, 2 black donkeys, and their gear, 1/3 minas silver--the be'ulātum-loan of Amur-Šamaš, 3 kutānum-textiles for his be'ulātum loan which are packed up separately, all this, Atata drives to you. My dear brothers, take half of the tin and textiles and deposit the corresponding silver from your own funds as a favor to me and let the silver come in the šēpum of Innāya. If you will not take the tin and textiles and not do me a favor, sell (them) either for cash or on long or short term credit so that I make a profit and let your message come here. To Innaya: In addition to the message which I wrote to you in the caravan of Pūšu-kēn, what do I owe you, seeing as in your last šēpum you withheld the price of my donkeys and you did not send it in Iliya's šēpum? Pay attention to the letters in Pūšu-kēn's šēpum. Do not say at your arrival, "Why did you not inform me?"

src: la-qe-pu-um MASKIM sa a-lim{ki} a-na me-er-e pu-su-ke-en6 is-ba-at-ni-a-ti-ma um-ma MASKIM-ma a-na me-er-e pu-su-ke-en6-ma a ma-la tup-pi-im sa a-lim{ki}-ma a-nim i-na a-lim{ki} is-ti be-el a-wa-ti-ku-nu a-ta-wu um-ma me-er-u pu-su-ke-en6 nu-us-ka-in a-na tup-pi-im sa a-lim{ki} u MASKIM sa be-li-ni ni-za-ku-ma ni-la-kam-ma a-na be-el a-wa-ti-ni a-wa-tam ni-da-an IGI il5-ba-ni DUMU a-mur-a-sur IGI i-ku-pi-a DUMU su-ISTAR IGI i-na-su-en6 DUMU e-na-nim DUMU a-mu-a
tgt: Lā-qēpum, the mayor of the city, seized us against the sons of Pūšu-kēn and the mayor said to the sons of Pūšu-kēn, "According to the tablet of the city, this in the city with the chief of your(pl.) case I will speak." The sons of Pūšu-kēn said, "We will establish it. We will clear regarding the tablet of the city and the mayor of our lord and we will come and give the case to the lord of our case." Witnesses: Ilī-bāni s. Amur-Aššur, Ikuppiya s. Šū-Ištar, Enna-Suen s. Ennānum s. Amāya(Amuwa).

src: KISIB sa-lim-a-sur KISIB a-su KISIB a-sur-be-el-ma-al-ki-im sa hu-bu-ul a-su 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa a-sur-SIPA is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ka-si-im a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM-im u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-su
tgt: Seals: Šalim-Aššur, Ašu, Aššur-bēl-malkim. Regarding the Ašu's debt of 5 minas refined silver to Aššur-rēʾī. He will pay 13 weeks from the ḫamuštum of kaššim. If he does not pay on time, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma i-ku-pi-a-ma 50 GU URUDU si-kam a-ka-sa-da-ku-um ki <big_gap><gap> um-ma a-na-ku-ma ANSE.HI.A i-la-tim u-nu-su-nu u e-ri-qa-tim tur4-da-am <gap>-<gap>-ti 3 ma-na URUDU ma-as-am u e-wa-sa-tim i-di-{d}UTU sa a-ni-nim ub-la-kum
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Ikūn-pīya: I will bring 50 talents of šikkum copper to you. ... I said, "Dispatch the donkeys of the caravan, their gear and the wagons." ... Idī-Šamaš of(?)(something is missing here) Anninum brings to you 3 minas washed copper and ewazātum.

src: a-na sa-lim-a-hi-im qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma is-tu <gap> <gap>-zu-ka sa 15 ma-na.TA <gap> <gap>-ni 5.5 {TUG}ku-ta-ni <gap> ip-la-ah ta-nim i-ri-hu-nim <big_gap> GIN KU.BABBAR <big_gap> bi a-se-er <big_gap> <gap> ta-nim <big_gap> a-sur <big_gap> <gap> SA.BA <gap> <big_gap> <gap> zi-ka sa 15 ma-na.TA <gap> ma-na a-na sa 15 ma-na.TA-ma as-qul 1 ma-na a-na wa-ar-ki-u-tim as-qul 2 ma-na a-na DUMU i-de-i-ISTAR as-qul 3 ma-na 15 GIN a-na sa ki-ma PUZUR4-a-na as-qul 5 GIN KU.BABBAR a-se-er 15 GIN sa ka-sa-ri-ka ga-me-er 3 GIN a pa-zu-ur-ti {TUG}ku-si-a-ti-ka as-qul SU.NIGIN 1 GU 22 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-wi-ti-ka 1.3333300000000001 ma-na 2 GIN <gap> <big_gap> DUMU <big_gap> 1.3333300000000001 <big_gap>
tgt: To Šalim-aḫum from Pūšu-kēn: I paid out (another) mina later. I paid out 2 minas to the son of Idī-Ištar. I paid out 3 minas 15 shekels to the representative of Puzur-Anna. 5 shekels toward the 15 shekels for your packerare settled. I paid 3 shekels for the smuggled goods-your robes. Altogether 1 talent 22 minas silver, your assessment, 1 mina 22 shekels ... son ... 1 1/3 .....

src: 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-na se-er na-hi-is-tim u ISTAR-la-ma-si a-sur-na-da i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa da-la-as u tu-uh-ni-is 1 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ba en-nam-ISTAR e-ru-ba-tu-a IGI a-zu-a-a IGI i-di-a-bi-im IGI i-di-su-en6
tgt: Naḫištum and Ištar-lamasī owe Aššur-nādā 1/3 mina silver. They will add 1 shekel per month as interest from the ḫamuštum-week of Dalaš and Tuḫniš. Ennam-Ištar is my guarantor. Witnesses: Azua, Idī-abum, Idī-Suen.

src: ku-si-a a-na dan-a-sur is-ba-at-ni-a-ti-ma um-ma ku-si-a-ma a-na dan-a-sur-ma a-hi a-ta 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa i-na a-wa-ti-ni a-na DUMU er-ra-a ta-du-nu-ma a-na a-lim{ki} i-lu-ku-ma ne-ma-al KU.BABBAR DUMU er-ra-a e-ku-lu-ma a-ta si-ma-at-ka ta-la-qe-u KU.BABBAR di-na-am-ma a-na DUMU er-ra-a a-na-ku la-zi-iz u KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na a-na se-er KU.BABBAR a-nim ra-di-a-ma a-wa-ti-ni is-ti ku-da-dim la-ag-mur dan-a-sur nu-sa-hi-it-ma a-na se-er 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR nu-ra-di-ma ku-si-a a-na DUMU er-ra-a u ku-da-dim i-za-az um-ma dan-a-sur-ma KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na lu tu-us-te-zi-ba-ni gam-ri a-a-kam a-la-qe um-ma ku-si-a-ma KU.BABBAR sa DUG-si-la-a-sur DUMU PUZUR4-{d}MUS 14.5 GIN li-qe a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim wa-ba-ar-tum sa u-pe i-di-in-ni-a-ti-ma IGI GIR sa a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in IGI pi-la-ah-a-sur DUMU a-sur-{d}UTU-si IGI a-sur-na-da DUMU su-{d}EN.LIL su-ma-a tap-pa-i-ni
tgt: Kuṣiya seized us against Dān-Aššur. Kuṣiya said to Dān-Aššur, "My dear brother, the three minas silver which you gave to the son of Erraya in our matter and which went to the city and which the son of Erraya consumed the profit of the silver and you took your share, give me the silver so that I can divide it(?) to the son of Erraya. Also, add add about a mina of silver to this silver so that I can pay off our matter with Kudādum." We ... Dān-Aššur and for 3 minas silver we added 1 mina silver and Kūṣiya settled with the son of Erraya and Kudādum. Dān-Aššur said, " Kuṣuiya said, "Take the silver belonging to Ṭāb-šilla-Aššur s. Puzur-Niraḫ, 14 1/2 shekels. The wabartum of Upe gave us witnesses for the matter and we gave our testimonies before the dagger of Aššur. Witnesses: Pilaḫ-Aššur s. Aššur-šamšī, Aššur-nādā s. Šū-Enlil, Šumaya our partner.

src: a-na im-di-DINGIR <gap> <gap>-a u DAM.GAR qi-bi4-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma 1.3333300000000001 ma-na KU.GI u 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa DAM.GAR sa i-di-na-ni 1 ma-na KU.GI 8.5 GIN.TA KU.BI4 8.5 ma-na 0.33333 ma-na KU.GI 8.83333 GIN.TA KU.BI 2.5 ma-na 3.33333 GIN SU.NIGIN 21 ma-na 3.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR qa-dum 10 ma-na SA.BA 0.83333 ma-na 2.5 GIN ni-is-ha-tum 0.33333 ma-na 1 GIN sa-du-a-tum 10 GIN wa-si-tum si-ti KU.BABBAR 19.5 ma-na 7 0.5 GIN 3 GU 37.5 ma-na AN.NA 14.5 GIN.TA KU.BI 15 ma-na 3 GU 15 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku <gap> 22.5 ma-na a-na AN.NA qa-tim ta-di-in 6 TUG sa li-wi-tim 1.5 ma-na 7 0.5 GIN it-bu-lu 1.5 ANSE sa-la-mi-im 0.5 ma-na 6 GIN KU.BI4 su-nu 2.5 GIN u-nu-su-nu 1 GIN u-ku-ul-ta-su-nu si-ti KU.BABBAR 3.33333 ma-na 1.5 GIN SA.BA 0.33333 ma-na mu-su-ka-u
tgt: To Imdi-ilum, ...-a, and the merchant from Pūšu-kēn: 1 1/3 minas of gold and 10 minas of silver belonging to the merchant which he gave (at a rate of) 1 minas of gold at 8 1/2 shekels each is its value - 8 1/2 minas of - 1/3 minas of gold - 8 5/6 minas shekels each it values 2 1/2 minas (silver) - 2 1/2 minas 3 1/2 shekels -- all together 21 mians 3 1/2 shekels of silver - together with 10 minas (of silver) - thereof 52 1/2 shekels (of silver) its excise, and 21 shekels shipping -- 10 shekels exit-tax the remainder of the silver 19 1/2 minas 7 1/2 shekels. 3 talents 37 1/2 minas tin at 14 1/2 shekel (rate) its value 15 mians silver, 3 talents 15 mians tin under seal (with) 12 minas hand tin is sold. 6 textiles for wrappings - their value 1 1/2 minas 1/2 shekel, 1 1/2 black donkeys - their value 36 shekels, 2 1/2 shekels (for) their gear, 1 shekel for their fodder, the remainder of the silver - 3 1/3 minas 1 1/2 shekels - thereof 1/3 minas is poor quality (silver).

src: KISIB i-tur4-DINGIR DUMU a-mur-ISTAR KISIB a-la-bi-im KISIB zu-zu sa hu-bu-ul zu-zu 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa a-sur-SIPA is-tu ha-mus-tim sa su-ka-li-a u u-ra-a a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab KISIB GAL-a-sur DUMU i-ba-a KISIB ku-bi-na-da DUMU bu-ka-na-a-a KISIB a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU a-mur-lu-su KISIB zu-u-zu DUMU ku-la sa hu-bu-ul zu-u-zu DUMU ku-la 9 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er zu-u-zu DUMU ku-la me-er-u a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-na-da u e-me-me ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um su-hu-bu-ur DUMU e-la-li 1 ma-na.TA i-na sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at 2 tup-pe-e ha-ru-mu-tim sa hu-bu-ul zu-zu-u DUMU ku-la
tgt: Seals: Itūr-ilī s. Amur-Ištar, Al-abum, Zuzu. Regarding the debt of Zuzu, 5 minas refined silver belonging to Aššur-rēʾī. He will pay 10 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Sukkalliya and Uraya. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Seals: Rabi-Aššur s. Ibāya, Kubi-nādā s. Buknaya, Aššur-imittī s. Amur-lussu, Zuzu s. Kula. Regarding the debt of Zuzu s. Kula, Zuzu s. Kula owes the sons of Aššur-rēʾī 9 minas refined silver. He will pay one mina one year from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-nādā and Ememe, month Ḫubur, eponymate Šū-Ḫubur s. Elālī. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest. This memorandum is a copy of two sealed tablets concerning the debt of Zuzu s. Kula.

src: KISIB en-um-a-sur DUMU <big_gap> KISIB a-sur-dan DUMU <big_gap> KISIB MI-{d}ISKUR DUMU na-ab-su-en6 sa 1 ma-na 4.66666 GIN 10 SE sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er si-li-{d}ISKUR su-ku-bu-um i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa e-la-ma u su-ku-bi-im ITU.KAM ab-sa-ra-ni li-mu-um a-al-DUG a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM-im u-sa-ab
tgt: Silli-Adad owes Šū-Kūbum 1 mina 4 2/3 shekels 10 grains refined silver. He will pay 10 weeks from ḫamuštum of Elamma and Šū-Kūbim, month Ab šarrānē, eponymate Āl-ṭāb. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest).

src: 7 GU 50 ma-na a-wi-it pu-su-ke-en6 8 GU 17 ma-na a-wi-it a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim 1 GU 0.5 ma-na LA+0.5 GIN sa-hu-ur-ma 22 ma-na 4 GIN AN.NA a-la-qe
tgt: 7 talents 50 minas - the assessment of Pūšu-kēn. 8 talents 17 minas - the assessment of Aššur-bēl-awātim. 1 talent 1/2 mina less 1/2 shekel is deducted and I will take 22 minas 4 shekels.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma 16 ma-na KU.BABBAR e-la ub-lam 16 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-di-su-en6 ub-lam SA.BA 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-mu-ru-um ne-pi-sa-am sa i-di-su-en6 ub-la-ni IGI ku-lu-ma-a ap-tu-ur-ma 0.33333 ma-na 0.66666 GIN KU.BABBAR ba-ti-iq sa-ab-ra-tum ra-bi4-a i-na mi-ta-hu-ri-im e ta-li-ib 3.33333 GIN a-na ni-is-ha-at ni-is-ha-tim a-di-in 10.83333 ma-na 4.16666 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na lu-qu-tim sa a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku ir-de8-ku-ni as-qu-ul 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 10 ma-na AN.NA-ak qa-tim KU.BABBAR-ap-su 10 ma-na 4.66666 GIN 10 TUG.HI.A 0.5 ma-na 3.33333 GIN it-bu-lu 17 GIN lu si-im ANSE lu u-ku-ul-tu-su u 2 GIN KU.BABBAR <gap>-<gap> a-na e-<gap>-<gap> <gap> 2 GIN u-nu-ut ANSE 5 GIN wa-si-tum 1 TUG ka-ab-tum a-ha-ma sa a-zi-a mi-ma a-nim ku-nu-ki-a e-la i-ra-de8-a-kum si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-ka 9.5 ma-na 6.5 GIN 2 GU 7 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 9 ma-na AN.NA-ak qa-tim 15 LAL 0.16666 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR-ap-su 9 ma-na 10 GIN 0.33333 ma-na si-im ANSE 5 GIN wa-si-tum 1 GIN u-nu-ut ANSE mi-ma a-nim ku-nu-ki-a ku-lu-ma-a i-ra-de8-a-kum KU.BABBAR sa se-ep e-la u i-di-su-en6 gam-ra-kum sa sa-ri-dim a-na ku-lu-ma-a la a-di-in 1 {TUG}ku-ta-nim sa a-zi-a ku-lu-ma-a na-as-a-kum 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa i-lu-a e-la ub-lam 1.25 GIN ni-is-ha-tim a-di-in 14 LAL 0.33333 GIN.TA 6.5 ma-na 3 GIN AN.NA ri-ik-su i li-bi4 su-uq-li-ka na-di ku-lu-ma-a i-ra-de8-a-kum
tgt: Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: Ela brought 16 minas silver. Idi-Suen brought 16 minas silver. Thereof, 2/3 minas 'inspected' silver, a bag which Idi-Suen brought, I opened in the presence of Kulumaya, and 20 2/3 shekels silver were deficient. The lumps? were too large. It must not bear it in the repeated reception. I gave 3 1/3 shekels for the nisḫat nisḫatum. I paid 10 minas 54 1/6 shekels for the goods which Aššur-taklāku transported. 130 minas tin under seal, and 10 minas hand-tin, the silver price was 10 minas 4 2/3 shekels. 10 textiles, they were valued at 33 1 /3 shekels (each). The donkey and its feed together cost 17 shekels. And (I gave?) 2 shekels silver to Ela(?) The gear for the donkey was 2 shekels (silver). The exit tax was 5 shekels. 1 heavy textile apart belongs to Aziya. Ela brings all this to you under my seal. The remainder of you silver was 9 minas 36 1/2 shekels. 2 talents 7 minas tin under seal, 9 minas hand-tin, at a rate of 14 5/6 shekels, their (price in) silver was 9 minas 10 shekels. The price of the donkey was 1/3 minas (silver). The exit tax was 5 shekels. The gear for the donkey was 1 shekels (silver). Kulumaya brings you all this under my seal. The silver from the transport of Ela and Idī-Suen is exhausted. I did not give the wages of a driver to Kulumaya. Kulumaya brings you 1 Ela brought 1/2 minas silver corresponding to Iluwa. I gave 1 2/3 shekels for the excise. At a rate of 13 2/3 shekels, He put 6 minas 33 shekels tin its package in your sack. Kulumaya brings this to you.

src: a-na a-sur-na-da u i-di-su-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma i-li-a-lum-ma a-bu-um-DINGIR sa-ab-ta-ma 4 {TUG}ku-ta-nu sa li-bi4-su me-at 5 TUG lu-sa-he-er-ma si-ti KU.BABBAR ki-ma sa ni-is-ha-tim is-ku-nu-ni KU.BABBAR li-pu-la-ku-nu-ti-ma a-na GEME-tim di-na is-tu ITU.KAM na-ar-ma-ak-a-sur sa ke-na-tim a-na ITU.3.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul si-ib-tam la ta-ga-mi-la-su tup-pu-su ha-ar-ma-am u-ka-al ni-is-ha-at TUG.HI.A sa-hu-ur
tgt: To Aššur-nādā and Iddin-Suen from IIī-ālum: Seize Abum-ilum, and with respect to the 4 He is to pay in 3 months reckoned from the month If he does not pay, don't show him any favours over the interest. I have in my possession his certified tablet. The import duty for the textiles has been deducted.

src: KISIB id-na-a KISIB a-la-bi-im DUMU su-ti-bar KISIB su-mi-a-bi-a DUMU PUZUR4-a-sur 0.66666 ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-na se-er id-na-a DUMU la-qe-pi-im a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-la-hi-im u kur-ub-ISTAR a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul id-na-a DUMU la-qe-ep
tgt: Seals: Idnāya, Al-abim s. Šū-Tibar, Šumi-abia s. Puzur-Aššur. Idnāya s. Lā-qēpim owes Aššur-rēʾī 2/3 mina 2 shekels refined silver. He will pay 10 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Al-aḫim and Kurub-Ištar. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest).

src: a-na a-la-hi-im e-me-me u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma is-tu <gap> 0.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR qa-ti 7.33333 ma-na qa-ti a-bi4-ni sa-am-ru 18 ku-ta-ni 5 TUG su-ru-tum E ka-ri-im na-ad-a-ku-ma la sa-am-ru 10 ku-ta-ni u 40 TUG su-ru-tim E wa-ab-ri-ni e-zi-ib SA.BA 40 ku-ta-ni i qa-ti u-su-ur-sa-a-sur i-na-di-u-ma KU.BABBAR a qa-tim sa a-bi4-ni i-ta-hi ka-ru-um i-di-na-su i-di la i-di u KU.BABBAR ma-la qa-ti a-bi4-ni u qa-ti sa-am-ru te-er-ta-ak-nu li-li-kam 2.5 ma-na <gap> qa-dum KU.GI <big_gap> hu dan-a-sur <big_gap> <gap> URUDU 40 ma-na URUDU <big_gap> <gap>-ri-ni e-zi-ib <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> <gap> 0.5 SE KU.BABBAR <big_gap> <gap> 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am qa-ti u qa-ti a-bi4-ni a-di-ma u 28.66666 ma-na 7.5 GIN <gap> sa ILLAT-at pu-su-ke-en6 30 ma-na URUDU IG-HI.A a-na 1 ma-na-im sa 3 TUG.HI.A sa ur-su sa se-pi-a ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma KU.BABBAR a si-ib-tim i-la-ak 2 {TUG}a-bar-ni-u sa su-su-en6 u i-a-ti <gap>-ma ub-lu-nim di-na-ma mi-is-la zu-za 0.66666 ma-na 5.16666 GIN KI ha-lu-li 0.5 ma-na KI a-zu 1.5 ma-na 7.5 GIN KI tu-tu-li i mi-ma a-nim 2.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR u si-ba-ti-su sa a-zu sa be-a-lim ni-ga-li u 2 ma-na <gap> <gap>-na a-na u-ti-tim sa-a-mi-im
tgt: To Alāhum, Ememe and Aššur-taklāku from Aššur-nādā: After my account and our father's account had been recorded at 11 1/3 minas 5 shekels and 7 1/3 minas respectively, I have been booked for 18 10 kutānu-textiles and 4 black textiles I left in our guest-house. Thereof they will deposit 4 The colony has given it to me. Send me word telling me whether or not he has deposited anything and how much silver has been recorded for our father's account and mine. 2 1/2 minas of silver together with the gold ... Dān-Aššur ... 40 minas of copper I left in our guest-house. ... copper ... shekels 15 1/2 grains of silver ... I deposited 2 minas of refined silver on my account and on our father's account, so that 28 2/3 minas 7 1/2 shekels of silver is from Pūšu-ken's enterprise: As to the 1 mina for three textiles from Uršu transported by me, you have written, saying: ''The silver draws interest." If they have brought the 2 2/3 mina 5 1/6 shekels is owed by Haluli. 1/2 mina is owed by Azu. Have paid in full out of all this 2 1/2 minas of silver plus interest belonging to Azu. 20+x sickles plus 2 minas ... Have paid 1 mina for grain.

src: um-ma a-sur-ma-lik-ma u sa-lim-a-sur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u a-sur-i-di qi-bi-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma DINGIR-mu-ta-bi-il5 KI ha-ra-nim i-ta-sa-am u {d}ISKUR-ba-ni u ka-as-lum KI ba-ti-qe-e i-ta-as-u-nim lu-qu-tum i-ta-as-a-kum 4 GU AN.NA ku-nu-ku 20 ma-na AN.NA a qa-tim 8 TUG su-ru-tum li-wi-tum 10 {TUG}ku-ta-nu e-li-ta-an 3 ANSE sa-la-mu u e-nu-su-nu <big_gap> nim <gap> <big_gap><big_gap> si su-ma a-hi a-ta <big_gap> <gap> ki-ma TUG.HI.A e-ru-bu-ni 5.TA TUG.HI.A a-na a-hi-im eb-ri-im di-in-ma me-eh-ra-tim li-di-nu-ni-kum u si-ti TUG.HI.A a-ta li-qe-ma KU.BABBAR me-eh-ra-tim di-su-um-ma gi-mi-lam i-se-ri-a su-ku-un-ma a-sur-i-di tur4-da-ma a-sar a-na-kam KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na a-hu-um eb-ru-um pa-su-nu i-di-nu-ni-ni le-ri-su-um-ma li-ir-si u su-ha-ra-am a-ma-kam za-<gap>-<big_gap> mi-ma li-ip-tam la i-ra-si e-ka i-se-ri-su li-li-ik la i-sa-la-at ma-ah-ri-ka lu-za-ki ma-num da <big_gap> um-ma sa-lim-a-sur-ma mi-su-um i-na <big_gap> sa i-bi-sa-e 4.5 ma-na ma <gap> <big_gap> sa la-qe
tgt: From Aššur-mālik and Šalim-Aššur to Pūšu-kēn and Aššur-idī: To Pūšu-kēn: Ilī-mutabbil departed with the caravan. Also, Adad-bāni and Kašlum departed with the express caravan. The goods have departed toward you. 4 talents of tin under seals, 20 minas of tin for 'hand-tin', 8 black textiles as wrappings, 10 kutānum-textiles (in) two top-packs, three black donkeys and their gear ... ... if (?) my dear brother ... When the textiles arrive, sell 5 textiles each to brother and neighbor, so that the they give the proceeds to you. Now, you buy the remainder of the textiles and give him the silver as immediate proceeds and do me this favor and then dispatch Aššur-idī so that he asks(?) wherever there is one mina of silver brother and neighbor who promised and raises (the silver?). Also, clear(?) the youth there. He must not contract any affliction. Keep an eye on him. He must not act inappropriately. Clear your m. Who ... From Šalim-Aššur: Why from ... which exist .. 4 1/2 minas ...

src: um-ma su-hu-bur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-su-mi sa PUZUR4-a-na DUMU qa-a-tim a-na-kam a-sar KU.BABBAR 1 GIN la-qa-em u-la i-ba-si a-ma-kam ki-ma ta-le-e-u a-wi-lam sa-zi-iz-ma KU.BABBAR sa-as-qi-il5-ma a-na tar-ki-is-tim a-na si-a-ma-tim pa-ka di-in-su-um su-ma tup-pu-su ha-ar-mu-um sa ku-nu-ki-su a-na-kam la u-ka-al ru-ta-ki-is en-um-a-sur DUMU sa-lim-a-hi-im is-ti ILLAT-tim i-la-ak a-na-kam i-na E-tim su-ha-ar-tam e-ha-az a-ma-kam ki-ma i-a-ti ka-bi-su li-bu-su la i-la-mi-in e-mi-i-ma la e-mu-ka ar-hi-is-ma tur4-da-su-ma su-ha-ar-tam li-it-ru su-ma a-hi a-ta me-er-i-ti-ma la me-er-at-ka ka-bi-su-ma tur4-da-su
tgt: From Šū-Ḫubur to Pūšu-kēn: Concerning the matter of Puzur-Anna son of Qayatum, here wherever there is a shekel of silver to be taken, it is not there. There, as much as you are able, make the man stand up and cause him to pay, and give him your word in a bound agreement about the purchases. If his sealed tablet with his seal here he does not hold, bind him. Ennum-Aššur son of Šalim-aḫum is going toward you with the caravan. Here in the house he will marry (my) daughter). There, honor him on my behalf. May he not become ill-tempered. Is not my son-in-law your son-in-law? Dispatch him very quickly so that he may take away (my) daughter. If you are my brother, (Is not my daughter and your daughter?) honor him, and send him off.

src: um-ma su-be-lim-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 PUZUR4-sa-tu-e hu-ra-sa-nim u ma-nu-ki-a-sur qi-bi-ma su-ma E ka-ri-im be-tam i-ta-<big_gap> E-ti la ta-<gap>-<gap>-a i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-a a-sar dam-qu-ma li-qe-a-ma id-a su-ma i ha-bu-lu-ti-a ma-ma-an KU.BABBAR i-sa-qa-la-ku-nu-ti tup-pi-a pi-te9-a-ma a ma-la tup-pi-su KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su sa-as-qi-la-su qa-ta-ta KU.BABBAR sa ub-la-ni li-is-ni-qa-ku-nu-ti-ma i ku-nu-ki-ku-nu ku-un-ka-ma u4-ma-kal la i-sa-hu-ur tur4-da-ni-su su-ma KU.BABBAR tu-us-ta-as-qi-la ma-nu-um-ki-{d}a-sur is-ti me-ra um-mi-a-nim ke-nim ta-hi-a-su li-tal-kam a-hu-u-a a-tu-nu a te-er-ti-a ih-da
tgt: From Šū-Bēlum to Pūšu-kēn, Puzur-sadue, Ḫuraṣānum, and Mannu-ki-Aššur: If the colony office ... the house ... do not ... the houses/my house. Take from my silver wherever it is good and deposit it. If anyone among my debtors will pay you silver, open the tablets and cause them to weigh out the silver and its interests according to the tablet. As for Qatata, the silver which he brought, let him 'clear it out' to you (pl.) and seal it in your seals and do not delay a single day. Dispatch him here. If you collect any silver, attach(?) Mannum-kī-Aššur to a reliable affiliated trader. Let him come. My dear brother, heed my instructions.

src: 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er {d}en-LIL-ba-ni DUMU il5-ba-ni im-di-lum i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim DUMU pa-na-ka u a-sur-DUG DUMU kar-ri-a a-na 60 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal ITU.KAM na-ar-ma-ka-a-sur li-mu-um PUZUR-{d}MUS i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI e-na-be-lim DUMU su-la-ba-an IGI u-sur-si-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti 22.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er i-di-a-bi4-im DUMU i-di-ISTAR a-sur-i-mi-ti u im-di-lum i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku u i-tur4-DINGIR a-na 55 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM si-ip-im li-mu-um <big_gap> IGI i-di-<big_gap> <gap>-<gap>-<big_gap> 0.5 ma-na 4-<gap> GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er u-sur-si-ISTAR IGI e-na-be-lim IGI <gap>-<gap>-<gap> SA.BA sal-sa-tum sa ILLAT-at e-na-ma-nim i li-bi4 im-di-lim 1.3333300000000001 ma-na 3.75 GIN KU.BABBAR i li-bi4 ISTAR-pi-la-ah DUMU a-ni-nim i ba-ab ha-ra-ni-a i-sa-qa-lam IGI ah-si-la ka-sa-ri-su IGI a-sur-dan DUMU i-ku-pi-a IGI i-di-{d}ISKUR DUMU MI-{d}ISKUR AN.NA sa ki-ma su-wa-ti a-na a-sur-na-da DUMU a-sur-i-di a-di-in 0.33333 ma-na 1 GIN KU.KI pa-sa-lam SIG5 DIRI i-se-er ku-zi-zi-a im-di-lum i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa pu-su-ke-en u kur-ub-ISTAR a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM ku-zal-lu li-mu-um a-la-hu-um DUMU e-na-hi-lim IGI pu-su-ke-en6 IGI hu-ra-sa-nim DUMU su-a-nim IGI a-sur-SIPA DUMU i-di-da 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR im-di-lum a-na i-di-a-sur i-di-in i-na e-la-i-su-ma i ka-ni-is i-sa-qa-al IGI en-LIL-ba-ni DUMU il5-ba-ni IGI a-mur-DINGIR DUMU i-bi4-su-a 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-na en-um-a-sur DUMU sa-lim-a-hi-im a-di-in KU.BABBAR dan-a-sur i-sa-qa-lam a-na be-a-lim im-di-lum i-di-in is-tu ha-mus-tim sa e-na-be-lim u a-sur-su-lu-li a-na <gap> ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu <gap> GIN.TA u-su-bu
tgt: Enli-bāni s. Ilī-bāni owes Imdi-ilum 10 mina refined silver. He will pay 60 weeks from the ḫamštum of Aššur-bēl-awātim s. Panaka and Aššur-ṭāb s. Qarwiya If he does not pay at the fulfillment of his term, he will 1 1/2 shekels (per mina per month) as interest. Witnesses: Enna-Bēlim s. Šū-Laban, Uṣur-ša-Ištar s. Aššur-imittī. Idī-abim s. Idī-Ištar owes Aššur-imittī and Imdi-ilum 22 1/2 minas silver. He will pay 55 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-taklāku and Itūr-ilī. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels. Month: Ṣip'um. Year: [broken]. Witnesses: [broken], Iddin-[...], [broken](?). Ušur-ša-Ištar owes 34 (1/2?) shekels silver. Witnesses: Enna-Bēlum, [1 broken name]. Thereof, the 'third' of the caravan of Ennam-Anum is with/owed by Imdi-ilum. Ištar-pilaḫ s. Anninum owes 1 mina 23 3/4 shekels silver. He will pay at the time of his departure. Witnesses: Aḫ-šila his transporter, Aššur-dān s. Ikuppiya, Iddin-Adad s. Ṣilli-Adad. I gave your representatives' tin to Aššur-nādā s. Aššur-idī. Kuzizīya owes Imdi-ilum 21 shekels extremely fine He will pay 13 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Pūšu-kēn and Kurub-Ištar. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 1/2 shekels. Month: Kuzallu. Year: Al-aḫum s. Inaḫ-ilum. Witnesses: Pūšu-kēn, Ḫuraṣānum s. Šū-Anum, Aššur-rē'ī s. Idīda. Imdi-ilum gave Iddin-Aššur 1 mina silver. He will pay promptly at his coming up to Kanesh. Witnesses: Enlil-bāni s. Ilī-bāni, Amur-ilī s. Ibbī-Suen. I gave 1/2 mina refined silver to Ennam-Aššur s. Šalim-aḫum. Dān-Aššur will pay me the silver. He (Imdi-ilum?) gave it as a capital loan (be'alum). They will pay x ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Enna-Bēlum and Aššur-ṣulūlī. If they do not pay (on time) they will add x shekels (as interest).

src: en-na-su-en6 DUMU i-ku-a u PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU a-la-bi-im i-na sa-ha-at DAM i-ku-pi-a me-er-a-at i-ku-pi-a u me-er-e i-ku-pi-a ki-ma su-nu-ti i-zi-zu-ma 40 ma-na KU.BABBAR hu-bu-ul i-ku-pi-a a-na a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5 DUMU pu-su-ke-en6 u be-la-nim ra-bi4-si-im sa pu-su-ke-en6 is-qu-lu a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um tur4-hu-mi-it i-di-in-ni-a-ti-ma IGI GIR sa a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in IGI la-ba-na-da DUMU i-di-su-en6 IGI i-ku-pi-a-sur DUMU pi-la-ah-a-sur i-di-da-gan DUMU sa-ar-ni-ki-im u sa-lim-a-hu-um DUMU DU10-i-li tap-pa-u-ni
tgt: Ennasu'in, der Sohn des Ikū'am und Puzurištar, der Sohn des Alâbum, sind für die Frau des Ikuppi'a, die Töchter des Ikuppī'a und die Söhne des Ikuppī'a an deren Stelle eingetreten, und haben 40 Minen Silber, die Shculd des Ikuppī'a, dem Aššurmuttabbil, dem Sohne des Pūšukēn, und dem Bēlānum, dem Kommissär des Pūšukēn, bezahlt. Für diese Angelegenheiten hat der Kārum Turḫumit uns (als Richter) bestellt. Vor dem Dolche des Aššur haben wir unsere Beurkundung gegeben. Vor Labannādā, dem Sohne des Idīsu'in; vor Ikuppī'aššur, dem Sohne des Pilaẖaššur. Idīdagān, der Sohn des Sarnikum, und Šalimaḫum, der Sohn des Ṭābilī, (waren) unsere Beisitzer.

src: KISIB su-en-na-da DUMU en-um-a-sur KISIB a-sur-DU10 DUMU ki-ki-i KISIB ni-mar-ISTAR DUMU PUZUR4-su-en6 KISIB i-ku-pi-a DUMU su-su-en6 8 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-am i-se-er i-ku-pi-a DUMU su-su-en6 su-ISTAR i-su is-tu ITU.KAM kan-mar-ta a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i ITU.KAM-im u-sa-ab li-mu-um a-ku-tum i-0.33333 ma-na a-mu-tim sa ku-ku-zi u su-ku-tim sa qa-ti su-ISTAR i-ku-pi-a <gap> u sa-at-i-li sa-ak-na-at-ni i-ta-da-an a-mu-tim su-ma 8 ma-na KU.BABBAR qa-ti i-ku-pi-a i-ka-sa-ad su-ISTAR i-la-qe su-ma ba-ti-iq i-ku-pi-a u-ma-la su-ma i-te-ti-ir i-ku-pi-a i-la-qe su-ma la-ma u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim a-mu-tum i-ta-an-di-in su-ISTAR KU.BABBAR i-la-qe me-he-er tup-pi-im sa i ta-ma-la-ki nu-se-li IGI a-sur-ma-lik IGI ma-sa-a IGI su-ma-bi4-a
tgt: Seals: Suen-nādā s. Ennum-Aššur, Aššur-ṭab s. Kikki, Nimar-Ištar s. Puzur Suen, Ikuppiy s. Šū-Suen. Ikuppiya s. Šūen owes Šū-Ištar 8 minas refined silver. He will pay 20 weeks from the month of Kanwarta. If he does not pay, he will add interest at a rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Witnesses:Aššur-mālik, Mazāya, Šuma-abiya.

src: i-na 1 me-at 43 ma-na URUDU sa su-mi ku-ni-lim u i-di-ISTAR i-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum E ka-ri-im la-ap-tu 1 GU 2 ma-na sa-du-a-su-nu u-sa-hi-ru-nim 4 GU 28 ma-na sa ka-u-ni-im a-sur-na-da i-la-qe 1 {TUG}ku-ta-nam i-na li-mi-im lu-lu u a-sur-DUG a-na qa-ti-a a-di 1 GU 23 ma-na la sa-li-it SA.BA 3 GU 10 ma-na sa da-ti-a a-sur-DUG i-la-qe
tgt: Out of the 143 minas of copper which have been booked in the names of Kuzallum and Iddin-Ištar in Burušhaddum in the colony office 1 talent 2 minas, their transport tariff, they have deducted; 4 talents 28 minas to be secured Aššur-nādā will receive. 1 1 talent 23 minas were not available; thereof Aššur-ṭāb will receive 3 talents 10 minas of my fees.

src: a-na a-sur-ba-ni u sa-lim-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma la li-bi DINGIR-ma i-di-{d}UTU me-et a-na 10 ma-na u e-li-is i ha-ra-nim im-ta-ah-sa-ni u 5 TUG hu-lu-qa-u i-na sa-i-ti-su i-ta-ab-si-u 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR be-u-la-tu-su u 3.33333 ma-na AN.NA ha-bu-lam IGI su-su-en6-ma-tim IGI dan-a-sur i-na 4 TUG-ti-su sa e-li-u-ni-ni 3 GIN KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-tu-su <gap>-6 GIN i-na TUG.HI.A sa a si-mi-im E.GAL-lum il5-qe-u ik-su-su 12 GIN.TA 0.66666 ma-na 8 GIN si-im 4 TUG-ti-su SA.BA 9 GIN ni-is-ha-tu-su i-na si-mi-im is-he-er-ma si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-su 0.66666 ma-na LA 1 GIN SA.BA <gap> ma-na 1.83334 GIN ni-is-ha-su u sa-du-a-su <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> al-qe 3 GIN <gap>-<gap>-<gap> ki-si-tum <gap> 4.16666 GIN
tgt: To Aššur-bāni and Šalim-Aššur from Pūšu-kēn: Unfortunately, Idī-Šamaš has died. A loss of ten minas (of silver?) or more has hit me on the road. And 5 textiles are lost. From its remnant which has arised, 1/2 mina of silver, his be'ulātum, and 3 1/3 minas of tin is owed(?) (who owes who here?). Witnesses: Šū-Suen [x-x]-mātim, Dān-Aššur. From his four textiles, which he brought up to me, 3 shekels of silver are its excise. x+6 shekels (of silver) fall to him from the textiles which the palace took for the tithe. At a 12 shekel rate, the price of the four textiles is 48 shekels. Thereof, 9 shekels is the excise. He deducted it from the tithe and the remainder of his silver is 39 shekels. Thereof, x minas and 1 5/6 shekels (of silver) is its excise, and his shipping charge, [...], I took. ... 3 shekels (of silver?) the assets (?) ... 4 1/6 shekels ...

src: KISIB ka-ri-im tur4-hu-mi-it sa-he-er-ra-bi4
tgt: Seal of the plenary colony at Durḫumit.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma kur-ub-ISTAR-ma 2 ma-na KU.GI a-bu-ni a-na sa-lim-a-sur DUMU i-su-ri-ik a-di-im 6 ku-ta-ni SIG5 DIRI a-ku-ku-um ka-sa-ar qa-ar-wi-a u-bi4-il5-sum a-bi4 a-ta su-ma sa a-wi-lim ha-ra-su li-li-kam su-ma sa-he-er ma-la ta-le-e-u is-ti a-wi-lim na-am-ge5-er
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Kurub-Ištar: Our father owns a share of 2 minas of gold in Šalim-Aššur son of Issu-rīk. Akkukum the My dear father, if the man's goods, his caravan, arrive, or if they are late, come to an agreement with the man for as much as you are able.

src: KISIB i-ku-pi-a DUMU su-a-nim KISIB i-di-ku-bi4-im DUMU a-sur-ma-lik KISIB su-sa-a DUMU su-ISTAR DUMU na-ap-ra-ka 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-sa-a DUMU su-ISTAR pu-su-ke-en6 i-su ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-DINGIR li-mu-um sa qa-ti ku-bi4-a a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 5 GIN KU.BABBAR si-ib-tam a-na 1 ma-na-im i ITU.KAM u-sa-ab
tgt: Seal of Ikūppiya son of Šū-Anum; Seal of Idī-Kūbum son of Aššur-mālik; Seal of Susaya son of Šū-Ištar, son of Napraka. Susaya son of Šū-Ištar owes Pūšu-kēn 1/2 mina refined silver. He will pay 20 ḫamuštum weeks from the month Maḫḫur-ilī, the limmum following the one of Kūbiya. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1/2 shekel interest per mina per month.

src: 8 ma-na LA 8 GIN KU.BABBAR i-na li-bi hu-bu-li-su a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim is-qu-lam i-na ha-mus-tim sa i-di-a-sur u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku IGI a-sur-da-ni IGI la-li-im
tgt: Witnesses: Aššur-dānni, Lālim.

src: um-ma qur-ub-ISTAR-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma a-na-kam-ma a-su-mi TUG.HI.A sa is-me-ti-DINGIR u-na-hi-id-ka a-na pa-ni-ka su-pu-ur-ma DUG-si-la-a-sur a-na pa-ni-ka le-ti-qam-ma TUG.HI.A sa is-me-ti-DINGIR su-lu-ut-ma di-su-um a-na 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa tu-se-bi-la-ni ki-ma si-mu-um sa a-ki-di-e la-ap-tu-ni la u-se-bi-la-kum su-ma a-di 10 u4-me-e si-mu-um sa a-ki-di-e la i-ta-as-ra-am AN.NA a-sa-a-ma u-se-ba-la-kum 10.66666 GIN KU.BABBAR PUZUR4-su-en6 DUMU i-ka-la li-di-na-kum u tup-pa-am sa sa-li-tim i-na E PUZUR4-su-en6 a-mu-ur-ma KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su sa-as-qi-el
tgt: From Kurub-Ištar to Aššur-nādā: It was here that I gave you instructions about Iṣmid-ilum's textiles. Write before you (leave) so Ṭāb-ṣill-Aššur may travel on to you, and then give him Iṣmid-ilum's textiles on your own authority. As for the 2 minas of silver that you sent me, since the trade in Akkadian textiles is affected, I have not sent you any. If within 10 days the trade in Akkadian textiles does not return to normal, I shall buy you tin and send it to you. Puzur-Suen son of Ikaya should give you 10 2/3 shekels of silver. Then check the tablet of Katātum son of Nanaya in Puzur-Suen's house, and have the silver and its interest paid.

src: 12 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er i-di-a-hi-im a-sur-GAL i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-tur4-DINGIR u kur-ub-ISTAR ITU.1.KAM si-ip-im li-mu-um ku-bi-a 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i-na ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab a-sur-ma-su-i qa-ta-tum IGI na-na-a
tgt: Iddin-abum owes Aššur-rabi 12 shekels refined silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina per month) as interest from the ḫamuštum of Itur-ilī and Kurub-Ištar, month of Ṣipʾum, eponymate of Kubiya. Aššur-massūʾī is the guarantor.

src: 2 ne-pi-su 15 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa ba-ri-ni sa-du-a-su sa-bu 1 ri-ik-su 0.66666 ma-na ni-is-ha-su DIRI sa-du-a-su sa-bu TUG.HI-ti-su sa DUMU ku-da-di a-na a-sur-mi-ti sa-lim-a-hi-im u su-hu-bur 1 ri-ik-su 0.66666 ma-na a-na su-lu-la-a u um-mi-sa 1 ri-ik-su 0.5 ma-na a-na hu-sa-ri-im sa ik-ri-bi-a 17 GIN ni-is-ha-su DIRI a-na la-ma-si 10 GIN a-na sa-at-a-sur 12 GIN a-na i-ku-nim NU.TUR 12 GIN a-na a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU su-ISTAR mi-ma a-nim a-na i-di-su-en6 ap-qi-id IGI im-di-DINGIR IGI dan-a-sur
tgt: Its textile belongs to Son of Kudadi

src: 1 tup-pi sa 7 ma-na KU.BABBAR 1 tup-pi sa 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR 1 tup-pi sa 1.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR 1 tup-pi sa 1 GU 10 ma-na URUDU <gap> 1 tup-pi sa 17 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa pi-la-ha-a u a-ki-a u-ka-lu-ni-ma a-na KU.BABBAR su-a-ti la ta-hu-u-ni-ma hu-bu-li-ni SU.NIGIN 5 tup-pu-u sa ku-nu-ki-a ki-i-la-su-nu i-na li-bi4 tup-pi-a su-uk-na-su-nu-ma u te-er-tak-nu li-li-kam
tgt: Eine Tafel von mir über 7 Minen Silber, eine Tafel von mir über 4 Minen Silber, eine Tafel von mir über 1⅔ Minen 5 Seqel Silber, eine Tafel von mir über 1 Talent 10 Minen Kupfer, eine Tafel von mir über 17 Minen Silber, die Pilaḫāja und Aki'a unter Beschlagnahme halten und auf welches Silber sie kein Anrecht haben und die meine Schuld (oder: eine Schuld an mich) (betreffen), insgesamt fünf Tafeln mit meinen Siegeln: (nehmt sie ihnen ab und) haltet sie zurück, zu meinen (anderen) Tafeln legt sie (die Urkunden) (mir) und dann möge euer Bescheid zu mir kommen. (Rs unbeschrieben.)

src: a-na sa-lim-a-sur u pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma kur-ub-ISTAR-ma a-na sa-lim-a-sur qi-bi-ma 2 ma-na KU.GI a-bi-i a-na na-ru-qi-su a-di-im 6 ku-ta-ni SIG5 DIRI a-ku-ku-um ka-sa-ar qa-ar-wi-a ma-ha-ti-i tu-se-bi4-il5-sum a-bi4 a-ta a-ma-kam i-na a-hi-a u-ul sa ki-ma a-hi-a e is-li-u-ka-ma KU.BABBAR e ta-di-in KU.GI u si-im TUG-ba-ti i-a-ti <gap>
tgt: To Šalim-Aššur and Pūšu-kēn from Kurub-Ištar: To Šalim-Aššur: My My dear father, let neither my brother nor his representatives trick you to give out the silver. The gold and the yeild of the textiles are mine. ...

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma PUZUR4-a-sur-ma a-su-mi a-mu-tim u hu-sa-ri sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni E li-mi-im u-la i-du-nu mi-ma <gap> u-sa-ka la i-ba-si ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa se-ep DINGIR-ma-lik li-qe u i-na 25 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa se-ep su-ISTAR URUDU ku-a-am u sa DAM.GAR li-qe-ma si-ti KU.BABBAR a-na sa li-bi4-a li-qe 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR se-bi4-lam-ma a-na-kam is-ti sa ki-ma ku-a-ti la-si-ma su-ma KU.BABBAR ap-ka i-te-te-er a li-bi4 KU.BABBAR-pi-ka lu ni-di ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma 2 ma-na KU.GI sa a-wi-il5-tim a qa-ti-a te-hi i tup-pi-im la-pa-tim a-wi-il5-tum e ik-la te-er-ta-ka li-li-ka-si-im a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta KU.BABBAR <gap> AN.NA u TUG.HI.A lu sa i-a-sar lu ba-ab-ti za-ki-ma se-bi4-lam-ma si-ma-am qa-ti li-is-a-am su-ma ba-ab-ti ma-as-ra-at 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR se-bi4-lam-ma i wa-sa ba-ab-ti-a li-qe-ma ma-la u4-me-su <big_gap>-ku-ka ta ah <gap> i-di <gap> sal-tam
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Puzur-Aššur: Concerning theamūtum-mineral and lapis about which you wrote, the -office will not sell them. There was nothing at your departure. You wrote me. You said, "Take 10 minas of silver from the cargo of Ilī-mālik. Also, take 25 minas of silver from the proceeds of the cargo of Šū-Ištar, your copper and that of the merchants and take the remainder of the silver for that of my account." Send 10 minas of silver so that I can make a reckoning with your representatives here so that if they took your silver we can deposit in your silver. You wrote me. You wrote, (saying) "Add 2 minas of gold belonging to the lady to my account." In the tablet, may the writing of the lady's name not be retained. Let your message go to her. My dear father and lord, clear the silver, tin, and textiles both as to that of Ea-šar and of my outstanding claims and send them to me so that he may make purchases for my account. If my claims persist as outstanding, send 10 minas of silver so that he may take it when my assets go out, and as much as their term period ... ... know. ... available ...

src: a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma um-ma sa-ra-at-ISTAR-ma 2 TUG zu-pa na-as-a-ku-um 1 is-ra-am ku-a-ti 1 is-ra-am a-na <gap> 4 sa-ku-ka-tim is-te-na di-in si-it-ra-am a-na GU4 sa ka-ni-is 2 TUG 30 ma-na URUDU it-bu-lu i-na <gap> as-a-am-su-nu 1 TUG a-na <gap> a-di-ni-ma la im-tal-<gap> <big_gap> kur-ub-ISTAR <gap> na bi <gap> is-ti-ka sa-ki-in mi-ma la aq-bi4-su-um a-wi-lum ar-ti-bi4 ti-ib-a-ma a-tal-kam mi-ma a-nim zu-pa na-as-a-kum 0.5 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR en-nam-a-sur ub-lam 5 GIN KU.BABBAR 3 GIN KU.GI PUZUR4.ISTAR ub-lam 5 GIN KU.BABBAR 5 ma-na URUDU DUG-si-la-a-sur ub-lam a-ma <big_gap> <gap>-ka sa ni-is i-na <gap> ni-ta-ar-ri-a-am
tgt: To Aššur-nādā from Šarrat-Ištar: Zuba brings [x] textiles to you. 1 belt for you, 1 belt for ... Sell the 4 The undergarment is for the maid in Kaneš. 2 textiles cost 37 minas of copper. I sold 1 textile for silver .... Kurub-Ištar ... is deposited with you. I have said nothing to him. Set out and come. All this Zuba brings to you. 1/2 mina 5 shekels of silver Ennam-Aššur brought me. 5 shekels of silver and 3 shekels of gold Puzur-Ištar brought me. 5 shekels of silver and 5 minas of copper Ṭāb-ṣill-Aššur brought me. I shall love your maid who is with you in Kaneš.

src: a-gu5-za PUZUR4 MAR.TU is-ba-at-ma um-ma a-gu5-za-ma 2 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am di-nam um-ma su-ut-ma i si-ri-is sa ki-ma i-a-ti e-ri-is-ma li-di-nu-ni-kum su-ma la i-di-nu-ni-kum 3 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM E DAM.GAR le-qe-am IGI pu-zur-sa-du-e e-ri-is-ma u-la i-di-nu-nim ma-la pi-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa en-nam-a-a 3 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im a-si-sum IGI MI.ISTAR IGI {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni
tgt: Puzur-Amurrum seized Aguza. Aguza said: Give me 2 minas 5 shekels refined silver. He (Puzur-Amurrum) responded: "Ask Iširis my representatives so that they give it to you. If he does not give it to you, take the silver for me at a merchant's house at the rate of 3 shekels per mina per month." I asked (them) in the presence Puzur-šadūʾē and they did not According to his word, from the amutum of Ennumaya, I .. at the rate of 3 shekels (per mina) per month.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma a-mur-ISTAR-ma a-su-mi AN.NA sa hi-na-a sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni DUMU a-wi-lim u ka-sa-ar-su a-na-kam wa-as-bu u-se-ra-ab-su-nu-ma ma-ah-ri-su-nu AN.NA ku-nu-ki sa a-lim{ki} sa a-bi4-su lu-sa-ni-iq-ma ba-ti-iq u wa-tu-ur a-da-an-ma KU.BABBAR u-se-ba-la-kum AN.NA sa E a-sur-ma-lik a-na URUDU si-ki-im 15 ma-na.TA a-di-ma URUDU i-ba-si eb-la-i-u ma-du-tum i-li-ku-ni-ma URUDU ma-dum i-na E.GAL-lim i-si-qi-il5-su-nu-ti-ma KU.BABBAR 2.33333 ma-na.TA a-mu-ra-am u-ta-e-ru a-di 10 u4-me URUDU-su i-ga-mu-ru KU.BABBAR a-sa-a-ma u-se-ba-lam
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Amur-Ištar-ma: Concerning the tin belonging to Ḫinnaya about which you wrote, th(at) affiliated trader and his packer are here. I deposited the tin belonging to the house of Aššur-mālik for copper at a rate of 15 minas and there was copper available. But then a great number of Eblaites arrived here and much copper was weighed out to them in the palace and they returned silver at 2 1/2 minas refined. In 10 days its copper will be exhausted. I will purchase silver and send it to you.

src: a-na a-du-e qi-bi4-ma um-ma wa-la-wa-la-ma 2 GIN KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-a pu-su-ke-en6 ub-la-ki-im a-na is-ta-ar u is-ha-ra 3 ri-mu ka-su-um a-na is-ha-ra ku-nu-ki-a pu-su-ke-en6 ub-la-ki-im la ub-la-ki-im te-er-ti-ki li-li-kam 2 GIN KU.BABBAR i SA.BA KU.BABBAR sa-ma-ma i-di-na-ki-im la i-di-na-ki-im te-er-ti-ki ar-hi-is li-li-kam pu-su-ke-en6 tup-pa-am la ub-lam
tgt: To Aduwe from Walawala: Pūšu-kēn brought 2 shekels silver under my name to you. Let your message come as to whether or not Pūšu-kēn also brought to you 2 r. for Ištar and Išḫara and 1 k. for Išḫara under my seal. Pūšu-kēn does not bring a tablet.

src: 0.83333 ma-na LA 1 GIN KU.BABBAR li-ti i-se-er su-pi-u-ma-an u tal-ha-ma a-si-ti-su pe-ru-a ga-na-na um-mi-su u si-mi-is-ku-ni a-si-ti-su a-sur-ma-lik i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ISTAR a-na 3 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 3 GIN-ta a ma-na-im si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM u-su-bu ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-i-li li-mu-um bu-zu-ta-a IGI a-bi4-a-a IGI ba-ar-wa-ma-da IGI be-li-DUG
tgt: Šuppiuman and Talḫama his wife, Peruwa, Gana, his mother, and Šimiškuni, his wife, (all), owe Aššur-mālik 49 shekels quality silver. They will pay three weeks from the ḫamuštum of Šū-Ištar. If they do not pay (on time), they will add 3 shekels per mina per month as interest. Month: Maḫḫur-ilī. Eponymate: Buzutaya. Witnesses: Abīya, Barwamada, Bēlī-ṭāb.

src: um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma a-na zu-pa a-bu-SA u u-su-ur-sa-a-sur qi-bi4-ma a-na ni-ka-si-a su-uh-ta da-tum ma-la ik-su-du u ma-la ta-as-me-ra-ni te-er-ta-ak-nu li-li-kam 5 {TUG}ku-ta-nu i-na sa-e-tim sa en-na-be-li na-du ta-ah-si-is-tam am-ra-ma a-na se-er ni-ka-si-a te-eh-a su-ma KU.BABBAR i-li-a-lum mi-ma u-se-bi4-lam KU.BABBAR u tup-pi-su su-ba-al-ki-ta-ma se-bi4-la-nim si-im 1 {TUG}a-bar-ni-im <big_gap>
tgt: From Aššur-nādā to Zuba, [ ... ] and Uṣur-ša-Aššur: Pay on my behalf at the time of the accounting. Send me word about how much the fees amounted to, and how much you recorded. 5 kutānu-textiles have been placed in Ennam-Bēlī's sa'utum. Check the memorandum and add them on top of those on my account. If Ilī-Anum has sent any silver, then do ship and send me the silver and his tablets. The proceeds from 1 abarniu-textile is owed by a merchant ... 1 textile ...

src: KISIB i-di-su-en6 KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur KISIB la-ra-am-su KISIB ku-ku-wa KISIB <gap>-<big_gap> sa hu-bu-ul ku-ku-wa pe-ru-wa hu-ma u ku-bi4-ta 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am im-di-DINGIR i-se-ri-su-nu i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-{d}UTU-si u a-mur-{d}UTU a-na 22 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma i-na u-me-su-nu ma-al-u-tim KU.BABBAR la is-qu-lu <big_gap> 3 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR i-na ITU.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam i-sa-qu-lu KU.BABBAR i-na qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ke-ni-su-nu u a sa-ti-su-nu ra-ki-is NA4.KISIB sa KISIB sa <gap> <big_gap> a-da-ma-<gap> DUMU su-i-<gap> <big_gap> i-di-ISTAR DUMU su-li
tgt: Seals: Idī-Suen, Puzur-Aššur, Laram-Suen, Kukuwa, - ....

src: a-na i-na-a qi-bi-ma um-ma ma-num-ba-lum-a-sur-ma bur-a-sur is-tu bu-ru-us-ha-dum i-li-ik-ma um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-se-er a-hi-ka a-na ka-ni-is a-li-ik um-ma su-ut-ma en-na-su-en6 DUMU i-di-a-bi-im a-di 10 u4-me-e i-ma-qu-tam-ma a-wi-lum i-<gap>-<big_gap> a-na se-er a-hi-a a-la-ak en-na-su-en6 is-tu bu-ru-us-ha-dum i-ma-qu-tam-ma a-hu-ka u su-wa-ti a-ta-ra-dam a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta a-ma-kam i sa-ha-at u-nu-ti-a i-zi-iz mi-ma <big_gap> ki-ma u-nu-tum ur-da-ni su-ha-ri a-ma-kam-ma <big_gap> 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR di-nam
tgt: To Innāya from Mannum-bālum-Aššur: My dear father and lord, there watch after my goods.

src: 1.5 ma-na URUDU SIG5 i-se-er i-ri-si-im DUMU a-mur-{d}UTU {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li DUMU ku-us-ku-si-im i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ma-li-bi4-i-li-a ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur a-na sa-na-at i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 ma-na.TA a-na bi4-il5-tim i ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI a-gu5-a DUMU PUZUR4-a-sur IGI u-sur-sa-a-sur DUMU bu-ta-a
tgt: Erišim s. Amur-Šamaš owes Adad-ṣulūlī s. Kuzkuzim 1 1/2 minas refined copper. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 minas per talent per month as interest. Witnesses: Agua s. Puzur-Aššur, Uṣur-ša-Aššur s. Butaya.

src: a-na sa-at-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-ma-lik-ma sal-ma-ku li-bi-ki la i-pa-ri-id a-pu-tum i-na {d}UTU-si na-as-pe-er-ti ta-sa-me-i-ni su-lu-um-ki u su-lu-um E-be-tim se-bi4-lam-ma <big_gap> u li-bi-i la pa-ri-id si-it-ra-am ku-nu-ki-a i-di-su-en6 na-as-a-ki-im 2 pa-na-re-e sa GU4 i-a-ma-lik su-ha-ru-um sa i-ku-pi-a na-as-a-ki-im
tgt: To Šāt-Aššur from Aššur-mālik: I am well. Let not your heart be troubled. Please, on the day that you read my letter, write to me about your well-being and the well-being of the household so that I do not worry. Idī-Suen brings you a šitrum-textile under my seal. Ili-mālik, the servant of Ikuppiya, bring you 2 ox-hides(?).

src: KISIB la-li-im KISIB zu-ba KISIB a-su 1.8333300000000001 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-su a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa kur-ub-ISTAR u a-la-hi-im i-na ba-ab ha-ra-ni-su su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-su
tgt: Seals: Lālim, Zupa, Ašu. Ašu owes Aššur-rēʾī 1 5/6 minas refined silver. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest).

src: 1 GU AN.NA sa su-hu-bu-ur a-na il5-ba-ni DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR i-di-nu is-tu il5-ba-ni a-na ka-ni-is{ki} e-ru-bu ITU 15 KAM i-la-ak-ma 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-na pu-su-ke-en6 sa ki-ma su-hu-bur il5-ba-ni i-sa-qal KU.BABBAR sa su-hu-bur i-na ka-ni-is{ki} i-sa-qal IGI ku-na-ni-a IGI is-me-a-sur IGI u-zu-a
tgt: 1 talent tin which Šū-Ḫubur gave to Il-bāni son of Puzur-Ištar, after Il-bāni arrives in Kanesh, it will go for 15 months and he will pay 10 minas silver to Pūšu-kēn, the representative of Šū-Ḫubur. He will pay the silver of Šū-Ḫubur in Kaneš. In the presence of Kunānia, Išme-Aššur, and Uzuwa

src: a se-ep <big_gap> KU.BABBAR a-na hu-<gap> <big_gap> u si-ma-am li-is-a-am i-nu-mi si-ma-am i-sa-u-mu u a-tu-nu i sa-ha-ti-su i-zi-za a-hu-u-a a-tu-nu a-na-ku ma-na-ah-tam a-ta-na-ah a-na-kam u-zu-a DUMU a-sur-{d}SIG5 as-ba-at-ma um-ma a-na-ku-ma KU.BABBAR di-in um-ma su-ut-ma tup-pa-am sa si-be-e sa ah-ri-mu bi4-la-ni-ma u KU.BABBAR-ap-ku-nu li-qe-a tup-pa-am su-a-ti na-an-si-a-su-ma a-hi a-ta a-pu-tum tup-pe-e a-na te-ga-ra-ma nu-ur-ISTAR u us-ta-la lu-se-si-u 3 GIN KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-a a-na se-er wa-al-ha-as-na a-na tup-pe-e se-su-e-em a-na gam-ri-su-nu nu-ur-ISTAR na-si a-pu-tum <big_gap> KU.BABBAR <big_gap> ni a-sar <big_gap> 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-hi a-ta u ar-hi-is al-kam-ma lu nu-sa-bi4
tgt: ... to/for the transport of (PN), silver to Ḫu... ... so that he makes purchases. When they make purchases, you yourselves assist them. My dear brothers, I myself am ... Here, I seized Uzuwa s. Aššur-damiq. I said, "Give the silver." He said, "Bring me the sealed tablet with witnesses so that you can take your (pl.) silver." We produced the tablet for him, so, my dear brother, urgent, so that Nūr-Ištar and Uštala bring out the tablets to Tegarama. Send out 3 shekels silver under my seal to Walḫašna for the tablets. Nūr-Ištar carries it as a favor for them. Urgent, urgent, ... silver ... wherever ... 2 minas silver, my dear brother, also come quickly, so that we can satisfy.

src: <gap> ma-na <gap> GIN KU.BABBAR ti-re-e i-se-er zu-zu-bi-a u sa-ni-na-num <big_gap> ti-ri-sa-<gap> <big_gap> da-a-a DUMU il5-ba-ni i-su a-na <big_gap> KU.BABBAR i-sa-qu-lu ITU.1.KAM su-en6 li-mu-um sa qa-ti <big_gap>
tgt: They will pay the silver in ... .

src: 1.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ta-i-a ka-ma-li-a u nu-nu a-sur-ma-lik i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ka-si-im a-na 15 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 3 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu u ke-ni-su-nu ra-ki-is a-na sa pa-ar-ka i-sa-qu-lu IGI ki-zi IGI en-um-a-sur IGI la-i-la IGI MAR.TU-ba-ni
tgt: Tāya, Kammalīya, and Nūnu owe Aššur-mālik 1 1/2 minas refined silver. They will pay 15 weeks from the ḫamuštum of the If they do not pay (on time), they will add 3 shekels per mina per month. (The responsibility to pay) the silver is bound to whoever is solvent and financially responsible. They will pay at the festival of Parka. Witnesses: Kizi, Ennum-Aššur, Laila, Amurrum-bāni.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma a-su-mi sa {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni sa ta-qi-pu-su ta-as-pu-ra-ma i-na te-er-ti-ka-ma lu-qu-tam i li-bi4 {d}MAR.TU a-di-in-ma KU.BABBAR-pi al-qe si-ti KU.BABBAR 0.83333 ma-na 1.25 GIN a si-tam as-pu-ra-kum um-ma a-na-ku-ma li-is-qu-la-ku-ma tup-pu-su di-in-su-um tup-pu-ka 5 u 6 i-li-ku-nim a-ni-a-tim ki-ma sa-bu-a-ku-ni mi-su-um i tup-pi-ka la ta-al-pu-tam 6.33333 ma-na AN.NA KU.BABBAR-ap-su 1 ma-na 3 GIN ku-si-tum ma-al-a-i-tum 0.5 {TUG}ku-ta-num 0.5 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR-ap-su-nu 3 TUG sa ik-ri-bi4-a 1 TUG sa su-ha-ar-tim is-ti su-ba-ti-su a-sur-ma-lik DUMU a-zu-za u-bi4-il5-su-um 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR la i-ba-ta-qam su-ma TUG.HI.A a-ta tal-qe te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam tup-pu-um sa a ki-la-li-ku-nu la-pu-tu ki-ma ta-as-me-u pa-nam su-ku-su-ma mi-ma a-nim sa la-pu-ta-ku-ni a-na nu-ku-ra-e la i-sa-ka-an tup-pu-um sa ki-la-li-ku-nu li-li-kam-ma KU.BABBAR-pi a-na-kam la-al-qe a-na KU.BABBAR-pi-su sa a-na-kam ma-di-is du-mu-uq-tam e-pu-su-um u li-ba-ka i-de8 a-na KU.BABBAR-pi-su sa-lu-hi-im is-tap-ra-am i-di qa-ti-ma li-is-pu-ra-ma a-na-kam KU.BABBAR-pi la-al-qe su-ma si-ib-sa-tim e-ta-wu i-na is-te-en6 a-li-ki-im te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam-ma sa la-qa KU.BABBAR-pi-a a-na-ku a-na-kam mi-il5-ki la-am-li-ik
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: Concerning the matter of Ilabrat-bāni in which you entrusted to him, you wrote me and in your message: "I sold the goods in Amurrum and I took my silver." The remainder of the silver is 51 1/4 shekels. Regarding the remainder, I wrote to you. I said, "Let him weigh it out to you and give his tablet to him." Five or six of your tablets have arrived. As for these, why did you not write in your tablet that I am paid in full? 6 1/3 minas tin--its price in silver: 1 mina 3 shekels; a mal'aītum kusītum-textile and 1/2 a kutānum-textile--their price in silver: 35 shekels; 3 textiles for my votive fund; and Aššur-mālik son of Azuza brought him 1 textile for the girl along with his textiles. He must not pay less than 1 mina silver. If you yourself received the textiles, then let your message come. When you read the tablet addressed to both of you, confront him with it so that he cannot deny all for which I am written. Let a tablet from both of you come to me so that I can take my silver here. As for his silver which is here, I have done him a great favor. And you know it very well! He had sent word to me to withdraw his silver. He should have written at the same time so that I could take my silver here. If he quarrels, let your message come with the first traveler and I will make my decision about taking my silver myself here.

src: um-ma a-la-hu-um-ma a-na a-sur-na-da u PUZUR4-a-na qi-bi4-ma 20 {TUG}ku-ta-ni 1 pi-ri-ka-num 1 pi-it-ha-la u wa-at-ka-am na-as-u-ni-ku-nu-ti a-na-kam na-na-a DUMU i-ku-uh-li-im ip-qi-su-nu-ti 1.3333300000000001 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR ig-ri-su-nu di-na u si-si-ka-tim sa TUG.HI.A ku-nu-ti sa ki-ma i-a-ti wa-di-a su-ma a-wi-li ti-de8-a-su-nu a-ma-kam ti-mi-il5-ki-a-i-e si-ip-ri pa-ni-u-tim sa wa-as-bu-ni sa-la su-ma sa-lim-{d}ISKUR tup-pu-um a-ni-um ik-ta-as-da-su 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR ti-ri i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-a ku-un-ka-ma lu-ub-lam sa-lim-{d}ISKUR u-ma-kal la i-bi4-at tu-ur-da-ni-su i-li-a-lum u i-na-ar is-ti-su li-li-ku-nim su-ma sa-lim-{d}ISKUR i-ta-al-kam u-la a-la-kam la i-mu-a 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na DUMU um-mi-a-nim ke-nim di-na-ma lu-ub-lam su-ma DUMU um-mi-a-nim la-su 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR <big_gap> i-li-a-lim di-na-ma i-na qa-ab-li-su li-ir-ku-us-ma i-na-ar u su-ut le-ta-at-qu-nim u a-ma-kam i-li-a-lim na-di-da
tgt: 20 kutānu-textiles and 1 pirikannu-textile Pithala and Watkam are bringing to you. Here Nannaya, the son of Ikuhlum, entrusted it to them. Give them each 1 1/3 shekel of silver as wages. Then you must mark the hems of the textiles, acting as my representatives. If you know the men, then question the men from Timelkia there, the earlier messengers who stay there. If this letter catches up with Šalim-Adad, then seal 5 minas of tiri silver from my stocks of silver, that he may bring it here. Šalim-Adad must not stay for a single night, but send him. Ilī-ālum and Inar should come together with him. If Šalim-Adad has already left or is unwilling to come, then give the 5 minas of silver to a trustworthy affiliated trader, so he may bring it. If there is no affiliated trader, then give 2 minas of silver to Ilī-ālum, and let him be bound by a contract in Kaneš, so that Inar and he may come overland. Do give Ilī-ālum instructions there!

src: KISIB a-bi-la-ma-si KISIB ku-lu-lu KISIB su-be-lim KISIB MAR.TU ba-ni KISIB bur-nu-nu KISIB pi-la-ah-a-sur DUMU da-dim 2 ma-na KU sa-ru-pu-um sa pi-la-ah-a-sur i-na si-na-hu-tim e-zi-bu a-na si-na-hu-tim pi-la-ah-a-sur u su-na-da u-la sa ki-ma su-na-da i-lu-ku-ma KU.BABBAR 2 ma-na 10 u4-me i-na si-na-hu-tim i-ma-nu-u-ma pi-la-ah-a-sur i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul a-na ma-na-im 3 GIN.TA i-na ITU u-sa-ab is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa pi-la-ah-a-sur DUMU da-dim
tgt: Seals: Abī-lamassī, Kululu, Šū-Bēlim, Amurrum-bāni, Būr-Nunu, Pilaḫ-Aššur s. Dādim

src: 12 TUG E ka-ri-im la-ap-ta-ku 4 TUG su-ISTAR la-pi-it 4 TUG lu-zi-na la-pi-it 4 TUG su-su-en6 la-pi-it 5 TUG i-na sa lu-zi-na ah-bu-ul
tgt: I am recorded for 12 textiles in the colony office. Šū-ištar is recorded for 4 textiles. Luzina is recorded for 4 textiles. Šū-Suen is recorded for 4 textiles. I owe 5 textiles from the account of Luzina.

src: 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er si-li-a a-di-ma-tum ti-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim u a-mur-ISTAR <gap> SAG ITU.1.KAM na-ar-ma-ak a-sur sa ke-na-tim 1 ma-na.ta KU.BABBAR i-na sa-tim i-sa-qal li-mu-um sa qa-te su-da-a DUMU en-na-nim su-ma 1 ma-na.TA <gap> i-na sa-tim la is-qul a ma-la u4-mu-su e-ti-qu-ni a-na 1 ma-na-im 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI KU.BABBAR.GAL IGI dan-a-sur
tgt: Ṣilliya owes Adi-mātum 3 minas refined silver. From the hamuštum of Aššur-bēl-awātim and Amur-Ištar, the beginning of Month III, he will pay 1 mina silver per year. Eponymate: after Šudaya s. Ennanim. If he does not pay 1 mina silver per year, according to however he passes his term, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina (per month) as interest. Witnesses: Kaspum-rabi(?), Dān-Aššur.

src: 0.5 ma-na 7.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er da-ga-ni-a su-na-da i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa hu-ra-sa-nim a-na 1 ma-na-im 2 GIN.TA i-na ITU u-sa-ab ITU te-i-na-tim li-mu-um su-ka-li-a IGI ha-ba-ti IGI su-pi-la-ah
tgt: Dagānia owes Suen-nādā 37 1/2 shekels refined silver. He will add 2 shekels per mina per month (as interest) from the ḫamuštum of Ḫuraṣānim. Month: Teʾinātim. Eponymate: Sukkallīya Witnesses: Ḫabati, Suppilaḫ.
