src: um-ma hi-na-a-ma a-na qar-wi-a pu-su-ke-en6 u a-sur-dan qi-bi-ma a-na qar-wi-a u a-sur-dan qi-bi-ma ta-as-pu-ra-nim um-ma a-tu-nu-ma a-sur-na-da u DUMU e-la-ma KU.BABBAR ne-ri-is-ma um-ma su-nu-ma a-a-nu-um KU.BABBAR a-na-kam a-na tur4-hu-mi-it ne-ra-ab-ma KU.BABBAR nu-se-ba-la-ma ku-un-ka-ma se-bi4-la-su-um is-tu ta-as-pu-ra-ni-ni sa-li-is-tum sa-tum a la-qa AN.NA MU.5.SE su-ma-mi-in4 a-sur-dan wa-ar-ka-su-nu i-li-ik-ma KU.BABBAR u-sa-as-qi-il5-su-nu la-mi-in4 SIG5 i-na ka-ni-is mi-nam i-a-tam e-pa-as u a-su-mi 15.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa e-la-ma a-na la-qe-ep sa-qa-lam qa-bi4-u ta-as-pu-ra-nim um-ma a-tu-nu-ma um-ma sa ki-ma e-la-ma-ma si-be-su lu-se-li-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-su li-il5-qe sa sa-la-sa-at si-be-a tup-pa-am i-na ba-ab DINGIR la tal-qe-a sa 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-di-nu-su-ni u i-na ba-ab a-la-hi-nim IGI a-sur-ma-lik DUMU a-la-hi-im la a-ta-wu-su-um um-ma a-na-ku-ma i-hi-id-ma KU.BABBAR ar-hi-is se-bi4-lam mi-su-um sa te-er-ta-ku-nu za-ku-tum la i-la-ka-ni u KU.BABBAR sa AN.NA-ki-a la tu-se-ba-la-ni-ni
tgt: From Ḫinnaya to Qarwiya, Pūšu-kēn, and Aššur-dān: To Qarwiya and Aššur-dān: You wrote me. You said, "We asked Aššur-nādā and the son of Elama for the silver. They said, 'Wherever silver here to Durḫumit we arrive and we will send the silver and seal it and send it to him.'" After you wrote to me, third year for the taking of the silver -- should Aššur-dān go after after them and he casued them to pay. ??? Bad or good, who in Kaneš will do anything on my behalf? Now, you wrote me regarding the 15 1/2 minas silver which Elama promised to pay to Lā-qēpum. You said, "The representative of Elama said, 'Let him bring out his witnesses so that he can take his silver.'" Of the third my witness tablet at the gate of the gods you did not take! For the 20 minas silver which I gave to him or at the gate of the Alaḫḫinum, I will not prosecute him in the presence of Aššur-mālik son of Al-āḫum. I said, "Take heed to send me the silver quickly!" Why is it that your full message has not come nor have you sent the silver of my tin?

src: um-ma i-li-a-ma u la-qe-ep a-na ZI-IR i-di-ISTAR URUDU sa te-zi-bu i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-ka sa a-na-kam-ma ni-il5-qe 1 me-at 60 AS se-am ni-is-am du-du AN.NA 1 GU is-ku-na-ma a-na sa-ba-tim ni-li-ik-ma um-mi-a-nu-ka a-na sa-ba-tim i-li-ku-ma a-se-er a-wi-lim-ma nu-ta-er du-du a-na ka-ra-tim a-la-kam qa-bi su-ma a-ta ta-sa-ka-nam-ma i-sa-bu-tu ti-ib-a-ma a-tal-kam ra-ma-ka za-ki su-ma a-na a-lim{ki} la pa-nu-ka ta-ad-mi-iq-ti-ni se-bi4-lam
tgt: From Ilya and Lāqēp to Idī-Ištar:

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-la-hi-im e-la-ma pu-su-ke-en6 u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi-ma a-hu-a a-tu-nu is-tu MU.SE 30 i-na a-lim{ki} wa-as-ba-ku-ma u ni-ka-si u-sa-qal ka-ra-am mu-uh-ra-ma is-ti ka-ri-im e-na-na-tim er-sa-nim-ma a-na KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na-um 3 GIN la-di a su-ma la i-ma-gu5-ru sa-li-a-ma a-mi-sal a-we-el la-zi-iz a-tu-nu la ti-de8-a-a a-i-a-tum ma-as-ka-na-tu-a e-la ma-la ma-as-ka-tam la as-ku-nam 37 ma-na ni-ka-si as-qul gi-mi-lam i-se-ri-a su-ku-na ih-da-ma a-na mi-sal a-we-el la-zi-iz a-ni-tum la a-ni-tum te-er-ta-ak-nu i pa-ni-e-ma li-li-kam is-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-a 4.5 ma-na sa ku-ru-ub-ISTAR ba-ab-tam e-zi-ba-ku-nu-ti-ni sa-as-qi-la-ma se-bi-la-nim
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Alāhum, Elamma, Pūšu-kēn and Aššur-taklāku: My dear brothers, for 30 years I have been living in the City and I always pay the accounts. Appeal to the colony authorities and ask for clemency for me from the colony, so that for the silver I may deposit 3 shekels per mina. If they do not agree with you, then implore them that I may stand only for half a share of a man. Are you not aware which are my deposits? Should I make another deposit on top of that? I have paid 37 minas on the account! Do me this favor. Take care to have me stand only for half a share of a man. Send me word whether this is so or not as soon as possible. Together with my other silver I left 4 1/2 minas belonging to Kurub-Ištar as an outstanding claim with you. Have it paid and send it to me.

src: 4.16666 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-na se-er i-na-a a-bu-ni i-su ITU.KAM ab-sa-ra-ni a-na ITU-<gap>-KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul a-na 10 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR 0.5 GIN KU.BABBAR u-sa-ab li-mu-um i-ku-pi-ISTAR IGI a-sur-ka-si-id
tgt: He will pay x months (from) the month of Ab šarrānē. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1/2 shekel per 10 shekels (as interest).

src: a-na su-ISTAR qi-bi4-ma um-ma i-li-ba-ni-ma 0.66666 ma-na 3 GIN KU.BABBAR sa me-er-i-ti-ka sa a-na si-a-ma-tim ta-di-na-ni a-sur-tak-la-ku is-ti-a sa-zu-uz-tu-ni 2 {TUG}a-bar-ni-e 1 {TUG}ku-ta-nam SIG5 ni-is-a-ma-kum ku-nu-ku-ni a-sar da-da-a-a DUMU ku-um-ri-im sa su-en6 i-ba-si-u a-na-ku ha-ra-ni sa-ni-a-at su-pu-ur-ma {TUG}su-ba-tim li-di-nu-ni-kum
tgt: To Šū-Ištar from Ilī-bāni: As for the 43 shekels of silver belonging to your daughter which you gave me for purchases, Aššur-taklāku with me and our certified representatives, we purchased for you 2 abarnium-textiles and 1 fine kutānum textile. They are available under our seals at (the house of?) Dadaya son of the priest of Suen. As for me, send another on my journey (?) so that he can give the textile to you.

src: KISIB na-ab-su-en6 KISIB a-mur-a-sur sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-ra-bi 1.3333300000000001 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa a-sur-SIPA is-tu ha-mus-tim sa tu-tu u su-a-nim 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-ra-bi
tgt: Seals of Nāb-Suen, Amur-Aššur

src: 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er i-ku-nim u-su-ur-sa-a-sur i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni i-na e-ra-bi4-su is-tu u-la-ma u-se-ba-lam su-ma la us-te-bi4-lam 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab IGI {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni IGI ma-nu-ki-a-sur
tgt: Ikūnim owes Uṣur-ša-Aššur 2 minas refined silver. Witnesses: Ilabrat-bāni, ma-nu-ki-a-šùr

src: 0.5 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR li-ti i-se-er ki-ka-ar-sa u a-si-ti-su PUZUR4-a-sur i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-na-a u a-sur-i-mi-ti a-na 5 ha-am-sa-tim 17.5 GIN i-sa-qal u 5 ha-am-sa-tim i-la-ka-ma 17.5 GIN.TA i-sa-qal IGI ka-lu-lu IGI ku-ku-a
tgt: Kikarša and his wife owe Puzur-Aššur 1/2 mina 5 shekels liti silver.

src: um-ma su-hu-bur-ma a-na i-ku-nim <gap> u pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-na i-ku-nim qi-bi-ma tap-pa-u-ka sa AN.NA u TUG.HI.A is-ti-ka il5-qe-u-ni KU.BABBAR si-im AN.NA-ki-a u TUG.HI.A u-se-bi-lu-u-nim u a-ta su-ma a-hi a-ta KU.BABBAR si-im AN.NA-ki-a u TUG.HI-ti-a a-na pu-su-ke-en su-qu-ul 15 ma-na AN.NA a-ha-ma sa ik-ri-bi-a i-na li-bi su-uq-li-ka sa se-ep GI6-li-ISTAR a-di u 5 ma-na AN.NA i-nu-mi tu-su-ni a-sur-SIPA ha-nu-nu-um IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU i-ku-pi-a i-di-na-kum a-hi a-ta is-te-ni-is lu pa-ni-am lu bar-ki-a-am KU.BABBAR a-na pu-su-ke-en6 su-qul
tgt: From Šū-Ḫubur to Ikūnum and Pūšu-kēn: To Ikūnum: Your partners who bought tin and textiles along with you sent me silver, the price of the tin and textiles. But as for you, if you are my brother, weigh out the silver, the price of my tin and textiles. I placed 15 minas tin belonging to my Also, when you left, Aššur-rēʾī Ḫanunum gave you 5 minas tin in the presence of Aššur-imittī son of Ikuppiya. My dear brother, either with the next departure or the following one, pay the silver altogether to Pūšu-kēn.

src: KISIB pe-ru-a DUMU na-ah-<gap>-sa-nu KISIB ha-su-i DUMU <gap>-<gap>-pi-ip-ra KISIB ka-ra-su-na-<big_gap> KISIB a-la-hi-im KISIB i-la-li-is-ka-an KISIB en-num-ISTAR 3.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er a-la-hi-im i-la-li-is-ka-an u en-num-ISTAR pe-ru-a i-su 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i sa-tim i-nu-mi ru-ba-um a-na E u ni-pa-as e-ru-bu 0.5 ma-na.TA KU.BABBAR u-sa-qu-lu i-na MU.7.SE KU.BABBAR u-sa-bu-u KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu u ke-ni-su-nu E-ti-su-nu u wa-ar-ki ra-ki-is ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um i-na-su-en6
tgt: Al-aḫim, Ilališka, and Ennam-Ištar owe Peruwa 3 1/2 minas silver. They will pay 1/2 mina silver. He will add silver in seven years.

src: a-na i-tur4-DINGIR i-na-a u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi4-ma um-ma hu-sa-ru um-ma as-pu-ra-ku-nu-ti um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-wa-tum sa um-mi-a-an kur-ub-ISTAR u a-hi-a su-ma im-ta-ag-ru a-wa-tim ki-ma ta-le-a-ni gu5-um-ra mi-ma a-wa-tim sa i-ma-qu-ta-ni lu ma-ma-an i-sa-pu-ru-nim te-er-ta-ak-nu li-li-kam-ma uz-ni pi-te-a a-la-nu-ma a-wa-su la ta-ga-ma-ra um-ma a-tu-nu-ma te-er-ti-ni a-se-ri-su li-li-ik KU.BABBAR sa E a-lim{ki} sa kur-ub-ISTAR la sa u-se-bi4-la-ni a-tu-nu la ti-de8-a ki-ma KU.BABBAR-pu wa-aq-ru-ni is-tu bu-ru-us-ha-dum u-se-ba-lam
tgt: To Itūr-ilī, Innāya, and Aššur-taklāku from Ḫuṣārum: I wrote to you. I said, "As for the matter of Kurub-Ištar's and Aḫia's investors, if they come to an agreement settle the matter insofar as you can. However the matter falls out, or whatever they write, let your report come and inform me. Don't try to resolve the matter from there." Don't you three know that becasue silver is scarce, he will send it from Purušhattum?

src: 2 GIN KU.BABBAR i-na be-u-la-ti-su sa en-um-a-sur i-na li-bi4-a
tgt: Zwei Seqel Silber von dem Betriebskapital des Ennumaššur bin ich schuldig. (Rs unbeschrieben)

src: 0.33333 ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im 4 {TUG}ku-ta-ni i li-bi4 a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku DUMU qa-a-tim is-tu sa a-mur-{d}UTU sa-bu-u 0.33333 ma-na 2 GIN si-im 4 {TUG}ku-ta-ni i li-bi <gap> <gap>-ta-a 7 {TUG}ku-ta-nu <gap> ma-na <gap> GIN 4 TUG su-ru-tum <big_gap> <gap>-0.5 ma-na <big_gap> ma-na 2 GIN <big_gap> ku bi <gap> <big_gap> sa sa-lim-a-hi-im <gap> <big_gap> i-na 16 {TUG}ku-ta-ni u 7 TUG su-ru-tim sa a-sur-i-mi-ti sa E i-ku-nim u-se-si-a-ni SA.BA 7 ku-ta-ni u 4 TUG su-ru-tim qa-su a-di-ma si-ti TUG.HI-ti-su 11 ku-ta-nu u 3 su-ru-tum i li-bi4-a 7 {TUG}ku-ta-nu <big_gap> <gap>-ISTAR u-se-si-a-ma qa-su a-di-i <big_gap> TUG su-ru-ti-su <big_gap> <gap>-ti-su a-di-ma 1 TUG <big_gap> i li-bi4-a <big_gap> 1 ku-ta-<gap> <big_gap> <gap>-tum-0.33333 ma-na <big_gap>-0.5 ma-na <big_gap> a-sur-i-mi-ti
tgt: 22 shekels silver, the price of 4 kutānum textiles owed by Aššur-taklāku s. Qayyātum, from the property of Amur-Šamaš was satisfied. 22 shekels silver the frice of kutānum textiles Owed by x-x-ta-a, 7 kutānum textiles x minas x shekels black textiles ... x+1/2 minas, x minas, 2 shekels ... belonging to Šalim-aḫum ... from the 16 kutānum textiles and the 7 black textiles of Aššur-imittī which he/I sent to the house of Ikūnum, from that 7 kutānum textiles and 4 black textiles, I gave his share and the remainder of the textiles, 11 kutānum textiles and 3 black textiles thereof, 7 kutānum textiles ... xx-Ištar sent here and I gave his share. x black textiles .. (to his share?) I gave and 1 textiles which I own ... kutānum textiles and ... 1/3 minas, x+1/2 minas ... Aššur-imittī.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um hi-na-a a-sur-i-mi-ti ta-ri-is-ma-tum u be-la-tum-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a ma-la te-er-ti-ka tup-pa-am sa a-lim{ki} ni-il5-qe-ma ra-bi-su-um na-as-a-kum a-ma-kam i-hi-id-ma lu KU.BABBAR lu GEME lu IR lu E-be-tum mi-ma su-nu-nu e-zi-bu-u pa-he-er-ma ku-nu-uk-ma se-bi-lam 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na AN.NA a-na ra-bi4-si-im ni-di-in 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-ma-kam di-su-um u sa-bu 10 GIN KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na AN.NA a-na im-gu5-a ni-di-in tup-pu-um sa a-lim{ki} sa a-na KU.BABBAR-ap a-sur-ma-lik a-di hu-bu-ul <big_gap> na-ru-qi-im er-bu-um GA-ra-tam u sa-ku-ul-tum us-ta-bu-u i-na me-er-e a-sur-ma-lik ma-ma-an la i-ta-hi-u a-ma-kam i-ba-si tup-pa-am ka-li-im-su-nu a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma ta-ri-is-ma-tum u be-la-tum-ma a-su-mi KU.BABBAR sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni i ma-qa-at KU.BABBAR pa-ni-e-ma a sa ki-ma ku-a-ti ni-da-an
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum, Ḫinnaya, Aššur-imittī, Tariš-mātum and Bēlātum to Pūšu-kēn: According to your instructions, we obtained a tablet of the city and the attorney brings it to you. There, take care to gather together silver, maids, servants, houses--whatever Šū-Nunu left behind and seal and send to us. We gave 1/3 mina silver a mina tin to the attorney. Give to him 1/3 mina silver there so that he is satisfied. We gave 10 shekels silver and 1 mina tin to Imgua. According to the tablet of the city: "Concerning the silver of Aššūr-mālik, no one shall make claims on the sons of Aššur-mālik until they have satisfied the debts of the joint-stock fund, the income, the GA-ra-tim, and the šakultum (feasts?)." It is there. Show them the tablet. To Pūšu-kēn from Tariš-mātum and Bēlātum: Concerning the silver about which you wrote, at the arrival of the silver, we will give the first silver to your representative.

src: KISIB su-be-lim DUMU sa-lim-a-sur KISIB su-be-lim DUMU a-gu-a KISIB i-ku-nim DUMU sa-lim-a-sur KISIB a-ta-ta DUMU a-ku-tim sa 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-ta-ta DUMU a-ku-tim a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa la-li-im u a-ni-nim a-na 15 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-ta-ta DUMU a-ku-tim
tgt: Seals: Šū-Belim s. Šalim-Aššur, Šū-Belim s. Agua, Ikūnim s. Šalim-Aššur, Atata s. Akutum. Atata s. Akutum owes Aššur-rēʾī 2 minas refined silver. He will pay 15 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Lālim and Anninim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest).

src: a-lu-um di-nam IGI 2 GIS.GAG.EN.GAL i-na ha-am-ri-im i-di-in-ma is-tu ITU.1.KAM ab sa-ra-ni li-mu-um <big_gap> <gap>-<gap>-ni li-mu-um <big_gap> ga ni <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap>
tgt: The city rendered a verdict in the presence of the nail? of the district: From the month Ab šarrānē, eponymate [Adad-ba]ni(?) ... eponyamte ...

src: 15 ma-na AN.NA za-ku-am i-se-er a-sur-DUG DAM.GAR i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa im-di-lim u {d}UTU-ba-ni ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-i-li li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-di-a-bi-im DUMU na-ar-bi4-tim a-na 16 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i ITU.KAM a-1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab i-nu-mi zu-zu-wa is-tu a-lim{ki} e-ta-li-a-ni a-sur-DUG u-la i-qa-bi4 um-ma su-ut-ma u4-mu-a li-im-lu-u AN.NA a-na DAM.GAR a i-da-an KU.BABBAR GAN-a-lam5 a-su-mi DAM.GAR a-na-nu-um u a-la-num e-ti-iq IGI a-hu-wa-qar IGI ir-ma-a-sur
tgt: Aššur-ṭab owes the merchant 15 minas clear tin. He will pay 16 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Imdilim and Šamaš-bāni, month of Maḫur-ilī, eponymate after Iddin-abim s. Narbitum. If he does not pay (on time), he will add (interest) at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Witnesses: Aḫu-waqar, Irama-Aššūr

src: um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 {m}i-tur4-DINGIR u e-nam-a-sur qi-bi-ma a-su-mi KU.BABBAR si-im be-ti-ka E da-la-as a-lu-um di-nam i-di-in-ma tam-ka-ru sa E da-la-as ra-ap-su u is-tu da-la-as i-mu-tu-ni ma-ma-an i-na DAM.GAR lu KU.BABBAR GEME IR lu u-ta-tam lu mi-ma il5-qe-u-ni u-ta-ru-ma i-na IGI GIR sa a-sur i-ra-pu-su-ma a-na ba-a-ba-at KU.BABBAR-pi-ku-nu i-zu-zu su-ma DAM.GAR-ru sa is-tu da-la-as i-mu-tu-ni KU.BABBAR il5-qe-u-ni u-ta-ru u a-tu-nu si-im be-ti ta-e-ra-ma u ru-up-sa-ma a-na ba-a-ba-at KU.BABBAR-pi-a zu-za-ma se-bi-la-nim su-ma su-nu sa il5-qe-u-ni la u-ta-ru u a-tu-nu 1 GIN la tu-ta-ra KU.BABBAR pu-su-ke-en6 li-is-qu-ul-ma ku-un-ka-ma se-bi-la-ni-ma i-a-ti ma-ma-an i-se-e-a-ni-ni li-is-a-ni a-su-mi KU.BABBAR sa ILLAT-at a-sur-ma-lik ki-is-da-ti-a u 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR ILLAT-at bu-si-a na-pa-lam qa-bi4-u-ni ma-ma-an il5-qe-u-ni ku-ta-ni-na-ma te-er-ta-ak-nu li-li-kam a-na pu-su-ke-en qi-bi-ma a-hi a-ta u4-mu-u sa KU.BABBAR im-ti-du <gap> KU.BABBAR ku-nu-uk-ma se-bi-lam li-bi la tu-sa-am-ra-as
tgt: From Aššur-nādā to Pūšu-kēn, Itūr-Ilī, and Ennam-Aššur: Concerning the silver, the price of your house, and the house of Dalaš, the city rendered a verdict that the merchants of the house of Dalaš are rapš. Now after Dalaš died, anyone of the merchants who took silver, maid, servant or consumable grain or anything, will return and will rpš before the dagger of Aššūr and stand for the 'gate' of the your(pl.) silver. If merchants who took silver after the death of Dalaš return, the you(pl.) must return the price of the houses and take an oath, and stand for the 'gate'of my silver and send it to me. If they who took (silver after the death of Dalaš) do not return, then you (pl.) do not return even a single shekel. Let Pūšu-kēn pay so that you seal and send to me so that anyone who ther is(?) may ešu to me. Let you rmessage come stating whoever it was who took the silver from the caravan of Aššūr-mālik, my kšdt, and 3 minas silver from the caravan of Buṣiya which they promised to pay,-- kutanina-ma(???). To Pūšu-kēn: My dear brother, the terms of the silver they mtd(?). Seal the silver and send it to me. Do not disappoint me.

src: i-su-ur-tum sa tar-ma-na sa 8.33333 ma-na 1.75 GIN KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su a-na 12 ma-na i-tur4 SA.BA 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa PUZUR-a-sur 6 ma-na i-a-um 8 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa li-bi4 GAL si-se-e 4 ma-na si-ib-tum SU.NIGIN 12 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-ti GAL si-se-e u a si-ti-su il5-qe 2.5 ma-na 7.5 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im KU.GI is-ti be-el a-lim{ki} il5-qe su-pa-nam ha-ba-as-tam u ka-ta-pa-am sa KU.BABBAR e-zi-ib-sum IGI a-hu-qar si-im 8 TUG SIG5 sa i-na E.GAL-lim il5-qe-u a-ha-ma si-im 2 TUG sa is-ra-tim 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR E ka-ri-im il5-qe si-im 40 na-ru-uq GIG si-im-ti-a 4.5 GIN.TA a-ka-ar-pi-tim 12 ma-na KU.BABBAR si-im-sa mi-ma a-nim KI PUZUR4-a-sur
tgt: (Was die (Schuld)urkunde (auf den Namen) des Tarmānā über 8⅓ Minen 1¾ Seqel (betrifft), so ist das Silber und der Zins dazu zu (einer Summe von) 12 Minen angestiegen. Davon gehören 6 Minen Silber dem Puzuraššur, (und) 6 Minen mir. 8 Minen Silber (betrug) die Schuld des Pferdemeisters, 4 Minen (sind) Zins: Insgesamt 12 Minen Silber hat vom Pferdmeister und dessen Frau er erhalten. 2½ Minen 7½ Seqel Silber: (dieses) Silber, den Preis für Gold, hat er vom ,,Stadtherren'' erhalten. Einen Dolch (?), eine (Dolch)scheide (?) und ein Halfter aus Silber hat er ihm (dem Stadtherren) (als Geschenk) überlassen. Vor Aḫûqar. Den Preis für acht gute Stoffe, den er (P) im Palast erhalten hat, außerdem den Preis für zwei Stoffe vom Zehnten, 1 Mine Silber, hat er (P) im bīt kārim erhalten. (Was) den Preis für 40 Sack Gerste meines Anteils zu je 4½ Seqel pro Krug (betrifft): 12 Minen Silber ist der Preis dafür. Dies alles (befindet sich) bei Puzuraššur.

src: 16 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ha-nu sa-ta-na ti-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa qar-wi-a u kur-ub-ISTAR a-na 3 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1 GIN.TA.TA si-ib-tam i ITU.KAM u-sa-ab IGI a-sur-{d}UTU-si IGI im-li-ka-a IGI en-na-nim
tgt: Šāt-Anna owes 16 shekels refined silver to Ḫānu. From the ḫamuštum of Qarwiya and Kurub-Ištar he has 3 weeks to pay. If he does not pay 1 shekel will be added per month in interest. Witnesses: Aššur-Šamši, Imlikaya, Ennanim.

src: um-ma PUZUR-a-sur-ma a-na ba-sa-a-a-ma is-tu SAG {ITU}qa-ra-a-tim li-mu-um su-hu-bu-ur DUMU e-la-li a-na si-bu-ti-a u-la te-i-li u a-na-ku a si-bu-ti-ka u-la e-i-li a pu-ti be-el sa-al-ti-a la ta-za-za-am u a-na-ku u-la a-za-za-kum i-na pu-uh-ri-a la tu-sa-ab u a-na-ku i-na pu-uh-ri-ka u-la u-sa-ab IGI ra-bi-a-sur IGI en-nam-a-sur DUMU kar-ri-a IGI en-nam-a-sur DUMU me-ra-li
tgt: Puzur-Aššur to Basaya: From the beginning of the month qarra'ātum in the economy of Šu-Ḫubur s. Elāli, you shall not appear for my testimony and I will not appear for your testimony. You shall not stand for me against my adversary and I will not stand for you. You shall not sit at my assembly and I will not sit at your assembly. Witnesses: Rabi-Aššur s. Karriya, Ennam-Aššur s. Mera-ilī.

src: um-ma kur-ub-ISTAR-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma ma-la TUG.HI.A u AN.NA u tup-pe-e sa DAM.GAR-re-e sa is-mi-ti-DINGIR sa ip-qi-du-ni-ku-ni te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam uz-ni pi-te-e u a-na DUG-si-la-a-sur su-up-ur-ma um-ma a-ta-ma 60 {TUG}ku-ta-ni SIG5 wa-at-ru-tim u 6 {TUG}a-ba-ar-ni-e na-as-a-ku-um u-la a-ta a-na pa-ni-a si-a-am u-la ma <gap> su-up-ra-ma TUG.HI.A u si-ti AN.NA <big_gap> u ANSE.HI.A la-ap-qi-su-um 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR ga-am-ra-am sa a-lim{ki} a-na e-li-ti-ka i-di-u a-ma-kam a-na DUG-si-la-a-sur su-up-ur-ma ma-la KU.BABBAR a-na a-wi-ti-ka i-ka-su-du-ka-ni a-na pa-ni-ka lu-se-bi4-lam ku zu a-ni-am 2.5 GIN sa <gap> ba a la
tgt: From Kurub-Ištar to Aššur-nādā: Send me word about how many textiles and how much tin and what tablets concerning commission agents of Iṣmid-ilum they have entrusted to you. Inform me; then write to Ṭāb-ṣill-Aššur, saying: "He is on his way to you with 60 extra-fine kutānu-textiles plus 6 abarniu-textiles." You should either leave yourself to come to me or send Kura, so I may entrust the textiles plus the rest of the tin and the donkeys to him. They have imposed on 20 minas of silver expenses imposed by the City on your enterprise. Write there to Ṭāb-ṣill-Aššur that he should send to you whatever silver will accrue to you for the value of your shipment. I shall place 12 1/2 shekels of silver within the saddle.

src: 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa me-ra-su ki-nu-a sa a-sur-be-el-ma-al-ki-im su-e-ta-ta ip-tu-ru i-se-er a-sur-be-el-ma-al-ki-im su-e-ta-ta i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-la-hi-im u bu-zi-a a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im u-sa-ab ITU.KAM ka-an-wa-ar-ta li-mu-um su-ka-li-a DUMU me-na-nim IGI a-sur-SIPA IGI qar-dum-{d}IM
tgt: Aššur-bēl-malkim owes Suetata 1/2 minas refined silver, with which Aššur-bēl-malkim released his son Kinua from Suetata. He will pay 13 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Al-aḫum and Buziya. If he does not pay (on time) he will add (interest) according to the rate of the colony. Witnesses: Aššur-rēʾī, Qardum-Adad.

src: 0.83333 ma-na 6 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im 4 {TUG}ku-ta-ni i-na ni-ka-si sa 20 ma-na.TA a-na qa-ti-su sa i-na-a DUMU e-la-li at-hi i-na-a DUMU a-mu-ra-a si-bi4 a-ha-ma 14 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im 1 TUG as-qul-sum SU.NIGIN 1 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR KI i-na-a DUMU e-la-li
tgt: I handed over 56 shekels silver, the price of 4 kutānum textiles, at accountings for 20 minas for the account of Innāya s. Elālī. Innāya s. Ammurāya is my witness. Separately, I paid him 14 shekels silver, the price of 1 textile. In total, Innāya s. Elāli owes 1 mina 10 shekels.

src: KISIB a-bu-um-DINGIR DUMU a-ba KISIB i-di-a-sur a-hi-su KISIB la-qe-ep DUMU i-zi-za-am-DINGIR KISIB a-la-bi-im DUMU a-sur-na-da 9 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-bu-um-DINGIR u i-di-a-sur a-hi-su a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa la-qe-ep u i-li-a-lim li-mu-um i-di-a-sur DUMU ku-bi4-di ITU.KAM ti-i-na-tim 3 ma-na a-na sa-na-at i-sa-qu-lu a-na sa-ni-tim sa-tim 3 ma-na i-sa-qu-lu a-na sa-li-is-tim sa-tim 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-sa-qu-lu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is su-ma la is-qu-lu 1.5 GIN.TA i ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-su-bu KU.BABBAR u-sa-bu-u su-ma tup-pa-am
tgt: Abum-ilī and Idī-Aššur his borther owe Aššur-rē'ī 9 minas refined silver. They will pay interest at a rate of 3 minas per year from the hamuštum week of Lā-qēpum and Ilī-ālum in the year of Idī-Aššur s. Kūb-idī, month Teʾinātum. They will pay 3 minas on the second year. They will pay 3 minas silver on the third year. The silver is bound to the head of their souls. If they do not pay they will add 1 1/2 minas per mina per month. They will pay the silver in full.

src: 4.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er la-wa-tu-ma-an u ta-mu-ur-i-a im-di-DINGIR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-li-a-lim u im-di-DINGIR a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma i-na u4-me-su-nu ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-lu 3 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI a-mur-{d}UTU IGI ba-la-a
tgt: Luwatuman and Tamuria owe Imdi-ilum 4 1/2 minas refined silver. They will pay 13 ḫamuštum weeks from the week of Ili-ālim and Imdi-ilum. If they do not pay at the fulfillment of their term, they will add 3 shekels per mina per month as interest. The silver is bound to whomever is financially solvent. Witnesses: Amur-Šamaš, Bala

src: a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma um-ma i-di-ISTAR-ma is-tu a-na tur4-hu-mi-it e-ru-bu 10 GU URUDU i-na ba-ab-ti-ka am-hu-ur si-ti ba-ab-ti-ka a-na 20 u4-me u-za-ka-ma a-na SIG5 u-ta-ar ANSE.HI.A u i-li se-ri-a-ma URUDU SIG5 pa-ni-a-ma sa u-ka-nu a-sar ma-la-ki-im mi-li-ik a-sa-me-ma URUDU i-na bu-ru-us-ha-tim ta-ab <gap> GU 20 ma-na AN.NA sa i li-bi4-a i-ba-si um-ma i-li-a-lum-ma a-na bu-ru-us-ha-tim lu-se-ri-ib um-ma a-na-ku-ma ba-lu-um te-er-ti a-wi-li-im la tu-se-ra-ab um-ma su-ut-ma su-ma AN.NA sa a-bi4-ka la ta-da-nam sa a-la-hi-im di-na-ma a-la-ha-am la-ag-mi-il5 um-ma a-na-ku-ma te-er-tum li-ba-al-ki-tam 10 GU URUDU i-si-im AN.NA al-qe-ma i-ba-si URUDU-i-ka 20 GU na-di 2 tup-pe su-ha-ru-um sa a-sur-i-mi-ti ub-la-ku-um si-a-ma-ti-ka u-za-ka-ma a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum e-ra-ab a-ni a-ma-kam a te-er-ti-ka u-qa-a
tgt: To Aššur-nādā from Iddin-Ištar: After I arrived in Durhumit I received 10 talents of copper from your outstanding claims. Now, I shall await your orders there.

src: i-na 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR u si-ba-ti-su sa a-mur-a-sur a-na a-sur-SIPA ha-bu-lu is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa da-da-nim u a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim i-na SA.BA 5 ma-na 12 GIN KU.BABBAR a-sur-SIPA il5-qe IGI ab-la-ma-si IGI en-na-nim
tgt: Witnesses: Ab-lamassī, Ennanim.

src: KISIB a-sur-SIPA DUMU a-sur-is-ti-kal KISIB DU10-a-sur DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR KISIB a-sur-na-da DUMU ir-nu-id sa 0.66666 ma-na 6.5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er a-sur-na-da DUMU ir-nu-id a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-li-a-lim u a-ni-nim su-su-en i-la-kam-ma uk-ta-nu ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-na-da DUMU ir-nu-id
tgt: Seals: Aššur-rēʾī s. Aššuriš-tikal, Ṭāb-Aššur s. Puzur-Ištar, Aššur-nādā s. Irnuit. Aššur-nādā s. Irnuit owes Aššur-rēʾī 2/3 mina 6 1/2 shekels silver. Regarding the debt of Aššur-nādā s. Irnuit.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma la-ma-si-ma ta-sa-me-ma ta-ni-is-tum il5-te-mi-in a-hu-um a-na a-hi-im a-na ha-la-tim i-za-az ku-ta-bi-it-ma u al-kam-ma ku-ur-si-ka pa-ri-ir su-ha-ar-tam a-na su-un-a-sur su-ku-un i-na a-lim{ki} SIG.HI.A wa-aq-ra-at i-nu-mi KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na ta-sa-ka-na-ni i-na qe-ra-ab SIG.HI.A su-uk-nam KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na sa wa-si-ti-ka sa tu-se-bi4-la-ni mu-si-um e-ri-su-ni-ma a su-mi-ka pa-al-ha-ku-ma u-la a-di-in um-ma a-na-ku-ma li-mu-um li-ru-ba-ma E-be-tam li-pu-ug a-ha-at-ka <gap> GEME a-na si-mi-im ta-di-in-ma a-na-ku a-na 14 GIN ap-tu-ur-si sa-lim-a-hu-um 2 se-na E-be-te-en is-tu a-ta tu-us-u e-ta-pa-as ne-nu-ma a-na ma-ti ne-pa-as TUG sa a-sur-ma-lik i-na pa-ni-tim ub-la-ni KU.BABBAR mi-in la tu-se-ba-lam
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Lamassī: Each man stands prepared to swallow his neighbor. Place the girl on the lap of Aššur. Wool is scarce in the city. When you set a mina silver for me, put it within the wool. The mina of silver for your exit tax which you sent me, the exit regulators demanded it, and fearing for your reputation I did not give it. Your sister sold a maid but I liberated her for 14 shekels. Šalim-aḫum had built two houses before you left. As for us, when will we build? As for the textiles which Aššur-mālik took earlier, why have you not sent the silver?

src: 1 ma-na 1.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um 4 ma-na URUDU SIG5 sa-bu-ru-um ha-bu-ra-ba-i-a-am i-se-er ku-na-ni-a la-qe-ep i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-ku-nim u PUZUR4-a-sur a-na 5 ITU.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u-me-e ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na KU.BABBAR si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI en-um-a-sur IGI bu-ur-ISTAR
tgt: Kunaniya owes Lā-qēpum 1 mina 1 1/2 shekels silver (and) 4 minas fine ḫaburabayyum copper in pieces. He will pay 5 months from the ḫamuštum week of Ikūnum and Puzur-Aššur. If he does not pay at the fulfillment of the term, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest. Witnesses: Ennum-Aššur, Būr-Ištar.

src: a-na i-ku-pi-a en-nam-a-sur u su-mi-a-bi4-a qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma a-na e-nam-a-sur u su-mi-a-bi-a qi-bi4-ma 16 mu-ta-tim sa 1 GU.TA 7 e-li-a-tum sa 30 ma-na.TA e-zi-ib sa PUZUR4.ISTAR u 6 ANSE sa-la-me ap-qi-da-ku-nu-ti SA.BA 1 GU 25 ma-na URUDU sa is-ti u-su-ur-sa-a-sur al-qe-u a-na i-ku-pi-a u-se-bi-il5-ku-nu 1 GU 12 ma-na URUDU sa en-um-a-sur 1 GU 20 ma-na sa a-su-mi PUZUR4.ISTAR a-pu-lu-ka si-ti URUDU 15.5 GU 3 ma-na SA.BA 5.5 GU 3 ma-na URUDU sa DAM.GAR si-mu-um i-ba-la-ka-ta-ma 15.5 GU URUDU DAM.GAR i-sa-qa-lam u ga-me-er a-wa-ti-a en-um-a-sur-ma URUDU e ta-as-ba-at ba-lu-um mi-ma 15.5 GU URUDU sa tup-pu-su ha-ar-ma-am u-ka-lu DAM.GAR e it-ba-al-ma e tu-re-i-qa-ni si-ti URUDU 10 GU ku-na-na-ma-i-um u 6 ANSE um-ma a-na-ku-ma al-kam lu-sa-qi-il5-ka-ma at-kal tu-ni-a-ni-ma um-ma a-ta-ma i-na 10 GU URUDU u 6 ANSE qa-ti la-as-ku-un-ma i-na tur4-hu-mi-it a-na URUDU SIG5 lu-ta-er-ma a-na ka-ni-is lu-bi-il5-ma sa ki-ma ku-a-ti KU.BABBAR-pi lu-sa-bi-u-ni URUDU u ANSE.HI.A u-la u-sa-qi-il5-ka mi-su sa um-ma a-ta-ma la sa-qu-la-ku ANSE.HI.A sa i-ku-pi-a ANSE.HI.A wa-se-er-su-um a-si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-ka a-na-ku a-za-za-kum a-sur <big_gap> u {d}MAR.TU i-li a-bi-ni lu i-de8-a a-se-er na-ru-qa-ka u-sa-zi-za-ku-ni a-hi-um pu-ru-i u-la is-ku-un a-ta i-na ka-ar ka-ar-ma pu-ru-i ta-as-ta-na-kan
tgt: To Ikuppia, Ennam-Aššur and Sumi Abiya from Aššur-Nada; to Ennam-Aššur and Sumi-Abiya: I entrusted to you 16 half-packs of each 1 talent (and) 7 top-packs of 30 minas, apart from those belonging to Puzur-Ištar, plus 6 black donkeys. Thereof I sent with you 1 talent 25 minas of copper, that 1 received from Úsur-ša-Aššur, to Ikuppia. 1 talent 12 minas of copper belonging to Ennam-Aššur; 1 talent 20 minas which I balanced with you on behalf of Puzur-Ištar--- the rest of the copper: 15 1/2 talents 3 minas. Thereof 5 1/2 talents 3 minas of copper belong to the tamkārum. When the sale has been carried out the tamkārum will pay me 15 112 talents. And the one who resolved my dispute was Ennam-Aššur, so do not seize anycopper, and without any (authorisation) the tamkārum must not appropriate the 15 1/2 talents ofcopper for which I hold a certified tablet, lest you let it get out of my reach. As for the rest of the copper, 10 talents from Kunanamit plus the 6 donkeys, I said: "Come, I shall pay you"-so I trusted you, but you cheated me, saying: "I shall lay claim to the 10 talents of copper and the 6 donkeys, turn that into copper of good quality in Durhumit, bring it to Kaneš and your representatives will pay me in full in silver." I did not payout the copper and the donkeys to you. Why did you then say: "I have been paid." The donkeys belong to Ikuppia! Release the donkeys to him! For the rest of your silver I shall personally guarantee for you. may Aššur and Amurrum, the gods of our fathers, know: on top of the fact that I guaranteed for your joint-stock capital, it was no stranger who denounced me! It is you who keep denouncing me in colony after colony!

src: 2 GU 50 ma-na URUDU SIG5 sa-bu-ra-am i-se-er en-nam-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> a-hu-wa-qar i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa {d}UTU-ba-ni u a-sur-ma-lik a-na 32 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 ma-na.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 GU-tim u-sa-ab ITU.KAM te-i-na-tum li-mu-um PUZUR4-{d}MUS IGI a-mur-{d}UTU IGI dan-a-sur
tgt: en-nam-xxx owes Aḫu-waqar 2 talents 50 minas fine copper scraps. He will pay thirty two weeks from the ḫamuštum of Šamaš-bāni and Aššur-mālik. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 minas per talent per month (as interest). Month: Teʾinātim. Eponymate: Puzur-Niraḫ. Witnesses: Amur-Šamaš, Dān-Aššur.

src: 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR i li-bi4 su-mi-a-bi4-a ah-sa-lim i-su-u is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-la-hi-im a-na ITU.3.KAM i-sa-qal-su-ma su-ma la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab KU.BABBAR a-su-mi a-sur-ba-as-ti e-pu-ul IGI a-sur-SIG5 IGI en-um-a-sur
tgt: Šumī-abiya owes 2/3 mina silver to Aḫ-šalim From the ḫamuštum of Al-aḫim he must pay. If he does not pay the word of the colony will be added in interest because of the silver. Because of the silver Aššur-bāštī will be satisfied. Witnesses: Aššur-damiq, Ennum-Aššur

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma la-ma-si-ma KU.BABBAR sa a-na i-li-is-ti-kal a-na se-im sa-a-mi-im ta-di-nu-ni wa-di i-li-is-ti-kal se-am u-la i-sa-am-ni-a-ti
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Lamassī: Make known the silver which you gave to Iliš-tīkal for purchasing grain. Iliš-tīkal did not buy grain for us.

src: 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er DINGIR-mu-ta-pi-il5 id-na-a-a i-su is-tu ITU.KAM kan-war-ta a-na e-ti-su i-sa-qal li-mu-um DINGIR-pi-la-ah DUMU da-am-qi-im IGI {d}EN.ZU-na-me-er IGI GAL-be-lim IGI su-hu-bur
tgt: Ilī-mutabbil owes Idnāya 1/2 mina refined silver. He will pay ettišu from the month of Kanwarta. Eponymate: DINGIR-pilaḫ s. Damqum. Witnesses: Sîn-namer, Rab-bēlum, Šū-Ḫubur.

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-be-eh DUMU en-na-nim KISIB su-ka-li-a DUMU a-mur-a-sur KISIB a-sur-ba-ni DUMU sa-lim-a-sur KISIB a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU a-ta-a sa hu-bu-ul PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU a-ta-a 12.33333 ma-na 0.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-i-mi-ti a-na 36 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-1 ma-na-em i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab AN.NA-kam a-sur-i-mi-ti a-hu-su u su-a-num ni-a-um u-se-si-u-su-um tup-pa-am a-nim sa a-sur-pi-la-ah DUMU a-sur-ba-ni DUMU sa-lim-a-sur u a-mu-ra-a DUMU su-ka-li-a DUMU a-mur-a-sur ku-nu-ki sa 4 ma-<gap> <big_gap> <gap>-su-nu-ti <big_gap> <gap>-ma a-wi-li-<gap> <big_gap> <gap>-ma <big_gap> a-nim <big_gap> i-ba-ri-a-ti-<gap> <big_gap> u <big_gap> <gap>-mi bi-it-<gap> <big_gap> tup-pi-im a-nim i-qi-<big_gap> u e-<big_gap>-um ik-nu-ku
tgt: Seals of PUZUR₄-a-bé-eḫ s. Ennanim, Sukkallīya s. Amur-Aššur, Aššur-bāni s. Šalim-Aššur, Aššur-imittī s. Attaya He will pay thirty six weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-imittī. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest).

src: KISIB a-sur-ma-lik DUMU er-ra-a KISIB e-la-li DUMU i-pi-li-is KISIB a-sur-i-di DUMU ku-ku-la-nim KISIB i-ku-pi-a DUMU su-su-en6 1.66666 ma-na 1 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-ma-lik DUMU er-ra-a DAM.GAR-ru-um i-su-u is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU zu-pa-la-li ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU DINGIR-ba-ni 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab
tgt: Seals: Aššur-mālik s. Errāyaa, Elāli s. i-pí-li-is, Aššur-Idī s. Kukkulānim, Ikuppiya s. Šū-Suen. Aššur-mālik s. Errāya owes the merchant 1 2/3 minas 1 shekel refined silver. From the ḫamuštum of Aššur-imittī s. Zupa-lali. Month: ḫubur. Eponymate: Aššur-imittī s. Ilī-bāni. He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: 3.6666600000000003 ma-na 8 GIN KU.BABBAR sa tam-ka-ri-im a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 sa-ha-ar-li u i-di-ku-bu-um il5-qe-u is-tu ha-ra-nim i-tu-ru-ni-ma 0.66666 ma-na 8 GIN KU.BABBAR-ap-su tam-ka-ru-um i-la-qe-ma ne-ma-lam 3 su-nu i-zu-zu KU.BABBAR eq-lam a-su-mi 3 su-nu-ti e-ti-iq KU.BABBAR a-num sa a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 IGI a-tu-ma-an DUMU a-sur-la-ma-si IGI ma-nu-ba-lum-a-sur DUMU na-ab-su-en6 IGI a-sur-ma-lik DUMU su-en6-na-da
tgt: Witnesses: Adumna s. Aššur-lamassī, Mannum-bālum-Aššur s. Nabi-Suen, Aššur-mālik s. Suen-nādā.

src: 66 {TUG}ku-ta-nu DUB a-sur-na-da la-ap-ta 41 {TUG}ku-ta-nu sa DAM.GAR 7 TUG sa a-ki-di-e 4 TUG wa-ar-su-tum 3 TUG ma-as-u-tum 4 {TUG}ku-si-a-tum <big_gap> {TUG}na-ma-su-hu 1 TUG ka-ab-tum 1 {TUG}a-bar-ni-um 1 {TUG}ta-ku-us-tu-um <gap> {TUG}ku-ta-nu sa i-di-<gap> <big_gap> 44 TUG.HI.A i-ba-si-u 3 TUG ta-ad-mi-iq-tum i-ba-si-a-ma
tgt: 66 kutānu-textiles marked with Aššur-nādā's seal, 41 kutānu-textiles belonging to the merchant, 7 Akkadian textiles, 4 dirty textiles, 3 washed textiles, 4 kusītu-textiles, x namaššuhu-textiles, 1 heavy textile, 1 abarniu-textile, 1 takuštāu-textile, x kutānu-textiles belonging to Iddin- ... , in all (x+) 44 textiles x+3 textiles are available as

src: 1.3333300000000001 ma-na 6.5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er la-qe-ep DUMU sa-du-ha-nim la-qe-ep DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-ku-nim u PUZUR4-a-sur 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab IGI na-ra-am-ZU IGI li-pa-a IGI ku-na-ni-a
tgt: Lāqēp s. Šaduḫanum owes Lāqēp s. Puzur-Ištar 1 1/3 minas 6 1/2 shekels silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest) from the ḫamuštum of Ikūnum and Puzur Aššur. Witnesses: Naram-Suen, Libbaya, Kunānīya.

src: KISIB DUG-si-la-a-sur DUMU su-nu-nu KISIB su-la-ba-an DUMU a-al-DUG KISIB pi-la-ah-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-ba-ni KISIB a-ni-na DUMU u-sur-sa-a-sur KISIB i-di-a-bi4-im DUMU a-sur-ma-lik KISIB su-e-a DUMU pu-su-ke-en6 KISIB bu-za-zu DUMU pu-su-ke-en6 KISIB i-ku-pa-sa DUMU pu-su-ke-en6 KISIB a-ha-ha DUMU.SAL pu-su-ke-en6 40 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa i-ku-pi-a DUMU a-ta-a i-na ka-ni-is{ki} a-na pu-su-ke-en6 i-hi-ib-lu-ma a-sur-mu-ta-bil u be-la-nu-um ra-bi-su-um KU.BABBAR il5-qe-u-ni a-na KU.BABBAR su-a-ti me-er-u pu-su-ke-en6 u DUMU.SAL pu-su-ke-en6 NIN.DINGIR a-na a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5 a-hi-su-nu u-la i-tu-ru u i-na e-la-i-su i-na ka-ni-is{ki} tup-pa-am sa hu-bu-ul i-ku-pi-a DUMU a-ta-a me-er-u pu-su-ke-en6 u DUMU.SAL pu-su-ke-en6 NIN.DINGIR a-na a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5 i-du-nu ma-la di-in a-lim{ki} KU.BABBAR me-er-u pu-su-ke-en6 u DUMU.SAL pu-su-ke-en6 sa-bu-u i-di-a-bu-um DUMU a-sur-ma-lik ki-ma a-ha-ha i-zi-iz
tgt: Seal of Ṭāb-ṣilla-Aššur son of Šū-Nunu, seal of Šū-Laban son of Āl-ṭāb, seal of Pilaḫ-Ištar son of Aššur-bāni, seal of Anina son of Uṣur-ša-Aššur, seal of Idī-abum son of Aššur-mālik, seal of Sueyya son of Pūšu-kēn, seal of Buzāzu son of Pūšu-kēn, seal of Ikūppaša son of Pūšu-kēn, seal of Aḫaḫa daugher of Pūšu-kēn. The sons of Pūšu-kēn and the daughter of Pūšu-kēn, the ugbābtum-priestess, will not return to (did not return to?) their brother Aššur mutabbil for the silver--the 40 minas silver which Ikūppiya son of Attaya owed to Pūšu-kēn in Kaneš and Aššur-mutabbil and which Bēlānum the attorney received. Now, right at his ascent to Kanesh, the sons of Pūš-kēn and the daughter of Pūšu-kēn, the ugbābtum-priestess, will give the tablet stating the debt of Ikūppiya son of Attaya to Aššur-mutabbil. According to the verdict of the city, the sons of Pūšu-kēn and the daughter of Pūšu-kēn are paid (their) silver in full. Iddin-abum son of Aššur-mālik stood for Aḫaḫa.

pi-la-ah-ISTAR DUMU <big_gap> tup-pu-um a-ni-um me-he-er tup-pe ha-ru-mu-tim
tgt: From the 6 minas silver which Aššur-mutabbil s. Šū-Anum owes me, 2 1/2 minas silver is late. Witnesses: Ennānum the soldier (?), Āl-ṭāb s. Anali. According to his sealed tablet from the hamuštum week of Ikūnum s. Samaya, previously the term was surpassed by a year, interest on the 2 1/2 minas silver you will not read to him. 8 minas 45 shekels refined silver Lipit-Istar s. Maṣi-ilī owes to Imdi-ilum. Regarding the debt of his father he will pay. Witnesses: Pūšu-kēn s. Sueyya, Kunāya s. Abusa(?), Šū-Bēlum s. Puzur-šaduʾe. Adad-rēṣī s. Puzur-Anna owes (Imdi-ilum(?)) 4 minas 5 shekels silver. Witnesses: .. s. Amur-Naḫuš. From the hamuštum week of Aššur-mālik and Amur-Ištar their term has elapsed, 15 minas silver Aššur-emūqī s. Ikūnum owes. Witnesses: Idnāya s. Salliya, Ikūnum s. Il-bāni. I received 8 minas silver from his debt as exchange(?). Šū-Laban s. Baziya owes 2/3 minas silver. From the ḫamuštum week of s. Elālī and Šalim-Aššur, he will pay x minas per annum. Witnesses: Pūšu-kēn s. Sueyya, Amur-Aššur s. Ilī-ālum, Aššur-taklāku s. Šū-Enlil.

src: 8.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki <gap> <big_gap> sa sa-lim-a-hi-im i-li-as-ra-ni a-na sa-lim-a-hi-im u-bi-il5 IGI en-na-ni-a IGI NIN.SUBUR ba-ni DUMU a-sur-ma-lik <gap> sa <gap> <big_gap>
tgt: Ilī-ašrannī took 8 1/3 minas silver under (our?) seals belonging to Šalim-aḫum, to Šalim-aḫum. Witnesses: Ennaniya, Ilabrat-bāni s. Aššur-mālik

src: 3 ne-pi-su 55 ma-na ku-nu-ku sa pu-su-ke-en6 sa-du-a-su sa-bu 1 ne-pi-sum 15 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ku-su GAL ik-ri-bu sa a-sur 1 su-pa-num 0.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR se-bu-ul-ta-sa 10 ma-na SIG.HI.A 2 i-lu a-si-ru-um mi-ma a-nim a-na a-gu5-a ap-qi-id IGI su-ma-li-bi-a-sur DUMU ku-uz-ku-zi-im IGI i-ku-pi-a-sur DUMU PUZUR.ISTAR IGI sa-lim-a-sur DUMU i-tur4-DINGIR 5 GIN KU.BABBAR u-ku-ul-ti su-ha-ri u qa-qa-da-tim sa-bu
tgt: 3 packages: 55 minas under the seal of Pūšu-kēn, his charges paid, 1 package 15 minas silver under his large seal, the ikribum-offering of Aššur, 1 supānum-container: 50 shekels silver its consignment, 10 minas wool (in) 2 leather sacks, a net(?), all this I entrusted to Agua. Witnesses: Šumma-libbi-Aššur son of Kuzkzum, Ikuppi-Aššur son of Puzur-Ištar, Šalim-Aššur son of Itūr-ilī. 5 shekels silver (for) the provisions of the 'boys'and their head-tax paid.

src: 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-zu u ha-pu-a-su a-sur-i-di i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa kur-ub-ISTAR a-na 23 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu a-na 1 ma-na-im 3 GIN.TA u-su-bu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ke-ni-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI ha-al-ki-a-su DUMU ar-ku-li-a IGI su-ISTAR DUMU a-zu-da IGI zu-zu-li
tgt: Azu and Ḫappu-asu owe Aššur-idī 5 minas refined silver. They will pay 23 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Kurub-Ištar. If they do not pay (on time), they will add 3 shekels per mina (per month as interest).

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-ma-lik-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma URUDU i-na li-bi4-ka-ma sa-ba-at is-tu 3 ITU.KAM 14 GU URUDU as-qu-ul-su-um a-na-ku u su-mi-a-bi4-a sa-zu-uz-ti a-wi-lim i-na u4-mi-im <gap> sa na-as-pe-er-ta-ka as-me-u DUMU a-wi-lim u-ma-li-ma <gap> um-ma a-na-ku-ma sa-zu-uz-ti a-bi-ka a-na-ku lu URUDU lu KU.BABBAR ma-la i-ba-si-u a-ni-qam 8 GU URUDU SIG5 4.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR ni-is-ba-at-ma i-na ku-nu-ki su-ma-bi4-a u ku-nu-ki-a ni-ik-nu-uk-ma E-be-et ka-ri-a na-di sa 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR lu-qu-tum i-sa-ma sa-ab-ta-at a-na wa-su-ri-sa is-tap-ru u si-a-ti i-la-kam-ma ni-sa-ba-si 4 GU URUDU SIG5 i-na u-la-ma E-be-et ku-ra-ra na-di u su-a-ti ni-sa-par-ma ni-sa-ba-su
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Aššur-mālik: You wrote me. You said, "The copper from your account has been seized." I paid to him 14 talents of tin three months ago. As for myself and Šumi-abiya, on the day that I heard your letter, the man's son paid the certified agent(s) of the man and I said, "Your father is my agent." As for me, copper and silver as much as their are, 8 talents of fine copper, 4 minas and 45 shekels of silver, we seized and we sealed them with seal of Šumi-abiya and my seal and deposited them in my inn. He purchased merchandise worth 6 minas silver and (the merchandise) was seized. They sent it for its release. Now, they will go and we will seize (the goods). 4 talents of fine copper is deposited in my inn at Ulama. Now, we will write to them and we will seize him.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma dan-a-sur-ma a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta a-na sa-al-tim la ta-sa-ki-ni-a-ti URUDU sa E.GAL-lim a-di u4-mi-im a-ni-im i-ta-na-pu-lu-ni-a-ti u i-a-ti mu-ur-su-um im-qu-tam-ma a-di a-ni a-su-hu-ur sa-al-ma-ku mi-ma li-ba-ka la i-pa-ri-id a-di 5 u4-me u-ta-qa-ma su-ma URUDU sa E.GAL-lim la i-ta-sa-am ka-ki a-la-qe-ma a bu-ru-us-ha-tim a-ta-la-ak
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Dān-Aššur: My dear father and lord, do not treat me harshly. Regarding the copper at the palace, until this day they are putting us off. As for me, an illnes beset me and until now I was stuck (here). But I am (now) well. Don't be overly concerned. I will wait 5 more days, and if the copper of the palace does not come out, I will take my weapon and depart for Purušḫattum.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hi-im-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-se-er KU.BABBAR <big_gap> tu-se-bi-la-ni <big_gap> te9-er-ti-ka u <big_gap> 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR nu-<gap> <big_gap> AN.NA sa <gap> <big_gap> i-ba-si zu-<gap> <big_gap> i-na wa-si-im <big_gap> ni-ta-ra-da-kum <big_gap> sa <gap> <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> sa ILLAT <big_gap> a-di-ni i-ni-<gap> <big_gap> a-se-er su-ha-ri-im e-ka li-li-ik i-na tup-pi-im sa si-ma-at <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> tup-pa-am i-<gap> <big_gap>
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum-ma to Pūšu-kēn: Regarding the silver ... which you sent ... your instructions and .. n10 minas silver .. we ... Tin which ... is available. ... at the departure ... we will dispatch to you. ... broken .... ... of the caravan ... until now ... Please keep an eye on the boy. In the tablet containing the will of .... tablet ...

src: KISIB a-sur-i-di DUMU a-sur-ma-lik KISIB as-qu-dim DUMU a-sur-re-si 3.6666600000000003 GIN 15 SE KU.BABBAR li-ti i-se-er as-qu-dim DUMU a-sur-re-si mu-za ti-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa u-su-ur-sa-ISTAR ITU.KAM si-pi-im li-mu-um i-di-a-hu-um a-na ITU.2.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul i ITU.KAM-im 0.16666 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab
tgt: Asqudim s. Aššur-rëṣī owes Muza 2/3 shekels 15 grains of quality silver. He will pay two months from ḫamustum of Uṣur-ša-Ištar, month ṣipʾem, eponymate Iddin-ahum. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 0.167 shekels per month as interest.

src: 9.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-e-a DUMU pu-su-ke-en6 a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5 i-su si-im AN.NA-ki-su sa se-ep en-um-a-sur IGI su-su-en6 IGI a-sur-ba-ni IGI ni-mar-ISTAR DUMU PUZUR4-su-en6 IGI ma-nu-ba-lum-a-sur DUMU a-gu5-tim KU.BABBAR i-na ka-ni-is i-sa-qal IGI a-wi-li a-ni-u-tim KU.BABBAR i li-bi4-su a-di-i si-bu-ka
tgt: Aššur-mutabbil owed Sueyya s. Pūšu-kēn 9 1/3 minas refined silver. The price of his tin from the cargo of Ennum-Aššur, in the presence of Šū-Suen, Aššur-bāani, Nimar-Ištar s. Pzur-Suen, Mannum-bālum-Aššur s. Akūtum, he will pay the silver in Kanesh. I deposited the silver before these men in his (silver).

src: 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-na {d}EN.LIL-ba-ni DINGIR-is-ti-kal i-di-in is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-i-mi-ti u a-sur-GAL a-na 4 sa-na-at 8 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal ITU.KAM na-ar-ma-ak a-sur li-mu-um sa qa-ti su-da-a ma-la il5-qe-u KU.BABBAR a-na su-mi na-ru-qi-su il5-qe ma-la {d}EN.LIL-ba-ni i-ka-su-du u DINGIR-is-ti-kal ma-la-su-ma i-la-qe-ma u na-ru-qu-um a E DINGIR-is-ti-kal e-ra-ab IGI la-li-im IGI en-na-nim
tgt: Iliš-tīkal gave 4 minas refined silver to Enlil-bāni. From the hamuštum-week of Aššur-imittī and Aššur-rabi, he will pay 8 minas in 4 years. Month: Narmak Aššur. Eponymate: The one after the year of Šudāya. As much as he takes he will receive to the name of his narruqum. As much as Enlil-bāni 'treads' and Ilš-tīkal, as much as (there is?) to him, he will receive with the result that his joint stock fund will enter into the house of Iliš-tīkal. Witnesses: Lālum, Ennānum.

src: KISIB wa-bar-tim sa sa-la-ti-wa-ar wa-bar-tum sa sa-la-ti-wa-ar <big_gap> di-nam i-di-ma i-na 1 GU 30 ma-na URUDU SIG5 sa ba-al-tu-a u {d}UTU-e-nam a-na a-sur-i-di DUMU DINGIR-na-da ip-qi-du-ni KU.BABBAR i-na si-im URUDU ma-la iz-ku-a-ni ba-al-tu-a i-ka-na-ak-ma {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li ba-al-tu-a u {d}UTU-e-nam a-na a-sur-i-di i-pa-qi-du-ma ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um e-na-su-en6 a-na 2 ITU.KAM a-na ka-ni-is i-lu-ku-ma e-ta-u-ma sa KU.BABBAR i-la-qe-u 1 tup-pa-am sa 24 GU 10 ma-na URUDU SIG5 sa hu-bu-ul {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li sa-ni-am tup-pa-am sa 3 GU 55 ma-na URUDU SIG5 sa hu-bu-ul id-na-a-sur u wa-wa-li a-na {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li u {d}UTU-en-nam u-sa-ar
tgt: Seal: trading station of Šalatiwar.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u-ra-a u pi-la-ah-ISTAR qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku-ma a-na qa-ra-be-tim er-ba-ma tup-pi-a pi-te-a-ma se-na tup-pa-an sa hu-bu-ul PUZUR4-su-en6 DUMU a-mu-ra-a 11 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um tup-pa-an ki-la-la-an a-na pi-la-ah-ISTAR i-la-ka tup-pi-en a-na pi-la-ah-ISTAR pi-iq-da-ma u te-er-ta-ku-nu is-ti a-li-ki-im pa-ni-im-ma li-li-kam ki-ma tup-pe-en ta-ap-qi-da-ni
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn, Ūraya and Pilaḫ-Ištar from Aššur-taklāku-ma: Enter into the storeroom and open my tablets so that the 2 tablets concerning the debt of Puzur-Suen son of Ammuraya - 11 minas refined silver, both tablets, come out. Entrust the tablets to Pilaḫ-Ištar so that your message comes with the very next traveler. When you entrust the tablets, ...

src: 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa a-sur-GAL a-na a-sur-DUG ha-bu-lu-ma i-na tup-pi-su DAM.GAR-ra-am il5-pu-tu KU.BABBAR ma-nu-ba-al-ma-a-sur il5-qe su-ma DAM.GAR-ru-um u-ul a-sur-DUG a-na a-sur-GAL i-tu-ar ma-nu-ba-al-ma-a-sur u-ba-ab-su ITU.KAM si-ip-im li-mu-um {d}ISKUR-ba-ni IGI i-ku-pi-a-sur IGI a-sur-la-ma-si i-na ha-mu-us-tim sa a-mur-a-sur DUMU i-li-a KU.BABBAR il5-qe
tgt: Mannum-bālum-Aššur took the 1/3 mina silver which Aššur-rabi owed to Aššur-ṭāb, and about which he wrote the word merchant in his tablet. If the merchant is not Aššur-ṭāb, he will return Aššur-rabi. Mannum-bālum-Aššur will clear him. Month: Ṣipʾum. Eponymate: Adad-bāni. Witnesses: Ikūn-pī-Aššur, Aššur-lamassī. He took the silver during the ḫamuštum of Amur-Aššur s. Iliya.

src: um-ma a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim su-a-sur u a-sur-na-da-ma a-na i-di-su-en6 am-ri-a LUGAL-{d}EN.ZU a-sur-SIPA PUZUR4-su-en6 u PUZUR4-a-na qi-bi-ma is-ti a-sur-SIPA a-na-kam a-sur-be-el-ma-al-ki-im ni-ka-si i-si-ma 45 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ki sa {d}ISKUR.ILLAT-at u a-sur-ba-ni i-na sa-ni-tim su-uq-lim ku-nu-ki sa a-lim{ki} li-di-a-ku-nu-ti-ma 34 ma-na 15 GIN AN.NA su-te-bi-la-ma li-qe-a 15 ma-na 15 GIN AN.NA a-ha-ma za-ku-a-am li-di-na-ku-nu-ti 1 GU 34 ma-na AN.NA li-di-na-ku-nu-ti u 2 TUG su-ra-an a-sur-SIPA li-di-na-ku-nu-ti-ma ba-ti-iq u DIRI di-na-ma KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ka-ma a-na a-li-ki-im pa-ni-e-ma pi-iq-da-ma lu-ub-lam a-sur-be-el-ma-al-ki-im tur4-da-nim a-na i-di-su-en6 qi-bi-ma ma-la a-na-kam pa-ka ta-di-nu-ni-a-ti-ni su-ma a-hu-ni a-ta is-ti a-hi-im u eb-ri-im KU.BABBAR a-na be-a-lim a-na a-sur-be-el-ma-al-ki-im e-ri-is-ma KU a-na se-ri-ni ku-nu-uk-ma se-bi-la-ma a-na-kam bu-la-ti-su lu nu-ta-er-su-ma a-na a-lim{ki} lu ni-it-ru-su su-ma a-na be-a-lim la te-ri-sum bu-la-ti-su la-su
tgt: From Aššur-bēl-awātim, Šū-Aššur and Aššur-nādā to Iddin-Suen, Amria, Šar-Suen, Aššur-rē'ī, Puzur-Suen and Puzur-Anna: Aššur-bēl-malkim has here settled accounts with Aššur-rē'ī, and he must deposit for you 45 minas of tin sealed by Adad-ellat and Aššur-bāni from the second package that bears the seal of the City; then you must have brought 34 minas 15 shekels of tin and take it. Furthermore, he shall give you 15 minas 15 shekels of tin, cleared. In all: Aššur-rē'ī shall give you 1 talent 34 minas of tin and, 2 black textiles and you should sell that at whatever price, seal the silver, entrust it to the very first traveler who can bring Send Aššur-bēl-malkim. To Iddin-Suen: As you gave us your word here, and if you are truly our brother, ask for silver for a working-capital from colleague and friend for Aššur-bēl-malkim, send us the silver under seal and let us here turn over his working-capital to him and send him to the City. If you do not ask for anything for him to dispose over, there will be no working-capital for him.

src: a-sur-pi-la-ah MASKIM sa E a-mur-ISTAR su-en6-SIPA il5-ba-ni a-sur-ni-su u su-la-ba-an me-er-u a-mur-ISTAR ki-ma ra-mi-ni-su-nu u ki-ma ab-sa-lim DUMU.SAL a-mur-ISTAR u i-di-in-{d}ISKUR a-hi-su-nu a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5 bu-za-zu u i-ku-pa-sa me-er-u pu-su-ke-en6 ki-ma ra-mi-ni-su-nu u ki-ma a-ha-ha a-ha-ti-su-nu gu5-ba-ab-tim u su-e-a a-hi-su-nu su-e-a i-na mi-ig-ra-ti-su-nu is-bu-tu-ni-a-ti-ma ni-is a-lim{ki} it-mu-u-ma a-wa-ti-su-nu nu-ga-me-er-ma lu a-mur-ISTAR sa-zu-uz-ti pu-su-ke-en6 i-zi-iz lu pu-su-ke-en6 sa-zu-uz-ti a-mur-ISTAR i-zi-iz lu a-hu-um a-na a-hi-im ma-as-ka-tam u-se-bi-il5 lu a-hu-um sa a-hi-im KU.BABBAR i-na ba-ab-tim il5-qe lu tup-pu-um ha-ar-mu-um sa ku-nu-ki-su-nu lu sa si-be lu si-ip-ka-tum a-hu-um a-na a-hi-im is-pu-uk lu i-na a-lim{ki} lu i-na eq-li-im me-er-u a-mur-ISTAR me-er-at a-mur-ISTAR gu5-ba-ab-tum me-er-u pu-su-ke-en6 u me-er-at pu-su-ke-en6 gu5-ba-ab-tum a-hu-um a-na a-hi-im a-na mi-ma su-mi-su la i-tu-ar u-sa-nu-um DUMU a-mur-a-sur ku-lu-ma-a DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti hu-ni-a DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti DU10-si-la-a-sur DUMU a-sur-i-di PUZUR4-en-na DUMU en-na-a-sur a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku DUMU a-la-hi-im be-la-nu-um DUMU su-a-sur i-di-a-sur DUMU dan-a-sur a-wi-lu a-ni-ut-tu-um ga-me-er a-wa-tim
tgt: Aššur-pilah, the attorney of the estate of Amur-Ištar, Suen-rēʾī, Il-bānī, Aššur-nīšu, and Šū-Laban, sons of Amur-Ištar on their own behalf and on behalf of Ab-šalim, daughter of Amur-Ištar and Iddin-Adad their brother, and Aššur-mutabbil, Buzāzu and Ikūppaša, sons of Pūšu-kēn on their own behalf and on behalf of Aḫaḫa their sister the gubabtum priestess and Sueyya their brother Sueyya seized us in their agreement and swore the oath of the city and concluded their case: Amur-Ištar stood as the legal representative of Pūšu-kēn. Pūšu-kēn stood as the representative of Amur-Ištar. One sent accounts to the other. Each brother accepted silver for the funds of the other. Sealed tablets with their seals or with witnesses or dividends(?) invested in each other. Either in the city or abroad, the sons of Amur-ištar and the daughter of the Amur-Ištar, the gubabtum priestess, and the sons of Pūšu-kēn and the daughter of Pūšu-kēn, the gubabtum priestess, will not return to each other for any matter. The following men were the adjudicators on the matter: Usānum s. Amur-Aššur, Kulumay s. Aššur-imittī, Ḫuniya s. Aššur-imittī, Ṭāb-ṣilla-Aššur s. Aššur-idi, Puzur-enna s. Enna-Aššur, Aššur-taklāku s. Āl-aḫum, Bēlānum s. Šū-Aššur, Idi-Aššur s. Dān-Aššur.

src: 30 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er en-um-a-sur a-sur-e-mu-qi i-su li-mu-um a-la-hu-um ITU.1.KAM kan-bar-ta a-na 4 sa-na-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam i-na ITU.1.KAM-im u-sa-ab IGI a-bu-sa-lim IGI PUZUR4-a-sur IGI su-zu-zu
tgt: Ennum-Aššur owes Aššur-emūqī 30 minas refined silver. He will pay 4 years from eponymate Al=aḫum, month Kanwarta. If he does not pay, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: 7 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er zi-ki DUMU a-sur-SIPA su-mi-a-bi4-a i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa e-la-li u a-sur-is-ta-ki-il5 0.33333 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tim li-mu-um PUZUR4-ni-ra-ah a-li zi-ki a-mu-ru KU.BABBAR-pi a-la-qe IGI da-a-a DUMU pi-la-ah-su-en6 IGI a-bu-sa-lim
tgt: Zigi s. Aššur-rēʾī owes Šumī-abiya 7 shekels refined silver. He will add interest at the rate of 1/3 shekels silver per month from the ḫamuštum of Elāli and Aššuriš-takil. Month: qarrātim Year: Puzur-Niraḫ Wherever I encounter Zigi, I will take my silver. Witnesses: Dāya s. Pilaḫ-Suen, Abu-šalim

src: IGI i-ku-nim DUMU {d}UTU-ba-ni IGI a-sur-is-ti-kal DUMU hi-na-a IGI u-sur-sa-a-sur DUMU a-sur-sa-du-ni ta-ma-la-ku sa lu-zi-na sa a-mur-ISTAR DUMU su-ISTAR u su-a-nim DUMU me-na-nim a-na ab-sa-lim e-zi-bu-ni ta-ma-la-ki a-sur-GAL u-se-si-a-ma ta-ma-la-ki ni-ip-tur4-ma mi-ma KU.BABBAR la i-ba-si ku-nu-ki sa pa-ni ta-ma-la-ki ni-is-ru-um-ma ni-ik-nu-uk-ma a-na sal-mi-hi-im DUMU lu-zi-na ni-di-in
tgt: Witnesses: Ikūnum s. Šamaš-bāni, Aššuriš-tikal s. Ḫinnāya, Uṣur-ša-Aššur s. Aššur-šasuni.

tgt: Thereof, 48 shekels gold from the (funds?) of Ennu-Aššur, share of Sueya, 48 shekels gold, the share of Ikuppaša, in total 1 mina 36 shekels gold, I myself purchased. I gave 10 minas silver to the merchant for purchasing the gold. Also the the tablet sealed with my seal from the eponym year of Akutum (REL 108) which stated that the representative of the merchant held the gold, ... x minas gold which I wrote down to/for ... , 20 shekels gold ... 4 shekels ...

src: KISIB us-na-ma GAL ma-hi-ri KISIB zu-la KISIB hi-is-ta-ah-su KISIB ha-nu KISIB su-pu-ta-ah-su KISIB la-bar-sa KISIB ta-mu-ri-a ne-wa-ah-su si-mi-su a-na la-bar-sa u ta-mu-ri-a is-qul tu-zi-nam sa GAL ma-hi-ri-im ne-wa-ah-su il5-qe tu-zi-nam sa GAL si-mi-il5-tim la-bar-sa u ta-mu-ri-a il5-qe-u a-hu-um a-na a-hi-im la i-tu-wa-ar sa i-tu-ru 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal u i-na i-di-nim i-du-ku-su
tgt: Seals: Ušnama the cheif of the market, Zula, Ḫištaḫšu, Ḫanu, Šupputaḫšu, Labarša, Tamuria. Newahšu paid his price (for manumission) to Labarša and Tamuria. Newaḫšu took the Labarša and Tamuria took the -right of the chief of the stairway. Colleague shall not return to colleague. He who returns (to raise the matter) will pay 5 minas silver. And in giving it, they will kill him.

src: KISIB a-sur-dan DUMU pu-da-dim KISIB i-ku-pi-a-sur <big_gap> DUMU PUZUR4-<big_gap> KISIB a-sur-DUG DUMU a ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu ITU.KAM ab sa-ra-ni li-mu-um i-di-a-bu-um KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu
tgt: In the presence of Aššur-dān son of Pudādum, Ikūn-pī-Aššur son of Puzur-..., ... ... per mina as interest they will add. Month: ab šarrāni, year eponym: Iddin-abum. The silver is on their person and their trust.

src: 1 GU 20 ma-na AN.NA E pi-la-ah-ISTAR a-na a-mur-DINGIR a-di-in 2 GU 9 ma-na AN.NA sa se-ep DINGIR-na-da as-ni-iq-su-um 11 ma-na 10 GIN AN.NA ni-ip-la-tim <gap> ma-na <gap> GIN AN.NA da-tam KU.BI 25.83333 ma-na 3 GIN SA.BA 25 ma-na LA 13 GIN KU.BABBAR is-qul si-ti KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR i li-bi a-mur-DINGIR
tgt: Zwei talent zwei Minen Zinn <vom> Hause des Pilaḫištar habe ich dem Āmurilī gegeben. (Weitere) zwei Talent neun Minen Zinn von der Karawane des Ilīnādā habe ich ihm überreicht. Elf Minen zehn Seqel Zinn sind Ausgleichszahlungen; <x Minen x Seqel> Zinn sind Wegzoll. Die mir (dafür zustehende) [Sil]ber(menge beträgt) 25⅚ Minen 3 Seqel. Davon hat er 24 Minen 48 Seqel Silber bezahlt. Den Rest des Silbers, eine Mine fünf Seqel Silber ist Āmurilī (mir) schuldig.

src: 15 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ISTAR-ba-ni DUMU a-sur-e-mu-qi a-sur-mu-ta-pi-il5 i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa kur-ub-ISTAR DUMU a-la-hi-im a-na 15 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 0.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-na-su-en6 DUMU su-a-sur IGI i-di-a-sur DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti IGI u-su-ur-sa-a-sur DUMU pu-ta-a IGI i-di-ku-bi-im DUMU pi-la-ah-ISTAR
tgt: Ištar-bāni s. Aššur-emūqī owes Aššur-mutabbil 15 mina refined silver. He will pay 15 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Kurub-Ištar s. Al-aḫim. If he does not pay he will add interest at the rate of 1/2 shekel per mina per month. Month: ša sarrātim Year: the year after Enna-Suen s. Šū-Aššur Witnesses: Idī-Aššur s. Aššur-imittī, Uṣur-ša-Aššur s. Puta, Idī-Kūbim s. Pilaḫ-Ištar

src: 31 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR sa i-a-sar u-se-bi-la-ni a-na a-mur-DINGIR DUMU sa-ak-si-im u al-be-li DUMU mu-na-bi-tim ni-ip-qi-id-ma a-se-er pu-su-ke-en6 ub-lu-u IGI i-di-su-en6 DUMU a-la-hi-im IGI {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li DUMU ku-us-ku-si-im 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa ga-al-ga-li-a is-qu-lu-ni-a-ti-ni a-na pu-su-ke-en6 PUZUR4-a-sur na-si 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-du-a-su sa-bu-u IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU i-ku-pi-a IGI i-ku-pi-a-sur DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR
tgt: We entrusted the 31 minas 15 shekels silver which Ea-šar sent to Amur-ilī s. Šaṣqum and Āl-bēlī s. Munabitum and he brought it to Pūšu-kēn. Witnesses: Idī-Suen s. Alahim, Adad-ṣulūlī s. Kuzkuzum. Puzur-Aššur took the 10 minas silver which Galgaliya weighed out to us for Pūšu-kēn. 10 shekels silver its shipping charge fulfilled. Witnesses: Aššur-imittī s. Ikuppiya, Ikuppī-Aššur s. Puzur-Išṭar.

src: IGI i-di-{d}IM DUMU a-sur-DU10 IGI u-su-ra-nim DUMU ku-da-a IGI en-na-su-en6 DUMU a-sur-DU10-me-er-e la-li-im as-ba-at-ma um-ma a-na-ku-ma DUMU me-tim a-na-ku u a-tu-nu me-er-u me-tim-ma a-bi tup-pa-am e-zi-ba-am tup-pu-um ku-nu-uk a-bi-ku-nu la ku-nu-uk a-bi-ku-nu ku-nu-ki u-di-a um-ma me-er-u la-li-im-ma tup-pa-am se-si-ma u ku-nu-ki lu nu-di um-ma a-na-ku-ma ku-nu-ki u-di-a-ma u tup-pa-am la-si-a-ku-nu-ti su-nu-u tup-pa-am ku-nu-ki u-du-a-am u-la i-mu-u um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-ma sa-ni-is a-lim{ki} u ru-ba-am ta-ma-u ka-i-la ki-ma ku-nu-ki u-du-a-am la i-mu-u-ni ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um i-na-a DUMU a-mur-ra-a is-tu tup-pa-am u-la u-ka-li-mu su-nu-u u-du-a-am la i-mu-u-ni
tgt: The sons of Lālum seized me: I said: "I am the son of a dead man, and you are sons of a dead man. My father left me a tablet. As for the tablet, make known whether the seals are the seasl of your father or not." The sons of Lālum said: "Bring out the tablet so that we can idetnify the seals." I said: "Identify the seals so that I can realease the tablet to you." They did not want to identify the seals on the tablet. I said: "Lo, you must swear by the oath of the city and the prince. Make offerings." They did not want to identify that they were the seals (in question). Month: Kuzalli. After they did not k'l the tablet, they did not want to identify.

src: a-na su-hu-bur qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma sa i-ku-nim se-li a-wi-lum a-na sal-sa-ti-su la ka-si-id KU.KI lu a-ta lu E a-bi-ka ma-la ad-ma-tu-nu-ni BI-SA-AM-ma tup-pa-ka la-as-ba-at-ma ma-la a-le-e-u la-al-qe a-su-mi AN.NA bi4-il5-tim u 4 TUG KU.BABBAR-ap-su as-ba-at-ma nu-se-si-ib-ma a-na 1 GU 3 ma-na AN.NA 7 GIN.TA 9 ma-na KU.BI sa 4 TUG.HI.A 15 GIN.TA 1 ma-na SU.NIGIN 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR SA.BA 8 ma-na al-qe 2 ma-na i-na tu-a-ri-su is-tu za-al-pa i-sa-qa-lam i-na 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR a sa ki-ma la-li-im u-ta-e-er ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma sa 1 ma-na KU.KI a-na en-na-a-sur e-bi-ik a-se-er 1 ma-na-im sa a-ma-kam ta-di-nu-su-ni u 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR u 5 ma-na-e AN.NA sa li-bi-su 1.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-na sa la-li-im sa al-qe-u u 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-ka u-ra-di-ma 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-di-sum-ma 4 ma-na LA 15 GIN KU.BABBAR sa 1 ma-na KU.KI u-pi-iq-sum si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-ka 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR dan-a-sur na-as-a-kum a-su-mi i-ku-nim te-er-ta-ka is-ti a-li-ki-im pa-nim-ma li-li-ka-ma ma-la u-se-lu-u i se-pi-a
tgt: To Šū-Ḫubur from Pūšu-kēn: You wrote me. (You said,) "Send up the goods of Ik The man cannot make his thirds. (Write?) to me the gold, both your own and that of the house of your father, as much falls to you as a share, so that I may take your tablet and take as much as I am able. Concerning the tin, a talent, and four textiles-I took their price in silver and we ... , and for one talent 3 minas tin at 7 shekels rate, its silver was 9 minas. Altogether the price of the 4 textiles at 15 shekels each was 1 mina (silver). 10 minas silver, thereof, I took 8 minas. He will pay me the (remaining) two minas (in?) Zalpa after his return. From the 5(?) minas silver, I/the representative of Lālum will return x minas silver to the representatives of Lālum/me. (?) You wrote me. You said, "Regarding the 1 mina gold I released to Ennam-Aššur ..." In addition to the mina which you gave to him there, (there is) also 45 shekels silver and 6 minas tin which he owes. From the silver of Lālum which I received, I took 1 2/3 minas silver, and also gathered 1/3 minas silver from your silver and I gave him 2 minas silver and also 3 minas 55 shekels silver for the 1 minas of gold I added(?) to him. Dān-Aššur brings to you the remainder of your silver: 6 minas silver. Regarding Ikūnum, let your instructions come from the city with the first traveller so that I (can bring) as much as I can raise in my cargo.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma ta-ri-is-ma-tum u be-la-tum-ma su-ha-ra-tum sa PUZUR4.ISTAR u u-sur-sa-a-sur im-ra-sa-ma mu-a-ti-is i-li-ka a-na sa-i-la-tim ni-li-ik-ma um-ma i-lu-um-ma ik-ri-be la tu-qa-i-a <gap> ek-ma-si-na a-na ha-ar-pe nu-us-te-re-sa e-ka-ma-am la e-ka-ma-am su-ha-ri sa-al-ma te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam-ma lu ne-ki-im-si-na lu si-im AN.NA lu sa TUG.HI.A KU.BABBAR ku-nu-uk-ma se-bi-lam 10 ku-ta-ni sa a-na MASKIM ni-di-nu KU.BABBAR sa-as-qi-il5-ma se-bi-lam 1 {TUG}ku-ta-nam a-na a-sur-i-mi-ti u su-ISTAR ni-di-in-ma i-na ILLAT i-na-a i-di-su-en6 u-se-bi4-lu-ni-kum su-ISTAR KU.BABBAR ne-ri-is-ma um-ma su-ut-ma 1 TUG su-a-ti i-di-su-en6 a pu-su-ke-en6 i-di-in KU.BABBAR si-im 1 TUG se-bi4-lam
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Tariš-mātum and Bēlātum: The daughters of Puzur-Ištar and Uṣur-ša-Aššur are ill and seem as though they are dying! We went to the diviners and thus says the god: "You do not respect the votive offerings. ... them." We are preparing for the harvest! Ask the youth whether he(?) will ... or not and let your message come so that we can ... them. Either the price of the tin or of the textiles, seal the silver and send it here. The ten textiles which we gave to the attorney, have the silver paid and send it here. We gave 1 textile to Aššur-imittī and Šū-Ištar and the sent it to you in the caravan of Innāya (and) Idī-Suen. We requested silver of Šū-Išrat and he said, "Idī-Suen gave that textile to Pūšu-kēn." Send here the silver, the yeild of the one textile.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 PUZUR.ISTAR {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni u i-di-ISTAR qi-bi4-ma um-ma ta-ri-is-ma-tu-ma u be-la-tu-ma ra-bi4-sa-am ni-is-pu-ra-am u tup-pa-am sa a-lim{ki} da-na-am ra-bi4-su-um u-ka-al sa ma-ma-an lu i-na a-lim{ki} lu i-na GAN-lim ma-ma-an la i-ta-hi-u-ma KU.BABBAR-ap su-nu-nu a-na a-lim{ki} i-pa-hu-ra-ni i-na a-lim{ki} a ma-la si-ma-ti-su-nu i-zu-zu i-na GAN-lim sa i-ta-hi-u-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN sa i-la-qe-u i-sa-ri-iq-su-um ni-sa-me-ma ki-ma a-wi-li a-su-tim ta-am-ta-sa-ha-a u pu-su-ke-en6 sa i-ni-hu-ma a-na E a-bi4-ni ik-ri-be sa a-bi4-ni u-sa-zi-ZU.ZU a-wi-la-am me-eh-ra-tim <gap> ta-ta-na-pa-la a-pu-tum i-na KU.BABBAR mi-ma la ta-ta-hi-a KU.BABBAR a-na a-lim{ki} li-ip-hu-ra-ma sa ki-ma ku-nu-ti li-il5-qe-u-ma a-sar KU.BABBAR 1 GIN i-na a-lim su-te-bu-la-tu-nu-ni pu-ut-ku-nu lu za-ku-a-at a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma ne-nu su-ma la ku-a-ti a-ba-am la ni-su su-ma a-bu-ni a-ta ma-ma-an sa a-na KU.BABBAR-ap-su it-hi-u si-be su-ku-su-ma li-si-ri-iq-su-um i-hi-id-ma KU.BABBAR pa-he-er-ma a qa-ti ra-bi4-si-im pi-qi-id-ma lu-ub-lam a-pu-tum la ta-ha-da-ar i-hi-id u a-na su-ba-ti es15-ra-at ta-ad-mi-iq-ti-ni sa a-na DUMU su-nu-nu ni-di-nu i-hi-id-ma 3.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-na dam-qi-ma se-bi4-lam i-hi-id
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn, Puzur-Ištar, Ilabrat-bāni, and Idī-īštar from Tariš-mātum and Bēlātum: We sent the attorney. And the attorney holds a sealed tablet of the city. As for the fact that no one must approach anyone either in the city or abroad, they will divide the silver that Šū-Nunu gathered in the city, (here) in the city according to their witnesses. They will confiscate every shekel received by anyone who makes claims abroad! We are hearing that you are plundering the men for his goods. Also, P You must keep answering the man the mehratim. Urgent, do not add?take away? anything from the silver! Let them gather the silver to the city and let your (pl.) representatives take it and wherever there is a single shekels of silver in the city to be sent (?), let your reports be cleared. To Pūšu-kēn: As for us, we have no father beside you. If you are our father, set witnesses on whomever makes a claim on his silver., so that he does (not?) steal silver from him. Take care to gather the silver and entrust it to the attorney so that he brings it here. Urgent, do not fear! Be diligent! Also, regarding the textiles, the tithe which you credited, which we gave to the son of Šū-Nunu, take care to send me 3 1/3 minas silver in good time(?). Be diligent!

src: KISIB <big_gap> KISIB <big_gap> sa en-nam-a-sur a-na 6 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 ma-na.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na bi-il5-tim si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-DINGIR li-mu-um sa qa-ti e-la-li DUMU i-ku-nim
tgt: He will pay six weeks (from the ḫamuštum)? of Ennam-Aššur. If he does not pay, he will add 1 1/2 minas per talent per month as interest.

src: 2.33333 ma-na 4 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er PUZUR4.ISTAR su-{d}ISKUR i-su is-tu SAG ITU.1.KAM sa te-i-na-tim a-na ITU.2.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab li-mu-um a-bi4-a DUMU su-da-gan KU.BABBAR i ka-ni-is i-sa-qal IGI kur-ub-ISTAR IGI sal-ma-a-sur
tgt: He will pay 2 months from the head of the month Teʾinātum. If he does not pay at the fulfillment of his term, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina (per month as interest) according to the colony rate. Eponymate: Abīya s. Šū-Dagān. He will pay the silver in Kanesh. Witnesses: Kurub-Ištar, Šalma-Aššur.

Pūšu-kēn his caravan.. 5 shekels when Anali investigated (for) him. 1/3 mina tin for Amur-Ištar s. Amur-ilī, his caravan. I sold 1 1/2 shekels. 15 shekels tin (to?) Idī-Ištar. 1 shekel (to?) Ḫuraṣānum. x shekel(s) (to?) Adad... . 2 shekels (to?) Pūšu-kēn. x shekel(s) (to?) Enna-Bēlum. 10 shekels (to?) I--a s. Ganāya.

src: um-ma {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni-ma a-na u-sur-sa-ISTAR qi-bi4-ma 10 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na a-ha-at a-bi4-ni ku-nu-ki-a ku-ra-ra DUMU a-bu-sa-lim na-si KU.BABBAR ma-ah-ri-ka ap-qi-su-um a-hi a-ta eb-ri a-ta a-mur-DINGIR u a-ta su-up-ra-su-ma KU.BABBAR a-na ma-ma-an la i-dan 1 a-bar-ni-a-am a-na li-tab-si-a lu-se-li-a-am a-hu-a a-tu-nu ih-da-ma su-up-ra-su-um KU.BABBAR a ta-ri-is-ma-tim ka-i-in mi-sum ta-as-ta-na-pa-ra-am gi5-im-la-ni
tgt: From Ilabrat-bani to Uṣur-ša-Ištar: Kurara s. Abu-šalim brings 10 shekels silver to the sister of our father under my seal. I entrusted the silver of your revenues to him. My dear brother and friend, you and Amur-ilāi send to him so that he does not give the silver to anyone. Let him bring up 1 abarnīum for my clothing. My dear brothers take heed to send to him. Establish the silver for Tariš-mātum. Why must I constantly be writing? Do me a favor.

src: 12 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er sa-te-a pu-su-ke-en6 i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-tak-la-ku a-na 5 ha-mus-tim ta-sa-qal su-ma la ta-as-qul 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im tu-sa-ab ITU.KAM a-la-na-tim li-mu-um i-li-dan IGI DU10-si-la-a-sur IGI i-ku-pi-a
tgt: Šāt-Ea owes Pūš-kēn 12 shekels silver. She will pay 5 If she does not pay, she will add 1 1/2 shekels (silver) as interest per month per mina. Month: Allanātum. Eponymate: Ilī-dan. Witnesses: Ṭāb-ṣill-Aššur, Ikuppiya.

src: a-na PUZUR4-a-sur qi-bi4-ma um-ma i-ka-a-ma mi-su sa ta-na-zu-mu-u ma-nu-um i-na tu-ur-hu-mi-it sa AN.NA a-na URUDU la-mu-nim i-ta-na-di-nu i-nu-mi su-e-a i-li-ka-ni AN.NA 9 ma-na.TA u 10 ma-na.TA i-ta-na-di-nu a-na-ku 11 ma-na.TA u-se-bi-la-kum a-sur u DINGIR-lu a-hu-tim li-tu-la 5 ma-na AN.NA i-na li-bi AN.NA-ki-ka a-na ha-na-nim a-na 30 ma-na.TA URUDU la-mu-nim a-di-su-ma su-ut-ma i-ta-ba-al 1 GIN i-na er-bi-im la i-di-na-ni a-na sa ku-<gap> mi-su-um ta-na-zu-um wa-di-i a-sa-ka-am il5-ta-na-qe-u 55 ma-na URUDU si-kam 12 ma-na URUDU SIG5 ma-su-ha-am 6 ma-na ki-ib-sa-tim a-na su-ISTAR a-di-in URUDU sa si-na-ZU ub-la-ku-ni le-qe-su a-su-mi URUDU sa sa-du-ni-ma sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni 6 ma-na KU.GI a-na ka-ni-is ta-ta-ba-al
tgt: Zu Puzuraššur sprich! Folgendermaßen Igā'a: (Was) all das (betrifft), worüber du klagst: Wer ist in Tu[rḫ]umit, der dauernd gegen einen Großkaufmann (?) ein Urteil fällt? Als Su'e'a herkam, gab man gewöhnlich Zinn zu(m Kurs von) je 9 Minen oder je 10 Minen. Ich habe je 11 Minen dir geschickt! Aššur und die Götter der Bruderschaft mögen Zeuge sein! 5 Minen Zinn von deinem Zins habe ich Ḫanānum zu (einem Kurs von) je 30 Minen sehr schlechtes Kupfer gegeben. D[er] hat (es) bereits weggebracht. Nicht einen (einzigen) Seqel vo[n der A]bgabe hat er mir gegeben. In Sachen Igmillum (?) ärgerst du dich. Er tut doch wohl dauernd Unrechtes! Ferner habe ich 55 Minen . . . . . . Kupfer, 12 Minen gutes Bruch- (?) Kupfer— 6 Minen sind Abzüge — dem Šū-ištar gegeben. Das Kupfer, das Ennasu (?) dir gebracht hat, nimm (es!) Wegen des Kupfers der Šadunum (?), bezüglich dessen sie mir geschrieben hat: 6 Minen [. . . . ] . . . . an ihren Herren hat sie weggebracht (?).

src: 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-a-ma-ru-um DUMU a-la-hi-im tam-ka-ru-um i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa e-la-ma u ku-ru-ub-ISTAR a-na 24 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im a-na ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tim IGI en-um-a-sur DUMU a-hi-a IGI su-ni-ra-ah DUMU su-ISTAR
tgt: Aššur-ammurrum s. Al-aḫum owes the merchant 1 mina refined silver. Month: Qarrātum. Witnesses: Ennum-Aššur s. Aḫia, Šū-Niraḫ s. Šū-Ištar.

src: 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ISTAR.DINGIR-su DUMU-su a-mur-ISTAR i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa e-di-na-a a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um DINGIR-su-GAL DUMU ba-zi-a su-ma i-na ma-la u4-me-su la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab IGI ib-ni-{d}ISKUR IGI u-zu-a IGI mu-us-me-ni
tgt: Ištar-ilšu owes his father Amur-Ištar 45 shekels refined silver. He will pay twenty weeks from the ḫamuštum of Edina. Month: Kuzalli. Eponymate: Ilšu-rabi s. Bazia. If he does not pay on time, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest). Witnesses: Ibni-Adad, Uzuwa, Muš(u)weni.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma te-er-ta-ka i-li-kam-ma i-na {d}UTU-si tup-pa-ka as-me-u 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na sa ki-ma ku-a-ti a-di-in-ma AN.NA is-u-mu-kum a-hi a-ta i-na is-te-en6 a-li-ki-im i-na pa-nim-ma KU.BABBAR-pi se-bi-lam u ki-ma KU.BABBAR as-qu-lu as-pu-ra-ku-ma te-er-ta-ka u-la i-tu-ra-am a-na im-di-DINGIR qi-bi-ma sa ba-pi-ri-a ma-la se-bu-li-im se-bi-lam
tgt: From Aššur-imittī to Pūšu-kēn: Your message came and on the same day that I heard your letter, I gave 3 minas silver to your (pl?) representatives, and thay purchased tin for you. My dear brother, from one traveler, "Send my sivler immediately! But when I weighed out silver, I sent (it) to you and your message has not returned. Say to Imdi-ilum: "Send as much as can be sent of the profits of my (Aššur-imittī's) wheat grain."

src: a-na sa-at-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-ma-lik sal-ma-ku mi-ma li-bi-ki la i-pa-ri-id 2 pa-ni-ri sa al-pe-e i-li-ma-lik na-as-a-ki-im a-pu-tum i-na {d}UTU-si na-as-par-ti ta-sa-me-i-ni su-lu-um-ki u su-lu-um E-be-tim se-bi4-lam
tgt: To Šāt-Aššur from Aššur-mālik: I am well. Don't worry at all. Il-mālik brings you 2 ox-hides(?). Please, on the day that you read my letter, send me news about your well-being and the well-being of the household.

src: 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um i-se-er a-sur-ba-as-ti sa E pu-la su-ma-bi-a i-su-u is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa sal-ma-a-sur ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um a-sur-SIG5 a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma <big_gap> i-na u4-me-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI en-um-a-sur IGI DUG-si-la-a-sur IGI a-ta-ta
tgt: Aššur-bāštī owes Šuma-abiya 3 minas refined silver for the house of Pula. He will pay 20 weeks after the ḫamuštum of Šalim-Aššur, month of Ḫubur, in the year of Aššur-damiq. If he does not pay at the fulfillment of his term, he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Witnesses: Ennum-Aššur, Ṭāb-ṣilla-Aššur, Adada.

src: a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-ta-ak-la-ak-ma 5 GU.TA TUG.HI.A 3 me-at-TA mas-ki a-na qa-ta-ti-ku-nu al-qe 1 ma-na 10 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR i-qa-ta-ti-ku-nu i-sa-he-er 31.5 mas-ku 40 ma-na.TA a-na ma-na-em KU.BABBAR sa ILLAT-at pu-su-ke-en6 ik-su-da-ma 12 GU 50 ma-na TUG.HI.A 6 me-at mas-ki al-qe 1 0.16666 GIN.TA a-na TUG.HI.A KU.BABBAR la-su mas-ku wa-as-mu a-di sa a-na ka-ri-im ma-ha-ri-im ta-as-ta-na-pa-ra-ni a-di es15-ri-su a-na a-la-hi-im u kur-ub-ISTAR at-hi-ma la na-tu-ma la i-ma-hu-ru-ni-ku-um KU.BABBAR sa a-bu-zu-ta-a a-pu-lu uk-ta-i-ni ni-ka-su qu-ur-bu a-na a-ta-al-ki-im sa-ap-ra-ku-nu-ti al-ka-ma a ma-la ta-ah-si-is-tim li-zu-zu
tgt: To Aššur-nādā from Aššur-taklāku: 5 talents of wool for each of you, representing 300 fleeces, I received as your shares. 1 mina 10 shekels of silver will be deducted from each of your shares. 31 1/2 hides or 40 minas (of wool) for each mina of silver (invested) resulted from Pūšu-kēn's enterprise, so I received 10 talents 50 minas of wool representing 600 fleeces. Even at the rate 1 1/6 shekel for (a mina of) wool there is no silver to be had, although the fleeces are in order. As to the matter of appealing to the colony authorities, about which you have written so often, at least ten times, I approached Alāhum and Kurub-Ištar, but it was not the right moment to appeal on your behalf. Buzutaya has confirmed to me the silver which I balanced with him. The time for the accounting is close. You had been told by me by letter to leave, so, come and let them divide (the assets) in accordance with the note.

src: zu-pa a-na me-er-e pu-su-ke-en6 is-ba-at-ni-a-ti-ma um-ma zu-pa-ma a-na me-er-e pu-su-ke-en6-ma sa tup-pi-a ha-ar-mi-im KU.BABBAR a-bu-ku-nu il5-qe mi-su-um su-en6-SIPA i-a-ti u-ka-la-ni um-ma ma-ru-u pu-su-ke-en6-ma a-na su-en6-SIPA sa DUB-tu-pi-su ha-ar-mi-im sa zu-pa KU.BABBAR a-bu-ni il5-qe wa-se-er-su-ma ne-nu a-wa-tam ni-da-na-ku-um ma-ah-ri-ni-ma zu-pa su-en6-SIPA u-se-er a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um ka-ni-is-ki i-di-ni-a-ti-ma IGI GIR sa a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in IGI zi-a-du-du DUMU a-la-bi4-im IGI MAR.TU ba-ni DUMU su-ISTAR
tgt: Zupa seized us against the sons of Pūšu-kēn and Zupa said to the sons of Pūšu-kēn, "Your father took the silver stated in my sealed tablets. Why is it that Suen-rē'ī detains me? The sons of Pūšu-kēn (responded): "Our father received the silver of the sealed tablet of Zupa. Release it and we will give you the matter." Suen-rē'ī released Zupa in our presence. The colony at Kanesh gave us witnesses regarding this matter and we gave our witnesses before the dagger of Aššur. Witnesses: Ziyadudu s. Āl-abum, Amurrum-bāni s. Šū-Ištar.

src: ka-lu-a be-su-u a-na si-mi-im a-na us-nu-ma-an a-na 0.5 ma-na 3.5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-di-in su-ma us-nu-ma-an a-na a-ba-tim i-tu-ar 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal su-ma sa ka-lu-a lu be-al hu-bu-li-su lu a-hu-su lu be-al tu-zi-ni a-na us-nu-ma-an i-tu-ar 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal IGI sa-hi-is-nu-ma-an IGI pe-ru-a IGI du-du
tgt: Kalua sold his house to Ušnuman for 33 1/2 shekels of silver. If Ušnuman makes a claim against Abatum he will pay half a mina of silver. If a man of Kalua, either his creditor or his brother or the lord of the tuzinnum raises a claim against Ušnuman he will pay half a mina of silver. Witnesses: Šaḫišnuman, Perua, Dudu.

src: a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5 u bu-za-zu is-bu-tu-ni-a-ti-ma a-wa-ti-su-nu nu-ga-me-er-ma lu sa 5 ma-na KU.GI u a-ha-ma 1.3333300000000001 ma-na KU.GI sal-tim qa-ti-sa sa a-ha-ha DUMU.SAL pu-su-ke-en6 sa na-ru-uq dan-a-sur DUMU sal-mah <big_gap> a-sur it-mu-ma <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> sa ki-ma <big_gap> <gap>-ma <big_gap>-su-nu i-di-nu <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> 0.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR <big_gap> i-sa-qal u tup-pu ha-ru-mu-tum sa i ku-nu-ki-su-nu ka-an-ku-ni a me-er-e pu-su-ke-en6 ki-li-su-nu i-za-zu a-hu-um i pa-ni a-hi-im u-la i-la-qe sa i-la-qe-u i-sa-ri-iq-su-um ITU.1.KAM ma-hu-ur-DINGIR li-mu-um sa qa-ti a-ku-tim a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ni-is a-lim{ki} it-mu-u-ma 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na be-a-lim a-na 40-<gap> ha-am-sa-tim bu-za-zu a-na a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 i-di-in i-1+0.33333 ma-na KU.GI sal-tim mi-is-lam i-da-su-um mi-is-lum a-na a-wa-at a-ha-ha DUMU.SAL pu-su-ke-en6 i-za-az
tgt: They swore the oath of the city concerning these things and Buzāzu gave Aššur-mutabbil 10 minas silver as capital for 40+x ḫamuštum-weeks. As for the 1 1/3 minas gold, the cash assets, he will give half to him. (The other) half with stand for the matter of Aḫaḫa d. Pūšu-kēn.

src: um-ma su-hu-bu-ur u me-er-u a-sur-i-mi-ti-ma a-na bu-zu-ta-a pu-su-ke-en6 u im-di-DINGIR qi-bi-ma su-ma a-ma-kam ta-da-ga-la-ma a-wi-lum e-mu-qam i-su a-wi-lum i-na se-er E a-bi-ni la i-sa-la a-na ma-la ta-le-a-ni KU.BABBAR sa lu-qu-ti-im em-da-su-ma KU.BABBAR i-na a-lim{ki} lu ra-ki-is su-ma la ki-a-am a-wi-lam e-bi-ba-su ni-is-ta-na-me-ma a-wi-lum ma-ru-us <gap> ih-da-ma e-bi-ba-su 15 ma-na AN.NA a-ha-ma a-na li-bi lu-qu-ti-su sa ik-ri-bi-a i-nu-mi lu-qu-su E-su a-di u 5 ma-na AN.NA a-sur-SIPA ha-nu-nu-um a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU i-ku-a i-di-nu-sum si-im AN.NA-ki-a sa-as-qi-la-su
tgt: From Šū-Ḫubur and the sons of Aššur-imittī to Buzutaya, Pūšu-kēn and Imdī-ilum: If you come to an agreement there and the man is well, then the man must not harm our father's house. As much as you are able, lean on him for the silver from the goods so that the silver is bound in the city. If it is not so, clear the man of it (the obligation). We keep hearing that the man is ill. Take care to clear him. 15 minas tin, separately, that are in the midst of his goods, are my ikrībū-funds. When his house deposited his goods, Aššu-rēʾī, Ḫannunum, and Aššur-imittī son of Ikuwa gave to him 5 minas tin. Have him pay the price of my tin.

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU su-en-na-da KISIB su-a-nim DUMU a-uh-a KISIB a-ta-a DUMU su-ISTAR KISIB a-sur-SIPA DUMU i-di-da sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-SIPA DUMU i-di-da 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um i-se-er a-sur-SIPA DUMU i-di-da a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-la-hi-im u e-na-ma-nim 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-SIPA DUMU i-di-da
