tgt: Seals of Puzur-Aššur s. Suen-nādā, Šū-Anum s. Aqua, Attaya s. Šū-Ištar, Aššur-rēʾī s. Idīda Aššur-rēʾī s. Idīda owes Aššur-rēʾī 5 minas refined silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest from the hamuštum of Al-aḫim and Ennam-Anim.

src: um-ma <gap> sa ki-ma ku-a-ti u <gap> <gap>-a-sur-ma a-na <big_gap> qi-bi-ma a-su-mi sa en-um-a-sur DUMU su-{d}EN.LIL sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni ni-is-ri-ma um-ma su-ut-ma i-nu-mi pu-su-ke-en6 us-bu i-li-a u a-sur-i-mi-ti i-zi-zu-ma a-na tup-pe-e ki-la-le-en6 7 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa u-sur-sa-a-sur i-ra-de8 0.33333 ma-na sa E a-<gap> <big_gap> i-ra-de8 3 ma-na <gap> GIN sa <big_gap><gap> <gap> u 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-na sa-tim 5 ma-na.TA a-sa-qal a-na a-ni-a-tim a-wa-tu-a gam-ra su-ma ma-ag-ra-tu-nu tup-pi lu-up-ta su-ma la ta-mu-a lu-si ki-ma i-na tup-pi-ka la be-u-sa-ni la ni-im-gu5-ur a-ni-tam la a-ni-tam te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam a-su-mi sa u-sur-sa-ISTAR sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni a-wa-tu-su-nu is-ti im-di-DINGIR gam-ra ni-is-ba-su-ma um-ma su-ut-ma is-ti a-bi-a la-az-ku-ma a-ni-tam la a-ni-tam a-qa-bi4-a-ku-nu-ti e-na-ma-nam ni-is-ba-at-ma um-ma su-ut-ma en-um-a-sur KU.BABBAR mi-ma la is-qu-lam a-sur-na-da a-hu-su u <big_gap> <gap>-pu-lu-ni-ma a-sur-na-da la is-qu-lam <big_gap> la i-di-su-ma <big_gap> <gap>-ni u-sur-sa-a-sur la <gap> <gap>-a-ku-nu-ti en-um-a-sur mi-ma la is-qu-la-ni
tgt: From ... your representative and .. Aššur to ... Concerning the matter of Ennam-Aššur son of Šū-Enlil about which you wrote, we .. and he said, "When Pūšu-kēn was there, Iliya and Aššur-imittī stood and added 5 minas silver from Uṣur-ša-Aššur to all the tablets. He added the 1/3 minas of the house of A-... 3 minas x shekels beloning to PN and 20 minas silver, at a rate of 5 minas per year I will say. To these (Besides these?) my matters are concluded. If you(pl.) are in agreement write my tablet. If you do not swear(?) let (me) go. Because b. not in your tablet, you did not agree. Let your message come as to whether it is one or the other. Regarding the matter of Uṣur-ša-Ištar about which you wrote, their matters with Imdī-ilim are concluded. We seized him and he said, "Let me clear myself from my father so that I can say one or the other to you (pl.). We seized Ennāmnum and he said, "Ennum-Aššur did not pay out any silver." Aššur-nādā his brother ... answered, "Aššur-nādā did not pay. ... did not deposit and ... Uṣur-ša-Ištar did not .. you (pl.) Ennum-Aššur did not pay anything ...

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 zu-pa PUZUR4-a-sur a-sur-tu-ku-ul-ti u a-sur-sa-du-ni qi-bi-ma um-ma la-ma-sa-tum-ma su-ma a-ba-u-a a-tu-nu a-na ma-la tup-pi-im sa a-lim{ki} E-be-tam sa ka-ni-is{ki} tu-ub-ta-am lu a-ma-tim lu tup-pe-e lu a-li KU.BABBAR 1 GIN i-ba-si-u ih-da-ma ku-un-ka-ma se-bi-la-nim a-pu-tum {d}ISKUR-ba-ni u TUG-tu a-na si-mi-im la ta-da-na a-na ma-la tup-pi-im sa a-lim{ki} i-na sa-ha-at ra-bi-si-im i-zi-za-ma tup-pa-am sa ka-ri-im ka-ni-is a-na se-er tup-pi-im sa a-lim{ki} li-qe-a-ma a-na wa-ah-su-sa-na a-na se-er am-ri-a tur4-da-su la i-sa-hu-ur
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn, Zupa, Puzur-Aššur, Aššur-tukultī and Aššur-šaduni from Lamassātum; If you are truly my fathers, to as many tablets of the city, which are in the houses at Kaneš, either maids or tablets or wherever there is a single shekels of silver, take care to seal it and send it to me. Urgent, Adad-bāni and ... you must not sell the textiles (nominative!) for a price. Assist the attorney according to the tablet of the city and take/receive the tablet of kārum Kanesh (into?) the tablet of the city and send him to Waḫšušana to Amrīya. He must not be delayed!

src: 42 ma-na KU sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er du-uh-ni-is u me-er-e da-la-as a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-SIPA u sa-lim-a-sur a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu-u su-ma i-na u4-mi-su-nu ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-lu u ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu KU i-na sa-al-mi-su-nu ke-ni-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI PUZUR4-a-sur IGI a-ha-ni-ir-si IGI i-ku-nim be-et da-ak-ni-is e-ru-ba-tu-su
tgt: Tuḫniš and the sons of Dalaš owe Aššur-rē'ī 42 minas refined silver. They will pay 20 weeks from the If they do not pay at the fulfillment of their term, they will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest according to the colony rate. The silver is bound to (whomever) is financially solvent and legally responsible. Witnesses: Puzur-Aššur, Aḫanirši, Ikūnum. The house of Dakniš is his guarantee.

src: 2 GU 13.5 ma-na URUDU si-kam i-se-er i-li-me-sar DUMU ku-lu-mi-im {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li i-su ITU.KAM be-el-ti-ka-lim li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-na-a 1.5 ma-na.TA a-na 1 GU-tim i-na ITU.1.KAM-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI su-sa-a DUMU i-si-hi-im IGI a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim DUMU PUZUR4-su-en6 IGI i-di-a-sur DUMU bu-a-a
tgt: Ilī-mīšar s. Kulumim owes Adad-ṣulūlī 2 talents 13 1/2 mina poor quality copper. He will add 1 1/2 minas per talent per month as interest from the month of Bēlet-ekallim, eponymate after Innāya.

src: 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR li-ti i-se-er tu-tu-li u hu-da a-si-ti-su hi-is-ta-ah-su u a-na-li su-pi-u-ma-an u tal-ha-ma a-si-ti-su pe-ru-a u ka-na-na a-si-ti-su is-pu-da-ah-su u mu-a-na-ni a-si-ti-su a-sur-ma-lik i-su a-na sa a-na i-sa-qu-lu su-ma i-na u4-me-su-nu ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-lu 3 GIN.TA a ma-na-im si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-bu ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-i-li li-mu-um bu-zu-ta-a KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu u ke-ni-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI a-su IGI ba-ar-wa-ma-da IGI a-bi4-a-a IGI be-li-DUG
tgt: Duduli and Huda his wife, Ḫištaḫšu and Anali, Šuppiuman and Talḫama his wife, Peruwa and kà-na-na his wife, Išpudaḫšu, Muanani and his wife owe Aššur-mālik 5 minas quality silver. They will pay at the festival of Anna. If they do not pay at the fulfillment of their term, they will add 3 shekels per mina as interest for twenty months. Month: Maḫḫur-ilī. Eponymate: Buzutaya. The silver is bound to whomever is financially solvent and legally responsible. Wintesses: Ašu, Barwamada, Abīya, Bēlī-tāb.

src: KISIB {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni <big_gap> DUMU ma-na-na KISIB PUZUR4.SA.TU-e DUMU 0.5 KISIB u-sur-sa-a-sur DUMU a-sur-ma-lik KISIB i-la-ab-ra-at-ba-ni DUMU a-sur-ma-lik KISIB i-di-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-ma-lik 7 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er u-sur-sa-a-sur {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni u i-di-ISTAR DUMU-me-er-e a-sur-ma-lik pu-su-ke-en6 i-su i-nu-mi pu-su-ke-en6 i-na a-lim{ki} NIG-ka-si a-na um-me-a-ni-su i-du-nu i-na si-ip-ka-tim sa a-sur-ma-lik i qa-tim sa u-sur-sa-a-sur {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni u i-di-ISTAR i-sa-he-er KU.BABBAR i-na a-lim ki-i-ma i-su-u-ni ra-ki-is u i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is a-su-mi KU.BABBAR a-nim tup-pa-am sa 12.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR u si-ba-ti-su sa hu-bu-ul u-sur-sa-a-sur a-di-su-nu-ti a-na ku-lu-ma-a u bu-za-zu qi-bi4-ma um-ma pi-la-ha-a-ma si-im su-ba-ti-a si-li-ip-ka-im i-na ba-ri-ku-nu la tu-uk-ta-ba-sa sa e-pa-si-im ep-sa-ma e-sa-am u ma-dam se-bi4-la-nim
tgt: Seal of Amurrum-bāni son of Manana, seal of Puzur-saduʾē son of MAŠ, seal of Uṣur-ša-Aššur son of Aššur-mālik, seal of Ilabrat-bāni son of Aššur-mālik, seal of Idī-Ištar son of Aššur-mālik. Ušur-ša-Aššur, Ilabrat-bāni and Idī-Ištar, sons of Aššur-mālik owe Pūšu-kēn 7 minas silver. When Pūšu-kēn gives accounts in the city to his investors, it will be deducted from the dividend of Aššur-mālik, from the shares of Ušur-ša-Aššur, Ilabrat-bāni, and Idī-Ištar. The silver, while he has claim on it, is bound in the city. And it is bound to the heads of their selves. In (exchange for) this silver, I gave them the tablet stating 12 1/3 minas silver and its interst--the debt of Uṣur-ša-Aššur. To Kulumaya and Buzāzu, from Pilaḫaya: The price of my textiles, the Make what can be made and send it to me, great or small.

src: 0.66666 ma-na LA 2 GIN KU.BABBAR sa a-mur-DINGIR i li-bi4 {d}ISKUR-ba-ni i-su-u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku is-ba-at su-ma a-mur-DINGIR a-an 0.66666 ma-na LA 2 GIN a-na {d}ISKUR-ba-ni i-tu-ar a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku u-ba-ab-su IGI su-be-lim IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti IGI a-sur-na-da
tgt: The 38 shekels of silver that Amur-ilī had as a claim against Adad-bām, Aššur -taklāku has taken (that). If Amur-ilī raises claim concerning the 38 shekels against Adad-bāni, then Aššur-taklāku will clear him. Witnessed by Šū-Bēlum, witnessed by Aššur-imittī, witnessed by Aššur-nādā.

src: um-ma su-hu-bur a-hu-qar u i-a-sar-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma 1 ma-na 12.5 GIN KU.GI u 7 ma-na 14 GIN KU.BABBAR qar-wi-a ub-lam 0.66666 ma-na 2.25 GIN KU.GI 7.33333 GIN.TA KU.BI 5 ma-na 9.75 GIN u 0.5 ma-na 0.25 GIN KU.GI SIG5 8.66667 GIN.TA KU.BI 4.33333 ma-na 2.16666 GIN SU.NIGIN 16.66666 ma-na 6 GIN KU.BABBAR SA.BA 1 me-at 49 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 12.5 ma-na 0.5 GIN KU.BABBAR it-bu-lu 5 ANSE sa-la-mu KU.BI 1.5 ma-na 6 GIN 15 GIN u-nu-su-nu 10 GIN u-kul-ta-as-nu 23.83333 ma-na 1 GIN AN.NA qa-tim 12.5 GIN.TA KU.BI 1.66666 ma-na 6 GIN 3 GIN sa sa-e-tim 8.33333 GIN wa-si-tum 17 GIN te-su-bi KU.BABBAR-ap-ka gam-ra-kum a-sur-ma-lik DUMU ir-ra-a ku-nu-ki-ni na-as-a-kum
tgt: From Šū-Ḫubur, Aḫu-waqar and Ea-šar to Pūšu-kēn: Qarwiya brought 1 mana 12 1/2 shekels gold and 7 minas 14 shekels silver. 2/3 minas 2 1/4 shekels gold, at a rate of 7 1/3 shekels, was 5 minas 9 3/4 shekels (silver?), Also, 30 1/4 shekels fine gold, at a rate of 8 2/3 shekels, was 4 minas 22 1/6 shekels silver. Altogether, it was 16 minas 402 1/6 shekels silver. Thereof, 149 kut The 5 black donkeys cost 1 minas 36 shekels. Their gear was 15 shekels. Their fodder was 10 shekels. The 23 minas 51 shekels hand tin cost1 mina 46 shekels silver at a 12 1/2 shekel rate. The ša saitum charge was 3 shekels. The exit tax was 8 1/3 shekels. Additional expenses were 17 shekels. Your silver is exhausted. Aššur-mālik son of Erraya brings it to you under our seals.

src: 0.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ku-lu-uk-lu a-hu-qar i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-ba-ba-a-a a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM na-ar-ma-ak a-sur sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti bu-zu-zu IGI a-sur-SIPA IGI ku-ra IGI en-nam-a-sur
tgt: Kuluklu owes 1/3 mina 5 shekels refined silver to Aḫu-waqar. From the ḫamuštum of Ababāya h has 13 weeks to pay. If at the completeion of the term he does not pay the word of te colony will be added per month in interest. Month: Narma Aššur of kēnātim, Eponymate after Buzuzu

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU EN.ZU-na-da KISIB a-sur-ni-su DUMU sa-la-dim KISIB a-sur-DU10 KISIB i-di-a-bi4-im DUMU a-mur-ISTAR sa hu-bu-ul a-mur-ISTAR i-di-a-bu-um ki-ma a-mur-ISTAR a-bi-su ik-nu-uk 1.5 ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-mur-ISTAR DUMU na-ab-su-en6 a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-la-hi-im u e-na-ma-nim 2 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab ITU.KAM sa ki-na-tim li-mu-um sa i-na qa-ti i-di-a-sur DUMU ku-bi4-di il5-qe-u su-ma i-na tup-pi-su pa-ni-im sa a-mur-ISTAR 2 GIN.TA la-pi-it 2 GIN.TA-ma u-sa-ab su-ma 1.5 GIN.TA la-pi-it en-na-num u a-mur-ISTAR uk-ta-nu tup-pu-um pa-ni-um sa hu-bu-ul a-mur-ISTAR E a-sur-ni-su i-ba-si ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tu-um me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-mur-ISTAR DUMU na-ab-su-en6
tgt: Seals: Puzur-Aššur s. Suen-nādā, Aššur-nīšu s. Saladim, Aššur-ṭāb, Idī-abum s. Amur-Ištar. Regarding the debt of Amur-Ištar (Iddin-abum sealed in place of his father Amur-Ištar.), Amur-Išṭar s. Nāb-Suen owes Aššur-rēʾī 1 mina 32 shekels refined silver. He will add 2 shekels per mina per month from the ḫamuštum of Al-aḫum and Ennamaya. Month: (Narmak-Aššur) ša kēnātim. Eponymate: He who took it from teh hand of Idī-Aššur s. Kūbidi. If in a previous of tablet belonigng to Amur-Ištar it is written 2 shekels (rate), he will indded add at a 2 shekel rate. If (a) 1 1/2 shekel (rate) is written, Ennānum and Amur-Ištar will establish it. There is a previous tablet concerning the debt of Amur-Ištar in the house of Aššur-nīšu. This memorandum is a copy of the sealed tablet concerning the debt of Amur-Ištar s. Nabi-Suen.

src: um-ma bu-zu-ta-a-ma a-na a-mur-{d}UTU a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku u pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma AN.NA u TUG.HI.A sa {d}EN.ZU-na-we-er u li-pa-a ir-de8-u-ni-ku-nu-ti-ni lu i-a-u-tum lu sa ba-ri-ni a-na i-a-u-tim-ma i-tu-ru as-pu-ra-ku-nu-ti um-ma a-na-ku-ma 1 GU AN.NA a-na ku-ku-zi-zi-a {d}EN.ZU-na-we-er lu-bi4-il5 u a-na {d}EN.ZU-na-we-er 10 TUG.HI.A u 20 TUG.HI.A di-na-su-um u si-im-i-su ki se-er DAM.GAR-ri-im ke-nim sa la ta-sa-hu-ta-ni id-a-a lu a-na ku-ku-zi-zi-a tu-se-bi4-la lu a-na {d}EN.ZU-na-we-er ta-di-na lu i-na se-er DAM.GAR ta-di-a a-hu-a a-tu-nu te-er-ta-ku-nu li-li-kam lu KU.BABBAR lu TUG.HI.A a-na E ka-ri-im su-ma is-ta-pu-ku qa-ti id-a-a KU.BABBAR sa i-na ba-ab-ti-a tal-qe-a-ni id-a-a su-ma i-na ba-ab-ti-a la ta-al-qe-a a-na si-ib-tim li-qe-a-nim u-la pu-su-ke-en6 li-is-qu-ul-ma su-mi lu-up-ta lu KU.KI is-tu wa-ah-su-sa-na u-se-bi4-lu-nim lu KU.BABBAR sa hu-ra-sa-nim u a-sur-SIG5 re-eq
tgt: From Buzutaya to Amur-Šamaš, Aššur-taklāku, and Pūšu-kēn: The tin and textiles which Suen-nawer and Libbaya drove to you (pl.), both mine and those between us, they converted them all to mine. I wrote to you (pl.). I said, "Let Suen-nawer bring 1 talent tin to Kukkuzizzia. And to Suen-nawer, give 10 or 20 textiles to him. And set his prices as though it were a trusted merchant for whom you did not (have a relationship configured by) the dressing of a garment." Concerning that which you sent to Kukkuzizzia, which you gave to Suen-Nawer, or which you placed on a merchant, my dear brothers, let your message come. The silver, the textiles to the colony office, if they called for deposits, deposit my share. Deposit silver which you take from my accounts. If you do not (have anything to) take anything from my accounts, borrow silver on interest for me. Let not Pūšu-kēn pay but write my name down. Both the gold which he sent from Waḫšušana and silver from Ḫuraṣānum and Aššur-damiq is idle!

src: ki-ma te-ra-tu-ka-ma a-ta-na-di-ka-ni-ma ha-ra-nam sa-ni-tu la i-ba-si-u a-wa-tam a-na E.GAL-lim sa-zu-za-am la ni-le-e 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-a as-qu-ul-ku-nu-ti-ma su-a-num u na-ki-li-at na-as-u-ni-ku-nu-ti a-ga-ma-ar-ku-nu a-na-kam
tgt: Becasue I kept depositing(?) you and there was not another caravan, we were unable to settle the matter at the palace. I will pay 1 mina silver to you (pl) and Šū-Anum and Nakiled will bring it to you. I will settle with you. Here ...

src: 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-na se-er su-be-lim a-sur-i-di i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-gu5-a 0.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab ha-ti u me-er-a-sa e-ru-ba-tu-a a-di KU.BABBAR u-sa-ba-a-ni-ni ma-ma-an u-la i-ta-hi-si-na-ti IGI en-um-a-a IGI a-sur-ma-lik
tgt: He will add 1/2 shekel (per mina) per month (as interest) from the ḫamuštum of Agua. Witnesses: Ennamāya, Aššur-mālik.

src: KISIB a-la-bi-im DUMU zi-a KISIB su-be-lim DUMU ba-zi-a KISIB la-qe-ep DUMU i-zi-za-am-DINGIR sa hu-bu-ul en-na-nim DUMU i-di-a-bi-im sa 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-na a-sur-SIPA ha-bu-lu is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-na-ah-i-li a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um a-al-DU10 a-hu ib-ni-li KU.BABBAR a-ni-um a-su-mi ba-a-a i-sa-qa-al ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul en-na-nim DUMU i-di-a-bi4-im
tgt: He will pay 13 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Anāḫ-ilī. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest. Eponymate: Al-ṭāb b. Ibnī-ilī. As for this silver, he will pay it to the name of Baya.

src: a-na a-la-hi-im a-gu5-za a-sur-na-da u i-li-a-lim qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma 5 GIN par-zi-lam DINGIR-i-di-na-su DUMU a-sur-na-da 2 GIN par-zi-lam i-ku-pi-a DUMU a-sur-dan 6 ma-na AN.NA i-ku-nu-um DUMU sa-ma-a-a PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU sa-ak-ta-a-a a-na ta-ad-mi-iq-tim i-di-su-nu-ti 23.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR ha-bu-ul-ni-a-ti-ma ni-a-ti u-sa-ki-lu a-hu-a a-tu-nu ih-da-ma i-sa-ha-at a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim u am-ri-a i-zi-za-ma KU.BABBAR se-si-a-ma a qa-ti <big_gap> a-na 4 ma-na is-te-ni-is zu-za-ma se-bi4-la-nim i-na 30 ma-na hu-sa-ri sa ba-ri su-{d}EN.LIL a-sur-ma-lik i-a-ti u a-mur-ISTAR i-na ki-li hu-sa-ri 5 ma-na hu-sa-ri u-sa-ni-iq-ma u ku-nu-ku-um sa 0.33333 ma-na SA.BA na-di um-ma su-ut-ma lu i ka-ni-is lu i ha-hi-im a-da-su-nu-ma KU.BABBAR a-ka-sa-da-ku-nu-ti a-pu-tum a-wi-lum e is-li-ku-nu-ma su-ma i-nu-mi ta-zu-za-ni hu-sa-ri sa se-pi-su la ub-la-ma ma-ah-ri-ku-nu la is-ku-un-ma is-te-ni-is la tu-us-te-bi4-la-ma la ta-zu-za a-wi-lam DIRI la ta-ga-mi-la-su hu-sa-ru sa se-pi-su SIG5 da-ni-is
tgt: To Alāhum, Aguza, Aššur-nādā and Ilī-alum from Aššur-idī: 5 shekels of iron: Ili-iddinaššu son of Aššur-nādā; 2 shekels of iron: Ikuppia son of Aššur-dān; 6 minas of tin: Ikūnum son of Samaya -- Puzur-Ištar son of Saktaya has given them (this) as an interest-free loan. He owes 23 1/2 minas of silver to us, and it is us they have satisfied. My dear brothers, take care to support Aššur-bēl-awātim and Amria, raise the silver and divide it up jointly in shares for you of 4 minas, and send that to me. Out of the 30 minas of lapis lazuli owned jointly by Šū-Illil, Aššur-malik, myself and Amur-Ištar, i.e. out of all of the lapis lazuli, I checked 5 minas of lapis lazuli and a seal costing 1/3 mina (of silver) was deposited with it. He said: "I shall sell these either in Kaneš or in Hahhum, and I shall acquire silver for you." Please, the man must not cheat you, so when you make the division, if he has not brought the lapis lazuli carried by him, has not deposited it in front of you, so that you have not (been able) to send it jointly, or divided it, then do not favour the man with any extras! The lapis lazuli carried by him is of outstanding quality.

src: KISIB u-sa-nim DUMU a-mur-a-sur KISIB ku-lu-ma-a DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti KISIB hu-ni-a DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti KISIB DU10-si-la-a-sur DUMU a-sur-i-di KISIB a-sur-tak-la-ku DUMU a-la-hi-im KISIB be-la-nim DUMU su-a-sur KISIB PUZUR4-a-na DUMU en-na-a-sur KISIB i-di-a-sur DUMU KISIB a-sur-pi-la-ah ra-bi-si-im sa a-mur-ISTAR KISIB su-en6-SIPA KISIB i-li-ba-ni KISIB a-sur-ni-su KISIB su-la-ba-an me-er-e a-mur-ISTAR KISIB a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5 KISIB bu-za-zu KISIB i-ku-pa-sa me-er-e pu-su-ke-en6 a-sur-pi-la-ah MASKIM sa E a-mur-ISTAR su-en6-SIPA i-li-ba-ni a-sur-ni-su u su-la-ba-an ki-ma ra-mi-ni-su-nu u ki-ma ab-sa-lim DUMU.SAL a-mur-ISTAR u i-di-in-{d}ISKUR a-hi-su-nu a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 bu-za-zu i-ku-pa-sa me-er-u pu-su-ke-en6 ki-ma ra-mi-ni-su-nu u ki-ma a-ha-ha gu5-ba-ab-tim u a-hi-su-nu su-e-a i-na mi-ig-ra-ti-su-nu is-bu-tu-ni-a-ti-ma ni-is a-lim{ki} it-mu-u-ma a-wa-ti-su-nu nu-ga-me-er-ma lu a-mur-ISTAR sa-zu-uz-ti pu-su-ke-en6 i-zi-iz lu pu-su-ke-en6 sa-zu-uz-ti a-mur-ISTAR i-zi-iz lu a-hu-um a-na a-hi-im ma-as-ka-tam u-se-bi4-il5 lu a-hu-um sa a-hi-im KU.BABBAR i-na ba-ab-tim il5-qe lu tup-pu-um ha-ar-mu-um sa ku-nu-ki-su-nu lu sa si-be-e lu si-ip-ka-tim a-hu-um a-na a-hi-im is-pu-uk lu i-na a-lim{ki} lu i-na GAN-lim me-er-u a-mur-ISTAR u me-er-at a-mur-ISTAR gu5-ba-ab-tum me-er-u pu-su-ke-en6 u DUMU.SAL pu-su-ke-en6 gu5-ba-ab-tum a-hu-um a-na a-hi-im a-na mi-ma su-um-su la i-tu-ar a-wi-lu a-ni-u-tum ga-me-er a-wa-tim
tgt: Siege[l des Us]ān[um, des Sohnes des] Ām[ur]aššur; Siegel des Kulumā´ā, [des Sohnes des] Aššurimittī; Sie[gel des Ḫuni'a, des Sohnes des Aššu]rimittī; Siegel des Tāb-ṣillaššur, des Sohnes des A[ššurid]ī; Siegel des Aššurtaklāku des Sohnes des Alâḫum; Siegel des Bēlānu[m, des Sohne]s des Šū'aššur; Siegel des Puzurenna, des Sohnes des Enn[a'aššur]; Siegel des Idī'ašš[ur, des] S]o[hnes des Dā]naššur; Siegel des Aššurpilaḫ, des Komissäars <des Hauses> Āmurištar; Siegel des S[u'i]nrē'ûm, Siegel des Ilībāni, Siegel des Aššurnīsū, Siegel des Š[ūlab]an, der Söhne des Āmurištar; Siegel des Aššurmuttabbil, Siegel des Buzāzu, S[iege]l des Ikuppāša, der Söhne des Pūšukēn; Aššurpilaḫ, [der Kommis]sär des Houses Āmurištar, Su'inrē'ûm, Ilībāni, Aššurnīšu und Šūlaban, in eigener Sache und als Vertreter der Abšalim, der Tochter des Āmurištar, und des Iddinadad, ihres Bruders, Aššurmuttabbil, Buzāzu, Ikuppāša, [die Söhn]e des [Pūšuk]ēn, in ei[gener Sache] und als Vertreter der Aḫāḫā <ihrer Schwester>, [der gubabtu]m-Priesterin, und ihres Bruders S[u'e'a haben auf] ihre gegenseitgigen Verpflichtungen un[s (als Richter) genommen]. Den Eid bei der Stadt haben sie ge[leis]tet. Dann haben wir ihre Rechtsstreitigkeiten be[en]det: Entweder ist Āmurištar als Vertreter des Pūšukēn ist als Vertreter des Āmurištar aufgetreten; oder der eine hat dem anderen ein Depôt geschickt: Entweder hat der eine des anderen Silber vom Außenstand eingenommen, oder, (was) eine Doppel- urkunde mit den Siegeln (des einen) von ihnen oder das (Gut) der Karawanen beziehungsweise die Vorräte (betrifft), (so) hat der eine (es) dem anderen aufgespeichert, (und zwar) sowohl in Assur als auch in Kappadokien. Die Söhne des Āmurištar und die Tochter des Āmurištar, die gubabtum-Priesterin, die Söhne des Pūšukēn und die Tochter des Pūšukēn, die gubabtum-Priesterin: Die eine (Partei) wird auf die andere in irgendeiner Sache nicht zurckkommen. Diese Leute (waren) [die Beender der Rechtssach]en.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma PUZUR4-a-sur-ma 7.5 GU AN.NA ku-nu-ku 1 me-at 80 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 2.33333 sa ka-sa-ri-im 1 GU AN.NA qa-tim 9 ANSE sa-la-mu u u-nu-su-nu mi-ma a-nim {d}UTU-ba-ni i-ra-de8-a-kum 2.5 GU AN.NA ku-nu-ku 10 ku-ta-ni su-ISTAR i-ra-de8 a-li KU.BABBAR 1 GIN e-li-a-ni AN.NA u TUG.HI.A sa ta-da-nim a-na su-ISTAR di-in-ma a-se-er sa ki ku-a-ti su-pur-ma i sa-ha-ti-su li-zi-zu <big_gap>-am li-qe la u-su-ru KU.BABBAR le-ru-ub-ma AN.NA u TUG.HI.A lu-us-u i wa-su-ur ha-ra-nim lu-qu-ti a ku-lu-ma-a a-pa-qi-da-ma a-ta-be-a-ma a-ta-la-kam
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Puzur-Aššur: 7 1/2 talents of tin under seals, 180 kutānum-textiles, 2 1/3 (textiles) for the transporter, 1 talent of 'hand-tin', 9 black donkeys and their equipment: Šamaš-bāni transports all this to you. Šū-Ištar transports 2 1/2 talents tin under seals and 10 kutānum-textiles. Wherever any shekel of silver arises, sell the tin and textiles which can be sold to Šū-Ištar and send (them) to your representatives and let them stand at his side.

src: um-ma su-e-ta-ta-ma a-na i-di-a-bi4-im-ma qi-ta-am sa il5-ba-ni e-zi-ba-kum um-ma i-di-a-bu-um-ma ke-na te-zi-ba-am a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um wa-ah-su-sa-na i-di-ni-ma tup-pa-am a-di-in IGI GIR-sa-a-sur
tgt: Suetata said to Idī-abim, "I left the tablet? of Ilī-bāni to you." Idī-abum said: "True. You left it."

src: KISIB a-na-ah-DINGIR DUMU PUZUR4.DINGIR KISIB kur-ub-ISTAR DUMU PUZUR4.DINGIR KISIB a-na-ah-DINGIR DUMU en-na-su-en6 KISIB ta-ha e-mi-su sa hu-bu-ul a-na-ah-DINGIR DUMU en-na-su-en6 u ta-ha e-mi-su sa 2.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa na-ra-am-ZU u ha-na-nim a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu KU.BABBAR i-na qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is su-ma i-na u4-mi-su-nu ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-lu 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM-im u-su-bu ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-na-ah-DINGIR DUMU en-na-su-en6 u ta-ha e-mi-su
tgt: Seals: Anaḫ-ilī s. Puzur-ilī, Kurub-Ištar s. Puzur-ilī, Anaḫ-ilī s. Enna-Suen, Taḫa (father) in law of Anaḫ-ilī. Regarding the debt of Anaḫ-ilī s. Enna Suen and Taḫa his (father) in law. They will pay 20 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Naram-Suen and Ḫannānim. The silver is bound to whomever is solvent. If they do not pay on time, they will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest. Regarding the debt of Anaḫ-ilī s. Enna-Suen and Taḫa his (father) in law.

src: a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku-ma a-na se-ni-su se-ne-en6 pa-ti-te-en6 si-pa-ra-tim sa 5 GIN KU.BABBAR u tup-pa-am sa a-sur-la-ma-si DUMU a-la-hi-im a-na a-sur-DUG ip-qi-da-ni a-ma-kam i-bi-si mi-ma u-nu-tim i-a-tim u sa su-ha-ri u-na-di-id-ma la-su su-ha-ri a-ma-kam sa-il5 si-pa-ra-tim u tup-pa-am a-na a-sur-DU10 ta-er-ma te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam me-nu-zi-il5-ka sa-al <gap>
tgt: To Aššur-nādā from Aššur-taklāku: Take action for me there with respect to two pairs of open sandals, bronze nails worth 5 shekels of silver plus the tablet that Aššur-lamassī, the son of Alāhum, entrusted to Aššur-tāb. I searched all my own things and those of the servants, but it is gone. Ask the servants there and return the bronze nails and the tablet to Aššur-tab, and sent me word here. Ask Minusilka.

src: a-na a-la-hi-im u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma KU.BABBAR u KU.GI ma-la is-tu tur4-hu-mi-it u-se-bu-lu-ni-ku-nu-ti-ni a-na sa qi-ip-ti-a su-uk-na-ma su-ma i-li-a-lum su-ri ma-si-ir a-sa-me-ma i-di-su-en6 pa-ni-ni i-se-e a-ma-su i-na ka-ni-is le-zi-ib-ma su-a-ti a-na a-lim{ki} tu-ru-su-ma a-na ba-ra-im a-na ka-ni-is li-ik-su-dam su-ma a-la-hu-um la-su sa ki-ma su-a-ti a si-bu-tim su-ku-ma KU.BABBAR sa ba-ri-ni a-na su-mi ki-la-le-ni eq-lam le-ti-iq 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am ha-na-nu-um DUMU i-ku-pi-a DUMU i-ku-a sa ba-ri-ni na-si ni-is-ha-su u sa-du-a-su i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-a lu i-si-im TUG.HI-ti-a i-di-ma a ba-ri-ni li-li-ik su-ha-ri sa e-li-u-ni-ni KI sa-hi-ri a-pu-ul
tgt: To Alāhum and Aššur-taklāku from Aššur-nādā: Whatever silver and gold they will send to you from Durhumit, add that to what (I owe) on goods entrusted to me, and if Ilī-ālum (is there), then certainly it is agreed. Hannānum son of Ikuppiya, grandson of Ikua, is on his way with 10 minas of refined silver that belongs to us both. Deposit its import duty and its transport tariff (with money taken) from my silver or from the price of my textiles, and let the amount go for us both. Dispatch the servants who have arrived with Saher-ilī.

src: KISIB su-su-en6 DUMU na-bi-su-en6 KISIB su-la-ba-an DUMU su-ma-bi4-a KISIB sa-si-a DUMU a-sur-SIPA sa hu-bu-ul sa-si-a 1 ma-na 12 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ma-ak-ru-a ITU na-ar-ma-ak a-sur sa ke-na-tim a-na 1 ma-na-im 2 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i-na ITU u-sa-ab li-mu-um sa qa-ti su-ka-li-a
tgt: Seals of Šū-Suen s. Nabi-Suen, Šū-Laban s. Šuma-abia, Sasiya s. Aššur-rē'ī. Regarding the debt of Sasiya, 1 mina 12 shekels refined silver. He will add interest at a rate of 2 shekels per mina per month from the ḫamuštum of Makrua, month Narmak-Aššur ša kēnātim. Eponymate after Sukkaliya.

src: 7 me-at 20 DUG GIG sa ik-ri-bi sa {d}IM i li-bi en-num-a-sur URUDU-si-na 7 me-at 20 ma-na
tgt: 720 pots of wheat -- votive offering (belonging to the temple) of Adad -- are due from Ennum-Aššur. Their copper is 720 minas.

src: KISIB bu-ur-a-sur KISIB en-um-a-sur KISIB a-bu-sa-lim sa hu-bu-ul a-bu sa lim sa 1.5 ma-na 7.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-bu-sa-lim a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-{d}UTU-si u a-mur-{d}UTU a-na 3 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-bu-sa-lim
tgt: Seals: Bur-Aššur, Ennum-Aššur, Abu-šalim. Regarding the debt of Abu-šalim. Abu-šalim owes Aššur-rēʾī 1 1/2 minas 7 1/3 shekels refined silver. He will pay 3 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-Šamši and Amur-Šamas. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er se-zi-zi u su-ku-bi-im en-nam-be-lum i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa la-qi-pi-im u bu-zu-ta-a a-na 3 ITU.KAM i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab KU.BABBAR i-na qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI su-be-lim IGI PUZUR4-a-sur
tgt: Šezizi and Šū-Kūbim owe Enna-Bēlum 2 minas refined silver. Witnesses: Šū-Bēlim, Puzur-Aššur

src: um-ma a-sur-ka-si-id-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma 1 GU 5 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ki-a u li-wi-su 4.5 ma-na AN.NA a-na qa-ti-su-nu a-di-in a-sur-i-mi-ti u bu-ni-ma-hu-um na-as-u-ni-kum 1 TUG ik-ri-bu sa {d}NIN.SUBUR ki-la-li-ma di-in-ma si-im-su-nu se-bi4-lam AN.NA 1 GU il5-qe-e <gap> hu-ur <gap> na-ru-qam i-na-si-u ha <gap> a-na-ku <big_gap> <gap>-na-di-im <big_gap>
tgt: From Aššur-kāšid to Aššur-nādā: 1 talent 5 minas of tin under my seal, plus its wrapping--I gave 4 1/2 minas of tin for their expenses--Aššur-imittī and Bunima-ahum are on their way to you (with this). Sell to both one textile, votive offerings for divine Ilabrat, and send me their proceeds. At least one talent of tin ...

src: um-ma su-li-ma a-na bu-za-zu qi-bi-ma a-di TUG.HI-ti-ka sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni hu-sa-ra-am ni-is-ba-at-ma um-ma su-ut-ma <big_gap> <gap> ti <big_gap> <gap> er-su-um <big_gap> <gap> e a ni is <gap> <big_gap> um-ma ne-nu-ma <big_gap> si-im <big_gap> TUG.HI-ti di-in um-ma su-ut-ma TUG <big_gap> si-im <gap> <big_gap> la al <big_gap> TUG.HI-ti su a <big_gap> <gap> ki a <big_gap> KU.BABBAR <big_gap> u <big_gap>
tgt: From Šūli to Buzazu: Regading your textiles about which you wrote me, we seized the lapis lazuli and he said, "..."

src: <gap> GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er DINGIR-na-da sa-li-ma-nu-um i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-di-a-sur a-na <gap> ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul <gap> GIN.TA a ma-na-im i ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim IGI <big_gap>
tgt: Ilī-nādā owes Šalim-Anum x shekels silver.

src: KISIB a-mur-{d}UTU KISIB a-bu-sa-lim sa hu-bu-ul a-mur-a-sur 2 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um sa a-sur-SIPA is-tu ha-mus-tim sa kur-ub-ISTAR u a-la-hi-im a-na 7 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-mur-a-sur
tgt: Seals: Amur-Šamaš, Abu-šalim. Regarding Amur-Aššur's debt of 2 minas 15 shekels refined silver owed to Aššur-rēʾī. He will pay 7 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Kurub-Ištar and Al-aḫim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-se-er AN.NA-ki-im sa a-na en-nam-a-sur ta-di-nu u TUG.HI.A ma-la ra-du-im ra-di-su-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN i sa TUG.HI-ti-a le-li-am u qa-su-ma lu-ka-il5 a-sa-me-ma <gap>-<big_gap>-<gap> ti a-na {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni DUMU a-sur-ma-lik a-ma-kam wa-sa-ab gi-ri-su-ma AN.NA u TUG.HI.A a-na u4-me qu-ur-bu-tim ma-la ta-da-nim di-su-um um-ma a-ta-ma te-er-ti sa-lim-a-hi-im AN.NA-ki u TUG.HI.A mi-ma a-na sa ki-ma ku-a-ti la te-zi-ib qa-at-ka-ma i-se-er DAM.GAR li-di-ma ki-ma-ma KU.BABBAR i se-pi-ka tu-ub-la-ni li-bi4 i-ha-du
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: Regarding the tin which you gave to Ennam-Aššur and the textiles, gather up as much as you can so that I can raise every shekel of silver from my textiles. But let him retain his share. I heard that ... to(?) Ilabrat-bāni is there. Approach him and give to him as many tin and textiles as you can on short terms. Thus you will say, "The instructions of Šalim-aḫum: Do not hand over my tin and textiles to any of your representatives. Let your share be deposited to the merchant so that my heart is gladdened specifically by you bearing the silver in your transport."

src: 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-a-nim DUMU me-na-nim-su-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-ba-ni i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa qa-ti e-na-ah-DINGIR a-na 6 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.1.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um su-su-en6 DUMU pa-pi-lim IGI a-hu-wa-qar DUMU su-ISTAR IGI a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku DUMU am-ri-a IGI PUZUR4-a-be-e DUMU en-um-a-sur
tgt: Šū-Anum s. Menānum owes Šū-Ištar s. Aššur-bāni 2 minas refined silver. He will pay 6 weeks from ḫamuštum after Inaḫ-ilī. If he does not pay in full on time, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: 18 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er i-di-su-in pu-su-ke-in i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa su-ku-bu-um u kur-ub-ISTAR a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i u4-me-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i ITU.KAM u-sa-ab ITU.KAM sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-di-a-bi4-im IGI e-di-na-a IGI i-ku-pi-a-sur
tgt: Idī-Suen owes Pūšu-kēn 18 shekels silver. He will pay 13 'weeks' after the week of Šū-Kūbum and Kurub-Ištar. If he does not pay when the term is full, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Month: ša sarrātum Year: year after the year of Idī-abum (REL 94 ii). Witnesses: Idinnāya, Ikuppī-Aššur.

src: KISIB i-ku-nim DUMU <big_gap> KISIB en-um-a-sur DUMU u-sa-ri-a KISIB a-sur-i-di DUMU PUZUR4-a-sur KISIB i-na-su-en6 DUMU en-num-i-li 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-di-in ITU.KAM te-i-na-tim li-mu-um
tgt: Seals of Ikūnim s. . . ., Ennum-Aššur s. ú-sa-ri-a, Aššur-idī s. Puzur-Aššur, Enna-Suen s. en-num-ì-lí.

src: um-ma a-la-hu-um u zu-pa-ma a-na {d}a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma a-na ma-la tup-pi-im sa ka-ri-im ki-ma 10 u4-me la ta-su-us a-di a-wu-ni-su-ni is-ti E.GAL-lim ni-la-qe-u-ni a-na-kam sa ki-ma su-ku-bi4-im ka-ra-am im-hu-ru-ma um-ma su-nu-ma a-sur-na-da a-na ni-ka-si u-la i-za-az su-ku-bu-um lu ra-bi4-su-nu-ma a si-2-a-ti ni-is-ta-la-ma a-na ni-ka-si a-na gam-ra-tim-ma nu-us-ra-zi-iz-ka 6 {TUG}ku-ta-ni 6 TUG su-ru-tim a-na E ka-ri-im ni-ta-di 0.5 ma-na.TA a-na ku-ta-ni 18 GIN.TA a-na su-ru-tim a-na ni-ka-si ta-sa-kan i-na a-wa-at a-lim{ki} sa a-na ni-ka-si i-sa-hu-tu-ni hu-bu-lam sa ka-ri-im-ma
tgt: In accordance with the tablet of the colony authorities you should not worry for ten days, i.e. until we receive (a decision in) our case from the palace. Here Šū-Kūbum' s representatives appealed to the colony, saying: "Aššur-nādā is not ready for the accounting." Šū-Kūbum is indeed their attorney; that is why we have made inquiries and have appointed you to answer for it all at the accounting. We gave 6 According to the order of the City, who evades the accounting shall pay the debt of the colony.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 i-na-a u ki-li-a qi-bi-ma um-ma su-ku-bu-um-ma a-hu-u-a a-tu-nu qa-ti i-na me-si-ti-a lu a-na ni-ka-si lu a-na i-ta-at-lim mi-ma tap-pa-u-a sa i-na-di-u u a-tu-nu i-ta-di-a-ma sa a-na ni-ka-si a-na ni-ka-si-a i-da sa a-na i-ta-at-lim a-na i-ta-at-lim KU.BABBAR le-qe-a-ma se-bi-la-nim a-hu-u-a a-tu-nu qa-ti i me-si-ti-a qa-di ta-pa-e-ma i-ta-di-ma ma-ma-an ma-e i se-ri-a la i-sa-ti a-na te-er-ti-a ih-da u a-na-ku a-wi-il5 gi5-mi-lim a-sar ga-ma-lim a-ga-mi-il5-ku-nu
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn, Innāya, and Kiliya from Šū-Kūbum: My dear brothers, my share from my m. both to accountings and for cash, all that my partners have deposited, you also have deposited and deposit that which is appropriate for accountings for accountings. Take that which can be taken as cash as cash in silver and send it to me. My dear brothers, my share from my m. should be deposited together with that of my partners so that no one drinks water off my back. Take heed of my instructions. I also am a man of favors. Wherever needed, I will do a favor for you.

src: 1.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ta-i-a ka-ma-li-a u nu-u-nu a-sur-ma-lik i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ka-si-im a-na 15 ha-am-sa-tim a-na sa pa-ar-ka i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 3 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu
tgt: Tāya, Kammalīya and Nūnu owe Aššur-mālik 1/2 mina refined silver.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma PUZUR4-a-sur-ma a-ma-kam-ma aq-bi-kum um-ma a-na-ku-ma wa-ar-ha-am is-te-en6 la-as-hu-ur-ma ba-ab-ti KU.BABBAR 1 GIN lu-za-ki um-ma a-ta-ma me-he-er-ka e-ez-ba-ma KU.BABBAR u-sa-as-qal-ma wa-ar-ka-at-ka u-se-ba-la-kum u me-eh-ra-at URUDU sa E.GAL-lim u 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa tup-pe-e ha-ru-mu-tim 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-na ra-mi-ni-a a-na-di-ma u-se-ba-la-kum a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta i-hi-id-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN sa a-ma-kam e-zi-bu za-ki-ma u 10 ma-na-e KU.BABBAR sa pa-ka ta-di-na-ni i-di-ma KU.BABBAR ku-nu-uk-ma a-na a-lim{ki} li-ik-su-da-ma si-ma-am qa-ti li-is-a-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN le-li-a-am 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa a-da-da i-ku-pi-a-sur sa-qa-lam qa-bi KU.BABBAR i-ku-pi-a-sur sa-as-qi-il5-su im-gu5-u-a la tu-sa-as-ha-ar-su-ma i pa-ne-e-ma a-li-ki-im tur4-da-su-ma li-ik-su-da-ni E-et-ka u su-hu-ur-ka sa-lim 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa i li-bi4 i-a-sar a-di-u su-ma la u-se-bi4-lam su-pur-ma lu-se-bi4-la-kum
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Puzur-Aššur: I spoke to you there. You said, "As for me, I will be delayed one month in order for me to clear every shekel of all my outstanding claims." You said, "Leave them here for me and I will have the silver paid out and send the silver after you." Also, I will deposit (arrange)-from my own funds- the proceeds of the copper from the palace and the 4 minas silver from the sealed tablet--10 minas silver and send it to you. My dear father and lord, take care to clear every (remaining?) shekel of silver there and so deposit the 10 minas silver which you promised me and seal the silver and ship it to the city so that my account can make purchases and I may raise every shekel of silver possible. 5 minas silver which Ikuppi-Aššur promised (subjunctive?) to pay Adada, cause Ikuppi-Aššur to pay the silver. You must not delay Imgua but dispatch him immediately to the city so that he may catch up to me. May your house and your little ones be well. 5 minas silver belonging to Ea-šār which I deposited, if he did not send it, write to him so that he sends it.

src: 15 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-zu a-hu-wa-qar i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa en-na-nim a-na 22 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-me-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM a-la-na-tim li-mu-um i-di-a-bu-um IGI a-sur-i-di DUMU i-li-a IGI i-ku-pi-ISTAR DUMU il5-me-sar
tgt: Azu owes Aḫu-waqar 15 shekels refined silver. He will pay 22 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Ennanum. If he does not pay at the fulfillment of his term, he will add interest at the colony rate. Month: Allānātum. Eponymate: Iddin-abum. Witnesses: Aššur-idī s. Iliya, Ikuppī-Ištar s. il₅-me-šar.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma DINGIR-mu-ta-bi4-il5-ma u en-nam-a-sur-ma i-na 4 GU AN.NA ku-nu-ki sa a-lim{ki} sa DINGIR-mu-ta-bi4-il5 ub-la-ni nu-ba-li-it-ma a-na a-bi4-i-la-am-dim 1.5 ma-na.TA i-ti-ir SA.BA 0.83333 ma-na 2 GIN a-na E ka-ri-im e-ri-ib-ti AN.NA-ka ni-is-qul si-ti AN.NA-ka 4 GU 5 ma-na 8 GIN AN.NA-ka iz-ku-am 9 GIN 22.5 SE.TA AN.NA-ka ta-di-in KU.BABBAR-ap-su 26.83333 ma-na 1.8333300000000001 GIN i-na 6 TUG su-ru-tim u 2 ku-ta-ni sa li-wi-tim SA.BA 3 su-ru-tim u 2 ku-ta-ni a-na ma-la te-er-ti-ka a-na a-la-hi-im a-di-in si-ti TUG.HI-ti-ka 3 TUG su-ru-tim a-na 40 LA 1 ma-na URUDU ta-ad-nu SA.BA 32 ma-na a-na ku-ta-nim as-qul-ma a-na qa-ti-ka a-na E ka-ri-im a-di-i si-ti URUDU-ka 7 ma-na URUDU i li-bi4-a <gap> TUG sa a-ki-di-e <gap> <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> al-qe-u <gap> <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> ta ta-ad-nu e-ri-ib-ti <gap> sa a-na E ka-ri-im ni-di-in 20 ma-na.TA li-ti si-ti URUDU-ka is-ti lu-lu i-ba-si-u 18 GU 45 ma-na iz-ku-am 1.66666 ma-na 5 GIN.TA 10.66666 ma-na 2.83333 GIN KU.BABBAR-ap-su SU.NIGIN 38.5 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR-ap-ka u 1 GU 4 ma-na URUDU SA.BA 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-sur-i-mi-ti ub-la-ku-um 11 ma-na 3.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR a-hu-qar ub-la-ku-um 12 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-di-{d}UTU ub-la-ku-um a-ha-ma 5.5 ma-na 8 KU.BABBAR <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR a qa-ti i-di-{d}UTU SU.NIGIN 38.66666 ma-na 5.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR i-li-ka-ku-um u 41.66666 ma-na i li-bi4 DINGIR-mu-ta-bi4-il5
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Ilī-mutabbil and Ennam-Aššur: From the 4 'talents' tin under seals from the city which Ilī-mutabbil brought, we 'cleared' and he tāru to Abi-ilamdim at a rate of 1 1/2 minas. Thereof, we weighed out 52 shekels to the colony office as the entry tax. (As for) the remainder of your tin, your tin cleared 4 talents 5 minas 8 shekels. Your tin is sold at a rate of 9 shekels 22 1/2 grains (per shekel silver). Its (yield in) silver was 26 minas 51 5/6 shekels. From the 6 šurum-textiles and kutānum-textiles that were wrappings, thereof I gave 3 šurum-textiles and x kutānum-textiles to Al-aḫum according to your instructions. The remainder of your textiles are 2 šurum-textiles. They are sold for 39 minas copper. Thereof, I weighed out 32 minas for a kutānum-textile and deposited it in your account in the colony office. The remainder of your copper, 7 minas copper, are with me. ... Akkadian textiles, which I took .. are sold. ... eribti ... which went to the colony office, we gave. 20 minas liti silver? The remainder of your copper is with Lulu. They cleared 18 talents 45 minas. At a rate of 1 minas 45 shekels, its silver is 10 minas 42 5/6 shekels. In all, your silver is 38 minas 30+ shekels. Now, as for the 1 talent 4 minas copper, Aššur-imittī brings to you thereof 10 minas silver. Ahuqar brings you 11 minas 3 1/3 shekels silver. Idi-Šamaš brings you 12 minas silver. Separately 5 minas 38 shekels silver .... x minas silver are in the hands of Idi-Šamaš. x minas are to the account of Idi-Šamaš. In sum, 38 minas 45 1/3 shekels silver goes to the two of us. And 41 minas 40 shekels is with Ilī-mutabbil.

src: 0.33333 ma-na 6 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er la-qe-ep DUMU a-sur-ma-lik a-di-ma-tum ti-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa en-na-ma-nim u a-la-hi-im a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab
tgt: Lāqēp s. Aššur-mālik owes Adi-matum (f) 1/3 mina 6 shekels refined silver. He will pay 13 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Ennamānim and Al-aḫim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels at the rate of the colony as interest.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma a-bu-sa-lim-ma a-sa-me-ma a-ma-at a-bi-ni ma-ha-i ip-tur4 a-na E a-bi-ni e u-se-ri-ib-si-ma sa-al-tam E a-bi-ni e is-ku-un a-bi a-ta a-na E a-bi-ni u-la u-se-ra-ab-si a-sar li-bi-su lu-se-si-ib-si i-na KA ha-ra-ni-a u-ra-ni as-ba-at-ma um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-na a-lim{ki} a-la-ak mi-ma sa ta-da-nim di-nam um-ma su-ut-ma su-hu-ur-ka u-sa-kal a-bi a-ta a-na GEME KU.BABBAR 10 GIN u 0.33333 ma-na li-di-in u a-na-kam a-na-ku a ma-la te-er-ti-ka sa a-na sa-lim-a-hi-im ub-la-ni e-pu-us
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Abu-šalim: I hear that my 'uncle' (maḫā'um) freed the maid of our father. He must not bring her into the house of our father and cause a quarrel in our father's house. My dear father, he bring her into the house of our father. He can send her wherever (else) he likes. At my departure, I seized Urāni and said to him, "I am going to the City. Give me whatever there is to give." He said, "I will feed your children." My dear father, let him give the maid 10 or 20 shekels of silver. Also, here I have done according to the your message which I brought to Šalim-aḫum.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma as-qu-dum-ma 3.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR {d}UTU-ba-ni ka-sa-ar-ka na-as-a-kum a-bi4 a-ta be-li a-ta la ta-as-ta-na-me ki-ma a-na URUDU SIG5 si-mu la ma-ah-su-ni a-na-kam sa DAM.GAR-ri KU.BABBAR i-da-na-ni su-ISTAR DUMU lu-zi-na a pu-ti DAM.GAR-ri-a i-zi-za-ma di-nam e-ta-ap-sa-kum a-na a-wa-tim a-mi-sa-am na-da-ni ka-ru-um u4-me-e is-ku-ni-a-ti-ma u4-mu-ni ITU.KAM a-hu-ru is-ti a-li-ki wa-ar-ki-u-tim a-ta-la-kam
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Asqudum: Šamaš-bāni your transporter brings you 3 1/2 minas silver. My dear father and lord, do you not constantly hear? Because no purchases for fine copper are available, and the palace is paying silver for mercantile goods, Šū-Ištar s. Luzina acted on behalf of my merchant and sold. I acted on your behalf. The colony set our due date for depositing the matter toward there, and our term is one month late. I will come with the next travelers.

src: 8.5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er su-pi-ma-ni pu-su-ke-en6 i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa im-di-lim u pi-la-ah-ISTAR a-na si-bi4-it ni-ga-li ta-sa-qal su-ma la ta-as-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im i ITU.KAM-im tu-sa-ab ITU.KAM si-ip-e-em li-mu-um a-sur-i-di IGI a-sur-DU10 IGI a-la-hi-im
tgt: Šuppi-mani owes Pūšu-kēn 8 1/2 shekels silver She will pay from the ḫamuštum of Imdī-ilum and Pilaḫ-Ištar at the beginning of harvest. If she does not pay (on time), she will add (1 1/2 shekels per mina) per month (as interest) at the colony rate. Month: Ṣipʾem. Witnesses: Aššur-ṭāb, Al-aḫim.

src: a-na im-di-DINGIR pu-su-ke-en6 i-ku-nim i-di-a-bi-im u ha-da-a qi-bi-ma um-ma a-mur-ISTAR-ma 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR-pi i-ku-num a si-ib-tim u-ka-il5 9.66666 ma-na qa-dum si-ib-ti-su i-ku-num a-na ha-da-a u-bi4-ik SA.BA 4 ma-na ha-da-a i-di-nam u 2 ma-na a-se-er i-ku-nim u kar-wa-a a-na ku-ta-u-nim na-di si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-a 3.6666600000000003 ma-na ha-da-a u-ka-al a-na-ku a-na 3.6666600000000003 ma-na KU.BABBAR u si-ba-ti-su sa is-tu 10 sa-na-at a-se-e-su u4-ma-am 1 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na-pa-al-sum a-wa-tim ma-la im-di-DINGIR i-di-u-su-ni a-di ni-na-mu-ru li-im-ta-sar tup-pa-am ha-ar-ma-am sa ku-nu-ki-su le-qe-a ki-ma a-wa-tu-a la ka-ab-sa-ni a-na 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR kar-wa-a i-ku-num u ha-da-a ku-lu-su-nu-ma pu-uh-ru i-ku-num u kar-wa-a lu-uk-ta-i-nu-ma 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am u si-ba-su sa is-tu 10 sa-na-at a-sar i-bu-ra-ni is-te-en6 i ba-ri-su-nu li-di-nam a-hu-u-a a-tu-nu be-lu-a a-tu-nu la i-tu-ru-ma la i-na-pu-su a-na-ku la sa-ah-ra-ku 10 ma-na su-qu-ul-tam ma-az-li-gi5 u su-ga-ri-a-e SA.BA 8 ma-na a-na im-di-DINGIR i-di-in si-tum 2 ma-na 20 ma-na hu-sa-u 1 sa-sa-num 7 pa-su 5 na-qu-bu 6 ma-na su-qul-tam 1 ta-as-ka-ri-num 3 i-na a-mi-tim u-ru-uk-su ka-ab-sa-at 1 ru-pu-su 3 ma-na sa sa-du-i-su 20 e-pa-da-tum tal-ha-di-a-tum SA.BA 10 e-pa-da-tim a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim 8 GIN KU.BABBAR mu-su-ka-e sa-du-a-tam i ku-bu-ur-na-at i-di-ma su-ru <big_gap> a-mur-ISTAR lu-ka-in a-na ka-ri-im u-ka-i-ma mu-su-ka-e-su ar-ki mu-ul-wa-ri-su u-ta-e-er-sum mi-ma a-nim ha-da-a sa-di-na
tgt: To Imdī-ilum, Pūšu-kēn, Ikūnum, Iddin-abum, and Ḫadāya from Amur-Ištar: Ikūnum holds 5 minas of my silver for interest. 9 2/3 minas together with its interest he ... to Ḫadāya. Ḫadāya gave me 4 minas from that amount. Also, 2 minas (silver) are deposited to Ikūnum and Qarwāya for Ḫadāya retains the remainder of my silver, 3 2/3 minas. Though I myself have been looking to him for 3 2/3 minas silver and its interest for 10 years, today I am paying him back 1 minas 10 shekels silver! As for the matter, as much as Imdi-ilum placed on him, until we see each other, let (Imdī-ilum) (deposit?) it. Take a sealed document from him. So that my words are not tread on, gather Qarwiya, Ikūnum and Ḫadāya--all of them--concerning the 2 minas silver. Let Ikūnum and Qarwiya ... be bound and let each give one mina amongst them (for) 2 minas refined silver and its interest which for 10 years wherever iburani. My dear brothers and lords do not turn them away. Do not show them mercy. Am I not (your) junior? As for the 10 minas package, m. and š., therein he sold 8 minas to Imdī-ilum. The remainder is 2 minas. 20 minas metal scraps, 1 sh, x pa-shu-x naqubu - weighing 6 minas, 1 boxwood log, length is 3 in a cubit, and width 1 k., 3 minas of sh, 20 ep from Talḫada, therein, A weight of 6 minas, 1 (log of)? boxtree. Its length is within 3 cubits. Its width is about 1 kabsu. Cause Ḫadāya to give all this.

src: 1.3333300000000001 ma-na 7 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI DUMU si-li-a u a-hu da-da-ni-a is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-SIPA u en-na-ma-nim 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-su-bu SA.BA <big_gap> 0.33333 ma-na 7 GIN a-mu-ra-am u 9 GIN si-im 6 TUG su-ri-im GIN KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-at 5 TUG-ti-su ib-tu-qam-ma si-ti KU.BABBAR u si-ba-tu-su i li-bi4-su KU.BABBAR is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa na-ra-am-su u ha-na-nim a-hu da-ga-ni-a is-ni-qam 7.5 GIN KU i si-im-ti-a u si-ba-at 0.5 ma-na 4.5 GIN 10 GIN i-li-iq KI a-ta i-la-li-ah-su u pe-ru-a qa-ta-tum 7 a sa-mi-la-tim ti-ib-nim KI a-la-hi-im
tgt: The son of Ṣilliya and the brother of Dadanīya owe 1 mina 27 shekels refined silver. They will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-rēʾī and Ennamānim. Thereof, the 27 shekels checked (silver) and the 9 shekels (silver) the price of šurum textile, he deducted to me(?) 5 shekels silver, the interest on 5 textiles, and he owes the rest of the silver and its interest. He will 'check' the silver from the ḫamuštum of Narām-Suen and Ḫanānum brother of Dagāniya. 7 1/2 shekels silver from my lot and interest on 1/2 mina--4 1/2 shekels, comes to 12! shekels. You owe (it). Ilaliaḫšu and Peruwa are guarantors.

src: KISIB hu-ra-sa-nim KISIB ha-ba-ti KISIB a-sur-re-si sa 2.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-re-si a-sur-SIPA i-su-u ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-i-li li-mu-um sa i qa-ti i-di-a-sur is-bu-tu 2 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-re-si
tgt: Seals: Huraṣānum, Ḫabati, Aššur-rēṣī. Regarding the 2 1/2 minas refined silver which Aššur-rēʾī owes Aššur-rēʾī. He will add 2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: 1.5 GIN KU.BABBAR a ta-ri-is-ma-tim DAM a-sur-ma-lik DUMU su-ku-bi-im a-di-in IGI a-sur-DUG DUMU i-na-su-en6 IGI ma-num-ki-i-e-ni-a DUMU i-sar-ha-ri-im
tgt: I gave 1 1/2 shekels silver to Tariš-mātum wife of Aššur-mālik s. Šū-Kūbum. Witnesses: Aššur-ṭāb s. Enna-Suen, Mannu-kī-ēniya s. Išar-ḫarum.

src: um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma a-na si-sa-ah-su-sar qi-bi-ma 55 ma-na I.DAN sa hu-zi-ri-im nu-hu-um ku-nu-ki-a u na-ru-tum sa e-ru-bu {d}UTU-ba-ni na-as-a-ki-im a-pu-tum mu-sa-am u e-wa-za-tim sa e-zi-bu sa-si-ri-ma se-bi4-li-si-na URUDU li-di-nu-ma ti-ib-nam sa-ma tu-hi ih-da-ma a-bi4-la GU4.HI.A SIG5 a-la-hu-um li-is-a-ma ti-ib-nam pa-hi-ra
tgt: From Aššur-nādā to Šišahšušar: 55 minas of lard, (in) a leather pouch under my seal, plus the narūtu-malt that has arrived, Šamaš-bāni is on his way to you with that. Please, guard the Let them sell copper, and buy straw. Take care to dry the chaff. Let Al-aḫum buy oxen of good quality and gather the straw.

src: 1 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR si-ib-tam sa 7.5 ma 9.16666 GIN KU.BABBAR sa 8 ITU.KAM i-se-er a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 bu-za-zu mi-ma u-la il5-qe su-ma <gap> um-me-a-nu a-sur-ma-lik si-ib-tam i-se-er bu-za-zu il5-ta-qe-u 1 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 a-na bu-za-zu i-sa-qal su-ma si-ib-tam i-se-er bu-za-zu mi-ma la i-tal-qe KU.BABBAR mi-ma a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 a bu-za-zu la i-sa-qal IGI be-la-nim IGI ah-sa-lim me-er-e su-a-sur
tgt: 1 Mine 10 Seqel Silber, den Zins für 7½ Minen 9¾ Seqel Silber für acht Monate hat von Aššurmuttabil Buzāzu gar nicht erhalten. Wenn die Geldgeber des Ašš[urmuttabbil] den Zins von Bu[zāzu] jeweils einfordern, wird 1 Mi[ne] 10 Seqel Silber Aššurmuttabbil an Buzāzu zahlen. Wenn der Zins von Buzāzu nicht eingefordert werden sollte, wird keinerlei Silber A[šš]urmuttabbil dem [Buz]āzu zahlen. Vor Belānum; vor Aẖšalim; den Söhnen des Šū'aššur.

src: KISIB ha-li-it-ka KISIB su-be-lim DUMU a-gu-a KISIB a-nu-nu KISIB ta-ar-hu-nu KISIB ha-al-ki-a-su 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er ta-ar-hu-nu u ha-al-ki-a-su a-sur-SIPA u i-li-is-ti-kal i-su-u is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-ma-lik u ka-ab-ri-a a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im <gap> GIN.TA KU.BABBAR u-su-bu
tgt: Seals of Ḫalitka, Šū-Bēlim s. Agua, Anunu, Tarḫunu, Ḫalik-aššu Tarḫunu and Ḫalik-aššu owe Aššur-rēʾī and Iliš-tīkal 2 minas silver. He will pay ten weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-mālik and kà-áb-ri-a. If he does not pay (on time), he will add ? shekels silver per mina per month (as interest).

src: 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-na e-bu-tim a-na ku-ra-ra DUMU a-bu-sa-lim i-na-a DUMU a-mu-ra-a i-di-in i-la-ak-ma i-na a-lim{ki} i-na tup-pi-im sa e-bu-ti-su KI um-me-a-ni-su i-na-a la i-ma-sa ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tim li-mu-um ku-bi4-a IGI su-la-ba-an DUMU dan-i-li IGI ba-zi-a DUMU DINGIR-kur-ub
tgt: Innaya s. Amura gave Kurara s. Abu-šalim 5 minas refined silver as an ebuṭṭum loan. He will go and Innāya will not be considered equal with his investors in the tablet of his ebuṭṭum loan in the city. Witnesses: Šū-Laban s. Dān-ilī, Bazia s. Ilī-Kurub.

src: 1.66666 ma-na 1 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-ma-lik DUMU er-ra-a DAM.GAR-ru-um i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU zu-pa-la-li ITU.KAM hu-bur li-mu-um a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU DINGIR-ba-ni 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI e-la-li DUMU i-pi-li-is IGI a-sur-i-di DUMU ku-ku-la-nim IGI i-ku-pi-a DUMU su-su-en6
tgt: Aššur-mālik s. Errāya owes the merchant 1 2/3 minas 1 shekel refined silver. From the ḫamuštum of Aššur-imittī s. Zupa-lali. Month: ḫubur. Eponymate: Aššur-imittī s. Ilī-bāni. He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest. Witnesses: Elāli s. i-pí-li-is, Aššur-idī s. Kukkulānim, Ikuppiya s. Šū-Suen.

src: sa 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa 8 ha-am-sa-tim u sa-pa-tim 0.66666 GIN 15 SE si-ib-tam al-qe
tgt: I have taken 2/3 shekel and 15 grains (of silver) as interest on 5 minas of silver for 8

src: KISIB i-ri-si-im DUMU a-mur-{d}UTU KISIB a-gu5-a DUMU PUZUR4-a-sur KISIB u-sur-sa-a-sur DUMU bu-ta-a-a 1.5 GU URUDU SIG5 i-se-er i-ri-si-im DUMU a-mur-{d}UTU {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li DUMU ku-us-ku-si-im i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ma-li-bi4-li-a a-na sa-na-at i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 ma-na.TA a bi4-il5-tim u-sa-ab ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur
tgt: Erišim s. Amur-Šamaš owes Adad-ṣulūlī s. Kuzkuzim 1 1/2 talents refined copper. He will pay 1 year from the ḫamuštum of Šumma-libbi-ilia. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 minas per talent. Month: Ḫubur.

src: 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-su-en6 DUMU PUZUR4-a-na a-sur-ba-ni DUMU ku-ta-a i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa e-na-su-en6 DUMU su-ISTAR a-na <big_gap> ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal a-na a-lim{ki} u-sa-ak-sa-su su-ma a-na a-lim{ki} la us-ta-ak-si-da-su ma-he-er a-lim{ki} a-sur AN.NA sal-ma-am ba-lim da-tim u ta-si-a-tim su-su-en6 i-sa-qal ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-i-li li-mu-um sa qa-ti a-zu-ma IGI su-hu-bur DUMU i-di-a-bi4-im IGI a-bu-sa-lim DUMU i-li-a-lim
tgt: Šū-Suen s. Puzur-Anna owes Aššur-bāni s. Kudāya 20 shekels of refined silver.

src: 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er {d}UTU-ba-ni u a-sur-ma-lik sa-at-{d}IM i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-ku-pi-a a-na 6 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu IGI du-ma-na IGI ga-li-a IGI li-li
tgt: Šamaš-bāni and Aššur-mālik owe Šāt-Adad 1 mina refined silver. They will pay six weeks from the of Ikūn-piā. If they do not pay, they will add interest at the colony rate.

src: KISIB a-zu-u DUMU PUZUR4-a-sur KISIB {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni DUMU a-sur-ma-lik a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um ka-ni-is i-di-ni-a-ti-ma IGI GIR-sa-a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in da-da-a DUMU ni-mar-ISTAR tap-pa-i-ni
tgt: Seals: Azu'u s. Puzur-Aššur, Ilabrat-bāni s. Aššur-mālik. Dadaya s. Nimar-Ištar was our partner.

src: KISIB la-qe-pi-im DUMU zu-zu-za-nim KISIB i-lu-a DUMU a-sur-{d}UTU-si KISIB a-sur-e-mu-qi DUMU e-di-na-a-sur KISIB e-di-na-a-sur 2 ma-na 2.5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er e-di-na-a-sur DUMU i-sa-li-a a-hu-qar i-su a-na a-lim{ki} wa-ar-ka-at a-hu-wa-qar KU.BABBAR u-se-ba-al su-ma wa-ar-ka-at a-hu-qar a-na a-lim{ki} KU.BABBAR e-di-na-a-sur la us-ta-ak-si-id a-hu-qar is-tu a-lim{ki} i-na tu-wa-ri-su 4 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na a-hu-qar e-di-na-a-sur i-sa-qal KISIB e-di-na-a-sur DUMU i-sa-li-a KISIB su-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-DUG DUMU a-sur-{d}UTU-si KISIB si-la-{d}ISKUR DUMU i-li-e-mu-qi 1 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er e-di-na-a-sur a-hu-qar i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ku-bi4-im u ga-zi-a 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM kan-mar-ta li-mu-um i-di-a-bu-um DUMU na-ar-bi4-tim KISIB e-di-na-a-sur DUMU i-sa-li-a KISIB {d}ISKUR.ILLAT DUMU {d}ISKUR-ba-ni KISIB su-ISTAR DUMU su-wa-a KISIB bu-zu-a DUMU a-sur-DUG 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er e-di-na-a DUMU i-sa-li-a DAM.GAR-ru-um i-su a-hu-qar a-hu-su qa-ta-at is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-i-mi-ti 1 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab li-mu-um i-li-dan ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tim am-tum a-ni-a e-ru-ba-tu-su KISIB a-de8-la-at DUMU {d}ISKUR-ba-ni KISIB su-ISTAR DUMU su-a-a KISIB bu-zu-a DUMU a-sur-DUG KISIB e-di-na-a-sur DUMU i-sa-li-a sa hu-bu-ul e-di-na-a-sur 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er e-di-na-a-sur DAM.GAR i-su a-hu-qar qa-ta-tum is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ku-bi4-im u kur-ub-ISTAR 0.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab ITU.KAM sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-di-a-bi4-im DUMU na-ar-bi4-tim
tgt: Seals: Lā-qēpum s. Zuzuzānum, Iluwa s. Aššur-šamšī, Aššur-emūqī s. Iddin-Aššur, Iddin-Aššur. Iddin-Aššur s. Isaliya owes Aḫu-waqar 2 minas 2 1/2 shekels silver. He will send the silver to the city after Aḫu-waqar. If Iddin-Aššur does not encounter the silver after (the departure of) Aḫu-waqar, Iddin-Aššur will pay 4 minas 5 shekels silver when Aḫu-waqar returns from the city. Seals: Iddin-Aššur s. Isaliya, Šū-Ištar s. Aššur-ṭāb s. Aššur-šamšī, Ṣilli-Adad s. Ilī-emūqī. Iddin-Aššur owes Aḫu-waqar 1 mina 10 shekels refined silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina) per month as interest from the ḫamuštum of Šū-Kūbum and Gazia. Month: Kanwarta. Eponymate: Iddin-abum s. Narbitum. Seals: Iddin-Aššur s. Isaliya, Adad-ellat s. Adad-bāni, Šū-Ištar s. Šuwa, Buzua s. Aššur-ṭāb. Iddināya s. Isaliya owes the merchant 2/3 minas refined silver. His brother Aḫu-waqar is guarantor. He will add 1 shekel silver per month as interest from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-imittī. Eponymate: Ilī-dān. Month: Qarrātum. The amtum maid Aniya is his pledge. Seals: Adad-ellat s. Adad-bāni, Šū-Ištar s. Šu-Aya, Buzua s. Aššur-ṭāb, Iddin-Aššur s. Isaliya. Regarding the debt of Iddin-Aššur, Iddin-Aššur owes the merchant 1/2 mina refined sivler. Aḫu-waqar is the guarantor. He will add 1/2 shekel per month from the ḫamuštum of Šū-Kūbum and Kurub-Ištar. Month: Ša sarrātim. Eponymate: the one after Iddin-abum s. Narbitum.

src: 1 ma-na AN.NA is-tu ha-hi-im u-se-bi-lam-ma si-im-su 7.5 GIN KU.BABBAR ti-ib-nam is-u-mu-nim-ma ha-ra-an su-qi-nim a-ta-la-ak-ma ti-ib-nam su-wa-ti a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku il5-qe-ma a-na am-tim si-im-su la i-di-in
tgt: I sent 1 mina tin to you from Ḫaḫḫum and its price was 7 1/2 shekels silver. They purchased straw and I left for the 'narrow track.' Aššur-taklāku took that straw but he must not give its exchange value to the amtum-wife.

src: um-ma e-la-ma-ma a-na a-sur-na-da i-di-a-bi-im u a-sur-la-ma-si qi-bi-ma a-na a-sur-la-ma-si qi-bi-ma AN.NA-ki sa is-tu a-lim{ki} tu-se-li-a-ni a-sar ta-ap-qi-du te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam u si-bi-ka su-mi-su-nu i-na tup-pi-im lu-up-tam u a-ta ta-ah-si-is-tam sa si-bi-ka su-mi-su-nu lu-pu-ut-ma ka-il5 i-nu-mi AN.NA-<gap>-bu a-na sa ki-ma i-a-ti ta-ap-qi-du-ma a-ma-kam si-bu-ka wa-as-bu-ni ha-si-su-nu-ma la wa-as-bu te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam
tgt: From Elamma to Aššur-nādā, Iddin-abum and Aššur-lamassā: (specifically) to Aššur-lamassī: My tin which you brought up here from the City, send me word about where you entrusted it on commission; also, write the names of your witnesses in the letter. Then you yourself should write a note about your witnesses, with their names, so that when they convene you can there remind those to whom you entrusted (goods) about the names of your witnesses. Send me word about who was not and who was present.

src: 16 GIN KU.BABBAR sa DAM.GAR-ri-im la-qe-pu-um a-na PUZUR.ISTAR DUMU a-ta-a-a i-di-in ITU.KAM sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um sa qa-te-e a-sur-ba-la-at IGI a-du-ma-an DUMU a-sur-la-ma-si IGI ISTAR-il5-su DUMU i-ku-nim
tgt: Month: Ša sarrātim. Eponymate: after Aššur-balāṭ. Witnesses: Aduman s. Aššur-lamassī, Ištar-ilšu s. Ikūnim.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma is-tu sa-ah-ra-ku-ni a-la-nu-ka a-ha-am u eb-ra-am u-la i-su ki-ma uz-ni ta-ap-te-u su-ma mi-ma ta-as-te-me-e uz-ni pi-te-e AN.NA 1 GU sa se-ep i-di-a-sur KU.BABBAR 1 GIN ra-ma-ka ku-bu-us-ma se-bi4-la-ma li-bi4-i li-ih-du a ma-la te-er-ti-ka um-mi-a-ni-ka nu-ma-ge5-er u-su-ur-sa-ISTAR a si-li-tim la ta-da-su KU.BABBAR 10 ma-na le-pu-us tu-ur-da-su-ma
tgt: From Aššur-imittī to Pūšu-kēn: Since my humilitaion, I have no brother or colleague beside you. Like have informed (me in the past), if you hear anything, inform me. Regarding the talent of tin in Idi-Aššur's cargo, extend yourself over every shekel and send it to me so that I am pleased. Your investors agreed according to your instructions. Do not give over Uṣur-ša-Ištar to slander. Let him(me?) make about 10 minas silver. Dispatch him and ... (supplementary tablet missing)

src: 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-za-a u su-be-lum 16 GIN KU.BABBAR <big_gap> i-na <big_gap> sa-al-sa-tim <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap>
tgt: As for the 1/3 mina silver, Kuzāya and Šū-Bēlum ... 16 shekels silver. ... ina ... šalšatim ...

src: 11 ma-na KU.BABBAR li-ti SIG5 i-se-er ha-ar-su-nu-ma-an AH.ME sa {d}UTU pu-su-ke-en6 i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa su-ku-bi-im u kur-ub-ISTAR a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim a-na sa par-ka sa i-la-ka-ni i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-me-su ma-al-u-tim <big_gap> la is-qul 2.5 GIN.TA a ma-na-im u-sa-ab ITU.KAM sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-di-a-bi-im IGI a-de8-la-at IGI en-na-nim IGI ha-al-ki-a-su IGI ar-zi-ap
tgt: Ḫaršunuma, the priest of Šamaš, owes Pūšu-kēn 11 minas of fine liti silver. He will pay 13 ḫamuštum-weeks from the ḫamuštum-week of Šū-Kūbum and Kurub-Ištar at the festival of Parka which is coming. If he does not pay when the term is full, he will add 2 1/2 shekels per mina. Eponymate: The one following Idī-abim. Witnesses: Adelat, Ennānum, Ḫalikiaššu, Arziap.

src: 2 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ku-ku-zi su-ISTAR i-su is-tu ITU.KAM kan-mar-ta li-mu-um en-na-su-en6 DUMU su-{d}a-sur 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI a-lu-la-a DUMU i-sa-li-a IGI su-ku-bi-im DUMU a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim IGI a-sur-i-di DUMU DINGIR-na-da
tgt: Kukuzi owes Šū-Ištar 2 minas 10 shekels refined silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina (per month) as interest from the month Kanwarta, eponymate Enna-Suen s. šu-da-šur.

src: 0.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er na-qi-du a-sur-ma-lik i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-la-hi-im u na-ab-su-en6 a-na 4 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab i-di-{d}UTU DUMU da-la-as qa-ta-tum IGI a-mur-a-sur IGI ku-ra-ra
tgt: Naqidu owes Aššur-mālik 5/6 minas silver. He will pay 4 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Al-aḫum and Nāb-Suen. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest). Idī-Šamaš s. Dalaš is the guarantor. Witnesses: Amur-Aššur, Kurara.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u a-sur-i-mi-ti qi-bi4-ma um-ma {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li-ma a-na-kam pu-su-ke-en6 e-mu-qa-tim e-pu-si-ma a me-si-ti-a <gap> <gap>-ak lu-up-ta i-ta-di-a 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-ku-pi-a-sur <big_gap> li-di-na-ku-nu-ti ma-la ta-ha-sa-ha-ni su-up-ra-ni-ma lu-se-bi4-la-ku-nu-ti
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn and Aššur-imittī from Adad-ṣulūlī Here Pūšu-kēn treated me harshly and he ... to my fund ... Write down ... Deposit it. Let Ikuppi-Aššur give 1 mina of silver to you (pl.). Write to me as much as you need so that I may send it to you.

src: 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR li-ti SIG5 i-se-er da-la-as su-li-i-e i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-ma-lik DUMU lu-zi-na 3 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i ITU.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab KU.BABBAR i-na qa-qi-di-su u be-ti-su ra-ki-is IGI wa-da-ap-ra IGI <big_gap>-<gap>-du IGI <big_gap>-<gap>-ma-lik
tgt: Dalaš owes Šule 2 minas fine liti silver. From the ḫamuštum of Aššur-mālik s. Luzina 3 shekels interest will be added per month per mina. The silver is tied to the head and house (?) Witnesses: Wadabra, ....-x-du, ....-x-mālik.

src: a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma um-ma u-su-ur-sa-a-sur-ma u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ak-ma 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-ni da-a-a u DUG-si-la-a-sur na-as-u-ni-kum a-na-kam ka-ra-am am-hu-ur-ma ta-ta-la-ka-nim i-na u-mi-im sa tup-pa-am ta-sa-me-a-ni ti-ib-a-nim-ma a-tal-ka-nim a-su-mi 25 {TUG}ku-ta-ni sa tu-se-bi4-la-ni-ni i-na lu-hu-sa-ti-a sa-ab-tu a-na E.GAL-lim ne-li-ma um-ma ru-ba-tum-ma sa-bi4-it TUG.HI.A a-na AN.NA i-la-kam su-ma {TUG}ku-ta-nu i-ba-si-u li-qe-a su-ma la-ap-tu KU.BABBAR li-qe
tgt: To Aššur-nādā from Uṣur-ša-Aššur and Aššur-taklāku: 2 minas of silver under our two seals Dāya and Ṭāb-Ṣill-Aššur are bringing to you. I confronted the colony here, but you will have to come anyway. Set out and come the very day you hear the letter. Concerning the 25 We went up to the palace, and the queen said as follows: "The one who seized the textiles (and) the tin will come. If the If they have been infested, take silver instead."

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma PUZUR4-a-sur-ma i-na KU.BABBAR u KU.GI sa DINGIR-ma-lik ub-la-ni 2 GU 20 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ki 1 me-at 10 ku-ta-ni qa-dum 8 ku-ta-ni SIG5-tim 2 {TUG}ka-am-su 40 ma-na AN.NA qa-tim 6 ANSE sa-la-me DINGIR-ma-lik i-ra-de8-a-kum i-nu-mi us-a-ni hu-sa-hu-ma tup-pa-am la nu-la-pi-tam si-ti lu-qu-ti-ka i pa-ni-e-ma wa-si-im ne-ba-ka-kum u te-er-ti-ni za-ku-tum i-la-ka-kum si-ta su-ba-at E a-hu-qar sa ha-hi-im sa a pa-at su-qi-nim sa E zi-zi-<gap> a-na 6.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-a-ma-ku-ma KU.BABBAR a-wi-il5-tim <gap>-<gap> um-ma ne-nu-ma ni-sa-a-ma u-se-ba-la-ki-im
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Puzur-Aššur: From the silver and gold that Ili-mālik brought, Ili-mālik drives to you 2 talents 20 minas of tin under seals and 110 kutānum-textiles together with 8 fine kutānum textiles and two kamsum-type textiles, 40 minas of 'hand-tin', and 6 black donkeys. When he departed we did not write the .. and tablet. We will dispatch the remainder of your goods at the first departure. And our complete report will come to you. We purchased for you two šubtum measures of Aḫu-waqar's house in Ḫaḫḫum which is at the front of the suqinnum road of the house of Zizi for 6 1/3 minas of silver and (we ...ed?) the silver of the lady. ... (lady?) ... We said, "We will make purchases and I will send to you(f.)."

src: mu-sa DUMU SAL.DINGIR-is-ti-kal a-sa-at i-la-ab-ra-at-ba-ni i-na E-be-ti sa a-sur-ma-lik DUMU PUZUR.ISTAR-a-di ba-al-ta-at-ni tu-sa-ab i-na E-tim sa a-sur-ma-lik-ma ta-sa-be-er a-sur-ma-lik u me-er-u-su la i-ta-ru-du-si E-tam 6 gu5-su-ri da-la-tim u-tu-up-tam la ta-da-an u-la tu-ra-ab IGI a-ta-a IGI i-di-a-sur IGI a-mur-a-sur IGI ma-si-i-li
tgt: Muza d. Iliš-tīkal, wife of Ilabrat-bāni will live in the houses of Aššur-mālik s. Puzur-Ištar as long as she is supported. She will ??? in the houses of Aššur-mālik. Neither Aššur-mālik nor his sons will send her away. house, six beams, doors, household, goods, ... Witnesses: [PN], Attaya, Idī-Aššur, Amur-Aššur, Maṣi-ilī.

src: 1.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er i-sar-ha-ri-im a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ITU.1.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um a-bi-a DUMU su-da-gan a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 1 GU URUDU a-na a-sur-da-ni ha-bu-la-ku u a-na-ku 1 GU URUDU u-se-ba-la-su-ma 10 GIN KU.GI u <gap> i-ba-ta-qam 30 ma-na URUDU a-di-su-um 6 GIN KU.GI a-na pa-ha-ar bu-qu-nim i-sa-qal 5 ma-na AN.NA a-ha-ma ha-bu-lam IGI ISTAR-pi-la-ah IGI a-<gap>-<gap>-im
tgt: Išār-Ḫarim owes Aššur-rēʾī 1 2/3 minas refined silver. He will pay 20 ḫamuštum weeks from the month Ḫubur, eponymate: Abīya s. Šū-Dagan. I owe 1 talent copper to Aššur-dani. I gave him 30 minas copper. He will pay 6 shekels gold to the assempbly of Buqūnum. He owes me 5 minas tin separately.

src: ka-ru-um di-nam i-di-in-ma mi-ma su-um-su ma-ma-an a-na GAL si-mi-il5-tim la i-da-an sa i-du-nu ma-la KU.BABBAR GAL si-mi-il5-tim a-na i-ku-nim ha-bu-lu i-sa-qal
tgt: The colony issued a verdict: No one will give anything to the cheif of the stairway. He will (instead) pay whatever he (was to) give, as part of silver as the cheif of the stairway owes to Ikūnum.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma AN.NA sa se-ep ku-za-ri ki-ma e-ru-ba-ni a-na pu-ru-us-ha-tim us-te-bi4-il5-su a-na 5 u4-me a-na KU.BABBAR a-da-ga-al i-na u4-mi-im sa tup-pi ta-sa-me-u sa 45 ma-na KU.BABBAR AN.NA a-na ba-ri-ni sa-a-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-ka li-be-i-el AN.NA as-a-ma PUZUR4-a-sur i-ra-de8-a-ku-nu-ti a-se-er KU.BABBAR sa se-ep ku-za-ri u sa DUMU a-sur-i-di sa ta-qi-pa-ni i pa-nim-ma wa-si-e-em se-bi-la-nim i-na tup-pi-ka ki-ma dan-a-sur e-ru-ba-ni a-na-ku-ma a-na pu-ru-us-ha-tim se-pi-a a-da-an-ma lu-qu-tam lu i-a-tam lu ku-a-tam u-za-ka-ma i se-pi-a u-ba-la-kum e-zi-ib sa ba-ri-ni AN.NA u TUG.HI.A lu sa se-ep dan-a-sur lu sa se-ep ku-lu-ma-a u i-di-su-en6 i se-pi-ka a-hi a-ta KU.BABBAR mi-ma la te-zi-ba-am ma-la i-na ba-ab a-bu-lim la a-ba-su lu su-um-ka qa-ti ki-ma pa-ni-a-ti-ma a E ka-ri-im i-ta-di-a-ma i-na ni-ka-si mi-ma la a-na-pa-al
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: You wrote to me. "I sent the tin of Kuzari's transport to Purusḫattum when he arrived. I expect the silver in 5 days. On the day you read this tablet, purchase 45m silver worth of tin for our common property and let you silver be thus disposed." I purchased the tin and Puzur-Aššur transports it to you. In addition to the silver from Kuzari's transport, send to me that which you entrusted to Aššur-idi's son with the first departer. According to your tablet: "When Dan-Aššur arrives, I will set off to Purushattum myself and the goods, both mine and yours, I will clear and in my transport will deliver (it) to you." Apart from the the goods between us and that of Dan-Aššur's transport, and Kulmaya and Idi-Suen's transport, from your transport, my dear brother, you did not leave me any silver. So that I will not be put to shame in the city gate, make some deposits to the colony office in your name (to) my account as previously, so that I will not have to balance anything at accounting time.

src: i-na 4 ANSE.HI.A sa-lim-a-hi-im e-la-at a-ta-ta sa e-li-u-ni-ni 1 ANSE E.GAL-lum is-ba-at-ma si-im-su a-gu-a il5-qe 1 ANSE sa DUMU ir-ra-a sa a-mur-ISTAR a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum ir-de8-u i-a-ti i-zi-za-am 1 ANSE a-na lu-lu a-di-in 1 ANSE i-na na-ab-ri-tim me-et 1 ANSE sa se-ep dan-a-sur a-se-er i-la-ap-ra-at-ba-ni ir-de8-u 3 GIN KU.BABBAR na-ab-ri-it 3 ANSE.HI.A 1.5 GIN a-na-kam <gap> e-ku-lu
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum's four donkeys in the caravan of Atata which acame up, the palace took 1 donkey and Agua received its yeild. One donkey (brought by) the son of Erraya, which Amur-Ištar took to Purušḫattum, stands to be mine(??). I gave 1 donkey to Lulu. One donkey died in the One donkey from the transport of Dān-Aššur they took off to Ilabrat-bāni. 3 shekels silver, the nabrītum of the 3 donkeys. They consumed 1 1/2 shekels here. (damaged signs?)

src: a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma um-ma pi-la-hi-ISTAR-ma is-tu ba-ad-na a-gu5-a ta-bi-a-nu-um u il5-li-ba-ni u-wa-se-ru-ni-ma um-ma ta-bi-a-nu-ma ba-am is-ti-ni TUG.HI u-qa-i-u is-ti-su-nu is-tu ba-ad-na na-ba-ta-am nu-si-ma is-ti-su-nu a-na E wa-ab-ri u-la u-se-ru-ni a-ha-ma E al-pi a bi-it E-tam im-lu-su-ma 6 TUG.HI i-ta-ab-ku ep-ra-am a-na qa-qi-di-a as-pu-KUM-ma a-na ba-ad-na a-na se-er a-la-bi-im a-tu-ra-ma wa-ba-ar-tum10 sa ba-ad-na a-na se-er ba-ru-li e-li-u-ma um-ma su-nu-ma lu ni-is-e u su-ma i-ha-li-qu ne-nu nu-ma-la
tgt: To Aššur-nādā from Pilah-Ištar: Agua, Ṭāb-pī-Anum and Ilī-bāni released me from Badna, and Ṭāb-pī-Anum said: "Come on, together with us." They were waiting for textiles. We left Badna together during the night but they did not allow me into the guest-house together with them. Alone I spent the night in a cow-stable. They broke into the house and removed 6 textiles. I poured dust on my head (in despair) for your sake, and I returned to Badna to Alābum; then (officers of) the trading station at Badna went up to the barullu-officers (of the palace) and said: "Let us search (for the textiles), and if they are lost then we shall personally give compensation."

src: KISIB i-di-su-en6 KISIB mu-za <big_gap> KISIB sa-ta-ah-su-sa-ar 11 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er sa-ta-ah-su-sa-ar a-na-na ti-su a-na sa ha-ri-ha-ri ta-sa-qal en-na-na-tum DUMU.SAL PUZUR4-sa-da
tgt: Seals of Idī-Suen, Muza [daughter of ?], and Šataḫšušar. Šataḫšušar owes Anna-Anna 11 shekels of silver. She will pay at the festival of Ḫariḫari.

src: a-na i-ku-nim qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma 4 {TUG}ku-ta-ni u 1 TUG su-ra-am sa su-ISTAR ub-la-ni 13 GIN.TA {TUG}ku-ta-nu 0.83333 ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR-ap-su-nu 8 GIN TUG su-ru-um SU.NIGIN 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR ap-su-nu lu ni-is-ha-tum lu si-mu-um lu hu-lu-qa-u 15 GIN KU.BABBAR e-mu-du-ka 0.83333 ma-na 5 GIN AN.NA ta-a-su-nu 10 GIN.TA 4.5 GIN KU.BI si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-ka 0.83333 ma-na 0.5 GIN ku-nu-ki-a su-ISTAR KU.BABBAR na-as-a-kum IGI dan-a-sur
tgt: To Ikūnum from Pūšu-kēn: 4 kutānum-textiles and 1 black textile which Šū-Ištar brought, 13 shekel rate for the kutānum-textiles--52 shekels is their yield, 8 shekels for the black textile--in sum: 1 mina was their yield in silver. Excise, purchases and losses of 15 shekels silver fell to you. 55 shekels tin was their dātum. At 10 shekel rate their silver price was 4 1/3 shekels. The remainder of your silver is 55 shekels. Šū-Ištar brings the silver to you under my seals. Witness: Dān-Aššur, witness: (not written).

src: um-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-su-mi sa PUZUR4-sa-du-e DUMU tu-i-mi-im a-di-i 1 GIN KU.BABBAR na-ru-qu-um a-na E a-bi-ni e-ra-bi-im sa-al-su-ma pi-su si-me-ma a-ni-tam la a-ni-tam te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam-ma u a-na-ku ma-al-ki la-as-ba-at a-pu-tum i-hi-id-ma i-na is-te-en6 a-li-ki-im te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam AN.NA u TUG.HI.A sa se-ep DUMU u-za-ri-a ma-la iz-ku-u-ni a ma-la te-er-ti-a a-sar ta-ta-di-nu te-er-ta-ka li-tu-ra-am
tgt: From Aššur-imittī to Pūšu-kēn: Concerning the matter of Puzur-saduʾē son of Tuimim, question him about (his) sack-capital entering the house of our father for (only?) 1 shekel of silver and listen to his word and let your message come as to whether it is this or that so that I may make up my mind. Urgent-take care to let your message come with the first traveler. Let your message return regarding the tin and textiles from the cargo of the son of Usariya, as much as they cleared, and (how you are) selling them wherever you can, according to my instructions.

src: 0.33333 GIN 15 SE KU.BABBAR a-sur-pi-la-ah 22.5 SE KU.BABBAR dan-a-sur 15 SE KU.BABBAR a-sur-i-mi-ti 0.25 GIN 10 SE KU.BABBAR i-di-su-en6 27.5 SE KU.BABBAR sal-ma-hu-um 7.5 SE KU.BABBAR a-sur-ke-en6-ra-am 1 GIN KU.BABBAR a-sur-SIG5 u {d}UTU-ba-ni
tgt: 1/3 shekel 15 grains silver (for) Aššur-pilaḫ. 22 1/2 grains silver (for) Dān-Aššur. 15 grains silver (for) Aššur-imittī. 1/4 shekel 10 grains silver (for) Idī-Suen. 27 1/2 grains silver (for) Šalim-aḫum. 7 1/2 grains silver Aššur-kēn-ram(?) 1 shekels silver (for) Aššur-damiq and Šamaš-bāni.

src: um-ma hi-na-a-ma a-na a-sur-na-da dan-a-sur u ha-da-a-ni qi-bi-ma 4 GU AN.NA u it-ra-su 2 me-at 30 TUG.HI.A 4 ku-si-a-tim 4 su-lu-up-ka-u SA.BA 1 ku-si-tum sa a-sur-{d}UTU-si 2 TUG sa ka-sa-ri 1 GU 20 ma-na AN.NA-ak qa-tim a-ha-ma 11.66666 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku a-na a-sur-{d}UTU-si a-ha-ma 1 ma-na 5 GIN AN.NA su-a-um SU.NIGIN 1.5 GU 1.66666 ma-na AN.NA 2 me-at 40 TUG e-zi-ib sa a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim ka-sa-ri-a 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR lu a hu-sa-e lu a-na sa-he-er-tim a-di-su-nu-ti a-ha-ma 1 GIN KU.BABBAR a sa-he-er-tim KA ha-ra-nim a-di-su-nu-ti 10 ma-na sa-am-ru-a-tum 1 me-at 36 mu-nu-si-na 10 e-li-a-tim u 4 mu-ta-tim a-ta-si-a-tim i-di-nu-ma a-di qa-ta-ra ta-si-a-tim a-na-ku a-di-in 11 ANSE sa-la-mi mi-ma a-ni-im a-na ha-da-a-ni ap-qi-id SU.NIGIN 13.5 GU a-wi-ti da-tam lu-sa-he-ru-ma si-ti AN.NA u TUG ku-nu-ka-ma a-se-er sa ki-ma i-a-ti se-bi4-la u ma-la TUG.HI.A sa a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim u hu-zi-a lu sa ka-sa-ri la tu-sa-ra u <gap> <gap>-a a-se-er sa ki-ma i-a-ti se-bi4-la lu a-na pa-zu-ur-tim lu a-na <big_gap> u u-ku-ul-ti-su-nu <big_gap> <gap>-nu di-na a-hu-a a-tu-nu ih-da-ma i-nu-mi u-nu-ti a-na <big_gap> e-ru-bu i-sa-ha-at <big_gap> i-zi-za-ma pa-qi-da-ma a-se-er ISTAR-pi-la-ah a-sur-{d}UTU-si u a-sur-is-ta-ki-il5 <gap> se-bi4-la u ma-la a qa-ti-su-nu <gap> a-di-su-nu-ti-ni lu-pa-qi-du-ni-ku-nu-ti su-ma E ka-ri-im lu TUG.HI.A is-ta-pu-ku lu KU.BABBAR is-ta-pu-ku a-tu-nu su-up-ka-ma u ma-la qa-ti ta-sa-pa-ka-ni a-se-er ISTAR-pi-la-ah su-up-ra-ma KU.BABBAR ma-la qa-ti ta-as-pu-ka lu-se-bi4-la-ku-nu-ti tup-pa-am si-ta-me-a-ma ku-un-ka-ma a-se-er ISTAR-pi-la-ah
tgt: From Hinnaya to Aššur-nādā, Dān-Aššur and Hadāni: 4 1 talent 20 minas of tin for expenses plus 11 2/3 minas of tin under seal for Aššur-šamšī, 1 mina 5 shekels of tin, his own-- in all 1 1/2 talent 1 2/3 mina of tin; 240 textiles, except those belonging to Aššur-bēl-awātim, my packer; I gave them 13 2/3 minas of silver for either scrap metal or small wares; further, I gave them 1 shekel of silver for small wares just before the departure; they gave 10 minas of nails, 136 in number, for the carriage of 10 top-packs and 4 half-packs, and I personally paid the transportation costs until Qaṭṭara; 11 black donkeys-all this I entrusted to Hadāni. The total value of the shipment: 13 1/2 talents. Let them deduct the fees and send the proceeds from the sale of the tin and textiles to my representatives. Also, do not release as many textiles as may belong to Aššur-bēl-awātim and Huzzia or to the packers; but send my ... to my representatives, either by smuggling or (paying) import duty. Give (them) their food and their... My dear brothers, take care to stand by... when my merchandise enters the palace and entrust it to be sent to Ištar-pilah, Aššur-šamšī and Aššuriš-takil; then have them entrust to you as much as I have given to them to dispose over. If they permit šitapku-deposits in the colony office of either textiles or silver, then you must make deposits, and then write to Ištar-pilah how much you will deposit as my share so he can send you as much silver as you have deposited as my share. Read the letter, seal it and send it to Ištar-pilah.

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU su-en6-na-da KISIB MAR.TU-ba-ni DUMU ma-na-na KISIB sa-lim-a-sur DUMU i-su-ri-ik KISIB zi-kur-DINGIR DUMU i-ku-nim sa 8.83333 ma-na 4.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er zi-kur-i-li a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-la-hi-im u e-na-ma-nim a-na 5 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sax-ab ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-DINGIR li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-di-a-sur DUMU ku-bi4-di-il5-qe-u ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul zi-kur-i-li
tgt: Regarding the 8 minas 54 1/2 shekels refined silver which Zikur-ilī owes Aššur-rēʾī. He will pay 5 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Al-aḫum and Ennam-Anum. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. This memorandum is a copy of the sealed tablet of the debt of Zikkur-ilī.

src: KISIB a-sur-ma-lik a-na il5-ka-si-id
tgt: Seal of Aššur-mālik (Addressed) to Il-kāšid.

src: PUZUR.ISTAR a-na {d}ISKUR.SIPA is-ba-at-ni-a-ti-ma um-ma PUZUR4.ISTAR-ma a-na {d}ISKUR.SIPA-ma 7.66666 ma-na 3 GIN KU.BABBAR i-na li-bi-ka i-ba-si la i-ba-si u-ul ik-ri u-ul ka-i-ni um-ma {d}ISKUR.SIPA-ma a-na PUZUR.ISTAR-ma ki-na 7.66666 ma-na 3 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im pa-ra-ka-ni-ka sa a-su-hu u 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa a-na be-a-lim ta-di-na-ni i-na li-bi4-a i-ba-si um-ma PUZUR.ISTAR-ma KU.BABBAR-pi di-nam um-ma {d}ISKUR.SIPA-ma a-na PUZUR.ISTAR-ma hu-ur-si-a-ni se-si-a-ma lu URUDU lu si-im ANSE sa tal-qe-u di-nam hu-ur-si-a-su PUZUR.ISTAR u-se-si-a-ma 4 ma-na URUDU KU.BABBAR sa hur-si-a-ni-su a-na PUZUR.ISTAR is-ni-iq lu KU.BABBAR lu si-im 2 GU URUDU la-mu-nim lu si-im 0.5 GU URUDU DU10 lu si-im ANSE 15 GIN KU.BABBAR i-di-nu
tgt: Puzur-Ištar seized us against Adad-rēʾī: Puzur-Ištar said, "Give me my silver." They gave silver, the price of 2 talents poor copper, 4 talents fine copper, and the price of the donkey-15 shekels silver.

src: 10 ma-na URUDU si-kam i-se-er a-sur-ma-lik DUMU LUGAL-{d}ISKUR tam-ka-ru-um i-su ITU.KAM si-pi-im a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal IGI <big_gap>-su-ma-bi4-a IGI na-ni-a li-mu-um i-ku-pi-ISTAR DUMU i-ku-a
tgt: Aššur-mālik s. Šar-Adad owes the merchant 10 minas poor quality copper.

src: a-na su-a-nim qi-bi-ma um-ma si-la-ma-si-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma KU.BABBAR si-im TUG.HI-ti-ka PUZUR4.ISTAR na-as-a-ki-im PUZUR4.ISTAR KU.BABBAR e-ri-is-ma um-ma su-ut-ma mi-ma u-la i-di-nam a-hi a-ta KU.BABBAR-pi se-bi-lam 1 {TUG}is-ra-am ki-sa-am ta-ad-mi-iq-ta-ka PUZUR4.ISTAR na-as-a-kum
tgt: To Šu-Anum from Šī-Lamassī: You wrote me: "Puzur-Ištar brings to you the yield of your textiles." I asked Puzur-Ištar about the silver, and he said: "He did not give me anything." My dear brother, send me my silver. Puzur-Ištar will bring you 1 (wool) belt as capital for your interest-free loan.
