src: a-na a-sur-na-da u u-su-ur-sa-a-sur qi-bi4-ma um-ma i-li-a-lum-ma 13 ma-na 11.5 GIN KU 0.33333 ma-na 7 GIN KU.GI ku-nu-ki sa ki-ma i-a-ti be-lum-ba-ni ub-la-ku-nu-ti 2.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am 10.16666 GIN KU.GI pa-sa-lam5 i-di-a-sur ka-sa-ar a-al-DUG ub-la-ku-nu-ti as-pu-ra-ku-nu-ti 15.5 ma-na a-na pu-su-ke-en6 su-uq-la-ma si-tam a-na a-sur-na-da di-na ta-as-pu-ra-am a-tal-kam la li-bi4 DINGIR-ma i-na sa-la-tu-ar ITU.8.KAM <big_gap> uk-ta-si-du-ni u sa KU.BABBAR 20 ma-na lu-qu-tum qa-di-a-ma ka-su-ud u su-ma-nim a-na URUDU sa ki-ma bi4-it-qa-tim sa 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-ta-mar a-na se-er a-na-nu-um <big_gap> bi-it-qa-tu-ni u a-ma-kam su-ISTAR u tap-pa-u-su a-na <big_gap> ta-am-li-a-tim u-ka-lu i-hi-id-ma KU.BABBAR sa-as-qi-il5-ma ha-ra-nam a-na a-lim{ki} la a-ha-li-iq sa a-hi la i-su-u ki-a-am la su nu
tgt: To Aššur-nādā and Uṣur-ša-Aššur from Ilī-ālum: 13 minas 11 1/2 shekels of silver (and) 1/3 mina 7 shekels of gold under the seals of my representatives Bēlum-bāni brought to you. 2 1/2 minas of refined silver (and) 10 1/6 shekels of I wrote to you, (saying): "Pay 15 1/2 minas to Pūšu-kēn and give the rest to Aššur-nādā." You wrote back, (saying): "Come!" Against god's will they have held me up in Šaladuwar for 8 months; moreover, merchandise worth some 20 minas of silver has been tied down together with me. So, if indeed it had been invested in copper, I would have experienced losses of 5 minas of silver; not only was there a deficit from here, but then there Šū-Ištar and his associates hold back on the reparations. Take care and have the silver paid, so I shall not perish on the journey to the City. He who has no brothers--I am like him!

src: a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-i-di-in-ma 0.5 ma-na 7.5 GIN KU.BABBAR {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni ha-bu-lam tup-pu-su ha-ar-ma-am is-tu MU.5.SE e-zi-ba-kum-ma u-la KU.BABBAR tu-sa-as-qal u-la tup-pi tu-ta-ra-am as-ta-na-me-ma {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni a-na ka-ni-is e-ta-ar-ba-am u KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na u 2 ma-na a qa-ti-su pa-qi-id a-hi a-ta sa-ba-su-ma KU.BABBAR sa-as-qi-il5-su su-ma i ma-hi-ri-im la i-na-mar DUB.SAR sa ka-ri-im E sa-te-a DUMU.SAL su-e-ta-ta na-hi-id
tgt: Zu Aššurnādā sprich! Folgendermaßen Aššuriddin: ½ Mine 7½ Seqel Silber ist Amurrabbāni mir schuldig. Seine Dopel-urkunde habe ich seit {dem Eponymat} fünf Jahren dir überlassen. Entweder läßt du ihn das Silber zahlen, oder meine Urkunde gibst du mir zurück. Wie ich immer wieder höre, ist Amurrubbāni nach Kaniš gekommen. Silber, 1 oder 2 Minen, ist ihm anvertraut. Mein Bruder bist du! Lade ihn vor und laß ihn das Silber zahlen! Wenn er sich auf dem Markte nicht zeigt, beauftrage den Schreiber des Kārum bezüglich des Hauses der Šad'a, der Tochter des Su'eddādā.

src: um-ma pu-su-ke-en6 sa ki-ma PUZUR4-a-sur u su-e-a-ma a-na PUZUR4-a-sur qi-bi4-ma 19 GU URUDU ma-si-am ku-nu-ki sa i-a-sar nu-sa-ni-iq-ma 13.66666 ma-na im-ti SA.BA 1 GU 40 ma-na URUDU si-ku-um i-na URUDU ma-si-im pa-ni-im u ur-ki-im ub-lu-nim 7.5 GU URUDU si-kam ku-nu-ki sa i-a-sar nu-sa-ni-iq-ma 10 ma-na im-ti mi-ma a-nim i-a-sar us-te-bi-lam 3 GU URUDU sa-la-mu-um i-na URUDU-i-su na-di <gap>-<gap> 2 GU URUDU ma-si-am sa i-na wa-la-ma i-ni-du ub-lu-nim-ma nu-sa-ni-iq-ma 1 ma-na im-ti 20 ma-na si-ku-um i pa-ni i-la-tim na-di 10 GU 30 ma-na URUDU si-kam ku-nu-ki sa ku-ra-ra u su-be-lim nu-sa-ni-iq-ma 12 ma-na im-ti 52 ku-ta-ni is-tu wa-ah-su-sa-na sa ki-ma ku-a-ti u-se-bi4-lu-nim SA.BA 30 ku-ta-ni 9.25 GIN.TA a pu-su-ke-en6 ni-di-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-su-nu a-di-ni <big_gap> la is-qu-ul 48 ku-ta-ni i-di-a-sur <gap> ir-de8-a-am SU.NIGIN TUG-ti-ka 1 me-at 48 TUG-ba-tu sa se-ep i-di-a-sur i-ba-si-u 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-ni en-na-su-en6 DUMU e-la-li na-as-a-ku-um lu URUDU lu TUG-ti lu ba-a-ab-tam sa te-zi-bu a ma-la a-wi-lu-ti-ni a KU.BABBAR nu-ta-ar-ma i se-ep dan-a-sur KU.BABBAR-ka nu-za-ka-ma KU.BABBAR-ka nu-se-ba-la-kum a ma-la te-er-ti-ka ANSE-ru-ka a na-ab-ri-tim na-du sa-am-ka-ka sa-li-im
tgt: From Pūšu-kēn, the representative(s) of Puzur-Aššur, and Sueyya to Puzur-Aššur: We checked the 19 talents of refined copper under seals which Ea-šar (brought), and it was deficient 13 2/3 minas. Thereof, they brought 1 talent 40 minas of poor quality copper from the previous and former washed copper. We checked the 7 1/2 talents of poor quality copper under seals which Ea-šar (brought), and it was deficient 10 minas. All this Ea-šar brought. 3 talents of 'black' copper are placed in his copper. They brought 2 talents of refined copper which he deposited in Walama and we checked it and it was deficient 1 mina. 20 minas of poor quality (copper) are deposited in the previous caravan-enterprise. We checked the 10 talents 30 minas of poor quality copper under seals which Kurara and Šū-Bēlum (brought), and it was deficient 12 minas. Your representatives brought 52 textiles from Waḫšušana. Thereof, 30 kutānum-textiles are deposited to Pūšu-kēn at a rate of 9 1/4 shekels (of silver) and he has not yet paid the silver. Idī-Aššur drove here 48 kutānum-textiles. Total of your textiles is 148 textiles which arose from the transport of Idī-Aššur. Enna-Suen son of Elāli is bringing you 20 minas silver under our seals. We will convert to silver the copper, the textiles, and the outstanding claims and assets which you left like gentlemen, and we will clear your silver from the cargo of Dān-Aššur and we will send your silver to you. According to your instructions your donkeys are put to pasture. Your servant is well.

src: 1.3333300000000001 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-i-di DUMU DINGIR-na-da ku-ur-ku-ri-a u ku-ku-zi me-er-e sa-ah-ri-li bu-za-zu i-su is-tu ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um a-gu5-tum a-na ITU.2.KAM i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 1.5 GIN.TA a ma-na-em i ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-su-bu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI en-na-nim DUMU ku-ku-a IGI i-ku-pi-a DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti IGI DU10-si-la-a-sur DUMU a-sur-na-da
tgt: Witnesses: Ennānum s. Kukuwa, Ikūnpīya s. Aššur-imittī, Ṭāb-šill-Aššur s. Aššur-nādā.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-su-mi sa um-me-a-ni-ka ta <gap> <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> ma-da-<big_gap> TUG is ma am <big_gap> u a-na DINGIR-il5-ba-ni um-ma a-ta-ma DUB-pe-ka <big_gap> a-ta-ra-ad 1.5 ma-na KU.GI u 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR <gap> pa-sal-lam u 0.33333 ma-na <gap> <big_gap>
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: Concerning the matter about your investors ... ... textile(s) ... ( purchase?) ... Also, you will say to Ilí-bānī, "I will dispatch (your tablets?) ... ." 1 1/2 minas (gold?) and 5 minas silver ...

src: KISIB a-ha-na-ar-si KISIB a-na-ah-DINGIR KISIB i-ku-nim KISIB a-mur-a-sur DUMU zu-u-a sa hu-bu-ul a-ha-na-ar-si u a-na-ah-DINGIR 8 ma-na 16 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um sa a-sur-SIPA is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-ma-lik u su-ki-tim a-na 3 ITU.KAM i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-su-bu ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-ha-na-ar-si u a-na-ah-DINGIR
tgt: They will pay 3 months from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-mālik and Šukatim. If they do not pay (on time), they will add 1 1 /2 shekels (per mina) per month (as interest).

src: a-na i-di-a-sur {d}ISKUR-ba-ni a-sur-i-mi-ti i-ku-pi-a-sur PUZUR4.ISTAR u im-di-lim qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6 PUZUR4-ti-a-am-tim u i-na-a-ma a-su-mi sa su-a-sur sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni-ni ki-ma tup-pa-ak-nu ni-is-me-u um-ma ne-nu-ma a-hi-am u-la nu-se-ra-ab um-ma su-nu-ma nu-se-ra-ab a-na a-ni-a-tim 10 u4-me ni-si-bi-it-ma a-na ka-ri-im i-li-ku-ma um-ma su-nu-ma sa ki-ma a-bi-ni nu-se-ra-ab <gap> tup-pi ta-<gap> <gap>-<gap> i-sa-qal u lu sa a-na u4-me qu-ur-bu-tim lu sa nu-a-e sa tam-ka-ri-su-nu pa-zu-ur-tim e 1 GU KU.BABBAR u-la i-di-u a-na lu-qu-tim sa is-tu a-lim{ki} i-li-a-ni a-hi-su ni-is-ni-iq-ma 9.5 GU AN.NA u me-at 50 TUG is-ku-nu um-ma ne-nu-ma sa u4-me-su na-as-pa-ra-tim sa is-tu a-lim{ki} tu-se-si-a-ni <gap>-<gap> a-le um-ma su-nu-ma <gap> nu-us-te-bi-la-sum me-eh-ri u-ta-bi-u sa SIG sa a-na-nu-um is-ta-ku-nu me-eh-ru la-su me-eh-ri sa tup-pi-su ha-ru-mu-tim nu-us-ba-al-ki-it-ma i ku-nu-ki-ni E ka-ri-im ka-an-ku tup-pe ha-ru-mu-tim sa su-mi <big_gap><gap> a-na me-er-e-su nu-ta-se-er 2 pi-iz-lu-ti 7 as-ti-pi-ru-um u sa na-am-e-dim <big_gap> um-ma su-nu-ma <big_gap>
tgt: To Idī-Aššur, Adad-bāni, Aššur-imittī, Ikuppī-Aššur, Puzur-Ištar and Imdī-ilum, from Pūšu-kēn, Puzur-Tiamtum, and Innaya: With regard to the matter of Šū-Aššur about which you (pl.) wrote, when we read your tablets, we said, "We will not bring in a stranger." They said, "We will bring someone in." We remained stuck in these (positions) 10 days, then they went to the colony and they said, "We will bring in the representative(s) of our father." ... tablets ... ... he will pay. Also(?), they did not deposit anything apart from one talent of silver from the (assets tied up) in short term credit and those with Anatolians (and) smuggled goods of their merchants. With regard to the goods which came up from the City, we checked his brothers (or partners), and they deposited 9 1/2 talents tin and 150 textiles. We said, "Where are the letters which you brought from the City?" They said, "We sent them to him." They destroyed the copies. Regarding the wool that he gathered(?) from here, there are no copies. We made copies of the certified tablets and they were sealed with our seals at the colony office. We have released the certified tablets with the names of the (merchants?) to his sons. ... 2 piz[..] 7 house servant(s) and the remainder ... They said, "... ."

src: KISIB {d}IM-ba-ni DUMU ka-na-a KISIB en-na-su-en6 DUMU a-bu-bu KISIB da-da-a-a DUMU la-li-im 16 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er da-da-a-a tam-ka-ru-um i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-na-a-a DUMU e-la-li 1.5 GIN.TA i ITU.1.KAM a-1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab ITU.KAM si-ip-im li-mu-um a-sur-na-da DUMU i-li-bi4-na-ni lu i-na a-lim{ki} lu i-na GAN-lim a-li i-na-mu-ru-ni KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su i-sa-qal
tgt: Seals of Adad-bāni s. Kanāya, Enna-Suen s. Abubu, and Dadaya s. Lālim. Dadaya owes 16 shekels refined silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month from the ḫamuštum of Innāya s. Elāli. Month: ṣipʾem Eponymate: Aššur-nādā s. Ilī-binanni

src: a-la-hu-um a E-ti-su-nu u-se-ri-ib-ni-a-ti-ma um-ma su-ut-ma a-ma 8.25 GIN KU.BABBAR E DAM.GAR-ri-im al-qe-ma a-na nu-a-im a-na hu-bu-ul en-um-ISTAR um-mi-ni a-sa-qal ITU.KAM ab sa-ra-ni li-mu-um a-sur-i-mi-ti IGI PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU a-bu-sa-lim IGI i-ku-pa-sa DUMU pu-su-ke-en6
tgt: Month: Ab šarrānē. Eponymate: Aššur- imittī. Witnesses: Puzur-Ištar s. Abu-šalim, Ikūppaša s. Pūšu-kēn.

src: um-ma su-hu-bur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma E-tam sa ti-hi-ka sa E DINGIR-ma-lik i-du-nu um-ma ne-nu-ma qa-ab-li-tam nu-ra a-na-ku a-ni-sa-am u-sa-am-ma E-be-tam u-la ta-di-in wa-ar-ki-a sa ki-ma ku-a-ti u sa ki-ma i-a-ti u-na-hi-du-ma E-be-tam i-la-qe-u-ni-kum su-ma a-di a-lu-ku-ni E-be-tam sa ki-ma ku-a-ti u i-a-ti a-di-ni la la-qe-u MU 1 i-na a-la-ki-a a-na-ku a-la-qe-a-kum u-la e-zi-ib-su-nu a-su-mi 1 GU AN.NA sa i-na ha-hi-im a-na la-li-im a-sur-ma-lik u ir-ma-a-sur ip-qi-du-u-ni a-na-kam a-su-mi AN.NA a-nim E la-li-im as-ba-at-ma um-ma su-nu-ma si-bi-ka ri-dam a-pu-tum a-ma-kam a-sur-ma-lik u ir-ma-a-sur si-bi-su-nu sa i-nu-mi AN.NA a-na la-li-im i-di-nu-ni lu-da-ni-nu-ma u KU.BABBAR 10 ma-na i ba-ab-ti-a a-ma-kam ma-mi-tu li-is-bu-tu-ma a-ni-sa-am la ta-na-di-a-nim KU.BABBAR ku-un-ka-ma se-bi-la-nim su-ma sa ki-ma la-li-im i-ba-si a-wi-li sa-hi-su-nu-ma KU.BABBAR li-il5-qe-u-ni-ma u ma-la a-na ha-wi-li-a a-di-in 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na sa-sa-ra-ra a-di-in 10 GIN KU.BABBAR u 2 ma-na AN.NA a-na DUMU u-ra-a mi-ma a-nim a-su-mi ka-ri-im u-sa-qi-il5 a-ma-kam ka-ra-am KU.BABBAR e-ri-is-ma se-bi-lam
tgt: From Šū-Ḫubur to Pūšu-kēn: Regarding the house next to yours which the house of Ilī-lmālik sold, (we said), "We will 'bear the When I myself departed from there, the house was not sold. Since (I have departed), your representatives and my representatives are working hard to purchase the house for you. If when I arrive (back) your representatives and my representatives have not yet acquired the house, I myself will acquire it for you at my arrival. I did not abandon them. Concerning the 1 talent of tin which Aššur-mālik and Irma-Aššur sold on credit to Lāum in Ḫaḫḫum, here, I seized the house of Lālum regarding this tin and they said, "Gather your witnesses." Urgent, there, Aššur-mālik and Irma-Aššur must prepare their witnesses that (witnessed) them (when) sold the tin to Lālum so that the oaths seize the 10 minas silver from my holdings there if they do not present it towards here. Seal and send the silver. If the representatives of Lālum are there, clear the men of obligations so that they take the silver. Also, I gave ... to Hawilia. I gave 1/3 mina silver to Šasarara(?). 10 shekels silver and 2 minas of tin to the son of Uraya, all this I paid out in consequence of the colony. There, request the silver from the colony and send it.

src: um-ma su-hu-bur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma 2 ma-na.TA KU.BABBAR a-na 1 ma-na-em KU.GI um-mi-a-nu i-ku-nim <big_gap><big_gap> a-na KU.GI-su-nu u-se-li-u su-ma ta-na-ta-al-ma i-na 2 ma-na.TA wa-at-ra-am 3 ma-na.TA i-da-na-kum nam-ge5-er su-ma i-na 2 ma-na.TA wa-at-ra-am la ih-ta-la-qum su-up-ra-ma a-na-kam sa-al-sa-ti-su le-mu-su-ma KU.BABBAR-pi i-na a-lim{ki} ar-ku-us a-su-mi AN.NA 1 GU-tim sa a-na la-li-im i-na ha-hi-im a-sur-ma-lik u ir-ma-a-sur i-di-nu-ni a-di ma-la u se-ni-su as-pu-ra-kum um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-na-kam E la-li-im KU.BABBAR e-ri-is-ma um-ma su-nu-ma a-sar AN.NA ta-di-nu-su-ni su-pu-ur-ma as-ra-kam-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-ka li-qe KU.BABBAR-ap la-li-im i-na GAN-lim la i-ba-si a-pu-tum i-hi-id-ma a-sur-ma-lik u ir-ma-a-sur si-bu-u-a sa AN.NA ip-qi-du-ni a-ma-kam a-na sa ki-ma la-li-im se-li-su-nu a-li KU.BABBAR 1 GIN i-ba-si-u sa-as-qi-il5-ma KU.BABBAR-pi la i-ha-liq 15 ma-na AN.NA ik-ri-bu sa a-sur a-na li-bi su-uq-lim sa i-ku-nim a-di sa-as-qi-il5
tgt: From Šū-Ḫubur to Pūšu-kēn: You wrote, (saying) "Ikūnum's investors have gotten out 2 minas of silver for each mina of gold for their gold (shares)." You wrote. Ikūnum's investors have realized 2 minas silver on each mina gold for their gold. If you judge look on him kindly, then he will give you an additional, (i.e.) three mina rate, instead of two mina rate. Come to an agreement (with him). If after the 2 minas he does give up to you an addition, write me so that I may impose his 'thirds' here and bind my silver in the city. Concerning the 1 talent of tin which Aššur-mālik and Irma-Aššur sold to Lālum in Ḫaḫḫum, I have written to you several times (saying) "Here, I requested silver from the estate of Lālum, and they said, 'Write to wherever you sold him the tin and take your silver there; (but) there is no silver belonging to L Urgent, take heed to send Aššur-mālik and Irma-Aššur, my witnesses that they entrusted the tin, to the representatives of Lālum there. Wherever there is a single shekel of silver make them pay so that my silver is not lost. I deposited 15 minas tin, the ikribū of Aššur, into the sack of Ikūnum. Make him pay.

src: a-na im-di-DINGIR qi-bi4-ma um-ma i-di-{d}ISKUR a-na-li u PUZUR4.ISTAR-ma a-di ha-ra-an su-qi-nim sa tas-pu-ra-ni-ma um-ma a-ta-ma ki-ma sa-la-am KU.BABBAR-pi-a 1 GIN u qa-qa-da-ti-ma sa-la-mi-im ep-sa ha-ra-an su-qi-num i-pa-te-ma a ma-la te-er-ti-ka ne-pa-as tup-pa-am sa PUZUR.SA.TU u i-tur4-DINGIR sa si-bu-tim sa a-di e-nu-be-lim sa tas-pu-ra-nim um-ma a-ta-ma tup-pa-am sa be-la-nim lu tup-pu-um sa PUZUR.SA.TU u i-tur4-DINGIR lu tup-pu-um sa a-sur-ma-lik DUMU qa-ti-im lu tup-pu-um sa e-bu-ut i-ku-pi-a ma-sar-tum i-na ku-nu-ke-e sa ki-ma ku-a-ti ka-an-ka-at a-sar tup-pu-u i-ba-si-u-ni te-er-ta-ka a-se-er sa ki-ma ku-a-ti li-li-kam-ma tup-pe-e li-di-nu
tgt: To Imdī-ilum from Idī-Adad, Annali and Puzur-Ištar:

src: um-ma su-hu-bur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-su-mi AN.NA u TUG.HI.A sa i-ku-num il5-qe-u-ni ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma a-na TUG-ti-ka 0.33333 ma-na.TA u a-na AN.NA-ki-ka 7 GIN.TA a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-sa-qal ki-ma ta-as-pu-ra-ni li-bi ih-du i-na bar-ki-tim ta-sa-pa-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma na-as-pe-er-ta-ka i-ku-num IGI i-ba-ru-ti-a u-se-si-a-am u ub-ta-i-sa-ni ke-na i pa-ni-tim lu as-pu-ra-sum u-la a-tu-ur-ma is-tu a-ta u4-me-e ta-as-ku-nu-su-ni-ma te-er-ta-ka i-li-ka-ni u-la as-pu-ra-sum a-pu-tum su-ma a-hi a-ta i-hi-id-ma KU.BABBAR sa-as-qi-il5-su u 15 ma-na AN.NA a-ha-ma sa ik-ri-bi-a a li-bi su-uq-li-su a-di u 5 ma-na AN.NA a-sur-SIPA ha-nu-nu-um IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU i-ku-pi-a i-di-na-su-um <big_gap> <gap>-<gap>-sum KU.BABBAR <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> um-ma a-ta-ma a-wi-lum a-wi-il5 gi-mi-lim gi-mi-lam i-se-ri-su su-ku-un ki-ma te-er-ti ta-as-me-u-ni te-er-ta-ka is-ti ba-ti-qi-im pa-nim-ma li-li-kam
tgt: Šū-Ḫubur to Pūšu-kēn: Regarding the tin and textiles which Ikūnum took, you wrote me, (saying) "He will pay silver--20 shekels for your textiles and 7 shekels (per shekel silver) for your tin--in 13 weeks." Regarding the tin and textiles which Ikūnum took, you wrote me: When you wrote me, I was relieved/glad. (Now) later you are writing, (saying) "Ikūnum produced your letter before my colleagues and he put me to shame." (Now) later you are writing: Indeed, I most certainly wrote to him earlier. (But) I did not (write) again and after you set his terms and your message came, I certainly did not write to him. Please, my dear brother, take care to make him pay the silver. Also, I placed 15 minas tin separately in his pouch. Also, Aššur´rēʾī You said, "The man is a man of favors." Do him a favor. When you read my message, let your message come with the next express caravan.

src: KISIB a-sur-ma-lik KISIB i-ku-pi-a-sur KISIB a-mur-a-sur 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-mur-a-sur su-ku-tim i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa u-ra-a u kur-ub-ISTAR 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa zu-zu 0.25 GIN i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na 10 GIN-tim u-sa-ab
tgt: Seals: Aššur-mālik, Ikūppī-Aššur, Amur-Aššur. Amur-Aššur owes Šukkutum 1 mina refined silver. He will add (interest) at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month from the ḫamuštum of Ūraya and Kurub-Ištar.

src: 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR KI {d}IM.GAL is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-la-hi-im u ku-ra 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KI da-di-a is-tu ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um su-hu-bur 30 ma-na URUDU SIG5 KI zi-ka-a 0.33333 ma-na KI wa-al-di-DINGIR is-tu ha-mus-tim sa kur-ub-ISTAR u su-a-nim 0.66666 ma-na KI a-sur-re-si is-tu ha-mus-tim sa u-ra-a u su-ki-tim 1 ma-na KI i-di-a-sur is-tu ha-mus-tim sa su-ka-li-a u u-ra-a 0.5 ma-na KI a-la-hi-im sa ma-ma u ISTAR-la-ma-si is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-ku-nim u na-ra-am-ZU 0.5 ma-na be-u-la-ti-a im-li-ka-a u-ka-al 10 GIN KI sa i-la-li 10 GIN KI {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni 0.5 ma-na 2 GIN KI en-um-a-sur DUMU is-du-ke-en6 10 GIN KI i-di-a 0.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KI id-na-a is-tu li-mi-im sa-li-a 12 ma-na KI en-um-i-li 5 GIN KU.BABBAR KI a-ku-za mi-ma sa a-wi-lim a-ni-u-tim tup-pu-su-nu ha-ru-mu
tgt: Adad-rabi owes 45 shekels silver. (He will pay interest) from the ḫamustum of Al-aḫum and Kura.

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-be-eh DUMU en-na-nim KISIB su-ka-li-a DUMU a-mur-a-sur KISIB a-sur-ba-ni DUMU sa-lim-a-sur KISIB a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU a-ta-a-a sa hu-bu-ul PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU a-ta-a-a 12.33333 ma-na 0.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-i-mi-ti a-na 36 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na ma-na-em i-na ITU.KAM-im u-sa-ab AN.NA-kam a-sur-i-mi-ti a-hu-su u su-a-num ni-a-um u-se-si-u-su-um
tgt: Seals: Puzur-Abiḫ s. Ennanum, Sukkallīya s. Amur-Aššur, Aššur-bāni s. Šalim-Aššur, Aššur-imittī s. Attaya. He will pay 36 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-imittī. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest). Aššur-imittī his brother and our Šū-Anum sent the tin to him.

src: 1.5 ma-na 0.25 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-GAL DUMU a-gu5-za DAM.GAR-ru-um i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni u a-sur-na-da ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um a-sur-na-da DUMU PUZUR4-a-na 0.66666 GIN 15 SE.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI i-di-{d}UTU DUMU da-la-as IGI a-bi4-a-a DUMU a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5
tgt: Aššur-rabi s. Aguza owes the tamkārum 1 mina 30 1/4 shekels refined silver. He will add 3/4 shekel and 15 grains per month per mina as interest from the ḫamuštum of Amurrum-bāni and Aššur-nādā, month Ḫubur, eponymate of Aššur-nādā s. Puzur-Anna. Witnesses: Idī-Šamaš s. Dalaš, Abīya s. Aššur-mutabbil.

src: su-ISTAR DUMU a-bi-la su-ku-tum DUMU i-su-hi-im i-di-ISTAR DUMU kur-ub-ISTAR su-a-nim DUMU i-sa-li-a a-na-ah-i-li DUMU ki-i-ki su-i-ta-a DUMU ir-i-bi-im da-a-a DUMU i-su-hi-im DINGIR.ILLAT {d}UTU.DU10 a-ku-lim id-na-a DUMU su-da-a qu-qa-dum DUMU bu-zu PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU be-da-ki la-qe-ep DUMU ba-bi-di su-la-ba-an DUMU kur-ub-ISTAR su-be-lum DUMU i-su-hi-im na-ab-su-en DUMU su-ISTAR ha-da-a DUMU e-la-li en-um-a-sur DUMU be-ga-a i-ku-num DUMU su-da-a
tgt: Šū-Ištar s. Abila Šū-Kutum s. Išuḫum Iddin-ilum s. Kurub-Ištar Šū-Anim s. Isalia Anaḫ-ilī s. Kiki Suetaya s. Iribum Dāya s. Išuḫum Ilī-ellitī Šamaš-ṭāb Akulim Idnaya s. Šū-Dāya Quqādum s. Buzu Puzur-Ištar s. Bedāki Lāqēp s. Babidi Šū-Laban s. Kurub-Ištar Šū-Bēlum s. Išuḫum Nab-Suen s. Šū-Ištar Ḫadaya s. Elāli Ennum-Aššur s. Bagaya Ikūnum s. Šū-Dāya

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi-ma 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 2 ANSE.HI.A sa-la-mu 30 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 4 TUG su-ru-tum ka-ab-tu-tum sa li-wi-tim 17 ma-na AN.NA a qa-ti-su a-di-in 1 TUG ra-qu-tum 1 TUG sa ta-tur4-a-li-sa 1 TUG sa DINGIR-su-GAL mi-ma a-nim LUGAL-{d}ISKUR un-la-ku-nu-ti a-na a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi-ma lu-qu-tam a-ni-tam za-ki-ma su-ma a-hi a-ta i-na is-te-en6 a-li-ki-im KU.BABBAR se-bi-lam li-bi la tu-la-ma-an i-hi-id me-eh-ra-tim i-na ra-mi-ni-ka se-bi-lam 26 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 1 ANSE sa-la-mu-um 5 ma-na AN.NA i-a-u-tum mi-ma a-nim su-nu-nu ub-la-ku-nu-ti 2 GU 11 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 35 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 2 ANSE sa-la-mu 6 ma-na AN.NA u 0.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR a qa-ti-su mi-ma a-nim i-a-um kur-ub-ISTAR na-as-a-ku-nu-ti AN.NA u TUG.HI.A ma-la i-na E.GAL-lim i-za-ku-a-ni a-na a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku di-in su-ma a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku la-su a-sar wa-as-bu se-bi-il5 lu-qu-tum ma-la iz-ku-a-ni tup-pa-am se-bi-lam a-na a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi-ma i-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum ka-ra-am la tu-sa-ab i-nu-mi te-ru-bu a-la-an 10 u4-me la tu-sa-ab sax-ha-ra-tim la e-ri-is za-ki-a-ma ra-ma-ku-nu a-tal-ka-nim
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā and Aššur-taklāku: 2 talents 10 minas of tin under seal, 2 black donkeys, 30 To Aššur-taklāku: Clear these goods (with the palace), and, as you are my brother, send me silver with the very first caravan. Do not make me angry! Take care to send me the corresponding amount out of your own funds. 26 2 talents 10 minas of tin under seal, 35 Give the tin and the textiles, as many as are cleared in the palace, to Assur-taklaku; Send me a letter about the goods that are cleared. To Assur-taklaku: In Burushaddum you should not stay in the colony; when you arrive, do not stay more than 10 days. Ask for the girls; clear yourselves and set out to come here personally.

src: a-na sa ki-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti im-di-lim u bu-si-a qi-bi4-ma um-ma id-na-a-ma 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-li-us-ra-ni na-as-a-ku-nu-ti a-na sa qa-ta-ti-a ta-al-ta-ap-ta-ni su-uq-la a-na-ku a-na si-ib-tim i-na a-la-ki-a u-ba-ab-ku-nu a-na im-di-DINGIR qi-bi4-ma a-bi4 a-ta be-li a-ta a-na sa KU.BABBAR-ap-ka la u-se-bi4-la-ku-ni li-ba-ka la i-la-mi-in su-ma a-na-ku 10 u4-me a-su-hu-ur KU.BABBAR-ap-ka is-ti a-sur-su-lu-li u-se-ba-la-kum
tgt: To the representatives Aššur-imittī, Imdī-ilum, and Buṣia from Idnāya. Ilī-uṣranni brings you 10 minas refined silver. Weigh it out to the one you recorded as my guarantor.

src: 5.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er i-di-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-na-da hu-ra-sa-nu-um i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa su-nu-nu u PUZUR4-a-sur a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-em i ITU.1.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM te-i-na-tim li-mu-um a-la-hu-um DUMU i-na-ah-DINGIR IGI a-bu-sa-lim DUMU i-di-er-ra IGI en-nam-a-sur DUMU qar-ri-a
tgt: Iddin-Ištar son of Aššur-nādā owes 5 5/6minas of refined silver to Huraṣānum. He will pay 13 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Šū-Nunu and Puzur-Aššur. If he does not pay (on time) he will add interest at the rate 1 1/2 shekel per mina per month. Month: Te'inātum. Eponymate: Al-aḫum s. Inaḫ-ilī. Witnessed by Abu-šalim son of Iddin-Irra, witnessed by Ennam-Aššur son of Karria.

src: a-wa-tim sa na-ru-uq su-a-nim u a-gu5-za ni-ig-mu-ur-ma ki-ma sal-sa-at 2 ma-na KU.GI 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR u4-ma-ma ku-ku-la-num il5-qe 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR a ma-la tup-pi-su-nu ha-ar-mi-im a-ku-za u me-er-u-su a-na 26 ha-am-sa-tim a-na ku-ku-la-nim i-sa-qu-lu tup-pa-am sa na-ru-uq su-a-nim u a-ku-za ku-ku-la-num a-na sa ki-ma a-ku-za i-da-an-ma su-ma na-ru-qum i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ak-sa-at-ma sa-li-is-tam e-ku-lu-ma a-na sa-li-is-tim i-za-zu ki-ma-ma gam-ra-am gam-ra su-ma i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu la ra-ak-sa-at tup-pu-um sa 0.66666 ma-na i-mu-a-at su-ma sa-li-is-tam la e-ku-lu a sa-li-is-tim la i-za-zu KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na-am u-ta-ar-ma u tup-pu-um sa 0.66666 ma-na i-mu-a-at IGI DUG-i-li IGI a-sur-SIPA IGI si-lu-lu IGI {d}en-LIL-ba-ni
tgt: Witnesses: Ṭāb-ilī, Aššur-rēʾī, Ṣilūlu, Enlil-bāni

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma su-e-a-ma DUB.SAR-tam wa-di la-am-da-ni e-pa-ta-am a-na um-mi-a-ni-a se-bi-lam u ma-ti-ma la ta-aq-bi um-ma a-ta-ma 1 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na me-er-i-a lu-se-bi4-il5 su-ma a-la-ak a-hu-ra-ti te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam-ma la-li-kam
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Sueyya: Teach (me?) the scribal arts! We are (supposed to be?) learned. Send anepattum-garment to my teacher. And (why is it?) you never say, "I shall send a shekel of silver to my son." If you are delayed, let your message come so that I may come.

src: a-na sa-lim-a-hi-im u pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma a-la-hu-um-ma im-di-lum u PUZUR4-a-sur-ma 2 GU 6 ma-na AN.NA 32 TUG qa-dum sa li-wi-tim 2 ANSE sa-la-me-en6 hu-ra-sa-num ip-qi-id-ni-a-ti 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA 30.5 ku-ta-ni 4 su-ru-tim 2 ANSE sa-la-me a-mur-a-sur ip-qi-id-ni-a-ti 23 ku-ta-ni 1 ANSE sa-la-ma-am {d}ISKUR-ba-ni ip-qi-id-ni-a-ti i-na 4 GU 16 ma-na AN.NA-ki-ka 8 ma-na ni-is-ha-tum 9 ma-na 3.5 GIN a-na {d}ISKUR-ba-ni ne-pu-ul 1.8333300000000001 ma-na a-na hu-ra-sa-nim ne-pu-ul 13.83333 ma-na 5.5 GIN mu-ta-u si-ti AN.NA-ki-ka 3 GU 43.33333 ma-na 85.5 ku-ta-nu 4 su-ru-tum 5 ANSE sa-la-mu iz-ku-u-nim SA.BA 2 GU AN.NA 32 ku-ta-ni 10 GIN.TA AN.NA 15 GIN.TA ku-ta-ni 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na 25 ha-am-sa-tim i-se-er DAM.GAR ni-di 1 GU AN.NA 16 ku-ta-ni 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er DAM.GAR ni-di 43.33333 ma-na AN.NA 17 {TUG}ku-ta-ni 2 ANSE 9.5 ma-na 5 GIN i-se-er DAM.GAR ni-di 2 ANSE 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er DAM.GAR ni-di 1 wa-ni-qu a-na 0.33333 ma-na i-se-er DAM.GAR ni-di a-na 3 GU 43.33333 ma-na AN.NA 65 TUG u 5 ANSE 40.83333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er DAM.GAR ke-nu-tim la sa ta-sa-hu-tu a-na 25 ha-am-sa-tim na-di ITU.KAM ab sa-ra-ni li-mu-um bu-zu-zu 8 TUG a qa-ti-ka ni-di KU.BABBAR-ap-su-nu a qa-ti-ka ni-di 1 su-ru-um a-na qa-ti-ka si-ti TUG-ti-ka 12 ku-ta-nu 3 su-ru-tum
tgt: To Šalim-aḫim and Pūšu-kēn from Al-āḫum, Imdī-ilum and Puzur-Aššur: Ḫuraṣāum entrusted to us 2 talents, 6 minas tin, 32 textiles together with those for wrappings, and 2 black donkeys. Amur-Aššur entrusted to us 2 talents 10 minas tin, 30 1/2 kutānum textiles, 4 šurūtum textiles, and 2 black donkeys. Ilabrat-bāni entrusted to us 23 kutānum (textiles) and 1 black donkey. From the 4 talents 16 minas of your tin, the excise tax was 8 minas. We balanced 9 minas 3½ shekels (tin) to Ilabrat-bāni. We balanced 1 5/6 minas (tin) to Ḫuraṣānum. The deficiencies were 13 5/6 minas 5½ shekels (tin). We cleared the remainder of your tin--3 talents, 43⅓ minas, the 85½ kutānum textiles, the 4 šurūtum textiles, and 5 black donkeys. Therein, we placed 2 talents tin, 32 kutānum textiles, a 10 shekels rate (for) the tin, 15 shekels each for the kutānum textiles--20 minas silver for 25 ḫamuštum weeks. We placed 1 talent tin, 16 kutānum textiles for 10 minas silver on (another) merchant. We placed 43⅓ minas tin, 17 kutānum textiles, 2 donkeys for 9 minas 35 shekels (silver) on (another) merchant. We placed 2 donkeys for 1 mina silver on a merchant. We placed 1 donkey foal on a merchant for ⅓ minas (silver). For 3 talents 43⅓ minas tin, 65 textiles and 5 donkeys--40 5/6 (minas) 5 shekels refined silver on trustworthy merchants, not ??the cheating kind??, for 25 ḫamuštum weeks are placed. Month: Ab-šarrāni (v), Year: Buzuzu (REL 87). We placed 8 textiles in your account. Their silver we placed in your account. 1 šurūtum textile (went) into your account. 12 kutānum textiles and 3 šurūtum textiles are the remainder of your textiles.

src: 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um i-se-er ma-si-i-li su-{d}EN.LIL a-mur-ISTAR u a-sur-i-mi-ti i-su-u is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim DUMU pa-na-ka a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u-me-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab IGI bur-{d}ISKUR IGI id-na-a-a
tgt: Witnesses: burdIŠKUR, Idnāya.

src: 1 ma-na 4.66666 GIN 10 SE KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er si-la-{d}ISKUR su-ku-bu-um i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa e-la-ma u su-ku-bi4-im a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im 1.5 GIN.TA a ma-na-im u-sa-ab ITU.KAM ab-sa-ra-ni li-mu-um a-al-DUG IGI e-nam-a-sur IGI a-sur-dan
tgt: Ṣilli-Adad owes Šū-Kūbum 1 mina 4 2/3 shekels 10 grains refined silver. He will pay 10 weeks from ḫamuštum of Elamma and Šū-Kūbim. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the colony rate from 1 1/2 shekels.

src: a-na PUZUR4-a-sur qi-bi4-ma um-ma il5-we-da-ku-ma 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI sa-du-a-su sa-bu sa su-e-a a-na i-di-lim DUMU DUG-i-li i-di-nu-ma a-na a-lim{ki} a-na si-a-ma-tim se-bu-lu-ma DAM.GAR wa-du-u DAM.GAR a-na-ku tup-pa-am ha-ar-ma-am sa ku-nu-uk su-e-a u-ka-al sa KU.BABBAR KU.BABBAR-pi-ni u na-as-par-tam sa ku-nu-uk su-e-a a-na i-di-lim la-pu-ta-at-ma i-ku-pi-a-sur na-as-a-kum ki-ma DAM.GAR a-na-ku-ni a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 DUMU pu-su-ke-en6 im-si-ma KU.BABBAR il5-qe a-na sa la ha-bu-la-ku-su-ni-ma KU.BABBAR il5-qe-u sa-ab-ta-su-ma a-na KU.BABBAR KU.GI i-se-ri-su li-qe-a KU.BABBAR ku-nu-uk-ma a-na a-sur-UTU-si pi-qi-id-ma a-se-er sa ki-ma DAM.GAR a-na a-lim{ki} lu-bi4-il5 a-bi4 a-ta i-hi-id-ma is-ti TUG.HI.A sa i-di-a-sur u sa <gap>-<gap>-a-sur sa-di-ma <big_gap><big_gap> <gap>-<gap>-u <big_gap><big_gap> <gap>-<gap> <gap> si-ip-ka-tim ma-la tal-qe-u ta-ah-si-is-ta-ka i-di-ma <gap>-ni-sa se-bi4-lam 3 TUG i-ku-pi-a-sur ub-lam
tgt: To Puzur-Aššur from Ili-wēdāku: As for the 2 minas of silver, its excise tax paid, its shipping charges satisfied, which Sueyya gave to Idī-ilum son of Ṭāb-ilī and which he transported to the city for purchases and about which informed the merchant, I am the merchant. I hold the certified tablet with Sueyya's seal. As for the matter of the silver, our silver and the message with the seal of Sueyya has been written for Idī-ilum and Ikkūppī-Aššur brings it to you. Aššur-mutabbil son of Pūšu-kēn, instead of the merchant, which is me, checked and received the silver. Because (?) they received the silver, of which it can be said that I do not owe it, seize him and received from him gold for silver. Seal the silver and entrust it to Aššur-šamši so that he brings it to the representative of the merchant in the City. My dear father, take care to cause them to be deposited with the textiles of Idī-Aššur and of ...-Aššur so that ... Deposit your taḫsistum (concerning šipkātim, as much as they took and send ... . Ikūppī-Aššur brought 3 textiles.

src: um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma a-na a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi4-ma 24 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR i-na tup-pi-im GAL i-na E ka-ri-im la-ap-ta-a-ku 0.83333 ma-na 5 GIN qa-dum si-ib-ti-su sa ha-mus-tim pa-ni-tim 0.5 ma-na 2.5 GIN sa ha-mus-tim wa-ar-ki-tim si-im 3 {TUG}ku-ta-ni 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN 7.5 GIN ig-re-e ANSE sa wa-as-ha-ni-a 15 GIN ig-re-e na-ab-ri-tim SU.NIGIN 26.66666 ma-na <gap> 5 GIN SA.BA 20 ma-na da-at-ka 6 ma-na sa-hi-tum sa en-um-a-sur a-hi-ka 1.5 ma-na a-ta u <big_gap> na-ab-su-en6 a-na ar-ni-im ta-ad-na-tu-nu 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN ki-is-da-tu-ka 2.33333 ma-na ga-ma-ar-ka sa pu-ru-us-ha-tim u-la is-ku-nu 18 GIN sa su-ha-re-e-ka u ANSE-ri-ka u-la is-ku-nu
tgt: From Pūšu-kēn to Aššur-taklāku: I am written down for 24 minas 10 shekels silver in the great tablet in the colony office. 55 shekels together with its interest from the previous ḫamuštum week, 32 1/2 shekels from the following ḫamuštum-week, the price of three kutānum textiles, 45 shekels, 7 1/2 shekels the hire of the donkeys at Wašḫaniya, 15 shekels the hire for the paddock, total 26 minas 45 shekels. Thereof, your The šaḫītum of Ennum-Aššur your brother was 6 minas. You and Nāb-Suen were given 1 1/2 minas for a fine. Your arrival expenses were 45 shekels. They did not set the 2 1/3 minas your complete spending (?) of Purušḫattum. They did not set the 18 shekels of your servants and donkeys.

src: a-na im-di-DINGIR u pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma kur-ub-ISTAR-ma lu-qu-ti sa se-ep im-di-DINGIR sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni-ni um-ma a-tu-nu-ma sa qi-a-pi-im ni-qi-ip u si-ta-am ba-ti-iq u wa-tu-ur ni-da-ma KU.BABBAR nu-se-ba-la-kum a-hu-a-a a-tu-nu lu ta-qi-pa lu ba-ti-iq u wa-tu-ur ta-di-na KU.BABBAR E ka-ri-im ma-la na-da-ku-ni te-er-ta-ak-nu za-ku-tum a-na pa-ni-a li-li-kam 2.5 ma-na hu-sa-ra-am SIG5 wa-at-ra-am u ka-sa-am sa hu-sa-ri-im ku-nu-ki-a a-me-ta na-as-a-ku-nu-ti su-ma 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR u e-li-is hu-sa-ra-am di-na su-ma 0.5 ma-na KU.GI pa-sa-la-am u e-li-is ka-sa-am di-na su-ma la i-ta-ab-si-ma la ta-ta-ad-na hu-sa-ru-um u ka-sa-am a-di a-la-ka-ni li-bi4-si u a-na-kam si-ma-am sa ba-la-ti-a a-mu-ur-ma sa KU.BABBAR 10 ma-na u 15 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na si-ib-ti-im a-al-qe-ma a-as-a-am a-hu-a-a a-tu-nu lu i-na lu-qu-ti-im pa-ni-ti-im lu i si-mi-im sa a-me-ta ub-la-ku-nu-ti-ni ta-ta-ad-na KU.BABBAR ku-un-ka-ma bu-ur-su-en6 a-na pa-ni-a lu-ub-lam su-ma bu-ur-su-en6 la-su a-na DUMU um-mi-a-ni-im pa-ni-e-ma di-na-ma lu-ub-lam su-ma KU.BABBAR i-na lu-qu-tim la-su a-hu-a-a a-tu-nu KU.BABBAR i-na ra-ma-na-ti-ku-nu di-na <big_gap> ma <gap> ni <big_gap><gap> ITU.1.KAM u ITU.2.KAM li-be-el-ku-nu-ma gi5-im-la-ni a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma 1 ma-na hu-sa-ra-am sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni ni-il5-qe a-me-ta <big_gap>-ka na-as-a-kum
tgt: To Imdi-ilum and Pūšu-kēn, from Kurūb-Ištar: As for my merchandise in the transport of Imdī-ilum about which you (pl.) wrote me, you said, "We entrusted what we could. And the remainder, cheap or dear, we will sell and we will send you the silver." My dear brothers, let you full message come as soon as possible regarding what you gave on credit, and what you sold cheap or dear, (and) as much silver as I have deposited in the colony office. Ameta brings you 2 1/2 minas exceedingly fine carnelian and a goblet of carnelian under my seal. If (the going rate) is 6 minas silver or higher, sell the carnelian. If 1/2 mina pašallum-gold or higher, sell the goblet. If no sales arise, then do not sell. As for the carnelian and the goblet, until I come, its heart and tin prices that will make me a little look for(?) and I will borrow an amount around 10 or 15 minas silver and make a purchase. My brothers either from the previous merchandise or from the price which Ameta brought to you, sell. Seal the silver and let Būr-Suen bring it at the earliest opportunity. If Būr-Suen is not available, give it to the first affiliated trader and let him bring it. If there is not silver from the goods, my dear brothers, give silver from your own funds. .... let it be a loan to you, and let it be a favor to me. To Pūšu-kēn: The one mina carnelian about which you wrote, we received it. Ameta brings your... to you.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma la-ma-si-ma KU.BABBAR 1.5 ma-na sa ig-ri E-be-tim sa DINGIR-ma-lik i ba-ab ha-ra-ni-ka ta-am-si-ma i-na ta-ah-si-is-ti-ka u-la ta-al-pu-ut mu-zi-zu-ka il5-ta-qe-u-su i-na 70 BANES sa li-bi ab-ba-a-im <big_gap><gap> 20 BANES se-am im-du-ud si-ti se-im i-ma-da-ad-ma te-er-tum i-la-ka-kum a-pu-tum i-hi-id-ma pu-uh a-ni-ki sa su-ha-ri sa ta-ap-tu-ru KU.GI se-bi4-lam-ma a-ni-ki la-as-ku-su-nu-ma li-ba-su-nu la i-la-mi-in KU.GI sa bu-za-zu sa te-zi-bu hi-ti a-na a-ha-ha e-pu-us a-na mu-zi-zi-ka la ta-sa-la-at su-ha-ra-am tur4-dam-ma ip-ra-am lu-pa-he-er
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Lamassī: You forgot the roughly 1 1/2 minas silver for the rent of the house of Ilī-malik at the beginning of your journey and you did not write it in your memorandum. Your representatives took it. From the 70 sūtum-measures in the possession of Abbāʾim, he measured out 20 sūtum-measures. He will measure out the rest of the barley and the message will come to you. Urgent, take care to send the gold, the yeild of my tin (brought by) the lads which you opened, so that I may set my tin to them and not disappoint them. The gold belonging to Buzāzu which you left, fashion it into ḫittum-objects for Aḫaḫa. Do not act high-handedly with your representatives. Dispatch the lad so that he gathers the grain ration.

src: 10.66666 ma-na AN.NA is-tu ha-mus-tim sa en-na-su-in u a-sur-ma-lik li-mu-um {d}IM-ba-ni a-na ta-ad-mi-iq-tim a-na dan-a-sur DUMU sa-lim-a-hi-im a-di-in IGI i-ku-pi-a-sur IGI a-sur-ma-lik DUMU a-ni-nim
tgt: 10 2/3 minas of tin from the ḫamuštum of Enna-Suen and Aššur-mālik.

src: KISIB i-li-as-ra-ni DUMU a-sur-DUG KISIB li-ip-ti-ISTAR DUMU da-gan-ma-al-ki-im KISIB i-li-us-ra-ni DUMU da-nu-mi-il5 KISIB en-nam-a-sur DUMU a-ni-nim 50 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa i-se-er ku-si-a u su-e-a en-nam-a-sur i-su-u-ma tup-pa-as-nu ih-ri-mu-ma i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ak-su a-na 50 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na tup-pi-im a-nim en-nam-a-sur DUMU a-ni-nim a-na su-e-a DUMU pu-su-ke-en6 a-mi-ma su-um-su la i-tu-ar
tgt: Seals: Ilī-ašranni s. Aššur-ṭāb, Lipit-Ištar s. Dagan-malkum, Ili-uṣranni s. Dannum-il, Ennum-Aššur s. Anninum. As for 50 minas silver which Kūziya and Sueyya owed to Ennam-Aššur and their tablet was sealed and bound upon their head, for 50 minas silver (becasue of) this tablet, Ennam-Aššur s. Anninum will not return to Sueyya s. Pūšu-kēn whatsoever.

src: um-ma i-di-a-sur {d}ISKUR-ba-ni a-sur-i-mi-ti i-ku-pi-a-sur PUZUR4.ISTAR u im-di-DINGIR-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 zu-pa a-sur-su-lu-li i-na-a u pi-la-ah-ISTAR qi-bi-ma a ma-la tup-pi-im sa is-ti a-la-hi-im la-ap-ta-ni-ni a-na E su-a-sur er-ba-ma mi-ma su-um-su sa su-a-sur e-zi-bu a-li i-ba-si-u lu tup-pi-su a-na a-sur-ma-lik a-hi-su pa-qi-da na-ru-qam a-na se-ri-su nu-ta-er ih-da-ma mi-ma KU.BABBAR ap-ni la ta-ka-ba-sa ka-la-ma pa-qi-da-sum i-na u4-mi-im sa a-na E su-a-sur te-ra-ba-ni a-sur-SIPA DUMU sa-ba-si-a bu-zu-ta-a u is-te-en6 is-ti-su-nu sa a-na a-lim{ki} i-la-ka-ni sa-ba-ta-ma a-na E su-a-sur se-ri-ba-ma a-na a-si-im ma-la a-na a-sur-ma-lik tu-pa-qa-da-ni a-na si-bu-tim su-uk-na-su-nu-si ma-la a-na a-sur-ma-lik tu-pa-qa-da-ni a-ha-ma te-er-ta-ku-nu sa-li-tum a-se-ri-ni li-li-kam a-pu-tum ih-da-ma a-wi-li se-ri-ba su-ma bu-zu-ta-a la-su 2-si-na sa a-na a-lim{ki} i-lu-ku-ni-ni is-ti a-sur-SIPA se-ri-ba IGI a-wi-li sa tu-se-ra-ba-ni qi-bi-a-sum um-ma a-tu-nu-ma a-bu-ka i-na a-lim{ki} ki-ma ku-a-ti im-gur16-ma na-ru-uq a-hi-ka a-se-ri-ka u-ta-e-ru ma-la a-hu-ka e-zi-bu pa-aq-da-kum su-ma la a-tu-nu sa i-na tup-pi-im la-ap-ta-tu-nu-ni u 2 ba-ri a-la-hi-im ma-ma-an DIRI is-ti-ku-nu la e-ra-ab u su-ma i-na e-li-ti tup-pi-im ma-ma-an la-pi-it la tu-sa-ra-ma la e-ra-ab
tgt: From Idī-Aššur, Adad-bāni, Aššur-imittī, Ikuppī-Aššur, Puzur-Ištar, and Imdī-ilum to Pūšu-kēn, Zupa, Aššur-ṣulūlī, Innāya and Pilaḫ-Ištar: We will turn over the joint-stock fund to him. Entrust all of it to him. And let your authoritative message come seprately as to how much you entrusted Aššur-mālik. If Buzutaya is not available, cause two others who will go to the city to enter with with Aššur-rē'ī. In the presence of the men which you bring in, speak to him. Except for you, those delineated in the tablet, and the two partners of Al-aḫum, no one else is to enter the house with you.

src: um-ma bu-zu-ta-a u en-um-be-lum-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma 10 ma-na KU sa im-di-DINGIR is-qu-lu-ni-a-ti 6.83333 ma-na 7 GIN KU a-mur-ISTAR is-tu tur4-hu-mi-it u-se-bi4-lam 3 ma-na 3 GIN KU sa-qa-lim 2.83333 ma-na 3 GIN i-na-a DUMU a-mu-ra-a 2.5 ma-na 2 GIN sa a-sur-i-mi-ti 3 ma-na a-mu-ra-am is-ti nu-a-im i ba-ab-ti-ka ni-il5-qe SA.BA 15 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na pa-la u IH.ME sa ti-ib-nim 3 GIN KU.BABBAR a ni-ga-li lu mu-ta-ti-im 28 ma-na 3.6666600000000003 GIN KU sa i-na ba-ab-ti-ka ni-il5-qe-u 2.5 ma-na 6 GIN KU ni-ih-sa-ah-ma a si-ib-tim ni-il5-qe-a-kum i-na ma-qa-at KU-pi-ka nu-ta-ar 30.5 ma-na 9.16666 GIN KU-ap-ka 30 ma-na KU ku-nu-ki-ni il5-ba-ni na-as-a-kum 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR a qa-ti-su 1 GIN a ni-qi-su 5.33333 GIN KU a-na ki-se ni-di-in a-na ma-la ti-i-er-ti-ka si-ti ba-ab-ti-ka nu-za-ka-ma KU-ap-ka nu-se-ba-la-kum
tgt: From Buzutaya and Ennum-bēlum to Pūšu-kēn: Regarding the 10 minas silver which Imdī-ilum paid to us, Amur-Ištar sent 6 minas 57 shekels from Durḫumit. We took from your outstanding merchandise 3 minas 3 shekels for payments, 2 minas 53 shekels for Innaya son of Ammurāya, 2 minas 32 shekels belonging to Aššur-imittī, 3 minas checked silver with the 'natives'. Thereof, 15 shekels silver (went) to Pala and the priest of Tibnum, 3 shekels silver for sickles and the half-pack. Total: 28 minas 3 2/3 shekels which we took from your outstanding merchandise. We (still) needed 2 minas 36 shekels and we borrowed it for you on interest. We will (add) it from the yield of your silver. In sum, your silver is 30 minas 39 1/6 shekels. Il-bāni brings you 30 minas silver under our seals. We gave 1/2 minas silver to his share, 1 shekels to his sacrifice(?), 5 1/3 shekels silver to Kissē. According to your instructions, we will clear the remainder of your outstanding merchandise and we will send you your silver.

src: 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er id-na-a-sur u sa-li-a la-zu-ta-a i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa la-qe-pi-im u na-ab-su-en6 a-na 14 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-em si-ib-tam u-su-bu ITU.KAM ka-an-ma-ar-ta li-mu-um DUG-a-sur IGI i-li-a-lim IGI su-en6-na-da KU.BABBAR i-na qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is
tgt: Iddin-Aššur and Sallīya owe Lazutāya 1 mina refined silver. They will pay 14 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Lā-qēpum and Nāb-Suen. If they do not pay (on time), they will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest. (The responsibility to pay) the silver is bound to whomever is financially solvent.

src: KISIB kur-ub-a-sur DUMU si-li-a KISIB pi-la-ah-ISTAR si-li-li KISIB ta-ki-il5-a-sur DUMU ha-na-nim KISIB ku-ni-na-ah-su-sa-ar DAM a-sur-pi-la-ah DUMU a-mur-a-sur tup-pa-am sa 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa si-im ha-da-a-ni IR a-sur-pi-la-ah DUMU a-mur-a-sur sa a-hu-ni DUMU su-ISTAR u a-ha-tum a-sa-su a-na DAM.GAR-ri-im ha-bu-lu-ni-ma tup-pu-um a-na a-sur-na-da pa-aq-du tup-pa-am ku-ni-na-ah-su-sa-ar DAM a-sur-pi-la-ah DUMU a-mur-a-sur su-ma ma-ma-an i-na me-er-e a-sur-pi-la-ah u-la DUMU.SAL a-sur-pi-la-ah a-na tup-pi-im a-na a-sur-na-da i-tu-a-ar ku-ni-na-ah-su-sa-ar DAM a-sur-pi-la-ah DUMU a-mur-a-sur tu-ba-ab-su me-he-er tup-pi-sa ha-ar-mi-im sa ku-ni-na-ah-su-sa-ar a-sur-pi-la-ah DUMU a-mur-a-sur
tgt: Seal of Kurub-Aššur son of Ṣilliya, seal of Pilah-Ištar son of Ṣilli-ilī, seal of Takil-Aššur son of Hannānum, seal of Kuninahšušar, the wife of Aššur-pilah son of Amur-Aššur. As to the tablet concerning 2/3 mina of silver, being the price of Hadāni, the slave of Aššur-pilah son of Amur-Aššur, which Ahuni son of Šū-Ištar and his wife (This is) a copy of the certified tablet of Kuninahšušar, the wife of Aššur-pilah son of Amur-Aššur.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u a-sur-ma-lik qi-bi-ma um-ma la-ma-si-ma a-na a-sur-ma-lik qi-bi-ma TUG ka-ab-ta-am sa i-na ILLAT a-sur-is-ta-ki-il5 DUMU su-ka-li-a sa u-se-bi-lu-ka i-li-kam-ma pu-su-ke-en6 um-ma su-ut-ma u-la i-di-nam <gap>-<gap> su-ut a-ma-kam <gap>-ta-i-na-ma KU.BABBAR u si-a-ma-ti-su sa is-tu ma-al-u-su sa-na-tim se-bi-la-nim
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn and Aššur-mālik from Lamassī: To Aššur-mālik: The 1 heavy textile which I sent to you in the caravan of Aššuriš-tīkal s. Sukkallīya came and Pūšu-kēn said, "He did not sell it." he (said?) "There .... and send the silver and its purchases which have been due for a year.

src: <big_gap> <gap>-lu-su <big_gap> DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR KISIB e-na-su-en6 DUMU i-li-a-lim sa hu-bu-ul en-na-su-en6 DUMU i-li-a-lim 0.83333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR a-mu-ra-am is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa am-ri-a u i-ku-nim a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i ITU.KAM u-sa-ab
tgt: Regarding Enna-Suen s. Ili-ālim's debt of 5/6 mina 5 shekels ammurum silver. He will pay 13 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Amrīya and Ikūnim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest).

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na en-nam-a-sur qi-bi4-ma lu is-ti nu-a-e lu a-a-kam-ma ba-ab-ta-ka sa as-ta-na-me-u la-ma ha-ra-nim sa ha-hi-im e-ru-ba-ni ra-ma-ka za-ki a-se-er KU.BABBAR sa is-ti i-na-a tu-se-bi4-la-ni ki-ma ni-is-ri-im KU.BABBAR ma-la qa-at-ka i-ka-su-du i pa-ni-ka sa se-bu-lim se-bi4-lam AN.NA u TUG.HI.A sa se-ep dan-a-sur qa-at-ka la tu-sa-ar a-na KU.BABBAR li-tu-ra-ma i ka-ni-is la ta-ba-re ti-be-a-ma a-tal-kam al-kam-ma su-ma li-bi4-ka a-ni-ma tup-pa-ka li-li-pi-it-ma ha-ra-ka ka-si-id a nu-a-e ka-la na-az-qa-ti KU.BABBAR sa AN.NA ILLAT-at a-sur-ma-lik DUMU lu-zi-na ki-is-da-ti-a la te-zi-ba-am KU.BABBAR sa AN.NA sa sa-at-a-sur u a-zi-a i pa-ni-ka se-bi4-lam u sa su-ba-ti-su-nu is-ti <gap> lu-qu-ti-a la ta-ZA-hi 15 ma-na URUDU da-mu-qam re-es15-tam sa ka-ni-is u sa ha-hi-im bi4-lam 16.5 GIN KU.GI is-ti li-pi-it-su-en i si-ma-la la-di-na-kum ka-sa-tam sa pa-su-ri-im sa a-ma-at u u-ut bi4-lam ka-ab-lu a-na-kam i-ba-si a-gu-a DUMU DU10-a-sur pa-su-ra-am sa ha-bu-la-ni li-di-na-kum
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Ennam-Aššur: As for your outstanding claims with both the Anatolians and wherever, which I continue to hear about, clear yourself before the caravan from Ḫaḫḫum arrives. In addition to the silver which you sent to me with Innaya, send as much silver as you can lay your hands on ahead of you as an installment. Come home! Do not leave my assets behind, (i.e.) the silver from the tin in the caravan of Aššur-mālik s. Luzina. Send the silver from Šāt-Aššur's and Azia's tin ahead of you. Now, do not (mix) the proceeds of their textiles with that of my goods! Bring 15 minas of top-quality fine copper from both Kanesh and Ḫaḫḫum. I shall give you the 16 1/2 shekels gold owed (you) by Li--en in Šimala. Bring a tabletop one and half cubits in size. There are legs available here. Let Agua s. Tāb-Aššur give to you the table which he owes me.

src: a-na PUZUR4-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma ah-sa-lim-ma 6 GU AN.NA i-ku-pi-a ub-lam si-im AN.NA i-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum ni-is-ta-na-me al-kam-ma ma-la e-bu-ri-su-nu AN.NA-ka a-bu-uk-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN ta-sa-am
tgt: To Puzur-Aššur fom Aḫ-šalim: Ikuppiya brought 6 talents tin. We keep getting reports about the price of tin in Purušḫattum. Come and send out as much of your tin as (has arrived?) so that you buy a shekel of silver.

src: KISIB su-la-ap-ra-at KISIB PUZUR4-a-na KISIB a-sur-ba-ni sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-ba-ni 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-ba-ni a-sur-na-da i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-a-nim a-na ITU.3.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u-me-su ma-al-u-tim
tgt: Seal of Šū-Ilabrat, seal of Puzur-Anna, seal of Aššur-bāni. Concerning the debt of Aššur-bāni: he must pay 1/2 mina of refined silver reckoned from the week of Šū-Anum and within 3 months; if within his completed term he has not paid ....

src: 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-SIPA DUMU <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-a a-sur-SIPA DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-na-da a-na 3 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 6 GU URUDU SIG5 i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su KU.BABBAR is-ta-qal a-na ma-la u4-mu-su e-te-qu-ni a-na si-ib-ti-su a-sur-SIPA i-se-e-su IGI i-ku-pi-a IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti IGI a-sur-na-da
tgt: Aššur-rēʾī s. ...---a owes Aššur-rēʾī s. Puzur-Ištar 3 minas refined silver. He will pay three weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-nādā. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 6 bilat fine copper.

src: 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-sa-a pu-su-ke-en6 i-su ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-DINGIR li-mu-um sa qa-ti ku-bi4-a a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam a-na 1 ma-na-em i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab IGI i-di-ku-bi4-im DUMU a-sur-ma-lik IGI i-ku-pi-a
tgt: Susaya owes Pūšu-kēn 1/2 mina refined silver. He will pay 20 ḫamuštum weeks from the month Maḫḫur-ilī, the limmum following the one of Kūbiya. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1/2 shekel interest per mina per month. Witnesses: Idī-Kūbum son of (Aššur-mālik); Ikūppiya.

src: KISIB i-di-a-bi4-im KISIB i-li-as-ra-ni KISIB {d}UTU-tap-pa-i KISIB {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni sa hu-bu-ul i-li-as-ra-ni u {d}UTU-tap-pa-i sa 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-{d}EN.LIL u e-la-li 2.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-su-bu KU.GI ri-ik-su-um a-na sa-pa-ar-tim na-di KU.BABBAR za-ku-am i-sa-qu-lu
tgt: Seal of Iddin-abum, seal of Ilī-ašranni, seal of Šamaš-tappā'ī, seal of Ilabrat-bāni. Concerning the debt of Ilī-ašranni and Šamaš-tappā'ī; concerning 1 1/2 mina of silver; reckoned from the week of Šū-Illil and Elāli they will add interest at the rate 2 1/2 shekel per month per mina. A bundle of gold has been deposited as collateral security. They will pay in pure silver.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma ku-lu-ma-a-ma su-ma DUMU ku-ra is-ti en-nam-a-sur a-du-um a-wa-ti-su-nu mi-ma i-ta-ag-ri-u a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta a ma-la ta-le-e-u a-wa-ti-a gu5-mu-ur 9.16666 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im 1 ma-na 13 GIN AN.NA sa a-na a-lu a-di-nu-ma KU.BABBAR i-ku-pi-a-sur E ha-pu-a-la im-hu-ru KU.BABBAR mi-ma u-la al-qe a-na se-er KU.BABBAR sa {d}UTU-ta-ak-la-ku a-pu-lu ra-di-ma KU.BABBAR ku-nu-uk-ma se-bi4-lam 0.33333 ma-na 2.5 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im 2.5 ku-ta-ni sa dan-a-sur sa i-na li-bi-a ta-di-u i-na sa-du-i-ti-a tu-sa-hi-ra a-ma-kam i-na li-bi4-ka e u-si ta-ah-si-is-ta-ka i-di AN.NA u TUG-ba-tu sa dan-a-sur u 6 ku-ta-nu sa a-ha-ti-su ba-lu-tu-ni-kum im-ku-a su-ku-ba-am u a-li-ki ba-ti-iq-ma i pa-ni-su-nu i-la-ak a-bi4 a-ta be-li a-ta a-na a-wa-ti-a sa E ku-ra i-hi-id a-na bu-za-zu qi-bi4-ma 0.83333 ma-na 5 GIN a-a-ar-tam sa e-zi-ba-ku-ni a-na e-na-su-en6 ni-a-im se-bi4-il5-si
tgt: Zu Pūšukēn sprich! Folgendermaßen Kulumā'a: (Auch) wenn der Angestellte des Kura mit Enumaššur wegen (?) ihrer Angelegenheiten sich irgendwie streiten sollte, —mein Vater bist du, mein Herr bist du — bringe meine Sachen zu Ende, soweit du kannst. 9¾ Seqel Silber, den Preis für 1 Mine 13 Se[qel] Zinn, das ich dem Allu gegeb[en] habe [und] (welches) Silber Ikuppī'aššur im Hause des Ḫabu'[ā]lā erhalten hat, (dieses) Silber habe ich erhalten. Zu dem Silber, das ich dem Šamaštaklāku gegeben habe, füge es hinzu; dann siegle das Si[lb]er und schicke (es) mir. Die ⅓ Minen 2½ Seqel Silber, den Preis für 2½ Kutānū des Dānaššur, womit du mein Konto belastet hast, kannst du (?) von meiner Provision abziehen. Dort braucht (das Silber) von deinem Konto nicht abzugehen. Dein Aufzeichnung hat er [mir] gegeb[en](?). Das Zinn und die Stoffe des Dānaššur und die 6 Kutānū seiner Schwester sind dir sichergestellt. Den Imku'a, den Šūkūbum und die (anderen) Boten schicke (her)! Mit dem ersten von ihnen wird (die Ware an dich) (ab)gehen. Mein Vater (bist) du, mein Herr (bist) du! Wegen meiner Angelegenheiten betreffend das Haus des Kurā sei achtsam! Zu Buzāzu sprich: "⅚ Minen 5 Seqel, Blumen (?)', die ich dir,überlassen' habe, schicke an unseren Ennasu'in!"

src: 0.5 ma-na 7.5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er ha-bu-la PUZUR4-a-sur i-su i-nu-mi 0.5 ma-na 7 0.5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-sa-qu-lu sa 0.5 ma-na 7.5 GIN tup-pu-su is-tu sa ha-mus-us-tim sa a-la-hi-im u sal-ma-a-sur a-na 12 ha-am-sa-tim tup-pu-su i-la-pa-at IGI zu-pa
tgt: Ḫabulá owes 1/2 mina 7 1/2 shekels silver to Puzur-Aššur.

src: 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI i-di-su-en DUMU a-la-hi-im ITU.KAM si-ip-im li-mu-um ku-bi4-a IGI su-pi-la-ah DUMU su-be-lim IGI tu-ur-a-sur DUMU su-<gap>-<gap> 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI ZA-<gap>-<gap>-<big_gap>-<gap> DUMU su-ku-bi4-im ITU.KAM <big_gap>-<gap>-<gap> li-mu-um ku-bi4-a <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR u 15 ma-na URUDU si-kum a-ha-ma i li-bi4-su IGI su-en-na-da DUMU en-um-a-sur IGI en-na-nim DUMU ku-ku-u-a IGI a-sur-la-ma-si DUMU la-qe-ep 15 GIN KU.BABBAR KI ma-za-a-a IGI a-na-ah-i-li DUMU e-nu-da-gan 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-ti zu-pa na-ab-su-en IGI su-ISTAR IGI i-li-is-ta-ki-il5 IGI PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU i-ku-pi-a <big_gap> ITU.KAM sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um i-li-dan IGI a-sur-ba-ni DUMU kur-ba-<gap> IGI su-su-en DUMU a-gu5-za-a-a 0.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI a-na-li ITU.KAM te-i-na-tim li-mu-um ku-bi4-a IGI u-sa-nim DUMU a-mur-a-sur IGI a-sur-la-ma-si DUMU la-qe-ep <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR KI da-da-a DUMU ir-me-<gap> ITU.KAM si-ip-im li-mu-um <big_gap>-<gap> 0.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR KI a-sur-la-ma-si DUMU la-qe-ep ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um i-li-dan <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR is-ti a-du-u u i-li-as-ra-ni DUMU u-su-ur-sa-a-sur IGI en-na-nim DUMU a-bi4-a <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR KI a-sur-DUG DUMU zu-pa ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um si-lu-lu IGI ah-sa-lim IGI bu-zu-ta-a IGI i-di-{d}ISKUR
tgt: Idī-Suen s. Al-aḫim owes 4 minas silver. Month: ṣipʾem. Eponymate: Kūbīya. Witnesses: Suppilaḫ s. Šū-Bēlim, Tūr-Aššur s. sú. . . Month: (Broken) Eponymate: Kūbīya. Witnesses: Suen-nādā s. Ennum-Aššur, Ennanim s. Kukuwa, Aššur-lamassī s. Lāqēp. Mazāya owes 15 shekels silver. Witnesses: Anaḫ-ilī s. Enna-Dagān. Zupa Nāb-Suen owes 30 shekels silver. Witnesses: šu-IŠTAR, Iliš-tīkal, Puzur-Aššur s. Ikuppiya. Month: ša kēnātim. Eponymate: Ilī-dān. Witnesses: Aššur-bāni s. kur-ba--, Šū-Suen s. Aguza. Anali owes 40 shekels silver. Month: Teʾinātim. Eponymate: Kūbīya. Witnesses: Usānum s. Amur-Aššur, Aššur-lamassī s. Lāqēp. Month: ṣipʾem. Eponymate: (Unknown). Aššur-lamassī s. Lāqēp owes 25 shekels silver. Month: Ḫubur. Eponymate: Ilī-dān. Adu and Ili-ašranni s. Usur-ša-Aššur owe (unknown amount) minas silver. Witnesses: Ennanim s. Abīya. Aššur-tāb s. zu-pa owes (unknown amount) silver. Month: Kuzallī. Eponymate: Silūlu. Witnesses: Aḫ-šalim, Buzutaya, Idī-Adad.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma i-ku-pi-a-ma i-na sa-am-si sa tup-pa-ka u-la-pi-ta-ku-ni su-nu-nu u-si-am te-em-ka lu sa-ab-ta-kum 2.33333 ma-na URUDU ma-as-am 10 si-ba-ra-tim a-na qa-ti-i e-la-li a-di-in <gap> 2 ma-na la-mu-nam sa is-ti-ka a-na i-li-a di-in
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Ikuppiya: On the day I wrote to you your tablet, Šū-Nunu departed. May your message(?) seize you. I gave 2 1/3 minas washed copper, and 10 (household utensils) to the account of Elāli. Give x minas l. that is with you(?) to Iliya.

src: KISIB a-sur-GAL DUMU la-qe-ep KISIB ma-num-ba-lum-a-sur DUMU a-sur-SIPA 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ma-num-ba-lum-a-sur a-sur-GAL i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-tu-ur-DINGIR u kur-ub-ISTAR a-na ITU.1.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab
tgt: Mannum-bālum-Aššur owes Aššur-rabi ... . He will pay a month from the ḫamuštum of Itūr-ilī and Kurub-Ištar. If he does not pay (on time) he will add interest at the rate of the colony.

src: a-na a-sur-na-da u ISTAR-pi-la-ah qi-bi4-ma um-ma ku-ni-lum-ma i-nu-mi ku-ra DUB.SAR a-na sa-du-a-tim sa-du-im i-li-ka-ni is-tu sa a-na-kam us-te-bi4-lu u-sa-di-u-ni-ni sa lu-qu-tim sa is-ti ISTAR-pi-la-ah i-lu-ku <big_gap> KU.BABBAR <big_gap> <gap>-a ka-ri-im <big_gap> <gap>-<gap> <big_gap> <gap>-tim <big_gap> <gap>-ku-nu-ti sa lu-qu-tim sa ILLAT-at ISTAR-pi-la-ah ki-ma sa-du-a-su na-ad-u a-ba-u-a be-lu-a a-tu-nu a-ma-kam ka-ra-am mu-uh-ra-ma sa-du-a-tam la us-ta-sa-na-ma la a-na-di-i a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma a-ta a-na-kam la ta-ad-gu5-ul ki-ma u-sa-di-u-ni a-na ma-la ta-ah-si-is-tim sa <big_gap> ti-is-mur-na a-di-na-ku-um <gap> lu-qu-tam a-su-ur
tgt: To Aššur-nādā and Ištar-pilah from Kuzallum: When the scribe Kura came in order to levy the transport tariff, after they imposed the tax on what I had sent here, for the merchandise that came with Ištar-pilah . . . silver . . . . . . to the colony . . . . . . to you . . . on the merchandise in Ištar-pilah's caravan, since the transport tariff had already been levied, then, my dear father and lords, confront the colony there in order that I do not have to pay transport tariff a second time. (Specifically) to Aššur-nādā: Did you not personally observe here that they levied the tax? Check the merchandise in accordance with the memorandum I gave you in Tišmurna.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma mi-su PUZUR4.ISTAR BA-a-tam e-pu-lu-ka um-ma su-ut-ma i-na e-ra-ab lu-qu-ti-a a-sa-qal u su-ma TUG.HI-ti-su sa-ru-um i-di-si a-na-ku mi-nam ta-hu-a-ku i-se-er a-sur-ma-lik gi5-mi-lam ta-as-ku-un KU.BABBAR-ap-su tu-sa-as-qi-il5 i-a-am la tu-sa-as-qi-il a-hi a-ta i-na u4-mi sa tup-pi ta-sa-me-u sa-ba-su-ma <gap> KU.GI sa-as-qi-il-su hu-ra-si ni-is-ha-tum tup-pu-su ha-ar-ma-am a-na-kam u-ka-al su-ma mi-ma i-qa-bi4 ta-ar-ki-is-tam li-qe-su-um-ma u KU.GI sa-as-qi-il5-su-ma is-ti pa-ni-im-ma se-bi4-lam
tgt: Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: Why is it that Puzur-Ištar answered you (in that way?). He (had) said, "At the arrival of my goods I will pay." Now if the wind carried off his textiles, how am I liable? You did a favor for Aššur-mālik. You caused his silver to be paid. Mine you did not cause to be paid! My dear brother, on the day which you read this tablet, seize him and case him to pay the gold. My gold is the excise-tax. As for his certified tablet, I retain it here. If he makes excuses (lit. says anything), take a binding agreement for him so that you cause him to pay the gold and send it to me immediately.

src: 10.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI a-mur-a-sur DUMU is-me-DINGIR is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ha-pi-a-ah-su u la-qe-ep a-na 30 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 3.5 ma-na 9 GIN KU.BABBAR KI PUZUR4-i-li DUMU u-su-ur-si-ISTAR 3 ma-na 13.5 GIN KU.BABBAR KI PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU i-pi-li-is u ma-nu-um-ba-lum-a-sur DUMU du-ni-a is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim a-na ITU.2.KAM i-sa-qu-lu 3.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI du-du DUMU ISTAR-ba-ni is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-i-mi-ti a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 0.33333 ma-na 0.66666 GIN KU KI i-zi-iz-mi-sar 2.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU KI a-sur-na-da u 16 GIN a-ha-ma is-ti-su-ma is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-i-mi-ti a-na ITU.1.KAM i-sa-qal 2 ma-na KI hu-bi-is-nu-ma-an u si-li-u-ma-an a sa ni-pa-as i-sa-qu-lu 0.33333 ma-na be-u-la-at a-la-bi-im 3 ma-na KU KI ki-di-im is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ha-na-nim u sa-lim-a-sur a-na 40 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal zu-zu qa-ta-tum 1 ma-na LA 1.66666 GIN KI a-bi4-la-ma-si i tu-a-ri-su i-sa-qal 10 GIN KI en-na-ma-nim DUMU u-ta-hi 0.66666 ma-na 4 GIN KU KI na-ab-su-en DUMU gal-ga-ri-im i-na a-lim{ki} i-sa-qal
tgt: 10 2/3 mina silver is with Amur-Aššur s. Išme-ilī. From the ḫamuštum of Ḫa-bi₄-a-aḫ-šu and Lāqēp he has 30 weeks to pay. 3 1/2 mina 9 shekels silver is with Puzur-ilī s. Uṣur-ša-Ištar. Puzur-Ištar s. Ipìlís and Mannum-bālum-Aššur s. Dunnīya owe 3 mina 13 1/2 shekels silver. From the ḫamuštum of Aššur-bēl-awātim they have one month to pay. 3 1/2 minas silver is with Dudu s. Ištar-bāni. From the ḫamuštum of Aššur-imittī he has 20 weeks to pay. 1/3 mina 2/3 shekel silver is will Iziz-Mīšar. 2 1/3 minas 5 shekels silver is with Aššur-nādā and 16 shekels is separately with him? From the ḫamuštum of Aššur-imittī he has one month to pay. 2 minas is with Ḫu-bi-iš-nu-ma-an and Šili-uman . . . Nipas will pay. 1/3 mina capital is with Al-abim. 3 minas silver is with Ki-dí-im. From the ḫamuštum of Ḫanānum and Šalim-Aššur he has 40 weeks to pay. 1 mina - 1 2/3 shekels is with A-bi₄-lá-ma-sí, I-tù-a-ri-ší will pay. 10 shekels is with Ennamānim s. Uta-aḫum. 2/3 minas 4 shekels silver is with Nāb-Suen s. Gal-ga-ri-im in the city will pay.

src: 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-na a-lim{ki} a-na en-na-su-en6 sa a-na be-u-la-tim a-di-nu-su-ni um-ma en-na-su-en6-ma sa ki-ma ku-a-ti i-na a-lim{ki} tup-pi il5-pu-tu su-ma sa ki-ma i-a-ti i-na a-lim{ki} tup-pu-su il5-pu-tu 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na sa ki-ma i-a-ti i-sa-qal i-sa-<gap>-<gap> tup-pu-su a-ni-um i-mu-at su-ma tup-pu-su sa ki-ma i-a-ti la il5-pu-tu 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-na a-lim{ki} sal-ma-am i-na-su-en6 i-sa-qal IGI sa-lim-a-hi-im IGI pu-su-ke-en6 IGI hu-ra-sa-nim
tgt: Regarding the 1/2 mina refined silver in the city which I gave to Enna-Suen for management, Enna-Suen said, "Your representatives drew up my tablet in the city." If my representatives wrote up his tablet in the city, he will pay the 1/2 mina silver to my representatives. In that eventuality (?) this tabelt of his will be dead. If my representatives did not draw up his tablet, Enna-Suen will pay 1/2 mina silver in the city in full. Witnesses: Pūšu-kēn, Šalim-aḫum, Ḫuraṣānum.

src: KISIB i-di-a-sur DUMU i-me-er KISIB en-nam-a-sur DUMU ma-na-na KISIB en-nam-a-sur DUMU ku-ku-u-a sa hu-bu-ul en-nam-a-sur DUMU ku-ku-u-a 0.5 ma-na 2.5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er en-nam-a-sur DUMU ku-ku-u-a {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-ba-ni DUMU sal-lim-a- sur a-na 7 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul a-na 1 ma-na-im 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM-im u-sa-ab
tgt: Seals: Idī-Aššur s. Imir, Ennam-Aššur s. Manana, Ennam-Aššur s. Kukuwa. Regarding the debt of Ennam-Aššur s. Kukuwa, Ennam-Aššur s. Kukuwa owes Amurrum-bāni 32 1/2 shekels silver. He will pay 7 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-bāni s. Šalim-Aššur. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month.

src: 4 na-ru-uq se-um i-se-er ku-u-ut-ku-ta u ta-mu-ri-a a-mur-ISTAR i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa e-la-ma u kur-ub-ISTAR a-na e-ra-ab ad-ri-im i-ma-du-du su-ma la im-du-du ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im 1 ma-na-um 0.5 ma-na si-ib-tam u-su-bu IGI su-pi-wa IGI hu-ma-da-a-su
tgt: ku-ú-ut-ku-ta and Tammuriya owe Amur-Ištar 4 bags barley.

src: KISIB su-is-ha-ra DUMU i-di-ku-bi4-im KISIB i-di-a-bi-im DUMU a-sur-DUG pu-su-ke-en6 bu-za-zu tap-pa-i-ni in-bi-ISTAR DUMU si-in-is-me-a-ni a-na a-sur-ma-lik DUMU ku-ra-ra is-ba-at-ni-a-ti-ma um-ma su-ISTAR-ma a-na a-sur-ma-lik-ma <gap>-UD is-tu <big_gap> <gap> e-la i pi <big_gap> <gap> a-ha-ma <big_gap> um il5-qe <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap>
tgt: Seal of Šū-Išḫara s. Idī-Kūbum. Seal of Iddin-abum s. Aššur-ṭāb. Pūšu-kēn (and?) Buzāzu were our partners. Inbī-Ištar s. Suen-išmeanni seized us against Aššur-mālik s. Kurara: Šū-Ištar said to Aššur-mālik: ... from/after ... Ela? .. separately ... -um took. ...

src: 7.5 GIN KU.GI ku-bu-ur-si-num i-si-ra-tum sa-hu-ra-ma 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa pa-si-ri sa-pa-ar-tam mi-ma a-nim a-na im-di-lim e-zi-ib <big_gap>-0.66666 ma-na 3 GIN KU.BABBAR ne-ma-al sa-di-a sa ILLAT-at su-ku-bi4-im <big_gap>-1 GU <big_gap> ILLAT-at as-qu-dim KU.BABBAR ma-la ILLAT-at pu-su-ke-en6 KU.BABBAR a-na 1 ma-na-im il5-qe-u-ni sa 4 ma-na 13 GIN KU.BABBAR qa-at as-qu-dim a-la-qe 1 GU 7 ma-na URUDU a-na-kam e-zi-ib 12 GU 50 ma-na SIG.HI.A a-na su-ku-bi-im e-zi-ib
tgt: 7 1/2 shekels kubušinnum gold ... was deducted (?) and 1/2 minas silver and 1/2 minas silver worth of paširi .. sapartam, all this was left to Imdi-ilum. x+2/3(?) minas 3 shekels silver, the nml of Šadiya of the caravan of Šū-Kūbum, X+1 talent (tin?/copper?/wool?) from the caravan of Asqudum, silver according to the caravan of Pūšu-ken, silver which they took for 1 mina, I will take the share of Asqūdum worth 4 minas 13 shekels silver. 1 talent 7 minas copper tin left. 12 talents 50 minas wool left for Šū-Kūbum.

src: um-ma su-hu-bur a-sur-ba-ni u sa-lim-a-sur a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma 30 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-a-sar ub-lam SA.BA 1 me-at 77 {TUG}ku-ta-nu KU.BI 15 ma-na 4 GIN 31 TUG.HI.A u 0.33333 TUG sa a-ki-di-e KU.BI 5 ma-na 8 ANSE.HI.A sa-la-mu KU.BI 2.5 ma-na 5 GIN 0.33333 ma-na 4 GIN u-nu-su-nu 10 GIN u-kul-ta-as-nu 1 ma-na 15 GIN ni-is-ha-tum 3 ka-sa-ru 1.5 ma-na 6 GIN lu-bu-su-nu 40.5 ma-na AN.NA qa-tim 13.5 GIN.TA KU.BI 3 ma-na <gap>-<gap> 4 GIN sa sa-e-tim <gap> 14 GIN wa-si-tum <gap> 0.5 ma-na 1.5 GIN te-su-pe 6.5 GIN i ma-sa-im im-ti mi-ma a-nim i-a-sar i-ra-de8-a-kum 2 TUG sa a-sur-ba-ni 2 TUG sa sa-lim-a-sur
tgt: From Šū-Ḫubur, Aššur-bāni, and Šalim-Aššur to Pūšu-kēn: Thereof, 177 kutānum-textiles, their cost was 15 minas 4 shekels. 31 textiles and 1/3 of an Akkadian textile, their cost was 5 minas. 8 black donkeys, their cost was 2 minas 35 shekels. Their gear was 24 shekels. Their feed was 10 shekels. The excise tax was 1 minas 15 shekels. For 3 drivers their clothing was 1 mina 36 shekels. 40 1/2 minas 'hand-tin,' at a 13 1/2 shekels rate, its cost was 3 minas 4 shekels. The ša saetum was 4 shekels. The exit-tax was 14 shekels. The extra costs were 31 1/2 shekels. At the weighing (the silver) was deficient by 6 1/2 shekels. All this Ea-šar brings to you. 2 textiles belong to Aššur-bāni. 2 textiles belong to Šalim-Aššur.

src: um-ma su-hu-bur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma tup-pe-e sa na-as-pa-ra-ti-ka u sa su-ut KU.BABBAR us-te-bi4-la-ku-ni i-li-is-ti-kal wa-su-ra-am u-la i-mu-a te-er-ti a-na ku-a-ti u i-li-is-ti-kal i-li-kam um-ma a-na-ku-ma er-ba-ma tup-pe-a a-ta-ma-ra su-ma a-hu-u-a a-tu-nu ki-ma tup-pi ta-mu-ra-ni te-er-ta-ku-nu ar-hi-is li-li-kam-ma is-ti um-mi-a-ni la-tu-wu a-di ha-am-si-su u-sa-li-it-ma mi-ma lu-qu-ti-a a-na se-er a-sur-SIPA i-ta-lu-ku as-pu-ra-kum mi-su sa te-er-ta-ka la i-tu-ra-ni i-hi-id-ma tup-pi-a a-mur-ma te-er-ta-ka za-ku-tum li-li-kam 1 GU AN.NA u {TUG}ku-si-tam a-na a-sur-DU10 DUMU kar-ri-a a-na ta-ad-mi-iq-tim a-di-in as-ta-na-par-su-ma te-er-tu-su-ma la i-tu-ra-am a-ma-kam si-it-al-ma su-ma a-wa-tum i-la-ak KU.BABBAR e-ri-su KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na 4.5 GIN is-ti DUMU sa-ah-ru-ta-na-im e-ri-is-ma se-bi-lam sal-ma-am i-na a-lim{ki} sa-qa-lam qa-bi 1.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR kur-ub-ISTAR u-la i-di-nam te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam-ma lu-sa-as-qi-il5-su
tgt: From Šū-Ḫubur to Pūšu-kēn: You wrote me. You said, "As for the tablets of your naspartum and the goods (arising from) that silver which I sent to you, Iliš-tīkal does not want to release them." My instructions to you and Iliš-tīkal have come. I said, "Take out and thoroughly inspect my tablets. If you are my brothers, when you see my tablet, let your report come quickly so that I may discuss it with my investor. He has acted highandledly five times and all of my goods will go to Aššur-rēʾī. I wrote to you. Why is it that you have not responded to my instructions? Take heed to look at my tablet and let your complete report come. I gave 1 talent tin and 1 kusītum robe to Aššur-ṭāb son of Karriya and a tadmiqtum-loan. I am continually writing to him, but his reports do not return. There, inquire (of him), and if the matter is progressing, request silver from him. Request 1 mina 4 1/2 shekels silver from the son of Saḫrutanāʾum and send it here. He promised the complete payment in the city. Kurub-Ištar did not give me the 1 1/2 minas silver. Let your report come so that I can cause him to pay.

src: ra-bi-su-um sa a-lim{ki} a-na e-nam-a-sur DUMU a-ni-nim is-ba-at-ni-a-ti-ma um-ma ra-bi-su-um sa a-lim-KI-ma la li-bi DINGIR-ma su-e-a sa-nu 40 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-su su-e-a a-na na-ab-si-im i-di-na-kum la i-di-na-kum IGI a-wi-li a-ni-u-tim ap-la-ni ra-bi-su-um sa a-lim{ki} a-na-ku u sal-ta-tim ma-da-tim-ma a-se-e-ka um-ma en-nam-a-sur-ma ti-ma-li-ma i-ku-pi-a ki-ma su-e-a is-a-la-ni u4-ma-am ra-bi-su-um is-ta-la-ni us-ka-in a-na ra-bi-si-im u be-li-a u-la sa ma-la pu-su-ke-en6 a-na-ku a-na ka-ri-im sa-he-er GAL a-wa-ti bi-la a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um sa-he-er GAL bu-ru-us-ha-dum i-di-ni-a-ti-ma IGI GIR sa a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in IGI be-lu-ba-ni DUMU na-ra-am-su IGI i-di-su-en6 DUMU en-na-nim
tgt: The chief of the city seized us against Ennam-Aššur son of Anninim and the chief of the city said, "Unfortunately Suaeyya has changed. Did Sueyya give to you 40 minas silver under his seal for nabšum or not?" Before these men, our seed?, the chief of the city myself and the the extensive assets I requested?? Ennam-Aššur said, "you filled? and Ikūn-pīya when Sueyya asked, on that day the governor asked, he established. To the governor and my lord, do not carry my matter concerning Pūšu-kēn, I myself?, to general assembly ...." Concerning these matters the large and small assembly of Purušḫattum gave to us and we gave our testimonies before the dagger of Aššur. Winesses: Bēlum-bāni son of Naram-Su(en), Idī-Suen son of Ennānum.

src: 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-ba-ni a-sur-na-da i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-a-nim a-na ITU.3.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-me-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul a-na 0.5 ma-na-im 1 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR u-sa-ab IGI su-la-ap-ra-at IGI PUZUR4-a-na
tgt: Aššur-bāni owes 1/2 mina of refined silver to Aššur-nādā. reckoned from the week of Šū-Anum he must pay within 3 months; if he does not pay within his completed term he will add interest at the rate 1 shekel per half mina (monthly). He must pay 3 months after the ḫamuštum week of Šū-Anum. If he does not pay (on time) he will add (interest) at the rate of 1 shekel per 1/2 mina per month. Witnessed by Šū-Ilabrat, witnessed by Puzur-Anna.

src: a-na a-sur-na-da u i-di-su-in qi-bi-ma um-ma i-li-a-lum-ma i-na pa-ni-tim-ma la-ma lu-qu-ut-ka tu-se-bi4-la-ni as-pu-ra-kum lu-qu-tam mi-ma a-na se-ri-a la tu-se-ba-lam a-ta ra-du-u-ma tu-ra-da-am-ma ra-mi-ni u-la u-za-ka-am ki-ma lu-qu-ut-ka e-ru-ba-ni URUDU sa KU.BABBAR 10 ma-na u 15 ma-na a-na a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku as-hu-ut-ma a-na su-mi lu-qu-ti-ka ak-la u URUDU 20 GU u e-li-is e-pa-sa-ku-um u-la wa-ar-ki URUDU e-ru-ub-ma KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na u-se-li u <gap> <big_gap> <gap> ma-na i-na ba-ab-ti-a tal-qe-ma e-ni-a ta-ap-te a-su-mi sa-ar-ma-ma u tap-pa-e-su i-na pa-ni-tim ta-sa-pa-ra-am DUMU-su me-et la ni-il5-e-ma la ni-li-ik-sum i-na wa-ar-ki-tim ta-sa-pa-ra-am si-ka-tum la na-tu-ma pa-am a-na ba-ab-ti-ka u-la nu-ma-la ni-ka-su sa ILLAT-at a-bu-um-DINGIR la sa-si-u tu-ra-a as-al-ma um-ma su-ut-ma 12 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na i-di-su-in a-pu-ul a-di si-ni-su as-pu-ra-ku-nu-ti a-na ITU.3.KAM ki-ma i-ta-pu-lu-ni si-im TUG.HI.A la-qe-u a-bu-um-DINGIR li-pu-la-ku-nu-ti su-ma la is-qu-ul si-ib-tam u-sa-ba-am mi-su-um ma-la tup-pi-su la is-qu-ul ma-a 12 GIN i-di-su-in KI tu-ra-a i-la-qe 5 GU URUDU-a-ka sa-lim-be-li a-na bu-ru-us10-ha-dim u-se-ri-ib
tgt: To Aššur-nādā and Iddin-Suen from Ilī-ālum: Previously, before you sent me your goods, I wrote to you, (saying): "Do not send any goods to me!" CHECK TRANSLATION: You drive them verily yourself, so that I do not clear any of my own things. As your goods arrived, I cleared copper worth 10 or 15 minas of silver for Aššur-taklāku, and kept it back on account of your goods. Further, I shall make at least 20 talents of copper or more for you. I Also, x minas [you received] from my outstanding claims and thus opened my eyes. You must write to me soon about Šarmama and his partners. His son is dead. We were unable to go to him. You will write to me later. During the sikkātum it is not feasible for us to live up to the promises with respect to your outstanding claims. The accounting concerning Abum-ilī's enterprise has not taken place. I asked Turaya, who said: "I balanced 12 shekels of silver for Iddin-Suen." Twice I have written to you. Within 3 months after they have paid the balance (and) the price of the textiles has been received, Abum-ilum must pay the balance to you. If he does not pay, he must add interest for me. Why has he not paid in accordance with his contract? Indeed, Iddin-Suen will receive 12 shekels from Turaya. Your 5 talents of copper Šalim-beli has brought into Burušhaddum.

src: 1 ma-na 12 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er sa-si-a su-en-na-da i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ma-ak-ru-a ITU na-ar-ma-ak a-sur sa ke-na-tim a-na 1 ma-na-im 2 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i-na ITU u-sa-ab li-mu-um sa qa-ti su-ka-li-a IGI su-la-ba-an IGI su-su-en6
tgt: Sasiya owes Suen-nādā 1 mina 12 shekels refined silver. He will add interest at the rate of 2 shekels per mina per month from the ḫamuštum of Makrua, month of Narmak Aššur ša kēnātim. Eponymate: The one following Sukkalliya. Witnesses: Šū-Laban, Šū-Suen.

src: 14 GU URUDU <big_gap> si-kam i-se-er tu-uh-ni-is {d}ISKUR-ba-ni i-su-u ITU.KAM a-la-na-tim a-na 4 ITU.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul a-na 1 GU-tim 3 ma-na.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab li-mu-um a-al-DUG DUMU pi-la-ah-a-a IGI DUG-a-sur IGI ISTAR-il5-su IGI ku-bi-di
tgt: Tuḫniš owes Adad-bāni 14 talents refined copper. He will pay 4 months from the month of Allānātim. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 3 mina per talent per month. Year: Āl-ṭāb s. Pilaḫāya Witnesses: Ṭāb-Aššur, Ištar-ilšu, Kubi-idī

src: 1.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI sa-du-a-su sa-bu a-na la-ma-si SA.BA 0.5 ma-na sa su-bu-ul-tim 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa ki-is-ha-nu-il5 13 GIN sa KU.BABBAR si-im TUG.HI.A-ti-su sa se-ep u-ra-ni sa a-sur-ba-ni u sal-ma-a-sur 5 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na ni-qe-su sa a-ni-nim 5 ma-na URUDU ma-si-um a-na im-ra-a SU.NIGIN 7 ri-ik-si a-na ku-lu-ma-a ap-qi-id IGI i-ku-pi-a-sur DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR IGI en-nam-a-sur DUMU sal-mi-hi-im
tgt: 1 1/2 minas silver - its excise added and shipping paid to Lamassāi, therein 1/2 mina for š, and 1/2 mina for kišĭhanuil, 13 shekels of the silver is revenues of (her!) textiles from Urāni's shipment from Aššur-bāni and Šalim-Aššur, 5 shekels silver to (her!) niqe of Anninum, 5 minas washed copper to Imraya-- in total I entrusted 7 bundles to Kulmaya. Witnesses: Ikūn-pī-Aššur s. Puzur-Ištar, Ennam-Aššur s. Šalim-aḫum.

src: 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI en-um-a-sur DUMU si-li-ISTAR is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-i-mi-ti u a-mur-ISTAR 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI a-mur-a-sur u la-qe-ep DUMU a-mur-na-hu-us is-tu ha-mus-tim sa na-ra-am-ZU u ha-na-nim 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-su-bu 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI sa-lim-a-sur DUMU a-ba is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-i-mi-ti u a-mur-ISTAR 2.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab PUZUR4.SA.TU u {d}IM-tu-kul-ti qa-ta-tum 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI du-u-du is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-li-a-lim u a-sur-{d}UTU-si 1.75 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab tu-ra-a u u-su-ra-nim qa-ta-tum 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI kur-ub-ISTAR DUMU PUZUR4.DINGIR is-tu ha-mus-tim sa {d}UTU-ba-ni u e-la-li 1.25 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR KI sa-lim-{d}IM u DINGIR-na-da is-tu sa-pa-tim sa ha-na-nim u na-ra-am-ZU 0.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-su-bu 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI {d}IM.ILLAT DUMU {d}IM-ba-ni is-tu ha-mus-tim sa li-ba-a-a u i-ku-nim 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-su-bu 2 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR a-su-mi a-mur-{d}UTU DUMU sa-li-ti da-da-num il5-qe is-tu ha-mus-tim sa la-qe-ep u am-ri-a 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI tu-li u ta-am-ri-a is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-li-is-ti-kal u su-a-nim <gap> GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-su-bu <gap> ma-na KI DINGIR-i-sar is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-li-a-lim u a-sur-{d}UTU-si a-na 6 ITU.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul <gap> GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab 1 ma-na 15.5 GIN KU.BABBAR KI PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU i-tur4-DINGIR is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-li-is-ti-kal u su-a-nim 2 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI bur-a-sur is-tu sa-pa-tim sa li-ba-a u i-ku-nim 2 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI e-na-sa is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-li-<gap>-<gap> u a-sur-SIG5 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab
tgt: Ennum-Aššur s. Ṣilli-Ištar owes 5 minas refined silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest) from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-imittī and Amur-Ištar. Amur-Aššur and Lāqēp s. a-mur-na-ḫu-uš owes 2 minas silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina) per month (as interest) from the ḫamuštum of Naram-Suen and Ḫananum. Šalim-Aššur s. Aba owes 4 minas silver. He will add 2 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest) from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-imittī and Amur-Ištar. Dudu owes 5 minas refined silver. He will add 1 3/4 shekels (per mina) per month (as interest) from the ḫamuštum of Ili-ālim and Aššur-Šamši. Kurub-Ištar s. Puzur-ilī owes 3 minas silver. He will add 1 1/4 shekels (per mina) per month (as interest) from the ḫamuštum of Šamaš-bāni and Elāli. Šalim-Adad and Ilī-nādā owe ? minas silver. He will add 1/2 shekels (per mina) per month (as interest) from the day of the full moon (?) of Ḫananum and Naram-Suen. dIM-ELLAT s. Adad-bāni owes 2/3 minas silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina) per month (as interest) from the ḫamuštum of Libbaya and Ikūnim. Duli and Tamrīya owe 4 minas silver. They will add ? shekels (per mina) per month (as interest) from the ḫamuštum of Iliš-tīkal and Šū-Anim. Puzur-Aššur s. Itūr-ilī owes 1 mina 15 1/2 shekels silver. He will add 2 shekels (per mina) per month (as interest) from the ḫamuštum of Iliš-tīkal and Šū-Anum. Bur-Aššur owes 1 mina silver. He will add 2 shekels (per mina) per month (as interest) from the šapattim of Libbaya and Ikūnim. e-na-sá owes 1 mina silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina) per month (as interest) from the ḫamuštum of ì-lí... and Aššur-damiq.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma is-ti um-me-a-ni-a a-ta-wi KU.BABBAR mi-ma la tu-se-ba-lam a-di 5 u4-me wa-ar-ka-tam te-er-ti i-la-ka-kum su-ma ma-ma-na i-sa-ba-at-ka um-ma su-ut-ma KU.BABBAR-ap a-bi4-ka la-mi-di a-lu-um li-di-ni-ma u-la-ma-ad-ka
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā: I shall negotiate with my shareholders. Do not send me any silver. Within 5 days after this (negotiation) I shall send you word. If anyone should seize you, saying: "Inform me of your father's silver!" well, when the City has judged me, then I shall inform you.

src: pi-la-ah-ISTAR a-na a-sur-e-mu-qi u i-tur4-DINGIR DUMU-e i-ku-nim is-ba-at-ni-a-ti-ma um-ma pi-la-ah-ISTAR-ma a-na a-sur-e-mu-qi u i-tur4-DINGIR-ma DUMU me-tim-a-na-ku a-bi tup-pe-e e-zi-ba-am a-ma ku-nu-ki sa a-bi-ku-nu u-di-a um-ma su-nu-ma ki-na-a ku-nu-ku sa a-bi-ni is-te-en6 tup-pu-um sa 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa ni-um tup-pu-um sa 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sal-su-um tup-pu-um sa 8 ma-na KU.BABBAR tup-pe-e sa-la-as-tu-su-nu i-si-u-su-nu-ti um-ma pi-la-ah-ISTAR-ma DUMU me-tim-ma a-na-ku la ni-ip-ta-sa-ar-su-ma tup-pu-um ha-ar-mu-um sa ku-ti-bi4-la a-sur-SIPA a-bi-a u sa-pa-e sa ki-ma a-bu-ku-nu a-bi KU.BABBAR u-sa-bi4-u tu-ka-la-a sa ki-ma tup-pu-u a-ni-u-tum a-ku-su-ni a-na a-ni-u-ti-ma be-la-nim-ma tup-pe-e tu-qa-a um-ma su-nu-ma u ni-nu DUMU u-me-tim-ni-la-ak a-na sa-na-at ni-se-e-a-ku-um um-ma pi-la-ah-ISTAR-ma is-tu ITU.KAM kan-bar-ta li-mu-um sa-ma su-ma a-na sa-na-at tup-pa-am ha-ar-ma-am sa ku-nu-uk a-sur-SIPA a-bi-a u sa-pa-e la ta-ta-ab-la-nim u-la ta-tu-ra-ma u-la ta-na-pu-sa a-na hu-bu-ul a-bi-ku-nu ta-za-za-a um-ma su-nu-ma ni-za-az IGI i-li-ba-ni DUMU i-a-a IGI i-ku-nim DUMU {d}UTU-ba-ni IGI a-sur-i-di DUMU a-mur-a-sur
tgt: Pilaḫ-Ištar seized us against Aššur-emūqī and Itūr-ilī, the sons of Ikūnum. They said: "We will stand."

src: is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim u a-gu5-za a-na 44 ha-am-sa-tim sa pu-su-ke-en6 a-na 41 ha-am-sa-tim sa zu-kur-i-li is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-SIPA u e-na-ma-nim u4-mu-su-nu a-na 47 ha-am-sa-tim sa ISTAR-pi-la-ah u id-na-a
tgt: From the ḫamuštum-week of Aššur-bēl-awātim and Aguza for 44 ḫamuštum-weeks (belonging to?) to Pūšu-kēn. For 41 ḫamuštum-weeks (belonging to?) Zukur-ilī. From the ḫamuštum-week of Aššur-rēʾī and Ennam-Anum, their terms are for 47 ḫamuštum-weeks, (belonging to?) Ištar-pilaḫ and Idnāya.

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur KISIB a-sur-ma-lik KISIB a-bu-sa-lim sa hu-bu-ul a-bu-sa-lim 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-tu ha-mus-tim sa da-da-nim u a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim a-na 6 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-bu-sa-lim
tgt: Seals: Puzur-Aššur, Aššur-mālik, Abu-šalim. Regarding Abu-šalim's debt of 1 mina refined silver. He will pay 6 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Dadānim and Aššur-bēl-awātim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina) per month.
