src: a-na a-sur-na-da u u-su-ur-sa-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma a-su-ur-ta-ak-la-ku-ma a-na u-su-ur-sa-a-sur qi-bi-ma mi-su-u sa um-ma a-ta-ma 1.8333300000000001 ma-na 7.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa su-hu-pi sa su-mi a-su-ur-ta-ak-la-ku E ka-ri-im la-ap-tu i-a-ti i-la-kam ni-si-ma SA.BA 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR ta-la-qe si-tum sa a-bi-ni u ta-ah-si-is-tam al-pu-ut-ma me-eh-ra-am a-di-na-kum me-ha-ar-ka a-mu-ur ma-la la-ap-ta-ti-ni a-ta li-qe si-tam a-na se-er qa-tim sa a-bi-ni te-eh-a-am i-nu-mi e-li-a-ni as-al-ka-ma um-ma a-na-ku-ma qa-tam sa a-bi4-ni ta-di-i lu KU.BABBAR lu TUG.HI-ti a-hi a-ta li-qe-ma qa-tam sa-li-im-tam E ka-ri-im li-li-pi-it lu-mu-un li-bi-im a-na a-bi-ni la ta-ra-si um-ma a-ta-ma qa-tam sa-lim-ta-ma a-bu-ku-nu na-di KU.BABBAR u TUG.HI.A a-sur-na-da e-zi-ba-am a-di wa-as-ba-ku-ni-ma 9 TUG.TA si-tap-kum i-bi-si-ma 11 TUG.HI.A a-na E.GAL-lim <big_gap> u-se-li-a-ma um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-na ni-ka-si is-ta-pu-ku um-ma a-ta-ma wa-as-bu-ma i-na-di u-la a ni-ka-si ta-tur4-ma 9 TUG.TA is-ta-pu-ku 7 TUG.TA ta-aq-ta-bi-a-am 2 TUG <big_gap> sa is-ti-a ta-ah-bu-lu ta-am-li-a-at qa-tim sa a-bi-ni ta-di-ma su-um-ka ta-al-ta-pa-at us-ma-at ki-ma uz-ni-im pa-ta-im ta-sa-li-a-ni u4-ma-am KU.BABBAR 10 GIN su-ma-mi-in4 ma-dum ki-mi-in4 ki-ma qa-ba-im um-ma a-ta-ma a-wi-lum i-na a-lim{ki} wa-sa-ab i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-su-ma lu ni-ta-di-ma li-bu-su la i-la-mi-nam 2 TUG sa tu-ta-e-ra-ni li-qe-ma 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-na qa-ti-ka li-is-hi-ir-ma a-se-er 7 TUG.HI.A sa a-na-ku a-di-u te-eh-a-ma 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-se-er qa-tim sa a-bi-ni si-im-ma a-li ni-na-me-ru
tgt: To Aššur-nādā and Uṣur-ša-Aššur from Aššur-taklāku; to Uṣur-ša-Aššur: Why is it that you said" "1 5/6 mina 7 1/2 shekels of silver from the stocks booked in the name of Aššur-taklāku in the colony office will accrue to me."

src: KISIB {d}UTU.DUG DUMU am-ri-a KISIB PUZUR4-{d}UTU DUMU su-nu-nu KISIB su-a-nim DUMU a-zu-za-a sa hu-bu-ul su-a-nim 0.5 ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-a-nim DUMU a-zu-za-a DAM.GAR-ru-um i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa en-nam-a-sur ITU.KAM ab sa-ra-ni li-mu-um a-sur-na-da a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab
tgt: Seals: Šamaš-tāb s. Amrīya, Puzur-Šamaš s. Šū-Nunu, Šū-Anum s. Azuza. Regarding the debt of Šū-Anum. Šū-Anum s. Azuza owes the merchant 1/2 mina 2 shekels refined silver. He will pay 10 weeks from ḫamuštum of Ennam-Aššur, month Ab šarrānē, eponymate Aššur-nādā. If he does not pay, interest will be added at the colony rate.

src: su-ma-li-bi-a-sur u {d}ISKUR.DUL is-bu-tu-ni-a-ti-ma a-wa-ti-su-nu nu-ga-me-er-ma 1.8333300000000001 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa su-ma-li-bi-a-sur a-na {d}ISKUR.DUL ha-bu-lu KU.BABBAR {d}ISKUR.DUL sa-bu tup-pu-su ha-ar-mu-um sa ki-ma {d}ISKUR.DUL a-na su-ma-li-bi-a-sur i-du-nu-ma i-du-ak 1 ma-na 1 GIN KU.BABBAR sa a-sur-SIG5 i-se-er da-da-a DUMU di-li-a {d}ISKUR.DUL il5-qe-u su-ma-li-bi-a-sur KU.BABBAR il5-qe su-ma a-sur-SIG5 a-na 1 ma-na 1 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na {d}ISKUR.DUL i-tu-ar su-ma-li-bi-a-sur KU.BABBAR u-ta-ar um-ma {d}ISKUR.DUL-ma 7.5 GU 0.66666 ma-na URUDU-ka ma-si-am en-na-su-en6 DUMU i-li-a-lim il5-qe um-ma su-ma-li-ba-a-sur-ma 5 GU LA 5 ma-na URUDU il5-qe ITU.KAM sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um su-su-en6 DUMU ba-ba-lim a-na ITU.3.KAM tup-pa-am sa si-bi-su {d}ISKUR.DUL sa 7.5 GU 0.66666 ma-na i-la-qe-ma a-na su-ma-li-bi-a-sur i-da-su su-ma tup-pa-am sa si-bi-su {d}ISKUR.DUL la il5-te-qe 3.5 GU 5.66666 ma-na URUDU <big_gap> URUDU ma-si-am hu-bu-ul {d}ISKUR.DUL a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um wa-ah-su-sa-na sa-he-er GAL i-di-ni-a-ti-ma IGI GIR sa a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in IGI a-hu-qar IGI u-sur-sa-a-sur PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU i-sa-ar-ki-id-a-sur tap-pa-i-ni
tgt: Šumma-libbi-Aššur and Adad-ṣulūlī seized us and we brought their dispute to an end: (as for) the 1 5/6 minas of silver which Šumma-libbi-Aššur owed to Adad-ṣulūlī, Adad-ṣulūlī has been satisfied with the silver; Adad-ṣulūlī's representatives will give his certified debt-note to Šumma-libbi-Aššur and it will be destroyed. (As for) the 1 mina 1 shekel of silver which Adad-damiq had as claim on Dadaya son of Tilia, Šumma-libbi-Aššur took that silver. The plenary assembly in Wahšušana gave us for these words, and we gave our testimony before the dagger of Aššur. In the presence of Ahu-waqar (and) Uṣur-ša-Aššur, Puzur-Aššur son of Išar-kitti-Aššur was our partner.

src: <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR i-na tup-pi-a ha-ar-mi-im sa a-na PUZUR4-a-sur ha-bu-la-ku-ni as-qul IGI hu-ra-sa-nim IGI a-sur-su-lu-li
tgt: [. . M]inen Silber [vo]n meiner Dop[pel]urkunde, [das] ich dem Puzuraššur [schu]dig war, [habe ich be]zahlt. [Vor Ḫ]urāṣānum, [vor A]ššurṣulūlī.

src: a-na a-la-hi-im u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi4-ma um-ma i-li-a-lim mi-su sa ti-i-ra-tim a-na ka-sa-ri-ka ta-di-nu um-ma a-ta-ma al-<gap>-<gap>-su-ma ma-ha-ra-am u-la i-mu-a a-na a-bi4-ni qi-bi-ma a-ma-kam um-ma a-ta-ma su-ma 6 GIN-ta-ma ri-de8-su su-ma la ki-a-am a-ka-la-su-ma ka-sa-ar-ka tu-di sa ka-sa-ri-ka 8 GIN KU.BABBAR ta-di-nam a-na IR sa a-bi4-ni ta-da-nam u-la ta-mu-a a-na a-sur-i-di ta-tu-a-ar-ma si-ma-tim ta-si-ma-am um-ma a-na-ku-ma ma-la sa ki-ma a-bi4-ni i-<gap> <big_gap> mu ut a la am be <big_gap> u-la <big_gap>
tgt: To Alāhum and Aššur-taklāku from Ilī-ālum: Why is it that you have given orders to your packer, saying: "I have taken the slave; but if they refuse to receive (him), then take him for our father." But there you said: "If the price is 8 shekels of silver, then take him and lead him away. If it is not like that, I shall keep him." You pointed out your packer; you then gave me 8 shekels of silver belonging to your packer; you refused to give anything to our father's slave. When you return to Aššur-idī to take decisions about me, I shall say: "Whatever my father's representatives will say, I shall refuse to ask."

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma dan-{d}a-sur-ma 12.5 ma-na 4 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa-ba-si-a DUMU i-li-is-ta-kal ha-bu-ul u4-mu-su 4 ha-am-sa-tim e-ti-qa sa-ba-su-ma KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su sa-as-qi-il5-su a-na KU.BABBAR sa is-ti en-na-su-en6 la u-se-bi4-la-ni si-mu-um a-na AN.NA u URUDU SIG5 la-su-ma u AN.NA ma-su-uh-ma a-na ITU.1.KAM-im u ITU.2.KAM a-na um-mi-a-nim ke-nim u-se-er lu a-na AN.NA lu a-na TUG-ba-ti lu a-na URUDU SIG5 KU.BABBAR 1 GIN pa-ni-a-ma sa e-pu-su is-ti a-li-ki wa-ar-ki-u-tim u-se-ba-la-kum
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Dān-Aššur: Sabasiya son of Iliš-tīkal owes 12 minas 34 shekels refined silver His term is past due 4 ḫamuštum-weeks. Seize him and make him pay the silver and its interest. As for the silver which I did not send with Enna-Suen, there are no sales for tin or fine copper and the tin is bad quality, so I released them for one or two months to a trusted investor.

src: 0.33333 ma-na 7 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er en-na-nim im-di-lu-um i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-be-lim DUMU a-na-li a-na 8 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-me-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im u-sa-ab IGI en-nam-a-sur
tgt: Ennanim owes Imdi-ilum 1/3 mina 7 shekels refined silver. He will pay 8 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Šū-Bēlim s. Anali. If he does not pay at the fulfillment of his term, he will add (interest) at the rate of the colony. Witnesses: Ennam-Aššur

src: um-ma a-li-li-ma u sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 a-sur-is-ti-kal u dan-a-sur a-na a-sur-is-ti-kal qi-bi4-ma 1 GU 5 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ki-ni 6 ku-ta-nu 2-se-na sa li-wi-tim 5 ma-na AN.NA-ak qa-tim mi-ma a-nim <gap> a-na a-bi-la nu-se-bi-il5-ka AN.NA u TUG.HI.A e-ta-lu-tam ta-ap-tur4-ma a-na ra-mi-ni-ka ta-al-te-qe 6 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR sa AN.NA-ki-ni 0.5 ma-na.TA sa TUG.HI.A i-na u4-mi-im sa tup-pa-am ta-sa-me-u KU.BABBAR a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u dan-{d}a-sur di-in su-ma a-na a-bi-la ta-di-in a-ma-kam-ma si-bi-ka su-du-ud-ma i-na KU.BABBAR-ap a-bi-la li-qe-ma a sa ki-ma ni-a-ti di-in
tgt: 65 minas tin under our seal, 6 kutānum-textiles, 2 as wrappings, 5 minas hand tin, all this we sent to Abela with you. You opened the tin and textiles on (your own) authority and you took for yourself. A 6 shekel rate silver for our tin. A 30 shekel rate for the textiles. On the day you read (this) tablet, give the silver to Pūšu-kēn and Dān-Aššur. If you already gave it to Abela, line up your witnesses there, and take it from Abela's silver, and give it to our representatives.

src: 6.5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> DUMU UR-ad-ku-bi dan-a-sur DUMU PUZUR-<gap>-<gap> i-su a-na ta-qe i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im <big_gap> si-ib-tam u-sax-ab ITU.1.KAM si-ip-e-em li-mu-um za-za-bu-um DUMU a-sur-ma-lik IGI zu-zu-bi-a DUMU ku-zal-lim IGI e-nam-a-sur DUMU a-sur-e-na
tgt: ... s. Warad-Kūbī owes Dān-Aššur s. Puzur-... 6 1/2 shekels silver. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the colony rate (1 1/2 shekels per mina per month).

src: 2 ma-na 3.5 GIN KU.BABBAR li-ti SIG5 i-se-er a-lu DAM.GAR i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-li-a 1 ma-na 1.75 GIN a-na 7 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 1 ma-na 1.75 GIN a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-me-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab <gap> ITU.1.KAM <gap> sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti si-lu-lu IGI ta-ak-ni-is IGI a-sur-ma-lik IGI {d}UTU-ba-ni
tgt: 2 Minen 3½ Seqel gutes . . . . Silber hat zu Lasten des Allu der (jeweilige) Gläubiger gut. Vom Amtstage des Ili'a wird er 1 Mine 1¾ Seqel wird er bis zum siebenten Amtstag zahlen. 1 Mine 1¾ Seqel wird er bis zum zehnten Amtstag zahlen. Wenn er nach Ablauf seiner Zahlungsfrist nicht gezahlt hat, wird er 1½ Seqel pro Mine als Zins im Monat hinzufügen. Rasur 'Monat der Falschen'; Eponymat (aus) der Hand des Ṣilūlu. Vor Takniš, vor Aššurmalik, vor Šamašbāni.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti u su-hu-bur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 a-mur-{d}UTU DUMU me-sar-GAL u kur-ub-ISTAR qi-bi-ma 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 10 ma-na AN.NA qa-tim 4 TUG su-ru-tum li-wi-tum 1 ANSE sa-la-mu-um u e-nu-UM mi-ma a-nim u-sur-sa-a-sur DUMU a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim i-ra-de8-a-ku-nu-ti su-ma u-sur-sa-a-sur a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum e-ra-ab AN.NA u TUG.HI-ti-a di-na-su-ma a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum lu-se-ri-ib-ma a-na KU.BABBAR lu-ta-er-ma KU.BABBAR i-na se-pi-su lu-ub-lam
tgt: From Aššur-imittī and Šū-Ḫubur to Pūšu-kēn, Amur-šamšī son of Mesar-rabi, and Kurub-Ištar: 2 talents 10 minas tin under seal, 10 minas hand-tin, 4 šurutum textiles, 1 black donkey and his tack--all this Uṣur-ša-Aššur son of Aššur-bēl-awātim drives to you. If Uṣur-ša-Aššur arrives bound for Purušḫattum, give the tin and textiles to him so that he may convey them to Purušḫattum and convert them to silver and bring the silver in his transport.

src: KISIB ta-ri-ku-da KISIB tar-hu-ni-a KISIB ha-pu-a-la KISIB bu-ur-ka KISIB tar-hu-la KISIB su-pu-na-ah-su KISIB ha-su-us-ma-an 2 na-ru-uq 1.5 DUG 0.5 SE-am 0.5 GIG u 3.6666600000000003 GIN 15 SE KU.BABBAR i-se-er ha-su-us-ma-an tar-hu-la u su-pu-na-ah-su a-ta-ta i-su SE-am u GIG i ha-ar-pe i-du-nu KU.BABBAR i-na me-ra-as-tim i-sa-qu-lu ha-pu-a-la u bu-ur-ka a-sa-su qa-ta-tum sal-ma-am u ke-nam i-sa-qal
tgt: Siegel des Tarikuda; Siegel des Tarḫuni'a; Siegel des Ḫabu'ala; Siegel der Burka; Siegel des Tarḫula; Siegel Šubunaḫšu; Siegel des Hašušman. Zwei Sack anderthald Krug zur Hälfte Weizen, zur Hälfte Gerste und 3⅔ Seqel 15 Korn Silber hat zu Lasten des Ḫašušman, des Tarḫula und des Šubunaḫšu Addāda gut. Den Weizen und die Gerste werden sie zur (kommenden) Erntzeit geben. Das Silber werden sie zur (nächsten) Aussaat zahlen. Ḫabu'ala und Burka, seine Frau, sind Bürge. (Betrifft) den Wohlbehaltenen und (Orts)beständigen: er wird zahlen.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-su-mi {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni um-ma a-ta-ma KU.BABBAR i-na ta-si-im-tim-ma a-na be-a-lim e-re-es i-na ba-ti-qi-ma te-er-ta-ka is-ti ba-ti-qi-im mi-su sa a-na be-a-lim ta-du-nu-su-ni a-na KU.BABBAR 1 GIN sa a-na-kam e-pu-su-su-ni mi-nam ig-mi-la-ni a-na 2 GU AN.NA 20 ku-ta-ni u 1 ANSE sa-la-ma-am sa ta-di-nu-su-ni mi-ma a-na u la ta-di-su-um-ma u su-ma i-nu-mi-su-ma 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-di-na-ku-um a-na gi5-mi-li-im ma-a <gap> ki-ma ki-<gap> su <big_gap>
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: Regarding Ilabrat-bāni about whome you wrote me, you said, "He requested for management 'ina tašimtim.'" (You sent) your message by express...with the express!? Why did you give him anything to manage? What favor has he done for me for all the silver I make him here?

src: <gap> ma-na 17.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er en-um-a-sur u sa-ap-ta-ma-ni-ki {d}UTU-a-bi4 i-su be-tu u zi-tu-su sa en-um-a-sur is-ti KU.BABBAR uk-ta-lu-u a-di KU.BABBAR i-sa-qu-lu-ni {d}UTU-a-bi4 a-na be-tim sa en-um-a-sur i-te-ru-ub-ma is-tu KU.BABBAR u-ta-ru-su-ni {d}UTU-a-bi4 i-na be-tim u-si ITU.KAM sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um si-lu-lu IGI ga-ba-zi IGI {d}UTU.DU10 IGI na-ru-um-ba-ni IGI a-bu-sa-lim
tgt: Ennam-Aššur and Šaptamaniki owe Šamaš-abī x mina(s) 17 1/2 shekels refined silver. Month: Ša kēnātim. Eponymate: Ṣilūlu. Witnesses: Kapazi, Šamaš-ṭāb, Nārum-bāni, Abu-šalim.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma la-ma-si u a-ha-ha-ma 10 GIN KU.GI sa a-na u-ta-tim sa-pa-ki-im tu-se-bi-la-ni ki-ma sa-tum a-na pa-ni-sa i-lu-ku-ni a-di-ni sa ki-ma ku-a-ti u-ta-tam u-la is-pu-ku-ma u te-er-ti-ni i-li-ka-kum u4-ma-am u-ta-tam ma-la i-sa-pu-ku-ni u za-ku-sa ni-sa-pa-ra-kum u ik-ri-ba-am sa a-na ta-as-me-tim ta-ak-ru-bu-ni a-pu-tum la ta-ma-si i-il5-tum i-ir-ti-bi i pa-ni-ka bi-lam u-ul i pa-nim-ma a-li-ki-im se-bi-lam
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Lamassī and Aḫaḫa: Now, we are writing to you for as much grain as can be acquired and for its clearance. Also the prayer which you prayed for Tašmetum?, urgent do not mašā'um. As for the goddess, bring the pectorals with you. Or send them with the first traveller.

src: 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am la-qe-pu-um a-na nu-ur-ISTAR i-di-in um-ma nu-ur-ISTAR KU.BABBAR-ap-ka i-na tu-a-ri-a u-ta-ra-kum IGI e-di-na-a IGI i-di-su-en6
tgt: Lā-qēpum gave 2 minas refined silver to Nūr-Ištar. Nūr-Ištar said, "I will return your silver at my return." Witnesses: Edinnāya, Idī-Suen.

src: KISIB en-um-a-sur DUMU su-ka-li-a KISIB a-di-da DUMU wa-ar-di-i-li KISIB a-sur-DU10 DUMU kar-wa-a-a KISIB lu-zi-na DUMU a-sur-ba-ni KISIB ma-nu-ki-e-ni-a DUMU i-sar-ha-ri-im KISIB PUZUR4-a-na DUMU em-qi-im KISIB i-ku-pi-a DUMU be-la-a-sur KISIB be-lum-ba-ni DUMU a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim KISIB ah-sa-lim DUMU su-a-sur 10 GU URUDU SIG5 hu-bu-ul en-na-nim DUMU a-zu-a 8.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa li-bi su-be-lim DUMU a-gu5-a 16 ma-na KU.BABBAR u 80 {TUG}su-ul-hi-e sa da-na-a u ku-lu-mi-im sa a-sur-SIPA is-bu-tu me-er-u li-ba-a-a a-na me-er-e a-sur-SIPA la i-tu-ru-u en-um-a-sur a-di-du-um a-sur-DU10 lu-zi-na ma-nu-ki-e-ni-a i-ku-pi-a PUZUR4-a-na be-lum-ba-ni u ah-sa-lim a-wi-lu a-ni-u-tum da-a-nu ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa ku-nu-uk da-a-ni
tgt: Seals of Ennum-Aššur s. Sukkallīya, Adida s. Warad-ilī, Aššur-ṭāb s. Qarwaya, Luzina s. Aššur-bāni, Mannum-kī-ēnīya s. Išar-Ḫarim, Puzur-Anna s. Emqum, Ikuppiya s. Bēl-Aššur, Bēlum-bāni s. Aššur-bēl-awātim, Aḫ-šalim s. Šū-Aššur. As for the 10 talents fine copper the debt of Ennānum s. Azua, 8 1/2 minas silver which is owed by Šū-Bēlum s. Agua, 16 minas silver and 80 šuḫum textiles from Danaya and Kulumum which Aššur-rē'ī seized, the sons of Libbaya will not return to the sons of Aššur-rē'ī. Ennum-Aššur, Adīdum, Aššur-ṭāb, Luzina, Mannum-kī-enīya, Ikuppiya, Puzur-Anna, Bēlum-bāni and Aḫ-šalim: these were the judges of these memoranda. Copy of the sealed tablet with the seals of the judges.

src: KISIB a-ba KISIB i-di-{d}IM KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur sa hu-bu-ul PUZUR4-a-sur 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er PUZUR4-a-sur a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa la-qe-ep u na-ab-su-en6 1.5 GIN.TA a ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul PUZUR4-a-sur
tgt: Seals: Aba, Idī-Adad, Puzur-Aššur. Regarding the debt of Puzur-Aššur. Puzur-Aššur owes Aššur-rēʾī 2 minas refined silver. From the ḫamuštum of Lāqēp and Nāb-Suen, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest).

src: <big_gap> is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa da-da-nim u a-su 3.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR is-ti <gap>-<gap> is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa la-qe-ep u <big_gap> 1.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab 2 ma-na is-ti en-nam-a-sur DUMU si-li-ISTAR is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa sa-lim-a-sur u en-na-nim 1.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab 3 ma-na 9 GIN is-ti zi-kur-i-li is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku u a-sur-DU10 1.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab <gap> ma-na is-ti a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5 DUMU e-ra-di is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa LUGAL-su-en u kur-ub-ISTAR 1.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab 2 ma-na 7.5 GIN is-ti a-bu-sa-lim DUMU a-ta-a is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa da-da-nim u a-su 1.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab 1 ma-na is-ti a-mur-a-sur DUMU ili5-ba-ni is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa LUGAL-su-en6 u kur-ub-ISTAR 2 GIN.TA u-sa-ab 4 ma-na is-ti la-qe-ep DUMU a-mu-ur-na-hu-us is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-la-hi-im u kur-ub-ISTAR <gap>-0.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab <gap> ma-na <gap> bi-<big_gap>
tgt: Ennam-Aššur s. Ṣilli-Ištar owes 2 minas. He will add 1 1/2 shekels from the ḫamuštum of Šalim-Aššur and Ennanim.. Zikur-ilī owes 3 minas 9 shekels. He will add 1 1/2 shekels from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-taklāku and Aššur-ṭāb. Aššur-mutabbil s. Eradi owes ? minas. He will add 1 1/2 shekels from the ḫamuštum of Šarrum-Suen and Kurub-Ištar. Abu-šalim s. a-tá-a owes 2 minas 7 1/2 shekels. He will add 1 1/2 shekels from the ḫamuštum of Dadānim and Ašu. Amur-Aššur s. Ilī-bāni owes 1 mina. He will add two shekels from the ḫamuštum of Šar-Suen and Kurub-Ištar. Lāqēp s. a-mu-ur-na-ḫu-uš owes 4 minas. He will add x+1/2 shekel from the ḫamuštum of Al-aḫim and Kurub-Ištar.

src: um-ma {d}a-sur-ma-lik-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 ku-za-zi-a {d}a-sur-i-di qi-bi-ma ta-as-pu-ra-nim um-ma a-tu-nu-ma KU.BABBAR sa PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU {d}a-sur-ma-lik a-hu-su a-na 40 u4-mi-im e-pu-la-ni KU.BABBAR sal-ma-am i-na a-lim{ki} i-sa-qa-lam ni-is-ha-ti-su u sa-du-a-su sa-as-qi-la-su en-na-ma-na-am as-al-ma um-ma su-ut-ma KU.BABBAR a-na si-ib-tim na-di a-na-ku si-ba-su ha-as-ha-ku E-be-ti as-am-ma qa-ti-a u-ta-ri 8 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er <gap> a-sur-i-di DUMU su-hu-bu-ur i-su u4-mu-su sa-na-at e-ta-at-qu sa-ab-ta-su-ma <gap> <big_gap><gap>-<gap> a-na <big_gap><big_gap><gap> <gap>-ku-ni <big_gap><big_gap> KU.BABBAR sa <gap> <big_gap><big_gap> <gap>-a-sur 2 <gap> <big_gap><big_gap> sa a-sur <big_gap><gap> <gap>-su-ni a-na i-ku-pi-a-sur e-pu-ul zu-ku-a is-ti KU.BABBAR li-li-ik a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma E-tam ku-a-am sa a-na a-sur-DU10 DUMU ku-da-di a-na pu-uh-im ni-di-nu a-ni E-tam i-na-di-u te-er-ta-ka a-ni-tam la a-ni-tam li-li-kam a-sur-i-di tup-pi u ta-ad-mi-iq-ti-ni ba-ab KU.BABBAR a e-ri-is-ma li-ta-ma-ad a-su-mi KU.BABBAR la tu-se-bi4-la-ni li-bi-i la-am-na-kum u i-na se-er a-sur-i-di e-na-ka li-ta-la-ka
tgt: From Aššur-mālik to Pūšu-kēn, Kuzāziya, and Aššur-idī: You wrote me. You said, "The silver of Puzur-Ištar son of Aššur-mālik, which his brother was to pay within 40 days, he will pay all the silver in the city. Have him pay his excise tax and shipping charges." I questioned Ennamānum and he said, "The silver is deposited for interest." As for me, I need its interest. I purchased the houses and I will return my share(?). Aššur-idī son of Šū-Ḫubur owes (me) 8 minas of silver. His credit term is one year past due. Seize him and ... ... to ... to you (sg.) ... silver of ... PN ... of Aššur ... I paid to Ikūn-pī-(ya?/Aššur?) ..., which ... to him. Let Zukua go with the silver. To Pūšu-kēn: Your house, which we sold to Aššur-ṭāb son of Matāti as a replacement(?), now they have abandoned the house. Let your message come, concerning whether to (do) this or not. Request tablets and our yield of Aššur-idī at my departure (at the gate of my journey!) and study them carefully. Because you did not send the silver, you have dissapointed me. Now, keep your eye constantly on Aššur-idī.

src: um-ma su-hu-bur a-sur-ba-ni u sa-lim-a-sur a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma 30 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI u-ra-ni ub-lam SA.BA 27 TUG SIG5 su-ur-bu-i-tum KU.BI 3.33333 ma-na 1.66666 GIN 63 {TUG}ta-nu KU.BI 6 ma-na 1.3333300000000001 GIN SU.NIGIN 90 ku-ta-nu KU.BI 9.33333 ma-na 3 GIN 15 ma-na AN.NA qa-tim 14 GIN.TA KU.BI 1 ma-na 4.33333 GIN 2 ANSE sa-la-mu KU.BI 1 ma-na 14 GIN 15 GIN u-kul-ta-as-nu 12.66666 GIN u-nu-su-nu 0.33333 ma-na 1.5 GIN te-su-be 4 GIN qa-qa-da-at 2 su-ha-ri-ka e-mu-du 6 GIN wa-si-tum 3.666 sa sa-e-tim 45 GIN i-na i-si-ra-tim im-ti a-se-er 10 ma-na URUDU pa-ni-im sa i-lu-a sa li-bi4-su 15.5 GIN KU.BABBAR nu-si-ib-sum a-na 7.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa a-na a-sur-i-mi-ti ni-is-qu-lu 0.66666 ma-na si-ib-tam nu-si-ib a-na 6 GU URUDU sa si-im E-ti sa a-bu-um-DINGIR 30 ma-na si-ib-tam nu-si-ib 1.5 ma-na.TA KU.BI 4.33333 ma-na 2.83333 ma-na a-na E su-ti-a ni-is-qul tup-pa-am sa hu-bu-li-ka ni-il5-qe-am 0.83333 ma-na a-na tu-pe-zi 1.66666 GIN a qa-nu-e u ag-ri a zi-a-ri-im 1 TUG sa a-sur-ba-ni 1 TUG sa sa-lim-a-sur mi-ma a-nim u-ra-ni i-ra-de8-a-ku-um
tgt: From Šū-Ḫubur, A Urani brought 30 minas silver, its excise tax added. Thereof, 27 fine šurbuitum-textiles, their price 3 minas 21 2/3 shekels, 63 kutānum-textiles, their price 6 minas 1 1/3 shekels, total 90 kutnum-textiles, their price 9 minas 23 shekels, (then) 15 minas 'hand-tin,' their price at 14 shekels (per shekel of silver) (was) 1 minas 4 1/3 shekels, 2 black donkeys, their price 1 mina 14 shekels, 15 shekels (silver?) for their feed, 12 2/3 shekels for their gear, 21 1/2 shekels add 'added expenses,' 4 shekels for their head-tax--they levied that on your "servant," 6 shekels the exit tax, 3 2/3 (shekels silver) for 'saetum,' 45 shekels from the tithe he 'set.' In addition to the 10 minas previous copper from Iluwa, which is 'on his account,' 15 1/2 shekels silver we increased to him. As for the 7 1/3 minas silver which we paid out to Aššur-imittī, 2/3 minas interest we added. As for the 6 talents of copper which were the price of the houses of Abum-ilī, we added 30 minas (copper) interest. At a 1 1/2 mina rate, their price (in silver) is 4 2/3 minas. We paid 4 minas 22 5/6 shekels for the house of Sutiya. We took the tablet of your debt. 5/6 minas to Tupezi. X shekels for the reeds? and (hire?) for Ziarim, 1 textile belonging to Aššur-bāni, 1 textiles belonging to Šalim-Aššur, all this Urani brings to you.

src: <gap> <big_gap> lu ku-nu-um <big_gap> lu DAM.GAR a-na ku-nu-ti i-da-na-ku-nu-ti a-se-er a-bi-ni-ma se-bi-la-nim ki-ma su-wa-a la i-ba-su u a-na-ku i-na ba-ab a-bu-lim la a-ba-as 30 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa bu-si-a u-mu-su 4 ITU.KAM e-ta-at-qu 6 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim DUMU su-a-nim i-na e-ra-bi4-su a-na ka-ni-is 5 ITU.1.KAM i-la-ak-ma KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal tup-pu-su ha-ar-ma-am u-ka-al 12 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa PUZUR4-{d}ISKUR a si-ib-tim i-la-ak ma-la ta-le-e-u sa-di-na-su KU.BABBAR-pi la i-ru-a-aq 11 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na <big_gap> na-ad-a-ku u <gap> <big_gap> lu me-eh-ra-am sa tup-pe ha-ru-mu-tim <big_gap> lu sa-ha-ar-<gap> <big_gap> a-hu-a a-tu-nu <big_gap> <gap> be-li-a se-um u-la sa-pi-iq <big_gap> <gap>-u-ma la-su su-ma i-na {d}UTU-si tup-pi ta-sa-me-a-ni ma-la te-er-ti-a la tu-sa-as-hi-ra a-mi-sa-am ar-hi-is la ta-li-ka-nim <big_gap> u-si-am a-pu-tum ih-da
tgt: and yours, ..., and the merchant, to you I will give to you. Send it (instead?) to our father. Because of Šū-Aya(?) there is none. Also, I myself, I must not be shamed at the city gate. 30 minas silver belonging to Bušiya, its term 4 months, has passed. As for the 6 minas 10 shekels silver (owed by) Aššur-bēl-awātum s. Šū-Anum at his arrival in Kanesh, five month will come and he will pay. I hold his sealed tablet. Cause him to give as much as you are able.

{TUG}ku-ta-ni 7.5 GIN LA 6.5 SE KU.KI u 5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-di-in-ni-a-ti si-ti {TUG}ku-ta-ni-ka 17 TUG u 1 TUG su-ru-um KU.BABBAR-ap-su-nu 0.33333 ma-na.TA u 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa su-ri-im 5.83333 ma-na si-ti AN.NA-ki-ka 40 ma-na LA 10 GIN KU.BABBAR-ap-su 5 ma-na lu sa si-ti {TUG}ku-ta-ni u su-ri-im lu sa si-ti AN.NA-ki-ka 10.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i li-bi4 i-li-as-ra-ni ta-di-in tup-pu-su sa 10.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR u a-ha-ma sa 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR la-pi-it ITU.1.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um su-da-a DUMU e-na-nim 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab 5 ANSE.HI.A sa se-ep i-li-as-ra-ni me-tu
tgt: To Šalim-aḫum from Lā-qēpum and Ili-ālum: They took 4 1/4 kutānum-textiles and a šurum-textile from the 6 1/2 talents tin under seals 20 šurum-textiles together with wrappings, 85 kutānum-textiles which you gave to Ilī-ašranni. They refunded 2 shekels silver. The palace took 8 kutānum textiles as your tithe. Then you balanced 2 shekels silver. They took 1 šurum textile for the remainder of your textiles-72 3/4 They repaid 3 shekels silver. The remainder of your From your 6 1/2 talents tin, they took 12 minas tin as excise. Losses were 9 2/3 minas. Ilabrat-bāni took 6 1/3 minas tin. He is not here. (Everything?) from the 50 minas 5 shekels hand tin, 4 silas high quality oil, 1/3 minas tin and 5 shekels silver which you sent to Abitipan is exhausted. We balanced 9 minas tin to Ilī-ašranni. The remainder of your tin is 5 talents 53 minas tin. Thereof, 2 talents 59 minas, at a 7 shekel rate, 20 kutānum-textiles at 1/2 mina each, 10 šurum-textiles at 10 shekels each--the total of your silver: 38 minas 4 1/4 shekels, he (Ilī-ašranni) entrusted to Puzur-Anna s. Elāli. Thereof, he will pay 28 minas in 50 10 minas 4 1/4 shekels he will pay in 45 2 talents 14 minas 10 shekels tin, at a 7 shekel rate, 20 Their terms are the month of narmak Aššur ša kēnātim, the eponym year of Šudāyā s. Ennānum (REL 82 III). He gave 8 kutānum-textiles and 3 šurum-textiles to us. The palace took for purchases (tithe) 5 very fine kutānum-textiles and we deposited 1 2/3 minas in the accounts. In exchange for 2 textiles he (Ilī-ašranni) gave us 7 1/2 shekels less 6 1/2 grains gold and 5 shekels silver. The remainder of your Their (the kutānum textiles) value in silver at 1/3 mina silver each, and with 10 shekels silver each for the šurum-textiles, is 5 5/6 minas silver. The remainder of your tin is 39 minas 50 shekels. Its value in silver is 5 minas. That of the remainder of your kutānum-textiles, your šurum-textiles, and of the remainder of your tin, 10 5/6 minas silver is placed on the debit of Ilī-išranni. It's tablet stating 10 1/3 minas silver and separately of 1/2 mina silver is written. Month of Kuzalli, eponym year of Šudāyā son of Ennānum (REL 82 X). He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Five donkeys of Ili-ašranni's transport died.

src: KISIB ir-ma-a-sur DUMU ni-de8-ba-ni KISIB i-ku-pi-a-sur DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR KISIB bu-sa-nim DUMU PUZUR4-su-en6 1 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er bu-sa-nim DUMU PUZUR4-su-en6 {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-na-a u a-sur-ma-lik ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um a-sur-i-di DUMU su-li a-na 25 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i ITU.KAM u-sa-ab
tgt: Seals of: Irma-Aššur s. Nide-bānī, Ikūppī-Aššur s. Puzur-Ištar, Buzānum s. Puzur-Suen. Buṣānim s. Puzur-Suen owes Adad-ṣulūlī 1 mina 4 shekels refined silver. He will pay 25 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Innāya and Aššur-mālik, month Kuzalli, eponymate Aššur-idī s. Šuli. If he does not pay, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest).

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU su-en-na-da KISIB sa-lim-a-sur DUMU i-su-rik13 KISIB a-sur-ma-lik DUMU a-sur-ba-ni KISIB a-sur-na-da sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-na-da DUMU su-{d}EN.LIL 13 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-na-da a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-li-is-ti-kal u kur-ub-ISTAR 1.25 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab KU.BABBAR a-su-mi a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku a-hi-su ta-ah-si-is-tum10 a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-na-da DUMU su-{d}EN.LIL
tgt: Seals: Puzur-Aššur s. Suen-nādā, Šalim-Aššur s. Issu-rīk, Aššur-mālik s. Aššur-bāni, Aššur-nādā. Regarding the debt of Aššur-nādā s. Šū-Enlil. Aššur-nādā owes Aššur-rēʾī 13 minas refined silver. From the ḫamuštum of Iliš-tikal and Kurub-Ištar, he will add 1 1/4 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: 0.66666 GIN 15 SE KU.BABBAR a-na gu5-ba-ab-tim sa a-ni-qi sa a-na-ah-ISTAR tu-ka-i-lu as-qul 2 GIN KU.BABBAR i-na tap-hi-ri-im sa be-lim E a-la-hi-im ni-a-im as-qul
tgt: ⅔ Seqel 15 Korn Silber habe ich der gubabtum-Priesterin als (Betrag) für die Ringe, die sie dem (=für) Aḫištar unter Beschlagnahme gehalten hat. 2 Seqel Silber von dem Gut (?) des Bēl habe ich im (?) Hause unseres Alâḫum bezahlt.

src: um-ma a-sur-na-da a-na si-sa-ah-su-sar qi-bi4-ma a sa as-pu-ra-ki-ni um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-re-es15 da-as-e a-sa-pa-ra-ki-ma ta-li-ki-im li-bi4-ki la tu-la-mi-ni ku-su-um is-ni-iq-ni-a-ti-ma u bu-la-ti-im sa a-da-gu5-lu-ni a-na ba-ab-tim i-tu-ar-ma a si-a-ti la as-pu-ra-ki mi-su sa um-ma a-ti-ma u-la al-te-e bu-la-ti sa qa-ti is-bu-tu-ni e-su-ma is-ba-at ma-du ha-la-aq a-na ku-na-na-mi-it e-ra-ab-ma sa la-qa-e a-la-qe-a-ma i-wa-sa-i-a a-sa-pa-ra-ki-im a-se-ri-a ta-li-ki-im wa-di a li-ti-a u-la i-ta-hi-i su-ma i-la-kam ka-su-um la tu-sa-bi4-i-ma la ta-da-su-um u su-ma su-ha-ar-tum e-ri-is-ki ki-a-ma u-se-ri-su a-sar li-bi4-su li-it-ru-su
tgt: From Aššur-nādā to Šišahšušar: As to the fact that I wrote to you, saying: "At the beginning of spring I shall write to you, so you can come here"-- do not be angry at me! The cold weather caught up with us, and consequently the capital that I was expecting reverted to outstanding claims, and that is the reason I did not write to you. Why do you say: "I cannot manage"? The capital that I could lay my hands on-- very little could be had, much has been lost. When I arrive at Kunanamit I shall take what there is to take, and as soon as I leave again I shall write to you so you can come to me. As you know, my funds he must not touch. If he comes, do not look the other way and do not give it to him. But if he asks you for the girl, then let him take Sarna and his children where he wants.

src: KISIB sa-lim-a-sur DUMU i-su-rik13 KISIB a-mur-{d}UTU DUMU sa-li-ti KISIB a-sur-ma-lik DUMU a-sur-ba-ni KISIB li-ba-a-a DUMU u-zu-a sa 1 GU 16 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er li-ba-a-a a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa MAR.TU-ba-ni u i-ku-nim a-na 25 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im TA a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sax-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul li-ba-a-a DUMU u-zu-a
tgt: Seals of Šalim-Aššur s. Issu-rīk, Amur-Šamaš s. Zalidi, Aššur-mālik s. Aššur-bāni, Libbaya s. Uzuwa Libbaya owes Aššur-rēʾī 1 bilat 16 minas refined silver. He will pay twenty five weeks from the ḫamuštum of Amurrum-bāni and Ikūnim.

<gap> GIN KU.BABBAR ta-di-nam um-ma a-ta-ma a-la-ak-ma sa 10 ma-na u-sa-as-qa-al-ma u-se-ba-la-kum ta-al-qe mi-su-um la tu-se-bi-lam i li-bi-ka-ma mi-ma a-nim sa se-pi-ka pa-ni-tim 11.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR en-nam-a-sur DUMU {d}EN.ZU-na-da e-hi-ib-lam u4-mu-su ma-di-is i-ti-qu-ma i-nu-mi ta-li-ka-ni um-ma a-ta-ma a-wi-lum gi-mi-lam ha-bu-la-kum su-ma mi-ma i-la-qe-ma i-ga-mi-la-ni li-iq-a-am su-ma la ki-a-am si-ib-tam ma-la ta-al-qe-u se-bi-lam su-ma um-ma a-ta-ma mi-ma la al-qe su-up-ra-ma a-wi-lam la-as-e KU.BABBAR-pi sa is-ti zu-zu is-tu ma-li-su u4-me-e tal-qe-u mi-su-um la tu-se-bi-lam i-na sa <gap>-<gap>-li-a TUG.HI-ti-a <big_gap> i-na <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap>
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn, Innāya, and Iliya from Šū-Kūbum; to Innāya To Innāya: When you came as You said, "I have arrived being stretched thin." You said, "Let me go and see my copies in Kanesh and inspect both mine and Aššur-bāni's šēpum and write you a detailed message. None of your property will be lost." Set out(?) so that according to the letter which you wrote me, which I hold, the losses, the excise-tax, the tithe which the palace took, and that which you placed on the merchants are credited (to me) and you send the remainder of the textiles, 25 1/2 black textiles. You wrote me. You said, "Puzur-Suen and Šū-Suen brought 15 1/2 black textiles to Waḫšušana." To this day I have been continually writing you, yet you have not responded a word. Previously, hardly had I myself seized Šū-Suen here, when you wrote me. You said, "I will receive the silver from Puzur-Suen and send it to you." silver ... my share ... my share ... I myself brough the silver to you ... you owe As for you, to whom will you pay the silver? From the four donkeys you wrote me (in your tablet), "1 donkey died. Three are standing." Their price is your responsibility, so from the 25 minas tin of my debt, which until Burallim therein, the matter of 15 minas x shekels of silver you gave me. You said, "I will go and I will have that 10 minas (of silver) paid out and I will send it to you." You recieved it. Why did you not send it? You owe all this: 11 2/3 minas of silver from your previous šēpum. Ennam-Aššur son of Suen-nādā owes a debt to me. His term is far past due but when you went (to him), you said, "The man owes me a favor. If he receives anything, then take it as a favor to me." If it is not so, send as much silver as you can obtain. If you said, "I didn't receive anything," send a message so that I may sue the man. My silver, which you took from Zuzu after his term passed, why have you not sent it? from the (matter?) ... my textiles ... in ...
