tgt: Ennam-Aššur son of Šū-Aššur brought 30 minas silver, its excise added, its transport tariff paid, in totla 31 minas 45 shekels. Aššur-mālik son of Erraya brought you 20 mians silver, its excise added, its transport tarrif paid, in total 20 minas 10 shekels silver. 30 minas silver, its excise added, its transport tarriff paid, and 2 minas separately the silver exchanged for the 6 kutānum textiles of Dān-Aššur ... your silver ... (Dān-Aššur brought to you)

src: um-ma im-di-lum-ma a-na PUZUR4-a-sur qi-bi4-ma 20 ma-na.TA e-mu-du a-su-mi ar-ni-ka us-ka-i-ma us-ka-in a-ru-tum sa-ak-na-at-ma pa-ta-ra-am la i-mu-u <gap> <gap>-e-ka u-sa-di-nu KU.BABBAR as-ta-qal a-na 10 u4-me e-lu-tum e-ra-ba-am a-ma-kam u-za-ka lu pa-ti-at i-hi-id-ma KU.BABBAR AN.NA-ak qa-tim sa-ak-si-dam
tgt: Keep your ears open.

src: 12 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er en-nam-a-sur DUMU sa-lim-a-hu-um u su-a-nim DUMU ba-zi-a a-sur-SIPA i-su 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-a a-sur-SIPA i-su 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-<big_gap> a-sur-SIPA i-su SU.NIGIN 23 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um is-tu ha-mus-tim a-na 3 sa-na-at u 3 ITU.KAM i-sa-qu-lu li-mu-um su-ISTAR DUMU i-ku-nim su-ma i-na u4-mi-su-nu ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-lu 1 ma-na-um 15 GIN-at si-ib-tam u-su-bu tup-pu-e ha-ru-mu-tim E a-gi5-a i-ba-si-u se-bu-<big_gap> ni <gap> <big_gap> u a-<gap> <big_gap>
tgt: Ennam-Aššur s. Šalim-aḫum and Šū-Anum s. Bazia owe Aššur-rēʾī 12 minas refined silver. ...-a owes Aššur-rēʾī 6 minas refined silver. A-... owes Aššur-rēʾī 5 minas refined silver. Altogether they will pay 23 minas refined silver 3 years and 3 months after the ḫamuštum [omitted]. Eponymate: Šū-Ištar s. Ikūnum. If they do not pay at the fulfimment of their terms, they will add 15 shekels per mina (per year?) as interest. The sealed tablets are in the house of Agiya.

src: 23.5 ma-na 3 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er i-ku-nim a-sur-i-mi-ti i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni u i-ku-nim a-na 40 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.1.KAM a-la-na-tim li-mu-um su-ka-li-a IGI a-sur-SIPA IGI a-zu-na-a IGI a-sur-ma-lik
tgt: Ikūnim owes Aššur-imittī 23 1/2 minas 3 shekels refined silver. He will pay 40 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Amurrum-bāni and Ikūnim. If he does not pay at the fulfillment of his term, he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Month: Allānātim Eponymate: Sukkallīya Witnesses: Aššur-rēʾī, Azunāya, Aššur-mālik.

src: a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma um-ma en-na-nu-ma a-sur-ne-me-di me-ra-ka a-na ki-di-im it-ru-du-ma is-tu 20 SILA se-im i-na E-be-ti-ni at-ru-a-su-ma a-na-ku u-sa-qal-ma la-ma-sa a-ma-ma a-ni-na e-ba-ar-ka sa-i-il5 su-ma a-hi a-ta a-wi-il5 gi5-mi-li-im a-na-ku gi5-im-la-ni 1 TUG sa a-di-na-ku-ni KU.BABBAR-ap-su i pa-ni-u-ti-ma se-bi-lam
tgt: To Aššur-nādā from Ennānum: They sent Aššur-nēmedi, your son, into the countryside, but I fetched him back and it is I who personally feed him 20 Ask Lamašša there (or) Annina your friend. My dear brother, I am a man capable of doing favours. Now do The one textile which I gave you, send me the proceeds from its sale as soon as possible.

src: <gap> ku-ta-ni u 19.5 ma-na AN.NA i-na e-ra-ab ILLAT-tim a-na a-sur-i-mi-ti a-da-an-ma 13 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-na e-ra-bi-su-ma is-tu bu-ru-us-ha-dum u-se-ba-lam AN.NA u TUG-ba-tu is-tu ka-ni-is a-di bu-ru-us-ha-dum a-su-mi pu-su-ke-en6 eq-lam e-ti-iq KU.BABBAR is-tu bu-ru-us-ha-dum a-di ka-ni-is a-su-mi a-sur-i-mi-ti eq-lam e-ti-iq a-la-hu-um u im-di-lum a-wa-ti-su-nu ig-mu-ru
tgt: I gave x Tin and textiles (will go?) from Kanesh to Purušḫattum. Concerning Pūšu-kēn, he has gone overland. The silver (will go?) from Purušḫattum to Kanesh. Concerning Aššur-imittī, he has gone overland. Al-aḫum and Imdī-ilum resolved their matter.

src: 4.5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er ha-li-it-ka DUMU a-ra-wa-an-<gap> la-ma-si ti-su a-na ITU.3.KAM i-sa-qal ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-DINGIR li-mu-um sa qa-ti su-{d}MUS IGI a-sur-la-ma-si IGI u-zu-a IGI i-na-ar IGI ha-pi-a-ah-su
tgt: Ḫalitka s. a-ra-wa-an- owes Lamassī 4 1/2 shekels silver within 3 months. Month: Maḫur-ilī Year: the year after Šū-Niraḫ Witnesses: Aššur-lamassī, Uzuwa, Inar, Ḫappi-aḫšu

src: um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma a-sur-dan u en-um-a-sur-ma a-na ISTAR-pi-la-ah qi-bi4-ma 1.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa a-ba-tum a-na pu-su-ke-en6 ub-la-ni KU pu-su-ke-en6 i-di-ni-a-ti-ma SA.BA 0.33333 ma-na 6.83333 GIN KU a-na ni-pi-il5-ti-ka a-na i-di-a-bi-im ni-is-qul 14 GIN KU a-na ANSE ni-is-qul 6 GIN KU a-ti-ib-nim a-na en-um-a-sur a-di-in a-ma-kam lu-ba-li-ta-kum si-ti KU 0.5 ma-na 8.33333 GIN is-ti pu-su-ke-en6 i-ba-si AN.NA a-na en-um-a-sur i-di-a-bu-um u-la i-di-in AN.NA ni-la-qe-ma is-ti wa-ar-ki-u-tim nu-se-ba-la-kum
tgt: From Pūšu-kēn, Aššur-dān and Ennum-Aššur to Ištar-pilaḫ: Pūšu-kēn gave us the 1 1/2 minas silver which Abatum brought to him and thereof, we weighed out 26 5/6 shekels silver to Iddin-abum for your payment. We paid 14 shekels silver for the donkey. We weighed out 6 shekels silver (tibnim) to Ennum-Aššur. There, let him pay you in full. The remainder of your silver, 38 1/3 shekels, is with Pūšu-kēn. Iddin-abum did not give any tin to Ennum-Aššur. We will take the tin and send it to you with the next (caravan).

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma dan-a-sur-ma 5 ANSE.HI.A sa-la-me dam-qu-tim sa a-na bi4-il5-tim da-nu-ni u u-nu-su-nu is-ti ku-si-a se-ri-a-ma lu URUDU 10 ma-na lu ka-su-uh-ta-il5 sa e-pu-su i-na pa-ni-a la-bu-kam-ma a-di a-ma-kam wa-as-ba-ti-ni la-ak-su-da-ka a-bi a-ta ANSE.HI.A da-mi-iq-ma se-ri-am sa-du-u da-nu su-ma 2 ANSE.HI.A a-sur-e-mu-qi u en-um-a-sur e-ri-su-ka si-im-su-nu ki-ma u-bu-lu-ni gu5-mu-ur-ma ANSE.HI.A wa-se-er-su-nu-ma URUDU a-na-ku a-sa-qal
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Dān-Aššur: Send out 5 good black donkeys which are strong enough for carriage and their gear with Kuṣiya so that I can send ahead of me both the 10 minas copper and k. which I will make so I can reach you while you are still staying there. My dear father, send me healthy donkeys. The mountains are difficult. If Aššur-emūqī and Ennum-Aššur ask you for two donkeys, determine their prices as much as they are worth and release the donkeys to them and I will pay the copper myself.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 24 TUG.HI.A su-ru-tum 5 {TUG}ku-ta-nu sa na-ru-qi-a <big_gap> 12 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 11 TUG su-ru-tum 3 TUG ra-qa-tum 10 ma-na AN.NA 2 {TUG}si-li-ip-ki-u sa a-sur-na-da 11 TUG su-ru-tum 2 {TUG}ta-ku-us-ta-u 5 TUG ra-qa-tum sa DAM.GAR 8 {TUG}ku-ta-nu sa su-{d}ISKUR 6 {TUG}ku-ta-nu sa i-li-a-lim 3-<gap> <gap> <big_gap> <gap>-nu sa ik-ri-bi4 sa a-sur 3 {TUG}ku-ta-nu sa ik-ri-bi4 sa {d}ISKUR u {d}NIN.SUBUR 1 TUG ra-qa-tum sa ik-ri-bi4 sa {d}NIN.SUBUR 2 {TUG}ku-ta-nu sa LUGAL-{d}ISKUR 1 {TUG}ku-ta-nu-um sa a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku 2 {TUG}ku-ta-nu sa su-ku-bi4-im SU.NIGIN TUG.HI.A 1 me-at 10 TUG SA.BA 42 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 11 {TUG}ta-ku-us-ta-u 11 TUG ra-qa-tum qa-du-um si-li-ip-ke-en6 15 ma-na AN.NA sa {d}a-sur-i-di 5.83333 ma-na 4 GIN AN.NA sa a-sur-na-da 5 ma-na AN.NA sa DAM.GAR 3 ma-na LA 11 GIN AN.NA sa su-{d}ISKUR 0.33333 ma-na LA 3 GIN sa i-li-a-lim AN.NA sa qa-tim 30.66666 ma-na 6 ANSE sa-la-mu u 6 GU 8 ma-na a-wi-tum IGI a-zu-wa IGI i-li-da-lim
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā: 2 talents 10 minas tin under seal, 24 black textiles, 5 kutānum-textiles for my sack, 12 kutānum-textiles, 11 black textiles, 3 'thin' textiles, 10 minas tin, 2 ṣilipkiʾum-textiles belonging to Aššur-nādā, 11 black textiles, 2 takkuštāʾum-textiles, 5 'thin' textiles belonging to the merchant, 8 kutānum-textiles beloning to Šū-Adad, 6 kutānum-textiles belonging to Ilī-ālum 3+ kutānum-textiles from the ikrībū-fund of Aššur, the kutānum-textiles of the ikrībū-funds of Adad and Ilabrat, 1'thin' textile belonging to Ilabrat, 2 kutānum-textiles belonging to Šar-Adad, 1 kutānum-textile belongint to Aššur-taklāku, a? kutānum-textile belonging to Šū-Kūbum--Total 110 textiles, therein 42 kutānum-textiles, 11 takuštāʾum texitles, 11 'thin' textiles together with šilipkēn textiles, 15 minas tin from Aššur-idī, 5 minas 54 shekels tin belonging to Aššur-nādā, 5 minas tin belonging to the merchant, 2 minas 49 shekels tin belonging to Šū-Adad, 27 shekels belonging to Ilī-ālum, in total hand tin in 30 2/3 minas, 6 black donkeys, -- 6 talents 8 minas the awītum-assessment. Witnesses: Azuwa, Ilī-ālum.

src: 3 0.5 ma-na URUDU SIG5 i-se-er su-ka-lim i-li-a-lim i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-di-ISTAR a-na ITU.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1 0.33333 GIN.TA si-ib-tam a-na 1 ma-na i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab
tgt: Sukkallum owes 1/2 mina good cooper to Ili-ālim. From the ḫamuštum of Idī-Ištar he has a month to pay. If he does not pay 1/3 shekels interest per mina per month will be added.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u a-mur-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-ma-lik-ma a-na a-mur-a-sur qi-bi-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa E ka-ri-im a-sur-ma-lik SIG.HI <gap> u-sa-ma <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> <gap> ma si-ti SIG.HI <big_gap> <gap> ni E ka-ri-im i-di-u a-ma-kam ku-ta-ni a-na ku-ta-ni-a i-di-ma a si-im SIG.HI a-ta ri-de8 u i-na a-la-ki-a a-ma-kam lu ni-si tup-pa-am sa tam-ka-ri-im sa 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR e-zi-ba-ku-um i-di-na-kum la i-di-na-kum te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn and Amur-Aššur from Aššur-mālik: To Amur-Aššur: You wrote me. You wrote me, (saying) "45 shekels of silver of the colony office, Aššur-mālik, wool ... ... went out and ... ... (broken section) ... ... and the remainder of the wool ... ... colony office they deposited. There, deposit the textiles with my textiles and you yourself 'sell' the wool for a price. Now, at my departure, there ... , I will leave for you the tablet belonging to the merchant stating 2/3 mina of silver. Let your message come as to whether or not he gave it to you.

src: a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku-ma 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-a a-na a-bi4-ni sa ha-bu-la-ak-su-ni 4 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na ni-qi-i-ka i-di-a-bu-um DUMU i-di-ISTAR na-as-a-kum su-ma i-li-a-lum i-li-ka-am 2 GU AN.NA sa a-bi4-ni se-bi4-la-nim a-sar ba-la-ti-su le-pu-us a-pu-tum ki-ma AN.NA i-na E.GAL-lim us-a-ni se-bi4-la-ma i-di-a-sur a ma-la te-er-ti-a la ta-ga-mi-il5
tgt: To Aššur-nādā from Aššur-taklāku: 1/3 mina of silver under my seal for our father--money I owe to him--and 5 shekels of silver for your sacrifices Iddin-abum, the son of Iddin-Ištar, is bringing to you. If IIī-ālum has come then send me 2 talents of tin belonging to our father, so I can secure a profit for him. Please, As (soon as) the tin comes out of the palace, send it to me! As to Iddin-Aššur, in accordance with my instructions do him no favours.

src: 98 GU 50 ma-na URUDU si-kam ku-nu-ku-su GAL sa pu-su-ke-en6 3 ne-pi-su 40 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki sa pu-su-ke-en6 5 GU URUDU ma-si-um 30 ma-na ku-na-na-ma-i-um 30 ma-na ni-ga-lu 5 ma-na si-pa-ra-tim 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR u 5 GIN KU.GI 11 is-ra-tum tal-hi-di-a-tum 2 DUG a-la-nu ANSE sa-la-mu SA.BA <gap> ANSE sa ku-lu-ma-a u u-ra-ni 4.TA ra-ku-su <gap>-TA ra-bi4-u-tum u-ka-pu na-ad-u 2 me-at i-la-tum 13 na-ru-qa-tum sa li-wi-tim SA.BA 3 na-si-su 3 ur-zi-mi-ku mi-ma a-nim a ku-lu-ma-a u su-e-a ap-qi-id IGI su-ma-li-bi4-a-sur DUMU ku-us-ku-si-im IGI DINGIR-na-da DUMU a-sur-na-da IGI sa-lim-a-sur DUMU i-tur4-DINGIR
tgt: 98 talents 50 minas sikkum-copper under the great seal of Pūšu-kēn, 3 sacks(?) 40 minas silver under seal belonging to Pūšu-kēn... x talents washed copper 30 minas Kununamitian copper, 30 minas copper sickles, 5 minas ṣipparātum, 6 minas silver and 5 shekels gold, 11 išratum talhidiātum, 2 allanu-pots, a black donkey. Thereof, of the donkeys from Kulumaya and Urani, four are bound. # large ones, ukāpū, are deposited. 200 ilātum, 13 sacks of wrappings. Thereof, 3 are nasisu, 3 are urzimikkū. I entrusted all this to Kulumaya and Sueyya. Witnesses: Šumma-libbi-Aššur s. Kuskusum, Ilī-nādā s. Aššur-nādā, Šalim-Aššur s. Itur-ilī.

src: 12.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-ha-na-ar-si i-li-is-ta-ki-il5 i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa en-na-nim u {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni a-na 1 ma-na-em 1.25 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab IGI PUZUR4-a-sur IGI i-ku-nim
tgt: Aḫanarši owes ì-lí-ìš-ta-ki-il₅ 12 1/2 minas refined silver. Witnesses: Puzur-Aššur, Ikunim

src: um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma a-na i-li-a-lim qi-bi-ma la li-bi i-li-ma mi-qi-tum im-qu-ta-ma a-na ur-su is-ta-ap-ru-ni a-hi a-ta a-sar sa-li-um i-se-er E a-bi4-ni la i-sa-lu-u e-pu-us a-na u-um e-ta-ri-im 9 GU 20 ma-na URUDU-i sa a DAM.GAR a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku i-qi-pu 8 GU 39.33334 ma-na e-zi-ib sa-du-e-tim sa a-ta ta-as-a-ma-ni SA.BA 5 GU URUDU a-na pu-ru-us-ha-tim tu-se-bi4-il5-ma si-im-su al-qe 1 GU 18 ma-na URUDU SIG5 sa-bu-ru-um si-im 3 ANSE.HI.A sa DAM.GAR ta-qi-pu SA.BA 10 ma-na ku-a-um 25 ma-na SIG5 si-im ANSE i li-bi4-a me-eh-ru sa se-ep sa-lim-be-li pa-ni-tim la-su tup-pa-am sa te-er-ti-a sa-se-er 45 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 25 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku e-ri-ib sa a-na qa-ti-su a-di-nu i-na pa-ni-tim sa-li-be-li ub-la-kum 72 {TUG}ku-ta-nu SA.BA 2 {TUG}a-bar-ni-u 4 ANSE sa-la-mu u u-nu-su-nu 1 ma-na AN.NA sa 2 0.66666 GIN 15 SE KU.BABBAR sa-he-er-tum i se-pi-ka tu-se-bi4-lam 4 {TUG}ku-ta-nu KI kur-ub-ISTAR u-mu DAM.GAR 7 ITU.KAM e-ta-at-qu a-hi a-ta KU.BABBAR ma-la a qa-ti-ka i-ma-qu-tu a-na se-er u-su-ur-sa-a-sur se-bi4-la-ma lu-sa-ak-si-da-ni-ma la a-ba-as a-na u4-um ga-ma-li-im 8 GIN KU.BABBAR u-ku-ul-ti 2 ANSE 1 GIN a-na sa bi4-la-ti-ka a-di-in 2 GIN a-na qa-ti a-sur-{d}UTU-si IGI su-su-en6 DUMU i-tur4-DINGIR a-na 0.5 ma-na.TA 1 TUG IGI a-sur-DU10 IGI a-sur-dan u-ra-ki-su
tgt: From Assur-nada to Ili-alum: Against the will of the god misfortune has fallen upon me, as they have just written to me in Uršu. My dear brother, act in such a way that no evildoer may do harm to our father's house! While I may still be saved- 9 talents 20 minas of my copper that Aššur-taklāku has given on commission to an agent, 8 talents 40 minas less 2/3 mina apart from the transport tariff, which you have bought for me--- out of which you sent 5 talents to Burušhaddum, and whose proceeds I have already received- 1 talent 18 minas of good broken copper, proceeds from the sale of 3 donkeys, which you gave in commission to an agent, of that 10 minas belong to you, 25 minas of good (copper), proceeds from the sale of a donkey, owed by me. The copies concerning Šalim-bēlī's earlier caravan are not here; guard the tablet with my instructions! 45 kutānu-textiles (and) 25 minas of sealed tin, apart from what I gave to him for expenses, Šalim-bēlī brought to you earlier. 72 kutānu-textiles, 2 of those abami'u-textiles, 4 black donkeys plus their harness, 1 mina of tin (and) worth 2 2/3 shekels 15 grains of silver of small goods you carried personally. 4 kutānu-textiles are owed by Kurub-Ištar. The terms for the agent are overdue by 7 months. My dear brother, send as much silver as falls into your hands to Uśur-ša-Aššur, so he may let it reach me and I shall not be put to shame. While could still I oblige you I gave 8 shekels of silver for the fodder of 2 donkeys and 1 shekel for your porters. 2 shekels were for the share of Aššur-šamši, witnessed by Šū-Suen the son of Itūr-ilī. I bound him by contract to pay 1/2 mina per textile, witnessed by Aššur-tāb and Aššur-dān.

src: 8.16666 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-{d}UTU-si a-sur-GAL i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa KU.GI-sa-nim u a-sur-ma-lik a-na 4 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 0.16666 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM-im u-sa-ab ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-i-li li-mu-um sa qa-ti DUG-ba-a-sur IGI zi-ki-ki IGI i-di-a-sur
tgt: Witnesses: Zigigi, Iddin-Aššur.

src: a-na su-be-lim im-di-lim a-sur-su-lu-li u DUG-si-la-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma e-na-be-lum-ma 5.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-ti ka-ri-im 1 ma-na 5 GIN a-ha-ma u-ku-ub-tu-ru-us ip-qi-du-ni-su-ma la is-qu-lam a-na ka-ri-im a-tu-ar SU.NIGIN 6.5 ma-na 4 GIN KU.BABBAR is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa hu-ra-sa-nim 1 GIN.TA si-ib-tam a-ma-nu 6.33333 ma-na 1.5 GIN u-su-ur-sa-ISTAR is-tu ha-mus-tim sa su-li u a-mur-ISTAR 1 GIN.TA u-sa-ab <gap> ma-na KI PUZUR4-a-sur 1 ma-na su-be-lum <big_gap> ma-na a-sur-su-lu-li 2 ma-na hu-ra-sa-num 1 ma-na 3 GIN KU.GI pa-sa-lam SIG5 sa ha-ra-an a-lim{ki} is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa MAR.TU ba-ni u sal-ma-a-sur a-na ITU.3.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab 15 GIN KU.GI pa-sa-lum a-ha-ma 3 GU 30 ma-na URUDU SIG5 si-im 3 {TUG}ku-ta-ni a-ha-ma 1 {TUG}ku-ta-num sa GEME 1 ANSE 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-ha-ma tup-pu-su ha-ar-mu-um i li-bi tup-pi-a i-ba-si a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma u4-mu-su ma-al-u mi-ma a-nim KI a-mur-DINGIR KU.BABBAR sa-ab-ta-su-ma sa-as-qi-la-su 1.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR en-um-a-sur 1 TUG ra-qu-tum KI am-ri-a 2 ma-na im-di-lum 7 GIN KU.BABBAR {d}en-LIL-ba-ni 1 {TUG}ku-si-tum sal-ma-a-sur sa 10.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa i-se-er u-su-ur-sa-a-sur u i-a-ti a-sur-SIPA i-su-u tup-pu-um ha-ar-mu-um sa hu-bu-li-ni i li-bi tup-pi-a i-ba-si 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR a si-ib-tim al-qe-ma i-na ra-mi-ni-a as-qul KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su sa-as-qi-la-su a-pu-tum a-na te-er-ti-a ih-da-ma DU10-si-la-a-sur tur4-da-nim mi-su-um a-di-ni i-sa-hu-ur u tu-ta-a ki-ma e-ru-ba-ni ba-ru-ba-ni ba-ti-iq u wa-tu-ur di-na-ma KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ka-ma se-bi-la-nim <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-nim la i-<gap> <big_gap>
tgt: The colony owes me 5 1/3 minas refined silver. They entrusted to Ukubturuš 1 mina 5 shekels separately, but he did not pay me. I will initiate legal proceedings against the colony.

src: a-na ma-la tup-pi-im sa su-ku-bi4-im a-na a-sur-i-di KU.BABBAR ha-bu-lu da-ga-ni-a a-na a-sur-na-da i-sa-ni-is ITU.KAM <big_gap> i-la-ak-ma KU-su <big_gap> i-su-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im u-sa-ab <gap> <big_gap> <gap> a-di-su-um IGI a-la-hi-im IGI a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim
tgt: In accordance with the tablet stating that the twin brother of Šū-Kūbum owes silver to Aššur-idī, Dagānya will go to Aššur-nādā in Kaneš within a month, and pay. If he has not paid, he must add interest in accordance with the rule of the colony. I gave him ... Witnessed by Alahum, witnessed by Aššur-bēl[- ... ]

src: 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa a-sur-la-ma-si a-na a-sur-i-di ha-bu-lu-ni-ma a-sur-DUG DUMU e-na-ma-nim u a-sur-GAL DUMU la-qe-pi-im qa-ta-tu-ni i-na 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR u si-ba-ti-su 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im-tim i-be-<gap> <big_gap> <gap>-du ha-<gap> <big_gap> ISTAR <gap> <big_gap> li-mu-um DINGIR-su-GAL <big_gap> <gap>-al <big_gap> tim IGI su-la-ba-an IGI DINGIR-su-GAL
tgt: Witnesses: Šū-Laban, DINGER-šu-GAL.

src: KISIB su-ma li-bi4 i-li-a DUMU a-sur-SIPA KISIB a-ta-ta DUMU LUGAL-su-en6 KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU DINGIR-kur-ub sa 0.33333 ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU DINGIR-kur-ub a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-bi-DU10 2 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na u-sa-ab ITU.KAM te-i-na-tim li-mu-um a-al-DU10 ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul PUZUR4-a-sur
tgt: Regarding the 22 shekels refined silver which Puzur-Aššur s. Ilī-kurub owes Aššur-rēʾī. He will add 2 shekels per mina per month from the ḫamuštum of Abi-ṭāb.

src: su-nu-nu a-na ha-na-na-ri-im is-ba-at-ni-a-ti-ma um-ma su-nu-nu-ma a-na ha-na-na-ri-im-ma 2 ma-na 1 GIN KU.GI u 8 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-a ka-i-il5 URUDU en-um-a-sur a-sur-i-mi-ti u-sa-ba-ma KU.BABBAR u KU.GI i-a-ti tu-sa-ra-am su-ma URUDU en-um-a-sur a-sur-i-mi-ti la us-ta-bi URUDU a-na-ku a-na a-sur-i-mi-ti a-sa-qa-al-ma KU.BABBAR u KU.GI i-a-ti tu-sa-ra-am um-ma ha-na-na-ru-um-ma u-sa-ra-ku-um ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um a-sur-i-di DUMU su-li a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um wa-ah-su-sa-na sa-he-er-GAL i-di-ni-a-ti-ma IGI GIR sa a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in IGI pi-la-ah-a-sur IGI en-na-su-en6 sa-ba-si-a tap-pa-i-ni
tgt: The plenary assembly at Waḫšušana permitted us, and we gave our testimonies before the dagger of Aššur. Sabasiya is our partner.

src: um-ma a-la-hu-um-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma 1 ne-pi-sum sa 30 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI 1 ne-pi-sum sa 10 ma-na ni-is-ha-su DIRI 1 ne-pi-sum sa 11 ma-na sa ik-ri-be 51 ma-na KU.BABBAR 3 ne-pi-su ni-is-ha-su DIRI PUZUR4.SA.TU na-as-a-kum su-ma PUZUR4.SA.TU sa-he-er ma a-li-ku-um i-ba-si ku-ul-ma-num u i-na su-ha-ri-a is-ti ku-ul-ma-nim ta-hi-ma 30 ma-na su-nu e-pi-iq-ma a-na DUMU um-mi-a-nim pi-qi-id-ma a-na a-lim lu-ub-lu sa-du-a-at KU.BABBAR i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-a di-in
tgt: From Alāhum to Aššur-nādā: 1 package containing 30 minas of silver, its import duty added; 1 package containing 10 minas, its import duty added; 1 package of 11 minas from the votive offerings in all: 51 minas of silver in 3 packages, its import duty added, Puzur-šadue is bringing to you. If Puzur-šadue is delayed well, if there is a caravan (and) Kulbānum is there, then attach one of my servants to Kulbānum, pack their 30 minas and entrust it to an affiliated trader, so they may bring it to the City. Give the transport tariff on the silver out of my silver.

src: um-ma {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni-ma a-na a-mur-DINGIR qi-bi-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma a-su-mi TUG.HI.A sa ik-ri-bi4-a uz-ni pi-te TUG.HI.A i-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim DAM.GAR a-qi-ip-ma u4-mu-su ma-al-u is-tu ITU.KAM su-ha-ra-am a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum a-se-er u-sur-sa-a-sur as-ta-par DAM.GAR KU.BABBAR u-sa-as-qal-ma u-se-ba-la-kum u DAM.GAR IGI u-sur-sa-ISTAR a-qi-ip-su a-ma-kam sa-il5-su a-hi a-ta eb-ri a-ta sa-he-er-tum sa i-na tup-pi-a la-pu-ta-at-ku-ni u TUG.HI.A a-na li-tab-si-a se-bi4-lam ba-lum TUG.HI.A wa-as-ba-ku lu-be-er-su u hu-la-li la-bu-sa-ku <gap> ni-a-sur a-sa-me-ma a-na tur4-hu-mi-it ha-ra-ka a-pu-tum i-hi-id-ma ba-bi4-is TUG.HI.A u AN.NA ri-e-su-nu na-as-u-ni la-ma ma-ma-an e-ti-qa-ni et-qa-ma KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na u 2 ma-na se-li a-hi a-ta 1 mu-sa-ra-am SIG5 a-na qa-ab-li-a se-bi4-lam e-ri-im-tam i qa-ab-li-a sa-ak-na-ku
tgt: From Ilabrat-bāni to Amur-ilī: You wrote me. In Purušḫaddum I consigned the textiles on terms of 10 weeks to an agent, and his term is now up. One month ago I sent a servant to Uṣur-ša-Aššur in Purušḫaddum. When he has made the agent pay the money I will send it to you. Also, I entrusted (the textiles) to the agent with Uṣur-ša-Aššur as witness. Ask him there yourself! As you are my brother and friend, send me the small things that were booked for you in my tablet as well as textiles for my own clothing. I live here without any textiles. I am dressed ... in his garment ... ? x-x-ni-Aššur is the ... ? I hear that you are going on a trip to Durḫumit. Urgent, take care to get the first tin and textiles which they carry at the gate there before anyone else and thus raise an extra mina or two of silver. As you are my brother, send me a good belt for my waist. I am fitted out with a wrap on my waist.

src: 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR li-ti i-se-er ka-da-da hu-lu-pa ka-nu-a-su u i-na-ar a-sur-ma-lik i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa en-na-su-en6 u a-sur-ma-lik qa-qa-ad KU.BABBAR 6 na-ru-uq mi-is-lam se-am mi-is-lam ar-sa-tim 2 UDU.HI.A su-pu-tim su-ru-tim i sa-tim u-su-bu ITU sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti ku-bi4-a KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-me-su-nu u ke-ni-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI su-pi-a-ah-su IGI ka-ri-a IGI du-la+la-<gap> <big_gap> IGI su-ku-bi4-im IGI a-bi4-<gap>
tgt: Gadada, Ḫulupa, Kanua-šu and Inar owe Aššur-mālik 2 minas liti silver. From the ḫamuštim of Enna-Suen and Aššur-mālik they will add (as interest on) the captial silver, 6 sacks (of grain), half barley, half wheat, 2 ṣupputum sheep, andand šurūtum textile each year. Month: ša sarrātim. Eponymate: after Kūbīya. (The responsibility to pay) the silver is bound to whomever is solvent and legally responsible. Witnesses: Šuppiaḫšu, Qarwiya, du-lá--, [unknown], Šū-Kūbim, a-bi₄--.

src: i-na 80 ma-na qa-ti a-bi4-ni u 80 ma-na URUDU qa-ti a-sur-na-da sa 15 GIN.TA KU u {TUG}ku-ta-ni 12 ma-na sa a-sur-na-da 6 ma-na sa a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku i-na ab-ni-ni a-hu-ur i-nu-mi 20 {TUG}ku-ta-ni is-tap-ku-ni 1.5 TUG su-ri-im a-sur-na-da i-di li-mu-um a-sur-na-da u lu-lu i-nu-mi 15 {TUG}ku-ta-ni 1.5 ku-ta-nim a-sur-na-da i-di li-mu-um a-mur-ISTAR u {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni 1 {TUG}ku-ta-nam qa-tam sa a-bi4-ni 1 {TUG}ku-ta-nam qa-tam sa a-sur-na-da i-nu-mi is-tap-ku-ni a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku i-di 3 GIN KU.BABBAR i-na me-tum 5 TUG sa bu-ru-us-ha-dum 4 GIN KU.BABBAR sa 10-tum is-te-en6 i-na ka-ni-is is-ti a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku i ka-ni-is la-ap-tu ILLAT ka-ri-a a-me-si-it ILLAT-tim a-la-qe
tgt: Out of the 80 minas, the share of our father, plus the 80 minas of copper, the share of Aššur-nādā--at the rate in silver of 15 shekels per (talent)--plus When there was an opportunity to invest 20 When there was an opportunity (to invest) 15 kutānu-textiles, Aššur-nādā deposited 1 1/2 kutānu-textile; the limmu-officials were Amur-Ištar and Ilabrat-bāni. 1 3 shekels of silver for the 5 percent tax on textiles in Burušhaddum; 4 shekels of silver for the tithe in Kaneš has been booked for Aššur-taklāku in Kaneš,

src: um-ma a-bu-sa-lim-ma ki-ma i-li-a-lim-ma a-na a-sur-i-mi-ti qi-bi-ma um-ma <gap> um-me-a-nu a-sur-is-ti-kal-ma u <big_gap><gap> <gap>-di-li DUMU a-sur-is-ti-kal a-na a-mur-a-sur DUMU su-ka-li-a-ma 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI ku-nu-ki-su a-sur-is-ti-kal sa-ma-la-i-ni is-tu pu-ru-us-ha-tim a-na ka-ni-is a-na E i-li-a-lim a-na ma-sa-ar-tim a-na na-an-du-im u-se-bi4-la-ma <gap> ma-na <gap> GIN KU.BABBAR tal-qe-a-ma <gap> ma-na <gap> GIN KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su pi-la-ah-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-ma-lik sa tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im a-na a-sur-is-ti-kal sa-ma-la-i-ni i-hi-bi4-il5-ma KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su tal-qe 2 ma-na 9 GIN KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su ta-ra-am-i-li DUMU ba-al-se-e-ni sa tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im a-na a-sur-is-ti-kal sa-ma-la-i-ni i-hi-bi4-il5-ma KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su tal-qe 1.3333300000000001 ma-na 2.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR sal-sa-tim sa a-sur-is-ti-kal sa-ma-la-i-ni i-na E ka-ri-im tal-qe 15 TUG i-na za-al-pa i-na lu-qu-tim sa a-sur-is-ti-kal sa-ma-la-i-ni ta-as-pur-ma a-sur-la-ma-si DUMU su-ku-bi4-im a-na be-ti-ka i-di 4-<gap> TUG i-na ba-ab E.GAL-lim a-sur-is-ti-kal sa-ma-la-i-ni i-di-na-kum mi-ma a-nim KU.BABBAR-ap sa-ma-la-i-ni tal-ta-qe IGI a-ne-en-ma i-ki-ir u-ul ka-in sa-ma-la-i-ni me-et-ma KU.BABBAR-ap sa-ma-la-i-ni ni-se-e la tu-na-ah-ni-a-ti u KU.BABBAR ma-dam la tu-sa-ag-mar-ni-a-ti si-bu-tum
tgt: Folgendermaßen Abūšalim an Stelle des Ilī'alum. Zu Aššurimittī sprich! Folgendermaßen (sprachen) hier die Gläubiger des Aššurištikal und des . . . [. . . . ] . . tili, des Sohnes des Aššurištikal zu Ām[u]raššur, dem Sohne des Sukalli'a: "10 Minen Silber — die Abgabe war hinzugefügt — , mit seinen Siegeln, hat Aššurištikal, unser Händler, von Purušḫattum nach Kaniš, an das Haus des Ilī'ālum, daß es (dort) zur Bewachung deponiert werde, schicken (wollen) (?) ; [x Min]en 50 (?) Seqel Silber hast du erhalten. Ferner, [x M]inen [x Seq]el Silber und den Zins dazu war Pilaḫištar, der Sohn des Aššu[rm]alik, auf Grund einer Doppel-urkunde dem Aššurištikal, unserem Händler, schuldig geworden; das Silber und den Zins dazu hast du erhalten. 2 Minen 9 Seqel Silber und den Zins dazu war Tarāmilī, der Sohn des Palšeni (?), auf Grund einer Doppelurkunde dem Aššurištikal, unserem Händler, schuldig geworden; das Si[lber] und den Zins dazu hast du erhalten, 1 ⅓ Minen 2⅓ Seqel Silber, die ,Drittanteile' des Aššurištikal, unseres Händlers, hast du vom bīt kārim erhalten. 15 Stoffe hast du in Zalpa von der Ware des Aššurištikal, unseres Händlers, gekauft; Aššurlamassī, der Sohn des Šūkūbum, hat (sie) deiner Hand übergeben. 6 Stoffe vom Palasttore hat Aššurištikal, unser Händler, dir gegeben. Dies alles, das Silber unseres Händlers, hast du insgesamt erhalten." Vor diesen beiden leugne oder bestätige (es). Unser Händler ist tot; doch nach dem Silber unseres Händler haben wir die Suche aufgenommen. Du sollst uns nicht Mühe machen; viel Silber sollst du uns nicht ausgeben lassen. (Also) bitte!

src: KISIB i-di-{d}IM DUMU a-sur-DU10 KISIB ISTAR-pa-li-il5 DUMU su-ku-bi-im KISIB a-gu5-za KISIB su-ISTAR 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am be-u-la-at su-ISTAR PUZUR4-a-na i-di-in is-ti KU.BABBAR uk-ta-al a-gu5-za a-bu-su KU.BABBAR il5-qe is-tu wa-di i-sa-ri-du-ni a-di 5 sa-na-at is-ti PUZUR4-a-na u-sa-ab la i-sa-mu-hu-ma u-la u-si su-ma is-ta-mu-hu-ma i-ti-si 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal
tgt: Puzur-Anna gave 1/2 mina refined silver as the beulātum of Šū-Ištar. He will pay 2 minas silver.

src: 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er zu-pa DUMU ISTAR-pa-li-il5 PUZUR4-a-sur i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa {d}UTU-ba-ni u a-sur-is-ti-kal a-na ITU.3.KAM i-sa-qal li-mu-um DINGIR-su-ra-bi ITU.KAM ab sa-ra-ni su-ma la is-qul a ma-na-im 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab
tgt: Zupa son of Ištar-pālil owes Puzur-Aššur 5 minas refined silver. He will pay from the ḫamuštum of Šamaš-bāni and Aššuriš-tikal, year Ilišu-rabi, month ab šarrānē. If he does not pay he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-hu-qar PUZUR4-a-sur u dan-a-sur-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma sa 33 ma-na KU.BABBAR AN.NA sa-ma-nim eq-lum li-is-ba-su ba-at-qu-um u wa-tu-ru-um AN.NA ba-ab-su la-su 17 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa DINGIR-ma-lik ub-la-ni i-na ku-nu-ki-su i-ba-si i-na e-ra-ab AN.NA a ma-la te-er-ti-ka ni-sa-a-ma-ku-um KI ba-ti-qi-im nu-se-ba-la-ku-um ni-is-ha-tum u <gap>-<gap> sa-du-a-tam is-he-er-ma 7.5 ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR KI ga-zi-a ni-il5-qe-ma a-sar a si-ib-tim il5-qe-u-ni ni-is-qul 0.33333 ma-na 7 GIN KU.BABBAR si-ib-tam i-na KU-pi-ka ni-is-qu-ul ra-qa-tam sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni la-su
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Aḫu-waqar, Puzur-Aššur and Dān-Aššur: You wrote. You said, "Purchase 33 minas silver worth of tin for me." Let the open country (overland journey) seize it! Cheap or dear, there is was no tin to be had at his departure. The 17 minas which Ilī-mālik brought is available under his seal. At the arrival of tin we will purchase tin for you according to your instructions. We will send it to you with the express caravan. The excise and shipping fees were deducted and we received 7 minas 32 shekels silver from Gazia, and we will pay out the silver which they received. We paid out 27 shekels silver interest from your silver. The raqqutum-textile about which you wrote, is not available.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma <gap> ma-na 10 GIN <big_gap> am i u <gap> <big_gap> pi-la-ah-a-sur u bu-si-a ha-bu-lu-nim tup-pa-am ha-ar-ma-am sa hu-bu-li-su-nu a-na-ku u-ka-al i qa-qa-ad ke-ni-su-nu KU.BABBAR-pi ra-ki-is is-tu ITU.1.KAM na-ar-ma-ak a-sur sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um <big_gap>-<gap> a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu <big_gap> la ku <gap> <big_gap><big_gap> GIN u sa
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: ... x minas 10 shekels ... Pilaḫ-Aššur and Buṣiya owe me. I myself hold the sealed tablet of their debt. My silver is bound to the head of their reliability(?)! They will pay 20 ḫamuštum-weeks after REL (?) II. ... shekel(s) ...

src: 0.66666 ma-na KU.GI KU.BABBAR i-se-ri-a il5-qe-ma tup-pu-su ha-ar-ma-am sa ku-nu-ki-su u a-na a-wa-ti ni-ih-ti-ri-im si-ti KU.GI i li-bi4-a tup-pe-e ni-ip-qi-id um-ma su-ut-ma a-di is-ti-ka a-ta-wu-u u 1.3333300000000001 ma-na KU.GI qa-at-ki ka-la-su-ma a la-qa-em i-zi-iz-ma um-ma su-ut-ma a-se-er 6 ma-na KU.KI sal-tam ta-la-qe um-ma a-na-ku-ma i mi-ma pu-su-ke-en6 e-zi-bu qa-tam qa-di-ni-ma ta-la-qe su-ut im-si-ma mi-is-lam sa la tu-sar-im a-di <big_gap>
tgt: He borrowed(?) 2/3 minas gold worth of silver on me and we had sealed the sealed tablet with his seal concerning my matter. We entrusted the tablets (for) the remainder of the gold I owe. He said, "Until I speak with you, you must also stand to take the 1 1/3 minas gold - your share, all of it," and he said, "Regarding the 6 minas gold on hand, you take it." I said, "From the things which Pūšu-kēn left, you will take our two shares(?)" It is ... and half of the ...

src: KISIB u-pu-u-i-ma-an KISIB ar-ta-a KISIB ta-ha-a KISIB hi-pu-a-su sa hu-bu-ul ta-ha-a u ha-pu-a-su 1 ma-na 9 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-ri-su-nu PUZUR4-a-na i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim <big_gap>
tgt: Seals: Ú-pu-ú-i-ma-an, Arta, Taḫa, ḫi-pu-a-šu.

src: 13 ma-na 10 GIN AN.NA ni-is-ha-at 8 GU AN.NA pu-su-ke-en6 il5-qe 0.33333 ma-na 8 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im ANSE pu-su-ke-en-ma il5-qe <gap> ki <gap> <gap>-tim
tgt: Pūšu-kēn received 13 minas 10 shekels tin, the excise for 8 talents tin. Pūšu-kēn (also?) (received??) 28 shekels silver, the price of a donkey.

src: um-ma bu-zu-ta-a-ma a-na a-mur-{d}UTU a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku u pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma be-lu-a a-hu-a a-tu-nu i-na u4-mi-im sa tup-pi-a ta-sa-me-a-ni a-na qa-ra-be-tim er-ba-ma me-eh-ri-a si-ma-ma a-sar KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na i-na ba-ab-ti-a u-ka-lu-ni sa-di-na-ma <gap>-<big_gap> la ta-ga-mi-la DUMU <gap> <big_gap>-du a-na <big_gap>-<gap> na-ad-<big_gap> im i-nu-mi KU.BABBAR i-sa-qu-lu TUG.HI.A wa-si-ra tup-pa-su se-na a-hu-a a-tu-nu a-na te-er-ti-a ih-da u-ra-am a-tu-nu eq-lam la ta-la-ka-a su-ma KU.KI PUZUR4-su-en6 la u-se-bi4-la-ku-nu-ti te-er-ta-ak-nu li-li-kam u su-ma KU.KI u-se-bi4-la-ku-nu-ti i-na u-mi-im sa AN.NA i-sa-qu-lu-su-ni u KU.KI i-sa-qal
tgt: From Buzutāya to Amur-Šamaš, Aššur-taklāku and Pūšu-kēn: My dear lords and brothers, on the day that you read this tablet, enter into the strongroom of my house and read my copy (of the tablet?) so that wherever anyone holds a single mina of silver from my outstanding claims, cause it to be given, and don't do me a favor. As for the son of ...du, (? having sold it for silver?) When he weighs the silver, make known the textiles. There are two tablets. My dear brothers, heed my instructions As for you (pl.), don't go abroad tomorrow. Let your message come if Puzur-Suen does not send you the gold. Now, if he sends you the gold, he will pay the gold on the same day that he sends you the tin.

src: 8.5 GIN KU.BABBAR KI a-sur-ma-lik DUMU ir-ra-a is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ISTAR-pi-la-ah ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-DINGIR li-mu-um sa qa-ti bu-zu-ta-a ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im u-sa-ab <gap> 1 GIN 4 SE DUMU a-ni-nim 2 GIN 22.5 SE KU.BABBAR sa-lim-a-sur DUMU i-tur4-DINGIR 1.5 GIN 22.5 SE DUMU ir-ra 12 GIN KU.BABBAR PUZUR4.SA.TU DUMU la-qe-ep 1 GIN <big_gap><gap> mu-si-su-nu ha-pu E dan-a-sur u su-ISTAR la is-qu-lu 6 GIN KI <big_gap><gap> GIN <big_gap><gap> GIN a-sur-GAL 7.5 SE ku-ra-ra
tgt: 2 shekels 22 1/2 grains silver (are with) Šalim-Aššur s. Itūr-ilī.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN ma-la na-as-a-ti-ni su-ma sa-ah-ra-ti a-na se-ni-su ma-ha-as-ma mi-is-lam i pa-ni-im-ma se-bi-lam u si-tam <big_gap> i wa-ar-ki-u-tim se-bi-lam a-di sa-ah-ra-ti-ni si-ma-am la-as-a-ma lu-ta-e-ra-ku-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN li-bi-it su-ma ha-ra-ka mi-ma la tu-se-ba-la-am i-na se-pi-ka-ma KU.BABBAR bi-lam mi-nam te-ta-na-pa-as sa DINGIR la u-su-ru-su u a-ra-ka ka-bu-tu-ma tu-ka-ba-at a-wa-at DINGIR.HI.A ta-am-ti-si-i a-na mi-nim a-wa-at DINGIR.HI.A la ka-ab-ta-ni-ku-um u-um-su-ma sa-ah-ra-ti a-na-ku a-na ma-nim a-da-gal a-na ma-nim e-zi-ib a-wa-ti-ka i-di KU.BABBAR i-na sa-al-e la tu-us-te-ne-ba-al-ma u ka-ru-um sa-du-a-tam la il-ta-na-qe a-na mi-nim is-tu SE.6.MU i-li-a-lum a-ma-kam wa-sa-ab-ma ta-ta-kal-su a-di-ma-a i-mu-tu a-pu-tum i pa-ni-u-ti-ma tu-ur-da-su u su-ha-ar-tam li-ir-de8-am su-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-su i ka-ni-is-KI i-ba-si u-ta-ar-su-um tu-ur-da-su
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā: If you are delayed, then divide every single shekel of silver, as much as you carry, into two parts, and send me one half as soon as possible; then send the rest with the following transport. While you are delayed I shall make purchases and return that to you, so every single shekel of silver may be available. If you are en route, then send me nothing, but bring me the silver personally. Why do you keep doing things that the gods do not allow, so your sin becomes ever heavier? Have you forgotten the words of the gods? Why are the words of the gods not important for you? Until now you have delayed. As for me, in whom can I trust? You must not fraudulently keep sending me silver in such a way that the colony authorities do not collect the transport tariff. Please, send him as soon as possible; also, let him bring the girl. If his silver is tied up in Kanes I shall restore it to him. Send him!

src: 2 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er ISTAR.DINGIR-su su-ISTAR u a-sur-DUG i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa da-da u a-sur-ba-ni li-mu-um sa-li-a DUMU sa-ba-ku-ra 0.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na 2 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR a 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal is-tu <gap>-<big_gap> 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na 8 ITU.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 2 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab IGI zi-<gap>-<big_gap>-<gap>-<gap> IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti IGI hu-ra-ad
tgt: Ištar-ilišu owes Šū-Ištar and Aššur-tāb 2 minas 10 shekels silver. He will pay 50 shekels 2 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Dada and Aššur-bāni, eponymate of Alia s. Šabakura. He will pay 50 shekels in 13 ḫamuštum weeks. He will pay 50 shekels 8 months from ... . If he does not pay (on time), he will add 2 shekels (silver) per month. Witnesses: Zi.., Aššur-imittī, Ḫurad.

src: KISIB a-ta-ta KISIB me-zi-<gap> <big_gap> KISIB sar-ma-ma KISIB ni-ni sa 21 na-ru-uq GIG 20 SE i-se-er ni-ni a-sur-na-da i-su i-na ka-ar-pi-ti-a ta-ma-da-dam su-ma i-na ha-ar-pe la ta-am-du-dam ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ni-is si-ib-tam tu-sa-ab
tgt: Seal of Atata, seal of Mezini, seal of Šarmama, seal of Ninni. Concerning 21 sacks of wheat (and) 20 of barley, (which) Ninni owes to Aššur-nādā--she will measure it out with my own pot-measure; if she has not measured it out at harvest time she will pay interest in accordance with the regulations of Kane

src: um-ma a-sur-ma-lik u sa-lim-a-sur-ma a pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma a-su-mi si-im sa a-ki-di-e sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni is-tu tu-us-u a-ki-di-u a-na a-lim{ki} u-la e-ru-bu-nim ma-su-nu sa-hi-a-at-ma su-ma a ku-si im-ta-aq-tu-nim-ma si-mu-um sa ba-la-ti-ka i-ba-si ni-sa-a-ma-ku-um u KU.BABBAR i ra-mi-ni-ni ni-sa-qal KU.BABBAR i-hi-id-ma se-bi4-lam um-ma a-sur-ma-lik a-hi a-ta ki-ma ta-hi-du-ma KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na i-na ba-ab-ti-a tu-se-si-a e-ne-a ta-ap-te u 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU a-sur-ma-lik i-hi-id-ma i-na pa-ni-e-ma se-bi4-lam DUB-ka as-me-ma li-bi4 ih-du um-ma sa-lim-a-sur-ma su-ha-ra-am is-ti en-na-su-en6 at-ru-ud u a-na 10 ku-ta-ni-ka sa a-di-nu-su-ni en-na-su-en6 ra-ku-sa-am a-hi a-ta su-ma ta-ta-gal-ma su-ha-ra-am u-sa-am-ra-su su-ha-ru-um is-ti-ka lu-si-ib TA KU.BABBAR a-na ku-ta-ni-a en-na-su-en6 ra-ku-us
tgt: From Aššur-mālik and Šalim-Aššur to Pūšu-kēn: Concerning the price of the textiles of the Akkadians about which you wrote, since you left, no Akkadians have come to the City. Their land is in great turmoil, and if they arrive before winter and the prices are beneficial to you, we will purchase some for you. We will even make the purchases with silver from our own funds. Take heed to send the silver. From Aššur-mālik: My dear brother, because you took care to take out every single mina of silver of my outstanding claims, you have opened my eyes. Also, the 10 minas of silver with Puzur-Ištar son of Aššur-mālik, take care to send it with the first departure. I read your tablet and my heart was gladdened. From Šalim-Aššur: I dispatched the youth with Enna-Suen. Also, Enna-Suen is bound (?) for your ten textiles which I gave to him. My dear brother, if you wait, it will cause the youth to be sorrowful. Let the youth live with you. Enna Suen is bound to silver for my

src: 25 ma-na KU.BABBAR li-ti SIG5 i-se-er GAL-ga-li-a u a-lu pu-su-ke-en6 i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-tur4-DINGIR u kur-ub-ISTAR a-na 15 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 2 GIN.TA a-na ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu ITU.KAM ab sa-ra-ni li-mu-um i-di-a-bu-um KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu u ke-ni-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI a-sur-dan IGI i-ku-pi-a-sur IGI a-sur-DUG
tgt: Galgalia and Alu owe Pūšu-kēn 25 minas fine They will pay 15 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum-week of Itūr-ilī and Kūrub-Ištar. If they do not pay, the will add 2 shekels silver for each mina (silver) as interest (per month). Month of Ab-šarrānē, limmu-ship of Idi-abu(m). In the presence of Aššu-rdān, Ikūn-pī-Aššur, and Aššur-ṭāb.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um u su-hu-bur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 DAM.GAR u e-la qi-bi-ma 11 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI e-la ub-lam SA.BA 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku-ni 9 ma-na AN.NA-ak qa-tim 14 GIN.TA KU.BI 9.83333 la 0.16666 GIN 3.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na 2 GU 19 ma-na AN.NA te-su-pi nu-si-ib 10 ku-ta-nu 0.5 ma-na 1.66666 GIN it-bu-lu 1 ANSE sa-la-mu 16 GIN KU.BABBAR it-ba-al 2 GIN KU.BABBAR u-nu-su 3 GIN u-kul-tu-su 1.3333300000000001 GIN KU.BABBAR te-su-pi e-la il5-qe 1.3333300000000001 GIN a-na lu-bu-us a-da-lal e-la-ma il5-qe 5.5 GIN KU.BABBAR wa-si-tum SU.NIGIN lu-qu-tim 11 ma-na KU.BABBAR mi-ma a-nim e-la i-ra-di-a-ku-nu-ti gam-ra-ku-nu-ti
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum and Šū-Ḫubur to Pūšu-kēn, the merchant, and Ela: Ela brought 11 minas silver, its excise tax added.

src: 2 ma-na 9 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er en-um-a-sur DUMU su-ki-tim u sa-ap-ta-ma-ni-ka il5-ba-ni DUMU i-a-a i-su is-tu ITU.1.KAM te-i-na-tim DINGIR sa-pa-tam i-li-ik-ma 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu li-mu-um i-li-dan DUMU e-la-li IGI <big_gap>-<gap>-ti-a IGI en-um-a-sur IGI ka-ku-a IGI PUZUR4-a-sur
tgt: Ennum-Aššur s. Šukkutum and Šaptamanika owe Ilī-bāni s. Iya 2 minas 9 shekels refined silver.

src: KISIB sa-lim-ISTAR DUMU tu-ra-am-{d}ISKUR KISIB qa-ta-ti-a DUMU i-su-hi-im KISIB a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU a-ni-nim KISIB su-e-a DUMU pu-su-ke-en6 i-na 4 ma-na KU.GI sa pu-su-ke-en6 a-na en-um-a-sur DUMU e-na-su-en6 sa-ap-ku 0.66666 ma-na 8 GIN KU.GI qa-tam sa su-e-a DUMU pu-su-ke-en6 a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 a-hu-su is-a-am a-na 0.66666 ma-na 8 GIN KU.GI su-e-a a-na en-um-a-sur DUMU e-na-su-en6 u-la i-tu-ar KISIB sa-lim-ISTAR DUMU tu-ra-am-{d}ISKUR KISIB qa-ta-ti-a DUMU i-su-hi-im KISIB a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU a-ni-nim KISIB su-e-a DUMU pu-su-ke-en6 i-na 4 ma-na KU.GI sa pu-su-ke-en6 a-na a-sur-ma-lik DUMU e-na-su-en6 sa-ap-ku 0.33333 ma-na 2 GIN KU.GI qa-su sa su-e-a DUMU pu-su-ke-en6 a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 a-hu-su is-a-am a-na 0.33333 ma-na 4 GIN KU.GI su-e-a a-na a-sur-ma-lik DUMU e-na-su-en6 u-la i-tu-wa-ar KISIB sa-lim-ISTAR DUMU tu-ra-am-{d}ISKUR KISIB qa-ta-ti-a DUMU i-su-hi-im KISIB a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU a-ni-nim KISIB su-e-a DUMU pu-su-ke-en6 2 ma-na 8 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-e-a DUMU pu-su-ke-en6 a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 a-hu-su i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa su-li ITU.1.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um a-gu5-tum a ma-na-em 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab KU.BABBAR i-na ka-ni-is i-sa-qal me-eh-ru-um sa 3 tup-pe-su sa su-e-a a-su-mi <big_gap> GAN-lam e-ti-qu
tgt: Seals: Šalim-Ištar son of Turam-Adad, Qatatia son of Išuḫim, Aššur-imittī son of Anninum, Sueyya son of Pūšu-kēn. From the 4 minas gold which Pūšu-kēn piled up to Ennum-Aššur son of Enna-Suen, Aššur-mutabbil purchased 49 shekels gold, the share of Sueyya son of Pūšu-kēn his brother. Concerning the 48 shekels gold, Sueyya will not return to Ennum-Aššūr son of Enna-Suen. Seals: Šalim-Ištar son of Turam-Adad, Qatatia son of Išuḫim, Aššur-imittī son of Anninum, Sueyya son of Pūšu-kēn. From the 2 minas gold which P Regarding the 24 shekels gold, Sueyya will not return to Aššur-mālik son of Enna-Suen. Seals: Šalim-Ištar son of Turam-Adad, Qatatia son of Išuḫim, Aššur-imittī son of Anninum, Sueyya son of Pūšu-kēn. Sueyya son of Pūšu-kēn owes Aššur-mutabbil his brother 2 minas 8 shekels refined silver. From the ḫamuštum-week of Šuli, month Ḫubur, limmum Akutum, he will add as interest 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. He will pay the silver in Kaneš. As for the exchange value of the three tablets of Sueyya, concerning ... the crossed overland ...

src: 40 ma-na URUDU ma-si-am i-se-er si-la-{d}ISKUR {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li i-su is-tu SAG ITU.KAM be-el-ti-E a-na ITU.3.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma i ma-la u4-me-su la is-qu-ul 1.5 ma-na.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na bi4-il5-tim si-ib-tam u-sa-ab li-mu-um sa qa-ti a-sur-na-da URUDU sal-ma-am i-na wa-ah-su-sa-na i-sa-qal IGI su-ma-a IGI i-di-ISTAR
tgt: Ṣilli-Adad owes Adad-ṣulūlī 30 minas refined copper. He will pay 3 months from the beginning of the month Bēlet-ekallim. If he does not pay at the fulfillment of his term, he will add 1.5 minas per talent per month as interest. He will pay the entirety of the copper in Waḫšušana.

src: 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am 15 GIN si-ba-su sa-ru-up me-eh-ra-tim sa a-bu-na tal-qe KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su a-na su-mi-ka KI a-bu-na u-si-a-am 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am me-eh-ra-at 10 {TUG}ta-ku-us-ta-e a-bu-na ta-ku-us-ta-u a-na su-mi-ka a-na-num GAN-eq-lam e-ti-qu u KU.BABBAR-ap-su-nu a-na su-mi-ka GAN e-ti-qam ta-ku-us-ta-e-ka su-{d}ISKUR u-bi4-il5 2 {TUG}ku-ta-ni hu-<gap> <gap> is-pu-ra-ma tup-pu-su u-ka-li-im li-iz-bi4-il5 ku-ta-ni i-<gap>-<gap> a-na ba-a-ba-at ta-ku-us-te-ka ni-zu-a-az KU.BABBAR i-ba-ta-aq u i-ti-ir a-na su-mi <big_gap> 0.66666 GIN KU.GI <big_gap>-sa-lim sa <gap> a-lim{ki} i li-bi4-ka 10 GIN sa-ru-pa-am a-na su-mi a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim a-na be-a-lim te-ri-is um-ma a-ta-ma i-na e-la i-di-a-sur u a-sur-ma-lik TUG.HI-tu-su e-li-u-ni-ma li-qe 10.5 GIN si-ba-at 0.5 ma-na KU.UD ta-as-ku-nam ni-ka-si ki-ma qa-ar-wi-a is-ti-a ta-si-ma 17.5 GIN KU.BABBAR 1 me-eh-ra-tim hu-bu-ul qa-ar-wi-a a-di-na-kum lu KU.BABBAR lu TUG.HI.A lu sa mu-su-ka-e mi-ma sa qa-ar-wi-a u-la te-zi-ba-am su-ma 17.5 GIN KU.BABBAR qa-ar-wi-a tu-us-te-bi4-lam is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ka-as-si-im <gap> GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam a-na 1 ma-na a-ma-nu-ma ta-za-za-am 5.5 ma-na 6.5 GIN KU.BABBAR hu-bu-ul ma-<gap>-<gap> i-na KU.BABBAR-pi
tgt: You took the 1 mina refined silver and 15 shekels of "refined of its echange"? belonging to Abuna. Abuna took(?) The silver and its interest in your name?

src: a-na PUZUR4-a-sur qi-bi4-ma um-ma il5-we-da-ku-ma a-bi4 a-ta be-li a-ta i-na u4-mi-im sa tup-pi ta-sa-me-u i-hi-id-ma hu-sa-ha-ka 5 u4-me e-zi-ma a-wa-ti bu-tu-uq-ma a-na te-er-ti-ni la-ak-nu-us-ma ha-ra-ni le-pu-us 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR lu i-a-am lu ku-a-am qa-ti u-ka-al ITU.KAM is-te-en6 ITU.2.KAM e ta-as-lu-ut-ma a-wa-ti e la ta-ag-mu-ur-ma e a-si-li-ih mi-nam ma-da-tim lu-la-pi-ta-ku-um i-na tup-pi u na-as-pe-ra-tim lu-sa-am-ti-ka hu-ut-ka u-ma-kal la i-bi-at te-er-ta-ka za-ku-tam lu-ta-e-ra-ma KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na lu-us-ta-as-bi-it-ma ki-ma ma-as-ka-tam ni-sa-ku-nu-ma la ni-ba-su le-pu-us 10 GIN KU.KI si-im a-ni-qi-im sa a-mu-tim sa hu-ut-ka ub-la-ni ku-nu-ki-a hu-ut-ka na-as-a-kum
tgt: Zu Puzuraššur sprich! Folgendermaßen Ilīwēdāku: Mein Vater bist du! Mein Herr bist du! An dem Tage, an dem du meine Tafel liest, sei achtsam! Deinen Bedarf notiere in(nerhalb von) fünf Tagen. Meine Angelegenheit erledige! Dann will ich deinem Bescheid mich beugen und (dementsprechend) meine Reise unternehmen. 1 Mine Silber (sei es nun) meines oder deines, halte ich in Händen. Einen Monat oder zwei Monate sollst du nicht (darüber) verfügen. Denn meine Angelegenheien hast du nicht erledigt und soll ich da nicht angesteckt (?) werden. Was soll ich dir (noch) viel schreiben? Mit Tafeln und Briefen will ich (es) dir kurz machen! Ḫutka soll nicht einmal übernachten; einen klaren Bescheid von dir soll er mir bringen. Das Silber, 1 Mine, will ich bereitlegen. Dann möge er, damit wir das Depot niederlegen können und nicht zuschanden werden, handeln. 10 Seqel Silber, den Preis für den Ring aus Eisen, den Ḫutka mir gebracht hat, mit meinen Siegeln: (damit) ist Ḫutka zu dir unterwegs.

src: a-na su-be-lim u ku-zu KISIB su-li a-na ku-zu qi-bi4-ma a-na-kam um-mi-i za-ak-ra-am ta-ar-si-i
tgt: To Kuzu: Here, my mother has taken a man (as husband).

src: a-na a-sur-i-mi-ti en-nu-be-lim en-na-nim u bu-bu-ra-nim qi-bi-ma um-ma im-di-DINGIR pu-su-ke-en6 a-sur-su-lu-li u u-sur-sa-ISTAR-ma la li-bi4 i-li-ma PUZUR4-a-sur me-et lu KU.BABBAR lu tup-pu-u ha-ru-mu-tum sa PUZUR4-a-sur i-ba-si lu i-na wa-as-ha-ni-a tup-pu-u lu i-na wa-ah-su-sa-na lu i-na <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> <gap>-ni ni-is-ba-at <gap>-<gap>-<gap> a-ni-tim 1 GU <gap> ma-na <gap>-<gap> <gap>-tu-su ki-ma <gap> <gap>-tu-su e-su-u-ma li-bi4 <gap> im-ta-ar-su u ma-<gap> <gap>-ni-ta-na-<gap> as a-na-ku ak-ta-la um-ma a-na-ku-ma lu <gap>-<gap>-<gap> sa se-ep e-nu-be-lim lu us a <gap> KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na li-<gap>-<gap> ma-as-ti-ma KU.BABBAR a-ni-im lu-la-mi-id a-na-ku lu-bi4-il5-ma KU.BABBAR li-zu-zu i-na {d}UTU-si tup-pi-ni ta-sa-me-a-ni 40 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa e-nu-be-lum ub-la-ku-nu-ti-ni ni-is-ha-su DIRI sa-du-a-su sa-bu AN.NA li-wi-su u e-li-a-tim sa-ma-ma KI pa-ni-im-ma wa-si-im ab-ka-nim a-na-kam im-di-DINGIR a-su-mi ki-a-am sa-he-er um-ma ne-nu-ma si-mu-um le-li-a-ma ki-ma sa la ke-na-ti-ni-ma us-tam-ri-is-ma KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na <gap> <gap>-li-ma im-di-DINGIR i-na a-la-ki KU.BABBAR lu-bi4-il5-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-ni <gap> ni-<gap> su-ma ma-ma-an a-na <gap> i-ra-ga-ma-ku-nu-ti a-na im-di-DINGIR up-sa um-ma a-ta-ma i-na a-la-ak im-di-DINGIR <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> i-ta-ba-al KU.BABBAR li-ip-hu-ur su-ma ma-ma-an a-na <gap> <gap>-tim i-ra-ga-ma-ku-nu-ti <big_gap> <gap>-as <big_gap> a-li-<gap>-il5-ni KI a-sur-e-mu-qi DUMU i-di-su-en6 i-su a-ba-u-ni be-lu-ni a-tu-nu i-na tup-pi-im-ma la+la-<gap>-ti <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> ku-nu-ti-ni sa ki-ma ni-a-ti is-ti-ku-nu li-is-me-u-ma <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> <gap> me-at la-pu-ta-at-ni u-ru-ub a-wa-tim <gap>-<gap>-<gap> <gap>-<gap> <gap>-a su-ma e-nu-be-lum sa-he-er ir-ba-ma <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> <gap> sa ki-a-ma a-na e-ra-ab e-nu-be-lim a-na KU.BABBAR <gap>-<gap> <gap>-ku-nu di-na lu-qu-tum im-ti <gap> li sa su ar
tgt: To Aššur-imittī, Ennu-Bēlum, Ennānum, and Buburānum from Imdī-ilum, Pūšu-kēn, Aššur-ṣulūlī, and Uṣur-ša-Ištar: Unfortunately, Puzur-Aššur died. There is both silver and tablets belonging to Puzur-Aššur. We seized from Wašḫania, tablets (nom.?) from Waḫšušana and from ... ... about a talent of tin ... mina (silver?) .. him. When ... (left?) there was very little and I was disappointed. ..... as for myself I retained (?) it. I said, "Let him ... the goods of the transport of Ennum-Bēlum, or ..., every single minas of silver and make known the silver mastima." I will bring it myself and divide the silver. On the day your read the tablet, (with the) 40 minas silver which Ennum-Bēlum brough to you, the excise added, the shipping paid, purchase tin, wrappings, and top pack, and dispatch it with the first departer. Here, Imdi-ilum regarding the ??? was short. We said, "Let the prices come up and when the not true he causes to sorrow and every minas silver ...arise and Imdi-ilum bring the silver when he comes and our silver ...." If anyone for ... sues you (pl.) go? to Imdi-ilum. You said, "When Imdi-ilum goes/comes ... he ahd brought it, let him gather the silver." If anyone for ... sues you (pl.) ... ... something which I ... is owed by Assur-ēmūqī s. Idī-Suen. Our dear fathers and lords, as for you, let him read the very tablet to you and to our presresentatives with you ... and let the x hundred that are written enter. ... the matter. If Ennum-Bēlum is late, enter and ... in the same way and at the arrival of Ennum-Bēlum sell your .... for silver. The goods are missing. ...

src: um-ma hi-na-a-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma a-na KU.BABBAR sa a-di-na-ku-ni si-ma-am ma-la ta-as-a-ma-ni lu AN.NA lu TUG.HI.A ma-la ta-as-a-ma-ni a-na su-ku-bi4-im di-ma lu-ub-lam su-ma su-ku-bu-um i-ta-sa-am a-na a-li-ki-im pa-ni-e-ma di-in-ma lu-ub-lam
tgt: From Hinnaya to Aššur-nādā: As to the silver I gave to you, whatever purchase you make, be it tin or textiles, whatever you buy give that to Šū-Kūbum so he may bring it. If Šū-Kūbum has already left, then give it to the first caravan so it may bring it.

src: PUZUR4-a-sur u a-mur-DINGIR ma-ah-ri-ni ni-ka-si i-si-u um-ma PUZUR4-a-sur-ma a-na a-mur-DINGIR-ma 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na su-mi-ka i-na a-lim{ki} as-qu-ul ma-hi-ir a-lim{ki} i-na lu-qu-ti-a sa is-tu a-lim{ki} ta-ar-de8-a-ni 14 ma-na AN.NA i-na ni-ip-la-ti-a sa-he-er um-ma a-mur-DINGIR-ma mi-su-ma na-as-pe-er-tam sa ki-ma i-a-ti ki-ma 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR ta-as-qu-lu-u la tu-ub-lam5 um-ma PUZUR4-a-sur-ma su-ma 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na sa ki-ma ku-a-ti la as-qu-ul 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR la-as-qu-la-kum u a-su-mi 0.16666 GIN.TA sa TUG e-mu-du-ni um-ma PUZUR4-a-sur im-di-DINGIR lu ni-is-al-ma a-da-na-kum u a-su-mi ka-sa-ri-ka su-be-lim ni-sa-al a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um bu-ru-us-ha-dum i-di-ni-a-ti-ma <big_gap> ni-ka-si <big_gap> <gap> su <big_gap> IGI a-<gap> <big_gap>
tgt: Puzur-Aššur and Amur-ilī settled accounts in our presence. Puzur-Aššur said to Amur-ilī, "I paid 1 mina silver to your name in the City. Deduct the price in the City from my goods which you drove up from the City--14 minas tin-from my remuneration." Amur-ilī said, " Why did you not bring the letter of my represtative stating that you paid the 1 mina silver?" Puzur-Aššur said, "If I did not pay 1 mina silver to your representative, let me weigh out 2 minas silver to you. Also, I am .. concerning the 1/6 shekel of the textile." And regarding the fact that ... 1/6 shekel of the textile, Puzur-Aššur said, "Inquire of Imdī-ilum and I will give it to you." Also we questioned Šū-Bēlum concerning your packer. For this matter, the colony at Burušḫaddum gave us permission, (and we settled our accounts before the dagger of Aššur)

src: 7 ma-na 17 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er i-di-a-bi4-im i-di-ISTAR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim u a-mur-ISTAR a-na 45 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-em 1.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab li-mu-um a-al-DUG DUMU ib-ni-li ITU.1.KAM na-ar-ma-ka-a-sur sa ke-na-tim IGI a-sur-DUG DUMU a-sur-ma-lik IGI a-mur-DINGIR <big_gap> DUMU i-bi4-su-a
tgt: Iddin-abim owes Idī-Ištar 7 mina 17 shekels refined silver. He will pay 45 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-bēl-awātim and Amur-Ištar. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the colony rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Year: Āl-ṭāb s. Ibni-ilī Month: Narmak Aššur ša kēnātim. Witnesses: Aššur-ṭāb s. Aššur-mālik, Amur-ilī s. Ibbī-Sua

src: 1 ma-na 12.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ar-si-ah DUMU a-sur-ba-ni im-di-lum i-su-u a-na 3 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal ITU.1.KAM a-la-na-tim IGI u-sa-nim DUMU a-mur-a-sur IGI ma-as-hi-i-li a-bi4-i-a-a DUMU DUG-si-la-a-sur
tgt: Arši-aḫ s. Aššur-bāni (im-dí-lum) owes 1 mina 12 1/3 shekel He has three weeks to pay. Month: Allānātim Witnesses: Usānum s. Amur-Aššur, Mašiḫ-ilī, my father, s. Ṭāb-ṣilli-Aššur.

src: KISIB ku-la DUMU <big_gap> KISIB DUMU su-<big_gap> KISIB a-sur-DU10 DUMU a-sur-{d}UTU-si <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-DU10 DUMU a-sur-{d}UTU-si su-be-lim i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa la-li-im u a-ni-nim a-na 15 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-ma-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM 1.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab SAG ITU.1.KAM ka-an-ma-ar-ta li-mu-um a-al-DU10
tgt: Seals of Kula s. ?, s. šu?, Aššur-ṭāb s. Aššur-Šamši Aššur-ṭāb s. Aššur-Šamši owes Šū-Bēlim ? minas refined silver. He will pay fifteen weeks from the ḫamuštum of Lālim and Anninim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month at the colony rate (as interest). Month: Head of Kanwarta Eponymate: Āl-ṭāb

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma 2 ma-na LA 0.5 GIN KU.BABBAR ISTAR-pi-la-ah tu-se-bi4-lam 1 ma-na 0.5 GIN i-na sa su-ISTAR al-qe SU.NIGIN 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR SA.BA 7.5 GIN ni-is-ha-tim as-qul is-tu sa-du-u-tum ga-am-ra-at-ni 1 GIN KU.BABBAR a-pu-ul si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-ka 2.83333 ma-na 1.5 GIN 8 GIN KU.BABBAR is-ti DUMU a-bu-SILIM u tap-pa-i-su al-qe 2.6666600000000003 ma-na 1.25 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im TUG.HI.A sa se-ep en-nam-be-lim i-na li-bi4-ka a-si-tam um-ma a-ta-ma KU.BABBAR la-qe am-si-ma la ak-nu-ka-su KU.BABBAR i qa-ti-a la-su-ma al-qe 16 GIN 10 5 SE KU.BABBAR i lu-qu-tim sa se-ep DUMU ir-nu-id a-si-tam SU.NIGIN 2.83333 ma-na 7.66666 GIN sa-he-er-ma si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-ka 2.1666 GIN gam-ra-kum
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā: You sent me 2 minas less 1/2 shekel of silver with Ištar-pilah. I took 1 mina 1/2 shekel out of what belongs to Šū-Ištar. In all: 3 minas of silver. Thereof I paid 7 1/2 shekels as import duty; since the (money for the) transport tariff had been spent, I paid the balance of 1 shekel of silver. The rest of your silver amounts to 2 5/6 minas 1 1/2 shekel. I borrowed 8 shekels of silver from the son of Abu-šalim and his partner. I still had a claim against you of 2 2/3 minas 1 1/4 shekels of silver, the proceeds from the sale of the textiles transported by Ennam-Bēlum. You said: ''The silver has been taken." But I forgot to seal it, (and) since I have no silver available to me I have taken it. I also still had a claim of 16 shekels 15 grains of silver from the goods transported by the son of Irnuid. In all: 2 5/6 minas 7 1/3 shekels have been deducted, so the rest of your silver is 2 1/6 shekels. It has been spent for you.

src: 0.33333 ma-na 3 GIN KU.BABBAR li-ti SIG5 i-se-er si-li-{d}ISKUR DUMU na-ap-li-is su-ku-bu-um i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-nu-nu u PUZUR4-a-sur a-na ITU.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM-im u-sa-ab ITU.KAM te-i-na-tim li-mu-um a-la-hu-um DUMU i-na-ah-i-lim IGI ar-si-ah IGI PUZUR4-i-li DUMU i-ku-pi-a
tgt: Silli-Adad s. Naplis owes Šū-Kūbum 1/3 mina 3 shekel fine quality silver. He will pay a month from ḫamuštim of Šū-Nunu and Puzur-Aššur. If he does not pay (on time), he will add (interest) at the rate of the colony each month. Witnesses: Arši-aḫ, Puzur-ilī s. Ikuppiya.

src: KISIB su-ma-a DUMU i-ni-a KISIB i-di-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-i-di KISIB si-la-{d}ISKUR DUMU na-ap-li-is 40 ma-na URUDU ma-si-am i-se-er si-la-{d}ISKUR {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li i-su-u is-tu SAG ITU.KAM be-el-ti-E.GAL-lim a-na ITU.3.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 ma-na.TA i ITU.KAM a-na bi4-il5-tim si-ib-tam u-sa-ab li-mu-um sa qa-ti a-sur-na-da URUDU sal-ma-am i-na wa-ah-su-sa-na i-sa-qal
tgt: Seals: Šumaya s. i-ni-a, Idī-Ištar s. Aššur-idī, Şilli-Adad s. Naplis. Ṣilli-Adad owes Adad-ṣulūlī 40 minas refined copper. He will pay 3 months from the beginning of the month Bēlet-ekallim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1.5 mina per talent per month as interest. Eponymate: after Aššur-nādā He will pay the entirety of the copper in Waḫšušana.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma ma-la tup-pi-im sa su-ku-bi4-im sa a-su-mi su-ha-ri-im KU.BABBAR sa tu-di-ti-im ha-bu-lu 8 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-he-er-ma si-tam i-na u-mi-im sa e-ra-ba-ni sa-as-qi-il5-su-ma se-bi4-lam a-pu-tum sa-as-qi-il5-su i-di-{d}UTU tur4-da-nim
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā: In accordance with Šū-Kūbum's tablet according to which on account of the servant he owes silver for a fibula, deduct 8 shekels of silver and make him pay the rest the very day he arrives, and send it to me. Please, make him pay. Send me Iddin-Šamaš.

src: a-na u-zu-a ma-sa a-su-mi a-bi-a a-sur-ma-lik a-mur-a-sur su-a-nim a-sur-i-mi-ti u a-mur-ISTAR qi-bi-ma um-ma il5-mi-ti-ma 4.16666 GIN KU.AN SIG5 DIRI ku-nu-ki-a a-mur-a-sur su-a-nim a-sur-i-mi-ti u a-mur-ISTAR na-as-u-ni-ku-nu-ti a-hu-u-a a-tu-nu a-ma-kam KU.AN a-na si-mi-im di-na-ma a-se-er 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa i-di-a-bi4-im sa a-mur-a-sur a-se-er ni-si-ni na-as-u u a-tu-nu i-na si-im KU.AN 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-un-ka-ma a-na a-mur-a-sur di-na-ma a-se-er ni-si-ni lu-bi-il5 a-na si-ti KU.BABBAR si-im a-mu-tim a ma-la KU.BABBAR i-za-ku-u a ma-la na-as-pe-ra-ti-a pi-ri-ka-ni sa-a-ma-ma ku-nu-ki-ku-nu a-na a-mur-ISTAR u su-a-nim di-na-ma lu-ub-lu-nim-ma a-na-kam pi-ri-ka-ni a-na KU.BABBAR li-tu-ra-ma KU.BABBAR-pi a-na-ku la-al-qe ne-ma-lam a-na a-mur-ISTAR u su-a-nim li-il5-qe-u ma-la a-mu-tam i-na-di-nu i-na na-as-pe-er-ti-ku-nu lu-up-ta-nim
tgt: To Uzuwa, Mazāya, Šumī-abiya, Aššur-mālik, Šū-Anum, Aššur-imittī, and Amur-Ištar, from Ilī-imittī: Amur-Aššur, Šū-Anum, Aššur-imittī, and Amur-Ištar bring to you 4 1/6 shekels extremely fine iron under my seal. Let them take the profits for Amur-Ištar and Šū-Anum. Write in your (pl.) report how much iron is sold.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 im-di-DINGIR su-be-lim sa-lim-a-sur u-sur-sa-ISTAR u a-na-ah-i-li qi-bi-ma mi-ma tup-pi sa a-na-ah-i-li na-as-a-ku-nu-ti-ni lu sa bu-ru-tim na-as-pa-ra-tim ub-lu-su-ni er-sa-su-ma su-be-lum is-ti-ku-nu si-ta-me-a li-is-ta-me su-be-lum ki-ma i ka-ni-is la wa-as-bu la i-de8 a-li-ki sa a-lu-lu <gap> ha us-ha-<gap>
tgt: From Aššur-imttī to Pūšu-kēn, Imdi-ilum, Šū-Bēlum, Šalim-Aššur, Uṣur-ša-Ištar and Anaḫ-ilī: Request of him as to what tablets Anaḫ-ilī brought to you, or shipments which they brought to him from Burrudum and read them with Šū-Bēlum. Let him read! Šū-Bēlum did not know that he was not in Kanesh. ... the travelers ... of/which Alulu ...

src: um-ma su-ISTAR-ma a-na a-la-hi-im u a-sur-na-da 4.5 ku 1 GU 10 ma-na SIG.HI 1 TUG ra-qa-tum 17 GIN KU am-ma-ku-wa se-si-a-nim i-li-na-am a-na ta-ad-mi-iq-ti-a sa-ab-ta-su-ma ma-la e-bu-ku-ni-ni sa-am-tam ra-ku-us da-na-at-ku-nu qi-ib-a-su-um su-ma a-hu-a-tu-nu a-na a-wa-at tup-pi-im i-hi-id
tgt: From Šū-Ištar to Alāhum and Aššur-nādā:

src: 2.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er PUZUR4-a-na su-be-lum i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-ma-lik u i-na-a 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM a-na ma-na-im u-sa-ab ITU.KAM be-el-ti-kal-lim li-mu-um a-sur-na-da pu-su-ke-en6 qa-ta-ta-tum IGI ni-mar-ISTAR DUMU im IGI a-ni-na <big_gap><gap>
tgt: Puzur-Anna owes Šū-Bēlum 2 5/6 minas refined silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels as interest per month per mina from the Month: Belti-kallim Year: Aššur-nādā Pūšu-kēn is the guarantor. Nimar-Ištar son of Idī-Kūbim (erased); Anina son of (erased).

src: um-ma wa-ak-lum-ma a-na ka-ri-im ka-ni-is{ki} qi-bi-ma tup-pa-am sa di-in a-lim{ki} sa a-su-mi KU.GI sa ni-is-pu-ra-ku-nu-ti-ni tup-pu-um su-ut a-ku-us a-su-mi KU.GI i-su-ur-tam u-la ne-su-ur a-wa-tum sa KU.GI pa-ni-a-tum-ma a-hu-um a-na a-hi-im a-na si-mi-im i-da-an ki-ma a-wa-at na-ru-a-im DUMU a-sur-su-um-su KU.GI a-na a-ki-di-im a-mu-ri-im u su-bi-ri-im ma-ma-an la i-da-an sa i-du-nu u-la i-ba-la-at
tgt: From the waklum to the Assyrian colony at Kanesh: The tablet of the verdict of the city concerning the gold which we sent to you As for the gold, we did not ... a document. The matter of the previous gold, one sold to another...? According the word of the stele: no Assyrians will sell any gold to Akkadians, Amorites, or northerners.

src: um-ma bu-zu-ta-a-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u a-sur-e-mu-qi qi-bi-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-hi a-ta be-li a-ta a-na ma-ma-an la ta-ta-ka-al su-ma a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku la-su i-hi-id-ma KU.BABBAR lu sa e-zi-bu lu sa si-ib-tim me-eh-ri-a a-mu-ur-ma za-ki-a-ma a-sur-e-mu-qi la i-sa-hu-ur tur4-da-su su-a-ti u-qa-a-su su-ma is-tu bu-ru-us-ha-dum mi-ma la u-se-bi4-lu-nim KI tup-pi-a u ku-nu-tum te-er-ta-ak-nu li-li-ik su-ma a-sur-e-mu-qi sa-he-er KU.BABBAR 10 ma-na u 20 ma-na KI ba-ti-qi-im se-bi4-lam
tgt: Buzutaya to Pūšu-kēn and Aššur-emūqī: To Pūšu-kēn: My dear brother! You must not trust anyone! If Aššur-taklāku is not available, take care to inspect the silver, both the leftovers(?) and the interest of my list and clear (these things) and not detain Aššur-emūqī. Send him here. I am awaiting him. If they did not send me anything from Purušḫattum, let your message go with my tablet and yours. If Aššur-emūqī is delayed, send 10 minas or 20 minas silver with the express messenger.

src: 18.83333 ma-na 6.25 GIN KU.BABBAR ah-sa-lim a su-mi ISTAR-ba-ni a-na a-sur-mu-ta-pi-il5 is-qu-ul tup-pu-su ha-ar-mu-um sa 15 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa ku-nu-uk ISTAR-ba-ni is-ti ah-sa-lim i-ba-si u tup-pu-um sa ki-la-li-su-nu a-na ISTAR-ba-ni a-sur-mu-ta-pi-il5 ha-bu-lu tup-pu-um su-a-ti ni-di-in-ma i-du-uk is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa qa-si-im DINGIR-lu-um sa-pa-tam i-li-ik-ma ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mi-im i-di-a-hi-im 1.25 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im sa E ka-ri-im ta-ur-ma IGI ku-lu-ma-a IGI DU10-si-la-a-sur IGI su-en6-na-da IGI ma-nu-um-ki-a-sur DUMU su-be-lim
tgt: Witnesses: Kulumaya, Ṭāb-ṣilli-Aššur, Suen-nādā, Mannum-kī-Aššur s. Šū-Bēlim.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-se-er 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa a-na {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni as-pu-ru u a-ta 10 ma-na i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-a ra-di-ma 15 ma-na KU.BABBAR u KU.GI ma-la tu-ba-la-ni i-na a-wi-tim sa ILLAT-tim ki-ma KU.BABBAR ik-ri-bu-ni wa-di-ma sa-du-a-tam i-na ha-ra-nim la i-la-ma-ad 6 GIN KU.GI sa pa-na-ka 7 GIN is-ti hu-ra-sa-nim i-na e-ra-bi4-su-ma sa-as-qi-il5 0.5 ma-na KU.GI u ni-is-ha-su i-la-ab-ra-at-ba-ni li-di-na-kum 6 GIN KU.GI is-ti a-gu-a DUMU DU10-a-sur i-na a-la-ki-ka sa-as-qi-il5-su
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: In addition to the 5 minas silver about which I wrote to Ilabrat-bāni, you also add 10 minas from my silver and declare the silver and as much gold and you can carry and declare it in the awītum assessment as my votive funds so that it does not accrue shipping charges in the caravan. 6 shekels gold from Panaka. 7 shekels from Ḫuraṣānum, make him pay at his arrival. Let Ilabrat-bāni give you the 1/2 mina gold and its excise duty. Collect the 6 shekels gold from Agua s. Ṭāb-Aššur at your departure.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma la-ma-si-ma i-nu-mi a-na-kam wa-as-ba-ti-ni a-na a-sur-ma-lik 1 TUG ka-ab-tam a-di-sum u i-na tu-wa-ri-su 1 TUG kam-tam 3 {TUG}ku-ta-ni a-di-sum mi-sum TUG.HI.A sa us-te-ne-ba-la-ku-ni ub-lu-ni-ku-ni la ub-lu-ni-ku-um te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam-ma li-bi4 lu i-de8 u a-na su-mi TUG.HI.A sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni um-ma a-ta-ma sa-hu-ru la dam-qu la i pi-ka-ma u-sa-he-er-su u u4-ma-am ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma 0.5 ma-na.TA a-na su-ba-ti-ka ra-di-i ur-ta-di u u-ra-ni a-na sa ki-ma ku-a-ti a-su-mi gu5-su-ri u-ka-i-nu gam-ra-am ma-di-is is-ta-ka-an u-la ag-ra-am e-gu5-ur a ba-as-ti-ka ne-ta-ri-is la-at-kam is-am la eb-ra-am sa 10 GIN URUDU il5-qe u gu5-su-ri 8 sa a-hi-ka il5-qe URUDU sa a-na gu5-su-ri ta-di-nu-su-ni mi-ma la i-di-nam 1 TUG-na-ma-su-ha-am sa a-ha-ha a-na su-ha-ri-im i-li-ba-ni na-si-sum i-na wa-ar-ki-u-tim 1 TUG-ni-ib-ra-ra-am u-se-ba-la-sum
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Lamassī: When you were staying here, I gave 1 heavy textile to Aššur-mālik. Also, when he returned, I gave to him 1 kamtum textile and 3 kutānum-textiles. Why is it that the textiles which I keep sending to you, which he (is supposed to) bring, he does not bring to you? Let your message come and so inform me. Also, concerning the textiles about which you wrote, you said, "They are too small. They are no good!" Was it not according to your request that I made them smaller? Also, when you wrote me(?), you said, "Raise a 1/2 mina each for your textiles." I raised it. Also, Urāni did settle the logs to your representative, concerning the beams he confirmed. I did not exhaust it. Also, he took the beams belonging to your brother. The copper which you gave to him for the beams he did not give at all. Ilī-bāni brought to the youth a namšuḫam-textile belonging to Aḫaḫa. Later, I will send a nibrarum-textile to him.

src: a-na su-a-nim qi-bi-ma um-ma si-la-ma-si-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma KU.BABBAR sa ta-ad-mi-iq-ti-ki PUZUR4.ISTAR li-di-na-ki-im e-ri-su-ma um-ma su-ut-ma mi-ma u-la i-di-in a-hi a-ta KU.BABBAR sa TUG.HI-ti-a u sa a-mu-tim sa na-ni-a ub-la-ku-ni KU.BABBAR-pi i pa-ni-ti-ma se-bi-lam
tgt: To Šū-Anum, from Šī-lamassī: You wrote me. You said, "Let Puzur-Ištar give you the silverof your tadmiqtum." He asked him, and he said, "He did not give (the silver)." My dear brother, send me the silver from my textiles, and from the iron, and that which Naniya brought to you at the earliest opportunity.

src: KISIB e-na-su-in DUMU i-li-a-lim KISIB a-sur-DU10 DUMU ki-i-ki su-in-na-da DUMU en-um-a-sur u is-ma-a-sur DUMU hi-na-a tap-pa-u-ni su-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-ba-ni en-nam-a-sur DUMU sa-lim-a-hi-im u ma-nu-um-ki-a-sur DUMU a-hu-wa-qar i-na mi-ig-ra-ti-su-nu i-na wa-ah-su-sa-na i-bu-tu-ni-a-ti-ma a-mu-tam sa ma-nu-um-ki-a-sur sa a-na GAL si-ka-tim i-ni-id-nu lu URUDU us-a-am E su-ISTAR i-ba-si lu i-su-ur-tum lu URUDU i-na E.GAL-lim a-hu-ur lu URUDU i-na E.GAL-lim u-si-am 3-su-nu a-na KU.BABBAR u-ta-ru-ma KU.BABBAR a-na ka-ni-is i-la-ak-ma su-ISTAR en-nam-a-sur u ma-nu-um-ki-a-sur a-na tup-pe-su-nu u da-na-ti-su-nu e-ta-u u-la ra-ab-su a-di e-ta-u-ni a-hu-um i pa-ni a-hi-im mi-ma u-la i-la-qe a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um ka-ni-is i-di-ni-a-ti-ma IGI GIR sa a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in
tgt: Seal of Ennam-Suen, son of Ilī-ālum, seal of Aššur-ṭāb, son of Ki'ki; Suen-nādā, son of Ennam-Aššur, and Išme-Aššur son of Ḫinnaya, were our partners. Šu-Ištar, son of Aššur-bāni, Ennam-Aššur, son of Šalim-aĭhum, and Mannum-kī-Aššur, son of Aḫu-waqar, by mutual greement seized us in Waḫšušana and as for the meteoric iron of Mannum-kī-Aššur that had not been given to rabi sikkatim, whether copper had come forth (and) is in Šu-Ištar's house, or there is an iṣurtu-document, or copper is still due from the palace, or copper has come forth from the palace, the three of them will convert it to silver and that silver will go to Kanesh and then Šu-Ištar, Ennam-Aššur and Mannum-kī-Aššur will discuss on the basis of their tablets and valid deeds without raising claims. Until they have discussed, nobody shall take anything before the other. For this matter the colony at Kanesh gave us permission, and before Aššur's dagger we gave our testimony.

src: um-ma a-sur-ba-ni-ma u sa-lim-a-sur a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma su-ma-a-bi-a u ma-num-ba-lum-a-sur i-li-ku-nim 8.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR ub-lu-nim ni-is-ha-su u-la wa-at-ra a ma-la te-er-ti-ka KU.BABBAR E DAM.GAR ni-si-ma si-ma-am ni-is-a-ma-kum 3 ANSE.HI.A ku-ta-nu 1 ANSE AN.NA u li-wi-su ku-a-u-tum ANSE.HI.A sa DAM.GAR a-ha-ma 0.5 ANSE AN.NA 1 ANSE ku-ta-nu mi-ma a-nim si-mu-um sa-im su-ma-a-bi-a a-na 5 u4-me-e wa-ar-ka ki-li-a u-si-am KU.BABBAR ap-ka a-di-ni la e-ru-ba-am ma-nu-um-ba-lum-a-sur is-ti wa-ar-ki-u-tim ni-ta-ra-dam a-su-mi sa DAM.GAR sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni um-ma a-ta-ma KU.BABBAR 0.5 ma-na a-na ta-ad-mi-iq-ti-a lu-ra-di-am ra-du-am u-la i-mu-a 1.5 ma-na ni-ih-bu-ul-ma 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-ti um-mi-a-ni i-na sa e-bu-ti i-na tup-pi-im su-mi DAM.GAR ni-il5-pu-ut ku-lu um-mi-a-ni 4 ma-na.TA i-di-nu-sum su-ma li-bi-ka a-ta a-ma-kam 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR si-ib-sum 1.5 ma-na sa ni-ih-bu-lu is-ti pa-ni-e-ma se-bi-lam lu nu-ta-er um-ma sa-lim-a-sur-ma a-hi a-ta a-na-kam ki-li-a e-ba-ru-tu-ni u-sa-zi-zu-ma it-ru-du-ni-su a-ma-kam a-wi-lum la-mu-tu a-pu-tum i sa-ha-ti-su i-zi-iz-ma a-na te-er-ti-su u a-su-mi sa a-zu-a i-hi-id a-pu-tum a sa-ra-<gap>-tim la i-sa-ku-nu-su-ma u i-a-ti a-na-kam la i-ma-ra-sa-am a-hi a-ta er-ra-ba-ni me-ra-ka e-ka i-se-ri-su li-li-ik la i-sa-la-at
tgt: From Aššur-bāni and Šalim-Aššur to Pūšu-kēn: Šuma-abiya and Mannum-bālum-Aššur arrived They brought 8 1/2 minas of silver. The excise-tax was not added. According to your instructions, we ... the silver (in) the house of the merchant and made purchases for you. 3 donkeys (loaded with) kutānum-textiles, 1 donkey (loaded with) tin and its wrappings are yours. A donkey belonging to the merchant, and separately 1/2 donkey(load) of tin and one donkey (loaded with) kutānum-textiles--all this, purchases made, Šuma-abiya departed five days after Kiliya. (There are) donkeys belonging to the merchant, and separately 1/2 donkey(load) of tin and one donkey (loaded with) All this, purchases made, Šuma-abiya departed five days after Kiliya. Your silver has not yet come. We will dispatch Mannum-bālum-Aššur with the next travellers. Concerning the matter of the merchant about which you wrote to us, you said, "Let him raise about 1/2 mina silver for my He does not want to raise the money. We borrowed 1 1/2 minas silver and we wrote 3 minas silver with the investors from the assets of the ebuttum-loan in a tablet under the name of the merchant. All the merchants gave each 4 minas of silver to him. If you desire, you yourself add 1 mina of silver to him. Send the 1 1/2 minas of silver which we owe immediately. We will return it. From Šalim-Aššur: My dear brother, when Kiliya arrived I enrolled him for service and then dispatched him. There, they are informed about the man. Please, assist him so that (he does) according to his instructions. Now take heed concerning the matter of Azua. Urgent! Do not set him for dishonesty(?) so that it grieves me here. My dear brother, keep your eye on Erra-bāni your son so that he does not act high-handedly.

src: KISIB na-ab-su-en6 KISIB a-mur-a-sur sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-ra-bi 1.3333300000000001 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa a-sur-SIPA is-tu ha-mus-tim sa tu-tu u su-a-nim 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sax-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-ra-bi
tgt: Seals of Nāb-Suen, Amur-Aššur

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU EN.ZU-na-da KISIB sa-lim-a-sur DUMU i-su-ri-ik KISIB a-sur-na-da DUMU su-{d}EN.LIL KISIB i-ri-si-im DUMU i-a-a sa hu-bu-ul i-ri-si-im 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa DINGIR-is-ti-kal u kur-ub-ISTAR 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im i-ri-si-im DUMU i-a-a
tgt: Seals: Puzur-Aššur s. ?, Šalim-Aššur s. Issu-rīk, Aššur-nādā s. Šū-Enlil, Erisim s. Iya. Regarding Erišum's debt of 2 minas refined silver owed to Aššur-rēʾī. He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest from the ḫamuštum of Iliš-tīkal and Kurub-Ištar.

src: KISIB ka-ri-im ka-ni-is ka-ru-um ka-ni-is di-nam i-di-in-ma um-mi-a-nu su-su-en6 u me-er-u su-su-en6 a-na e-ta-lu-ti-su-nu 3 a-hi-u-tim i-sa-bu-tu-ma a-na E su-su-en6 e-ru-bu-ma tup-pi-su i-la-mu-du la sa e-ra-ba-am la i-mu-u-ni si-bi4 i-sa-ku-nu-su-ma u a-li-u-tum e-ru-bu
tgt: Seal of the colony of Kanesh. The colony at Kanesh rendered a verdict: The Šū-Suen's investors and the sons of Šū-Suen will seize the three partners on their own authority and they will enter the house of Šū-Suen and read his tablets. Whoever cannot enter or is not able (to be there?), they will set up witnesses for him so that those will enter.

He will pay thirty (weeks) from the hamuštum of Ilī-bāni and Amurrum-bāni. Aššur-bēl-malkim owes 5 minas refined silver. Ennum-Aššur s. Puzur-Ištar owes 45 minas refined silver. Aššur-mālik s. Aššur-bāni owes 7 1/2 minas refined silver. He will pay forty (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of Šamaš-bāni and Elāli. He will pay twenty (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of Lāqēp and ḫa-bi-a-aḫ-šu.

tgt: Aḫ-šalim s. Buzutaya and Aššur-taklāku s. Al-aḫim owe Enlil-bāni 42 minas 1 shekel refined silver. They will pay 46 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Luzina. If they do not pay, they will add interest at the rate of 1 shekel per mina per month. Month: bēlet-ekallim Year: ša qātī Akūtum Aḫ-šalim s. Buzutaya and Aššur-taklāku s. Al-aḫim owe Enlil-bāni 40 mina refined silver. They will pay 35 weeks from the ḫamuštum ša Luzina. If they do not pay they will add interest at the rate of 1 shekel per mina per month. Dadaya s. Aššur-imittī owes Enlil-bāni 6 1/2 mina refined silver. From the month of Ša sarrātim, eponymate after Maṣi-ilī -city of Assur-to come up/travel up to-toward-Kaneš-to enter-5 months-to go-silver-pay If he does not pay he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Šū-Suen s. Iliya owes Enlil-bāni 3 mina refined silver. He will pay from the ḫamuštum ša kaššim ša qātī Ennanim, month Allānatim, year ša qātī Akūtum. He will add 1 shekel per mina per month as interest. Nāb-Suen owes Enlil-bāni 1 mina refined silver. He will pay 11 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Ennanim. If he does not pay he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels. Month: Kuzalli Year: Akūtum Nūr-kī-ilī owes Enlil-bāni 1 mina refined silver. He will pay from the ḫamuštum of Enna-Suen. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels. Aššur-taklāku s. Burkia owes Enlil-bāni 1 1/2 mina refined silver. He will pay 15 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Kurub-Ištar s. Al-aḫim. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels 1 mina. Month: ša sarrātim Year: Enna-Suen s. Šū-Aššur Lā-qēpim s. Šū-Aššur owes Enlil-bāni 1/2 mina refined silver. He will pay 6 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-taklāku s. Al-aḫim, month Teʾinātim, year Maṣi-ilī. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 2/3 shekel 15 grain.

He will pay 7 ḫamuštum-weeks from the ḫamuštum-week of Aššur-imittī and Puzur-sadūʾē. If he does not pay, he will add 1 1/2 shekels interest per month per mina. Month Ḫubur, Limmu-ship of Kūbiya servant of Išar-bēlī entrance.

src: ur-dam sa PUZUR4-<big_gap> DUMU <big_gap> a-na u-sur-sa-a-sur DUMU pu-ta-a i-na ha-mus-tim sa i-tur4-DINGIR u-se-er um-ma a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5-ma ur-dam i-na ha-mus-tim sa DUMU i-li-a-lim tu-ta-ra-am su-ma la tu-ta-e-ra-am 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR ta-sa-qa-lam um-ma u-sur-sa-a-sur-ma a-sa-qa-la-kum IGI i-di-ku-bi-im DUMU pi-la-ah-ISTAR IGI i-ku-pa-sa

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma PUZUR4-a-sur-ma 1 ma-na a-mu-tam sa be-la-num u DUMU e-la-li ub-lu-ni-ni ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma a-na KU.BABBAR u KU.GI di-in a-na URUDU la ta-da-si en-nam-a-sur i-na wa-ah-su-sa-na ag-ri-ma ki-ma KU.BABBAR la i-sa-qu-lu la a-di-su-um a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum e-ru-ub-ma ki-ma mu-si-um KU.BABBAR ba-at-qam i-sa-qu-lu um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-na hu-up-si-im ra-bu-ma la ta-di-si ka-ru-um is-me-ma um-ma su-nu-ma a-di mu-si-um la e-mu-ru a-na ma-ma-an la ta-da-si-i di-in ka-ri-im i-ba-si is-ti en-nam-a-sur u i-di-ku-bi4 as-ta-a-al um-ma su-nu-ma a-mu-tam a-na ha-ar-tu bi-il5-ma um-ma a-ta-ma si-bu-um a-na si-ip-ru-tim i-li-ka-ni a-na se-ri-ka u-se-bi4-la-ni a-mu-tam a-na a-wi-lim u-bi-il5-ma wa-ar-ki-u-tam i-di-na-ni um-ma su-ut-ma la-as-ru-up-si um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-na sa-ra-pi-im pi-i la a-da-na-kum um-ma su-ut-ma is-tu a-ta ta-ta-lu-ku la-as-ru-up-si-ma su-ma a-na la-mu-tim i-tu-a-ar lu-mu-un li-bi-im a-na su-a-ti u i-a-ti be-li li-ir-si a-mu-tam is-ru-up-si-ma 0.66666 GIN ki-is-ru-um e-li-a-am lu i-na sa-ra-pi-im lu i-na i-si-ra-tim mu-ta-e 4 GIN e-ta-ru a si-ti a-mu-tim 8 GIN.TA a-na KU.KI iq-bi-a-kum um-ma a-na-ku-ma e-es i-na a-<gap>-<gap>-ma
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Puzur-Aššur: You wrote me concerning the 1 mina of amūtum-mineral which Bēlānum and the son of Elāli brought. You said, "Sell it for gold or silver; do not sell it for copper." I initiated legal proceedings against Ennam-Aššur in Waḫšušana and I did not sell to him because he would not pay (the?) silver. I arrived in Puršḫattum and because the muṣium(?) was paying poor quality silver, I said, "Do not sell under any circumstances sell it to just anyone (a commoner?)." The colony heard and they said, "Until m. do not xxx . Do not sell it to anyone." There is a verdict of the colony. I enquired of Ennam-Aššur and Idī-Kūbī. They said, "Send the amūtam-mineral to Ḫartu." But you would say "A witness should come to the messengers!" (or?) "He should send it to you!" I took the amūtum-mineral to the man and afterwards, when he had sold it(?), he said, "Let me refine it." I said, "I will not give you permission to refine it." He said, "Let me refine if after you depart so that if it turns for worse, my lord will acquire bad will towards him and me." He refined the amūtum and 2/3 mina in lumps came up. Both from the refining and the tithe(?) he/it ... losses of 4 shekels. I promised you an 8 shekel rate in gold for the rest of the amūtum-mineral. I said, "It is too little." ...

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU su-en6-na-da KISIB MAR.TU-ba-ni DUMU ma-na-na KISIB sa-lim-a-sur DUMU i-su-rik13 KISIB zi-kur-i-li DUMU i-ku-nim sa 8.83333 ma-na 4.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er zi-kur-i-li a-sur-SIPA i-su u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-la-hi-im u e-na-ma-nim a-na 5 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-DINGIR li-mu-um sa i qa-ti i-di-a-sur DUMU ku-bi4-di-il5-qe-u ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul zi-kur-i-li DUMU i-ku-nim
tgt: He will pay 5 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Al-aḫum and Ennnānum. If he does not pay (on time0, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month.
