src: 1.5 ma-na 1.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-ISTAR pu-su-ke-en6 i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-i-mi-ti u PUZUR-sa-tu-e a-na 7 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i ITU.1.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab ITU.1.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um ku-bi-a IR i-sar-be-li <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> e-ru-ba-tum IGI u-ra-a IGI a-sur-DUG
tgt: Šū-Ištar owes Pūšu-kēn 1 mina 31 1/2 shekels refined silver. He will pay him 7 If he does not pay, he will add 1 1/2 shekels interest per month per mina. Month Ḫubur, limmu-ship of Kūbiya servant of Išār-bēlī ...entrance (KEL 97). Witnesses: Urāya, Aššur-ṭāb.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma ku-lu-ma-a-ma 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR u 0.66666 ma-na KU.GI ku-nu-ki-ka i-ku-pi-a ub-lam 7.33333 GIN.TA KU.GI ka ta-di-in KU.BI 4.83333 ma-na 3.33333 GIN ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma 15.5 ma-na 7.5 GIN KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI ku-nu-ki-a ku-zi-zi-a na-si a-na si-im E-ti sa DUMU i-su-ri-iq su-uq-la-ma tup-pi se-si-a-ma i-na qe-ra-be-tim i-na li-bi4 tup-pi-a su-uk-na-su sa ki-ma ku-a-ti u sa-lim-a-hu-um IGI 5 DUMU um-mi-a-ni ne-pi-sa-am ku-nu-ki-ka ip-tu-ru-ma ni-is-ha-tim il5-qe-u-ma si-ti ne-pi-si-im is-ni-qu-ma 14.5 ma-na 7 GIN-ma 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na na-as-par-ti-ka ba-ti-iq a-ma-kam i-na sa-qu-lim e ta-su-sa ki-ma {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR bu-tu-qa-e i-si-u-ma <big_gap> u 16 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-qu-lu-ni-a-ti-ma sa 17 ma-na KU.BABBAR si-bi is-ku-nu-ni-a-ti ki-ma 17 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na ma-la na-as-pe-er-tim sa {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni ni-il5-qe-u ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma 8 ma-na KU.BABBAR wa-ar-ka-tam u-se-ba-lam ki-ma ha-ra-num ma-a-tum u-<gap>-<gap>-ni me-eh-ra-at 8 ma-na-e 7.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR E tam-ka-ri-im ni-il5-qe SU.NIGIN KU.BABBAR-pi-ka 33.33333 ma-na 4-<gap> GIN SA.BA 3 me-at 50 ku-ta-nu 20.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR it-bu-lu 14 ANSE.HI.A 3 ma-na 14 GIN si-im-su-nu u-ku-ul-ta-as-nu 0.66666 ma-na 1 GU 5 ma-na AN.NA qa-tim 14 GIN.TA 4.5 ma-na 7 GIN KU.BABBAR-ap-su 5 GIN sa sa-e-tim 1.5 ma-na be-u-la-at 3 ka-sa-ri 6 GIN lu-bu-su-nu 16.5 GIN wa-si-tum 2 GIN i ma-sa-im im-ti 1.5 GIN lu-bu-us sa ku-lu-ma-a 10.5 ma-na AN.NA a-ha-ma ku-lu-ma-a na-si 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR-ap-su
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Kulumāya: Ikūppīya brought 5 minas silver and 2/3 minas gold under your seal. Your silver was sold at a rate of 1/3 shekels (silver). Its silver is 4 minas 53 shekels. You wrote. You said, "Kuziziya brings you 15 minas 37 1/2 shekels silver, its excise added. Weigh it out to the price of the houses of Issu-rīk's son and pull out my tablet and put it among my tablets in the storeroom." Your representatives and Šalim-aḫum opened the package under your seal in front of 5 merchant-class individuals and they took the excise and the cut(?) the remainder of the package and there was 14 minas 37 shekels and 1 minas silver was deducted against your documentation. There, you must not (disagree?) with the weighing. Because Ilabrat-bāni issi'd 1 mina silver as losses, and weighed out 16 minas silver to us, and we set witnesses for us for an amount of 17 minas silver and we took it as 17 minas according to the shipment of Ilabrat-bāni, (?) you wrote. You said, "I will send you 8 minas silver next." When the maatum caravan u-x-x-ni, we received at the house of the merchant the 7 1/2 minas silver as the equivalent of 8 minas. Altogether, your silver is 33 minas 24+x shekels. Thereof, Kulumaya brings 350 kutānum-textiles-they cost 20 1/2 minas silver,14 donkeys - their cost was 3 minas 14 shekels (silver), their feed was 2/3 mina (silver), 1 talent 5 minas hand tin at a rate of 14 shekels - its silver was 4 minas 37 shekels, 5 shekels for sa'itum(?)- 1.5 minas capital payment for 3 packers, 6 shekels for their outfitting, 16 1/2 shekels for the exit tax, 3 shekels losses from the purification, 1 1/2 shekels for the outfitting of Kulumaya, and 10 1/2 minas tin separately His silver (hire) is 45 shekels.

src: ka-ru-um di-nam i-di-in-ma tup-pa-am sa 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa a-na e-bu-tim PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU a-ta-a-a a-na pu-su-ke-en6 i-di-nu-ni ma-ru DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU a-ta-a-a u um-mi-a-nu tup-pa-am i-du-nu-su-ma i-du-a-ak a-na 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR DIRI sa pu-su-ke-en6 sa il5-qe-u-ni is-ti la-qi KU.BABBAR pu-su-ke-en6 e-ta-wu KISIB ka-ri-im ka-ni-is i-ta-ma pu-su-ke-en6 i-na GIR sa a-sur 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa PUZUR4.ISTAR a-na e-bu-tim i-di-nu-su-ni 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR u 0.33333 ma-na sa a-na si-a-ma-tim i-di-nu-su-ni si-a-ma-tum8 u e-bu-tum i-na ke-na-tim lu ga-am-ru-su-ni i-na KU.BABBAR a-nim mi-ma i li-bi-a la i-ba-si-u ki-ma ma-ru PUZUR4.ISTAR en-nam-a-sur DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR a-bu-sa-lim DUMU e-di-na-a i-ku-pi-a a-hu-su ki-ma PUZUR4.ISTAR ah-sa-lim a-sur-SIPA i-li-is-ti-kal u na-ab-su-en6 ki-ma um-mi-a-ni PUZUR4.ISTAR i ka-ri-im e-ta-wu
tgt: The colony issued a verdict that Māru the son of Puzur-Ištar son of Attaya and the investors will give (Pūšu-kēn) the tablet stating that 4 minas silver which Puzur-Ištar son of Attaya gave to Pūšu-kēn, and he (Pūšu-kēn) will kill it. In regard to the one additional mina of silver belonging to Pūšu-kēn which they took--after the taking of the silver Pūšu-kēn will make a statement. He (?) sealed (?) the seal of the colony of Kanesh and Pūšu-kēn before the dagger of Aššur, 4 minas silver which Puzur-Aššur gave to him for ebuttum, 3 minas silver and 1/3 mina which he gave to him for purchases--the purchases and the ebuttum he( they?) did (?) (Will?), in truthfulness, exhaust. From this silver there is nothing which I owe. The following swore (in agreement) in the colony: in place of Māru, Puzur-Ištar, (and) Ennam-Aššur, the sons of Puzur-Ištar--Abu-šalim son of Edinnāya and Ikūn-pīya his brother; in place of Puzur-Ištar--Aḫ-šalim, Aššur-rēʾī, Iliš-tīkal and Nāb-Suen; in place of the investors--Puzur-Ištar.

src: 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-ti nu-ur-ki-li a-na 7 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal IGI a-sur-DUG DUMU ki-ki IGI da-da-a DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti
tgt: Nūr-kī-ilī owes 2 minas silver. Witnesses: Aššur-ṭāb s. Kikki, Dadaya s. Aššur-imittī

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma su-ma li-bi4-ka i-na u4-mi-im sa tup-pa-am ta-sa-me-u 13.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI se-bi4-la-ma u a-na-ku 2-si-ta qa-te-en6 la-di a-di a-mi-sa-am lu-qu-tum sa ba-ri-ni e-li-a-ni si-ma-am sa ta-sa-pa-ra-ni la-as-a-am-ma lu-se-bi4-la-kum i-na u4-mi-im sa dan-a-sur a-mi-sa-am e-ra-ba-ni si-ma-am pa-ni-a-ma sa ta-da-na-ni KU.BABBAR-ap-ka a-ta le-qe u i-a-am a-ni-sa-am lu-ub-lu-nim a-di AN.NA ma-dum is-ti e-li-tim i-lu-ku um-ma a-na-ku-ma dan-a-sur i-na e-ra-bi4-im i-na AN.NA 1 GIN.TA e e-ti-qu-ma e i-di-nu ma-as-ka-tum wa-ar-ka-tam li-li-ik-ma 0.5 ma-na u 0.33333 ma-na a ba-ri-ni li-li-a-am
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: If you are inclined, on the day that you read this tablet, send me 13 1/3 minas silver, its excise added, and I, for my part, will deposit double (lit. two shares). While our shared merchandise travels up toward you, I will make any purchases which you write to me and send them to you. On the day that Dān-Aššur arrives there, you can take your silver from the first sales you make, so that he (Dān-Aššur) brings my silver to me. Until much tin goes with the caravan, I say, "Dān-Aššur, at his arrival, let them not travel overland for every shekels of silver, nor sell. Let the later deposit 'go' so that a 1/2 or 1/3 extra mina arises between us.

src: wa-ba-ar-tum sa u-la-ma di-nam i-di-ma pa-na-ka u a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 DUMU pu-su-ke-en6 a-na 2 ITU.KAM a-na ka-ni-is i-lu-ku-ma tup-pa-am sa ku-nu-uk a-bi4-su pa-na-ka u-ta-ar-ma a ma-la tup-pi-im sa ku-nu-uk a-bi4-su a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 pa-na-ka e-pa-al su-ma pa-na-ka a-na ka-ni-is la i-la-ak i-sa-par-ma sa ki-ma su-a-ti a-wa-tam i-da-sum ITU.KAM kan-mar-ta li-mu-um bu-zu-ta-a
tgt: The wabartum settlement of Ulama rendered a verdict that Panaka and Aššur-mutabbil s. Pūšu-kēn will go to Kanesh within two months time and Panaka will return the sealed tablet of his father and according to the tablet sealed by his father, Aššur-mutabbil will repay Panaka. If Panaka does not go to Kanesh, he will send notice and his representative will set the matter for him. Month of Kanwarta (ix) eponym of Buzutaya (REL 102).

src: KISIB be-lum-ba-ni DUMU a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim KISIB LUGAL-su-en6 DUMU ma-ni-a KISIB we-re-si DUB.SAR KISIB ni-mar-ISTAR DUMU PUZUR4-su-en6 12 GU URUDU si-kam SIG5 i-se-er ni-mar-ISTAR bu-za-zu i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ma-li-ba-a-sur ITU.KAM sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti sa-ma-a a-na ITU.2.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 ma-na.TA a-na bi4-il5-tim i ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab tup-pa-am a-ni-am a-na il5-mi-ti DUMU su-ISTAR ap-qi-id IGI a-sur-i-di-in DUMU su-ISTAR IGI i-di-su-en6 DUMU i-na-su-en6
tgt: Witnesses: Bēlum-bāni s. Aššur-bēl-awātim, Šar-Suen s. Ma-ni-a, Wer-rēṣi the scribe, Nimar-Ištar s. Puzur-Suen. Nimar-Ištar owes Buzazu 12 talents poor quality fine copper. He will pay 2 months from the of Šumma-libbi-Aššur, month of Ša kēnātim, eponymate after Samaya. If he does not pay 1 1/2 mina per talen per month will be added in interest. This tablet is entrusted to Ilī-imittī s. Šū-Ištar. Witnesses:Aššur-Iddin s. Šū-Ištar, Idī-Suen s. Enna-Suen.

src: um-ma in-bi-ISTAR-ma a-na la-qe-pi-im u si-la-{d}ISKUR a-na si-la-{d}ISKUR qi-bi-ma as-pu-ra-kum um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-di a-sur-ma-lik KU.BABBAR TUG is-qu-lu la ta-da-su-ma ha-ra-su la i-la-ak a-ta KU.BABBAR la tu-us-ta-as-qi-il5-ma a-wi-lam tu-ta-se-er u a-ni ki-a-ma te-pa-as ki-ma si-be-e ta-ah-ri-ma-ni ih-da-ma KU.BABBAR i-ku-pi-a-sur u E a-sur-ma-lik sa-as-qi-il5 <gap> ul sa-pa-tim ma-la a-na KU.BABBAR-pi-a la a-pa-lu-hu sa-di-a-su-nu as-pu-ra-kum um-ma a-na-ku-ma TUG.HI.A a-na lu-bu-us su-ha-ri sa is-tu 0.5 GIN 0.66666 GIN 1 GIN sa-a-ma se-bi4-lam a-ta pa-li-a-tim sa 1 GIN.TA u 1.5 GIN.TA tu-us-te-bi4-lam mi-si-it su-ba-ti pa-ni-u-tim la u-ka-al-ma a-ni-tam te-pa-as a-di ta-la-kam-ma is-ti-a ta-na-mu-ru TUG-ba-tu e-ma-ad-ka i-ba-si u-la TUG-ba-ti la SIG.HI.A la si-ma-am ti-su i-hi-id-ma ra-ma-ka za-ki-ma ar-hi-is a-tal-kam
tgt: Folgendermaßen Inbi'ištar. Zu Lāqīpum und Ṣilladad, zu Ṣilladad sprich! Ich habe dir geschieben, folgendermaßen ich: "Bevor nicht Aššurmalik das Silber für die Stoffe bezahlt hat, sollst du ihm nicht(s) geben und seine Reise soll er nicht antreten." Du hast ihn das Silber nicht zahlen lassen und hast den Mann freigelassen! Nun sollst du so handeln: Gemäß den Zeugen hast du . . . . . . . und wir waren achtsam. Also lasse das Silb[er des E]nbi'aššur und des Hauses [Aššu]rmalik, —Rs um welches mir zustehende Silber entspre[chend] (dem Werte) der Wol[lad]ung ich keine Furcht habe, sie (den Enbi'aššur und den Aššurmalik) deponieren. Ich habe dir geschrieben, folgendermaßen ich: "Stoffe für die Bekleidung der Diener im Werte von ½ Seqel, ⅔ Seqel (oder) 1 Seqel kaufe mir und schicke (sie) her!" Du hast pali'ātum-(Stoffe) im Werte von je 1 Seqel oder je 1½ Seqel mir geschickt. Ein Lager von früher (gelieferten) Stoffen habe ich nicht (in Händen). Dies also sollst du tun. Bis du herkommst, um dich mit mir zu treffen sind die Stoffe, (die) du (mir) auferlegt (hast), vorhanden. Weder Stoffe, noch Wolle, noch einen Kaufpreis (dafür) hast du (bei mir) gut. Sei achtsam! Folgendermaßen (läßt) Kasāsā (dir sagen) : "Komm schleunigst her!"

src: a-na a-mur-<gap> <big_gap> 6 GU AN.NA ku-nu-ku sa a-lim{ki} SA 1 su-uq-lam ap-tur4-ma 1 GU 3 ma-na as-ni-iq i-se-er-tam i-ta-su 12 ku-ta-ni li-wi-su 3 ANSE.HI.A mi-ma a-nim sa sa-lim-a-hi-im u i-a-ti sa ba-ri-ni 4 GU AN.NA ku-nu-ku sa a-lim{ki} 8 ku-ta-nu li-wi-su <big_gap> 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA ma-as-ra-am a-na-kam-ma KU.BABBAR mar-sa-am as-qul SU.NIGIN 12 GU 10 ma-na u u-tu-ra-u-su AN.NA 20 ku-ta-ni u 6 ANSE.HI.A i-lu-u-a i-ra-de8-a-kum a-hi a-ta ki-ma a-wi-lu-ti-ka e-pu-us-ma la-ma AN.NA sa ILLAT-tim e-ru-ba-ni AN.NA a-na KU.KI ta-er a-na ba-li AN.NA la tu-sar-su-ma i-di-ku-bu-um AN.NA 1 GU u 2 GU e-ri-is-ka um-ma su-ut-ma la-ag-mi-il5-su di-su-um a-pu-tum i-hi-id-ma AN.NA a-na KU.KI ta-er-ma KU.BABBAR ku-nu-uk-ma a-na i-lu-u-a pi-qi-id-ma KI a-li-ki pa-ni-u-ti-ma se-bi4-lam <gap> GU AN.NA <big_gap> <gap>-<gap>-ri la tu-ka-al di-su-nu-ma si-im-su-nu se-bi4-lam ILLAT-tum a-di <gap> u4-me e-ra-ba-am AN.NA di-in la tu-ka-al-su a-na 15 GIN AN.NA u 3.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR a qa-ti i-lu-a a-di-in
tgt: To Amur-Ištar from ... 6 talents tin under seal from the city in his debt I opened one sack and I checked 1 talent 3 minas. išertam itašsu .. 12 kutānum textiles their wrappings 3 donkeys, all this belongs to Šalim-aḫum and myself. 4 talents tin under seal from the city, 8 kutānum textiles their wrappings, ... 2 talents 10 minas tin masram, the tin and the silver marsam I paid out. In total, 12 talents 10 minas and its uturaúm tin 20 kutanum textiles, and 6 donkeys Iluwa brought to you. My dear brother, Be a man/ Act like a man and after the tin of the caravan arrives, convert the tin to gold. Do not release the tin for bali (PN? or purpose?) but idī-Kūbum requested a talent or 2 talents from you. He said, Llet me exhaust it." Give it to him. Urgent, take heed to convert the tin to gold, seal the (silver?) and entrust it to Iluwa and send it 9and him) with the first travelers. # talents tin ... do not retain Sell it to him and send their send the gained silver. The caravan, as soon as the caravan arrives, sell the tin. Do not retain it. I gave Iluwa 15 shekels tin for 3 1/3 shekels silver.

src: su-hu-bu-ur DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-is-ti-kal DUMU su-ka-li-a ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um a-sur-mi-ti ma-la-hu-um a-na 5 ITU.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-em i-na wa-ar-hi-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab
tgt: He will pay five months from the ḫamuštum of Aššuriš-tikal s. Sukkallīya, month ḫubur, eponymate Aššur-imittī the boatman. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: a-na DAM.GAR-ri-im qi-bi-ma um-ma su-ku-bu-um u i-li-a-ma a-na DAM.GAR-ri-im qi-bi-ma 17 ma-na KU.BABBAR u 2 ma-na KU.GI e-la ub-lam SA.BA 1.5 ma-na KU.GI 8.16666 GIN.TA ni-di-in KU.BI 12.33333 ma-na 2.5 GIN 0.5 mana KU.GI ku-bu-ur-si-num 6.66666 GIN.TA KU.BI 3.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR-pi-ka lu sa KU.GI-si-ka 32.66666 ma-na 2.5 GIN SA.BA 2 me-at 30 ku-ta-nu KU.BI 13.33333 ma-na 6.66666 GIN 2 GU 20 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku-ni 15 GIN.TA 9.33333 ma-na 9 ANSE sa-la-mu a-na ma-la te-er-ti-ka dam-qu-tim ni-is-a-am KU.BI 2.83333 ma-na 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR be-u-la-at 2 IR-di-su a-da-da il5-qe 4 GIN KU.BABBAR lu-bu-su-nu 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR be-u-la-at su-sa-a 2 GIN lu-bu-su 0.33333 ma-na 4 GIN KU.BABBAR be-u-la-at su-a-nim 2 GIN lu-bu-su 2 ma-na 3 GIN KU.BABBAR be-u-la-at 4 ka-sa-ri qa-di lu-bu-si-su-nu 10 GIN KU.BABBAR u-kul-ti ANSE 15.5 GIN KU.BABBAR wa-si-tum 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR u-nu-ut ANSE 3.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR sa sa-i-tim 4 GIN KU.BABBAR te-su-bi e-la il5-qe 50 ma-na AN.NA-ak qa-tim 14 GIN.TA KU.BI 3.5 ma-na 4 GIN 5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-na ma-sa-im im-ti mi-ma a-nim e-la i-ra-de8-a-kum sa se-ep e-la gam-ra-kum 8 ku-ta-nu sa 4 ka-sa-ri a-ha-ma da-ar-ku
tgt: To the merchant from Šū-Kūbum and Ilīya:

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma a-hu-wa-qar-ma i-na sa-ni-im u4-mi-im sa su-be-lum DUMU sal-ma-a-sur u-sa-ni ANSE-ri-a sa-ar-du-tim en-na-a-sur is-tu ma-sa-ra-tim u-ta-e-ra-am um-ma su-ut-ma KU.BABBAR si-im lu-qu-tim sa ap-qi-da-ku-ni di-nam-ma u pu-su-ke-en6 li-li-kam-ma is-ti-a le-ta-u um-ma a-na-ku-ma KU.BABBAR a-na ka-ni-is i-tab-lu a-lik-ma a-ta u pu-su-ke-en6 a-ta-wa-ma su-ma KU.BABBAR a-na sa pu-su-ke-en6 i-tu-ar su-ut li-il5-qe-ma su-ma a-na ku-a-im i-tu-ar a-ta li-qe-su um-ma su-ut-ma pu-su-ke-en6 li-li-kam-ma is-ti-a le-ta-u a-wi-lum si-ki u-ka-al u a-na sa qa-ta-tim i-ta-na-di-na-ni a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta ki-ma tup-pi ta-as-me-u tup-pa-am da-nam sa ka-ri-im li-qe-a-ma la-at-be-a-ma la-tal-kam i-na ha-ra-ni-a la ka-su-da-ku
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Aḫu-waqar: On the day after Šū-Bēlim son of Šalim-Aššur left, Ennam-Aššur brought my loaded donkeys (back?) from the watchpost. He said, "Give me the silver, the price of the goods which I entrusted to you so that Pūšu-kēn comes and negotiates/discusses with me." I said, "The silver which he brought to Kaneš came and you and Pūšu-kēn discuss and if the silver returns to the property of Pūšu-kēn, let him take it, and if it returns to your property, you (will) take it." He said, "Let Pūšu-kēn come and let him discuss with me." The man holds my fringe. And he is repeatedly giving me to the guarantors. My dear father and lord, when you read my tablet, take a strong tablet from the colony office so that I may get up and come. I must not be detained in my journey!

src: <gap> GU 13 ma-na URUDU SIG5 ha-bu-ra-ta-i-um sa-bu-ru-um i-se-er a-sur-ma-lik DUMU ta-ku-a su-i-da-da i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-{d}EN.LIL u e-la-li a-na ku-bu-ur u-ti-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qul i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na 10 ma-na-im 1 ma-na.TA URUDU u-sa-ab IGI bu-zu-li-a <big_gap> <gap>-bi4-im
tgt: Ḫaburatāyum Šabūrum owes x talents 13 minas good copper to Aššur-mālik s. Takua sú-i-dá-dá.

src: KISIB is-pu-nu-ma-an KISIB ta-li-a KISIB ta-li-is me-er-e-su sa a-ma-li-a-as KISIB <gap> 1 ma-na 9 GIN KU.BABBAR li-tam SIG5 i-se-er is-pu-nu-ma-an u ta-li-a u ta-li-is me-er-e-su pu-su-ke-en6 i-su i ha-ar-pi sa i-la-ka-ni <gap> na-ru-uq mi-is-lam se-am mi-is-lam ar-sa-tim u-su-bu
tgt: [Siegel des Išp]unuman; Siegel des [Tal]i'a, Siegel des Tališ, seiner [Söhn]e, aus Amali'aš; [Siegel des . . . . . . . 1 Mine] 9 Seq[el] [gutes] . . . . . . . . [Sil]ber hat [zu La]sten des Išpunuma [und] des [Tal]i' und des Tališ, seiner [Söhn]e, Pūšukēn [gut. In der kommenden Erntezeit] [werden sie . . Sack . . Krug . . Getreide] [die Hälfte des Zinses 'hinzufügen'].

src: 25 ma-na KU.BABBAR u sa-du-a-su a bu-zu-ta-a u im-di-lim IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti IGI e-nu-be-lim IGI a-mur-a-sur pu-su-ke-en6 ip-qi-du-ni-a-ti-ni-ni a-na en-um-a-sur DUMU sa-lim-a-hi-im ma-ah-ri-su-nu-ma ni-ip-qi-su-um
tgt: We entrusted to Ennam-Aššur son of Šalim-aḫum the 25 minas silver and its shipping charge which Pūšu-kēn entrusted to Buzutaya and Imdī-ilum (i.e. us?) in the presence of Aššūr-imittī, Ennum-Bēlum, and Amur-Aššur.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma ta-ri-is-ma-tum u be-la-tum-ma a-bu-ni a-ta be-el-ni a-ta KU.BABBAR sa ik-ri-bi4 lu sa a-ma-kam lu sa AN.NA sa i-sar-be-li ha-bu-la-ku-ni pa-he-er-ma ku-nu-uk-ma se-bi4-lam su-ma a-di se-pi-ka KU.BABBAR ta-ka-la KU.BABBAR i-nu-mi AN.NA ni-is-u-mu 4 ma-na a-na si-ib-tim ni-il5-qe KU.BABBAR a si-ib-tim la i-ma-i-dam ku-nu-uk-ma se-bi4-lam a-na ma-ma-an la ni-da-gu5-lu ni-da-ga-la-kum
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Tariš-mātum and Bēlātum: Our dear father and lord, the silver of the ikrībū-funds, and that is there, and from the tin which Išar-bēlī owes to you, gather and seal and send it here. If you will withhold silver from your cargo, when we purchase tin here, we will (have to) borrow four minas silver on interest. Do not increase (your debt of) silver on interest. Seal it and send it here. We would prefer do kindness to you rather than anyone else.

src: 2.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er da-da-a DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti GUDU4 sa su-en6 {d}en-LIL-ba-ni i-su is-tu SAG ITU.1.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU DINGIR-ba-ni is-tu ka-ni-is{ki} i-na e-ra-bi-su <gap> a-na pa-ni-su u-se-ba-lam me-eh-ra-at ta-ah-si-is-tim a-ni-tim is-ti pi-la-ah-a i-ba-si IGI pi-la-ah-a DUMU e-na-su-en6 IGI a-mur-ISTAR DUMU en-um-a-a IGI i-li-a-lim DUB.SAR DUMU ri-ma-a-nim
tgt: Dadaya s. Aššur-imittī the kumrum priest of Suen owes Enlil-bāni 2 minas 20 shekels refined silver.

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU su-a-nim KISIB a-sur-na-da DUMU PUZUR4-a-na 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-gu5-za u a-mur-{d}UTU a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa su-ka-li-a u ha-bi4-a-su a-na 15 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad ke-ni-su-nu ra-ki-is ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-gu5-za u a-mur-{d}UTU
tgt: Seals: Puzur-Aššur s. Šū-Anim, Aššur-nādā s. Puzur-Anna. Aguza and Amur-Šamaš owe Aššur-rēʾī 3 minas refined silver. He will pay 15 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Sukkallīya and ?. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: 15 GIN KU.BABBAR ti-re-e i se-er su-ul-mu-um-SIG5 DUMU a-sur-tak-la-ku da-a-a DUMU il5-ba-ni i-su ITU.1.KAM su-en6 li-mu-um sa qa-at qa-tim pi-la-ah-su-en6 DUMU i-ku-nim IGI e-a-a-bu-su DUMU DU10-a-sur IGI a-sur-ta-a-a-ar DUMU dan-e-a
tgt: Šulmum-damiq s. Aššur-taklāku owes Dāyā s. Ilī-bāni 12 shekels uncertain silver. Month: Suen Year: the year after Pilaḫ-Suen s. Ikūnim Witnesses: Ea-abušu s. Ṭāb-Aššur, Aššur-tayyār s. Dān-Ea

src: KISIB a-hu-qar DUMU <big_gap> KISIB PUZUR4.ISTAR-<big_gap> KISIB en-na-nim <big_gap> sa hu-bu-ul <gap> 10.33333 ma-na <big_gap> sa zu-pa u <big_gap> a-na 50 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-me-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul 0.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti <big_gap> <gap>-<gap> me-ra su-<gap> <big_gap>
tgt: If he does not pay at the fulfillment of his term, he will add 1/2 shekel per month, as interest. Month: ša kēnātim. Eponymate: after . . .

src: 1 TUG su-ra-am 8.5 GIN 2 {TUG}ku-ta-ni 14 GIN.TA pu-su-ke-en6 i-di-in i-nu-mi a-na si-ka-tim i-na-a i-li-ku
tgt: Pūšu-kēn sold 1 black textile for 8 1/2 shekels and 2 tiles for 14 shekels each, when Innāya went to the.

src: 0.5 ma-na 0.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-ku-bi-im i-di-ISTAR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa u-ra-a u kur-ub-ISTAR 1 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab li-mu-um al-DU10 ITU.KAM sa ke-na-tim IGI a-sur-tu-ku-ul-ti IGI a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5
tgt: Šū-Kūbim owes Idī-Ištar 1/2 mina 1/3 shekel refined silver. He will pay 1 shekel per month from the ḫamuštum ša Ūraya and Kurub-Ištar. Year: Āl-ṭab Month: ša kēnātim Witnesses: Aššur-tukultī, Aššur-muttabbil

src: a-na a-sur-mu-ta-bil qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-ma-lik u a-sur-ma-lik-ma 0.25 ma-na 6.33333 GIN KU.GI sa a-sur-ma-lik-ma ub-la-ni 8.83334 GIN.TA-ma ta-di-in 3.83333 ma-na 2.6666600000000003 GIN KU.BABBAR-ap-su SA.BA 9.66667 GIN KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-tim ni-di-in 0.33333 ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im e-ma-ri-im u u-nu-su 2 GIN wa-si-tum 1.5 GIN na-ru-qa-tum 5 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na {d}UTU-ta-ak-la-ku ni-di-in 2.83333 ma-na 5 GIN AN.NA qa-tim 12.5 GIN KU.BI 22 TUG.HI.A 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR-ap-su-nu 1 ANSE sa-la-mu-um mi-ma a-nim ku-nu-ki-a a-sur-ma-lik-ma na-as-a-ku-um
tgt: To Aššur-mutabbil from Aššur-mālik and Aššur-mālik: The 21 1/3 shekels gold that Aššur-mālik brought was sold at an 8 5/6 shekel rate. Its silver is 3 minas 52 2/3 shekels silver. Thereof, we gave 9 2/3 shekels (silver) as the excise tax. The price of the donkey and its equipment was 22 shekels. The exit-tax was 2 shekels (silver). The sacks were 1 1/2 shekels. We gave 5 shekels silver to Šamaš-taklāku. 2 minas 55 shekels hand tin, its silver value 12 1/2 shekels, 22 textiles, their price 3 minas silver, 1 black donkey--all this the same Aššur-mālik brings you under my seal.

src: 40 ma-na <big_gap> URUDU i-se-er ku-za-ri su-en6-na-da i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa hu-ra-sa-nim a-na 10 ma-na URUDU 1 ma-na.TA i-na ITU u-sa-ab is-tu ITU si-bi-bi-ri-im li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-di-a-sur DUMU ku-bi-di IGI bur-nu-nu DUMU a-sa-a IGI su-a-sur DUMU su-su-en6
tgt: Kuzāri owes Suen-nādā 40 minas copper. He will add 1 mina per 10 minas copper per month (as interest) from the week of Ḫuraṣānum. From the month of Zibiburum, eponymate after Idī-Aššur s. Kūbi-idī.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma be-la-tum u ta-ri-is-ma-tum-ma a-se-er 8 ma-na KU.BABBAR u si-ba-ti-su sa a-na E a-la-hi-im ha-bu-la-ni-ni 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na si-ib-tim ni-il5-qe-ma a-na DUMU qa-a-tim ni-is-qul a-bu-ni a-ta a-na ma-nim sa-nim ni-da-gal KU.BABBAR sa-ak-ni-ik-ma lu-se-bi-lam a-bu-ni a-ta a-na ma-nim sa-nim ni-da-gal su-ma i-na su-ha-ri KU.BABBAR mi-ma e-ri-is-ka um-ma su-ut-ma qa-ti di-nam mi-ma la ta-da-an u a-na a-la-ma qi-bi-ma tup-pa-am sa a-lim{ki} nu-ka-al sa a-di er-bu-um u hu-bu-lu-um <big_gap><gap> sa-bu-u <big_gap> hi-ir mu-ra-su ra-bi-im sa a-lim{ki} di-na-si
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Bēlātum and Tariš-mātum: Regarding the 8 minas silver and its interest which we owe to the house of Al-āḫum, we borrowed 6 minas silver on interest and we paid it to the son of Qayyātum. Our dear father, to whom else can we turn? Cause silver to be sealed and send it here. Our dear father, to whom else can we turn? If anyone asks you for silver from my youth, saying, "Give me my possession!", do not give him anything. Also say to ?Alama?, "We have the tablet of the city." Fulfill the things which are not yet arrived (but)? owed ??? ... give it (f.) ... the cheif of the city ...

src: 2.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-mur-a-sur u ta-am-ri-a en-um-a-sur i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-tur4-DINGIR a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 3 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM a 1 ma-na-im u-su-bu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu u ke-ni-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI a-su-a-ah-su IGI pe-ru-a-li IGI ha-pu-a-su
tgt: Amur-Aššur and Tamrīya owe Ennum-Aššur 2 1/2 minas refined silver. They will pay in 10 weeks from the hamuštum-week of Itūr-ilī. If they do not pay, they will add 3 shekels per mina per month. The silver is bound to their heads, their health, and their trust. Witnesses: Ašuaḫšu, Peruwali, Ḫappu-ašu.

src: a-na a-la-hi-im e-me-me u si-sa-ah-su-sar qi-bi-ma 0.33333 ma-na 1 GIN KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-a PUZUR4-a-sur na-as-a-ku-nu-ti e-si u qa-nu-e ti-sa-a-ma sa GU4.HI.A sa-da-dim li-is-du-du-nim sa a-ma-kam-ma <big_gap> sa ma-zi-ri-<gap> ma-la-hi u ha-ba-sa-tim sa-mi a-pu-tum mi-ma su-mi-su lu er-su-ma i-na e-ra-bi4-a-ma lu-ra-ti-ib su-ma TUG.HI.A sa su-su-en6 u i-a-ti is-tu ur-su ub-lu-nim a-ma-kam-ma di-na-ma si-im-su-nu zu-za a-ni-um a-na-kam i-ta-an-ki-is su-ma ku-tu-pi-is KU.BABBAR mi-ma e-ri-is di-na-su-um
tgt: To Alāhum, Ememe and Šišahšušar (From Aššur-nādā): Puzur-Aššur is on his way to you with 1/3 mina 1 shekel of silver under my seal. Buy fire-wood and reeds, and have the oxen haul as much of what is there as they can; Buy malahum and habašatum utensils for the maziru tin. Please may everything be ready so I can move quickly as soon as I arrive. If they brought the textiles belonging to Šū-Suen and myself from Uršu, then sell them there and divide the proceeds. This one was set aside here. If Kutubiš asks for any silver then give him some.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma i-ku-nu-um kur-ub-ISTAR u hu-ra-sa-num-ma 75 ku-ta-nu 6.33333 ma-na 9 GIN KU.BABBAR it-bu-lu 15 ma-na AN.NA qa-tim KU.BABBAR su 1 ma-na 4 GIN 3 ANSE.HI.A 0.66666 ma-na 4.25 GIN 8 GIN u-nu-ut ANSE 0.5 ma-na 4 GIN be-u-la-at ka-sa-ri-im 4.5 GIN wa-si-tum SU.NIGIN 9 ma-na 3.75 GIN KU.BABBAR su-ma-bi-a u u-ra-ni i-ra-de-u-ni-ku-um KU.BABBAR a-ni-am E DAM.GAR-ri-im 1 ma-na-um 10 GIN ni-il5-qe-a-ku-um KU.BABBAR i pa-ni-e-ma se-bi-la-ma si-ib-tum ma-di-is i-se-ri-ka la i-la-qe-ma la i-ma-ra-sa-ku-um su-ma-mi-in is-tu tup-pa-ka ni-is-me-u KU.BABBAR ni-il5-qe ki ma-si-mi-in si-ib-tam nu-si-ib
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Ikūnum, Kurub-Ištar, and Ḫuraṣānum: Šumi-abiya and Urāni brought 75 kutānum-textiles, their price 6 minas 29 shekels, 15 minas hand-tin, its price 1 mina 4 shekels, 3 donkeys for 44 1/4 shekels, 8 shekels for the donkey's gear, 34 shekels for the be'ulātum of the driver, 4 1/2 shekels for the exit tax--in total 9 minas 3 3/4 shekels silver. For this silver, we took out (a loan of) 1 mina 10 shekels for you at the house of the merchant. Send the silver immediately so that the interest does not take you for much and disappoint you. If we did not take the silver after we read it from your tablet, we would not have on interest in this way ???.

src: 1 su-ba-at qa-qi-ri <big_gap> pa-si-u-tim sa a-na SES <big_gap> sa e-di-in-{d}a-sur <gap>-zu-u-ni sa te-hi sa ni-mar-{d}tas-me-tum DUMU ISTAR-<big_gap> sa qa-qi-ri sa ha-ta-ru <gap>-ma-a ur-ka-at i-na ri-sa-hu hu-ur-se-e DUMU a-mur-ISTAR a-na si-mi-im a-na 1.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR ti-ri u-zu-a DUMU e-di-in-{d}a-sur i-na mi-ig-ra-ti-su a-na ba-zi-e-en u {d}IM-ga-mil i-di-su-nu is-tu u4-mi-im e-di-in-{d}a-sur lu hu-bu-lu-su-nu a-na ba-zi-e-en DUMU {d}IM-<gap>-<gap> a-na DUMU.MES-su la i-tu-ru IGI sa-ma-a DUMU {d}UTU-ra-<gap> IGI se-li-bu DUMU {d}IM-ba-<gap> IGI la-ba-an-LUGAL.DINGIR.MES-ni DUMU ga-si-wa-<gap>-<gap> IGI <big_gap><gap>-ga-mil DUMU a-ba-ba ITU.1.KAM ab sar-ra-nim li-mu-um {d}a-sur-ma-lik
tgt: From today, Iddin-Aššur or his creditors will not return to Bazien s. Adad-... or his sons. Witnesses: Samaya s. Šamaš-ra..., Šabilu s. Adad-bani(?), Laban-šar-ilāni s. Gašiwa.., ..-gamil s. Ababa. Month: Ab-šarrānim. Eponymate: Aššur-mālik.

src: 0.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-ba-ni tam-ka-ru-um i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-tur4-DINGIR ITU.KAM sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti a-sur-i-mi-ti ma-la-hi-im 1.5 GIN.TA a 1 ma-na-im i-na ur-hi-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI i-di-ku-bi4-im IGI ku-ku-la-nim
tgt: Aššur-bāni owes the tamkārum 25 shekels refined silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month from the ḫamuštum of Itūr-ilī, month Ša sarrātim, eponymate after the one of Aššur-imittī the malāḫum officer.

src: 10.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-hu-ur-pi-a <gap> <big_gap> u ku-ur-ku-ra a-sur-na-da i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-a-nim u i-li-is-ti-kal a-na 3 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma i-na u4-mi-su-nu ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-lu 3 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-su-pu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu u ke-ni-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI a-sur-ma-lik IGI il5-ba-ni
tgt: Šuhurpia, Ma[ ... ] and Kurkura owe 10 2/3 minas 5 shekels of silver to Aššur-nādā. They will pay 3 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum week of Šu-Anum and Iliš-tikal. If they have not paid within their completed term they will add interest at the rate 3 shekels per month per mina. They are jointly responsible for the silver. Witnesses: Aššur-malik, Ilī-bānī.

src: a-na PUZUR4-a-sur qi-bi4-ma um-ma bu-za-zu-ma a-na sa-la-tu-wa-ar a-na te-er-ti-a e-ta-ra-ab ma-ki-ru-u a-di-ni la e-ru-bu-nim- ma um-ma a-na-ku-ma la-as-pur-ma AN.NA is-ti URUDU-i-ni a ba-ru-im lu-se-ti-qu-nim a-bi4 a-ta be-li a-ta i-hi-id-ma i {d}UTU-si tup-pi-i ta-sa-me-u su-pur-ma AN.NA-ki ma-la ta-le-e-u lu-se-ri-bu-nim-ma pa-ni-a-ma ab-kam a-bi4 a-ta a ma-nim sa-nim a-da-gal i-hi-id-ma su-ha-ru a-ma-kam u4-ma-kal la i-bi4-tu ha-ra-nam di-su-nu-ti a-na-ku a te-er-ti-ka ma-sa-ku pe-er-di sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni i pa-ni-a u-se-ra-am a-wa-ti sa DAM GAL si-se-e ma-la tag-mu-ru te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam
tgt: To Puzur-Aššur from Buzazu: I arrived at Šalatuwar according to my message. Buyers have not yet entered (the market). I said, "Let me send so that I can cause them to leave the tin with my copper." My dear father and lord, take care so that you you send (it) on the day that you read my letter, send as much of my tin as you can and dispatch them with the first caravan. My dear father, to whom else can I look? Take care to not delay the boys there overnight. Give them the caravan. As for me, I am mṣ' your instructions. The animals about which you wrote I will dispatch with the first caravan. Let your word come as to whether you have come to an agreement about the matter of the wife of the chief of horses.

src: {TUG}u-tu-up-lu bi-ra-qi
tgt: Utuplum textiles (belonging to) Biraqi.

src: hi-id-ri sa a-lim{ki} sa ar-ba-a-na-as
tgt: The ḫidrus of the city belonging to Arbanaš.

src: a-na a-sur-i-mi-ti qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en-ma 7 ma-na LA 3 GIN KU.BABBAR sa a-sur-SIPA u e-na-ma-nim i-li-is-ti-kal i-qi-pu-ni i-na u4-me-su ma-al-u-tim KU.BABBAR i-li-is-ti-kal u-sa-as-qi-il5-ma SA.BA 6.83333 GIN sa-du-a-su a-na u-sur-sa-a-sur a-di-in si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-ka 6.66666 ma-na 8.16666 GIN KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-a u-sur-sa-a-sur na-as-a-kum tup-pu-um ha-ar-mu-um sa 1 GIN KU.BABBAR lu i-na be-ti-a lu i-na E a-sur-SIPA lu i-na E e-na-ma-nim mi-ma la-su a-su-mi sa i-ku-nim sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni {d}ISKUR-ba-ni a-na ha-hi-im as-pur-ma qa-su i-na TUG.HI.A is-ku-un TUG.HI.A e-ru-bu-ni-ma a ma-la te-er-ti-ka KU.BABBAR u-sa-as-qal KU.BABBAR-ap-ka gam-ra-kum
tgt: To Aššur-imittī from Pūšu-kēn: 6 minas 53 shekels silver, which Iliš-tīkal entrusted to Aššur-rēʾī and Ennam-Anum, at the fulfillment of the term Iliš-tīkal collected the silver and thereof I gave 5 5/6 shekels, its šadduʾutum, to Uṣur-ša-Aššur. The remainder of the silver, 6 minas 48 1/6 shekels silver, Uṣur-ša-Aššur brings to you under my seal. Sealed tablet for (even?) 1 shekel silver is not in my house nor the house of Aššur-rēʾī nor even the house of Ennam-Anum. Concerning the matter of Ikūnum about which you wrote to me, I sent Adad-bāni to Ḫaḫḫum and he put his hand on the textiles. The textiles entered in and he collected the silver according to your instructions. Your silver is exhausted.

src: KISIB na-ni-a DUMU ha-a-a KISIB qa-ta-tim DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti KISIB u-su-pi-is-ki-im DUMU su-a-nim a-wi-lu-u a-ni-u-tum da-a-nu
tgt: Seal of Nannia son of Haya seal of Katātum son of Aššur-imittī, seal of Uṣup-iškum son of Šū-Anum; these men are the judges.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da u i-li-a-lim qi-bi4-ma i-na ba-ab ha-ra-ni-ka aq-bi4-a-kum um-ma a-na-ku-ma u-za-ka-ma a-sa-pa-ra-kum u-za-ki-ma a-wa-at DINGIR-li da-na a-pu-tum i-na u4-mi-im sa tup-pa-am ta-sa-me-u E-ti 2 GEME.HI-ti-ka ki-la-al-ti-ma u te-i-te-en6 ki-la-al-ti-ma a-na si-mi-im di-ma KU.BABBAR se-bi4-lam u E-tam ag-ra-ma ta-as-ba u su-ma sa-i-mu-um la-su a-tu-nu si-a-ma-a E ag-ra-ma ta-as-ba a-pu-tum a-na a-wa-at tup-pi-im ih-da ka-la-ma di-na su-ma la <big_gap> ta-di-na a-wa-at DINGIR-li da-na ta-ha-li-qa-ma lu KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na di-na-ma ti-i-ir-ta-ku-nu i-pa-ni-u-ti-ma <big_gap> li-li-kam u su-ha-ra-am a-se-er u-mi-su-ma <big_gap> tu-ru-ud <big_gap> SA la <gap> <big_gap> a-na <big_gap> li-ip-te-su <big_gap> nu-ta-ra-ga-ma DUMU ka-ri-a li-<gap> <big_gap> sa 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-qu-lu DINGIR-li be-el KU.BABBAR
tgt: From Aš[šur-idī] to Aššur-nādā and Ilī-ālum: When you were about to leave I said to you: "When I have cleared myself of obligations, I shall write to you.'" I have now cleared myself, and the words of the gods are urgent. Please, the very day you hear this letter you must offer for sale the houses, both of your slave-girls and both of the grinding-girls, and then send me the silver! Then you must rent a house and settle there. Further, should there be no purchaser, you must still leave (the house). Indeed, you must rent a house and settle there! Please, please, pay heed to the words of the letter! Sell everything! If you have not sold (everything)--as the words of the gods are urgent--you will perish! Do strive to give me every mina of silver and send word to me as soon as possible. Also, send my servant to the house of ... Bread ... for ... we shall return to you, and Karriya's son who has paid 1 mina of silver. My god is the owner of the silver.

src: a-na a-mur-ISTAR u su-a-nim qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma a-sa-me-ma da-ak-ni-is a-na a-lim{ki} i-la-ak <gap> <big_gap> sa i-ta-<gap> <big_gap> <gap>-<gap>-ni-ma qa-ti u-ka-lu KU.BABBAR li-di-na-ku-nu-ti-ma i-na KU.BABBAR-im <big_gap> qa-at-ku-nu <gap> <big_gap> sa-ak-na-at <big_gap> <gap>-<gap> um-mi-a-ni <gap> <big_gap> is-ti 2 sa <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> <gap>-pu-la-ni i 1 ma <gap> <big_gap> lu-sa-zi-za-ku-nu-ti sa-na-am lu a-na wa-ah-su-sa-na-i-e lu a-na ka-ni-si-e a-na ig-ri di-na-si-ma lu-ub-lu-ni-si a-na a-mur-ISTAR qi-bi-ma 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-di-na-ku-um um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-na sa ki-ma i-a-ti i-na a-lim di-in su-ma tu-se-bi-il5-su te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam su-ma la tu-se-bi4-il5 a-ni <big_gap> li-qe <big_gap>
tgt: To Amur-Ištar and Šū-Anum from Aššur-nādā: I hear that Dakniš is going to the City. Regarding the 20 minas of silver which he ... and I hold, let him give you the silver, lay claim to the silver on my behalf and entrust it to an affiliated trader. 1 mina ... let him make you the representatives. Give the šannu-kettle either to the men from Wahšušana or those from Kaneš as wages, and have them bring it. To Amur-Ištar: I gave you 1 mina of silver, saying: "Give it to my representatives in the City." Send me word if you have sent it. If you have not sent it, now, then send it with travelers, and write ... and seal my copper.

src: 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-na-bar a-sur-na-da i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa da-da-nim u a-sur-ba-ni a-na 44 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i ITU.KAM a 1 ma-na-em u-sa-ab a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qa-ta-tum IGI a-mur-a-sur DUMU DINGIR.SIPA IGI en-nam-a-sur DUMU i-li-ISTAR
tgt: Šū-Nabar owes Aššur-nādā 10 minas refined silver. He will pay 44 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum week of Dadāanum and Aššur-bāni. If he does not pay, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per month per mina. Aššur-taklāku is the guarantor. Witnesses: Amur-Aššur s. Ilī-rēʾī, Ennam-Aššur s. Ilī-Ištar.

src: 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er a-sur-na-da ha-ri-ma i-su is-tu ha-ra-nim i-na tu-a-ri-su 15 GIN KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal i-na sa-ni-tim ha-ra-nim i-na tu-a-ri-su-ma 15 GIN-ma KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal-ma u sa-bu-u IGI su-be-lim IGI pe-ru-a
tgt: ½ Mine Silber hat zu Lasten des Aššurnādā Ḫarima gut. Bei seiner Rückkehr von der (ersten), (Geschäfts)reise wird er 15 Seqel Silber zahlen. Bei seiner Rückkehr von der zweiten (Geschäfts)reise wird er wiederum 15 Seqel Silber zahlen; dann ist er (der Gläubiger) befreidigt. Vor Šūbēlum, vor Beru'a.

src: a-na PUZUR4-a-sur KISIB wa-qur-tim
tgt: Seal of Waqqurtum

src: um-ma hi-na-a sa ki-ma ku-a-ti u PUZUR4-a-sur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma i-na pa-ni-tim ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma 2 ma-na KU.GI PUZUR4-a-sur i-na tup-pi-su su-mi wa-qur-tim li-il5-pu-ut i-na wa-ar-ki-tim ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma 2 ma-na-e KU.GI a-na qa-ti-a ta-hi-a um-ma ne-nu-ma 2 ma-na KU.GI a-na qa-ti pu-su-ke-en6 nu-ta-ha um-ma PUZUR4-a-sur-ma is-tu-ma su-mi wa-qur-tim la ta-la-pa-ta-ni u a-na qa-ti-su la nu-ta-ha-a ni-is-ta-a-al-ma 2 ma-na KU.GI su-mi DAM.GAR-ri-im la-pi-it a-ta a-ma-kam ma-la-ka
tgt: Thus Hinnaya, your representatives, and Puzur-Aššur to Pūšu-kēn: Previously you wrote me. You said, "As for the 2 minas gold, let Puzur-Aššur write Waqqurtum's name in his tablet." Later you wrote me. (You wrote), "The 2 minas gold are credited to my account." (We wrote), "We will credit the 2 minas gold to Pūšu-kēn's account." Puzur-Aššur said, "Do not write Waqqurtum's name afterward", so we cannot associate it to her account. We will request so that 2 minas gold is written for the name of the merchant. Make your decision there.

src: a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma um-ma ku-ku-la-nu-um-ma 30 ma-na URUDU E DAM.GAR-ri-im 1 ma-na-um 10 GIN a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim u a-na-ku ni-zi-iz me-ra-ka u me-er-u-a e-ku-lu is-tu ITU.1.KAM na-ar-ma-ak-a-sur a-pu-tum i-hi-id-ma KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su se-bi-la-ma-ma DAM.GAR-ra-am lu nu-sa-bi u ma-la su-hu-ur-ka la i-ba-re-u-ni KU.BABBAR se-bi-lam <big_gap> i pa-ni-im-ma ba-ti-qi-im i-hi-id-ma KU.BABBAR ma-la se-bu-li-im se-bi-lam
tgt: Aššur-bēl-awātim and I have borrowed 30 minas of copper in a merchant-firm, at the (interest) rate 10 shekels per mina (monthly), and your son and daughters have spent it. (The loan runs from) the month Narmak-Aššur. Please, take care to send the silver and the accrued interest so we may pay in full to the merchant. Also, send silver so that your children do not starve. Take care and send whatever there is to send with an express messenger!

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u i-na-a qi-bi-ma um-ma su-ku-bu-ma a-su-mi sa ni-ka-si i sa-tim sa a-bu-ni i-mu-tu a-na ni-ka-si a-na-ku a-pu-uh a-bi4-ni a-zi-iz um-ma a-na-ku-ma su-mi a-bi4-a la u-qa-la-al si-hi-tu-su i-a-ti-me-en6 i-la-ak a-sa-me-ma si-hi-ti a-bi4-ni il5-ta-qe-u u da-tum ma-ri-is-tam a-di ar-be-e-su as-ta-qal ma-ti-ma i-nu-ma a ta-pa-e-a u sa ki-ma su-nu-ti e-ri-su-ma i-di-nu-ni a-tu-nu a-na i-a-ti e-na-na-tim la te-ri-sa-nim a-hu-a a-tu-nu ih-da-ma e-na-na-tim KI ka-ri-im er-sa u be-li-a er-sa-ni-ma ki-ma <big_gap> is-te-en6 u se-na <big_gap> a-bi-ni <big_gap> u i-a-ti
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn and Innāya from Šū-Kūbum: Concerning the matter of accountings in the year which our father died, I was the one who stood in place of our father. I said, "I will not dishonor the name of my father. Should not the clearing of his obligations go to me?" Should not the clearing of his obligations go to me? I hear that they received/declared our father's clearance from obligations. But I have paid a greivous It has always been that when I requested (clemency) for my partners and their representatives, they gave it, however you two, you don't request clemency for me. My dear brothers, take heed to request clemency for me from the colony office. Now, my lord, ask (clemency) for me so that ... one or two ... our father ... and to me.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma 1 GU AN.NA sa a-la-hi-im su-a-sur li-di-na-ku-ma 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-na e-ti-su su-qu-ul-sum ku-nu-ki sa a-lim{ki} 2 su-uq-le-en6 li-di-a-ku-ma is-te-et u-su-uq
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā: Šū-Aššur should give you 1 talent of tin that belongs to Alāhum, and then pay him 10 minas of refined silver promptly. He should place 2 containers under the seal of the City authorities before you, and then you choose one of them.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma a-su-mi ni-ka-si a-ni-u-tim as-pu-ra-kum um-ma a-na-ku-ma e-na-na-tim is-ti ka-ri-im e-ri-is-ma TUG.HI.A ma-la na-tu-ni a ni-ka-si-a su-ku-un u su-ma la-su lu <big_gap> lu TUG.HI.A lu <big_gap> i-nu-mi is-ti <big_gap> qa-ti <big_gap> KU.BABBAR <big_gap> 15 <gap> <big_gap> <gap>-<big_gap>
tgt: From Šalim+aḫum to Pūšu+kēn: I wrote to you regarding these accountings. Now, if there are none, the ... and textiles and ... when with ... account(?) ... silver ... 15 ...

src: a-na a-sur-na-da u su-a-sur qi-bi4-ma um-ma ga-ru-bu-a-ma a-mur-sa-ra-sa a-na wa-ah-su-sa-na as-pu-ur su-ma a-mi-sa-am i-ta-al-kam u ANSE.HI.A e-zi-ib-ma ANSE.HI.A im-tu-tu 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR be-u-la-tu-su 30 ma-na URUDU a-ha-ma a-na si-ib-tim i-la-ka-ni u-mu-su 3 ITU.KAM e-ti-qu 0.66666 ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR a-ma-su u-uk-ta-al u a-na si-ib-tim i-la-ak-sum 10 ma-na URUDU a-ha-ma ha-bu-lam a-hu-a-a a-tu-nu ka-ra-am mu-uh-ra-ma se-si-a-ni-su <big_gap> a ma-la tup-pi-im a-ni-im KU.BABBAR i-sa-qa-la-am li-is-qu-la-ku-nu-ti KU.BABBAR 0.33333 ma-na 2 GIN zu-zu-a na-si si-im li-bi4-su sa-zu-ku-ma la i-sa-hu-ur li-ta-al-kam ANSE.HI.A sa hu-ra-ma zu-zu-a li-it-ru-da-am ta-ah-si-is-tam li ba a ba ti a
tgt: To Aššur-nādā and Šū-Aššur from Karubua: As to Amur-šarrassa, I sent him to Wahšušana, and he has just left to go there. However, he left the donkeys and they have died. His working capital is 1/2 mina of silver, and interest accrues to him also on 30 minas of copper; his terms are overdue by 3 months. For 42 shekels of silver his maid is held as security, but interest still accrues for him. He furthermore owes me 10 minas of copper. My dear brothers, confront the colony, have him brought out so he pays the silver in accordance with this letter; he should pay to you. Zuzua brings 22 shekels of silver. Organise the purchase for him that he wants, do not delay but let him come here. The donkeys from Hurama Zuzua should send. The memorandum ...

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma 5 {TUG}ku-ti-nu sa a-sur-be-la-wa-tim sa i-na ku-nu-uk a-sur-i-mi-ti ka-an-ku-ni sa 13 ma-na.TA i-na a-lim{ki} it-bu-lu-ni i-na ba-ab wa-sa-i-su i-nu-mi a-na a-lim{ki} ha-ra-su-ni 2 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am me-eh-ra-tim di-su-um
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Assur-nādā: As to the 5 kutinnum textiles belonging to Aššur-bēl-awātim which were sealed with Aššur-imittī's seal, and which cost 13 minas (of copper) a piece in the City, give him 2 minas 5 shekels refined silver as their equivalent value when he is about to leave on a trip to the City.

src: 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er ta-mu-ri-a u is-pu-nu-ma-an a-sur-i-di i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ha-pi-a-ah-su u su-ka-li-a SA.BA 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-na ha-ar-pe i-sa-qu-lu 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR e-zi-ib ni-ga-lim a-nim a-na si-bi4-it ni-ga-lim sa-nim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma i-na u-me-su-nu ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-lu a-na 1 ma-na-im 3 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-su-bu KU.BABBAR i-na qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI me-zi-ni IGI da-da se i ni
tgt: Tammuriya and Išpunuman owe Aššur-idī 6 minas silver.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma a-su-mi i-di-su-en6 sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni i-di-su-en6 as-ba-at-ma i ma-ha-ar a-hi-ni um-ma a-na-ku-ma KU.BABBAR i-na ba-a-ba-ti-a ta-al-ta-qe KU.BABBAR-pi di-nam um-ma su-ut-ma mi-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-ka la al-qe u ni-ka-si u-ni-a-ni-ma KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na u 2 ma-na i-se-ri-a il5-qe AN.NA 1 GU KI sa-lim-a-hi-im a-na u4-me ni-il5-qe-ma a-na pu-ru-us-ha-tim u-se-ri-ib-ma ih-ta-al-qa-ni a-wa-at a-lim{ki} la ti-de8 a-na-kam a-ba-u-su im-ti-du-ma a-hi-ni nu-se-si-ib-ma a-su-mi KU.BABBAR a-na-kam ra-ka-si ni-is a-lim{ki} u-ta-mi-u-ni-a-ti-ma a-na 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR u-ma-gi5-ru-ni-a-ti is-tu ITU.1.KAM kan-bar-ta li-mu-um ib-ni-{d}ISKUR DUMU ba-qu-ni-im 1 ma-na.TA i-na sa-tim KU.BABBAR sa-al-ma-am i-na a-lim{ki} i-sa-qa-la-kum sa KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na u 2 ma-na si-ma-am na-si a-ma-kam sa-ba-su-ma ki-ma a-wi-lu-ti-ka e-pu-us a-pu-tum ra-ma-ka za-ki-a-ma <gap> i-na ha-ar-pe is-ti a-sur-ma-lik ti-ib-a-ma a-tal-kam su-ma AN.NA a-na e-bu-tim ta-al-ti-qi-i a-na u4-me i-se-er DAM.GAR i-di-su a-pu-tum i-li-a-lum is-ti is-te-en6 a-li-ki-im tur4-dam
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā: Concerning Iddin-Suen about whom you wrote, I seized Iddin-Suen and in the presence of our colleagues I said: "You have taken silver from my outstanding claims! Give me my silver!" He answered: "I have not taken any of your silver." So, he cheated me with the account, for he has taken at least 1 or 2 minas of silver at my expense. "Reckoned from the month Tanbarta in the eponymy of Ibni-Adad son of Baqqunum he is to pay 1 mina per year He carries goods worth at least 1 or 2 minas of silver. Seize him there and act as a gentleman. Please, free yourself of claims, set out and come at harvest time together with Aššur-malik. If you have taken tin as an investment loan, then give it in commission to agents on fixed terms. Please, send me Ilī-ālum with the first travelers.

src: um-ma {d}a-sur-na-da-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma TUG.HI.A sa en-na-a-sur tu-se-bi-la-ni en-na-a-sur u-la i-di-nam mi-ma sa se-bu-lim se-bi-lam-ma lu-da-mi-iq 18 TUG.HI.A is-me-DINGIR LUGAL.EN.ZU en-na-a-sur qa-ti-su sa-bu ir-de8-a-kum mi-su-um sa TUG.HI.A ma-ha-ra-am la ta-mu-u ma-ti-ma mi-ma u-la ta-ag-mi-la-ni a-hi a-ta li-bi la tu-la-ma-an TUG.HI.A li-qe-ma ki-ma ta-ga-mi-li-ni e-pu-us a-hi a-ta li-bi la tu-la-ma-an gi-im-la-ni u a-na-ku a-sar ga-ma-li-im u i-<gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap>
tgt: From Aššur-nādā to Pūšu-kēn: You wrote me. You said, Ennam-Aššur did not give me the textiles you sent to him. Send whatever is available so that I can be favorable. 18 textiles ... Išme-ilī, ??? Ennam-Aššur?? his account satisfied, brought to you. Why is that you refused to confront (him) about the textiles? You've never done me a favor! My dear brother, do not disappoint me. Acquire textiles and act so as to do me a favor. My dear brother, do not disappoint me. Do me a favor. And as for me, wherever there is a favor ...

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni-ma a-su-mi na-as-pe-er-tim sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni um-ma a-ta-ma tup-pa-am a-se-er sa ki-ma ku-a-ti la-pi-ta-ma tup-pi i-na a-lim{ki} li-di-nu-nim is-ti i-ku-pi-a-sur a-ta-al-ka-mi-in DUMU e-na-ma-nim a-na KU.BABBAR la-qe-e-em i-tu-ra-ma tup-pa-am sa se-pi-a al-te-qe u a-na sa-la-tu-ar e-te-eq-ma tup-pa-am sa se-pi-a a-la-qe-ma a-ta-bi4-a-ma a-ta-la-kam i-na a-la-ki-a pa-ti-a-ni-ma tup-pa-am lu-la-pi-ta-ku-ma tup-pi di-nam a-bi4 a-ta be-li a-ta bu-la-ti-a KU.BABBAR 4.5 ma-na KI ku-nu-ki-ka ta-as-ba-at-ma ih-ti-liq be-li a-ta tup-pa-am sa na-ab-su-en6 hi-ri-im ki-ma i-na si-im-tim i-sa-hi-ru-su-ni
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Ilabrat-bāni: Concerning the missive about which you wrote, you said, "Let me write a tablet to your representative(s) so that they give me the tablets in/from the city." Should I not depart with Ikūn-pī-Aššur, and the son of Ennamānum returne to take the silver, then I will take the tablet of my transport. Also (then?), depart to Šalatuwar and I will take the tablet of my transport and I set out and depart. At my arrival open so that I/he write a tablet to you and give me the tablets. My dear father and lord, as for my be'ulātum arrangement, ou took 4 1/2 minas from my sealed goods and it is lost. My dear lord, seal the tablet of Nāb-Suen. When he deducted it from his will ...

src: 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er DINGIR-ku-ru-ub la-lu-um i-su is-tu ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur a-na 4 ITU.KAM-im <big_gap> i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul a-ma-na-um 0.33333 ma-na ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im i-sa-qal li-mu-um sa-li-a DUMU sa-ba-ku-ra-nim IGI a-ta-ta IGI i-li-dan
tgt: Ilī-kurub owes Lālum 2/3 mina refined silver. He will pay 4 months from the month of Ḫubur. If he does not pay, from there he will add interest at the colony rate of 1/3 mina. Year: Sallīya s. Šabakurānim

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma be-la-num-ma wa-ku-ta-ma ku-ta-ni na-as-a-ni i-na mi-ma-su-ma is-ti pa-ni-im-ma u-za-ni pi-te u ne-nu i-na a ba ku ta-na sa e-za-bi4-im ne-zi-ib-ma sa se-tu-qi-im nu-se-ta-qum
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Bēlānum: Concerning anything??? inform me immediately. And as for us, at the departure (???) whatever can be left we (will?) leave and whatever can be caused to be forsaken we will cause to be forsaken.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti u PUZUR4-a-sur-ma 12 ma-na hu-sa-ra-am ku-nu-ki-ni im-gu5-a na-as-a-kum 6 ma-na 11 GIN KU.BABBAR it-ba-al a-na es15-ra-tim sa E ka-ri-im um-ma a-ta-ma ki-ma i-na-di-nu KU.BABBAR es15-ra-tim di-na-su-nu-ti su-ma la i-ma-gu5-ru-ka ab-na-am i-na sa-ra-mi-im-ma ki-ma sa-ar-ma-at-ni li-ik-su-du-si i-na na-ap-ri-si-im la i-na-di-u-si ab-nu-um a-ha-a i-la-ak su-ma a-ma-kam la ta-ti-di-si a-se-er a-mur-ISTAR u a-bu-sa-lim se-bi4-il5-si u u-za-su-nu pi-te-ma i-na ta-da-ni-su-nu i-na sa-ra-mi-im li-ik-su-du-si KU.BABBAR si-im-sa a-se-ri-ka lu-se-bi4-lu-nim
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Aššūr-imittī and Puzur-Aššur: Imgua brings you 12 minas lapis under our seals. It is worth 6 minas 11 shekels silver. As for the tithe of the colony office, you said, "When they are sold, give them the silver as tithe. If they do not agree with you, let them assess the stone as broken apart, because it is broken apart." They will not put a chisel on it. The stone will go to/with Aḫaya. If you did not sell it there, send it to Amur-Ištar and Abu-šalim. Also, inform them that they will asess as broken it at their sale. Let them send the silver, its revenue to you.

src: a-na i-na-a qi-bi-ma um-ma ma-num-ba-lum-a-sur-ma mi-nam lu-mu-un li-bi4-im ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma na-as-pe-er-tam a-sa-pa-ra-ma a-na te-er-ti-a la ta-na-hi-id-ma te-er-ta-ku-nu la i-tu-ra-am ma-ti sa a-na-ku a-na te-er-ti-a a-sa-pa-ra-ni a-na ku-wa-tim na-as-pe-er-tim la ad-mu-u-ni ki-ma sa a-na a-wa-at a-bi4-a a-pa-ri-du u a-na ku-wa-tim a-pa-ri-id ta-ki-li sa ma-ma-an la ta-sa-me a-ma-kam su-ha-ri-ka sa-i-il5 a-bi4 a-ta a-na te-er-ti-a u a-wa-ti-a pa-ni-ka la ta-sa-ka-an-ma a-wa-ti la i-na-di a-sa-me-ma ha-ra-nam u-si-ru ki-ma ha-ra-nam u-si-ru-ni lu-qu-ti ab-ka-nim la-at-be-a-ma la-tal-kam a-na-kam si-im TUG.HI.A URUDU DINGIR-ba-ni e-ri-si-ma URUDU u-ka-i-il5-su-um a si-a-ti as-pu-ra-ku-um i-na wa-sa DINGIR-ba-ni KU.BABBAR u-la KU.GI u-se-ba-la-ku-um u a-su-mi a-sur-i-di DUMU ku-ku-la-nim u en-na-su-en6 te-er-ta-ka SIG5-tum li-li-kam
tgt: To Innā from Mannum-bālum-Aššur Why did you write me in anger? You said: "I sent you a letter, but you paid no attention to my letter, and you did not return me your missive." I sent you a letter, but you paid no attention to my letter, and you did not return me your missive.

src: KISIB tu-uh-ni-is KISIB ku-bi4-di KISIB DUG-a-sur KISIB ISTAR-il5-su sa hu-bu-ul tu-uh-ni-is DUMU DINGIR-dan 14 GU URUDU si-kam i-se-er tu-uh-ni-is {d}ISKUR-ba-ni i-su ITU.KAM a-la-na-tim a-na 4 ITU.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul a-na 1 GU-tim 3 ma-na.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab li-mu-um a-al-DUG DUMU pi-la-ah-a-a
tgt: Seals of Duḫniš, Kūbidi, Ṭāb-Aššur, Ištar-ilšu Duḫniš s. Ilī-dān owes Adad-bāni 14 talents poor quality copper. He will pay 4 months from the month of Allānātim. If he does not pay, he will add interest at the rate of 3 mina per talent per month. Year: Āl-ṭāb s. Pilaḫāya

src: KISIB a-ta-ta DUMU zu-ku-a KISIB en-um-a-sur DUMU in-na-su-en6 KISIB DUG-si-la-a-sur DUMU wa-ar-di-{d}en-LIL KISIB a-sur-ba-as-ti sa E pu-la sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-ba-as-ti 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um i-se-er a-sur-ba-as-ti su-ma-bi-a i-su-u is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa sal-ma-a-sur DUMU a-ba ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um a-sur-SIG5 DUMU a-bar-zi-zi-im a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-me-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul a-na 1 ma-na-im 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab
tgt: Regarding the debt of Aššur-bāštī: Aššur-bāštī owes Šuma-abiya 3 minas refined silver. He will pay twenty weeks from the of Šalim-Aššur s. Abā, month , eponymate of Aššur-damiq s. Abarsisum. If he does not pay at the fulfillment of his term, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: KISIB la-ba-na-da DUMU i-di-su-en6 KISIB i-ku-pi-a-sur DUMU pi-la-ah-a-sur a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um tur4-hu-mi-it i-di-ni-a-ti-ma IGI GIR sa a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in i-di-da-gan DUMU sa-ar-ni-ki-im u sa-lim-a-hu-um DUMU DU10-i-li tap-pa-u-ni
tgt: [Siegel des] Labannādā, des Sohnes des Idīsu'in; Siegel des Ikuppī'aššur, des Sohnes des P[ila]ẖaššur. Regarding this matter, the colony at Durḫumit allowed us to give our witnesses before the dagger of Aššur. Idī-Dagān [s. Sa]rnikum, Šalim-aḫum s. Ṭābilī, (were) our partner witnesses.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na la-qe-ep u pu-su-ke-en6 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ki-a 12 ma-na AN.NA a qa-ti-su 4 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 6 TUG su-ru-tum sa li-wi-tim 1 ANSE sa-la-mu-um 1 {TUG}ku-ta-num sa ka-sa-ri-im mi-ma a-nim su-su-en6 DUMU bu-za-zu i-ra-de8-a-ku-nu-ti TUG.HI.A u ANSE sa-la-ma-am is-ti AN.NA-ki-a e-mi-da-ma a-na u4-me qu-ur-bu-tim a-na DAM.GAR ke-nim sa ki-ma qa-qi-di-ku-nu di-na ITU.KAM is-te-en6 u se-na la tu-se-qa-ra tam-ka-ar-ku-nu lu ke-en6 KU.BABBAR ma-la i-se-er DAM.GAR ta-na-di-a-ni u u4-me i-na tup-pe-ku-nu lu-up-ta-nim 1 TUG sa ka-sa-ri-im i li-bi4 TUG.HI-ti-a da-ri-ik TUG a-na su-su-en6 pa-qi-id i-na e-ra-bi4-su-ma 12.5 GIN KU.BABBAR be-u-la-ti-su li-di-na-ku-nu-ti-ma a-sar li-bi4-su li-li-ik
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Lā-qēpum and Pūšu-kēn: 2 talents 10 minas tin under my seal, 12 minas 'hand-tin', 4 Bundle the textiles and the black donkey with the tin and sell them on short terms to a trustworthy merchant as responsible as yourselves. Do not overvalue one or two months. Your merchants must be trustworthy! Write down the silver as much as you have placed on the merchant and the term period in your tablet. The textile for the driver (is laid out?) within my textiles. Entrust the textile to Šū-Suen. Upon his arrival let him give to you 12 1/2 shekels silver, his beʾulatum so that he may go where he pleases.

src: 11-<gap> GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku DUMU a-hu-wa-qar DAM.GAR-ru-um i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa sal-mi-hi-im DUMU bar-hi-li ITU.KAM sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um a-sur-i-mi-ti ma-la-hu-um 0.25 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i ITU.KAM u-sa-ab IGI na-ra-am-ZU <gap> a-sur-ma-lik
tgt: Aššur-taklāku s. Aḫu-waqar owes the merchant 11+x shekels refined silver. He will add 1/4 shekel per month as interest from the ḫamuštum of Šalim-aḫum s. Barḫili, month of Ša sarrātim, eponymate of Aššur-idī the boatman. Witnesses: Naram-Suen, (s.?) Aššur-mālik.

src: um-ma su-hu-bur-ma a-na im-di-DINGIR pu-su-ke-en6 a-mur-{d}UTU u zu-pa qi-bi-ma a-na a-mur-{d}UTU u zu-pa qi-bi4-ma te-er-ti la-li-im is-tu ha-hi-im i-li-ka-ku-nu-ti-ma 1 GU AN.NA sa ki-ma i-a-ti i-di-nu-ni-ku-nu-ti ki-ma la-li-im a-tu-nu tal-qe-a a-na-kam 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na AN.NA-ki-a a-wi-lum pa-su i-di-nam la li-bi4 DINGIR-ma la-lu-um me-et a-na-kam i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-su al-qe-ma sa ki-ma su-a-ti um-ma su-ut-ma su-pur-ma a-sar AN.NA-ka il5-qe-u-ni KU.BABBAR-ap-ka li-is-qu-lu-ni-kum a-hu-u-a a-tu-nu ki-ma tup-pi ta-as-me-a-ni 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-na KU.BABBAR ap la-li-im li-qe-a-ma a-na im-di-DINGIR u pu-su-ke-en6 su-uq-la
tgt: From Šū-Ḫubur to Imdī-ilum, Pūšu-kēn, Amur-Šamaš, and Zupa: To Amur-Šamaš and Zupa: The instructions of Lālum came to you from Haḫḫum and my representatives gave you (pl.) 1 talent tin. You took (them) on behalf of Lālum. Here, the man promised me 10 minas of silver for my tin. Unfortunately, Lālum died. Here, I took from his silver and his representatives said, "Send so that whoever received your tin pays you your silver." My dear brothers, When you read my tablet, take 10 minas of refined silver from the silver of Lālum and pay it to Imdī-ilum and Pūšu-kēn.

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur KISIB i-di-a-bi-im DUMU a-sur-GAL KISIB a-la-hi-im KISIB su-a-sur sa 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-la-hi-im u su-a-sur a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa na-ra-am-ZU u i-di-a-sur a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-la-hi-im u su-a-sur
tgt: Seals: Puzur-Aššur, Iddin-abim s. Aššur-rabi, Al-aḫim, Šū-Aššur. Al-aḫim and Šū-Aššur owe Aššur-rēʾī 1 mina refined silver. They will pay 13 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Naram-Suen and Idī-Aššur. If they do not pay (on time), they will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa i-ku-num a-na la-li-im ha-bu-lu-ma a-na-ku qa-ta-tu-ni tup-pa-am e-ri-su-ma um-ma la-lu-um-ma ha-la-aq KU.BABBAR a-na-ku sa-qu-la-ku su-ma tup-pu-um sa 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa hu-bu-ul i-ku-nim e-ta-li-am sa-ar IGI im-di-DINGIR IGI sal-ma-a-sur DUMU i-su-rik13 IGI a-sur-is-ti-kal DUMU a-sur-SIPA
tgt: As for the 5 minas silver which Ikūnum owed to Lālum, and about which tablet I inquired of the guarantors, and about which Lālum said, "It is lost. I myself paid the silver" -- if the tablet worth 5 minas silver of the debt of Ikūnum should arise, he is a liar. Witnesses: Imdī-ilum, Šalim-Aššur s. Issu-arik, Aššuriš-tikal s. Aššur-rēʾī.

src: KISIB su-sa-a DUMU su-ku-bi-im KISIB u-sur-sa-a-sur DUMU am-ri-a KISIB a-zu DUMU PUZUR4-a-sur KISIB su-be-lim DUMU a-sur-SIPA sa 2 ma-na 12 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er su-be-lim DUMU a-sur-SIPA su-be-lim DUMU a-gu-a i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa na-ab-su-en6 u su-ka-li-a 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na ma-na-im u-sa-ab a-na ITU.KAM si-pu-um li-mu-um su-da-a DUMU en-na-nim
tgt: Seals of Susaya s. Šū-Kūbim, Uṣur-ša-Aššur s. Amria, Azu s. Puzur-Aššur, Šū-Bēlim s. Aššur-rēʾī Šū-Bēlim s. Aššur-rēʾī owes Šū-Bēlim s. Agua 2 minas 12 shekels silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month from the week of Nāb-Suen and Sukkallīya.

src: 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR si-im 5 ma-na NA4.ZA.GIN.DURU5 sa i-na-a u e-na-a-sur sa en-um-a-sur DUMU u-zu-a qa-ta-tim al-ta-ap-tu KU.BABBAR en-um-a-sur DUMU a-ni-nim u su-ku-bu-um DUMU u-zu-a sa-bu-u IGI su-la-ba-an DUMU dan-i-li IGI a-sur-i-di-in
tgt: Witnesses: Šū-Laban s. Dān-ilī, Aššur-iddin.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi4-ma 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 34 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 2 ANSE.HI.A sa-la-mu 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR u 6 ma-na AN.NA a-na qa-ti-su ki-ma AN.NA ILLAT i-sa-ku-nu a-na KU.BABBAR AN.NA li-is-ku-na-ku-nu-ti sa-ri-dum ig-ri-su <big_gap> sa a-di hu-ra-ma sa-bu mi-ma a-nim su-li DUMU PUZUR4-a-sur na-as-a-ku-nu-ti lu AN.NA lu TUG.HI.A ma-la i-na E.GAL-lim i-za-ku-u-ni-ni a-na a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku pi-qi-id-ma a-sar KU.BABBAR 1 GIN ba-la-ti-a lu-bi-il5 u te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam su-ma la-su a-sar wa-as-bu se-bi-il5-su-um i-di-ISTAR a-se-er is-ta-ri-qi-ni a-na E a-bi4-im il5-qe-a-ni-ma u E ip-lu-us-ma e-ta-ba-at i-di-ISTAR sa-ab-ta-ma 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-na KU.BABBAR su sa-as-qi-la-su-ma se-bi4-la-nim-ma u lu-mu-un li-bi4-a la-ap-tur-su-um TUG.HI.A ma-la a-na ni-ka-si-a ta-ta-di-a-ni sa-li-ta-ma lu KU.BABBAR ma-la na-ad-a-ku-ni su-up-ra-nim
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā and Aššur-takl 2 talents 10 minas of tin under seal, 34 kutānu-textiles, 2 black donkeys, 2/3 mina of silver and 6 minas of tin for his expenses--he must calculate for you the value of the tin in silver using the rate which is established by the enterprise--as for the donkey-driver, his wages have been paid for the stretch until Hurama--with all this Šuli son of Puzur-Aššur is on his way to you. Entrust both the tin and the textiles, as many as are cleared in the palace, to Aššur-taklāku and let him bring it to where there is even a single shekel of profit for me. And do send me word. If he is not there, then send it to him where he is. As to Iddin-Ištar-not only has he continually robbed me, he took me to the office of the firm, and then he broke into the house and absconded! Seize Iddin-Ištar and have him pay 3 minas of silver out of his own silver, and send him to me so I can release my anger on him! Take charge of whatever textiles you have deposited on my account, and write to me about how much silver I have been booked for.

src: pu-su-ke-en6 a-na a-sur-ma-lik is-ba-at-ni-a-ti-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma a-na a-sur-ma-lik-ma is-tu 10 u4-me-e a-na KU.BABBAR 5 ma-na ta-ar-ta-na-ga-ma-am al-kam sa ha-bu-la-ku-ni i-na di-tim ru-ug-ma-am a-sur-ma-lik sa ni-is a-lim{ki} uz-na-ti-ni il5-pu-ut um-ma su-ut-ma ki-ma a-na di-tim is-pu-ra-ni-ni um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma ka-i-la a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um ka-ni-is i-di-ni-a-ti-ma si-bu-ti-ni IGI GIR sa a-sur ni-di-in IGI la-qe-pi-im DUMU i-zi-za-am-DINGIR IGI ha-na-na-nim
tgt: Pūšu-kēn seized us against Aššur-mālik and Pūšu-kēn said to Aššur-mālik, "You have been prosecuting me about 5 minas silver for 10 days. Come. litigate against me concerning that which I owe in a suit." Aššur-mālik wrote the words of the oath of the city of our ears. He said, "They (f.?) will write that for the verdict."?? Pūšu-kēn said, ""It is enough(?)" For this matter, the colony at Kanesh gave us permission, and we gave our witnesses before the dagger of Aššur. Witnesses: Lāqēpum s. Izēzam-ilī, Hannanum.

src: i lu-qu-tim pa-ni-tim 5 GU URUDU 9 ma-na sa qa-ti-im 8 ma-na sa-du-u-tum e-ku-ul sa 1 me-at 17 TUG.HI.A 56.5 GU 3 ma-na si-im-su-nu 23 TUG.HI-a sa sa-la-tu-ar 4 ma-na 0.5 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im-su-nu 10 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 1 su-lu-up-ki-u-um E ka-ri-im URUDU 74 GU 20 ma-na SA.BA A 5 GU 15 ma-na 14 si-im ANSE sa-la-mi-im 2.5 ma-na LA 1.5 GIN KU.BABBAR iz-ku-am si-im 10 GU 20 ma-na URUDU sa se-ep sa-lim-be-li 5.83333 ma-na 1.5 GIN KU.BABBAR-ap-su SA.BA 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na ur-su u-se-bi4-lam si im 0.33333 ma-na 6 GIN KU.GI 2.33333 ma-na 6 GIN KU.BABBAR-ap-su a-sur-na-da e-ku-ul 12 GU 28 ma-na URUDU sa i-li-a-lim a-na sa-la-ti-wa-ar u-se-ri-bu 5.5 ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR-ap-su is-ku-nam SA.BA 5 ma-na LA 4 GIN KU.BABBAR a-sur-na-da e-ku-ul si-im 2 GU URUDU SIG5 4 GU 10 ma-na URUDU-su 3 ma-na 4 GIN KU.BABBAR a-mur-a-sur ka-sa-ar dan-a-sur ub-la-kum SA.BA 0.83333 ma-na LA 1 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im KU.GI ta-hi 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI PUZUR4-a-na tup-pu-su E am-ri-a i-ba-si
tgt: Of the former merchandise: 5 talents of copper, 9 minas for expenses, the transport tariff took up 8 minas. For 117 textiles: their price was 56 1/2 talents 3 minas (of copper); 23 textiles from Šalatuwar, their price was 4 minas 1/2 shekel of silver; 10 textiles, 1 textile: (for) the colony office; in all in copper: 74 talents 20 minas. Thereof 5 talents 15 minas, the price of a black donkey; he cleared 2 1/2 minas less 1 1/2 shekel of silver for me; the proceeds of 10 talents 20 minas of copper transported by Šalim-bēlī--its value in silver: 5 5/6 minas 1 1/2 shekel; thereof he sent 2 minas of silver to Uršu (to my benefit); Aššur-nādā spent 2 1/3 minas 6 shekels, the value in silver of 1/3 mina 6 shekels of gold; 12 talents 28 minas of copper which Ilī-ālum brought into Šalatuwar, I was charged with its value in silver, 5 1/2 minas 2 shekels; thereof Aššur-nādā acquired 5 minas less 4 shekels of silver; as the proceeds of 2 talents of good quality copper (and) his 4 talents 10 minas of copper Amur-Aššur, the packer of Dān-Aššur, brought you 3 minas 4 shekels of silver, including 5/6 mina less 1 shekel of silver, the price of the gold; 1 mina of silver is owed by Puzur-Anna; his tablet is in Amria's house.

src: a-na i-na-a qi-bi-ma um-ma {d}UTU.DUG-ma i-na {d}UTU-si sa i-ku-pi-a e-ra-ba-ni u4-ma-kal la i-bi-a-at a-na wa-ah-su-sa-na tu-ru-su a-di TUG.HI-ti-a sa a-ma-kam i-ba-si-u-ni a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta TUG.HI-ti a-na KU.BABBAR ma-la i-du-nu-ni KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ku-ma se-bi-lam ku-su-um i-si-ni-iq-ni-a-ti-ma e-lu-tum i-ib-te-re te-er-ta-ka u e-ma-ru-ka sal-mu a-na-kam is-tu ha-hi-im a-na ti-me-el-ki-a 3 is-te-na u sa-na e-ma-ru us-ta-lu-hu ki-ma ta-as-pu-ra-ni mi-ma se-bu-lam <big_gap> te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam-ma uz-ni pi-te <big_gap> <gap> AN.NA <big_gap>
tgt: To Innāya from Šamaš-ṭāb: On the day that Ikuppīya arrives, he must not stay a single day. Dispatch him to Waḫšušana. With regard to my textiles which are there, my dear father and lord, as much the textiles were sold for silver, seal and send the silver to me. Winter overtook us and the caravan is stalled... The caravan ... Your consignment and donkeys are well. Here the donkeys will dispatch one or two at a time from Ḫaḫḫum to Timelkiya. ... tin ...

src: KISIB be-el-ha-ar-mi-im KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur KISIB a-sur-dan KISIB la-li-im KISIB a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim sa <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim DUMU su-a-nim-a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa na-ra-am-ZU u i-ku-nim a-na 21 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um su-da-a DUMU en-na-nim ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim DUMU su-a-nim
tgt: Seals of the cheif ḫarmum, Puzur-Aššur, Aššur-dān, Lāalum, Aššur-bēl-awātim. He will pay 21 hamuštum weeks from the hamuštum of Naram-Suen and Ikūnum. If he does not pay, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Month: Kuzalli.

src: KISIB i-di-a-bi-im DUMU su-ku-bi4-im KISIB su-su-en6 DUMU bu-za-zu KISIB en-um-a-sur DUMU ka-ri-a KISIB en-na-nim DUMU a-zu-a 3 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er en-na-nim DUMU a-zu-a a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-li-a-lim u u-su-ur-sa-a-sur ITU.KAM ab-sa-ra-ni li-mu-um bu-zu-zu 1 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na sa-na-at i-sa-qal a-na sa-ni-tim sa-tim 1 ma-na 5 GIN i-sa-qal a-na sa-li-is-tim sa-tim 1 ma-na 5 GIN i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul a-na 1 ma-na-im 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul en-na-nim
tgt: Ennānum s. Azua owes Aššur-rēʾī 3 minas 15 shekels refined silver. He will pay 1 mina 5 shekels one year from the hamuštum week of Ilī-ālum and Uṣur-ša-Aššur, month Ab-šarrānē, year of Buzuzu. He will pay 1 mina 5 shekels at the second year. He will pay 1 mina 5 shekels in the third year. If he does not pay at the fulfillment of his term, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest. This memorandum is a copy of the sealed tablet of the debt of Ennānum.

src: um-ma bu-zu-ta-a e-nu-be-lim u PUZUR4-a-sur a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma is-tu KU.BABBAR sa se-ep il5-ba-ni nu-se-bi4-la-ni 2.6666600000000003 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR tar-ma-na i-di-ni-a-ti 1 ma-na da-la-as KI.2 4 GIN a-sur-DU10 il5-qe 8 GIN ma-su-hu-um i-ba-si 7 GIN ki-ib-sa-tum si-ti KU.BABBAR 5.33333 ma-na 6 GIN i-na 2.5 ma-na 1 GIN KU.BABBAR-pi-ka sa ma-ga-ri-im 1 ma-na 6 GIN a-su-mi PUZUR4-a-sur u-sa-hi-ru-ni-a-ti a-ma-kam is-ti-ka li-si si-ti KU.BABBAR 1.3333300000000001 ma-na 4 GIN ni-il5-qe SU.NIGIN 4.83333 ma-na SA.BA 3 ma-na 16 GIN a-na 21-ma ni-is-qul si-ti KU.BABBAR 1.5 ma-na 4 GIN u 1 ma-na 13.5 GIN KU.BABBAR PUZUR4-a-sur i-di-ni-a-ti-ma 2.5 ma-na 7 GIN KU.BABBAR sa a-na mu-la ne-pi-si-im sa se-ep il5-ba-ni um-ma su-ut-ma a si-ib-tim ni-il5-qe-a-ku-ni KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su ni-is-qul
tgt: From Buzutaya, Ennum-Bēlum and Puzur-Aššur to Pūšu-kēn: After we sent the silver from the cargo of Ilī-bāni, Tarmana gave us 2 minas 45 shekels silver. Dalaš (gave to us) 1 mina (silver). Aššur-ṭāb took 4 shekels. There are 8 shekels of poor quality (silver). 7 shekels are deductions. The remainder of the silver is 5 minas 26 shekels. From the 2 minas 31 shekels of your silver about which there is agreeing(?), they deducted from us 1 mina 6 shekels on account of Puzur-Aššur. Let it be released there with you. We took the remainder of the silver, 1 minas 24 shekels. Altogether 4 minas 50 shekels. We weighed out 3 minas 16 shekels for (21-ma?). Thereof, the remainder of the silver is 1 minas 34 shekels. Also, Puzur-Aššur gave us 1 minas 13 1/2 shekels silver and concerning 2 minas 37 shekels silver which was in Il-bāni's cargo for the filling of the sack, he said, "That which we took for you on interest, we will weigh out the silver and its interest."

src: a-na i-na-a qi-bi-ma um-ma il5-we-da-ku-ma tup-pa-am sa a-na sa-ru-um-{d}ISKUR ta-di-nu a-di 41 TUG.HI.A sa E gu5-ba-ab-tim PUZUR4-a-sur e-zi-bu i-na a-la-ak a-sur-DUG TUG.HI.A a-na a-sur-DUG ta-hi-su-nu a ma-la te-er-ti-ka TUG.HI.A a-na a-sur-DUG u-ta-ha tup-pa-ka is-tu ha-hi-im i-na tu-wa-ri-su i-di-nam a-bi4 a-ta i-na tup-pi-im sa 15.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa tam-ka-ri-im 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR-ka li-qe-ma si-ti KU.BABBAR a-na hu-bu-li-a li-qe-ma tup-pi-a a-na i-na-ah-DINGIR pi-qi-id-ma a-na-ku a-la-qe-a-am
tgt: To Innāya from Il-wedāku:

src: 13.66666 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er a-la-bi-im i-di-ISTAR i-su is-ti KU.BABBAR uk-ta-al i qa-ab-li ha-ra-ni-im u-la i-qa-bi um-ma a-la-bu-um-ma u-la u-sa-ab is-ti-ka lu i-na ka-ni-is lu i-na a-lim{ki} su-ma i-ti-si KU.BABBAR-pi u-ta-ra-ma u u-si su-ma um-mi-a-su la sa-bu ma i pa-ni-a pu-uz-ra-am i-sa-ba-at u-la sa ki um-mi-a-ni-su la sa-bu-u is-tu li-mi-im sa i-du-a 10 GIN-um 1 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM i-la-ak-su-um a-li a-mu-ru-su lu i-na a-lim{ki} lu i ka-ni-is KU.BABBAR-pi u si-ba-su a-la-qe IGI ha-ru-hu-ur DUMU ki-ki-da-ni-im IGI a-sur-i-di DUMU su-li IGI PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU a-bi-a
tgt: Al-abim owes 13.667 shekels silver to Idī-Ištar. Mit dem Silber wird er gehalten. Witnesses: Ḫaraḫur s. Kikkidānum, Aššur-idī s. Šuli, Puzur-Aššur s. Abīya.

src: a-na im-di-lim pu-su-ke-en6 u a-sur-su-lu-li qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-ma-lik a-zu u i-di-{d}ISKUR-ma 1 GU 40 ma-na AN.NA {d}ISKUR-pi-la-ah ub-lam 6 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR-ap-su-nu 3.5 ma-na 14.5 GIN URUDU a-na 0.83333 ma-na 6 GIN KU.BABBAR ta-ad-nu 3 lu-bu-su a-na <big_gap><gap> ta-ad-nu SU.NIGIN KU.BABBAR-pi-ka <gap> <big_gap> a-ni-tum a-na KU <big_gap> <gap> u i-a-ti 3.5 ma-na <gap> GIN KU.BABBAR i-ku-pi-a ha-bu-ul 2 me-at 20 ma-na URUDU E ka-ri-im i-la-qe <gap>-<gap>-dim KU.BABBAR si-im ra-qi-tim i TUG su-ha-ri-im u-<gap> 2 {TUG}ra-qa-ta-an u <big_gap> 1 {TUG}lu-bu-su-um ma-ti-tum i-ba-si-u hu-sa-ri ku-nu-ki sa a-zu a-mur-ISTAR na-as-a-ku-nu-ti mi-su tup-pa-am ha-ar-ma-am sa tam-ka-ri-im a-na-kam la e-zi-ib <gap> <big_gap> a-na-kam la ha-bu-ul-su-um <big_gap>
tgt: To Imdī-ilum, Pūšu-kēn and Aššur-ṣulūlī from Aššur-mālik, Azu and Idī-Adad: Adad-pilaḫ brought 1 talent 40 minas of tin. At a 6 shekel rate, their silver is 3 minas 44 1/2 shekels. The copper was sold for 56 shekels of silver. Three garments were sold for ... . In total, your silver ... ... this ... for (?) silver (?) ... Also, to me Ikūppiya owes 3 1/2 minas of silver. The colony will take 220 minas of copper. The price of the raqqutum textile was .. silver. From the textiles of the boy, and(?) ..., 2 raqqutum textiles and ... and 1 mṭt garment are available. Amur-Ištar brings you lapis under seal belonging to Azu. Why is it that he did not leave the sealed tablet of the merchant here? ... here ... owes to him(?) ...

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma la-ma-si-ma 2 TUG a-sur-ba-as-ti na-as-a-kum a-su-mi TUG sa su-ur-bu-i-a-tim sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni um-ma a-ta-ma 1 TUG a-na li-ta-ab-si-a se-bi-li-im TUG wa-di e-pi-is is-ti as-la-ki-im-ma a-di-ni u-la u-se-li-su is-ti wa-ar-ki-u-tim TUG sa su-ur-bu-i-a-tim a-na li-ta-ab-si-ka u-se-la-kum
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Lamassī: Aššur-bašti brings you 2 textiles. Regarding the šurbuitum textiles about which you wrote, you said, "Send 1 textile for my clothing, inform me about the textile," I made it. Later I will send up to you a šurbuitum textile for your clothing.

src: <big_gap> GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er DINGIR-lu-um-re-si DUMU ba-al-tu-a GAR.GAR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa kur-ub-ISTAR mu-us-ta-qi-tim ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um en-na-su-en6 DUMU su-a-sur 22.5 SE i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI i-di-su-en6 DUMU u-su-ur-sa-a-sur IGI su-is-ha-ra DUMU i-li-as-ra-ni
tgt: Ilum-rēṣi s. Balṭua owes GAR.GAR ...shekels refined silver. He will add 22 1/2 grains (per mina) per month as interest from the ḫamuštum of Kurub-Ištar the boatman, month ḫubur, eponymate Enna-Suen s. Šū-Aššur. Witnesses: Idī-Suen s. Uṣur-ša-Aššur, Šū-Išḫara s. Ili-ašranni

src: um-ma bu-zu-ta-a-ma a-na a-mur-{d}UTU a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku pu-su-ke-en6 u su-en6-na-we-er qi-bi4-ma AN.NA u TUG.HI.A sa su-en6-na-we-er u li-pa-a ir-de8-u-ni-ku-ni-ti-ni lu a-na wa-ah-su-sa-na a-se-er ku-zi-zi-a tu-se-bi4-la-ni lu su-en6-na-we-er il5-qe lu DAM.GAR ta-qi-pa ti-i-ir-ta-ku-nu li-li-kam su-ma a-na ku-zi-zi-a la tu-se-ba-la si-ti AN.NA ki-ma tup-pi ta-as-me-a-ni se-bi4-la-su-um is-ti a-wi-lim nam-gu5-ra-ku a-na AN.NA 1 ma-na KU.GI la i-ba-ta-qam si-ti lu-qu-ti-a i-se-er DAM.GAR ke-nim la sa a-sa-hu-tu id-a-ma u4-me ITU.1.KAM u 2 ITU.KAM la tu-be-e-la u a-na qa-ti-a sa E ka-ri-im ih-da-ma qa-ti id-a-ma ut-ra-am-ma KU.BABBAR la a-na su-<gap>-ma-ma li-bi e im-ra-as u su-ma KU.BABBAR <big_gap> is-ta-pu-ku u a-tu-nu KU.BABBAR i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-a id-a
tgt: From Buzutāya to Amur-ŠamaS, Aššur-taklāku, Pūšu-kēn, and Suen-nawer: As for the tin and textiles that Suen-nāwer and Libbaya transported to you (pl.), let your message come as to whether you sent it to Waḫšušana to Kuzizīya, or Suen-nāwer took it, or you sold it on credit to a merchant. If you do not send it to Kuzizīya, send the remainder of the tin, as you read in my letter, to him. I am in business relations with the man. He must not detract any silver for every mina of tin. Deposit the remainder of my goods on a trustworthy merchant whom I have no reason to worry, and do not overvalue (a short) term or two months. Now, concerning my share in the colony office, take care to deposit my share and ... and the silver not ... and thus disappoint me. And if they call for a pouring .. of silver (?), then you yourself will deposit silver from my silver (account?).

src: KISIB a-sur-GAL DUMU la-qe-ep KISIB i-di-{d}UTU DUMU ha-lu-pa KISIB ka-ri-a KISIB ha-lu-pa KISIB ir-nu-wa-su a-hi-su 1.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er hu-lu-pa <big_gap> u ir-nu-wa-su a-hi-su a-sur-ma-lik i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa kur-ub-ISTAR a-na sa a-na i-sa-qu-lu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sa-al-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is su-ma la is-qu-lu 1 ma-na-um 0.5 ma-na i-sa-hu-ur ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um i-ku-pi-ISTAR
tgt: Seals of Aššur-rabi s. Lāqēp, Idī-Šamaš s. Ḫalupa, Qarwiya, Ḫalupa, Irnuašu

src: 0.5 ma-na LA 0.25 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er ISTAR-la-ma-si na-na-a ti-su i-na sa pa-ar-ka ta-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-me-sa la ta-as-qu-ul GEME E-tam ta-da-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-sa ta-la-qe IGI su-ma-bi4-a IGI e-la-li
tgt: Ištar-lamassī owes 29 3/4 shekels silver to Nanaya. She will pay at the festival of Parka. If she does not pay at her term, she will leave a servant at the house and take her money. Witnesses: Šuma-abiya, Elāli

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u dan-a-sur qi-bi-ma i-na u4-mi-im sa tup-pa-am ta-sa-me-u 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR u ni-is-ha-su sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni i-na pa-nim-ma wa-si-im se-bi-lam u ha-nu tur4-dam dan-a-sur na-ab-ri-tam a-ni-tam li-ib-re-ma a-se-er KU.BABBAR sa se-ep hu-ra-sa-nim u 7.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa TUG.HI.A sa se-ep DUMU er-ra-a sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni lu i-na AN.NA lu TUG.HI.A sa se-ep dan-a-sur lu i sa ANSE.HI.A lu i ba-ab-ti-a ta-ah-si-is-tam sa a-na-kam a-di-na-ku-nu-ti-ni 1 GU KU.BABBAR is-ti dan-a-sur se-bi-la-nim 55 TUG.HI.A sa se-ep DUMU er-ra-a mi-su sa 30-ma ta-as-pu-ra-ni-ni qa-ti sa TUG.HI.A KU.BABBAR a-se-er sa se-ep hu-ra-sa-nim-ma ta-hi-a lu-qu-tum lu sa se-ep dan-a-sur lu sa a-ni is-ti ha-ra-nim u-se-ba-la-ku-nu-ti-ni AN.NA-ki u TUG-ti-a za-ki-a-ma ma-la KU.BABBAR i-se-er DAM.GAR ta-na-di-a-ni dan-a-sur i se-pi-su za-ku-tam lu-ub-lam a-su-mi sa dan-a-sur KU.BABBAR sa ra-mi-ni-ka ma-la tu-se-ba-la-ni se-bi4-la-ma u a-na-ku si-ta qa-te-en6 la-di-ma a si-mi-im sa ta-sa-pa-ra-ni la-as-a-ma dan-a-sur i pa-nim-ma la-at-ru-da-kum a-se-er 6 GIN KU.GI sa pa-na-ka u si-im TUG sa su-ha-ar-tim ta-di-na-ku-ni u a-ta KU.KI ma-la ra-du-im ra-di-ma KU.KI pa-sal-lam DAM.GAR se-bi4-lam 40 ma-na URUDU SIG5 dan-a-sur lu-ub-lam
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn and Dān-Aššur: On the day that you read this tablet, send the 20 minas silver and its interest about which you wrote with the first departure. Also, dispatch Ḫanu. Let Dān-Aššur spend the nabrītum and in addition ot the silver from the transport of Ḫuraṣānum and the 7 1/2 minas silver from my textiles in the transport of the son of Aššur-mālik about which you wrote, add the proceeds of the tin and the textiles from the transport of Dān-Aššur and that from his donkeys, and that from my outstanding claims, the taḫšištum that I gave to you here,and send (in total) 1 talent silver with Dān-Aššur. As for the 55 textile from the transport of the son of Errāya, why is it that I have written you 30 times? As for my share of the textiles, gather the silver in addition to that from the transport of Ḫuraṣānum. As for the merchandise both from the transport of Dān-Ašsur and from that which I am now sending you with the caravan, clear my tin and textiles so that Dān-Aššur can bring eveyr single shekel of silver that you placed on merchants, the cleared amount, in his transport. Concerning the matter of Dān-Aššur, send silverof your own funds, as much as you can send, and I myself will put down two shares so that I purchase for whatever price you write, so that Dān-Aššur my bring it to you in the first caravan. In addition to the 6 shekels gold from Panaka and the yield of the textiles which the boy gave to you you add as much gold as you can so that the merchant send the pašallum gold. Let Dān-Aššur bring the 40 minas of fine copper.

src: <big_gap> 1.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa <big_gap> u a-mur-ISTAR a-na <gap> ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam a-na 1 ma-na-im u-su-bu
tgt: From the ḫamuštum of PN and Amur-Ištar he has x weeks to pay. If he does not pay 1 1/5 shekels interest will be added per mina.

src: 10 GIN KU.BABBAR a pu-su-ke-en6 2 GIN a me-er-e-ti-su 1 GIN a am-ti-su 1.5 GIN a-na a-hu-qar 1.5 GIN a en-um-a-sur DUMU su-ka-li-a 1 GIN a {d}ISKUR-ba-ni 1 GIN a pi-la-ah-a-sur 1 GIN a la-ba-na-da 1 GIN a i-di-su-en6 1 GIN a {d}UTU-ta-ak-la-ku 1 GIN a DINGIR-ma-lik 3 GIN a-na a-mur-ISTAR 3 GIN a-na 2 me-er-e-su u me-er-i-ti-su 1 GIN a-na a-sur-ma-lik DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR 1 GIN a su-a-nim mi-ma a-nim a ni-qi-su-nu a-di-su-nu-ti
tgt: 10 shekels silver to Pūšu-kēn, 2 shekels to his daughter, 1 shekel to his amtum-wife, 1 1/2 shekels to Aḫu-waqar, 1 1/2 shekels to Ennum-Aššur s. Sukkallīya, 1 shekel to Adad-bāni, 1 shekel to Pilaḫ-Aššur, 1 shekels to Laban-nādā, 1 shekels to Idī-Suen, 1 shekel to Šamaš-taklāku, 1 shekels to Ilī-mālik, 3 shekels to Amur-Ištar, 3 shekels to his two sons and one daughter, 1 shekels to Aššur-mālik s. Puzur-Ištar, 1 shekels to Šū-Anum: all this I gave to them for their offerings.
