src: a-na sa-lim-a-hi-im qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma 5 GU 4 ma-na qa-dum sa ka-sa-ri-im a-wi-it-ka sa se-ep en-um-a-sur 5 ma-na 5 GIN.TA 25.66666 ma-na 5 GIN da-tum ik-su-dam 0.66666 ma-na 5 GIN qa-qa-da-tum 4.5 ma-na u-ku-ul-ti ANSE.HI.A u sa-ri-di 0.33333 ma-na mu-ta AN.NA qa-tim is-tu 25 ma-na AN.NA qa-tim gam-ru 6.5 ma-na AN.NA a-na en-um-a-sur ni-pu-ul 4 ma-na ni-is-ha-at AN.NA su-qa-al-ka ni-ip-tur4-ma 10.5 ma-na AN.NA qa-dum ni-is-ha-ti-su ne-pu-ul i-na 72 TUG.HI.A sa a-na E.GAL-lim e-ru-bu-ni 2.33333 TUG ni-is-ha-tim 1.66666 GIN KU.BABBAR ta-na-pa-al 6 si-mu-um u 2.25 GIN KU.BABBAR ta-na-pa-al KU.BABBAR sa ta-na-pu-lu 0.25 TUG is-he-er
tgt: To Šalim-aḫum from Pūšu-kēn: 5 talents 4 minas together with that owned by the shipper, your awītum assessment for the transport of Ennum-Aššur is 5 minas 5 shekels. The dātum charge assessed 25 minas 45 shekels. The head tax was 45 shekels. The feed for the donkeys was 4 1/2 minas. And also for the packers. Losses from the hand tin were 20 shekels. After the 25 minas hand tin were exhausted, we reimbursed Ennum-Aššur 6 1/2 minas tin. For the 4 minas excise for the tin, we opened your packages and we reimbursed 10 1/2 minas tin, together with its excise. From the 72 textiles which entered into the palace, you will pay 1 2/3 shekels silver, (in addition to?) the excise of 2 1/3 textiles. Purchases (the tithe) were 6 textiles. And you will repay 2 1/4 shekels. (The palace) deducted a 1/4 textile for the silver which you are paying.

src: 1.5 GIN KU.GI u 0.5 GIN KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su a-ni-num a-na sa-at-a-sur u-bi-il5 10 GIN KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI su-ISTAR DUMU da-da-nim a-na sa-at-a-sur u-bi4-il5 a-na KU.BABBAR sa tup-pi-su ha-ar-mi-im sa a-ni-nim a-mur-{d}UTU me-sar-GAL u a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU i-ku-pi-ISTAR IGI dan-a-sur IGI ma-nu-ba-lum-a-sur
tgt: Witnesses: Dān-Aššur, Mannum-bālum-Aššur.

src: {m}su-su-en6 a-na a-lim{ki} i-la-ak-ma DUMU e-na-ma-nim is-ba-su-ma um-ma su-ut-ma i-na u4-me-ka ma-al-u-tim sa-zi-za-am sa 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa e-na-ma-nim ma-as-qa-al-tam i-sa-qa-la-ni 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR ki-ma su-su-en6 ne-pu-ul-ma i-na u4-me-su ma-al-u-tim DUMU e-na-ma-nim i-li-ka-ma KU.BABBAR 2 ma-na i-na sa su-su-en6 ni-is-qu-ul-su-ma um-ma ne-nu-ma KU.BABBAR E tam-ka-ri-im a-na si-ib-tim li-qe-ma KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su ne-nu ni-sa-qa-la-ku-um i-na KU.BABBAR-ap su-su-en6 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su a-na ma-num-ba-lum-a-sur ni-is-qu-ul a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um ka-ni-is i-di-ni-a-ti-ma IGI GIR sa a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in IGI pu-su-ke-en6 IGI a-mur-{d}UTU
tgt: Šū-Suen went to the city and the son of Ennamānum seized him and he said, "When your time is expired, the We repaid the 5 minas silver on behalf of Šū-Suen and when his term expired, the son of Ennamānum came and we paid him about 2 minas silver from teh matter of Šū-Suen and we said, "Take the silver from a merchant house on interest and we ourselves will pay you the silver and its interest." We paid 3 minas silver and its interest from the silver of Šū-Suen to Mannum-bālum-Aššūr. For this matter, the colony at Kanesh gave us permission, and we gave our testimonies before the dagger of Aššur. Witnesses: Pūšu-kēn and Amur-Šamaš

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma is-tu MU.4.SE tu-si lu-qu-ti a-di-ni-ma-a la i-tur4 si-ba-at lu-qu-ti-a i-li-a-lum u-sa-bi-ka a-na mi-nim ha-ra-nu-um ma-la u se-ni-su i-li-ka-ma KU.BABBAR la tu-se-bi-lam la li-bi DINGIR-ma a-hu-ka KU.BABBAR-pi 30 ma-na u-HU-ta-li-iq ki-ma-a li-bi-im ta-da-nim a-ta KU.BABBAR tu-ka-al ma-a li-qe-ma KU.BABBAR 30 ma-na se-bi4-la-ma um-ma a-ta-ma u-ta-ni-is 2 GIN sa-ah-ra-ti si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-a a-ki-a-ma i-na pa-ni-u-ti-ma se-bi-lam-ma si-ma-am la-as-a-ma lu-se-bi-la-ku-ma li-pi-ta-am KU.BABBAR 1 GIN le-li-a-ma i-bi-sa-i-a lu-ra-ib su-ma a-hi a-ta i-hi-id KU.BABBAR se-bi-lam KU.BABBAR ma tu-se-bi-la-nim-ma um-ma a-tu-nu-ma la i-ba-re a-su-mi te-er-ti-ku-nu AN.NA ba-at-qam as-a-ma u a-ma-kam ip-ti-ri u-ma-am AN.NA 16 GIN.TA u e-li-is i-ba-si i-sa qi-ip-ti-ka KU.BABBAR 30 ma-na se-bi-lam-ma si-ma-am la-as-a-ma-kum si-a-ma-tum i-ba-si a ni-ka-si-a su-HU-ta mi-su sa a-na lu-qu-tim ta-u-ri-im ta-as-pu-ra-ni a-a-nu-um KU.BABBAR e-ta-li-am 16 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-pu-HU i-li-a-lim a E a-lim{ki} as-qul u PUZUR4-a-na a-na e-pa-si-su u sa-a-mi-su 15 ma-na ag-mu-ur
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur- nādā: You left four years ago, but so far, have my goods left?

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u e-na-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma hu-sa-ru-um-ma AN.NA u TUG.HI.A sa se-ep a-al-DUG sa me-eh-ri sa lu-qu-tim su-ku-bu-um na-as-a-ku-ni a-bi a-ta a-ma-kam ma-la AN.NA u TUG.HI.A iz-ku-u-ni a-ta u e-na-a-sur ba-ti-iq u wa-tur4 di-na-ma i-na pa-nim-ma KU.BABBAR se-bi4-la-nim u su-ku-ba-am tu-ur-da-ni-su su-ma AN.NA u TUG.HI.A ta-ad-nu KU.BABBAR ku-un-ka-ma se-bi-la-nim su-ma si-mu-um a-ma-kam ba-ti-iq a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum lu-qu-ti le-ti-iq-ma KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na le-li-a-am
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn and Ennam-Aššur from Ḫuṣārum: Regarding the tin and textiles of the šēpum of Āl-ṭāb which the corresponding amount of the goods which Šū-Kūbum brought to you, my dear father, you and Ennam-Aššur sell there as much tin as they clear, cheap or dear and send the silver to me as soon as possible. Also, send back Šū-Kūbum. If the tin and textiles are sold, seal the silver and send it to me. If the prices there are deflated, let my goods go on to Purušḫattum so that they may raise every mina possible.

src: a-na a-sur-i-di qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma a-bi4 a-ta be-li a-ta-ma 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa kur-ub-ISTAR ub-la-ku-ni u mi-ma lu-qu-tim sa i-li-a-lum u-se-bi4-la-ku-ni i-na pa-ni-im-ma ab-ka-ma lu-qu-tum a-na ba-ra-im li-ik-su-da-ma i-na ha-ra-nim la-am-hu-ur-si-ma a-na-kam li-si-me-ma be-el qi-ip-ti-a ba-ab ha-ra-ni-a sa qa-ta-tim la e-ri-si-ma la a-ba-as su-ma lu-qu-tum la us-a-ma a-na-kam la i-se-me ma-nu-um sa a-na ma-li-su KU.BABBAR qa-ta-ti-a il5-ta-pu-tu um-ma su-nu-ma a-na se-er a-bi4-ka ta-la-ak a-bu-um ki-i su-mi-su <big_gap> lu i-de8 ma-num dam-qa-ni-ku-um a-na KU.BABBAR ma-ah-ri-ka na-di-ma a-na-kam TUG.HI.A a-na qa-ti-ka u qa-ti-a KU.BABBAR u-sa-qal-ma ke-na ak-ki-tim as-ta-na ba am ma-am u da-tam ki-a-ma u-sa-qal su-ma ku-a-am la tu-se-ba-lam5 KU.BABBAR sa qi-ip-ti-a u na-ak-ra-am sa a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku u-se-bi4-la-ku-ni lu-qu-tam za-ki-a-ma ab-ka-ma a-na-kam li-se-me-ma ba-ab ha-ra-ni-a be-el qi-ip-ti-a la i ka-le-e-ma la a-ha-li-iq
tgt: To Aššur-idī from Aššur-nādā: My dear father and lord, quickly dispatch the 1 mina of silver which Kurub-Ištar brought you plus whatever goods Ilī-ālum sent to you, so that the goods reach me to be available, and let me receive it en route so it will be heard here and the owner of the goods entrusted to me will not demand a guarantor when I am about to leave, and I shall not be put to shame. If the goods have not left so it will not be heard here, who then will let himself be noted as my guarantor for the silver in its entirety? They will say: "Go to your father! Who knows whether the father is good for his name?" Things are fine for you, in fact, silver lies in front of you, while I here repeatedly have to pay silver for textiles on your account and my own, and, yes, I constantly establish a reputation for truthfulness; and in this way I am paying the fees. If you do not send some of your own, then with respect to the silver entrusted to me plus the (silver) belonging to outsiders that Aššur-taklāku sent to you-- clear the goods and dispatch them so it will be heard here, and so that at my departure the owner of the goods entrusted to me will not hold me back and I shall not perish.

src: a-na i-di-a-bi-im u ku-lu-ma-a qi-bi-ma um-ma PUZUR4-a-sur-ma su-ma KU.BABBAR a-na SIG.HI.A is-ta-pu-ku qa-ti qa-at pu-su-ke-en6 qa-at DINGIR-na-da u qa-ti i-la-li-im id-a SIG.HI.A sa E pu-su-ke-en6 i-ba-si-u a-di a-la-ka-ni lu ta-ab-si ta-as-pu-ra-nim um-ma a-tu-nu-ma KU.BABBAR be-la-num is-qul-ni-a-ti-ma na-di KU.BABBAR la na-di su-ma i-di-a-bu-um i-ha-sa-ah li-il5-qe su-ma la ki-am a-na si-ib-tim di-na
tgt: To Iddin-abum and Kulumaya from Puzur-Aššur: If they call a pouring silver for wool, deposit the shares--the share of Pūšu-kēn, the share of Ilī-nādā. The wool which is available in Pūšu-kēn's house, until I arrive, please make available(?) You (pl.) wrote me. You (pl.) said, "Bēlānum paid us the silver and it is deposited." The silver is not deposited. If Iddin-abum will require it, take. If it is not so, then take the money on interest.

src: a-na a-la-hi-im a-sur-na-da u i-di-su-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma i-li-a-lum-ma a-sa-me-ma lu-qu-tum sa ku-za-zi-im e-li-a-am a-ba-u-a a-tu-nu KU.BABBAR sa-as-qi-la 4 ma-na u 1 ma-na 6 GIN a-ha-ma KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-tu SAG ITU.KAM ka-ra-a-tim 3 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-em i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab li-mu-um su-da-a DUMU en-na-nim KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su sa-as-qi-la-ma gi-mi-lam i-na se-er a-bi4-ni u i-a-ti su-uk-na su-ma lu-qu-su a-na KU.BABBAR u si-ba-tim la i-ka-sa-ad sa la-qa-em li-iq-a-ma si-tam a-na 1 ma-na-em 3 GIN.TA lu-si-ib
tgt: To Alāhum Aššur-nādā and Iddin-Suen from Ilī-ālum: I hear that Kuzāzum's merchandise has come up here. My dear fathers, have the silver paid. It is 4 minas plus furthermore 1 mina 6 shekels of refined silver, reckoned from the beginning of the month Qarra' atum, (on which) he will pay interest at the rate 3 shekels per mina per month; Eponym Sudaya, the son of Ennānum. Have the silver and its interest paid. Do our father and me (this) favour. If his merchandise does not suffice to cover the silver and the interest, then take what there is to take, and let him add interest on the rest at the rate of 3 shekels per mina.

src: um-ma 10-tum sa bu-ru-tim-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en qi-bi-ma 10-tum sa si-ma-la is-ti-ni sa-bi-is a-hu-u-ni a-ta su-ma mi-ma ta-ki-li <gap>-<gap> a-na ka-ri-im ka-ni-is{ki} is-ta-ap-ru-nim ki-ma ni-a-ti a-wa-tam ta-e-er-ma u te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam-ma u-za-ni pi-te a-hu-u-ni a-ta a-na su-ha-ri-ka na-ah-da-ni a-na ha-ra-nim ta-da-nim
tgt: From the council of ten of Buruddum to Pūšu-kēn; The ten-person council from Šimala is seized in a disagreement with us(?) Our dear brother, if any of the trusted ones(?) have written to the colony office at Kaneš, return a (good) word on our behalf and let your message come. Inform us. Our dear brother, we are taking care to send your youth on his way.

src: a-na a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 u DUG-a-sur a-na a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma tup-pa-am sa 17 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa i-na be-ti-ka e-zi-bu i-na a-wa-ti-ni tup-pu-um su-ut i-mu-at-ma u tup-pa-am sa 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR pu-su-ke-en6 DUMU bu-za-zu a-na i-a-ti u-sa-ra-am a-hi a-ta a-ma-kam i-na sa-ha-at DUG-a-sur a-hi-a i-zi-iz-ma tup-pu-um su-ut li-mu-ut-ma tup-pa-am sa 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa hu-bu-ul pu-su-ke-en6 DUMU se-ra-wa-sa-su-mi u-du-u qa-te-e DUG-a-sur a-hi-a li-is-ba-su a-di-i KU.BABBAR-pi-ka DUG-a-sur is-ni-i-su
tgt: To Aššur-mutabbil and Ṭāb-Aššur, specifically to Aššur-mutabbil, from Aššur-idī: The tablet concerning 17 minas silver which you left in your house is part of our legal affair. Kill that tablet and release to me the tablet concerning 10 minas silver (owed by) Pūšu-kēn s. Buzāza. My dear brother assist my brother Ṭāb-Aššur there to kill that tablet and 'make known?' the tablet concernign the 10 minas silver of the debt of Pūšu-kēn s. Šerawa(?), which (is credited to) my name.

src: um-ma im-di-DINGIR-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma i-zi-iz-ma lu-qu-tum <gap> sa se-ep a-hu-wa-qar DUMU zu-ur-zu-ur ki-ma ni-is-ha-tum i-ni-is-ha-ni u-nu-tum lu-ur-dam-ma a ma-la te-er-ti-a a-na pu-ru-us-ha-tim lu-qu-ti a-bu-uk-ma lu-qu-ti a-na i-ta-at-lim li-di-nu u-la i-qi-pu la u-su-ru KU.BABBAR le-ru-ub-ma AN.NA u TUG.HI.A lu-su u ki-ma a-na-ku a-na-kam si-bi4 as-ku-nu u a-ta a-ma-kam si-bi4 su-ku-un lu KU.BABBAR <gap>-<gap>-<gap> lu TUG.HI.A is-ta-pu-ku <gap>-<gap>-<gap> qa-ti a-na E ka-ri-im i-ta-di a-na ni-ka-si qa-ti sa-ak-li-il5
tgt: From Imdi-ilum to Pūšu-kēn: Stand so that when they asses the excise on the goods transported by Aḫu-waqar son of Zurzur, the merchandise comes down, and dispatch the goods to Purušḫattum according to my instructions so that the goods are sold for cash. They are not to be sold on credit. Do not release them. Let the silver arrive and let tin and textiles depart! Also, just as I set witnesses here for myself, you must set witnesses there for you. Let silver and textiles pile up! Deposit my share in the colony office. Finish my share at accountings.

src: KISIB en-um-a-sur DUMU u-zu-a KISIB a-sur-GAL DUMU e-na-nim KISIB pi-la-ah-su-en6 DUMU <big_gap> <gap>-<gap>-im 0.83333 ma-na 1 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er pi-la-ah-su-en6 {d}EN.LIL-ba-ni i-su KU.BABBAR i-na a-lim{ki} i-sa-qal is-tu SAG ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-DINGIR 1 ma-na-um 12 GIN.TA i-na sa-tim si-ib-tam u-sa-ab li-mu-um i-ku-pi-ISTAR DUMU i-ku-a
tgt: Seals of Ennum-Aššur s. Uzuwa, Aššur-rabi s. enānim, Pilaḫ-Suen s. ..., Pilaḫ-Suen owes Enlil-bāni 5/6 mina 1 shekel refined silver. He will add interest at the rate of 1 mina 12 shekels silver from the beginning of month Maḫur-ilī in the city of Aššur. Year: Ikuppī-Ištar s. Iku(w)a

src: um-ma ka-ru-um ka-ni-is-ma a-na ka-ri-im pu-ru-us-ha-tim qi-bi-ma a-sur-du-gul um-me-a-nu u a-sur-e-mu-qi im-hu-ru-ni-a-ti-ma um-ma a-sur-du-gul-ma ri-ik-se-e sa KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki u AN.NA-ki-ma E a-sur-e-mu-qi e-zi-ib u 10.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na si-ib-tim ha-bu-la-ak-su-um is-tu u4-mi-im sa tup-pu-su il5-li-ip-tu-u <big_gap> a-di ITU.KAM be-el-ti-E.GAL-lim li-mi-im sa qa-tim a-sur-i-mi-ti ma-la-hi-im a ma-la tup-pi-su KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su li-il5-qe-u si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-su a-na-kam sa ki-ma a-sur-du-qul wa-si-ra is-tu ITU.KAM be-el-ti-E.GAL-lim KU.BABBAR a-na si-ib-tim la i-la-ak i-za-az
tgt: From the colony at Kanesh to the colony at Purušḫattum:

src: 1 {TUG}ra-qa-tum SAG {d}UTU-mu-ta-be-el
tgt: 1 top-quality raqqutum textile (belonging to) Šamaš-mutabbil.

src: 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ki-ki-a-a a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ku-ra u su-ka-li-a a-na 3 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab KU.BABBAR a-ni-um a-na sa-du-i-ti-su u pa-zu-ur-ti TUG.HI-ti-su sa-qi-il5 IGI da-da-nim IGI du-du ka-sa-ri-su
tgt: Kiki(?) owes Aššur-rēʾī 2 minas refined silver. He will pay 3 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Kura and Sukkallīya. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest. Witnesses: Dadānim, Dudu the donkey driver.

src: um-ma kur-ub-ISTAR-ma u ki-ku-la-nu-ma a-na PUZUR4.ISTAR qi-bi4-ma a-ma-kam a-wa-ti la ta-as-me-ma i pi bu-si-a sa qa-ti u-ka-lu-su ha-ra-nam sa-ni-tam i-ta-la-ak-ma is-tu tu-ur-hu-mi-it a-na wa-ah-su-sa-na is-tu wa-ah-su-sa-na a-na sa-la-tu-ar i-ta-la-ak-ma ne-nu i ku-pa-a-tim ni-ir-ta-na-pu-ud u a-ta a-na gam-ri-im KU.BABBAR 1 GIN li-ba-ka ma-ri-is a-ta-an-ha-am sa tu-a-ri-ma a-tu-ra-am a-di tup-pa-am sa si-be 2-se-na e-ta-am-du-tim a-la-qe-a-ni-ma la ni-ba-su a-pu-tum KU.BABBAR sa E ka-ri-im u lu-qu-tam i-pi-a mi-si-ma sa-ba-at a-di-i sa ku-zi-zi-a a-da-ni-in-ma sa sa-la-hi-im a-sa-la-ha-am me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im sa a-lim{ki} na-as-u-ni-ku
tgt: From Kurub-Ištar and Kikkulānum to Puzur-Ištar:

src: um-ma a-sur-ba-ni sa-lim-a-sur u ku-lu-ma-a a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-su-mi e-na-tim GEME-ka PUZUR4.ISTAR ik-ta-ma KU.BABBAR 0.5 ma-na e-ri-is-ni-a-ti um-ma su-ut-ma 10 e-na-na-tim a-di-sum tap-pa-a-ti-si-na 3 GIN.TA a-ti-di-in 6 GIN KU.BABBAR i-be-el i-nu-mi e-na-tim tu-ta-ru KU.BABBAR-ap-ka ta-la-qe 8.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR su-nu-nu il5-qe si-bu-sum ip-tu-ur-ma a-da-sum sa ha-ra-ni-su su-ma a-ta ta-di-sum i a-da-sum li-qe na-na-a pu-uz-ra-ka e-hu-uz-ma 3 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na da-ti-su ni-is-qul PUZUR4-a-sur u i-a-sar ig-ri E su-la-ba-an il5-qe-u um-ma su-nu-ma la-ma-si ta-da-an 3.5 GIN KU.BABBAR la-ma-si la ta-di-in KU.BABBAR a-ta a id <gap> sum ni
tgt: From Aššur-bāni, Šalim-Aššur and Kulumaya to Pūšu-kēn: Concerning Ennašum, Puzur-Ištar took your maid as security and asked about 1/2 mina silver from us. He said, "I gave him ten beads(?). I have sold their companions for 3 shekels a piece at various occasions. 6 shekels have become inaccessible. When you return the beads, you can take back your silver." Šū-Nunu took 8 1/3 shekels silver. He obtained witnesses and I gave (them) to him. Concerning his journey, if you gave to him, ?? I will give to him (?) take. Your beloved Nanaya took it and we paid 3 shekels silver for his Puzur-Aššur and Ea-šar took the wages of the house of Šū-Laban. They said, "Lamassī will give." (But) Lamassī did not give the 3 1/2 shekels silver. As for you ... silver ...

src: KISIB <gap>-<gap>-nim KISIB u-sur-sa-a-sur sa hu-bu-ul a-mur-{d}UTU-si 8 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-mur-{d}UTU-si a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim a-na 25 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM 1.5 GIN.TA u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul a-mur-{d}UTU-si
tgt: Seals: ...--nim, Uṣur-ša-Aššur. Regarding the debt of Amur-Samši. Amur-Samši owes Aššur-rēʾī 8 minas refined silver. He will pay 25 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-bēl-awātim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest).

src: 1 GU 45 ma-na URUDU SIG5 sa bu-ra-am i-se-er su-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-e-mu-qi u a-sur-ba-ni <big_gap> DUMU hu-du-ur-la zu-ku-a i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-DUG a-na 3 ha-mus-tim i-sa-qu-lu URUDU i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu u ke-ni-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI i-di-a-bi4-im DUMU su-ISTAR IGI la-qe-pi-im DUMU a-sur-GAL
tgt: Šū-Ištar s. Aššur-emūqī and Aššur-bāni .... s. Ḫudurla owe 1 talent 45 minas refined copper scraps (?) to Zukua. From the ḫamuštum of Aššur-ṭāb he has three weeks to pay the copper. The copper is bound to whomever is solvent.

src: KISIB a-gu5-za KISIB-a-na-ah-DINGIR KISIB ki-is-du-a-at KISIB ha-al-ki-a-su sa hu-bu-ul ki-is-du-a-at <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um sa a-sur-SIPA is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-SIPA u a-la-hi-im 3 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im u-sa-ab <big_gap>
tgt: Seals of Aguza KIŠIBa-na-aḫ-DINGIR, ki-iš-du-a-at, Halik-aššu

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma lu-lu-ma 17 ma-na 12 GIN AN.NA sa dan-a-sur ba-ab ha-ra-nim ku-lu-ma-a-a e-pu-li AN.NA da-mi-iq-ma ku-nu-uk-ma se-bi-lam TUG-ba-ti ma-la a-na E ka-ri-im ta-ta-di-u te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam a-hi a-ta a-bi a-ta gi-mi-lam i-se-ri-a su-ku-un
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Lulu: 17 minas 12 shekels of tin which Dān-Aššur paid me just before Kulumaya's departure, seal the fine tin and send it. Let your message come as to how many textiles you deposited at the colony office. My dear brother, my dear father, do a favor for me!

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma su-bu-ul-tum-ma 7 {TUG}ku-ta-ni KISIB-ku-nu-ki-a dan-a-sur na-as-a-kum da-tam u ni-is-ha-tim u-la i-la-mu-du su-ma a-bi a-ta is-ti pa-ni-u-tim su-ha-ra-am tu-ur-da-su
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Šubultum: Dān-Aššur brings to you 7 kutānum-textiles under my seal. They did not make known the dātum-charge and excise. If you are my brother, send the youth to me with the first travelers.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u dan-a-sur qi-bi-ma AN.NA u TUG.HI.A sa se-ep ku-lu-ma-a u a-gu5-a te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam i-na KU.BABBAR sa hu-ra-sa-nim u a-sur-ma-lik u 7.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa TUG.HI.A sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni 30 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-nu-uk-ma i pa-ni-u-tim-ma wa-si-e se-bi-lam a-sa-me-ma dan-a-sur a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum ta-ta-ra-ad KU.BABBAR ma-la u-se-sa-a-ni lu a-ma-kam sa se-ep ku-lu-ma-a u a-gu5-a su-ma mi-ma ta-di-in lu sa ANSE.HI.A a-li KU.BABBAR 1 GIN i-ba-si-u za-ki-a-ma dan-a-sur tur4-dam a-hi a-ta a-na te-er-ti-a i-hi-id-ma li-ba-am di-nam KU.BABBAR sa PUZUR4-{d}ISKUR u en-um-a-sur su-ma u4-mu-su-nu ma-al-u sa-as-qi-il5-su-nu 30 ma-na KU.BABBAR ku-nu-uk-ma se-bi-lam su-ma dan-a-sur am-tam la ir-de8-a-am li-bi i-la-mi-na-kum i-na tup-pi-ka um-ma a-ta-ma KU.BABBAR sa a-pi-la a-sur-is-ta-ki-il5 <big_gap> KU.BABBAR sa-as-qi-il5-su
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn and Dān-Aššur: Let your message come concerning the tin and textiles in the transport of Kulumaya and Agua. From the silver pertaining to Ḫuraṣānum and Aššur-mālik and the textiles worth 7 1/2 minas silver about which you wrote, seal 30 minas silver and send it with the first departing travellers. I hear that you will send Dān-Aššur to Purušḫattum. As much silver as he sends(?) or is there from the transport of Kulumaya and Agua, if anything is sold, or of donkeys, wherever there is a single shekels of silver, clear it and dispatch Dān-Aššur here. My dear brother, give heed to my instructions and so make me happy. As for the silver owed by Puzur-Adad and Ennum-Aššur, if their term is up, have them pay. Seal 30 minas silver and send it here. If Dān-Aššur does not bring the maid, I will be very disappointed. In your tablet you said, "Aššuriš-tikal (has?) the silver of Apila." Make him pay the silver.

src: 1 ma-na 8.5 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na ni-hi-ri-a-e-em a-su-mi su-ISTAR as-qul is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-na-ah-DINGIR
tgt: A paid 1 mina 8 1/2 shekels to the man from Niḫriya in the name of Šū-Ištar. From the ḫamuštum of Inaḫ-ilī ...

tgt: From Aššur-kāšid to Aššur-nādā and Zikur-ilī: You have written as follows: "Binima-ahum has led 52 (The import duty was) 2 1/2 3 kutānu-textiles for pre-emption, and you will receive 1 1/2 shekel of silver in the storehouse; 4 1/3 shekels of silver accrued to you as losses in the sa'utum; for 5 kutānu-textiles you will receive 1 mina 45 shekels at the accounting; 6 kutānu-textiles have been taken from the sa'utum in the name of Elamma and Hinnaya; they will balance it with you at 16 shekels each, whereof we have received 28 shekels of silver; 7 1/2 kutānu-textiles have been taken for the transport tariff; Binima-ahum has received 1 kutānu-textile; 1/2 kutānu-textile was either loss To Aššur-nādā: Do send me silver, even 1 or 2 minas, so I can do you a favour on the tin.

src: 40 ma-na AN.NA DU10-ab-si-li-a-sur u-pi-qam SA.BA 24.33333 ma-na 6 GIN <big_gap> AN.NA i-di-na-am lu KU.BABBAR lu URUDU lu ni-ga-li i-si-ma a-na AN.NA u-ta-er-ma a-na se-er sa qa-ti-a
tgt: Ṭāb-ṣill-Aššur T Whether it be silver or copper or sickles, he will settle accounts and he will convert it to tin and (out it) into my account.

src: a-na a-sur-dan-ni u a-gu-a qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma a-na a-sur-dan-ni qi-bi-ma <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR sa ki-ma a-sur-SIPA <gap> ma-na sa ki-ma i-li-is-ti-kal <gap> ma-na la-lu-um <gap> ma-na ka-zi-a 1 ma-na <gap> <gap>-um a-hu qar-wi-a-a <gap> ma-na LA 1 GIN KU.BABBAR i-na u4-mi-ka <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> u sa-wi-ri <gap> <big_gap> na-as-be-e <gap> <big_gap> pa-su-ri dam-qu-tim wa-at-ru-tim i-na 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR si-im ra-qi-tim sa li-bi4-ka sa-a-ma i-nu-mi su-ha-ri-a a-sa-pa-ra-ni di-in su-ma la ta-ti-di-in par-sa-am u si-ba-su la a-ga-mi-il5-ka 0.5 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR ISTAR-pi-la-ah IH.ME sa a-sur ha-bu-lam tup-pu-su is-ti <gap>-<gap>-a i-ba-si u4-mu-su sa-na-at e-ti-qu <big_gap> al te-er-ti i-la-ka-kum si-ti KU.BABBAR <gap> <big_gap> u <gap> <big_gap>
tgt: To Aššur-dān and Agua from Pūšu-kēn: To Aššur-dān: x minas silver (with) the representative of Aššur-rē'ī, x minas (silver with) the representative of Iliš-tīkal, x minas (silver with) Lālum, x minas (silver with) Gazia, 1 mina (silver for PN), the losses of the brother of Qarwiya ... Purchase a very fine table with the 1/2 mina silver, the price of the raqqutum textile you owe. Sell(?) it when I write my youth. If you did not give (him it), I will not grant you the parsum and interest as a favor. Ištar-pilaḫ, the priest of Aššur owes me 35 shekels silver. His tablet is with my (servant/youth?). His term is exceeded by a year. ... my instructions will come to you. The remainder of the silver ...

tgt: Pūšu-kēn and Lamassī swore the oath of the city. Lammasi took [x] minas silver as her severance. Lamassī and her female slaves will not return to Pūšu-kēn, his sons, his daughters, and his employees. By the oath of Aššur, Anna, the prince, and the chief of the "war," they swore that from now on neither would return to the other for anything. Witnesses: ..-bi, Alu-..., PN, Ḫanu(nu?), ...-li, [PN], ...-Aššur, [PN].

src: KISIB sa-lim-a-sur KISIB a-mur-{d}UTU DUMU sa-li-ti KISIB i-ku-nim DUMU ili5-ba-ni sa hu-bu-ul i-ku-nim 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er i-ku-nim a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-gu-za u a-sur-i-di 1 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul
tgt: Seals: Šalim-Aššur, Amur-Šamaš s. ?, Ikūnim s. Ilī-bāni/ Regarding the debt of Ikūnim. Ikūnim owes Aššur-rēʾī 20 minas refined silver. He will add 1 shekel per mina per month as interest from the ḫamuštum of Akuzāya and Aššur-idī.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma a-mur-ISTAR u dan-a-sur-ma i-na 1 GU 10 2.5 ma-na 9 GIN AN.NA sa E.GAL-lim il5-qe-u 3 me-at 43 ma-na URUDU a 1 GU-tim u-sa-ma 4 me-at <big_gap> 10 ma-na ik-su-ud-ni-a-ti SA.BA 1 me-at 44 ma-na za-la-ma i-ba-si si-ti 1 me-at 68 ma-na 1.66666 ma-na 6.5 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR <gap> 2 ma-na 10.5 GIN SA 15 GIN sa-du-a-tam ni-di si-ti 1.8333300000000001 ma-na 6.5 GIN KU.BABBAR ku-nu-ki-ni dan-a-sur na-as-a-ku-um si-ti AN.NA a-di-ni i E.GAL-lim ga-ma-ar-su mi-ma u-la a-di-su-um
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Amur-Ištar and Dān-Aššur: From the 1 talent 12 minas and 39 shekels of tin which the palace took, 343 minas of copper for one talent went out and they credited to us 410(?) minas. Thereof, there are 144 minas zalam-ma(??). The remainder is 168 minas --- 1 2/3 minas of silver at a rate of 6 1/2 shekels. Total: x minas 10 1/2 shekels (of silver). Thereof, we deposited 15 shekels (of silver) as the shipping charges. Dān-Aššur brings you the remainder, 1 mina 56 1/3 shekels of silver under our seals. I will not sell any silver whatsoever to (the palace) until the exhaustion (of the stockpiles) in the palace.

src: a-na a-mur-ISTAR u pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma ku-ni-lim 1.5 ma-na 7.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa hi-na-a si-im KU.GI sa ka-ru-um i-hi-ib-lu-su-ni ku-nu-ki-a a-mur-a-sur na-as-a-ku-nu-ti a-ma-kam su-ma a-na pa-zu-ur-ti TUG.HI.A sa hi-na-a ta-ha-sa-ha KU-pa-am su-uq-la su-ma i-na te-er-ti hi-na-a lu-qu-su a-ni-sa-am a-ba-kam qa-bi4-i mi-ma a-na se-ri-a la ta-ba-ka-nim a-du-u ha-ra-ni-a a-na ra-mi-ni-a pa-al-ha-ku a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma a-ma-kam <gap> ma <gap> ma <big_gap> <gap>-<gap> <gap> <big_gap>-<gap> <gap> <big_gap>-<gap> <big_gap>
tgt: To Amur-Ištar and Pūšu-kēn from Kuzallum: Amur-Aššur brings you 1 mina 37 1/2 shekels silver belonging to Ḫinnaya under my seal, the price of the gold which the colony office lent out. There, if you need the textiles of Ḫinnaya for smuggling, pay out the silver. If Ḫinnaya dictated that his goods should be dispatched here, do not in any way send them to me.

tgt: Idī-Suen s. Al-aḫim owes 4 minas silver. Month: ṣipʾem. Eponymate: Kūbīya. Witnesses: Suppilaḫ, Tūr-Aššur. Saklīya s. Šū-Kūbim owes 3 1/3 minas silver. Month: Kanwarta. Eponymate: Kūbīya. Witnesses: Nanīya s.Ḫalāya, Ilī-nādā s. Aššur-nādā.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u sa ki-ma i-a-ti a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma um-ma DU10-a-sur-ma a-su-mi tup-pi-im sa 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa hu-bu-ul pu-su-ke-en6 DUMU sa-ra-wa sa i-na mi-ig-ra-ti-su-nu pu-su-ke-en6 DUMU sa-ra-wa u a-sur-i-di DUMU DU10-i-<gap> ip-qi-du-ni-ku-ni tup-pa-am sa 17 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa hu-bu-ul pu-su-ke-en6 DUMU sa-ra-wa a-di-su-um-ma i-du-wa-ak na-as-pe-er-tam sa a-su-mi tup-pi-im sa 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa a-sur-i-di a-hi-i-a sa ki-ma tup-pa-am tu-su-ru <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> na-as-pe-er-tam si-a-ti pu-su-ke-en6 u-ka-al na-as-pe-er-tam a-ta u sa ki-ma i-a-ti si-ta-me-a-si-ma a ma-la na-as-pe-er-tim tup-pa-am sa 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na pu-su-ke-en6 wa-se-er-ma tup-pa-am su-a-ti u tup-pa-am sa sa-ba-e sa 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa ku-nu-ki-a tup-pu-u ki-la-la-an-ma li-mu-tu
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn, Pūšu-kēn and my representatives, and to Pūšu-kēn specifically, from Ṭāb-Aššur; Concerning the tablet which states 10 minas silver, the debt of Pūšu-kēn s. Šarawa, which Pūšu-kēn s. Šarawa and Aššur-idī son of Ṭāb-i? entrusted to you in their m., I have placed the tablet stating 17 minas silver the debt of Pūšu-kēn s. Šarawa with him and it will be killed. The letter which is concerning the tablet which states 10 minas silver of Aššur-idī my brother, instead of the tablet you released, Pūšu-kēn holds that tablet. You and my representative must read them and according to the našpertam, release the tablet that states "10 minas silver" to Pūšu-kēn and kill that tablet and the tablet of fulfillment for the 10 minas silver which has my seal--all the tablets.

src: KISIB e-di-na-a DUMU i-sa-li-a KISIB i-di-a-bi-im DUMU a-sur-dan KISIB su-la-ba-an DUMU e-la-li KISIB a-sur-SIPA DUMU su-ISTAR 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-SIPA DUMU su-ISTAR a-hu-qar i-su is-tu ITU.KAM si-ib-em a-na 11 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-em si-ib-tam u-sa-ab li-mu-um PUZUR4-ni-ra-ah
tgt: Seals: Iddināya s. Idaliya, Iddin-abum s. Aššur-dān, Šū-Laban s. Elāli, Aššur-rēʾī s. Šū-Ištar. Aššur-rēʾī s. Šū-Ištar owes Aḫu-waqar 2 minas refined silver. He will pay 11 ḫamuštum weeks from the month of Ṣibʾem. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels mper mina per month as interest. Eponymate: Puzur-Niraḫ.

src: 20 GU AN.NA pu-su-ke-en6 20 GU dan-a-sur 5 GU la-qe-ep DUMU i-li-a 6 GU i-na-su-en6 4 GU su-su-en6 6 GU i-di-su-en6 5 GU i-li-su-GAL 8 GU a-ta-ta sa ILLAT-at pu-su-ke-en6 SU.NIGIN 74 GU AN.NA 14 na-ru-qa-tum 1 me-at 21 TUG i-lu-ku
tgt: 20 talents tin belonging to Pūšu-kēn, 20 talents belonging to Dān-Aššur, 5 talents belonging to Lā-qēpum son of Iliya, 6 talents belonging to Enna-Suen, 4 talents belonging to Šū-Suen, 6 talents belonging to Idī-Suen, 5 talents belonging to Ilišu-rabi, 8 talents belonging to Atata-- for the caravan of Pūšu-kēn-- altogether 74 talents tin, and 14 sacks (with) 121 textiles, will go.

src: a-na a-la-hi-im su-{d}a-sur zu-pa u i-li-a-lim qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa sa-la-ah-su-a uh-ta-bi-la-ma ha-lu-li me-eh-ra-tim i-di-nam i-na a-wi-ti-ni 6 ku-ta-ni u-se-ba-al-su-ma a-wi-lu-um i-a-ti i-za-za-am 6 {TUG}ku-ta-ni i-ku-pi-a na-as-a-ku-nu-ti a-wi-lam sa-hi-ta-ma TUG-ba-ti-su li-il5-qe-ma si-ib-tam sa sa-tim a-ni-tim a-na E-be-ti-ni lu-se-ri-ib li-bi la u-la-ma-an su-ma si-ib-tam sa sa-tim a-ni-tim ta-da-nam la i-mu-a TUG.HI.A la ta-da-na-su-um su-{d}a-sur sa pa-su a-na KU.BABBAR i-di-na-ni mi-su-um KU.BABBAR la u-se-bi-lam a-na ni-ih-ri-a a-na pa-ni-a se-bi-la-nim sa 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-he-er-tam lu si-pa-ra-tum lu tu-di-na-tum lu 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR lu 7 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na pa-ni-a se-bi-la-nim su-ma i-na ba-ab-ti-a mi-ma la ta-al-qe-a KU.BABBAR a-hu-um lu-se-bi-lam-ma u-ul si-ib-tam ki-ma a-hu-um a-na a-hi-im i-du-nu la-di-in u-ul be-u-la-tim lu ha-bu-la-ku-su-um a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku su-ma wa-sa-ab 2 TUG.HI.A <big_gap> <gap>-hi sa ma ti a lu-se-bi-lam su-ma la-su a-se-er <big_gap> bu su su-up-ra-su-um ti-ib-nam u e-si sa KU.BABBAR 0.33333 ma-na u e-li-is sa-ma-nim su-ha-ri na-hi-da-ma ba-a-ba-tim <gap> la a-di a-la-ka-ni bi-it
tgt: To Alāhum, Šū-Aššur, Zuba and Ilī-alum from Aššur-nādā: Haluli became indebted to me for 3 minas of silver from Šalahšua, but he has given me a corresponding amount.

src: 1 tup-pu-um sa 16 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR u 16 GU URUDU SIG5 sa su-ISTAR a-na bu-za-zu ha-bu-lu sa-ni-um tup-pu-um sa 12 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa hu-bu-ul sa-ba-zi-a u su-ISTAR sa a-na PUZUR4-a-sur ha-bu-lu-ni-ma 1 ma-na 5 GIN KU.GI sa a-sur-ma-lik DUMU lu-zi-na i-di-nu-ni-su-ni a-na tup-pi-i a-ni-u-tim is-tu ha-mus-tim sa su-ma-li-ba-a-sur ITU.KAM sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti sa-ma-a a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim mi-sal KU.BABBAR sa tup-pi-su u mi-sal URUDU sa tup-pi-su ni-is-ha-su DIRI sa-du-a-su sa-bu su-ISTAR qa-ti bu-za-zu u-sa-as-kan-ma is-tu mi-sal KU.BABBAR u mi-sal URUDU su-ISTAR qa-ti bu-za-zu u-sa-as-ku-nu 12 GU URUDU si-kam sa bu-za-zu il5-qe-u a-na su-ISTAR u-ta-a-ar mi-sal KU.BABBAR u URUDU a-na a-lim{ki} i-la-ak-ma KU.BABBAR a-na-num lu-qu-tum a-la-num eq-lam a-su-mi su-ISTAR e-ti-iq lu-qu-tum lu i-na a-lim{ki} lu i-na GAN-lim a-na E bu-za-zu e-ra-ab lu-qu-tum a-na wa-ah-su-sa-na e-ra-ba-ma a-na KU.BABBAR i-tu-a-ar-ma KU.BABBAR u URUDU sa tup-pi-su ha-ru-mu-tim si-im-tam su-ISTAR a-na bu-za-zu i-sa-qal-ma u tup-pi-su bu-za-zu u-sar-sum su-ma ba-ti-iq su-ISTAR u-ma-la su-ma DIRI su-ISTAR i-la-qe su-ma i-na ma-la u4-me-su sa tup-pi-im a-nim KU.BABBAR u URUDU qa-ti bu-za-zu su-ISTAR la u-sa-as-ki-in 12 GU URUDU si-ki-im su-ISTAR a-na bu-za-zu la i-tu-a-ar u tup-pu-um a-num i-mu-a-at su-ISTAR tup-pi-su e-mar-ma su-ma ba-ti-iq i-sa-he-er su-ma DIRI u-ma-la ki-ma bu-za-zu u-sur-sa-a-sur DUMU bu-zu-ta-a u i-ku-pa-sa a-hu-su a-wa-tam ig-mu-ru IGI a-sur-i-di-in DUMU su-ISTAR IGI LUGAL-su-en6 DUMU ma-ni-a IGI we-er-re-su-um DUB.SAR tup-pu-um a-num a-na il5-mi-ti DUMU su-ISTAR pa-qi-id IGI dan-a-sur DUMU pu-us-qa-nim IGI be-lum-ba-ni DUMU a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim IGI i-di-lim DUMU DUG-i-li
tgt: This tablet is entrusted to Il₅-mì-tí s. Šū-Ištar.

src: KISIB ka-ri-im ka-ni-is sa 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa ar-ni-su i-se-er su-ISTAR a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa en-na-nim u MAR.TU-ba-ni a-na 1 ma-na-im 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa ku-nu-uk ka-ri-im ka-ni-is sa ar-ni-su sa su-ISTAR
tgt: He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest) from the ḫamuštum of Ennanim and Amurrum-bāni.

src: 2.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er da-da-a DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti IH.ME sa su-en6 {d}en-LIL-ba-ni i-su is-tu SAG ITU.1.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU DINGIR-ba-ni is-tu ka-ni-is{ki} i-na e-ra-bi-su-ma a-na pa-ni-su u-se-ba-lam me-eh-ra-at ta-ah-si-is-tim a-ni-tim is-ti pi-la-ah-a i-ba-si IGI pi-la-ah-a DUMU e-na-su-en6 IGI a-mur-ISTAR DUMU en-um-a-a IGI i-li-a-lim DUB.SAR DUMU ri-ma-a-nim
tgt: Witnesses: Pilaḫāya s. Enna-Suen, Amur-Ištar s. Ennamāya, Ili-ālim the scribe s. Rim-Anun.

src: 3.5 ma-na AN.NA a-su-mi pu-su-ke-en6 a-na u-su-ur-sa-a-sur DUMU a-sur-ma-lik as-qu-ul 4 ma-na AN.NA ni-is-ha-at AN.NA-ki-su sa pu-su-ke-en6 i-na ra-mi-ni-a as-qul 3.83333 ma-na 3.25 GIN AN.NA sa ni-ip-la-tim i li-bi-su-ma 1 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR u 5 {TUG}ku-ta-ni a-mu-ra DUMU am-ri-a ip-qi-da-su <gap> ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa PUZUR4-a-sur as-qul <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR <big_gap> URUDU sa a-lim{ki} a-na sa ki-ma pu-su-ke-en6 ah-bu-ul mi-ma a-nim i li-bi pu-su-ke-en6 i-su 9 ma-na 3 GIN AN.NA ni-ip-la-tim sa a-na-kam u 0.66666 ma-na 2 GIN AN.NA sa ti-me-el-ki-a dan-a-sur DUMU sa-lim-a-hi-im 5 ma-na 19 GIN i li-bi bu-ur-su-en6 4.33333 ma-na 0.5 GIN AN.NA i li-bi su-<gap>-<big_gap> <gap> DUMU as-qu-dum <big_gap> <gap>
tgt: I weighed out 3 1/2 minas tin on behalf of Pūšu-kēn to Uṣur-ša-Aššur. I weighed out from my own funds 4 minas tin, the excise on the tin of Pūšu-kēn. 3 minas 53 1/4 shekels tin which ... in his own debt(?), Amurra son of Amriya entrusted him with 1 mina 15 shekels silver and 5 kutānum-textiles. I weighed out x minas 5 shekels silver belonging to Puzur-Aššur. I am in debt to the representatives of Pūšu-kēn ... minas silver (and) [.. talents?] copper. All this Pūšu-kēn owes (?). 9 minas 3 shekels, the n. of the tin, and 42 shekels tin of Timelkiya belong to Dān-Aššur son of Šalim-aḫum. 5 minas 19 shekels is in the heart of Būr-Suen. 4 minas 20 1/2 shekels tin is in the heart of Šu---- son of Asqudum(?).

src: um-ma a-sur-{d}UTU-si-ma a-na su-a-nim qi-bi4-ma a-na a-sur-na-da 20 5 TUG SA.BA 15 ku-ta-num 4.5 GU URUDU it-bu-lu 1.5 GIN u-nu-ut ANSE 5 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na sa-ri-dim ni-di-in 2.5 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na sa-lim-a-sur DUMU me-me-na-nim ni-pu-ul 4 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na DUMU AB-ba-ni sa URUDU SIG5 ha-bu-la-ti-ni ni-is-qul 10 GIN KU.BABBAR i ma-sa-im im-ti 15 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im ANSE 2 GIN KU.BABBAR wa-si-tum 4 ma-na 11 GIN AN.NA <gap> GU 0.33333 ma-na a-na qa-tim ni-di-in si-ti KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na 9 GIN 1 ma-na AN.NA a-mur-DINGIR u-bi4-il5 0.66666 ma-na URUDU wa-si-tum gam-ra-kum su-ma ta-la-kam KU.BABBAR i-a-am sa ha-na-nim u sa DUMU a-bar-zi-zi-im bi4-lam su-ma la ta-la-kam KU.BABBAR is-te-ni-is ku-un-ka-ma se-bi4-lam 1 TUG a-na i-ku-nim tu-bi-il5
tgt: From Aššur-šamšī to Šū-Anum: They brought 5 textiles within the package of 15 kutānum textiles and 4 1/2 talents of tin for Aššur-nādā. 1 1/2 shekels for the gear for the donkey. We gave 5 shekels silver to the driver. We balanced 2 1/2 shekels silver to Šalim-Aššur s. Memenānum. We paid 4 shekels silver to the son of Nabu-bāni for the fine copper which you owed. 10 shekels silver were lost from the cleaning procedure. 15 shekels silver, the price of the donkey. 2 shekels silver - the exit tax; 4 minas 11 shekels (hand) tin we gave for the share. The remainder of the silver was 1 mina 9 shekels. Amur-ilī brought 1 mina tin. 2/3 minas copper was the exit tax. Your funds are exhausted. If you come, bring my silver, Hananum's, and that belonging to the son of Abarzizum. If you do not come, seal the silver altogether and send it to me. You brought(?) 1 textile for Ikūnum.

src: a-na a-sur-i-mi-ti qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma tup-pu-ka sa se-ep a-sur-DU10 la-su 1 GU AN.NA sa se-ep a-sur-DU10 DUMU u-za-ri-a a-na i-tur4-DINGIR u-sa-ni-iq um-ma su-ut-ma mi-ma la ta-qa-bi-a-am u 10 ma-na la ta-qa-bi-am a-na-ku a-wi-lam u-ul a-ga-mi-il5 u-ul la a-ga-mi-il5 IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU i-ku-pi-ISTAR IGI e-me-me DUMU a-zu-ta-a AN.NA u TUG.HI-tu-ka i-na E.GAL-lim ur-du-nim-ma i-ba-si-u 1 ma-na.TA KU.BABBAR E ka-ri-im is-tap-ku-ma 1.5 ma-na.TA i ni-ka-si i-sa-ku-nu KU.BABBAR i-na ra-mi-ni-a as-qul ni-ka-su a-na 4 ITU.KAM i-sa-si-u a-ta ma-la-ka ki-ma AN.NA-ku ma-du-ni-ma u dam-qu-ni sa qi-a-pi-im ni-qi-ip a si-a-ti AN.NA a-di <big_gap> a ma-nim i-ir-ta-ka a-na ki-la-li-ni li-tu-ra-ma um-ma a-ta-ma KU.BABBAR a-na pu-su-ke-en6 di-in u KU.BABBAR lu sa-as-qi-il5-su
tgt: To Aššur-imittī, thus Pūšu-kēn: I do not have your tablet concerning the transport of Aššur-ṭāb. I transfered the 1 talent tin from the transport of Aššur-ṭāb son of Uzariya to Itur-ilī. (He said) "You promised nothing. And you will not promise 10 minas to me." I am the man (of favors). I will do a favor or I will not do a favor. In the presence of Aššur-imittī son of Ikuppī-Ištar and Ememe son of Azutaya, they brought down your tin and textiles from the palace and they are available. They are depositing for 1 minas shares (at the?) kārum office and they will set 1½ minas each at accountings. I paid out (for you) from my own funds. They will announce/call out/have accountings in four months. Make your decision. Because there is much tin and it is fine, we will sold on credit what we could. For that purpose I deposited tin. To whom shall your breast turn (other than) to both of us? You will say, "Give the silver to Pūšu-kēn or let him collect the silver."

src: um-ma a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5-ma a-na ku-na-ni-a qi-bi4-ma 0.5 SILA ka-mu-ni 2 ri-ik-si su-um-la-le-e sa 1 GIN KU.BABBAR si-pa-ra-tim 30 i-la-tim 3 {TUG}me-nu-ni-a-ni sa 1 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR <gap> a su-ha-ri sa-a-mi-ma ti-ib-e-ma a-tal-ki-im su-ma i-nu-mi ku-du-du i-li-ka-ni ma-ka-ru-um a-na is-ri-su i-tu-a-ar u-ma-am is-te-en6 ki-il5-i-su-ma ti-ib-e-ma a-tal-ki-im sa-at-a-sur i-na sa-ha-at wa-la-wa-la IR-di-im ez-bi4-i-si la u-su-ru-si su-ma a-wa-tum da-na-a I.GIS SIG5 u tup-pa-am is-ti ku-du-du se-bi4-lim u a-di-i nu-a-ah ka-ri-im ti-ib-e-ma a-tal-ki-im {d}UTU-ta-ak-la-ku a-sar da-al-tim lu na-al
tgt: From Aššur-mutabbil to Kunania: Purchase 1/2 a sila of kamūne, ... for the child and rise up and come here. ... and get up and come here.

src: a-na li-ip-ti-ISTAR qi-bi-ma um-ma i-ku-pi-a-ma a su-mi a-wi-lam sa a-ta-wa-ku-ni et-la-am a-ta ti-di-su i-nu-mi a-hu-a ha-ra-an su-ki-ni-im ta-at-ru-da-ni AN.NA su-a-ti ta-ap-qi-su-ma u-sa-li-im et-lu-um DUMU um-me-a-nim ma-ha-ta-ka e-ta-ha-az a-su-mi sa su-{d}EN.LIL tup-pa-am ka-ra-am u-sa-as-me-ma a-na ITU.KAM ni-la-kam-ma a-ma-kam ni-ta-wa u4-mu-ni i-ma-lu-u-ma ni-ta-bi-a-ma a-na-ku ma-ha-ta-ka u et-lu-um ni-ta-la-kam a-hi a-ta a-na sa-al-tim la ta-sa-ka-na-ni
tgt: To Lipit-Ištar, from Ikkūpiya: Because of the man you you named for yourself, you yourself gave the young man. When you dispatched my brothers on the smuggler's route, you entrusted that tin to him.

src: 12.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er sar-ma-ma a-zu zu-zu-u ma-la-ba ha-su-i u ha-pu-a-su DUMU ki-da-su sa-lim-a-hu-um i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-di-a-bi-im a-na ku-bu-ur u-ti-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 3 GIN KU.BABBAR si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM a 1 ma-na-im u-su-bu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu u ke-ni-su-nu i E-ti-su-nu u ba-a-bi4-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI a-lu-u DUMU u-du-du IGI lu-lu-a-hi-su
tgt: Šar-mamma, Azu, Zuzu, Malaba, Ḫašui, and Ḫappu-aššu s. Kidaššu owe Šalim-aḫum 12 1/2 minas refined silver.

src: 6 ma-na KU sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er i-sa-a u ir-ra-dan la-qe-ep i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-gu-a u la-qe-ep a-na 33 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma i-na u4-me-su-nu ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-lu a-na 1 ma-na-im 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-su-bu IGI na-ra-am-su IGI nu-ur-ISTAR KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad ke-ni-su-nu ra-ki-is
tgt: Isaya and Erra-dān owe 6 minas refined silver to Lā-qēpum. They will pay 33 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Agua and Lā-qēpum. If they do not pay at the fulfillment of their term, they will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Witnesses: Naram-Suen, Nūr-Ištar. The silver is bound to the head of their trustworthiness.

src: 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er la-li-im a-ha-tum ti-su ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um a-sur-i-di 1 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab a-ha-ma 2 GIN KU.BABBAR 6 GIN KU.BABBAR a ta-ad-mi-iq-tim a-ha-ma 1.5 GIN KU.BABBAR ik-ri-bu sa a-sur mi-ma a-nim a-na la-li-im a-di-in
tgt: Lālum owes Aḫātum 1/2 mina refined silver. Month of Kuzalli, Year of Aššur-idī (REL 94). He will add as interest 1 shekel per mina per month. Separately, 2 shekels of silver, 6 shekels silver to the tadmiqtum, and separately, 1 1/2 shekel silver (for) the ikribū of Aššur--all this I gave to Lālum.

src: a-na a-sur-ba-ni sa-lim-a-sur u i-ku-nim qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma la li-bi DINGIR-ma a-si-ti me-ta-at u-la tal-qe-a-ma sa la be-ti-a la tu-za-ki-a-ma la ta-as-pu-ra-nim 1 li-im 3 me-at se-um i-na ha-ri-a-tim sa-pi-ik er-ba-ma i-na ba-a-bi u a-pa-tim si-pa-su id-a 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-wi-ru sa su-ha-ar-tim 18 GIN KU.GI a-nu-qu-sa 2 me-eh-su-hi-tu u du-di-na-tu-sa 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI su-ma-a a-hu ir-bi-{d}ISKUR ub-la-si-im 2 GIN KU.BABBAR zu-pa u PUZUR4.ISTAR 1 ma-na 10 GIN ma-nu-um-ba-lum-a-sur u su-mi-a-bi-a 3 GIN KU.KI DUMU er-ra-a 1 GIN KU.GI en-um-a-sur DUMU su-a-sur 4 GIN KU.GI i-lu i-na tup-pi-im ka-an-ku ga-as-lu-um 5 GIN KU.BABBAR hu-ra-sa-num 15 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na e-si 5 GIN se-bu-ul-ta-sa a-sur-DU10 sa 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR e-si-a-am za-ku-a-am sa-a-ma-ma E-tam is-ti a-sur-i-mi-ti u-ul is-ti i-ku-nim u-ul sa-ma-a er-sa-a-ma i-na a-ri-im lu ka-an-ku SA.BA KU.BABBAR a-nim 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na li-mi-im sa ib-ni-{d}ISKUR i-la-ak a sa ka-li-ti-ni as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-na-ku-ma se-am <gap> um 4 me-at u 6 me-at di-ni-ma <big_gap> u mu <gap> <big_gap> GIN <big_gap> ba <big_gap> a-lim{ki} <big_gap> mi-ma la ta-<gap> <big_gap> <gap>-na-<gap> <big_gap>
tgt: To Aššur-bāni, Šalim-Aššur and Ikūnum from Pūšu-kēn: Unfortunately, my wife has died.

src: KISIB a-lu DUMU a-du-du KISIB ta-ak-ni-is DUMU ta-la-as KISIB a-sur-ma-lik DUMU a-sur-na-da KISIB {d}UTU-ba-ni DUMU su-ISTAR 2 ma-na 3.5 GIN KU.BABBAR li-ti SIG5 i-se-er a-lu tam-ka-ru-um i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-li-a 1 ma-na 1.75 GIN a-na 7 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 1 ma-na 1.75 GIN a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-me-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab ITU.KAM sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti si-lu-lu
tgt: Siegel des A[ll]u, des Sohnes des Adūdu; Siegel des Takniš, des Sohnes des Talaš; Siegel des Aššurmalik, des Sohnes des Aššurnādā; Siegel des Šamašbāni, des Sohnes des Šū'ištar. 2 Mine 1¾ Seqel gutes . . . . . . Silber hat zu Lasten des Allu der (jeweilige) Gläubiger gut. Vom Amtstage des Ili'a wird er 1 Mine 1¾ Seqel bis zum siebenten Amtstag zahlen. 1 Mine 1¾ wird er is zum zehnten Amtstag zahlen. Wenn er nach Ablauf seiner Zahlungsfrist nicht gezahlt hat, wird er 1½ Seqel pro Mine als Zins im Monat hinzufügen. 'Monat der Falschen' ; Eponymat (aus) der H[an]d des Ṣilūlu.

src: is-tu ni-ka-si pu-su-ke-en6 u a-na-ku ni-si-u-ma 1.66666 ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR i li-bi-a pu-su-ke-en6 i-di-u-ni u a-ha-ma 23 ma-na <gap>-<gap> KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am ku-nu-ki-a a-na ma-sar-tim a-na pu-su-ke-en6 lu e-zi-bu su-ma er-wi-LUGAL e-ta-ar-ba-am 23 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-la-qe su-ma i-ti-ri-is 23 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am er-wi-LUGAL a-na pu-su-ke-en6 i-sa-qal
tgt: After Pūšu-kēn and I called accounts and Pūšu-kēn deposited 1 mina 42 shekels silver to my account, then separately I indeed left 23 minas refined silver under my seal in the strong room for Pūšu-kēn. If Erwi-šarrum entered, he took the 23 minas silver. If the claim is proven, Erwi-šarrum will pay Pūšu-kēn 23 minas refined silver.

src: i-nu-mi is-me-ru-ni 1 {TUG}ku-ta-nam i-na sa i-la-qe-u la-ap-ta-ku DIRI a-di-ma i-nu-mi is-te-na is-ta-ap-ku-ni 1 {TUG}ku-ta-nam a-di-im 2 {TUG}ku-ta-ni i-na sa-na-ni-im a-di li-mu-um su-be-lim is-tu 14.66666 ma-na a-bu-ni la-ap-tu-ni 11.5 ma-na 5 GIN sa a-na-ku la-ap-ta-ku-ni i-na TUG-tim a-ni-u-tim 1 TUG sa a-bi-ni 3 TUG.HI.A i-a-u-tum
tgt: When they ..., I wrote down the kutanu textile which he took.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma ta-ri-is-ma-tum <gap> u be-la-tum-ma la ti-de8-e ki-ma KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na.TA i-su qa-ti-ni su-ha-ru-ni ha-al-DU-ni a-bu-ni be-el-ni a-ta a-na su-ha-ri la ta-sa-la-at AN.NA u TUG-ba-tu a-di a-na KU.BABBAR i-tu-ru-ni i-na E-ti-ka-ma li-ib-si-ma a-na KU.BABBAR ta-er-ma KU.BABBAR se-bi-lam na-as-pe-ra-tu-ni a-sar ku-a-ti li-ib-si-a
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Tariš-mātum and Bēlātum: Do you not know? Because someone has roughly a mina of silver (on them), the accounts of our 'boys' are ruined! Our dear father and lord, do not treat the 'boys' harshly. Let the tin and textiles, until they are returned for silver, be in your own house so that the silver will return and (you can) send the silver. Let our dispatches reach you wherever you are.

src: a-na be-lum-ba-ni qi-bi4-ma um-ma ta-ri-sa-ma TUG is-ti TUG-ba-ti-ka-ma na-as-u-ni-kum su-ba-at ra-mi-ni-a-ma ah-mu-us-ma u-se-bi4-la-kum su-ma a-ta la ta-la-kam si-im su-ba-ti-a is-ti pa-ni-im-ma se-bi4-lam a-ta-ma sa te-zi-ba-ni i-na li-bi4-ka-ma ti-de8-e u su-ba-ti a-ta-ma ti-de8-e se-am sa ta-aq-bi4-a-ni um-ma a-ta-ma <big_gap> se-am i-na E a-bi4-ka u-la i-ta-ad-nu-nim u4-ma-am se-am as-ta-na-am u4-ma-am te-ta-na-ti-ir-ma tup-pe-e a-na um-mi-ka tu-us-te-ne-ba-lam um-ma a-ta-ma su-ma E a-bi4-sa ta-la-ak te-er-ti-ki li-li-kam pa-ra-as E a-bi4-ka la ti-de8-ma tup-pa-am sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni a-na a-bi-a um-ma a-ta-ma ma-la sa-ku-li-ki E a-bi4-a la ma-su ma E a-bi4-ki ta-at-ta-la-ki ba-ri-ti ta-as-me-ma tup-pa-am is-te-en a-na a-bi4-a u um-mi-ka tu-se-bi4-lam u4-ma-am is-tu i-si u qa-ti-a ag-mu-ru E a-bi4-ka is-tu i-si u qa-ti-a ag-mu-ru-ni i-na se-im si-ta-u-mi-im ag-mu-ru-ni i-na ITU.1.KAM sa-ra-a-tim se-am GIN.TA i-di-nu-nim u is-ka-ra-am e-pa-su-nu-ti a-bi4 iq-bi4-a-kum-ma um-ma su-ut-ma mi-nam a-na su-ha-ar-tim te-zi-ib um-ma a-ta-ma zi-iq-na-am la za-qu-na-ku-ma hu-ur-si se-su-ra-am la a-le-e su-ma-me-en6 la E a-bi4-a a-e-sa-me-en6 a-lik sa-am-na-am sa te-zi-ba-ni a-na pi-ta-si-a u TUG a-na li-tab-si-a
tgt: To Bēlum-bāni from Tarišam: A textile is being brought to you with your textiles. I took out a textile of my own and sent it to you. . . Send the proceeds of my textile immediately. You yourself know in your heart that which you left for me. And you yourself know very well my textile.

src: KISIB a-sur-ma-lik DUMU lu-zi-na KISIB i-na-a DUMU e-la-li sa 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-na KU.BABBAR-ap a-sur-SIPA DUMU-u a-sur-{d}UTU-si DUMU ib-ni-li il5-qe-u-ni su-ma um-ma a-sur-SIPA-ma i-na URUDU sa a-sur-{d}UTU-si mi-ma u-la al-qe KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su 1.5 GIN.TA sa is-tu ha-mus-tim sa e-na-ma-nim u a-la-hi-im DUMU u-a-sur-{d}UTU-si i-sa-qu-lu ta-ah-si-is-tum10 a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im
tgt: Seals: Aššur-mālik s. Luzina, Innāya s. Elāli.

src: 1 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er bu-sa-nim {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-na-a u a-sur-ma-lik ITU.1.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um a-sur-i-di a-na 25 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab IGI ir-ma-a-sur IGI i-ku-pi-a-sur
tgt: Buṣānim owes Adad-ṣulūlī 1 mina 15 shekels refined silver. He will pay 24 weeks from ḫamuštum of Innāya and Aššur-mālik, month of Kuzalli, eponymate of Aššur-idī. If he does not pay, he will add 1 1/2 shekel per mina per month.

src: 43 ma-na URUDU i-se-er ku-sa-ri su-en-na-da i-su is-tu ITU.1.KAM na-ar-ma-ak-a-sur a-na 10 ma-na.TA 1 ma-na.TA u-sa-ab li-mu-um sa qa-ti su-da-a DUMU en-na-nim IGI en-nam-i-li IGI a-sur-DUG
tgt: Kuzāri owes Suen-nādā 43 minas copper. He will add 1 mina per 10 minas (per month(?), as interest) from the month of Narmak Aššur. Eponymate: The one after Sudaya s. Ennanim. Witnesses: Ennam-ilī, Aššur-tāb.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti su-ISTAR en-na-num u bu-bu-ra-num-ma a-na im-di-lim qi-bi-ma i-na 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR 1 GU 54 ma-na URUDU sa su-ISTAR 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-hu-ur i-na 1 GU 15 ma-na URUDU 0.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa en-na-nim 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-hu-ur 0.5 ma-na 3 GIN KU.BABBAR sa en-na-su-en6 a-sar la-qa-im la-su i-na-0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa a-mur-a-sur 10 GIN KU.BABBAR a-su-mi en-na-be-lim ib-tu-uq 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-qul 30 ma-na URUDU a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku is-qul 7 ma-na a-hu-a is-qul <gap> ma-na URUDU ga-ba-a is-qul 8 GIN KU.BABBAR na-ar-am-{d}ISKUR is-qul i-na-0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR 10 GIN KU.BABBAR i-ku-num is-qul i-na 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-zi-za-a is-qul 1.8333300000000001 ma-na URUDU su-a-num is-qul 6.5 ma-na URUDU sa i-ri-bi-im u-la ni-il5-qe 16 ma-na URUDU 5 SILA LAL sa-qu-u u-la ni-il5-qe 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa sa-lim-a-sur u DUMU ti-li-a sa i-ku-num DUMU i-di-a-bi4-im il5-qe-u i-ku-num si-be ar-be-et u-se-li-ma tup-pa-am sa ma-mi-it i-ku-nim ni-ih-ri-im i-na wa-su-ur di-ni i-ta-ma a-wi-lum u-la it-ma im-tu-at a-na 47 ma-na URUDU sa a-na sa-lim-a-sur u DUMU ti-li-a sa ki-ma pu-su-ke-en6 ta-as-qu-lu i-ta-ak-ru-ku-nu-ti um-ma su-nu-ma lu ni-it-ma-a <gap> ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa PUZUR4-a-sur a-hi-ka um-ma su-ut-ma as-ra-kam sa-bu-0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa ib-ni-{d}ISKUR um-ma su-ut-ma 2 ANSE AN.NA-ki sa a-na ma-ar-da-ma-an ub-lu u-0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR ag-mu-ur u-kul-tam sa su-ha-ri-su u-la-mi-su 8 ma-na URUDU <big_gap> <gap>-ti DUMU sa-lim-a-sur <big_gap> 3 ma-na URUDU sa i-di-a-bi-im <big_gap> u-la ni-il5-qe <big_gap> a-sur-ma-lik <big_gap> um-ma su-ut-ma mi-ma <big_gap> 1 GIN.TA <big_gap> a-sur-ma-lik <big_gap> a-<gap> <big_gap> a-sur-ma-lik <gap> GIN KU.BABBAR IR-{d}SES.KI um-ma su-ut-ma mi-ma i-se-ri-a u-la i-su 4.66666 ma-na URUDU sa u-si-pi-is-qi-im um-ma su-ut-ma sa-bu u <big_gap> is-ti a-sur-i-mi-ti <big_gap> <gap>-ka-ni a-di i-sa-ni <big_gap> a-sur-i-mi-ti
tgt: From Aššur-imittī, Šū-Ištar, Ennānum and Buburānum to Imdī-ilum:

src: a-na su-ISTAR qi-bi-ma um-ma la-qe-pu-um-ma sal-ma-ku u te-er-ti DAM.GAR sal-ma-at i-nu-mi a-na a-lim{ki} a-li-ku-ni ta-aq-bi4-a-am um-ma a-ta-ma AN.NA-wa-at-ra-am 10 ma-na sa-a-ma-ma lu-qu-tu sa DAM.GAR li-ba-am lu i-su um-ma a-na-ku-ma KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na u 2 ma-na su-ul-ta-ma la-as-a-ma-kum wa-ar-ki-tam-ma KU.BABBAR u-la ta-ta-ad-nam u a-na-ku as-tu-hu-ut-ma KU.BABBAR u-la e-ri-is-ka u i-na a-lim{ki} sa-zu-uz-tum u-la i-di-ni-ma a si-a-ti AN.NA 10 ma-na wa-at-ra-am u-la a-as-a-ma-kum a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta su-ma li-ba-ka me-eh-ra-at AN.NA-ki a-ni-e-im i-na KU.BABBAR sa DAM.GAR li-di-nu-ni-ma la-li-ik-ma i-na a-lim{ki} si-ma-am sa qa-ti i-sa-u-mu a-mu-ur ti-de8-e a-ta-ma ki-ma KU.BABBAR 10 ma-na a-bi ha-bu-lu-ma a-ta qa-ta-tu-ni ha-ra-na-am is-te-et u si-ta lu-ka-si-id-ma pu-ti lu-za-ki-ma za-ku-u-um a-na-ku i re-si-ka la-zi-iz a-bi4 a-ta be-li a-ta ha-ra-nam di-na-ma ma-la pu-ti u-za-ku-u ep-sa-ni su-ma te-er-ta-ka la i-li-kam-ma ha-ra-na-am la ta-ta-ad-na-am a-ta-bi4-ma a-se-er u-nu-tim a-ta-la-ak a-wi-lum la dam-qu-um is-tu 10 sa-na-tim a-na pa-ah-e-em u sa-ku-ki-im is-ta-ak-na-ni u4-ma-am i-na ke-en6-e-em sa e-ba-ru-ti-a la al-te-e su-ma ha-ra-na-am la ta-da-na-am a-ta-bi4-ma a-se-er u-nu-tim a-ta-la-ak li-ba-ka la i-la-mi-in
tgt: The man is no good. For ten years, he has taken me for a deaf and dumb one. (Even) if you don't allow me to travel, I'll (still) set off and go to (acquire) the merchandise. Don't be angry!

src: um-ma e-na-a-sur-ma a-na a-mur-ISTAR qi-bi-ma mi-nam sa a-di u4-mi-im a-nim ta-ta-as-ba-ni ku-ri-a-lum a-mi-sa-am sar-du-a-am la i-ba-re-e a-pu-tum i {d}UTU-si tup-pi-i ta-sa-me-u tup-pe-e-a wa-za lu ta-di-na-ku-ma u tup-pe-e sa E a-bu-sa-lim DUMU <big_gap><gap> na-as-pe-er-ti a-sur-tak-la-ku na-as-a-kum a ma-la na-as-pe-er-ti-a tup-pi-a sa wa-za u sa DAM a-bu-sa-lim le-qe-ma ar-hi-is a-tal-kam a su-mi-ka a-na wa-ah-su-sa-na e-ra-ba-am la a-mu-a ku-a-ti u-qa-a-ka a-pu-tum a-su-ri u4-me-e 2 a-ma-kam e ta-as-hu-ur-ma um-ma-na-tum e e-ki-pa-nim-ma a-ta e ta-ah-liq u tup-pe-e-a e tu-ha-liq i-hi-id wa-za ti-<gap>-tam su-su-en6 ta-hi-si-ma lu tu-si u-la a-ni-sa-am se-si-a-si
tgt: Folgendermaßen Enna'aššur. Zu Āmurištar sprich! Warum hast du mir (nur) bis zu diesem Tage gehorcht? (Betrifft:) die kurrū (Getreide) für die Stadt dorthin zu schicken: sie (die Stadt) soll nicht hungern! Bitte! An dem Tage, an dem du meine Tafeln liest, möge meine Urkunden Waza dir geben. Ferner ist mit den Urkunden des Hauses Absūšalim, des So[hnes des . . . ] . . [. . . , wie] ich geschrieben habe, Aššurtaklāku zu dir unterwegs. Gemäß meinem Briefe nimm meine Urkunden, die der Waza und die der Frau des Abūšalim und komm schleunigst her. Deinetwegen habe ich nach Waḫšušana nicht gehen wollen. Dich erwarte ich! Bitte! Möglichst keine zwei Tage sollst du dort dich aufhalte! Dann können die Geldgeber mir nicht zusetzen. Auch sollst du nicht zugrunde gehen und meine Urkunden sollst du nicht zugrunde richten Sei achtsam" Waza . . . Šūsu'in ist ihr nahe (?). Sie möge herausgehen. Hierher möge er sie nicht herausgehen lassen (?).

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 u dan-a-sur qi-bi4-ma a-na dan-a-sur qi-bi4-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma 45 ma-na sa DAM.GAR na-as-u-ni-kum 1 ne-pi-sa-am sa 10 ma-na ap-tur4-ma 9 ma-na-e-su-ma la-ma di-in a-lim{ki} a-na ma-la te-er-ti-ku-nu AN.NA u li-wi-su as-a-ma 4 ANSE sa AN.NA u is-te-en6 ANSE i-a-um sa AN.NA u 40 TUG SA.BA 20 TUG ka-ab-tu-tum a-na si-ti lu-qu-ti-im sa ba-ri-ni 30 TUG SA.BA 10 TUG ka-ab-tu-tum dam-qu-tum mi-ma a-nim a-sur-ma-lik DUMU ir-ma-{d}ISKUR i-ra-de8-a-ku-nu-ti 33 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa DAM.GAR sa ku-si-a tu-se-bi-la-ni i-na di-in a-lim{ki} sa-li-is-tam AN.NA i-sa-u-mu AN.NA la i-ba-si sa ma-at sa-pi-il5-tim i ma-qa-tim a lu-qu-tim sa DAM.GAR si-ma-am a-sa-a-ma ku-si-a u-ba-la-ku-nu-ti lu-qu-tam lu sa se-ep PUZUR4-a-sur lu sa se-ep a-sur-ma-lik za-ki-a-ma dan-a-sur li-ta-al-kam KU.BABBAR sa ik-ri-bi4-a u KU.GI 10 GIN i pa-nim-ma se-bi4-la-nim
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: To Dān-Aššur: You wrote me. You said, "45 minas (silver) which the merchant brought to you." I opened one sack of 10 minas and with 9 of its minas (?), before the verdict of the city, according to your instructions, I purchased tin and its wrappings and 4 donkeys loaded with tin and one donkey of mine loaded with tin As 33 minas silver belonging to the merchant, which you sent me (in the transport) of Kuṣia, becasue of the decision of the city they will purchase a third tin. There is no tin available. As for the lower land, at arrival (?) I will make purchases for the merchandise of the merchant and Kuṣia will bring it to you (pl.). Clear the merchandise, both from the transport of Puzur-Aššur and from the transport of Aššur-mālik, and let Dān-Ašsur come. Send me silver for my

src: 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er ma-ah-si sa pu-nu-a u ni-wa-ah-su-sar u si-wa-na-la a-sur-ma-lik i-su a-na qi-ti-ip ki-ra-nim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 2 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM u-su-bu IGI en-um-a-sur IGI PUZUR4-a-sur IGI ha-pu-a-la
tgt: The maḫši of Punuwa, Niwaḫšušar, and Šiwanala owe 1/3 minas silver to Aššur-mālik. They will pay at picking of the "mother" grapes. If they do not pay, they will add interest at the rate of 2 shekels per month. Witnesses: Ennum-Aššur, Puzur-Aššur, Ḫappu-ala

src: <big_gap> i-su-u is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-SIPA u a-la-<big_gap> 1 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na ma-na-im u-su-bu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is
tgt: [Regarding the debt of ... that PN and PN] owe [PN]. They will add 1 shekel per mina per month from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-rēʾī and Al-a[...]. The silver is bound to whomever is solvent.

src: <big_gap> KU.BABBAR <big_gap> <gap>-ti u <gap> ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR sa bu-zu-ta-a nu-ta-ar-sum sa 1 GU 4 ma-na AN.NA 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa MI-li-ISTAR sa 2 GU 1 ma-na AN.NA 5.66666 ma-na 8.66666 GIN KU.BABBAR sa i-tur4-su-en6 sa 2 GU AN.NA sa i-li-a-lim 8.33333 ma-na 7 GIN SA.BA 16 GIN sa sa-ri-dim nu-sa-ha-ar 17.5 GIN i-ku-nu-um 0.33333 ma-na 1 GIN si-im ANSE ma-nu-um-ba-lum-a-sur 4.83333 ma-na LA 0.25 GIN a-mur-ISTAR 1 ma-na sa-lim-a-sur is-tu sa bu-zu-ta-a u sa i-li-a-lim sa-hu-ru SU.NIGIN 39.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR pu-su-ke-en6 ha-bu-ul 49 ku-ta-nu E en-na-nim 5 ma-na AN.NA qa-tim is-ti a-sur-i-mi-ti 3 ku-ta-nu sa DAM.GAR i-na qa-ti-su mi-ma a-nim pu-su-ke-en6 e-zi-ib
tgt: ... silver ... and x minas 2 shekels silver belonging to Buzutaya, we returned to him. From the 1 talent 4 minas tin, 6 minas silver belonging to Ṣilli-Ištar, from 2 talents 1 mina tin, 5 minas 48 2/3 shekels silver belonging to Itur-Suen; from 2 talents of tin from Ilī-ālum, 8 minas 27 shekels, within it 16 shekels for the driver we deducted. 17 1/2 shekels Ikūnum, 21 shekels, the price of a donkey, to Mannum-bālum-Aššur, 4 minas 49 3/4 shekels to Amur-Ištar, 1 mina to Šalim-Aššur, ... from the goods of Buzutaya and of Ilī-ālum we deducted. In total, Pūšu-kēn owes 39 minas 25 shekels. 49 kutānum textiles in the house of Ennānum, 5 minas hand tin with Aššur-imittī, 3 kutānum textiles belonging to the merchant are in his account/share. Pūšu-kēn left all this.

src: 1.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-ba-ni su-la-ba-an i-su ITU.KAM ab-sa-ra-ni7 li-mu-um i-ku-pi-ISTAR 1.5 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR a-na 1 ma-na-e-em si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI PUZUR4.ISTAR IGI PUZUR4-sa-ka-ar
tgt: Aššur-bāni owes Šū-Laban 1 2/3 minas refined silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels silver per mina as interest. Witnesses: Puzur-Ištar, Puzur-sakar.

src: is-tu ha-mus-tim sa qa-ti a-sur-mi-ti u in-na-a ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tim li-mu-um DUG-a-sur tup-pu-um sa a-gu5-a i-la-pa-at
tgt: From the ḫamuštum after Aššur-imittī and Innāya, month of Qarrātum, eponymate of Ṭāb-Aššur. Written on the tablet of Agua.

src: en-um-a-sur a-na ma-num-ki-a-sur DUMU a-hu-qar is-ba-at-ni-a-ti-ma um-ma en-um-a-sur-ma 11 ma-na KU.BABBAR ha-bu-la-ti lu-qu-tam a-di-na-ku-ma qa-ti sa-ak-na-at um-ma ma-num-ki-a-sur-ma ke-na lu-qu-tam ta-di-na-ma ki-ma bi-it-qa-tu-ni a-mu-tam i-na ma-tim qe-er-bi-tim as-me-ma a-na ma-tim qe-er-bi-tim e-ru-ub-ma a-mu-tam as-a-ma qa-at-ka sa-ak-na-at ki-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-ka la ka-as-du-ni a-mu-tam i-na sa-la-tu-ar e-zi-ib-ma a-na wa-ah-su-sa-na e-ti-iq-ma 10 GU URUDU 1 GIN.TA <big_gap> 1 ma-na.TA is-ti su-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-ba-ni al-qe-ma a-na sa-la-tu-ar u-bi-il5-ma a-sar a-si-um ib-si-u a-di-in-ma a-mu-tam a-na wa-ah-su-sa-na ub-lam-ma a-na su-ISTAR a-di-in-ma su-ISTAR-ma a-sar ta-da-nim i-ti-di-in i sa-ha-ti-a i-zi-iz-ma tup-pa-am sa ka-ri-im li-qe-ma su-ma a-mu-tum i-na wa-ah-su-sa-na la i-na di-nu u la-li-ik-ma a-mu-tam a-ni-sa-am lu-ub-lam a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um ka-ni-is i-di-ni-a-ti-ma IGI GIR-sa-a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in IGI a-da-da IGI a-sur-ma-lik IGI DUG-si-la-a-sur
tgt: Witnesses: Adada, Aššur-mālik, Ṭāb-ṣilla-Aššur.

src: 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR li-ti SIG5-tim i-se-er su-{d}EN.LIL u a-sur-ni-im-ri su-la-ba-an i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa pu-su-ke-en6 u a-sur-ma-lik a-na 2 ITU.KAM i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu ITU.KAM te9-i-na-tim li-mu-um ku-bi4-a KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI DU10-si-la-a-sur IGI en-um-a-sur
tgt: Šū-Enlil and Aššur-nimrī owe Šū-Laban 1/2 mina fine quality silver. They will pay two months from the ḫamuštim of Pūšu-kēn and Aššur-mālik. If he does not pay (on time), he will add interest at the rate of the colony.

src: 11 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ku-na-a PUZUR4-su-en6 i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa en-na-nim u sa-lim-a-sur a-na 40 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab SAG ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um ib-ni-{d}ISKUR DUMU ba-qu-nim IGI PUZUR4-sa-du-e IGI u-su-ur-sa-a-sur DUMU a-gu5-a IGI a-sur-is-ta-ki-il5
tgt: Kunāya owes Puzur-Suen 11 minas refined silver. He will pay 40 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Ennānum and Šalim-Aššur. If he does not pay (on time), he will add interest at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. From the head of the month Kuzalli, eponymate of Ibni-Adad s. Baqqunum. Witnesses: Puzur-šaduʾe, Uṣur-ša-Aššur s. Agua, Aššuriš-takil.

src: um-ma kur-ub-ISTAR-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI a-sur-ba-ni ub-lam 15 GIN.TA 30 ma-na AN.NA as-a-ma-kum SA.BA 2 ma-na AN.NA qa-tim a-na pi-la-ah-ISTAR a-di-in 28 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ki-a pi-la-ah-ISTAR na-as-a-kum
tgt: From Kurub-Ištar to Aššur-nādā: Aššur-bām brought me 2 minas of silver, its import duty added. I bought for you 30 minas of tin at the rate 15:1; thereof I gave 2 minas of tin for expenses to Pilah-Ištar. Pilah-Ištar is on his way to you with 28 minas of tin under my seal.

src: 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-na-ah-DINGIR i-su is-tu sa-pa-tim sa ka-si-im a-na 1 ma-na-im 2 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab 12 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-su-mi DUMU da-da-nim a-na ku-ra as-qul is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-ba-ni u en-ma-a-a 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um is-ti su-ku-bi-im wa-ar-ki-a u-se-ba-lam 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um 5 ma-na 16.5 GIN KU.BABBAR <gap> i-ku-nim <gap> su u ba ru <big_gap> <gap> 8 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am <gap> u a e <gap> 2 <gap> ka <gap> ka bi i il5-<gap> i-ta-ad-na-am a-na si-a-ma-tim a-si-e-su 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er as-qu-di-a u la-qe-ep i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ha-na-nim u sa-lim-a-hi-im 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM u-su-bu-u SA.BA 2.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-na si-ib-ti-a ur-ki 1.3333300000000001 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-ti a-sur-GAL DUMU su-hu-bur is-tu ha-mus-tim sa su-a-nim 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab URUDU u am-tam a-na sa-pa-ar-tim u-ka-al 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR u si-ba-tu-su is-ti a-ha-na-ar-si 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-ti PUZUR4.ISTAR DUMU a-ta-a is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa li-ba-a u i-li-is-ti-kal 0.75 GIN.TA u-sa-ab
tgt: Anaḫ-ilī owes 10 minas refined silver. He will add 2 shekels per mina per month (as interest) from the šapattim of kaššim.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na la-qe-ep u pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma 54.66666 ma-na 5.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa se-ep ah-sa-lim sa a u4-me qu-ur-bu-tim ta-qi-pa-ni 58 ma-na 18.5 GIN sa se-ep pu-su-ke-en6 28.33333 ma-na 7 GIN sa lu-lu-u DUMU zu-ku-hi-im 31.5 ma-na sa i-na tu-ur-hu-mi-it a-sur-UTU-si u hi-na-a i-qi-pu-ni 5 ma-na sa a-mur-ISTAR sa AN.NA-ki-a ta-as-pu-ra-nim um-ma a-tu-nu-ma hi-na-a i-sa-qa-al-su u te-er-ti-ni a-na hi-na-a i-ta-la-ak SU.NIGIN 2 GU 58 ma-na 1 GIN SA 31 ma-na 15 GIN 0.5 ma-na sa-du-a-su su-su-en6 u DUMU su-a-sur ub-lu-nim 20.83333 ma-na 0.33333 ma-na sa-du-a-su DUMU e-ra-a ub-lam 31 ma-na 15 GIN 0.5 ma-na sa-du-a-su 2 ma-na a-ha-ma me-eh-ra-at TUG.HI-ti-su dan-a-sur ub-lam 41.66666 ma-na 0.66666 ma-na sa-du-a-su i-li-a-lim ub-lam 18 ma-na 18 GIN kur-ub-ISTAR ub-lam SU.NIGIN 2 GU 27 ma-na 18 GIN KU.BABBAR sa ub-lu-ni-ni si-ti KU.BABBAR 30.33333 ma-na 3 GIN sa u4-mu-su e-ti-qu-ni si-ib-tam la ta-sa-me-a KU.BABBAR sa-as-qi-la-ma i pa-nim-ma se-bi4-la-nim u a-se-er hi-na-a su-up-ra-ma KU.BABBAR sa as-ra-kam-ma i-qi-pu-ni lu-se-bi4-lam i-na tup-pi-ku-nu 7.5 ma-na 5.66666 GIN KU.BABBAR sa se-ep ah-sa-lim a-na u4-me pa-ti-u-tim i-se-er DAM.GAR-ri na-di 31 ma-na 18.5 GIN sa se-ep a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 u nu-ur-ISTAR su-ma u4-mu-su-nu ma-al-u KU sa-as-qi-la-ma i pa-nim-ma se-bi4-la-nim KU.BABBAR sa i-li-a-lim u kur-ub-ISTAR ub-lu-ni-ni mi-su-um tup-pu-um ik-bi4-da-ku-nu-ti-ma la tu-se-bi4-la-nim
tgt: Regarding the 54 minas 45 1/2 shekels silver from the šēpum of Aḫ-šalim which you 'entrusted' on long terms, 58 minas 18 1/2 shekels from the šēpum of Pūšu-kēn, 28 minas 27 shekels from Lulu son of Zukuḫūm, 31 1/2 minas which Aššur-šamši and Ḫinnāya 'entrusted' in Durḫumit, 5 minas from Amur-Ištar for my tin, you (two) wrote me. You said, "Ḫinnāya will pay it, and our message will go to him." Thereof, Šū-Suen and the son of Šū-Aššur brought me 31 minas 15 shekels--its The son of Errāya brought me 20 5/6 minas--its Dān-Aššur brought me 31 minas 15 shekels--its šadduatum 1/2 mina-- (and) 2 minas separately - the corresponding amount to his textiles. Ilī-ālum brought me 41 2/3 minas--its Kurub-Ištar brought me 18 minas 18 shekels. Total: 147 minas 18 shekels silver which they brought me The remainder of the silver is 30 minas 33 shekels, those whose terms are past Don't listen to the interest. Have the silver paid and send it to me immediately. In your (pl.) tablet (you said), "7 minas 35 2/3 shekels silver from the shipment of Aḫ-šalim is placed on merchants on 'long' terms. As for the 31 minas 18 1/2 shekels silver (arising) from the shipment of Aššur-mutabbil and Nūr-Ištar, if their terms are full, have them pay the silver and send it immediately. As for the silver which Ili-ālim and Kurub-Ištar brought, why has the tablet become too heavy for you(pl.) (to send)? Don't send that to me.

src: <big_gap> en-nam-a-sur u-sa-num u a-du-ma um-ma en-um-a-sur-ma 1 me-at 30 ma-na URUDU sa me-tum ha-am-sat E ka-ri-im qa-ti PUZUR4-a-sur al-qe 40 ma-na URUDU sa me-tum ha-am-sat qa-at-ka al-qe 1 me-at 80 ma-na.TA <big_gap> si-im URUDU SIG5 sa E ka-ri-im a-mur-ISTAR la-ap-tu SA.BA 78 ma-na 15 GIN a-na-ku al-qe 1 me-at URUDU E ka-ri-im si-im URUDU SIG5 u-sa-num il-qe URUDU-ka sa-bu-a-ti 1 me-at 50 ma-na URUDU ma-la E ka-ri-im qa-at-ka al-ta-qe-u a-na u-sa-nim u a-du a-di-in ma-la DAM.GAR i su-hu-pi-im <gap> <big_gap> <gap>-si-ka E ka-ri-im <big_gap> a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku DUMU a-bu-sa-lim ub-la-kum mi-ma i-na li-bi4-a <big_gap> <gap>-di-su i-na 2 me-at 50 ma-na 18 ma-na a-du il5-qe
tgt: To ... Ennam-Aššur, Usānum, and Addu, from Ennum-Aššur. I took 40 minas weri-copper of the dead man, a fifth of your share. Amur-Ištar is written down(subj.?) (for?) 180 minas as the price of the fine weri-copper at the colony office. Thereof, I myself took 78 minas 15 shekels. Usānum took 100 (minas) weri-copper at the colony office, the price of the fine copper. You are satisfied with regard to your weri-copper. 150 minas weri-copper, as much of your share in the colony office which I took, I gave to Usānum and Adu. Addu took 18 minas from the 250 minas.

src: 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-bu-sa-lim i-li-a-lum i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa {d}a-sur-{d}UTU-si a-na 15 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul a-na 1 ma-na-im 1.5 GIN.TA i ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab IGI a-bi-a DUMU ka-na-a IGI e-di-na-a DUMU a-bu-sa-lim
tgt: Abu-šalim owes Ilī-ālum 10 minas refined silver. He will pay 15 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-Šamši. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: 0.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-ha-su DIRI a-na a-sur-ba-as-ti ap-qi-id IGI ku-si-a IGI a-mur-ISTAR DUMU-i ba-la 2 ku-ta-nu KI ta-ba-a 3 GIN KU.BABBAR a be-a-lim a-na ur-da-la a-di-in 5 GIN a-na be-a-lim a-na be-la-nim 10 GIN a be-a-lim a-na a-sur-ba-as-ti a-wi-lum i-di-in 5 ma-na URUDU si-kum KI i-di-a-sur DUMU ha-am-ha-am-tim IGI ku-si-a 10 GIN KU.BABBAR KI a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 ni-a-im 4.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na pu-su-ke-en6 a-di-in IGI PUZUR4-a-sur IGI PUZUR4.SA.TU IGI e-nu-be-lim
tgt: I entrusted 5/6 minas silver, its excise added, to Aššur-baštī. Witnesses: Kuzīya, Amur-Ištar s. Bala. 2 kutānum textiles are with Ṭābāya. I gave 3 shekels silver to Urdala for managing. (I gave) 5 shekels to Bēlānum for management. The man gave 10 shekels to Aššur-bāstī for management. 5 minas poor quality copper is with Idī-Aššur s. Ḫamḫamtum. Witness: Kuzīya. 10 shekels silver are with our Aššur-mutabbil. I gave 4 1/2 minas silver to Pūšu-kēn. Witnesses: Puzur-Aššur, Puzur-saduʾe, Ennum-Bēlum.

src: 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um i-se-er da-ak-ni-is u hu-ru-ta i-ku-num i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ka-si-im 2 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu a-na 3 ITU.KAM KU.BABBAR u-la u-ta-ru-u IGI si-lu-lu IGI a-sur-dan IGI i-ku-num
tgt: Witnesses: Ṣilūlu, Aššur-dān, Ikūnum.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma mi-su sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni um-ma a-ta-ma i-na KU.BABBAR-ka ni-ka-si-a a-sa-qal pa-ka ta-di-nam pa-i u-la a-di-na-kum u tu-sa-li-a-ma IGI a-sur-ka-si-id 20 {TUG}ku-ta-ni a-qi-sa-kum is-tu a-wa-tu-ni gam-ra-ni lu i-si-im TUG.HI-ti lu i-si-im ANSE.HI.A KU.BABBAR pa-ni-a-ma 10 ma-na se-bi-la-ma 2 GU AN.NA la-as-a-ma lu-se-bi-la-ku-ma ne-ma-al-su a-ku-kul mi-ma i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-a la ta-kal li-ba-ka i-zi-iz li-ba-ka la ta-za-az me-ra-ka u-ra-bi-ma um-ma su-ut-ma la a-bi a-ta it-bi-a-ma i-tal-kam u me-er-u-wa-ti-ka u-ra-bi-ma um-ma si-na-ma la a-bu-ni a-ta i-na sa-al-si-ma u4-mi-im it-bi-a-ma i-tal-ka-ku-ma ti-ir-ta-ka lu i-de8
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā: Why have you written to me as follows: "I shall pay my accounts with your silver. You gave me your word." I did not give you my word! However, you begged me, so with Aššur-kāšid as witness I gave you a gift of 20 Since our affairs are concluded, you must send me at least ten minas of silver both from the proceeds of the textiles and from the proceeds of the donkeys, the first silver you may obtain, I shall then buy two talents of tin and send that to you, so you can enjoy the profit. Do not use any of my silver! If you wish, then stand! If you do not wish to, then don't stand. I have raised your son, but he said to me: "You are not my father." He got up and left. Also your daughters have I raised, but they said: Three days later they got up and left to go to you, so let me know what you think.

src: 14 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er bi-ra-di a-sur-GAL i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-ma-lik u en-na-su-en6 a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti a-sur-na-da su-ma la-ma u4-mi-su ha-ra-nam i-ta-ra-as i-na ku-ru-mi-ti-su KU.BABBAR i-sa-he-er IGI a-sur-GAL IGI PUZUR4-a-sur
tgt: Biradi owes Aššur-rabi 14 shekels silver. He will pay 10 weeks from the of Aššur-mālik and Enna-Suen. If he does not pay (on time), he will add the colony rate as interest. If he leaves town (lit. stretches out the road) before his term, he will deduct the silver from his sustenance allowance. Wintesses: Aššur-rabi, Puzur-Aššur.

src: um-ma hi-na-a-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en qi-bi-ma a-na-kam-ma a-ta-wa-ku-um i-na ni-ka-si su-hu-ut is-tu te-er-ti is-ti sa ki-ma i-a-ti i-ba-si-u a-na sa-ni-u-tum ni-ka-si a-sa-qal u te-er-ti za-ku-tam la a-sa-me su-ma sa-du-e-ti i-ha-i-tu ki-ma te-er-ti pa-ni-at-ni a-wa-tim ta-e-er 4 GU AN.NA u it-ra-su sa ILLAT-at a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku e-la-ma a-sur-na-da u qar-wi-a il5-qe-u 6 GIN.TA a-na AN.NA-ki-a u-se-bu-lu-nim u tup-pa-as-nu sa te-er-ti-su-nu u-ka-al sa 6 GIN a-na AN.NA-ki-a la i-ba-tu-qu a-hi a-ta ki-ma u-mu im-ti-du-ni-ni i-hi-id-ma KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am sa-as-qi-il5-su-ma se-bi4-lam u a sa ki-ma i-a-ti a-na tur4-hu-mi-it ta-hi-tam su-pu-ur-ma te-er-ti lu-za-ki-u-nim-ma lu-se-bi4-lu-nim a-na KU.BABBAR 8 ma-na sa u-sur-sa-a-sur a-na su-nu-nu i-di-nu su-ma KU.BABBAR i-di-in i ki-is-da-ti-su 2 ma-na KU.GI lu-sa-ki-la-ni a-na DUMU i-su-ri-ik qi-bi4-ma 8.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su sa is-tu MU.5.SE lu-se-bi4-lam 16 GIN KU.BABBAR sa sa-du-e-tim i li-bi4 a-mur-a-sur um-ma su-ut-ma a-na a-sur-dan a-di-in a-ma-kam a-sur-dan lu-sa-zi-za-ku-um 1 lu-bu-su-um ma-si-u-um a-mur-a-sur na-as-a-kum 5 TUG DUMU dan-na-i-il5 2 TUG SIG5 a-la-hu-um a-hu-u qar-wi-a na-as-a-kum di-su-nu-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-su-nu a-na dan-a-sur di-in u a-ta i ra-mi-ni-ka sa ra-du-e-em ra-di-ma i ma-qa-at te-er-ti-a KU.BABBAR-ap-ka li-qe a sa u-sur-sa-a-sur i-hi-id 1 GU KU.BABBAR i-ta-ap-la-ni
tgt: From Ḫinnāya to Pūšu-kēn: Here, I have spoken for you. It is deposited in my account. After my shipment is with my representatives, I will make accountings a second time. And I do not hear the full report. If my šadueti is ḫiatu, when my previous messages, matter. Elama, Aššur-nādā, and Qarwiya took the 4 talents tin and its tithe from the caravan of Aššur-taklāku. 6 shekels rate for my tin they sent to me. Now, I hold their instruction tablets. They must not pay less than a 6 shekel rate for my tin! My dear brother, because the days become many, take care to have them pay refined silver and send it to me. Also, send tḫt to my representative to Durhumit so that they clear my instructions and send to me. For about 8 minas of silver, they sold the the (goods) of Uṣur-ša-Aššur to Šū-Nunu. If he gave the silver, they should arrive it? Let him consume(?) 2 minas gold to me! To the son of Issu-rīk: Let him/me send 8 2/3 minas silver and its interst which ... 16 shekels from the shipping charges is owed by Amur-Aššur. He said, "I gave it to Aššur-dān." Let him cause Aššur-dān to settle with you. Amur-Aššur brings you a masium garment. The son of Danna-il (Taqna-il?), Al-aḫum brother of Qarwiya brings you 2 fine textiles. Sell them and give their silver to Dān-Aššur. And as for you, from my own funds add as much as you can and take the silver at the arrival of my instructions. Pay attention to the matter of Uṣur-ša-Aššur. He repaid me a talent of silver. (?)

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na la-qe-pi-im {m}i-li-a-lim u pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma u4-mu-u DAM.GAR-ri-a sa i-na ka-ni-is ta-qi-pa-ni ma-al-u ih-da-ma DAM.GAR-ri KU.BABBAR sa-as-qi-la-ma ku-un-ka-ma i-na pa-nim-ma se-bi-la-nim {m}dan-a-sur u a-hu-su tur4-da-nim i-na DAM.GAR sa u4-mu-su e-ti-qu-ni KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su sa-as-qi-la la ta-sa-me-a su-ma la ILLAT-at la-qe-pi-im lu-qu-ti sa ta-qi-pa-ni u4-mu-u DAM.GAR-ri su-nu-ti a-hu-ru-ni sa mi-ma DAM.GAR-ri-a u4-mu-su-nu ma-al-u 10.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa me-er-e a-sur-UTU-si DUMU ib-ni-i-li sa ki-ma su-nu-ti la-qe-pa-am e-pu-lu 21 ma-na sa hi-na-a i-na tur4-hu-mi-it i-qi-pu-ni u4-mu-su-nu ma-al-u te9-er-ta-ku-nu a-na li-li-ik
tgt: Thus Šalim-aḫum to Lā-qēpum, Ilī-ālum, and Pūšu-kēn: The term period of the merchants to whom you sold goods on credit is full. Take care to cause the merchants to pay and seal and send it to me immediately. Dispatch Dān-Aššur and his brother to me. From the merchant whose term has expired, make him pay the silver and its interest. Don't listen (to the interest). Except for the caravan of Lā-qēpum, the goods which you sold on credit, the terms of my merchants, those which are past due, they are past are due 10 1/2 minas silver of the sons of Aššur-šamšī son of Ibni-ilī, their representatitves will balance Lā-qēpum. 21 minas (silver) which Ḫinnaya extended as credit in Durḫumit, their terms are full. Let your report come.

src: KISIB {d}UTU-ba-ni KISIB PUZUR4.SA.TU KISIB la-qe-pi-im sa 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er la-qe-pi-im a-sur-SIPA i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-la-hi-im u kur-ub-ISTAR a-na 4 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul la-qe-ep
tgt: Seals: Šamaš-bāni, Puzur-saduʾe, Lā-qēpim. Lā-qēpim owes Aššur-rēʾī 4 minas refined silver. He will pay 4 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Al-aḫim and Kurub-Ištar. If does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: KISIB e-na-su-en DUMU a-sur-ma-lik a-sur-la-qe-pi-im DUMU a-sur-ma-lik u {d}UTU.SIG5 DUMU a-sur-ma-lik
tgt: Seal(s!) of Ennam-Suen s. Aššur-mālik, Aššur-lā-qēpum s. Aššur-mālik and Šamaš-damiq s. Aššur-mālik.

src: um-ma im-di-DINGIR en-nam-be-lum u a-sur-su-lu-li-ma a-na PUZUR4-a-sur qi-bi-ma i-na 2 me-at 45 TUG.HI.A qa-di sa ka-sa-ri sa se-ep a-mur-ISTAR SA.BA 3 TUG sa a-ki-di-e i-na ha-hi-im E DUMU e-mi-ka e-zi-ib u <gap> 3 TUG la-hu-pu-tim a-ni u-se-ri-ba-am si-ti su-ba-ti-ka 2 me-at 39 TUG a-na E.GAL-lim e-ru-bu SA.BA 12 ni-is-ha-tum 23 TUG 10-tum is-te-en E.GAL-lum a-na si-mi-im il5-qe 38 TUG i-na E ka-ri-im i-na-pu-lu-ni-kum si-ti su-ba-ti-ka qa-di sa ka-sa-ri 1 me-at 66 TUG.HI.A sa se-ep a-mur-ISTAR iz-ku-u-nim-ma i-ba-si-u i-na 1 me-at 10 TUG.HI.A sa se-ep i-di-{d}ISKUR a-na E.GAL-lim e-ru-bu 5.5 TUG ni-is-ha-tum 0.83333 GIN KU.BABBAR ta-na-pa-al 10.5 TUG 10-tum is-te-en E.GAL-lum a-na si-mi-im il5-qe 18.5 GIN KU.BABBAR hu-lu-qa-e ta-na-pa-al 2 TUG i-na E ka-ri-im i-na-pu-lu si-ti su-ba-ti-ka 92 TUG sa se-ep i-di-{d}ISKUR qa-di sa ka-sa-ri iz-ku-u-ma i-ba-si-u <gap> pa-zu-ur-tu-su DUMU er-ra-a a-se-er pu-su-ke-en6 u-se-ri-a-ma pa-zu-ur-tu-su i-si-bi-it-ma pu-su-ke-en6 E.GAL-lum is-ba-at-ma a-na ki-se-er-si-im i-di ma-sa-ra-tum da-na a-na lu-hu-sa-ti-a hu-ra-ma sa-la-ah-su-a u a-na ma-ti-sa a-di sa pa-zu-ur-tim ru-ba-tum ta-as-pur-ma e-na-tum na-ad-a a-pu-tum mi-ma la tu-pa-za-ar su-ma a-na ti-mi-il5-ki-a te9-ti-qam a-si-a-ka <gap> sa tu-se-ta-qa-ni i-na be-tim SIG5 i-na ti-mi-il5-ki-a e-zi-ib-ma u is-te9-en i-na su-ha-ri-ka sa ki qa-qi-di-ka e-zi-ib-ma u a-ta et-qam-ma a-na-kam lu ni-im-lik u su-ma ma-ma-an a-di-i KU.BABBAR 1 GIN ma-la ti-su u-ma-ga-ar-ka um-ma su-ut-ma lu AN.NA lu TUG.HI.A di-nam-ma lu-pa-ze-er-ma a-na-ku ma-as-a-ku la ta-da-an qa-tum i qa-tim a-ma sa-ak-na-at-kum
tgt: From Imdī-ilum, Enna-Bēlum and Aššur-ṣulūlī to Puzur-Aššur: From the 245 textiles and those of the transporters of the transport of Amur-Ištar, therein, 3 textiles of the Akkadian type were left in the hosue of your father-in-law in Ḫaḫḫum. Now, I caused 3 luḫuppu-textiles to enter (the palace) here. The remainder of your textiles, 239 textiles entered the palace. Therein, 12 textiles as excise tax. The palace took 23 textiles as the (tithe?) for purchases. They will balance 38 textiles to you in the colony office. They cleared the remainder of your textiles together with those of the transporters, 166 textiles from the transport of Amur-Ištar and they are available. From the 100 textiles of the transport of Idi-Adad, which entered the palace, the excise was 5 1/2 textiles and they will balance 5/6 shekel silver to you. The palace took 10 1/2 textiles for the tithe for purchases. You will balance 18 1/2 shekels silver as losses. They will balance you 2 textiles in the colony office. They cleared the reaminder of your textiles, 92 textiles from the transport of Idi-Adad, combined with the (textiles) of the transporters and they are available. The son of Erraya (Aššur-mālik?) brought his contraband (into the city) to Pūšu-kēn, but his contraband was seized and the palace seized Pūšu-kēn and placed him in jail. The guards are strong. The princess/queen sent to Luḫušattiya, Ḫurrama, Šalaḫšua, and her own land concerning the contraband and ENNATUm is established. Urgent, do not deal in contraband! If you departed from Timelkiya, I ... you, whatever you sent out, leave it in a good house in Timelkiya and leave one of your trustworthy ṣuḫārum-servants and you yourself leav it and be counseled here. Also, if anyone tries to get you to agree for even a single shekel of silver for whatever you have, saying "Sell me tin or textiles so that I can smuggle them and I will be responsible.", do not sell! There, a hand is set in hand against you.
