src: 12 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er la-ma-si-tim sa-at-e-a ti-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni u sal-ma-a-sur <gap> GIN.TA KU.UD si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM tu-sa-ab ITU.KAM ma-hu-ri-li li-mu-um su-hu-bu-ur IGI ku-ra IGI i-ku-pi-im
tgt: Lamassītum owes Šāt-Ea 12 shekels silver. After the ḫamuštum-period of Amurru-bāni and Šalim-Aššur, she will add x shekels per (mina) per month. Witnesses: Kura, Ikuppim

src: 0.83333 ma-na 1 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-na se-er pi-la-ah-su-en6 {d}EN.LIL-ba-ni i-su KU.BABBAR i-na a-lim{ki} i-sa-qal is-tu SAG ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-i-li 1 ma-na-um 12 GIN.TA i sa-tim si-ib-tam u-sa-ab li-mu-um i-ku-pi-ISTAR IGI en-um-a-sur IGI a-sur-GAL
tgt: Pilaḫ-Suen owes Enlil-bāni 5/6 mina 1 shekel refined silver. He will add interest at the rate of 1 mina 12 shekels silver from the beginning of month Maḫur-ilī in the city of Aššur. Year: Ikuppī-Ištar Witnesses: Ennum-Aššur, Aššur-rabi

src: pi-la-ah-ISTAR wa-la-wa-la a-ma-su e-zi-ib e-zi-ib-ta-sa 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-bu-a-at a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim pi-la-ah-ISTAR wa-la-wa-la sa-at-ISTAR um-ma-sa nu-nu u a-mur-a-sur a-hu-sa i sa-ha-ti-sa i-zi-zu-ma ni-is a-sur ni-is a-na ni-is ru-ba-im it-mu-u-ma a-na pi-la-ah-ISTAR me-er-e-su <big_gap> u a-na mi-ma su-mi-su u-la i-tu-ru-su-um su-ma i-tu-ru-su-um 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-sa-qu-lu la-ma-si me-er-a-su pi-la-ah-ISTAR i-nu-mi a-na a-lim{ki} i-lu-ku i-ra-de8-su ta-ar-bi-tam u-ku-ul-ta-sa sa-bu-u mi-ma u-la e-ri-su-su IGI en-nam-a-sur IGI en-na-su-en6 IGI <big_gap> IGI da-la-as IGI a-da-da
tgt: Pilaḫ-Ištar has left Walawala his amātum. She has been paid her settlement, 1 mina silver, in full. Regarding this matter (between?) Pilaḫ-Ištar( and) Walawala, Šāt-Aššur, Nunu, and Amur-Aššur her brother stood at her side and swore the oath of Aššur, Anna, and the rubāum that they will not return to Pilaḫ-Ištar, his sons, ..., for anything. If they return to him, they will pay out 10 minas silver. As for Lamassī his daughter and Pilaḫ-Ištar, when they go to the city, he will take her(!). The rearing for the child rearing is satisfied. They will not ask him for anything. Witnesses: Ennam-Aššur, Ennam-Suen, ..., Dalaš, Adada.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na la-qe-ep i-li-a-lim u pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma ta-as-pu-ra-nim um-ma a-tu-nu-ma i-na lu-qu-tim sa se-ep ah-sa-lim 12.5 ma-na 5.66666 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na u4-me-e pa-ti-u-tim i-se-er DAM.GAR ke-nim ni-di-in 54.66666 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa u4-mu-su ma-al-u-ni SA 31.5 ma-na qa-dum sa-du-e-tim su-su-en6 ub-lam 21 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR a-sur-ma-lik ub-lam si-ti KU.BABBAR 2 ma-na 5 GIN i li-bi-su 58 ma-na 18.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa lu-qu-tim sa se-ep pu-su-ke-en6 28 ma-na 27 GIN sa lu-qu-tim sa se-ep DUMU e-ra-di 10 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa me-er-e a-sur-UTU-si i-ma-du-du-ni-ma DUMU su-{d}EN.LIL la-qe-ep e-pu-lu 21 ma-na 17 GIN KU.BABBAR is-ti hi-na-a u 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-ha-ma sa a-mur-is8-tar is-ti-su-ma mi-ma KU.BABBAR a-nim u4-mu-su-nu ma-al-u tup-pi-su-nu am-ra-ma sa u4-mu-su-nu e-ti-qu-ni si-ib-tam la ta-sa-me-a KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su pa-ni-a-ma sa ta-al-qe-a-ni ku-un-ka-ma is-ti pa-nim-ma se-bi-la-nim u <big_gap><gap> sa-ah-ra-am tup-pi <big_gap><gap> 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR be-u-la-at a-sur-mu-ta-bil DUMU su-a-nim u 1 {TUG}ku-ta-num i li-bi4-su 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR be-u-la-at ah-sa-lim 0.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR be-u-la-at MAR.TU-ba-ni DUMU kur-ub-is8-tar sa is-ti ah-sa-lim is-ri-du su-ma la is-qu-ul sa-as-qi-la-su
tgt: Šalim-aḫum to Lā-qēpum, Ili-ālim, and Pūšu-kēn: You (pl.) wrote to me. You (pl.) said, "From the goods of the šēpum of Aḫ-šalim, we 'placed' 12 minas 35 2/3 shekels silver on long terms on a trustworthy merchant." As for the 54 minas 45 shekels which are due (thereof, Šū-Suen brought 31 1/2 minas together with the shipping fee; Aššur-mālik brought 21 minas 10 shekels silver), he owes the remainder of the silver, 2 minas 5 shekels. Aššur-mālik brought 21 minas 10 shekels silver. 58 minas 18 1/2 shekels silver deriving from the goods of the šēpum of Pūšu-kēn, 28 minas 27 shekels deriving from the goods of the šēpum of the son of Erra-idī, 10 minas 10 shekels silver which the sons of Aššur-šamšī will measure it out and which Lā-qēpum will balance the son of Šū-Enlil, 21 minas [17 shekels] silver with Ḫinnaya and 5 minas silver separately of Amur-Ištar-it is also with (Ḫinnaya)--all this silver, their terms are due. Inspect their tablets. As for those whose term is due, do not listen to the interest. Seal the previous silver you recieved with its interest and send it with the first (departer). 1/2 mina silver is the 1/2 mina silver is the 25 shekels silver is the

src: KISIB ka-ri-im-ka-ne-es 6.33333 ma-na 4 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am ta-a-su sa <gap>-<gap>-zi-su sa 20 ma-na.TA a-sur-SIPA a-na ka-ri-im ha-bu-ul-ma a-na sa-lim-a-sur u-sa-qi-il5-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa su-ku-bi-im u hu-ra-sa-nim 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa ku-nu-uk ka-ri-im ka-ne-es
tgt: Seals: Colony of Kaneš He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month from the ḫamuštum of Šū-Kūbim and Ḫuraṣānim.

tgt: Ememe and Aššur-ṣulūlī owe Imdī-ilum 31 5/6 minas refined silver. (He will pay) 23? ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Amur-Šamaš and Ikūnum. [If he does not pay at full term, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.] ... If Uṣur-ša-Aššur does not hand over the tablet of his seal, they will pay the silver themselves. Witnesses: (signs partially erased).

[x] Kutānū und 4 kusītum-Stoffe aus Akkad, die ich dem Puzurašš[u]r überlassen habe: Zusammen 80 Kutānū, 4 kusītum-Stoffe aus Akkad, 6 Behälter aus Zinn, 8 Esel und deren Geschirr habe ich gemäß dem Bescheid des Pu[zu]raššur einem Manne. . . . (der Rest ist unverständlich)

src: KISIB su-ISTAR DUMU a-zu-da KISIB a-zu KISIB ha-pu-a-su KISIB ha-al-ki-a-su DUMU ar-ka-li-a KISIB zu-zu-li sa hu-bu-ul a-zu u ha-pu-a-su 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa kur-ub-ISTAR a-na 23 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 3 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im u-su-bu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is
tgt: They will pay 23 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Kurub-Ištar. If they do not pay (on time), they will add 3 shekels per mina (per month as interest).

src: 0.33333 ma-na LA 1 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er {d}ISKUR.GAL DUMU a-sur-ma-lik la-qe-pu-um i-su a-na ITU.2.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.1.KAM sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti si-in-is-me-a-ni IGI a-sur-GAL DUMU a-da-da IGI a-sur-mi-ti DUMU su-ISTAR
tgt: Adad-rabi s. Aššur-mālik owes Lā-qēpum 19 shekels silver. He will pay in two months. If he does not pay (on time), he will add the colony rate as interest. Month: Ša sarrātim. Eponymate: after Suen-išmeanni. Witnesses: Aššur-rabi s. Adada, Aššur-imittī s. Šū-Ištar.

src: KISIB a-sur-GAL DUMU en-na-nim KISIB lu-lu DUMU am-ri-a KISIB LUGAL-su-en6 DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti KISIB en-nam-a-sur DUMU sa-lim-{d}IM <big_gap> 7.33333 ma-na 1.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er en-nam-a-sur DUMU sa-lim-{d}IM su-ISTAR DUMU a-sur-ba-ni i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-di-a-bi-im a-na 17 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na ma-na-nim i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM be-el-ti-E.GAL-lim li-mu-um sa qa-ti a-sur-ma-lik DUMU a-la-hi-im
tgt: Ennam-Aššur s. Šalim-Adad owes Šū-Ištar s. Aššur-bæni 7 1/3 minas 1 1/2 shekels refined silver. He will pay 17 ḫamuštum from the ḫamuštum of Iddin-abim. If he does not pay, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: 1 ma-na 5.83334 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um i-se-er is-du-ke-en i-li-dan i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ka-ri-a DUMU me-na-nim a-na 13 ha-am-sa-a-tim i-sa-qal <big_gap> su-ma i-na u4-me-e-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qul a-na 1 ma-na-em 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab IGI a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim DUMU a-sur-ma-lik IGI e-la-li DUMU i-ku-nim IGI PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU su-a-nim
tgt: Išdu-kēn owes Ilī-dān 1 mina 5 5/6 shekels refined silver. He will pay 13 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Qarwiya s. Menānum. If he does not pay at the fulfillment of the term, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Witnesses: Aššur-bēl-awātim s. Aššur-mālik, Elāli s. Ikūnum, Puzur-Aššur s. Šū-Anum.

src: 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa su-hu-bur sa a-sur-na-da i-su-ni <big_gap> pu-su-ke-en6 e-pu-ul a-sar e-mu-ru-su-ni <big_gap> i-sa-ba-su-ma KU.BABBAR a-na pu-su-ke-en6 i-sa-qal
tgt: Pūšu-kēn balanced 40 shekels silver belonging to Šū-Ḫubur which Aššur-nādā owed. Wherever he sees him he will seize him and he will pay the silver to Pūšu-kēn.

src: a-na sa ki-ma a-sur-ma-lik pu-su-ke-en u i-li-as-ra-ni qi-bi4-ma um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma 8 GU AN.NA ku-nu-ki-a 32 TUG.HI.A SA.BA 8 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 4 ANSE sa-al-mu 2 GU AN.NA li-wi-su u ANSE a-se-er a-sur-{d}UTU-si u hi-na-a se-bi4-la a-hu-u-a a-tu-nu AN.NA-ki u su-ba-tu-a la i-na-di a-na DAM.GAR-ri-im ke-nim sa ki-ma qa-qi-di-ku-nu a-na u4-me di-na DAM.GAR-ar-ku-nu lu ke-en6 ITU.KAM-am is-te-en6 u se-na la tu-se-qa-ra u te-er-ta-ku-nu li-li-kam 10 ma-na URUDU li-pa-a u ta-pa-u-su 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR su-ha-bu-ra 9 ma-na a-sur-i-mi-ti 13 ma-na a-bu-um-DINGIR DUMU a-ba 6.5 ma-na a-mur-ISTAR DUMU i-di-su-en6 mi-ma KU.BABBAR a-nim u4-mu-su-nu ma-al-u tup-pi-su-nu am-ra-ma sa u4-mu-su-nu e-ti-qu-ni si-ib-tam sa-as-qi-la a-hu-u-a a-tu-nu KU.BABBAR sa-as-qi-la-ma i-na pa-nim-ma wa-si-im ku-un-ka-nim-ma i-li-as-ra-ni u ku-da-ri-li tu-ur-da-nim a-na mi-nim is-ti a-sur-ma-lik ku-da-ri-li la i-li-kam ki-ma sa a-ha-am i-na ka-ri-im la i-su u IR e-ta-ap-sa-ni su-ma is-ti i-li-as-ra-ni a-la-kam la i-mu-a i-na sa-ha-ti-su i-zi-za-ma lu-ka-si-a-su-ma li-ir-de8-a-su
tgt: To the representatives of Aššur mālik--Pūšu-kēn and Ili-ašranni, thus Šalim-aḫum: 8 'talents' tin under my seal, 32 textiles, therein: 8 kutānum textiles, 4 black donkeys, 2 talents tin, its wrapping, and a donkey send to Aššur-šamšī and Ḫinnaya. My dear brothers, do not deposit my tin and textiles. Sell them on credit to a trustworthy merchant, as trustworthy as yourselves. Do not overvalue one or two months. Then let your message come. 10 minas copper Libbaya and his partner, 10 minas silver Šū-Ḫabura, 9 minas (silver) Aššur-imittī, 13 minas Abum-ilum s. Abaya, 6 1/2 minas Amur-Ištar s. Iddi-Suen--all this silver there terms are full. Inspect their tablets and makle them pay the interest according to their days which are past. My dear brothers, make them pay the silver and seal (and send) it to me with the first departing (traveller). Dispatch Ili-ašranni and Kudar-ilī to me. ?? To whom with Aššur-mālik Kudar-ilī did not come. ?? There is not anyone like Aḫum(?) in the colony. Now, the servant which ?was made?, if he does not with to go with Ilī-ašranni, assist him so that he ks' him and he brings it.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-ma-lik-ma 6 ma-na hu-sa-ra-am ab-na-am la-ka-pa-am ku-nu-ki-a u-zu-a DUMU i-di-a-sur na-as-a-kum a-bi4 a-ta be-li a-ta lu a-na tam-ka-ru-tim lu a-na ma-la ta-le-e-u di-in-su-ma KU.BABBAR a-na a-lim{ki} sa-ak-si-di i-na ha-ka u-ka-li-im-si-ma si-ma-am u-ka-lu-nim u-la KU.BABBAR su-ma a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum tu-se-ba-al-si 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR me-eh-ra-tim i-na ra-mi-ni-ka se-bi4-la-ma a-ta i-na si-im ab-nim li-qe a-na KU.BABBAR 5 ma-na sa i-na ra-mi-ni-ka tu-se-ba-la-ni gi5-mi-lam la-hi-ib-la-kum
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Aššur-mālik: Uzua son of Idī-Aššur brings you 6 minas lapis in stone block form under my seal. My dear father and lord, sell it to merchants or to anyone you can and cause the silver to come to the city for me. Should I keep it in Haka and I would keep the yeild. But its not silver. If you would send it to Purušḫattum and send me 5 minas silver as exchange from your own funds, you yourself can keep the yeild of the stone. So let me owe you a favor for sending me 5 minas silver from your own funds.

src: KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur KISIB li-ba-a-a KISIB sa-lim-a-sur sa 8.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er li-ba-a-a a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa en-na-nim u sa-lim-a-sur 1.25 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM-im a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab ta-ah-si-is-tum a-ni-tum me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im sa hu-bu-ul li-ba-a-a

be-el-te-E.GAL-lim li-mu-um sa qa-ti a-gu5-tim 1 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab 1 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-GAL DUMU la-qe-pi-im {d}en-LIL-ba-ni i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-ku-pi-a DUMU su-a-nim li-mu-um en-na-su-en6 ITU.KAM a-la-na-tim 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er DU10-si-la-a-sur DUMU PUZUR-{d}MUS {d}en-LIL-ba-ni i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-di-a-bi4-im ITU.KAM ab sa-ra-ni li-mu-um sa qa-ti a-gu5-tim 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er PUZUR-{d}UTU u a-sur-i-mi-ti me-er-u su-nu-nu {d}en-LIL-ba-ni i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-is-ta-ki-il5 ITU.KAM te-i-na-tim li-mu-um ma-si-i-li a-na ITU.KAM i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu
tgt: Aššur-imittī s. Ikuppī-Ištar owes Enli-bāni 2 1/2 minas refined silver. He will add 1 shekel per mina per month as interest from the ḫamuštum of Ennānum s. Šū-Ḫubur. Month: Kuzallī. Eponymate: Akūtum. The colony owes Enlil-bāni 6 minas refined silver. They will add 2/3 shekel 15 grain per mina per month (as interest) from the ḫamuštim of Kurub-Ištar, month of Ša sarrātim, eponymate after Enna-Suen. Aššur-mutabbil s. Pūšu-kēn owes Enlil-bāni 2 minas refined silver. He will add 1 shekel (per mina per month) as interest from the ḫamuštum of Ennam-Aššur s. Šalmiḫim, month of Kanwarta, eponymate of Maṣi-ilī. Zukuwa s. Aššur-idī owes Enlil-bāni 2 1/3 minas refined silver, verified according to my silver mina weight. He will add 1 shekel (per mina per month) as interest from the ḫamuštum of Puzur-Ištar, month of Kanwarta, eponymate of Akūtum. Al-aḫim s. Šalma-Aššur owes Enlil-bāni 1 1/2 minas refined silver. He will add 1 shekel (per mina per month) as interest from the ḫamuštum of Aḫu-waqar, month of Qarrātim, eponymate of Maṣi-ilī. Adad-rabi and Šū-Suen son of Puzur-Anna owe Enlil-bāni 1 mina refined silver. They will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina per month) as interest from the ḫamuštum of Ennam-Aššur. Month: Kanwarta. Eponymate: Maṣi-ilī. Buzazu owes Enlil-bāni 2 minas refined silver. He will add 1 shekel (per mina) per month as interest from the ḫamuštum of Luzina, month of Bēlet-ekallim, eponymate after Akūtum. Aššur-rabi s. Lā-qēpim owes Enlil-bāni 1 mina 15 shekels refined silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina per month) as interest from the ḫamuštum of Ikuppiya s. Šū-Anim, month of Allānātum, eponymate of Enna Suen. Ṭāb-ṣilli-Aššur s. Puzur-Niraḫ owes Enlil-bāni 30 shekels refined silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina per month) as interest from the ḫamuštum of Idī-abim, month of Ab šarrānē, eponymate after Akūtum. Puzur-Šamaš and Aššur-imittī sons of Šū-Nunu owe Enlil-bāni 40 shekels refined silver. They will pay one month from the ḫamuštum of Aššuriš-takil, month Teʾinātim, eponymate of Maṣi-ilī. If they do not pay, they will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina (per month) as interest.

src: 3 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR u 25 na-ru-uq SA 7 na-ru-uq ar-sa-tum si-mi-su pe-ru-wa a-na su-pi-ib-ra a-bi-su u um-mi-su i-di-in is-tu u4-mi-im a-ni-im a-na pe-ru-wa a-bu-su u um-mu-su u a-hu-su la i-tu-ru-su-um su-ma i-tu-ru-su-um 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na pe-ru-wa i-sa-qu-lu su-ma pe-ru-wa a-na a-bi4-su um-mi-su i-tu-wa-ar 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal su-ma a-hu-um a-na a-hi-im i-tu-ar i-na i-di-ni-im i-du-ku-su IGI ta-li-a IGI ha-al-ki-a-su IGI pe-ru-wa IGI la-ba-ar-sa IGI wa-as-hu-pa IGI ku-nu-wa-an
tgt: Peruwa gab an Šuppibra, seinem Vater und seiner Mutter, 3 Mine 15 Seqel Silber und 25 Sack (Gereide), davon 7 Sack Weizen, als seinen Preis. Von heute an werden sein Vater, seine Mutter, und seine Brüder auf Peruwa nicht zurückkommen. Wenn sie auf ihn zurückkommen, werden sie Peruwa 10 Mine Silber zahlen. Wenn Peruwa auf seinen Vater (und) seine Mutter zurückkommt, wird er 10 Mine Silber zahlen. Wenn einer auf den anderen zurückkommt, wird man ihn außerhalb der Ortsgemeinschaft töten. Vor Talia, vor Ḫalkiašu, vor Peruwa, vor Labarša, vor Wašhupa, vor Kunuwan.

src: KISIB su-ISTAR DUMU da-da-nim KISIB i-di-a-sur DUMU a-sur-<gap>-<gap> KISIB a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim DUMU <big_gap>-<gap>-<gap> URUDU i-se-er a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim pu-su-ke-en6 i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ku-<gap>-<gap> a-na 8 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-me-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul 1.5 ma-na.TA a bi4-il5-tim i ITU.KAM u-sa-ab ITU.KAM te-i-na-tim li-mu-um i-di-a-bu-um
tgt: Aššur-bēl-awātim owes Pūšu-kēn (some amount of) copper. He will pay 8 ḫamuštum-weeks from the ḫamuštum of Ku-x-x. If he does not pay when the term is full, he will add 1 1/2 minas per talent per month. Month: Teinātum. Līmmum: Iddin-abum.

src: 17 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er {d}ISKUR.GAL DUB.SAR a-hu-wa-qar i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ku-bi-im u a-mur-{d}UTU ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti a-la-hi-im IGI pa-na-ka IGI {d}ISKUR-pi-la-ah
tgt: Adad-rabi the scribe owes 17 shekels silver to Aḫu-waqar. After the ḫamuštum of Šū-Kūbim and Amur-Šamaš the word of the colony will be added in interest. Month of Sarrātim, eponymate after Al-aḫim. Witnesses: Panaka, dIŠKUR-pì-lá-aḫ

src: a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma um-ma i-li-a-lum-ma i-na tup-pi-ka 72 {TUG}ku-ta-nu la-ap-tu la-ma ne-ru-ba-ni ni-im-nu-su-nu-ma 71 TUG 1 TUG ba-ti-iq SA.BA 2 {TUG}a-bar-ni-u a-su-mi ni-ka-si-ka sa-ha-tim am-hu-ur-su-nu-ma um-ma su-nu-ma u-la i-sa-ha-at i-za-az qa-ta-am li-is-ku-un mi-su sa um-ma a-ta-ma a-sar pa-na-i-a a-sa-pa-ra-kum su-ma a-ta-ma a-na pu-ru-us-ha-tim ha-ra-ka-ma URUDU-i-ni a-na KU.BABBAR tu-ta-ar u a-na-ku a-na-kam TUG-ti-ka ku-ba-ri su-ma a-ma-kam ta-ga-mi-il5 TUG-ti-ka e-zi-ib-ma a-na pu-ru-us-ha-tim URUDU-i-ni u-se-ra-ab su-ma re-es15 da-as-e is-te-en i ba-ri-ni la e-ru-ub ne-ma-lam u-la ni-ra-si 27.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-mur-a-sur i-di-a-bu-um a-na a-bi4-ni ha-bu-lu KU.BABBAR sa-as-qi-il5-ma a-na a-bi4-ni se-bi4-il5 su-ma um-ma a-mur-a-sur-ma qa-ti le-qe la ta-ma-ha-ar-su KU.BABBAR i-na qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is su-ma ma-la tup-pi-su-nu i-sa-qal le-qe su-ma la i-sa-qa-la-kum um-ma a-ta-ma ma-la tup-pi-ku-nu si-ib-tam ni-ma-nu si-bi4 su-ku-su-um u ma-la i-pu-lu-ka su-up-ra-am TUG.HI.A pa-ni-u-tum lu ku-wa-u-tum lu i-a-u-tum sa a-na e-la-ma e-zi-bu a-di-ni i-ba-si-u wa-ar-ki-u-tum sa-sa-am la-ap-tu
tgt: To Aššur-nādā from IIī-ālum: In your letter 72 kutānu-textiles were mentioned. Before we entered (the town) we counted them and there were 71 textiles, 1 textile short. 2 of them were abarniu-textiles. "He cannot settle. He should guarantee. Let him lay claim." Why is it that you wrote as follows: "I shall write you from where I find myself." If your own journey takes you to Burušhaddum and you exchange our copper for silver there, then I personally shall put your textiles up for sale here. If you are detained there, then I shall leave your textiles and bring our copper into Burušaddum. Unless one of us two has entered (there) before the beginning of spring, we have enjoyed no profit. 27 1/3 minas 5 shekels of refined (silver) Amur-Aššur and Iddin-abum owe to our father. Have the silver paid and send it to our father. Should Amur-Aššur say: "Take my share (of the debt)"- do not oblige him! They are jointly responsible for the silver. If he pays in accordance with their tablet, then receive it. If he does not pay you anything, say to him: "We shall count interest in accordance with your tablet!" Set witnesses for him, and then write me what he answered you. The earlier textile shipments, yours as well as mine, which I left for Elamma, are still available. The later ones have been infected by moths.

src: a-na i-na-a sa ki-ma DAM.GAR qi-bi-ma um-ma i-ku-num <gap> u a-sur-la-ma-si-ma 20 ma-na LA 10 GIN KU.BABBAR a-sur-tak-la-ku DUMU i-di-ku-bi-im sa is-qu-la-ni-a-ti-ni a-na te-ga-ra-ma nu-se-ti-qa-su-ma i-ba-si i-na si-im AN.NA 0.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR u-sa-he-er um-ma su-ut-ma i-na ka-ni-is i-na-a KU.BABBAR il5-qe su-ma tal-qe ki-ma-ma tal-qe-u-ni tal-qe su-ma la tal-qe a-ma-kam i-di-ku-bu-um li-di-na-ku-um na-as-pe-er-tu-su na-as-a-ni sa ki-ma 0.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR u-sa-hi-ru li-ti-ik-tam sa KU.KI na-as-a-ni 5 ma-na AN.NA mu-ta-e u-sa-he-er mi-li-ik KU.BABBAR-pi-ka mi-li-ik
tgt: To Innāya, the representative of the merchant, from Ikūnum and Aššur-lamassī: We sent the 10 minas 50 shekels silver of Aššur-taklāku s. Idī-Kūbum which you weighed out to us off to him in Tegarama and it is there. He deducted 5/6 mina silver from the price of the tin. He said, "Innāya took the silver in Kanesh." If you took it, you took whatever you took. If you did not take it, make Idī-Kūbum give it to you there. While his package is being transported, let him ... in compensation for the 5/6 minas silver he deducted. As for the gold being transported, he deducted 5 minas tin as losses. Judge the matter of your silver.

src: a-na a-ta-ta bu-za-zu u a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 qi-bi-ma um-ma <gap> <gap>-ma a-hu-u-a a-tu-nu be-lu-a a-tu-nu <big_gap><big_gap> 10 TUG su-ru-tim <big_gap><gap> <gap> e-zi-ib <gap> <big_gap> <gap> a-ma-kam-ma i-<big_gap>-um e-ri-im <big_gap> <gap> i-<gap> <big_gap><gap> DAM.GAR-ri-im <big_gap><big_gap> <gap>-su <big_gap><gap> <gap>-ab du-lam <big_gap><gap> <gap>-nu u su-mi a-<gap> <gap> a-na ma-nim sa-nim la-ap-nu a-hu-u-a be-lu-a KU.BABBAR i-na pa-ni-im-ma se-bi-la-nim-ma a-na DAM.GAR-ri-im lu-ta-er a-na bu-za-zu qi-bi-ma ta-as-pu-ra-am um-ma a-ta-ma ra-bi-sa-am la ta-ha-za-ma la ta-sa-pa-ra-nim a-na-ku ma-sa-ki-im a-ti-ik-la-ku-ma ki-ma mu-ti-a u be-li-a ra-bi-sa-am u-la a-hu-za-am u4-ma-am ma-la am-tim qa-qi-di-im ma-ah-si-im u-la ad-mi-qa-ku-ma ep-re-e a-na am-tim tu-ma-da-ad a-na-ku a-na-kam hu-bu-lam a-ka-al u a-di-su-ma KU.GI 1 ma-na ta-ad-mi-iq-ti sa TUG.HI-ti-a sa be-li u-se-bi4-la-ni i qa-ti DUMU a-ma-a te9-ta-at-ra 4 TUG.HI.A SIG5 bu-za-zu 4 TUG.HI.A SIG5 a-sa-num 3 TUG.HI.A ku-su-um 2 TUG.HI.A DUMU la-li-im <gap> TUG.HI.A a-mur-a-sur DUMU la-qe-ep 2 TUG.HI.A su-be-lum DUMU zur-zur SU.NIGIN 13 <gap> TUG.HI.A SIG5 a-ni-tum e-pe-si ta-ad-mi-iq-ti a-na be-li-<gap> <big_gap><gap> <gap> ta-ad-mi-iq-<gap> <big_gap><gap> ta-ak-nu-ka-ma u-la tu-se-bi4-la-nim KU.GI-si ta-sa-ab-ta a-hu-u-a be-lu-a a-tu-nu i-na pa-nim-ma se-bi4-la-nim-ma li-ba-am di-na-nim
tgt: Zu Addād[a, Buzāzu und] Aššurmu[ttabbil] sprich! [Folgendermaßen. . . . :] [Meine] Brüder [(seid) ihr! Meine Herren] (seid) ihr! [. . . . . ] 10 sch[warze] Stoff[e. . . . . ] habe ich überlassen [. . . ] . . [. . . . ] dort . . [. . . ] des Kupfers [. . . . . . . . ]. . . . [. . . . ] des Kaufmannes [. . . . . ]. . . [. . . . . ]. . . hast du mir ge<brac>ht. [. . . . . ]. . . . [. . . . .] und wegen des . . . . [. . . An we]n sonst soll ich mich wenden? Meine Brüder, meine Herren! Das Silber schickt mir umgehend! Dann will ich (es) dem Kaufmann zurückgeben. Zu Buzāzu spr[ic]h! Du hast mir geschrieben, folgendermaßen du: "Einen Kommissär sollt ihr nicht nehmen! Ihr sollt mir (das) nicht schreiben!" Damit der Stoff <nicht> verderbe, habe ich dir vertraut und entsprechend (dem Wunsche) meines Gatten und Herren habe ich mir einen Kommissär nicht genommen. Heute war ich entsprechend der Sklavin . . . . . dir nicht und die Genossen (?) für die Sklavin sollst du . . . . . .. Hier hatte ich eine Schuldverpflichtung (in Händen). Ich habe ihm (einen Teil zurück)-gegeben; Gold, 1 Mine, ist (der Rest) mein(es) Darlehen(s). (Betrifft) die Angelegenheiten der Stoffe für mich, die mein Herr mir geschickt hat: Die von dem Anteil des Sohnes des Amā'a (hat) Titatra; 4 gute Stoffe: Buzāzu; 4 gute Stoffe: Asānum; 3 Stoffe: Kūṣum: Š[ūb]ēlum, der Sohn des Zurzur. Ins[gesa]mt 10 [+ x gute [Stoffe]. Dies ist, (was) ich (mit den Stoffen) getan habe. Mein Darlehen . . . . de[m] Bēlī'aššur [. . . . ]. . . .. Daß ich das Darleh[en zahlen kann,] habt ihr (das Gold) [nicht] gesiegelt und mir nicht geschickt. Das Gold habt ihr erhalten! Meine Brüder, meine Herren seid ihr! Umgehend schickt mir (das) Gold! Tut mir doch den Gefallen!

src: 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ku-ra i-tur4-DINGIR i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa pi-la-ah-a-sur DUMU ka-sa-sa ITU.KAM ab sa-ra-ni li-mu-um DINGIR-su-GAL a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-em u-sa-ab IGI DINGIR-na-da IGI a-mur-a-sur IGI pa-na-ka
tgt: Kura owes Itūr-ilī 1 mina refined silver. He will pay 10 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Pilaḫ-Aššur s. Kasasa, month of Ab šarrānē, eponymate of Ilšu-rabi. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month (as interest). Witnesses: Ilī-nādā, Amur-Aššur, Banaga.

src: KISIB en-nam-i-li DUMU ku-za-ri KISIB en-nam-a-sur DUMU a-sur-{d}UTU-si KISIB nu-ur-ISTAR mu-pa-zi-ri-im sa 0.83333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er nu-ur-ISTAR mu-pa-zi-ri-im ma-la-hu-um DUMU i-tur4-DINGIR i-su-u is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku DUMU ka-a-dim u a-sur-DU10 DUMU ka-ri-a 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.1.KAM-im u-sa-ab SAG ITU.KAM sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um sa wa-ar-ki ib-ni-{d}IM DUMU ba-qu-nim
tgt: Seals of Ennam-ilī s. Kuzāri, Ennam-Aššur s. Aššur-Šamši, and nu-ur-ištar mupazzirim Nūr-Ištar the smuggler owes Malaḫum s. Itūr-ilī 5/6 minas refined silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month from the ḫamuštim of Aššur-taklāku s. kà-a-dim and Aššur-ṭāb s. Qarwiya. Month: Head of Ša sarrātim Eponymate: The year after Ibni-Adad s. Baqqunim

src: a-na a-sur-i-mi-ti i-li-su-du bu-za-zu u wa-qur-tim qi-bi4-ma um-ma PUZUR4-a-sur-ma 3 ma-na 10.16666 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na li-mi-im a-la-hi-im ha-bu-la-ku ITU.KAM sa-ra-tim li-mu-um i-na-a a-di ITU.KAM te-i-na-tim 12.66666 GIN.TA si-ib-tum i-li-ik SU.NIGIN 3.33333 ma-na 2.83333 GIN 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na li-mi-im a-sur-i-di ha-bu-la-ku ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tim li-mu-um i-na-a a-di te-i-na-tim 2 GIN.TA si-ib-tum i-li-ik 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na li-mi-im DINGIR-su-GAL li-mu-um bu-zu-ta-a ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tim a-di ku-zal-li 7.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tum i-li-ik 6.5 ma-na 2.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na E a-lim{ki} ha-bu-la-ku SA.BA 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR DINGIR-ba-ni ub-lam 6 ma-na 1 GIN KU.GI sa ma-nu-a SA.BA 0.33333 ma-na 7.5 GIN ni-is-ha-tum 6.5 ma-na 2.33333 GIN a-na E a-lim{ki} ta-as-qu-la ta-ah-si-sa-ti-a sa-ni-qa-ma te-er-ta-ku-nu li-li-kam i-se-er pa-ni-a-tim la i-ba-ri-a-nim si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-a 5 ma-na SA.BA 2.33333 ma-na a-na i-di-a-bi4-im ta-sa-qa-la-ma DUB sa hu-bu-ul a-bi4-ni tu-se-sa-a si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-a 2.6666600000000003 ma-na u 1.3333300000000001 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa li-bi4 a-ha-ha 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR-pi ma-la a-na i-ku-pi-a ta-as-qu-la-ni sa-hi-ra-ma 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na si-im be-ti sa E u-ki-da su-uq-la si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-a si-ma-am sa ba-la-ti-a sa-ma-nim
tgt: To Aššur-imittī, Ilī-šudu, Buzazu and Waqqurum, from Puzur-Aššur. I owe 3 minas 10 1/6 shekels silver to the limmum-official Al-aḫum. Since the month of Tēʾinātum, 12 2/3 shekels as interest has continued. In sum, (it is) 3 minas 22 5/6 shekels silver. I owe 2 minas silver to the limmum official Aššur-idī. Since Teʾinātum, 2 shekels in interest have accrued. Since Kuzalli, 7 1/2 shekels interest have accrued.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma lu-qu-ut-ka <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-<gap> AN.NA u TUG.HI.A i-na ILLAT DUMU su-{d}EN.LIL DUMU i-di-a-sur us-te-si-a-kum sa si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-ka u KU.BABBAR sa DUMU er-ra-a ub-la-ni i pa-nim DUMU su-su-en6 u DUMU er-ra-a ni-ta-ra-da-kum su-ma a-hi a-ta KU.BABBAR sa li-bi-ka u sa AN.NA-ki-a i pa-nim-ma se-bi-lam a-su-mi sa su-a-sur DUMU a-la-hi-im sa as-pu-ra-ku-ni i-hi-id-ma a-na E a-wi-lim e-ru-ub-ma ma-la e-zi-bu i pa-nim-ma te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam u a-su-mi AN.NA-ki-a sa a-ma-kam DUMU i-ku-pi-a u il5-ba-ni i-di-nu-su-ni a-na a-hi-su pu-nu-ma um-ma a-ta-ma a-wi-lum a-wi-il5 gi-mi-lim KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na la tu-se-qa-ar-sum KU.BABBAR li-di-na-ku-ma i pa-nim-ma se-bi-lam
tgt: From Aššur-imittī to Pūšu-kēn: I sent out to you your goods, tin and textiles, in the caravan of the son of Šū-Enlil son of Idī-Aššur. We despatched to you that which (arose) from your silver and the silver which the son of Erraya brought. If you are my brother, send the silver from your own funds and from my tin immediately. Concerning the matter of Šū-Aššur son of Al-aḫum about which I wrote you, take care to enter into the man's house and let your message come as to how much he left. Also, concerning my tin which the son of Ikkupya and Il-bāni gave to him there, turn to his brother and say, "The man is a man of favors. Do not overvalue every shekel!" Let him give the silver to you. Send it to me immediately.

src: 10 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er en-nam-a-sur DUMU ku-ur-ku-ur a-hu-qar i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa i-tur4-DINGIR u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku ITU.KAM si-ip-im a-na 15 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im a-na 1 ma-na-im 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab li-mu-um a-sur-SIG5 IGI ki-li-a IGI PUZUR4.ISTAR
tgt: Ennam-Aššur, son of Kurkur, owes Aḫuqar 10 shekels silver. He will pay him 15 ḫamuštum periods after the ḫamuštum of Itur-ili and Aššur-taklāku in the month of Ṣipim. If he does not pay (then), he will add 1.5 shekels per mina as interest according to colony policy. Eponymate: Aššur-damiq. Witnesses: Kiliya, Puzur-Ištar

src: KISIB pa-ru-a-wa-ta KISIB is-ta-ri-ip-ra KISIB pu-ta KISIB is-pu-na-ah-su KISIB ut-ka-ri-a 1.3333300000000001 ma-na 1 GIN KU.BABBAR 4 na-ru-uq se-am 2 na-ru-uq GIG 20 NINDA u 2 UDU.HI.A su-pa-an i-se-er ut-ka-ri-a a-sur-ma-lik i-su is-tu ITU.KAM sa sa-ra-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-ku-pi-ISTAR a-na MU.1.SE i-da-an is-pu-na-ah-su u su-pi-u-ma-an qa-ta-tum
tgt: Seals of Paruawata, Ištaribra, Puta, Išpunaḫšu, Udkaria Udkaria owes Aššur-mālik 1 1/3 minas 1 shekel silver, 4 bags grain, 2 bags wheat, 20 bread, and 2 sheep. He will pay one year from the month of ša sarrātim, eponymate after Ikuppi-Ištar. Išpunaḫšu and Šuppi-uman are the guarantors.

src: 31 ma-na AN.NA 6 {TUG}ku-ta-ni sa qi-ip-ti-ni nu-ur-ISTAR a-na ha-tim u-bi4-il5 lu AN.NA lu TUG.HI.A la u-sa-ar sa lu-qu-tim a-ni-tim 8 ma-na 10 GIN KU.BABBAR is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-a-nim u tu-ra-a a-na 37 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal IGI bu-zu-zi-im IGI tu-ra-a
tgt: Witnesses: Buzuzum, Tūrāya

src: 2.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-ba-tim u ku-ki-ni-im me-er-i-su a-hu-qar i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa qa-ti {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni u a-sur-na-da a-na 8 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul i ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM si-ip-im li-mu-um a-sur-na-da DUMU PUZUR-a-na IGI a-sur-is-ta-kal IGI {d}ISKUR.ILLAT IGI en-um-a-sur
tgt: Abatim and ku-ki-ni-im his son owe Aḫu-waqar 2 minas 25 shekels refined silver. He will pay 8 weeks from the ḫamuštum after Amurrum-bāni and Aššur-nādā. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest. Month: Ṣipʾem.

src: um-ma a-sur-ma-lik-ma a-na il5-ka-si-id qi-bi-ma 1.5 GIN KU.BABBAR ki-ma ku-wa-ti is-ti en-um-a-sur al-qe a-na su-sa-al-sum pa-i a-di-su-um la ta-tu-ar-ma KU.BABBAR is-ti en-um-a-sur la ta-la-qe IGI a-a-am-si-il5 IGI DINGIR.SIPA IGI sa-aq-si-im
tgt: From Aššur-mālik to Il-kāšid: I received 1 1/2 shekels silver on your behalf from Ennum-Aššur. For the thirds(?) I gave my word to him. Do not return to him and do not receive silver from Ennum-Aššur! Witnesses: Ayyamšil, Ilī-rēʾī, Šaqṣum.
