src: 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-mur-{d}UTU a-sur-DUG i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-di-a-bi4-im a-na 15 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA a-na <gap> 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM-im u-sa-ab ITU.KAM ku-zal-lim li-mu-um si-lu-lu IGI su-su-en6 IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti IGI a-ni-na
tgt: Amur-Šamaš owes Aššur-tāb 1/3 mina refined silver. He will pay 15 weeks from the ḫamuštim of Iddin-abim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er e-la-a u a-sur-ma-lik PUZUR-a-sur i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa PUZUR-a-sur a-na 7 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-su-bu ITU.KAM te-i-na-tim li-mu-um a-sur-i-mi-ti ma-la-hu-um KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu u ke-ni-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI i-ku-pi-a IGI zu-zu-ba-ar
tgt: Elā(ya) and Aššur-mālik owe Puzur-Aššur 1 mina silver. They will pay 7 weeks from the ḫamuštum of Puzur-Aššur. If they do not pay (on time), they will add interest at a rate of 1 1/2 shekels per month Month: Teʾintātim. Eponymate: Aššur-imittī the boatman. (The obligation to pay back) the silver is bound to whichever one is financially solvent and legally responsible. Witnesses: Ikuppiya, Zuzubar.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 PUZUR4-is8-tar u-sur-sa-a-sur {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni u i-di-ISTAR qi-bi-ma a-na PUZUR4.ISTAR u-sur-sa-a-sur {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni u i-di-ISTAR qi-bi-ma um-ma ta-ri-is-ma-tum u be-la-tum-ma a-hu-ni a-tu-nu a-su-mi KU.BABBAR ik-ri-bi4 sa a-bi4-ni be-la-tum a-na-kam ta-am-ra-as u i-na u-tu-ki u i-na e-ta-mi sa-am-tu-a-ni a-ma-kam a-na pu-su-ke-en6 pu-nu-a-ma AN.NA u TUG-ba-ti a ma-la i-le-e-u li-di-ma KU.BABBAR li-ik-nu-uk-ma lu-se-bi4-la-ma na-pa-as-ta-ak-nu u na-pa-as-ti-ni li-ti-ir a-na-kam lam-ni-is i-lu-um E a-bi4-ku-nu e-pa-as ma-ma-an a-ma-kam a-na KU.BABBAR 1 GIN i-na ba-ri-ku-nu la i-ta-hi AN.NA u TUG-ba-tu sa nu-se-bi4-la-ni a-di a-na KU.BABBAR i-tu-ru E pu-su-ke-en6 li-ib-si
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn, Puzur-Ištar, Uṣur-ša-Aššur, Ilabrat-bāni, and Idī-Ištar, specifically to Puzur-Ištar, Uṣur-ša-Aššur, Ilabrat-bāni, and Idī-Ištar, from Tariš-mātum and Bēlātum. Our dear brothers, Bēlātum is grieved becasue of the silver of our father's votive fund. And we are tormented by the There, turn to Pūšu-kēn and let each (of you) give all the tin and textiles they can and seal up silver and send it so that he can save your lives and our lives. Here, the god is angry. He is harming the house of your father! Whoever among any of you there who makes a single shekel of silver, do not claim it. Let the tin and textiles that we send up remain in the house of Pūšu-kēn until they are converted to silver.

src: KISIB su-la-ba-an DUMU dan-i-li KISIB en-nam-a-sur DUMU a-ni-nim KISIB ah-sa-lim DUMU bu-zu-ta-a 8 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er ah-sa-lim DAM.GAR i-su i-na tup-pi-im sa e-bu-ti-su su-mi DAM.GAR i-la-pa-at su-ma sa KU.GI i-la-pa-at 2 ma-na KU.GI DAM.GAR i-la-pa-at KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU la-qe-ep KISIB su-ISTAR DUMU li-ba-a KISIB sal-ma-a-sur DUMU a-sur-ma-lik 16 ma-na AN.NA SIG5 i-se-er sal-ma-a-sur DAM.GAR i-su is-tu ITU.KAM sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti su-su-en6 a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul si-ib-tam u-sa-ab KISIB ISTAR-ba-ni DUMU i-li-a-lim KISIB ma-ni-a DUMU a-sur-is-ti-kal KISIB i-di-lim DUMU DU10-i-li 1.3333300000000001 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er i-di-lim DUMU DU10-i-li ISTAR-ba-ni i-su is-tu ITU.KAM be-el-te-ka-lim li-mu-um en-na-su-en6 a-na 3 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul si-ib-tam u-sa-ab KISIB a-sur-ma-lik DUMU ma-num-su-um KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU E-a-LUGAL KISIB MAN-a-sur DUMU a-<gap>-za KISIB IR DUMU tu-ur-a-sur 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er IR DUMU tu-ur-a-sur ISTAR-ba-ni i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa lu-zi-na a-na <gap> ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM-im a-na ma-na-im u-sa-ab ITU.KAM sa ki-na-tim li-mu-um a-sur-i-mi-ti ma-la-hu-um 2.5 ma-na u 1.5 hi-tim KU.BABBAR is-ti ha-li-is-ka IGI da-di-a IGI <gap>-<gap>-ra IGI su-na-wi-ri 2 me-at 20 ma-na URUDU i-na ab-na-ti is-ti sa-da-ra-wa sa-pa-ti 3 me-at 70 ma-na is-ti ha-ma-da-lim 1 GU 10 ma-na URUDU SIG5 is-ti a-sur-mu-ta-pi-il5
tgt: He will pay 20 weeks from the month ša kēnātim, year after Šū-Suen. If he does not pay he will add interest. Seals: Ištar-bāni s. Ili-ālim, Maniya s. Aššuriš-tikal, Idī-ilim s. Ṭāb-ilī

src: um-ma a-sur-ba-ni u sa-lim-a-sur a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma KU.BABBAR sa DUMU qa-a-a-tim su-hu-bur ta-da-nam la i-mu-ni-a-ti um-ma su-ut-ma a-ma-kam-ma li-il5-qe a-ma-kam-ma li-qe KU.BABBAR sa a-na a-sur-i-mi-ti ha-bu-la-ti-ni a si-ib-tim ni-il5-qe-ma ni-is-qul 6 GU URUDU sa si-im be-ti a si-ib-tim ni-il5-qe-ma ni-is-qul KU.BABBAR se-bi4-lam-ma si-ib-tum la i-ma-ra-sa-kum tu-pi-zi a-na a-lim{ki} ma-ha-ri-im i-zi-iz-ma ne-nu nu-sa-hi-su um-ma ne-nu-ma a-ma-kam i na-sa be-ti-ka at-wu
tgt: From Aššur-bāni and Šalim-Aššur to Pūšu-kēn: Šū-Ḫubur did not want to give us the silver of Qayyātum's son. He said, "Let him take it there." So take it there. As for the silver which you owe to Aššur-imittī, we borrowed (silver) on interest and we paid him. We borrowed 6 talents of copper for the price of the houses and we paid it out. Send the silver so that the interest does not become burdensome to you. Tupezi stood to face the city council and we cleared his obligations(?). We said, "There inasa (?) your house is spoken(?)"

src: a-sur-na-da u dan-a-sur is-bu-tu-ni-a-ti-ma ma-ah-ri-ni ni-ka-si i-si-u-ma a-wa-ti-su-nu ni-ig-mu-ur-ma ni-is a-lim{ki} it-mu-u-ma lu a-na tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im lu a-na a-wa-tim lu a-na mi-ma su-um-su a-hu-um a-na a-hi-im u-la i-tu-ar IGI hi-na-a IGI su-nu-nu IGI a-sur-SIPA IGI hu-ra-a-si IGI qar-wi-a a-na a-wa-at tup-pi-im a-ni-im tup-pa-am sa ku-nu-ki-su-nu u sa ku-nu-uk a-sur-na-da u-ka-al
tgt: Aššur-nādā and Dān-Aššur seized us and settled accounts in our presence. We and they swore the oath by the City to the effect that: either with respect to a certified tablet or a lawsuit or anything else one will not raise claim against the other. Witnessed by Hinnaya, witnessed by Šū-Nūnu, witnessed by Aššur-rē'ī, witnessed by Hurāṣī, witnessed by Karwaya. With respect to the words of this tablet I hold a tablet with their seals and with the seal of Aššur-nādā.

src: a-na se-zu-ur qi-bi4-ma um-ma ku-na-ni-a-ma a-hi a-ta i-li a-ta mi-na-am e-pu-us-ka ma-ti-ma a-na a-hi-i-a u-na-ke-er-ka a-ma hu-lu-ka-ni-ka i-na pu-zu-ri-im u-se-bi4-la-ku-um mi-su-um a-ta a-na a-hi-i-a tu-ka-li-im mi-su-um i-na e-ni-su tu-ba-a-sa-ni mi-na-am e-pu-us-ka i-lu-um lu i-de8-e u e-ta-mu lu i-de-u a-na a-du-e qi-bi4-ma ma-num iq-bi4-a-ki-im-ma a pa-ni se-zu-ur a-hi-ki ta-zi-zi a-ma ig-ri E-tim ki-ma DUMU-e a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 pu-su-ke-en6 il5-qe ki-a-am da-mi-iq ki-ma a-na-ku ig-ri be-tim la-qa-im a-ni pu-su-ke-en6 il5-te-qe a-na a-du-e qi-bi4-ma a-ma me-er-at-ki i-ra-de8-u-nim ra-mi-i-si a-na se-zu-ir qi-bi4-ma a-ma me-er-at-ka i-ra-de8-u-nim a-ma-kam ra-a-am-si si-im hi-lu-ka-ni-im a-hi la te-ri-is a-na a-du-e qi-bi4-ma a-ma E-tum u u-tu-ip-tum a-ma-kam mi-ma la-su-ma ku-a-um ar-nu-um
tgt: To Šēzur from Kunaniya: My dear brother and god, who questioned you?

src: a-na 42 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 12.66666 ma-na 8 GIN LA 22.5 SE KI a-la-hi-im u sa-lim-{d}ISKUR is-tu ha-mus-tim sa qa-te la-qe-ep u i-li-a-lim ITU.KAM a-la-na-tim li-mu-um ah-mar-si a-na 45 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 13.66666 ma-na KI lu-lu DUMU a-zu-a is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ka-si-im sa qa-te la-qe-ep u i-li-a-lim li-mu-um ah-mar-si <gap> ma-na KU.BABBAR KI a-na-<big_gap> is-tu ha-mus-tim sa su-ki-tim u u-ra-a ITU.KAM qar-ra-a-tim li-mu-um ah-mar-si a-na 45 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 15.5 ma-na 8.5 GIN KI <gap>-<big_gap> DUMU su-hu-bur is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ka-si-im sa qa-te la-qe-ep u i-li-a-lim ITU.KAM te-i-na-tim li-mu-um i-di-a-sur a-na 40 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 32.83333 ma-na 1-<gap> GIN KI as-qu-dim u i-li-us-ra-ni is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-i-mi-ti u a-mur-ISTAR ITU.KAM na-ar-ma-ak a-sur sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um sa qa-te su-ka-li-a a-na 20-<gap> ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu 10.66666 ma-na <big_gap> KI su-su-en6 DUMU <big_gap> is-tu ha-mus-tim sa <big_gap> u <big_gap>-ti-a-<big_gap> ITU-KAM <big_gap> li-mu-um ah-mar-si <big_gap>
tgt: ... he will pay in 42 hamuštum weeks. Al-aḫum and Šalim-Aššur owe 12 minas 47 shekels less 22 1/2 grains. He will pay 45 weeks from the ḫauštum week after the ḫamuštum week of Lā-qēpum and Ilī-ālum, month Allanātum, eponymate of Aḫ-marši. Lulu s. Azua owes 13 2/3 minas. [He will pay ...] from the hamuštum week of the kaššum official after the week of Lā-qēpum and Ilī-alum. Ana... owes x minas silver. He will pay 45 weeks after the hamuštum of Šukkutum and Uraya, month of Qarrātum, year of Aḫ-marši. PN s. Šū-Ilabrat owes 15 minas 38 1/s shekels. He will pay 40 hamuštum weeks after the hmuštum week of the kaššum official after the ḫamuštum week of Lā-qēpum and Ilī-ālum, month of Teʾinātum, year of Idī-Aššur. Asqudum and Ilī-uṣranni owe 32 minas 51+x shekels. They will pay 20+x weeks after the ḫamuštum of Aššur-imittī and Amur-Ištar, month of Narmak Aššur ša kēnātim, year after the year of Sukkalliya. Šū-Suen [He will pay x ḫamuštum weeks?] from the ḫamuštum of [PN and] x-tí-a-x, month [of MN, year LN.]

src: a-na i-di-su-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma hi-na-a-ma KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na bu-la-ti sa a-sur-be-el-ma-al-ki-im sa u-ka-lu a-na sa ki-ma i-a-ti a-qa-bi-ma te-er-ta-ka li-li-ka-ma i-nu-mi a-na a-lim{ki} i-lu-ku lu-ta-e-ru-su-um su-ma da-mi-iq-su-ma i-na e-la e-li-tim 10 {TUG}ku-ta-ni dam-qu-tim sa ki-ma i-a-ti u-sa-hi-iz-ma li-di-nu-su-um-ma i-na e-la-i-su 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR li-is-qu-lam su-ma tap-pa-u-a sa i-na a-lim{ki} wa-as-bu bu-la-ti-su ma-la qa-su-nu u-ka-lu i-di-nu-su-um u a-na-ku 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR <big_gap> a-da-su-um u su-ma su-nu si-a-ma-tim i-du-nu-su-um u a-na-ku si-a-ma-tim a-da-su-um su-ma ha-ra-nam a-na a-lim{ki} ta-da-su-um bu-la-ti-su sa qa-at-ka u-ka-lu di-su-um u e-si-is tur4-da-su
tgt: To Iddin-Suen, from Ḫinnāya:

src: a-na a-sur-i-mi-ti u su-hu-bur qi-bi-ma um-ma pu-su-ke-en6-ma 27.66666 ma-na 8 GIN KU.BABBAR E ka-ri-im al-pu-ut a-na KU.BABBAR a-nim lu KU.BABBAR-ku-nu as-qul lu TUG.HI.A as-a-am 12.66666 ma-na 9 GIN KU.BABBAR i KU.BABBAR-ap a-sur-i-mi-ti u-sa-qi-il5 1 ma-na.TA KU.BABBAR is-tap-ku-ma 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR as-qul-ma 1 ma-na mi-qi-su a qa-ti-ku-nu at-hi-ma a-sur u i-lu-ku-nu li-tu-la 12 ma-na KU.BABBAR-pi i-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim lu al-qe SU.NIGIN 28.66666 ma-na 8 GIN KU.BABBAR na-ad-a-tu-nu 15 ma-na.TA da-tum ik-su-ud-ma 1 ma-na 12 GIN KU.BABBAR ta-na-pa-la mi-is-la i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-ku-nu a-la-qe a-na su-hu-bur qi-bi-ma mi-su sa a-sur-i-mi-ti is-pu-ra-ni um-ma su-ut-ma KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-ka a-la-qe mi-is-li-ka KU.BABBAR a-hu-ka ta-ib su-ma la tu-ta-ib a-na-ku a-sur-i-mi-ti u-ta-ab-ma 15 ma-na KU.BABBAR qa-at-ka a-li i-ba-si-u i-na KU.BABBAR-pi-ka a-la-qe a-na-ku u im-di-DINGIR i ni-ka-si ni-is-hu-ut-ka 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR si-hi-ta-ka i-na si-im AN.NA-ki-ka u TUG-ba-ti-ka ni-is-qul su-ma ma-as-ka-tam ta-sa-ka-nam 1 ma-na-um 10 GIN sa-du-a-tam u-sa-du-u-ka su-ma tu-sa-za-az te-er-ta-ka li-li-kam-ma is-tu u4-mi-im sa KU.BABBAR ni-is-qu-lu 1 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i-na ka-ri-im ta-la-qe ITU.1.KAM ba-al-tam-ma ka-ra-am a-lu-um-ma um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-na-1+0.25 a-wi-il5 li-zi-zu u-la im-gu5-ru-ni u a-tur4-ma um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-na a-wi-il5 u mi-sa-al a-wi-lim li-zi-zu um-ma su-nu-ma ne-nu i se-ri-su-nu a-wi-la-ni a-di-i a-ni-a-tim u-sur-sa-a-sur u-sa-as-he-er
tgt: To Aššur-imittī and Šū-Ḫubur from Pūšu-kēn: I wrote 28 minas 48 shekels silver at the colony office. For this silver I both weighed out your(pl.) silver and sold textiles. I weighed out 12 minas 49 shekels silver from the silver of Aššur-imittī. They (the colony office) initiated a pouring in units of 1 mina of silver and I weighed out 2 minas of silver and I placed 1 minas-its Altogether, 28 minas 48 shekels silver you gave. The dātum-assessment came to 15 minas each and you will be refunded 1 mina 12 shekels silver. I will take half from (each of) your (pl.) silver. To Why is it that Aššur-imittī wrote me saying: "I will take the silver and its interest from your silver." As for your half of the silver, your brother is satisfied. If you do not satisfy (your half), I myself will satisfy (the silver of) Aššur-imittī. With regard to the 15 minas silver, I will take your share, wherever it is, from your silver. As for myself and Imdī-ilum, we cleared you of obligations at accountings. We weighed out 6 minas silver, (the amount for) your clearance of obligations, from the price of your tin and textiles. If you make a deposit, they will assess you a If you will take responsibility, let your message come and from the day which we weigh out the silver, you will take 1 shekel of silver interest (per mina per month) in the colony office. Satisfy (the silver) a month. I (already) pressed the colony, saying, "Let them stand for 1 1/4 man." They did not agree with me. I returned, saying, "Let them stand for a man and a half." They said, "Are we more 'men' than them?" On account of these things, I am delaying Uṣur-ša-Aššur.

src: KISIB a-sur-SIPA DUMU <big_gap> KISIB ku-ra DUMU u-la-a-a KISIB en-nam-a-sur DUMU en-na-ma-nim KISIB ku-lu-uk-lu DUMU <big_gap> sa hu-bu-ul ku-lu-uk-lu 0.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am a-na a-hu-qar i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM sa ke-na-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti bu-zu-zu
tgt: Seals: Aššur-rē'ī s. ..., Kura s. Ulaya, Ennam-Aššur s. Ennānum, Kuluklu s. ...

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR tu-se-bi-lam SA.BA 2 GU 10 ma-na ku-nu-ku 16.5 GIN.TA KU.BABBAR-pi-su 7.83333 ma-na 2.6666600000000003 GIN 4 TUG su-ru-tum 5 {TUG}ku-ta-nu 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR it-bu-lu 7 GIN i-na ma-sa-i-im im-ti 17 GIN KU.BABBAR si-im 1 ANSE 5 GIN u-nu-su 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR si-im 2 TUG su-ru-en sa a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku e-BA.ZI-ku-ni um-ma a-ta-ma i-na 1.3333300000000001 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa en-na-be-lum na-as-u-ni le-qe KU.BABBAR u-la al-qe i-na KU.BABBAR a-nim al-qe 12 ma-na 5 GIN AN.NA-ak qa-tim 15 GIN.TA 0.66666 ma-na 8.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR-pi-su mi-ma a-nim a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku i-ra-di-a-kum gam-ra-kum
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā.: You have sent me 10 minas of silver. Specification: 2 talents 10 minas (of tin) under seal at the rate 16 1/2 to 1 - in silver: 7 5/6 minas 2 2/3 shekels. 4 black textiles (and) 5 It diminished 7 shekels during the washing. 17 shekels of silver: the price of one donkey. 5 shekels: its harness. 1/3 mina of silver: the price of 2 black textiles that Aššur-taklāku left with you. You said (earlier): ''Take that out of the 1 1/3 mina of silver that Ennam-Bē1um is bringing." I did not take the silver then, (so) I have taken it out of this silver. 12 minas 5 shekels of tin for expenses at the rate 15 to 1 - in silver: 2/3 mina 8 1/3 shekels of silver. Aššur-taklāku brings all this to you. (Your money) has been spent for you.

src: 0.5 ma-na 7.5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-na sa tup-pi-su ha-ar-mi-im i li-bi4 i-ku-pi-a is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa e-la-ma u kur-ub-ISTAR ITU.1.KAM qa-ra-a-tim li-mu-um e-la-li 1.5 GIN.TA a-na 1 ma-na-im i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI bu-ur-qa-nim DUMU ka-ka-ba-nim IGI su-ISTAR DUMU su-a-a
tgt: Ikuppiya owes (me) 37 1/2 shekels certified silver from the matter of the sealed tablet. He will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest from the ḫamuštum week of Elama and Kurub-Ištar, month Qarrātum, eponymate of Elāli. Witnesses: Burqānum s. Kakkabānum, Šū-Ištar s. Šuaya.

src: a-na a-la-hi-im e-me-me u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi4-ma um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma a-sa-me-ma DUMU gi-ri-a a-na a-lim{ki} i-ta-la-ak mi-su su-ha-ru-sa sa-lim-a-sur u a-li-ku a-di se-ni-su i-li-ku-ni-ma te-er-ta-ak-nu-ma la i-li-ka-ni am-tam sa-la-ma u-tu-tum ma-la e-ru-bu te-er-ta-ak-nu li-li-kam su-ma se-am ta-ha-sa-ah sa KU.BABBAR 0.5 ma-na sa-ma-si-im KU.BABBAR ma-la is-tu tur4-hu-mi-it u a-na-nu-um i-li-ka-ku-nu-ti-ni a-sar ta-pa-qi-da-ni ITU.KAM sa us-u-ni te-er-ta-ak-nu li-li-kam ni-ni u hu-lu-ba im-ta-su-hu-ni-ma qa-ar-ni I.GIS DUG.GA ma-li-a-am
tgt: To Alāhum, Ememe and Aššur-taklāku from Aššur-nādā: I hear that Ṣiriā's son has left for the City. Why is it that Šalim-Aššur's servants and other travellers have come here twice, but no message from you has arrived? Ask the maid how much grain has come in. Send me word. If you wish to have barley, then buy for up to 1/2 mina of silver. Send me word about every single shekel of silver which has accrued to you both from Durhumit and from here, where you will entrust it and the month in which it left your hands. Ninni and Huluba have robbed me, so fill my horn with good quality oil.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma kur-ub-ISTAR-ma a-su-mi sa-lim-a-sur DUMU i-su-ri-ik sa a-na-kam a-ta-wa-ku-ni im-gu5-a i-li-kam-ma mi-ma-sa-ma la ta-as-ta-ap-ra-am 10 ma-na AN.NA a-mur-a-sur DUMU su-ka-li-a u-se-bi4-la-kum 6 ku-ta-ni a-ku-ku-um ka-sa-ar qa-ar-wi-a ma-ha-ti tu-se-bi4-il5-su <gap> a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta a-la-nu-ka a-ba-am sa-ni-am i-su a-ma-kam sa-lim-a-sur u wa-bi4-la-ni sa-il5-ma i-di-nu-sum la i-di-nu-sum su-up-ra-ma a-na a-la-ki-su-nu pa-i la ap-ta-na-te a-su-mi sa a-ta-ta uz-ni mi-su-um la ta-pa-te
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Kurub-Ištar: Concerning Šalim-Aššur son of Issu-rīk about whom I spoke to you here, Imgua arrived and you did not send anything whatsoever. Amur-Ištar son of Sukkallīya brought you 10 minas tin. My aunt(?) brought Akkukum, the packer of Qarwīya, 6 kutānum textiles. My dear father and lord, do I have another father beside you? There, inquire of Šalim-Aššur and Wābilanni and send to me as to whether or not they sold it to him, so that at their departure I do not keep opening my mouth. Concerning the matter of Atata, why do you not inform me?

src: KISIB i-ku-nim KISIB u-sur-sa-a-sur DUMU na-ab-su-en6 sa hu-bu-ul a-mur-{d}UTU 12 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-mur-{d}UTU a-sur-SIPA i-su-u is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim a-na 30 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul a-na 1 ma-na-im 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM u-sa-ab me-eh-ra-at tup-pi-im ha-ar-mi-im
tgt: Seals: Ikūnim, Uṣur-ša-Aššur s. Nāb-Suen. Regarding the debt of Amur-Šamaš. Amur-Šamaš owes Aššur-rēʾī 12 minas refined silver. He will pay 30 weeks after the ḫamuštum of Aššur-bēl-awātim. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: 1.8333300000000001 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er na-ar-hi se-er-du u a-mur-{d}UTU i-ku-nu-um i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-i-di a-na 4 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu 6 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM si-ib-tam u-su-bu KU.BABBAR i qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu ra-ki-is IGI a-la-hi-im IGI bu-zu-ta-a IGI e-wa-ri-a IGI a-du-a
tgt: Narḫi, Šaerdu and Amur-Šamaš owe Ikūnum 1 5/6 minas silver. They will pay four ḫamuštum periods after the ḫamuštum of Aššur-idī. If they do not pay, they will add 6 shekels as interest. (The obligation to pay back) the silver is bound to whichever one is financially solvent. Witnesses: Al-aḫum, Buzutāya, Ewariya, Adua.

src: KISIB i-di-a-bi4-im KISIB a-sur-e-mu-qi DUMU me-sar-GAL KISIB a-sur-e-mu-qi DUMU i-ku-nim sa hu-bu-ul a-sur-e-mu-qi DUMU i-ku-nim sa 18 ma-na LA 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-a-nim u du-du a-na 36 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab SA.BA 7 ma-na 15 GIN sa a-mur-ISTAR u a-sur-i-mi-ti
tgt: Seals of Idī-abum, Aššur-emūqī s. Mešar-rabi, Aššur-emūqī s. Ikūnum. Regarding the debt of Aššur-emūqī s. Ikūnum. Regarding the 17 minas 55 shekels refined silver, He will pay 36 weeks from the hamuštum of Šū-Anum and Dudu. If he does not pay, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Therein, 7 minas 15 shekels belong to Amu-Ištar and Aššur-imittī.

src: 1 ma-na 7.5 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er ma-wa-as-hi a-sur-na-da i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa na-ra-am-su a-na ha-ar-pe ta-sa-qal su-ma la ta-as-qu-ul 3 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-em tu-sa-ab IGI me-si-li IGI sar-ma-ma IGI ha-li-it-ka IGI ku-su-ma-an
tgt: Mawašhi owes 1 mina 7 1/2 shekels of silver to Aššur-nādā. She will pay before harvest from the ḫamuštum week of Naram-Suen. If she does not paid (in time), she will add interest at the rate 3 shekels per month per mina. Witnessed by Mezini, witnessed by Šarmama, witnessed by Halitka, witnessed by Kušuman.

src: a-na a-sur-re-si u a-sur-ma-lik qi-bi4-ma um-ma PUZUR4-a-sur-ma a-na a-sur-re-si qi-bi4-ma i-na <gap> 2 ma-na AN.NA i-sa DAM.GAR-ri-im is-qu-lu-ni a-na-ku i ha-ka us-ba-ku u-la i-de8 a-li-ka-ma um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-na a-he-e-ka tup-pa-am di-na-nim um-ma su-nu-ma i-sa DAM.GAR-ri-im AN.NA sa-qi-il5 a ka-ni-is nu-se-ra-ab-su-ma ki-ma a-wa-tim a-mi-sa-a-am a-na-ku e-pa-as um-ma su-su-en6-ma u-la tup-pa-am u-se-ra-ab i-li-ka-ma dam-qa-ti-ma i-bi-ra-ku-ma a-ta a-na i-a-ti hi-im-ta-tim ta-sa-pa-ra-am sa a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim a-na-ku la ta-hu-a-ku-ni a-hi a-ta a pa-ni-a a za-al-pa te-er-tum li-li-kam-ma a sa ha-ra-an a-lim{ki} a-na-ku le-ru-ba-ma a-na-kam la-az-ku
tgt: Zu Aššurrēṣī und Aššurmalik sprich! Folgendermaßen Puzuraššur: Zu Aššurrēṣī sprich! Mit 2 Minen Zinn von dem des Kaufmannes hat man mich bezahlt. Ich halte mich in Ḫaka auf. Ich weiß nicht (was tun)! Ich kam her und (sprach) folgendermaßen zu deinen Kollegen: "Die Urkunde gebt mit!" Folgendermaßen (antworteten) zu dein Kollegen: "Von dem (Zinn) des Kaufmannes bezahle das Zinn!" Nach Kaniš werden wir es (das Zinn?) bringen und entsprechend (dem Stande) der Angelegenheit werde ich dorthin (eine Reise) unternehmen. Folgendermaßen (sprach) Šūsu'in: "Die Tafel werde ich nicht (hin)bringen." Er kam her und der Kaufmann wird (nun) den Besche[id] dir überprüfen (?). Du sollst mir eiligst scheiben! Weil ich an diesen Dingen keinen Anteil habe, mein Bruder bist du, möge zu mir nach Zalpa Bescheid kommen. Dann will ich in Angelegenheiten einer Reise nach der Stadt (d. h. nach Assur) hinkommen und ich will mich dort rechtfertigen

src: KISIB en-um-a-sur DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR KISIB a-bu-sa-lim DUMU DINGIR-tap-pa-a KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur DUMU bu-ut-ki-im KISIB su-zu-zu DUMU e-ra-di 30 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er en-um-a-sur a-sur-e-mu-qi i-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa u-zu-a ITU.1.KAM kan-bar-ta li-mu-um a-la-hu-um a-na MU.4.SE i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM a-na ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab
tgt: Ennum-Aššur owes Aššur-emūqī 30 minas refined silver. He will pay 4 years from the ḫamuštum of Uzuwa, month Kanwarta, eponymate Al-aḫum. If he does not pay, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: KISIB bi-zi-a DUMU a-na-ah-i-li KISIB DINGIR.SIPA DUMU su-ku-bi-im KISIB a-sur-ba-ni DUMU ku-ur-ba-a 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-ba-ni ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu si-lu-lu 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab KISIB su-la-ba-an DUMU dan-i-li KISIB bi-zi-a DUMU a-na-ah-i-li KISIB ni-mar-{d}IM DUMU en-na-ZU KISIB a-mur-ISTAR DUMU i-sar-ki-id-ISTAR 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR si-im E-be-ti a-mur-ISTAR il5-qe KISIB li-ip-ti-ISTAR KISIB DU10-a-sur DUMU {d}EN.LIL-ba-ni KISIB ku-zi-a DUMU bu-zi-zi KISIB im-li-ka-a 2.6666600000000003 ma-na 1.3333300000000001 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er im-li-ka-a ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tim li-mu-um si-lu-lu 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab KISIB a-sur-ba-ni DUMU ku-ur-ba-a KISIB DINGIR.SIPA DUMU su-ku-bi KISIB im-li-ka-a 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er im-li-ka-a ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tim li-mu-um si-lu-lu 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab KISIB i-lu-ku DUMU su-ISTAR KISIB ISTAR-ba-ni DUMU as-qu-dim 18 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er ISTAR-ba-ni ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um bu-zu-zu KISIB u-su-ur-sa-a-sur DUMU a-ku-a KISIB a-sur-ma-lik DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR KISIB PUZUR4-a-sur 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-ma-lik ITU.KAM si-ib-im li-mu-um a-sur-SIG5 KISIB a-bu-SILIM DUMU as-qu-dim KISIB ta-ki-il5-a-sur DUMU en-na-nim 5 GU 15 ma-na URUDU si-kam i-se-er ta-ki-il5-a-sur DUMU en-na-nim ITU.KAM qa-ra-a-tim li-mu-um i-li-dan 1.5 ma-na.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab KISIB sal-lim-a-sur DUMU ip-hu-ri-im KISIB a-ta-ta DUMU a-ku-tim KISIB i-li-as-ra-ni DUMU su-be-lim 11 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-in-pi-la-ah DUMU su-be-lim DAM.GAR i-su ITU.KAM ab-sa-ra-ni li-mu-um sa qa-ti i-li-dan 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab KISIB i-di-lim DUMU sa-ar-i-li KISIB a-bi-a DUMU a-sur-i-mi-ti KISIB a-bu-SILIM DUMU as-qu-dim 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-bu-SILIM DUMU as-qu-dim 0.5 ma-na.TA i sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM a-la-na-tim li-mu-um bu-zu-ta-a a-ha-ma 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR be-u-la-tu-su KISIB a-sur-ba-ni DUMU ku-ur-ba-a KISIB su-in-pi-la-ah DUMU su-be-lim KISIB ku-zi-a DUMU bu-zi-zi 2 ma-na 6 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-ba-ni DUMU ku-ur-ba-a ITU.KAM sa ke-na-a-tim li-mu-um sa qa-ti si-lu-lu 1.5 GIN.TA si-ib-tam u-sa-ab KISIB ma-num-ba-lum-a-sur KISIB ku-da-dim KISIB a-sur-i-mi-ti KISIB a-sur-ma-lik 0.5 ma-na 3 GIN KU.BABBAR i-se-er a-la-bi4-im ku-da-dum qa-ta-tum is-tu a-lim{ki} i-tu-ar i-sa-qal
tgt: Seals: Bezīya s. Anaḫ-ilī, Ilī-rēʾī s. Šū-Kūbum, Aššur-bani s. Kurbāya. Aššur-bāni owes 4 minas refined silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina per month) as interest (from) the month of Kuzallu, eponymate of Ṣilūlu. Seals: Šū-Laban s. Dān-ilī, Bezīya s. Anaḫ-ilī, Nimar-Adad s. Enna-Suen, Amur-Ištar s. Išar-kit-Ištar. Amur-Ištar received 4 minas silver, the price of the houses(/my house?). Seals: Lipit-Ištar, Ṭāb-Aššur s. Enlil-bāni, Kuzīya s. Buzizi, Imlikaya. Imlikaya owes 2 minas 41 1/3 shekels refined silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina per month) as interest (from) the month of Qarrātum, eponymate of Ṣilūlu. Seals: Aššur-bāni s. Kurbāya, Ilī-rēʾī s. Šū-Kūbum, Imlikaya. Imlikaya owes 3 minas silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina per month) as interest (from) the month of Qarrātum, eponymate of Ṣilūlu. Seals: Iluku s. Šū-Ištar, Ištar-bāni s. Asquidim. Ištar-bāni owes 18 shekels refined silver. Month: Kuzallu. Eponymate: Buzuzu. Seals: Uṣur-ša-Aššur s. Agua, Aššur-mālik s. Puzur-Ištar, Puzur-Aššur. Aššur-mālik owes 3 minas refined silver. Month: Ṣipʾum. Eponymate: Aššur-damiq. Seals: Abu-šalim s. Asqūdum, Takil-Aššur s. Ennānum. Takil-Aššur s. Ennānum owes 5 talents 15 minas poor quality copper. They will add 1 1/2 minas (per talent per month) as interest (from) the month of Qarrātum, eponymate of Ilī-dān. Seals: Šalim-Aššur s. Ipḫurum, Atata s. Akutum, Ilī-ašranni s. Šū-Bēlum. Suen-pilaḫ s. Šū-Bēlum owes the merchant 11 minas refined silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekel (per mina per month) as interest (from) the month of Ab šarrānē, eponymate after Ilī-dān. Seals: Idī-ilum s. Šar-ilī, Abiya s. Aššur-imittī, Abu-šalim s. Asqūdum. Abu-šalim s. Asqūdum owes 3 minas refined silver. He will pay 30 shekels in one year. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina per month) as interest. Month: Allānātum. Eponymate: Buzutaya. Seperately, 1 mina silver is his beʾulātum loan. Seals: Aššur-bāni s. Kurubāya, Suen-pilaḫ s. Šū-Bēlum, Kuzīya s, Buzizi. Aššur-bāni s. Kurbāya owes 2 minas 6 shekels refined silver. He will add 1 1/2 shekels (per mina per month) as interest (from) the month of Ša kēnātim, eponymate after Ṣilūlu. Seals: Mannum-bālum-Aššur, Kudātum, Aššur-imittī, Aššur-mālik. Al-abum owes 33 shekels silver. Guarantor: Kudātum. He will pay after he returns to the City.

src: 4 GU 28 ma-na URUDU sa ka-u-nim i-na E ka-ri-im i-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum a-la-qe 1 {TUG}ku-ta-nam as-ra-kam-ma a-na qa-ti-a a-di 20 ma-na URUDU sa-du-i-ti i-di-ISTAR ka-ra-am i-se-e 20 ma-na i-na UD.ZA.URUDU i-di-ISTAR i-la-qe 38 ma-na URUDU ku-ni-lum i-la-qe si-ti URUDU-i-a 3.5 GU SA.BA 3 GU 10 ma-na da-ti a-sur-DUG i-la-qe 7 {TUG}ku-ta-ni 4 ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR a-na i-di-ISTAR e-zi-ib
tgt: I shall receive 4 talents 28 minas copper to be secured in the colony office in Burušḫattum. I have deposited 1 the 20 minas of copper, my transport tariff, Iddin-Ištar will claim from the colony; Iddin-Ištar will receive 20 minas when the copper comes out; 38 minas of copper Kuzallum will receive; the rest of my copper amounts to 3 1/2 talents. Thereof Aššur-ṭāb will receive 3 talents 10 minas, my fees. 7 kutānu-textiles and 4 minas 2 shekels of silver I left for Iddin-Ištar.

src: um-ma a-la-hu-um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da u su-a-sur qi-bi-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma i-na u-mi-im sa tup-pa-am ta-sa-me-a-ni 1 GU AN.NA ku-nu-ki sa a-lim{ki} su-a-sur li-di-na-ku-ma i-na e-ti-su 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am su-qu-ul-su-um mi-su sa um-ma a-ta-ma KU.BABBAR-pi ta-as-ba-at KU.BABBAR-ap-ka ki-a-ma at-ba-al i-na lu-qu-tim sa se-ep en-nam-be-lim sa-hi-ra-am a-ta 15 ma-na sa ta-aq-bi-a-ni is-tu a-bi-im a-sar li-bi-ka la tu-se-bi-il5 KU.BABBAR sa se-ep i-zi-me-a u hi-na-a u4-mu-su-nu e-ta-at-qu KU.BABBAR i-na pa-ni-u-ti-ma se-bi-la-su tup-pa-am ha-ar-ma-am sa si-bu-ti la-qe-ep u a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU a-mur-DINGIR i-na pa-ni wa-sa-i-su tup-pa-am sa si-bu-ti-su u ku-nu-ki-su IGI is-ti-in a-li-ki-im ka-li-im-su u a-wa-at tup-pi-im pa-si-is a-pu-tum AN.NA sa a-la-hi-im le-qe-ma a-na a-hi-im u eb-ri-im za-ri-su-ma KU.BABBAR-ap-su su-qu-ul-su-um
tgt: From Alāhum and Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā and Šū-Aššur; (specifically) to Aššur-nādā: the same day that you hear the letter Šū-Aššur shall give you 1 talent of tin under the seal of the City, and you must pay him 10 minas of refined silver promptly. Why is it that you say: "You have seized my silver"? Have I removed any of your silver in this way? Deduct it from the merchandise transported by Ennam-BēIum. But you yourself, have you not sent the 15 minas that you promised me from Abum to where it pleased you? As to the silver transported by Izimea and Hinnaya, their terms are overdue. Send the silver as soon as possible. With respect to the certified tablet with the testimony of Lā-qēp and Aššur-imittī son of Amur-ilī, before he leaves you must show him the tablet with his testimony and his seal with one of the travellers as witness, and then erase the words on the tablet. Please, take Alāhum's tin and scatter it among colleagues and friends and pay him his silver.

src: KISIB u-su-ur-sa-a-sur DUMU en-nam-a-a KISIB a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR KISIB DINGIR-mu-ta-bi4-il5 DUMU a-zu-a-a sa hu-bu-ul DINGIR-mu-ta-bi4-il5 DUMU a-zu-a-a 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er DINGIR-mu-ta-bi4-il5 DUMU a-zu-a-a su-ISTAR i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-mur-ISTAR DUMU da-mu-ma ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um bu-zu-zu DUMU i-bi-ZU a-na 40 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma i-na u4-mu-su ma-al-u-tim KU.BABBAR la is-qu-ul a-na ma-na-im 1.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.1.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab
tgt: Seals: Uṣur-ša-Aššur s. en-nam-a-a, Aššur-imitī s. Puzur-Ištar, Ilī-mutabbil s. Azua. Regarding the debt of Ilī-mutabbil s. Azua. Ilī-mutabbil s. Azua owes Šū-Ištar 2 minas refined silver. He will pay 40 weeks from ḫamuštum of Amur-Ištar s. Damuma, month Kuzalli, eponymate Buzuzu s. Ibbi-Suen. If he does not pay the silver at the fulfillment of his term, he will add 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month as interest.

src: a-na sa-zu-a sa-lim-ma u bi-ta-a qi-bi4-ma um-ma en-um-a-sur-ma i ha-ra-nim a-na MAN-a-sur u ku-zi-im tup-pa-am ki-ma ki-na-ti u-la-pi-it um-ma a-na-ku-ma KU.BABBAR 10 GIN lu nu-se-bi4-il5 ni-su-ni e-ri-a um-ma ma-ka-ma a-di a-hu-ku-nu i-ra-bi4-u-ni mi-ma tup-pe u-la ta-ma-ra u u-tu-ub-tam la a-da-na-ku-nu-ti bi-ta-a u ku-wa-ti ma-nu-um us-ta-ki-da-ku-nu um-ma a-na-ku-ma bi4-li-im i-li sa KU.KI lu ni-ik-nu-uk-ma lu-ub-lu-si-im um-ma si-it-ma ab-ta-a-ku-nu um-mi a-ti u a-hu-wa-tu-a a-ti-na a-na sal-ti-im la ta-sa-ka-na-ni mu-si u u-ri zi-ib-ta-ak-na a-zu-ab um-ma a-na-ku-ma lu-us-bu-ma sa ki-ma a-bi4-ni tup-pe li-ib-ri-u-ma 3 DAM.GAR na-bu-am lu ni-is-ba-at-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN a ni-si-ni lu nu-se-bi4-il5 tup-pe ta-da-nam la ta-mu-wa um-ma si-it-ma ke-e e-na-a-sur ma-e u-sa-az-ba-la mi-su-um da-ma-am la i-sa-ti-a a-na mu-se-bi4-il5 i-li-ka-ma um-ma su-ut-ma ak-lam tu-me-sa-ni-a-ti su-ma um-mi u a-ha-ti a-ti-na a-di ur-hi-im is-ti-in <gap>-ta-su sa si-ka-ri-im a-ra-di-si-ma a ka-ri-im a-qa-bi4 um-ma a-na-ku-ma um-mi u a-ha-ti e-ri-a-ma si-it u-tu-ub-tam tup-pe tu-ka-al ka-ru-um u-sa-na-aq-si <gap> ar-hi-is ti-ir-ta-ak-na li-li-kam a-na DUMU i-ku-pi-a u MAN-a-sur <gap> ka-an e-nu-um-a-sur <gap> li-li-kam
tgt: To Šazua, Šalimma and Bitāya from Ennam-Aššur:

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma PUZUR4-a-sur-ma a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta a-na ma-nim sa-nim la-ti-ki-il5 KU.BABBAR ma-la i-na me-eh-ri-a u-la-pi-ta-ku-ni sa-as-qi-il5-ma a-na a-lim{ki} sa-ak-si-di-ma la KU.BABBAR ap-ka 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa a-da-da DUMU i-ku-pi-a-sur sa-qa-lam qa-bi-u sa-as-qi-il5-su-ma u 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa pa-ka ta-di-na-ni se-bi4-lam KI pa-ni-e-ma a-li-ki-im im-ku-a tur4-da-am
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Puzur-Aššur-ma: My dear father and lord, who else can I trust? Have the silver paid, as much as I wrote to you in my copy, and cause it to reach me in the City so that it is not your silver (that I need to use(?)). Have Adada s. Ikuppī-Aššur pay the 5 minas of silver which he promised to pay and also send the 10 minas of silver which you promised. Dispatch Imgua with the very first traveler.

src: 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR li-ti i-se-er sa-di-a ISTAR-la-ma-si ti-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni u a-sur-na-da 2 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM a-la-na-tim li-mu-um DUG-a-sur IGI zu-zu-a IGI su-be-lim
tgt: Šadīya owes Ištar-lamassī 1 mina quality silver. He will add (as interest) 2 shekels from the month of ṣibtam Month: Allānātim. Eponymate: Tāb-Aššur. Witnesses: Zuzuwa, Šū-Bēlim.

src: <big_gap> sa-am la i-mu-u a-ni-tam <big_gap> <gap>-kum <big_gap> u me <big_gap> sa <big_gap> e 0.66666 ma-na AN.NA ni-is-a-ma la-bu-<gap> <gap> si a du um AN.NA sa a ma-la dan-a-sur sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni sa ma-at sa-pi-il5-tim sa am <gap> a-na ma-la ta-as-pu-ra-ni a-sa-a-ma u su-ma dan-a-sur a-hu-ur AN.NA sa-a-ma-ki-im is-<gap>-<big_gap> li-qe-a <gap>-<gap>-<gap>-am a-su-mi sa {d}NIN.SUBUR-ba-ni sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni um-ma a-ta-ma KU.BABBAR a-na be-a-lim e-ri-si su-ma ta-da-su-um KU i-na ta-si-im-tim di-su-ma u ma-ma-an i-na um-mi-a-ni le-pu-ul-ka ta-as-pu-ra-nim um-ma a-tu-nu-ma 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-ma-kam li-qe KU.BABBAR a-na-kam u-la a-al-qe u su-ma a-na be-a-lim ta-da-su-um KU.BABBAR a-na ta-si-im-tim-ma di-su-ma u um-mi-a-num le-pu-ul-ka <big_gap><gap> <gap>-ra-ma ni-ma-qu-ut <big_gap><gap> <gap> sa-si-a <big_gap><big_gap> dan-a-sur
tgt: .. they did not want to ... This ... to you. ... days ... We purchased 2/3 mina tin (so that I could dispatch it ??) ...(As for?) the amount of tin(for?) Dān-Aššur about which you wrote me, the (goods/caravan) of the 'south' land ša-am-... Regarding the matter of Ilabrat-bāni about which you wrote, "He asked me for silver for management." You (pl.) wrote me. I did not receive the silver. ... we will fall(?) ... Sāsiya ... Dān-Aššur ...

src: um-ma a-sur-na-da-ma a-na a-gu5-za u-su-ur-sa-a-sur u si-sa-ah-su-sar qi-bi-ma 17 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-tu 8 MU.SE ku-zi-zi-a ha-bu-kam i-nu-mu wa-as-ba-ku-ni as-ba-su-ma um-ma su-ut-ma u-nu-ti a-di-ni la e-ru-ba-am a-hu-a a-tu-nu sa-ab-ta-su-ma KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su ma-la wa-as-mu sa-as-qi-la-su la ta-ga-mi-la-su a-na am-tim di-na-su nu-he-en6 a-sa-ma-ma ANSE i-GIS ma-li-a-ma se-bi4-la-nim u ma-la ki-la-le-ma se-pe-a
tgt: From Aššur-nādā to Aguza, Uṣur-ša-Aššur and Šišahšušar: 7 shekels of refined silver Kuziziya borrowed from me 8 years ago. When I stayed there I seized him, but he said: ''My merchandise has not arrived yet." My dear brothers, seize him and make him pay the silver and as much interest as is fitting. Do not show him any favours! Give it to the maid. Buy two leather pouches, load a donkey with oil, and send it to me. Do send as much as both can contain.

src: 2.5 ma-na <gap> ni-ga-li i-na te-ga-ra-ma a-na E ub-ri a-di-in 0.33333 ma-na ni-ga-li a-na ki-ri-im i-na ta-al-pa 15 GIN a-sar IR i-mu-tu a E ub-ri 0.33333 GIN 7 0.5 SE a-na ki-ri-im i su-pa-na 0.5 GIN a-na sa ma-sa-ra-tim
tgt: I gave 2 1/2 minas in sickles to the caravanserai at Tegarama. 1/2 shekel for guards at the watchhouse.

src: 0.66666 ma-na 6 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er in-na-a-sur i-ku-pi-a-sur i-su is-tu ITU.1.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um am-ma-e-a 1 ma-na-um 12 GIN.TA i-la-ak-su-um IGI a-mur-e-a IGI si-ik-ma-tim IGI na-ni-a
tgt: Enna-Aššur owes Ikūppī-Aššur 46 shekels refined silver. Witnesses: Amuria, Šikmātum, Nanīya.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-ma-lik-ma i-a-sar u {d}ISKUR-su-lu-li-ma URUDU sa PUZUR4-a-sur i li-bi i-a-sar i-su-u URUDU ta-as-bi-ta-am i-di-ni-a-ti ki-ma URUDU-i-u i-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum ma-ah-su-ni i-ri-qam la ni-gu5-ur-ma a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum la nu-se-ri-ib e-ma-ri-i se-ri-a-ma URUDU-u-su a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum lu nu-se-ri-ib su-ma tup-pu-su sa PUZUR4-a-sur a-se-ri-ni i-li-kam si-ta-me-a-su-ma a-ni-sa-am se-bi4-lam i sa-am-si tup-pi-ni ta-sa-me-u e-ma-ri se-ri-am
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Aššur-mālik, Ea-šār, and Adad-ṣulūlī: The copper which Ea-šar owes Puzur-Aššur, he (Ea-šar) has given us the full payment of copper. Because the (supply of) copper is cut off in Purušḫattum, we were unable to rent a wagon and we were unable to take (the copper) to Purušḫattum. Send donkeys so that we can take the copper to Purušḫattum. If Puzur-Aššur's tablet comes for us, read it and send it here. On the day you read our tablet, send the donkeys.

src: 46 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-na li-bi i-di-su-en6 i pa-ni-nim-ma u-se-ba-lam IGI a-mur-a-sur DUMU su-ISTAR IGI ip-qi-im 42 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-ti du-uh-ni-is u da-ak-ni-is is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-SIPA DUMU ma-a-su u sa-lim-a-sur a-na 20 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-ti a-na-ah-DINGIR is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa e-ra-di u ka-ab-ri-a a-na 5 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 10 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-ti a-mur-a-sur DUMU PUZUR4-a-sur is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-ba-ni u en-ma-a-a a-na 10 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 12 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um is-ti e-la-li is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-mur-ISTAR u PUZUR4.ISTAR a-na 7 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 6 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am is-ti a-sur-DU10 DUMU i-da u4-mu-su ma-al-u 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um is-ti zu-zu DUMU ku-la is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-ba-ni u en-ma-a-a a-na 14 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 3 ma-na 12 GIN KU.BABBAR u si-ba-tu-su is-ti a-sur-i-di SA.BA 2 ma-na LA 2 GIN ili5-ba-ni i-di-nam 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR is-ti {d}IM-ba-ni DUMU la-qe-ep is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa ka-ab-ri-a u PUZUR4.ISTAR a-na 13 ha-am-sa-tim 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR u si-ba-tu-su u 0.5 ma-na be-u-la-tu-su is-ti a-sur-SIPA DUMU a-ku-ti-a 4.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-ni i-sa-qal IGI {d}UTU-ba-ni IGI DINGIR-na-da 3 ma-na LA 10 GIN KU.BABBAR is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ka-li-a u ha-bi-a-ah-su a-na 15 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal mi-ma a-nim i-na li-bi a-gu5-a u a-mur-{d}UTU SA.BA 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR al-qe
tgt: Witnesses: Amur-Aššur s. Šū-Ištar, Ibkum Duḫniš and Dakniš owe 42 minas refined silver. He will pay twenty weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-rēʾī s. ma-a-šu and Šalim-Aššur. Anaḫ-ilī owes 20 minas refined silver. He will pay five weeks from the ḫamuštum of Erra-idī and kà-áb-ri-a. Amur-Aššur s. Puzur-Aššur owes 10 minas refined silver. He will pay ten weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-bāni and en-ma-a-a. Elāli owes 12 minas refined silver. He will pay seven weeks from the ḫamuštum of Amur-Ištar and Puzur-Ištar. Zuzu s. Kula 2 minas refined silver. He will pay fourteen weeks from the ḫamuštum of Aššur-bāni and en-ma-a-a.

src: um-ma a-sur-ba-ni u sa-lim-a-sur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma E en-na-nim DUMU a-sur-SIPA a-na 16 ma-na KU.BABBAR ni-is-a-ma-kum sa-la-as su-ba-tim i-ma-du-du-ma i-na sa-la-as su-ma ba-ti-iq KU.BABBAR i-sa-he-er su-ma i-na sa-la-as wa-ta-ar KU.BABBAR i-te-er i-hi-id KU.BABBAR se-bi-lam lu-qu-tum sa se-ep a-sur-ma-lik 4 GU AN.NA u li-wi-su i-ta-as-a-kum ki-ma AN.NA ba-at-qu-ni E DAM.GAR la ni-si-ma la ni-is-a-ma-ku-nu-ti-ma sa KU.BABBAR-pi-ku-nu nu-se-bi4-la-ku-nu-ti lu-qu-tum sa se-ep su-su-en6 is-ti ha-ra-nim u-si-a-ku-um nu-za-ka-ma ni-sa-pa-ra-kum a-pu-tum i ti-i-er-ti-ka su-hu-bur ka-bi-id su-ma la su-a-ti ma-nu-um KU.BABBAR 1 GIN E a-bi4-su a si-ib-tim ni-il5-qe-a-kum
tgt: From Aššur-bāni and Šalim-Aššur to Pūšu-kēn: We purchased the house of Ennānum son of Aššur-rēʾum for you for 16 minas of silver. They will measure out three Take care to send the silver. The goods of the šēpum of Aššur-mālik: 4 talents of tin and its wrappings. He has departed to you. Because tin was scarce, we did not leave the house of the merchant and we sent the proceeds of your (pl.) silver to you (pl.). The goods of the We will clear (ourselves?/you?) and write to you. Please, in your letter honor Šū-Ḫubur. If not him, from whom will we borrow for you even a single shekel of silver in the house of his father?

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma a-su-mi E-ti sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni su-ma ni-is-ta-a-ma-kum KU.BABBAR i ra-mi-ni-a ma-la sa-qa-li-im a-sa-qal-ma te-er-ti i-la-ka-kum a-wi-lu KU.BABBAR ma-dam e-ri-su a si-a-ti nu-ta-qa su-ma la ku-a-ti sa-im-su-nu u mu-ri qa-ab-li-tim u-li-ba-si su-ma ta-da-nu-um i-ta-ab-si a-na-hi-id-ma a-sa-a-ma-ku-su-nu u KU.BABBAR i ra-mi-ni-a a-sa-qal KU.GI sa DUMU a-sur-ma-lik ha-bu-la-ni a mi-nim 1 ma-na 11 GIN KU.BABBAR ta-tur4-su-um a ki-ma is-mu-hu-ma a-ni-sa-am is-pu-ra-ni 14 ma-na AN.NA ma-ZI-ra-am sa dan-a-sur a-na a-gu5-a ub-lu a-na i-ta-at-li-im di-in-ma a-se-er KU.GI sa i-li-is-ra-ni sa 5 GIN.TA u 4 GIN.TA 0.33333 ma-na KU.GI u 1 ma-na pa-sa-lam i pa-nim-ma se-bi4-lam u-tu-ku u-sa-ah-du-ru-ni
tgt: Šalim-aḫum to Pūšu-kēn: Concerning the houses about which you wrote me, if we purchase them for you, I will pay as much as is required from my own funds, and my message will come to you. The men requested a lot of silver. On this account, we will wait. Besides you there are no buyers or murri qablītim. If any sales develop, I will make sure to purchase them for you, and I will pay the silver from my own funds. The gold which Aššur-mālik's son owes me, why did you return 1 minas 11 shekels silver to him? On account of this he defaulted and wrote me here. Sell for cash the 14 minas ma-ZI-ra-am-tin which Dān-Aššur brings on behalf of Agua, and besides the 5 or 4 shekels of gold from Ilī-ašranni, send 1/3 mina gold and 1 mina pašallum-gold immediately. The

src: <gap> GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am 15 SILA ta-ab-tam i-se-er id-na-a DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR u da-da DUMU du-<big_gap> i-di-a-sur i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-ma-lik a-na <gap> ITU.KAM i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-su-bu ITU.KAM ku-zal-lu li-mu-um i-ku-pi-ISTAR
tgt: If he does not pay (on time), he will add interest at the rate of the colony. Month: Kuzallu Eponymate: Ikuppī-Ištar

src: KISIB a-sur-dan KISIB bu-si-a KISIB im-di-DINGIR KISIB a-sur-DUG sa 9.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-up sa ka-ri-a a-na a-sur-na-da a-na e-bu-tim i-di-nu KU.BABBAR u si-a-ma-tu-su is-tu a-lim{ki} us-a-ni-ma lu-qu-su a-sur-DUG il5-qe su-ma ma-ma-an a-na a-sur-na-da i-tu-a-ar a-sur-DUG u-ba-ab-su
tgt: Seal of Aššur-dān, seal of Buzia, seal of Imdī-ilum, seal of Aššur-ṭāb. Concerning the 9 2/3 minas of refined silver which Karria gave to Aššur-nādā as an investment loan: The silver and the purchases made with it has left the City, and Aššur-ṭāb has taken his merchandise. Should anyone raise a claim against Aššur-nādā, Aššur-ṭāb will clear him.

src: 15 GIN KU.BABBAR ti-ri i-se-er a-sur-GAL DUMU a-sur-i-su i-di-ku-bu-um DUMU u-sur-sa-a-sur i-su i ITU.1.KAM KU.BABBAR i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul <big_gap> a-na ga-ri-a si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.1.KAM <big_gap> li-mu-um ri-is-{d}UTU DUMU a-nu-pi-sa IGI a-nu-nu DUMU {d}ISKUR.DUL IGI ni-mar-ISTAR DUMU i-di-ku-bi4-im
tgt: Aššur-rabi s. a-šùr-ì-šu owes Idí-Kūbum s. Uṣur-ša-Aššur 15 shekels ṭīrē silver. He will pay the silver in one month. Month: ...

src: 18 ma-na LA 5 GIN KU sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-e-mu-qi a-sur-i-mi-ti i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-a-nim u du-du a-na 36 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qul 1.5 GIN.TA i ITU.KAM a 1 ma-na-im u-sa-ab IGI i-di-a-bi4-im IGI a-sur-e-mu-qi SA 7 ma-na 15 GIN sa a-mur-ISTAR u a-sur-i-mi-ti
tgt: Aššur-emūqī owes Aššur-imittī 18 minas and 5 shekels refined silver. He will pay 36 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Šū-Anum and Dudu. If he does not pay (on time), he will add (interest) at the rate of 1 1/2 shekels per mina per month. Witnesses: Iddin-abim, Aššur-emūqī

src: 6 GIN <big_gap> a-na za <gap> <big_gap> 4 GIN KU.BABBAR a qa-ti-su a-di-in <big_gap> a-di-in 13 GIN KU.BABBAR a su-ha-re-e sa a-sa-nim a-di-in
tgt: I gave 13 shekels silver to the servants of Asanum.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma hu-sa-ru-um-ma 2 GU 11 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 40 ku-ta-nu qa-dum li-wi-tim 2 ANSE.HI.A sa-la-mu 17 ma-na AN.NA qa-tim mi-ma a-nim su-ku-bu-um DUMU a-li-li i-ra-di-a-kum ki-ma u-nu-tum i-na E.GAL-lim ur-da-ni u4-ma-kal su-ku-bu-um la i-sa-hu-ur a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum a-se-er sa ki-ma ku-a-ti u a-sur-DUG DUMU a-la-hi-im lu-qu-ti su-ku-bu-um lu-se-ri-ib-ma lu-qu-ti ba-ti-iq u wa-tu-ur a-na i-ta-at-lim li-di-nu na-hi-id-ma a-na DAM.GAR la u-su-ru su-ku-bu-um is-ti-su-nu li-zi-iz-ma a-na KU.BABBAR lu-qu-ti lu-ta-i-ru a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta a-la-nu-ka a-ba-am u-la i-su a-na te-er-ti-a i-hi-id-ma KU.BABBAR a-na DUMU um-mi-a-nim pi-qi-id-ma su-ku-bu-am KI KU.BABBAR tur4-dam i-se-er su-ku-bi-im en6-ka li-li-ik
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Ḫuṣārum: 2 talents 11 minas tin under seal, 40 kutānum-textiles together with wrappings, two black donkeys, 17 minas hand tin--all this Šū-Kūbum son of Āl-ilī brings to you. When the merchandise come down from the palace, do not detain Šū-Kūbum for a single day. Let Šū-Kūbum take my goods to Purušḫattum, to your representative and Aššur-ṭāb son of Al-āḫum, and let them sell my goods-high price or low-for cash. Take care that they not release it to a merchant. Let Šū-Kūbum assist them so that they convert my merchandise to to silver. My dear father and lord, beside you I have no father! Heed my instructions and entrust the silver to an affiliated trader and dispatch Šū-Kūbum with the silver. Keep your eye on Šū-Kūbum.

src: a-na su-be-lim u im-di-lim qi-bi4-ma um-ma su-ku-<gap>-<gap>-ma a-hu-u-a be-lu-a a-tu-nu a-na u-um e-ta-ri-im et-ra-ni a-la-nu-ku-nu ma-nam i-su a-na-kam DUMU zi-ka-a u-na-ni a-se-er ki-a-ma <gap> u-sa-la-ak-ma sa <gap> i-se-e-u da-nu-tam e ta-wu-a lim-da-ma la i-da-nam as-ba-su-ma um-ma a-na-ku-ma u-la pu-ru-us u-la se-si-ib pa-ra-sa-am u se-su-ba-am la i-mu-a um-ma a-na-ku-ma sa wa-ni-u-tim u KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na 2 ma-na la tu-as-ta-ag-mi-ra-ni i-zi-iz i-na GIR sa a-sur ta-am-a-am i-na a-mu-tim la a-wu-a-ku-ni ta-ma-a-am la i-mu-a u-na-ni a-ba-u-a be-lu-a a-tu-nu i-zi-za-a-ma tup-pa-am sa ka-ri-im li-qe-a ab-ka-nim <gap> ri <big_gap> <gap> er <gap> <big_gap> TUG ub-la+la-<gap> <big_gap> <gap>-la-ti-a li-zi-iz <big_gap> la u-na-a-ni
tgt: To Šū-Bēlum and Imdī-ilum from Šū-Kūbum(?):

src: 15 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI a-bu-um-DINGIR DUMU a-ba u sa-lim-a-sur a-hi-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa DUMU ba-na-ga u a-gu5-za a-na 40 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qu-lu 15.5 ma-na 3.16666 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am KI a-sur-i-mi-ti DUMU a-ta-a is-tu ha-mus-tim sa e-la-li u la-qe-ep a-na 45 i-sa-qal 15.5 ma-na 2.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-a-pa-am KI ili5-ba-ni DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR is-tu ha-mus-tim sa e-la-li u la-qe-ep a-na 45 i-sa-qal 15.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am KI na-bi-su-en6 DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR is-tu ha-mus-tim sa am-ri-a u i-ku-nim a-na 45 i-sa-qal 15.5 ma-na 1.66666 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am KI a-sur-na-da is-tu ha-mus-tim sa du-du u li-ba-a-a a-na 45 i-sa-qal 7.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI a-la-bi-im is-tu ha-mus-tim sa a-la-hi-im u kur-ub-ISTAR a-na 40 i-sa-qal 15 ma-na 6.66666 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI a-la-bi4-im DUMU su-ti-bar is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ha-bi4-a-ah-su u la-qe-ep a-na 38 i-sa-qal 10 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI i-ku-nim sa ta-wi-ni-a is-tu ha-mus-tim sa {d}MAR.TU-ba-ni u i-ku-nim a-na 15 i-sa-qal 4 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am KI zu-ba u a-sur-DU10 is-tu ha-mus-tim sa e-la-ma u su-ku-bi-im a-na 6 i-sa-qu-lu 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI a-su is-tu ha-mus-tim sa ka-si-im a-na 13 i-sa-qal 10.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am KI i-li-is-ti-kal is-tu ha-mus-tim sa DUMU ba-na-ga u a-gu-za a-na 45 i-sa-qal 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am KI zu-zu is-tu ha-mus-tim sa su-ka-li-a u ku-ra a-na 10 i-sa-qal mi-ma a-nim u4-mu-su-nu ma-al-u sa KU.BABBAR la i-sa-qa-ku-nu-ti-ni la si-be su-uk-na-ma a si-ib-tim li-li-ik
tgt: Abum-ilī s. Abu and Šalim-Aššur his brother owe 15 minas refined silver. They will pay forty weeks from the ḫamuštum of the son of ba-na-gà and Aguza. Aššur-imittī s. Attaya owes 15 1/2 minas 3 1/6 shekels refined silver. He will pay forty five (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of Elāli and Lāqēp. Ilī-bāni s. Puzur-Ištar owes 15 1/2 minas 2 1/3 shekels refined silver. He will pay forty five (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of Elāli and Lāqēp. Nāb-Suen s. Puzur-Ištar owes 15 1/2 minas refined silver. He will pay forty five (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of Amria and Ikūnim. Aššur-nādā owes 15 1/2 minas 1 2/3 shekels refined silver. He will pay forty five (weeks) from the hamuštum of Dudu and li-ba-a-a. Al-abim owes 7 1/2 minas refined silver. He will pay forty (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of Al-aḫim and Kurub-Ištar. Al-abim s. Šū-Tibar owes 15 minas 6 2/3 shekels refined silver. He will pay thirty eight (weeks) from the hamuštum of ḫa-bi₄-a-aḫ-šu and Lāqēp. Ikūnim of Tawiniya owes 10 minas 5 shekels refined silver. He will pay fifteen (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of Amurrum-bāni and Ikūnim. Zupa and Aššur-ṭāb owe 4 minas refined silver. He will pay six (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of Elamma and Šū-Kūbim. Ašu owes 5 minas refined silver. He will pay 13 (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of kaššim. Iliš-tīkal owes 10 1/3 minas refined silver. He will pay forty five (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of the son of Banaga and Akuzāya. Zuzu owes 5 minas refined silver. He will pay ten (weeks) from the ḫamuštum of Sukkallīya and Kura.

src: 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-ma-lik dan-a-sur i-su a-na 30 ha-am-sa-tim i-be-el su-ma i-na u-mi-su ma-al-u-tim la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa dan-a-sur ITU.1.KAM si-ip-im li-mu-um pu-zu-ta-a IGI a-sur-GAL DUMU en-na-nim IGI a-gi5-a DUMU <big_gap>
tgt: If he does not pay on time, he will add interest at the rate of the colony. Witnesses: Aššur-rabi s. Ennanim, Agiya s. ?

src: 6.5 ma-na 2 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er dan-a-sur pu-su-ke-en6 i-su i-la-ak-ma i-na a-lim{ki} 2 ma-na KU.GI is-ti um-mi-a-ni-su pu-su-ke-en6 i-la-pa-at-ma i-tu-ra-ma is-tu a-lim{ki} 1.3333300000000001 ma-na 8 GIN KU.BABBAR pu-su-ke-en6 a-na dan-a-sur i-sa-qal IGI qa-ar-wi-a IGI dan-a-sur
tgt: Dān-Aššur owes Pūšu-kēn 6 minas 32 shekels refined silver. He will go and in the city he will write down 2 minas gold among his investors for Pūšu-kēn and he will return and Pūšu-kēn will pay 1 mina 28 shekels silver from teh city to Dān-Aššur. Witnesses: Qarwiya, Dān-Aššur

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi4-ma si-bu-tim am-hu-ur-ma mi-ma ANSE la u-wa-si-ru-nim su-ma la qa-qi-di-ka i-na u4-mi-im sa tup-pa-am ta-sa-me-u ti-be-ma at-la-ak i-na u4-mi-im sa a ka-ri-im {d}a-sur u-sa-lu-mu-ka-ma te-ru-bu-ni i-na e-ra-bi4-ka-ma 40 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na na-ru-qi-a se-bi4-lam lu i-na ku-a-im lu sa na-ru-qi-a ma-li-ma se-bi4-lam a su-mi-a mas-ka-tam 1-is-te-et la ta-ma-ga-ar tup-pa-ka lu 2-se-na mi-is-lam sa na-ru-qi-a lu-up-tam mi-is-lam sa DAM.GAR lu-up-tam u i-li-a-lim tur4-dam u me-sa-ra-ma a-wa-ti-su sa-ni-um le-wu KU.BABBAR qa-su lu-ka-il5 sa-du-a-tam a-na sa a-wa-su e-wu-u li-di-in um-ma su-ut-ma KU.BABBAR sa DAM.GAR si-ba-am mi-ma a-hu-um a-na a-hi-im la i-sa-kan a-pu-tum i-hi-id-ma li-bi4 la tu-la-ma-an su-ma a-na ha-hi-im ta-pa-la-ah a-na ur-su-ma a-li-ik a-pu-tum we-di-ka-ma a-li-ik is-ti ILLAT a-na ma-ma la te-ra-ab u ma-la te-er-ti a-lim{ki} ILLAT-at a-hi-ka a-na sal-si-su li-pe-er-su-ma pa-ni-u-um i ma-ma lu-si-ma a-na ma-at ka-ni-is <big_gap> ik-su-du sa-ni-um i-na ur-su lu-si u sa-li-is-tum <big_gap> ki-a-ma lu-si a-pu-tum su-ma ta-ra-a-ma-ni a-na a-wa-at tup-pi-im i-hi-id-ma li-bi4 la tu-la-ma-am
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Aššur-nādā: I have appealed to the elders, but they have not released any donkeys to me.

src: a-na im-di-DINGIR qi-bi-ma um-ma u-zu-a-ma is-tu a-na ku-na-na-mi-it e-ru-bu-ni-ma a-na ir-ti-ka a-ru-qu a-sur u ISTAR-ZA-AT li-tu-la ma-ti-ma tup-pi-ka la as-me-u ki-ma tup-pi-ka la as-me-u pa-nu-a a-se-ri-ka a-na a-la-ki-im ka-du um-ma a-na-ku-ma is-tu-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN ir-tu-qa-ni-ni a-di te-er-ti a-bi-a u be-li-a i-la-ka-ni-ni la am-ta-qu-ut-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN lu-sa-zi-iz-ma e-en6 a-bi-a u be-li-a la-mu-ur am-ta-qu-ut-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN us-ta-zi-iz ki-ma te-er-ta-ka mi-ma-a-sa la as-me-u a-na ka-ri-im se-pi pa-ar-sa-at a su-mi-ka pa-al-ha-ku-ma u a-sar 1 GU.TA a-na si-a-ma-tim a-du-nu i-na KU.BABBAR 10 GIN.TA ma-ah-sa-ku u gi-mi-li a-ga-mi-il5-ma i-da-a ka-ab-sa u a-na-ku a-na-kam i-se-er KU.BABBAR 1 GIN sa e-pu-su a-hu-al u a-zu-ab a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta mi-su-um IR-ad-ka ke-nu-um a-na-ku i-na la a-si-ri a-ha-liq u a-na sa-an-u-tim KU.BABBAR 1 GIN e-pa-as ki-ma tup-pa-ka as-me-u-ma u a-bu-sa-lim te-er-tam sa ta-ta-u-su-ni e-ta-wu-ni tup-pi a-ni-u-tim a-di ha-am-si-su u-se-bi4-la-ku-ma te-er-tam la tu-ta-e-ra-am su-ma li-bi-ka ma-a a-na ir-ti-ka qa-ru-bi ta-ta-u e-ne-ka a-ta-mar ka-sa-ar pu-su-ke-en6 sa i-na sa-ri-dim ta-za-na-ka-ra-ni se-na-su su-ma-am ma-ah-ri-ka la-as-ku-un sa KU.BABBAR 10 ma-na qi-ip-tam ki-ma a-na u4-me qi-ip-tim DAM.GAR ta-qi-pu sa KU.BABBAR 10 ma-na u i-a-ti di-na-ma i-na re-es15 qi-ip-tim sa ta-da-na-ni 10 GU URUDU ma-si-am i-na tur4-hu-mi-it a-na sa ki-ma ku-a-ti la-di-in-ma URUDU a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum le-ru-ub-ma KU.BABBAR ma-la i-ma-qu-ta-ni a-na a-lim{ki} lu-se-bi-il5-ma si-ma-am a-na qi-ip-ti-a i-na be-ti-ka li-is-u-mu e-zi-ib a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-tim mu-ug-ra-ni-ma KU.BABBAR 1 GIN sa i li-bi-ka a-mu-ru a-di a-ta sa-ah-ra-ti-ni na-ab-ri-tam a-ni-tam i-na ku-na-na-mi-it a-na qi-ip-ti-a la-ab-re-ma u ma-la e-pu-su a-mu-ur la-ma tup-pa-ka sa se-ep a-bu-sa-lim as-me-u 5 GU URUDU ma-si-am i-se-er DAM.GAR ke-nu-tim sa wa-ar-hi-sa-ma URUDU 1 GU.TA i-sa-qu-lu-ni-ni a-di-ma a-su-mi <big_gap> ak-la su-ma-mi-in la a-wa-tim a-ni-tim lu-mi-in a-tal-kam a-ma {d}ISKUR-pi-la-ah li-is-ta-me a-di a-ma-kam la tu-si-ri-ni bu-la-ti-a la u-ka-la-am-ka is-tu tu-se-si-ri-ni LA 10 GU URUDU ma-si-am la-ap-ta-kum 15 GU URUDU ma-si-am a-ka-sa-da-kum u hu-bu-li lu-sa-bi-ka-ma lu-qu-ti di-na-am u i-nu-mi e-ne-ka a-mu-ru <big_gap> <gap> <big_gap> <gap>-e-ma su-ma-am la-as-ku-un la wa-ra-ad-ka ke-nu-um a-na-ku is-ti {d}ISKUR-pi-la-ah su-ha-ar-ka li-li-kam-ma la-tal-kam-ma e-ne-ka la-mu-ur mi-su-um e-na-ka i-ze-ra-ni as-ta-la-al a-sa-me-ma ma-ha-i is-ti a-mur-ISTAR us-a-am is-ti {d}ISKUR-pi-la-ah tur4-da-su DUMU PUZUR4-{d}MUS us-ta-bi te-er-ta-ka a-na a-lim{ki} a-na PUZUR4-{d}MUS u a-wi-la-ti-ni li-li-ik
tgt: To Imdī-ilum from Uzua: After I arrived in Kunanamit, and I was far from your breast, may Aššur and Ištar-zat witness that becasue I never recevied heard any of your letters, I (set out) towards you. I said to myself, " .. so that I may see the eye of my father and lord." I came down and I gatehred togethre(?) every shekel of silver. Because I had not heard any of your messages whatsoever, I made my way to the kārum-office. I am protective of your reputation and wherver I gave a talent for putchases, I am able to raise a 10 shekels rate in silver. And I have done many favors Also, I myself here to every shekels of silver which I made I hwl'd And i will z'b. My dear father and lord, who (but I) is your true servant? I will lose from ... Also, for years(?) I will make every shekel of silver. When I heard your tablet and Abu-šalim spoke the instructions which you ..., I sent these tablets five time to you so taht you would not return the instructions. If you desire, you will indeed approach to your breast and I will see your eye. The packer of Pūšu-kēn which you cleared from being a sāridum hauler, let me set another name before you. The package worth 10 minas silver, when you sold it on credit to the merchant, give the package worth 10 mians silver and mine so thatI can give from the top of the package which you sold, 10 talents washed copper from Durḫumit to your representative and I will casue the copper to arrive at Purušḫattum and I wil send the silver as much as it fetches to the city and they may make purchases for my package from your house. Apart from these matters, make amends with me and I every shekel of silver which is in your possession (when I see) as soon as you are deducted, this 'nabritum'' in Kunanamit I will bru it to you your qiptum and whatever I make I will see. Why is that, with regard to your tablet concerning the transport of Abu-šalim, which I heard/read, 5 talents washed copper toa reliable merchant who is after her every talent of copper which they will weigh out I gave to you concerning this ... I ate. If these words should have been evil, I would depart for you. Indeed, let Ištar-pilaḫ hear so that until he is released there I will not klm my bulatia to you. After he left, ? 10 talents washed copper I opened for you. 15 talents washed copper I will send to you. Now let him ... you my debt and sell my goods. And when I see your eye ..... Truly, I am not your servant! Let Ištar-pilaḫ come with your young man/son, so that I may depart and see your eye. Why should your eye ... I keep asking. I hear that my maḫāúm left with Amur-Ištar. Dispatch him with Ištar-pilaḫ. The son of Puzur-... ,,,, Let your message come to the city, to Puzur-Mus and our ladies.

src: ka-ru-um tur4-hu-mi-it sa-he-er GAL di-nam i-di-in-ma is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5 ITU.KAM hu-bu-ur DINGIR sa-pa-tam i-li-ik li-mu-um i-na-a DUMU a-mu-ra-a 1 GU 15 ma-na.TA URUDU SIG5 {d}IM.ANDUL u a-sur-SIG5 i-na-di-u-ma en-na-su-en6 DUMU i-li-nim u-sa-bu-u si-bi {d}IM.ANDUL i-sa-ka-su-um sa ki-ma 7.5 GU 0.66666 ma-na URUDU SIG5 ki-ma su-ma-li-bi4-a-sur sa-bu-u u-ra-ma {d}IM.ANDUL-ma si-bi-su a-na a-sur-SIG5 i-za-kar-ma a-li i-ma-gu5-ru-ni e-ta-wu-u
tgt: Seal of Durḫumit.

src: um-ma hi-na-a-ma a-na a-sur-na-da qi-bi-ma 5.66666 ma-na KU a-di-na-ku-ma a-na a-lim{ki} tu-se-ri-id ki-ma ta-qa-bi-u na-ru-qam u-la ta-ta-si-i a-na ISTAR-pi-la-ah AN.NA u ANSE tu-ka-in mi-su ta-si-a-tim u sa-ri-dam tu-la-pi-ta-ni is-tu 2 sa-na-at u KU si-im-tam la ka-as-du-u AN.NA sa tu-se-bi4-la-ni 56 ma-na
tgt: From Hinnaya to Aššur-nādā: I gave you 5 2/3 minas of silver and you sent it down to the City. Since you claim that you do not administer a joint-stock capital, you offered the tin and the donkey to Ištar-pilah. Why have you booked me for transportation costs and a donkey driver? It is now two years ago but the agreed amount for the silver has not been reached yet;

src: a-na zu-us-ka u sa-at-a-sur qi-bi-ma um-ma na-ab-su-en6-ma sal-ma-ni mi-ma la ta-ra-si-a a-wa-tim dam-qa-tim ni-is6-ta-na-me i-na {d}UTU-si a-wa-at-ni ni-la-qe-u su-lu-um-ni is-ti pa-nim-ma u-se-ba-lam la ta-ra-si-a
tgt: To Zukša and Šāt-Aššur say: thus (says) Nab-Suen. We are well. Do not worry! We hear good news from various sides. As soon as we obtain (a decision in) our legal case, I will send with the first messenger (news about) our well-being. Do not worry!

src: 11 ma-na 10 GIN AN.NA ku-la a-na ILLAT-at la-qe-pi-im ha-bu-ul 1 GIN.TA si-ib-tam i-na ITU.KAM-im u-sa-ab ITU.1.KAM be-el-ti-E.GAL-lim li-mu-um a-la-hu-um DUMU e-na-ah-DINGIR IGI sa-ar-wa-a IGI a-sur-ma-lik IGI a-sur-i-mi-ti
tgt: Kula owes Lā-qēpim's caravan 11 minas 10 shekels tin. He will pay interest at the rate of 1 shekel per month.

src: um-ma sa-lim-a-hu-um-ma a-na la-qe-ep u pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi4-ma 26 ku-ta-ni SIG5-tim wa-at-ru-tim ku-nu-ki-a ANSE sa-la-ma-am 5 ma-na AN.NA a-na qa-ti-su mi-ma a-nim nu-ur-ISTAR i-ra-de8-a-am-ku-nu-ti ig-ri sa-ri-dim sa-bu TUG.HI.A i-se-er DAM.GAR ke-nim sa ki-ma qa-qi-di-ku-nu a-na u4-me id-a DAM.GAR-ku-nu lu ke-en6 1 ITU.KAM 2 ITU.KAM la tu-se-qa-ra ANSE is-ti TUG.HI.A e-mi-da a-se-er AN.NA-ak qa-ti-su sa DUMU i-di-ISTAR sa 5 ma-na AN.NA URUDU a-na a-mu-ri-im a-di-in u su-ut a-na ILLAT-ti-su is-ku-un-su KU.BABBAR sa TUG.HI-ti-a ma-la i-se-er DAM.GAR ta-na-di-a-ni u u4-me te-er-ta-ku-nu za-ku-tum li-li-kam
tgt: From Šalim-aḫum to Lā-qēpum and P 26 kutānum very fine textiles under my seal, a black donkey, 5 minas tin for his 'expenses,': all this Nūr-Ištar drives to you. The wages of the driver are paid. Sell the textiles on credit to a reliable merchant as reliable as yourselves. Your merchant must be reliable. Don't overvalue one or two months. Bundle the donkey with the textiles. In addition to the 'hand-tin' of Idī-Ištar's son, I gave (him) copper worth 5 minas tin for Ammurum. And he added it to his caravan. As for the silver from my textiles, let you full report come about how much you placed on the merchant and the terms.

src: 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR i-se-er su-su-en6 DUMU a-wa-ar-na-hu-us i-ku-nu-um i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-ne-nim u la-li-im a-na 6 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI i-li-as-ra-ni DUMU a-sur-DU10
tgt: Šū-Suen s. Awarnaḫuš owes 1/2 mina silver to Ikūnum From the ḫamuštum of A-né-nim and Lālim he has 6 weeks to pay. If he does not pay the word of the colony will be added in interest. Witness: Ili-ašranni s. Aššur-ṭāb

src: 2.5 GU 3 ma-na URUDU ma-si-am i-se-er PUZUR4.ISTAR a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa en-nam-a-sur a-na 6 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1.5 ma-na.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na bi-il5-tim si-ib-tam u-sa-ab ITU.KAM ma-hu-ur-DINGIR li-mu-um sa qa-ti e-la-li DUMU i-ku-nim IGI i-zi-zi-a IGI su-en6-na-da
tgt: Puzur-Ištar owes Aššur-taklāku 2.5 talents 3 minas refined silver. He will pay 6 weeks from ḫamuštum of Ennam-Aššur. If he does not pay, he will add 1 1/2 minas per talent per month as interest.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-mi-ti a-sur-ba-ni sa u sa-lim-a-sur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma 20 ma-na AN.NA ni-di-su-um sa 5 ma-na AN.NA lu I.GIS lu du-ul-ba-tum ni-di-su-um SU.NIGIN 25 ma-na AN.NA a-na su-mi-a-bi4-a ni-di-in ANSE ku-ta-lim i-mu-ut-ma 16 GIN KU.BABBAR ni-is-qu-ul a-se-er hu-bu-li-ka sa su-mi-a-bi-a na-as-a-ku-ni nu-ra-di
tgt: From Aššur-imittī, Aššur-bāni and Šalim-Aššur to Pūšu-kēn: We gave 20 minas tin to him. We gave him both oil and Altogether we gave 25 minas tin to Šumī-abia. The ... donkey died and we paid out 16 shekels silver. Instead of your debt, we raised that which Šumi-abia is carrying to you.

tgt: Seals: Nāb-Suen s. Šū-Bēlum, Abu-šalim s. Asqudum, Takil-Aššur s. Ḫana

src: KISIB a-sur-ma-lik DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR KISIB a-sur-GAL DUMU a-gu5-za KISIB a-sur-UTU-si DUMU en-um-{d}ISKUR 1 ma-na 3 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er a-sur-UTU-si DUMU en-um-{d}ISKUR a-sur-ma-lik i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-ku-bi-im u e-la-ma a-na 5 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal su-ma la is-qu-ul 1 0.5 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM a-na ma-na-im u-sa-ab
tgt: Seals: Aššur-mālik s. Puzur Ištar, Aššur-rabi, s. Aguza, Aššur-Šamši s. Ennam-Adad Aššur-Šamši owes Aššur-mālik 1 mina 3 shekels refined silver. He will pay 5 ḫamuštum weeks from the ḫamuštum of Šū-Kūbim and Elamma. If he does not pay (on time), he will add (interest) at the rate of 1/2 shekel per mina per month.

src: a-na a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim sa ki-ma a-la-hi-im a-li-li hi-na-a u a-sur-na-da KISIB a-sur-be-el-ma-al-ki-im
tgt: To Aššur-bēl-awātim, the representatives of Alāhum (and) Alili, Hinnaya and Aššur-nādā. Seal of Aššur-bēl-malkim.

src: 0.5 TUG i-nu-mi DUMU.SAL-su me-ta-at-ni a-na um-ma-na u-se-bi4-il5
tgt: I gave 1/2 textile to Ummana when his daughter died.

src: a-mur-ISTAR u tu-uh-ni-is is-bu-tu-ni-a-ti-ma ni-ka-si i-si-u-ma URUDU lu sa {TUG}ma-ku-hi-su lu sa {TUG}ku-ta-ni sa ik-ri-bi-su 32 GU 30 ma-na URUDU sa wa-as-ha-ni-a i li-bi tu-uh-ni-is a-mur-ISTAR i-di URUDU i-na wa-as-ha-ni-a i-sa-qal um-ma tu-uh-ni-is-ma 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR u 3.75 GIN KU.GI tal-qe um-ma a-mur-ISTAR-ma a-na zi-ga-an-LUGAL u TUG.HI.A sa a-di-na-ku-ni al-qe IGI pu-su-ke-en6 DUMU su-e-a <gap> IGI la-qe-pi-im DUMU {d}AB-ba-ni IGI e-na-ZA DUMU en-na-nim a-na a-wa-tim a-ni-a-tim ka-ru-um ka-ni-is{ki} i-di-ni-a-ti-ma IGI GIR sa {d}a-sur si-bu-ti-ni ni-di-in
tgt: Amu-Ištar and Tuḫniš seized us and made accounts, copper, both yeilding from makuḫi-textiles and from the kutānum-textiles of his ikrībū-account, Amur-īštar deposited 32 talents 30 minas copper from Wašḫaniya. He will weigh out the copper in Wašḫaniya. Amur-Ištar said, "I took it for the z and textiles which I sold to you." Witnesses: Pūšu-kēn s. Sueyya, Lā-qēpum s. Nabu-bāni, Enna-ZA s. Ennanum. For this matter, the colony of Kanesh gave us permission, and we gave our testimonies before the dagger of Aššur.

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-mur-ISTAR a-la-hi-im i-li-a-lim u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi-ma 2 GU 10 ma-na AN.NA ku-nu-ku 38 TUG.HI.A u-su-ur-sa-a-sur ub-la-ku-nu-ti ig-ri sa-ri-dim sa-bu mi-ma la ta-da-na-su-um i-na pa-ni-im tup-pi-a as-pu-ra-ku-nu-ti um-ma a-na-ku-ma a-na i-li-a-lim di-na mi-ma la ta-da-na-su-um i-na sa se-pi-su AN.NA-kam ma-dam il5-te-qe i-na TUG.HI-ti-a ma-ti-u-tim li-qe-a-ma a-na ni-ka-si-a qa-ti i-ta-di-a si-ti TUG.HI-ti-a u 2 GU AN.NA a-na a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku di-na-ma a-sar KU.BABBAR 1 GIN ba-la-ti-a lu-bi-il5 u su-ma la-su a-sar wa-as-bu se-bi4-la-su-um su-ma ha-ra-su a-ni AN.NA-ki u TUG.HI-a i-na se-er DAM.GAR ke-nim a-na u4-me id-a DAM.GAR lu ke-en6 u4-me ITU.KAM u ITU.KAM la ta-be-e-la a-na i-li-a-lim qi-bi4-ma si-ti KU.BABBAR-pi-a pa-ni-im 20 ma-na i-na pa-ni-im-ma se-bi4-lam lu-qu-tam sa se-pi-ka za-ki-a-ma ti-ib-a-ma a-tal-kam tup-pu-um a-num wa-ar-ki
tgt: From Aššur-idī to Amur-Ištar, Al-āḫum, Ilī-ālum and Aššur-taklāku. Uṣur-ša-Aššur has brought to you 2 talents 10 minas of tin under seal and 38 textiles. The wages of the driver are paid. Do not give him anything. In my previous letter I wrote to you: "Give (the goods) to Ilī-ālum." Do not give him anything. He took much tin from his own caravan. Out of my textiles, take those of lesser quality and deposit them as my share on my account. Give the remainder of the textiles and 2 talents of tin to Aššur-taklāku and let him bring that to wherever there is even a small profit for me. If he is absent, send (the goods) to him wherever he is staying. If he is on a journey, well, then entrust my tin and textiles witn a trustworthy agent in commission on fixed terms. The agent must be reliable! Do not attach importance to terms of one or two months. To Ili-ālim: Send me the rest of the previous silver shipment, 2 minas as soon as possible. Clear the goods from your own caravan, set out and come here. This tablet is late(?)...

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma e-a-sar-ma as-pu-ra-kum um-ma a-na-ku-ma i-na 30 GU URUDU DIRI a-ka-sa-ad ki-ma ANSE.HI.A la-su-u-ni 30 GU URUDU ma-si-am {d}ISKUR-ba-ni a-na bu-ru-us-ha-dum us-te-ri-ib ki-ma ANSE.HI-ru sa se-ep su-a-nim e-ru-bu-ni-ni u4-ma-kal la us-bi-a-su-nu a-ta-ra-su-nu su-ba-tu sa ku-nu-uk su-ku-bi4-im u i-li-a 3 TUG.HI-ti si-it-ru se-lu-u-ma si-me-tum ta-bu-uk ra-di lu-qu-tim ta-mi la ta-ga-mi-il5 si-me-tum 1 bi-tum sa ha ku wa-ad-a-at u-la a-lim{ki} be-tum
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Ea-šar: I wrote to you. You said, "I will take from the 30 talents of excellent copper." Because there were no donkeys available, Adad-bāni took 30 talents refined copper to Purušḫattum. When the donkeys from Šū-Anum's transport arrive, I will rest them one day not two. I will dispatch them. There are textiles under the seal of Šū-Kūbum and Iliya. Take up three š.

src: um-ma su-hu-bu-ur-ma a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma a-su-mi i-ku-nim sa ta-as-pu-ra-ni a-na-kam a-su-mi sal-sa-ti-su i ma-ti-im ra-bi-sa-am a-ha-az-ma is-ti wa-ar-ki-u-tim a-sa-pa-ra-kum KU.BABBAR sa tu-se-bi-la-ni ki-ma AN.NA sa-du-u-ni AN.NA u-la ni-is-ta-a-am sa KU.BABBAR-pi TUG.HI.A ni-sa-a-ma is-ti pa-ni-u-tim-ma a-ta-ra-da-kum AN.NA 10 ma-na sa e-li-a-ku-ni i-se-er AN.NA-ki-ka ri-bi-is AN.NA wa-ar-ka-tam u-la i-su a-su-mi sa DUMU qa-a-tim mi-su-um a-ni-um sa mi-ma-sa-ma la ta-as-pu-ra-nim a-wi-lum e-mu-qa-tam e-ta-wu a-sa-me-ma KU.BABBAR 30 ma-na a-na a-sur-UTU-si a-hi-su ha-bu-ul-ma tup-pu-su ha-ar-mu-um a-ma-kam i-ba-si sa-i-il5-ma te-er-ta-ka za-ku-tum li-li-kam
tgt: From Šū-Ḫubur to Pūšu-kēn: Regarding Ikūnum about whom you wrote: Here I will acquire an attorney over his 'thirds' in the land and with the next traveller I will write to you. As for the silver that you sent, we did not purchase tin because tin cannot be purchased. We purchased textiles from the proceeds of my silver and I will dispatch them to you with the first departure. Hoard every 10 minas tin which goes up to you into your tin. There won't be tin later. Regarding the matter of the son of Qayyātum, who are you that you did not write me this concerning the matters (??) I heard that the man is able to speak and he owes about 30 minas silver to Aššūr-Šamšī his brother and his sealed tablet is there. Inquire and let your complete instructions come.

src: 3.33333 ma-na 7.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er su-su-en6 PUZUR4-a-na i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa su-e-ta-ta a-na 5 ITU.KAM i-sa-qal su-ma i-ma-la u4-me-su la is-qul 1.5 1 0.5 GIN.TA i ITU.KAM a-na ma-na-im u-sa-ab IGI PUZUR4-a-na IGI {d}ISKUR.GAL
tgt: Šū-Suen owes Puzur-Anna 3 minas 27 1/3 shekels refined silver. Witnesses: Puzur-Anna, Adad-rabi.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma i-ku-nu-um u kur-ub-ISTAR-ma a-na lu-qu-tim sa E DAM.GAR-ri-im ni-si-a-ku-ni si-ma-at KU.BABBAR tu-se-bi4-la-a-am lu si-ib-tam nu-si-ib lu KU.BABBAR ni-im-si 1.3333300000000001 ma-na 2.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR DAM.GAR-ru-u i-na li-bi4-ni i-si-ta-a-ma tup-pi-ni ik-la-a-ma KU.BABBAR a-na si-ib-tim ni-il5-qe-e-ma is-tu ITU.KAM-ku-zal-li a-na si-ib-tim i-la-ak-ni-a-ti 1.3333300000000001 ma-na 2.33333 GIN KU.BABBAR u si-ba-su sa is-tu ku-zal-li se-bi4-la-am la-ma hu-ra-sa-nu-um u-sa-ni ni-is-pu-ra-ma a mi-nim KU.BABBAR la tu-se-bi4-la-a-ma a-na si-ib-tim i-la-ka-ku-um a-ma-kam hu-ra-sa-nam sa-i-il5
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn, from Ikūnum and Kurub-Ištar: Concerning the goods of the house of the merchant that we ... to you, you sent the .. of the silver. We both added interest and deducted silver, and the merchants ... 1 mina 22 1/3 shekels silver in our (accounts?) and our tablet they(?) opened and the silver for interest we recieved and from the month of Kuzalli for the interest will go to us. Send the 1 minas 22 1/3 minas silver and its interest for the month of Kuzalli. Before Ḫuraṣānum left, we wrote to you, so why did you not send the silver and allow it to go to interest? Ask Ḫuraṣānum there.

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma a-hu-wa-qar-ma 30 TUG.HI.A 11 GIN KU.BABBAR hu-bu-lu-um ku-nu-ki-a ar-si-ah na-as-a-kum TUG is-te-et ra-qu-tum <gap> ku-ta-nu a-na KU.BABBAR li-<gap>-<gap>-ma KU.BABBAR a-na se-ri-ka li-li-kam-ma a-na te-er-ti-ka pa-ni-su-ma i-na hu-bu-li-a li-is-hi-ra-am a-bi a-ta be-li a-ta ki-ma ga-<gap> <big_gap> ta-sa-<gap> <big_gap> su-a-ti <gap> <big_gap>
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Aḫu-waqar: 30 textiles at 11 shekels silver each the debt. Aršiaḫ brings this to you under my seal. The one Let him ... for silver and let the silver go to you so that he turns to you instructions and diminsihed my debt. My dear father and lord, because (?) ... that ...

src: um-ma a-sur-i-di-ma a-na a-sur-na-da u a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku qi-bi-ma 4.33333 ma-na 6 GIN KU.BABBAR KI ur-si-si ITU.1.KAM hu-bu-ur li-mu-um PUZUR4-{d}MUS 6 GIN.TA i ITU.1.KAM a-na 1 ma-na-im si-ib-tam u-sa-ab tup-pu-su ha-ar-mu-um u sa ku-nu-uk ka-ri-im KI i-di-ISTAR pa-aq-du 2 tup-pu sa 11 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR sa hu-bu-ul ku-za-zi-im ITU.1.KAM ma-hu-ur-i-li li-mu-um bu-zu-zu 2 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-na ITU.5.KAM i-sa-qal si-tam a-na SE.1.MU i-sa-qal 0.33333 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR KI sa-lim-a-sur ITU.1.KAM kan-bar-ta li-mu-um su-da-a 2 GIN.TA a-na ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI me-er-e en-nam-a-sur u a-na-ah-i-li 0.33333 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI a-zu-da DUMU a-sur-ma-lik su-ma la u-sa-ak-si-di is-tu ITU.1.KAM ab sa-ra-ni 1 ma-na-um 1.5 ma-na si-ib-tam u-sa-ab li-mu-um bu-zu-zu 15 GIN KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pu-um KI a-sur-la-ma-si DUMU a-la-hi-im ITU.1.KAM kan-bar-ta li-mu-um su-da-a 1.66666 GIN 15 SE.TA ITU.1.KAM u-sa-ab tup-pu-su-nu E sa-lim-a-sur sa 7 GIN KU.BABBAR e-pi-su-um KI sa-lim-a-hi-im DUMU su-ISTAR i-na si-mi-a-ma i-di-nam 1.3333300000000001 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR KI su-ISTAR si-ik-ma-da u su-ka-li-a 5 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI zi-kur-li 0.66666 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI ku-du-na u la-bu-na 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI {d}UTU-ba-ni DUMU PUZUR4.ISTAR ITU.1.KAM te-i-na-tim li-mu-um su-da-a a-na 15 ha-am-sa-tim i-sa-qal 0.5 ma-na KU.BABBAR KI ba-al-tu-sar DUMU zu-ku-hi-im 0.5 ma-na 5 GIN KU.BABBAR KI nu-ur-ISTAR hu-ur-dim sa en-nam-a-a 15 GIN KU.BABBAR ku-bi-na-tal 15 GIN KU.BABBAR KI a-la-hi-im DUMU su-ka-li-a a-wa-tum sa i-li-ba-ni gam-ra 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-hu-ur su-ma a-hu-a a-tu-nu ih-da-ma KU.BABBAR se-bi4-la-ni-ma il5-ba-ni lu-sa-bi sa tap-ki-in-da ma-na a-hu-ur
tgt: From Aššur-idī To Aššur-nādā and Aššur-taklāku . 4 1/3 minas 6 shekels of silver owed by Uršiši. Month of Ḫubur, eponym of Puzur-Niraḫ

src: a-na pu-su-ke-en6 qi-bi-ma um-ma ISTAR-pi-la-ah-ma 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-di-a-sur na-as-a-ku-um su-ma te-er-ti bu-ur-su-en6 mi-ma i-li-kam KU.BABBAR a-na pa-ni-su se-bi4-il5 i te-er-ti bu-ur-su-en6 1 me-at 60 ku-ta-nu 4 GU AN.NA ku-nu-ke-e 6 TUG.HI.A sa a-ki-di-e na-si a-hi a-ta ki-ma sa a-na ra-mi-ni-su ta-sa-pu-ru-ma u-pa-zu-ru-ni u a-na i-a-im su-pu-ur-ma TUG.HI.A SIG5-tim 50 TUG lu-pa-zi-ru-nim u i-na re-es15 ni-is-ha-tim i-zi-iz-ma u4-nu-ti i-na E.GAL-lim lu-ur-dam su-ma la ku-a-ti ma-nam i-su
tgt: To Pūšu-kēn from Ištar-pilaḫ; Idī-Aššur brings you 1 mina refined silver. If the instructions of Bur-Suen come at all, send silver ahead of him. From the instructions of Bur-Suen; 160 kutānum-textiles, 4 talents tin under seals, 6 Akkadian textiles, he carries. My dear brother, when you wrote to him himself and they his, then send your own so that they can hide? fine textiles, 50 textiles. Now, stand at the beginning of the excise so that they bring my goods down from the palace. Besides you, who do I have?

src: a-na sa ki-ma i-a-ti u ni-ni a-na ni-ni qi-bi-ma um-ma a-sur-mu-ta-bi-il5-ma 2 TUG.HI.A sa e-zi-bu a-se-er si-mi-su su-ma KU.BABBAR a-a-kam-ma i-na ba-ab-ti-a ta-am-hu-ra KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na ma-li-a-ma ku-un-ka-ma se-bi4-la-nim su-ma i-na ba-ab-ti-a a-a-kam-ma la tal-qe-a lu tu-di-na-tu-ki lu mi-ma i qa-ti-ki i-ba-si-u KU.BABBAR 1 ma-na ma-li-a-ma se-bi4-la-nim la ti-de8-a-ki-ma ha-ra-an ku-si-im a-lu-ku KU.BABBAR 10 GIN ut-ra-am a-ga-mu-ru
tgt: To my representatives and Nini, specifically to Nini, from Aššur-mutabbil: If there is any silver anywhere, raise it from my outstanding claims.

src: i-na 20 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa ku-lu-ma-a a-na DAM.GAR ha-bu-lu-ma is-tu ha-mus-tim sa i-li-a tup-pu-su la-ap-tu is-tu ha-mus-tim sa kur-bi-ISTAR DUMU a-la-hi-im 5 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR si-ba-su PUZUR-a-sur u a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 a-na su-su-en6 DUMU i-li-a is-qu-lu IGI DU10-si-la-a-sur IGI ah-sa-lim IGI be-la-nim DUMU su-a-sur i-na 5 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR 2 ma-na 15 GIN KU.BABBAR sa PUZUR-a-sur 3 ma-na KU.BABBAR a-sur-mu-ta-bi4-il5 is-qu-ul
tgt: Für 20 Minen Silber, die Kulumājā dem Kaugmann schuldig ist und dessen Schuldurkunde seit dem Amtstag des Ili'a ausgestellt ist, haben den seit dem Amstage des Kurbištar, des Sohnes des Alâḫum, (in der Höhe von) 5 Minen 15 Seqel Silber (fälligen) Zins dazu Puzuraššur und Aššurmuttabbil dem Šūsu'in, dem Sohne des Ili'a, bezahlt. Vor Ṭābṣillaššur; vor Aḫšalim; vor Bēlānum, dem Sohne des Šū'aššur. Von den 5 Minen 15 Seqel Silber (sind) 2 Minen 15 Seqel Silber das des Puzura[ššur]; 3 Minen Silber hat Aššurmuttabbil bezahlt.

src: KISIB ib-ni-{d}ISKUR DUMU ku-da-a KISIB mu-us-me-ni DUMU a-mur-ISTAR KISIB u-zu-a DUMU a-bi-a-a <big_gap> i-za-zu 5 GIN <big_gap> ITU.KAM ku-zal-li li-mu-um DINGIR-su-GAL su-ma i-na ma-la u4-me-su la is-qul ki-ma a-wa-at ka-ri-im
tgt: Seals: Ibni-Adad s. Kudāya, Muš(u)weni s. Amur-Ištar, Uzuwa s. Abīya. Month: Kuzallī. Eponymate: Ilšu-rabi. If he does not pay by the fulfillment of his term, (he will add) the colony rate (as interest).

src: 1 ma-na KU.BABBAR sa-ru-pa-am i-se-er i-na-ar-me-e u zu-zu bu-zu-ta-a i-su is-tu ha-mu-us-tim sa a-sur-be-el-a-wa-tim u a-ku-za a-na sa bu-uq-la-tim i-sa-qu-lu su-ma la is-qu-lu a-na 1 ma-na-im 3 GIN.TA i-na ITU.KAM si-ib-tam u-sa-ab IGI a-sur-ta-ak-la-ku IGI {d}IM-re-bi4 DUB.SAR i-na qa-qa-ad sal-mi-su-nu KU.BABBAR ra-ki-is
tgt: i-na-ar-me-e and Zuzu owe Buzutaya 1 mina refined silver. If he does not pay (on time), he will add 3 shekels per mina per month as interest. Witnesses: Aššur-taklāku, dIM-re-bi4
